Reviews.Author: James C.
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to dress up, look great, see and be seen while chopping down massive steak and guzzling wine!  A great atmosphere is created by the darken room (even on a sunny day outside) candlelit tables and a smoky atmosphere sans actual smoke.  I went with a mutli-ethnic group that all speak Spanish so bantering with the waiters in Spanish then back to English was a riot in itself.  Very good service!We started with empanadas, great choice!  Entrees were Lomo and Ribeye steak both were seasoned to perfection.  The Lomo seemed more fun to eat because it comes out on a table top grill.  After chilling with some strong coffee, we kicked back shouted our conversations like everyone else and enjoyed the experience.  Great fun this place.

Reviews.Author: T. B.
Reviews.Content: Last night I had my first Tango Sur dining experience, and I can honestly say that I've got nothing but love for the hearty food, the intimate (yet lively) ambiance, and the friendly service! I will definitely be returning, and would recommend it to anyone who loves quality meats, delicious sweets, and a good ol' BYOB. So what if we waited 15-20 minutes to be seated? The weather was lovely and I was in great company. Besides, I never mind waiting a little longer for good eats. Speaking of which...- We started with the seafood salad (Mezcla del Mar), which was delicious! Fresh and savory, with a tangy little pop of fresh squeezed lemon that created the perfect flavor balance. Simple and satisfying. I could stand to have more of this salad in my life. - I got the filet mignon entree (El Filet) and have zero regrets. It actually comes with two fillets as well as a little cup of chimichurri sauce (I could've used two of those) and a healthy serving of spinach and garlic mashed potatoes. I wasn't a huge fan of the mash, but that's more because I'm simply not big on potatoes unless they are either in fry form or sweet/yam form. Not your fault, Tango Sur. That's an ongoing personal issue I'm working through.- My date got the Bife Ve Suvio, which he destroyed. It was an amazing feat to witness, since they really load each dish up with copious amounts of meat. He just got really quiet and Hoovered that thing. I was able to salvage a sample and it was HEAVENLY! - Holy mother of flan! Now when I tell you that I'm the kind of gal who "likes" flan, I mean that I don't particularly "love" flan. Like, I never go out of my way to get my hands on the stuff and am usually pretty "meh" about it when I do. But that thick, rich (but not too rich!) dollop of dulce de leche on top makes Tango Sur's flan the only dessert I ever want to finish a meal with ever again. Real talk. I don't ever need to see another piece of chocolate anything if I can have this stuff instead. My date is even less of a fan of flan, but was fully converted as well. Seriously: try the flan, thank me later.And to top it all off, our waiter was a dream: super friendly, helpful, attentive and hospitable. He was tipped very well in return :)All in all, this was easily one of THE BEST meals I've had since I moved to Chicago almost two years ago. And that's coming from a gal who's really been eating her way around the city. I'll be back, Tango Sur... just you wait :)

Reviews.Author: Jessica S.
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing. I visit the city about once a year and last year this made the "i have to try" list so when i made my travel plans this was the main place to go for me. The food was amazing, i had the pork chop and it was creamy with the right kind of seasoning it was perfection. In fact everything ordered did not disappoint. The wait staff was on point we never needed to fag anyone down nor where they constantly at our table, just the right amount of attentiveness to make our night a pleasure.

Reviews.Author: MmeMorticia D.
Reviews.Content: My favorite intimate little treasure nestled close to the Music Box Theatre hasn't disappointed me yet. In the decades I've been bringing people, the same people that got engaged here now celebrate anniversaries, birthdays, etc here. Yes it's loud, always packed and always has a wait but that should clue you in as to how memorable and succulent the meals are. We always cover the table (and our faces) with empanadas, parilladas and churrascos. Factor in that it's now BYOB and let this become ground zero for the start of a fabulous and memorable night- you won't go wrong. You're welcome.

Reviews.Author: Trevor M.
Reviews.Content: Went here for a bachelor party, and had a really good time. Would get 5 stars except when our party of 18 arrived for our reservation they told us we'd have to wait 30-45 mins as they had to move people inside due to rain. Would have been nice to get some free appetizers or something for the inconvenience.  Food is really good, although you can share any entree, the filet comes with 2 filets and when I commented to the waitress about how much food there is she said " Yea most entrees can be shared" Well it was a little late at that point as we all ordered our own entree. But this place is definitely worth a visit

Reviews.Author: Mark H.
Reviews.Content: Argentine's finest? It's simple w/ no frills.The ambience was dark, quaint yet spartan-ish  with either romantic undertones....or it's the restaurant's attempt to conserve on electricity. During the course of the dinner some clues led me to believe the latter might be more likely.For one, the lack of plate settings. Another the table cloth. And of course the seating.Their greatest asset however and what probably keeps 'em coming back. BYOB.I don't usually comment too much on service but...the service was guido-ish. This ponytail dude chose ten words when he could have just used one. He was eager creepy on his communicative approach. That doesn't affect my star rating.So I sampled the empanadas....meh.Tried the meat platter from filet, ribeye, chorizo and blood sausages to get a full course flavor of meats.The filet was actually decent. Ribeye was flavorless though. Needed A1 sauce which I had to request. Chorizo was interesting. The blood sausage was unique and an acquired taste. Overall, it's just OK.This place has a niche audience though.Tango Sur is like having to pay a cable bill versus paying a car note elsewhere.  I'd say this is a great neighborhood spot but not worth a 20 minute drive.

Reviews.Author: John Z.
Reviews.Content: What's not to love about this place? BYOB, red meat, empanadas, romantic. My only hesitation is the lack of reservations, there is nothing worse than trying there for a Friday night date and waiting outside for an hour. If I want red meat, and don't mind waiting, I'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Leslie W.
Reviews.Content: Yup not 3 stars, should have reread my own review but I wanted steak and BYOB, hopefully outdoor seating. We sat outdoors this time and that was the best part of the meal, nice patio seating and a bottle of Champagne on a Monday night.Anyone who puts this is the "best steakhouse in Chicago" in their review really needs to clarify exactly WHICH other steakhouses they're comparing it to. They probably haven't been to any of the big boys Chicago is known for. Even at a lower price point, it's just not worth it.The meat was, meh, not at all the awesome steak of my memories. I got the El Filet. Cooked right, just bland and really dependent on the sauce. The spinach mashed potatoes were just awful, no potato flavor and watery as other reviewers have said. Yes, no potato flavor sounds odd, but it was a flavorless green paste. The rolls are just sad: tough, cold, chewy in a bad way.Their service is VERY "laid back," if you want something, like your check, you need to be assertive. Not a negative per say, just be aware and adjust your expectations accordingly.Follow the four star hype if you want, but Yelpers got this one wrong. This update is more for me anyway, so I remember that I don't want to waste a night out on steak I'm not going to enjoy. Take it or leave it. If you loved it, glad you had a good experience, but this place is just not for me.

Reviews.Author: lesley r.
Reviews.Content: A favorite of mine. The steak is always good no matter what. I've never tried anything besides the parrillada because everytime I go that's all I want. My fiancé and I always share one and that's sufficient.

Reviews.Author: Morgan G.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came here for our anniversary and were very disappointed. I'll start with the positives, the ambiance is great for a date night, candlelit, very intimate. The empanadas were ordered for our appetizer were pretty good, they were cooked nicely and had a good crunch and flavorful filling. Unfortunately the positives stop there. We were seated ridiculously close to another couple (I was much closer to the man at the other table than I was my husband. It took the intimate vibe to an awkward level). The bread we were served looked like day old rolls from Thanksgiving at Grandma's and tasted like it too. We waited over 30 minutes between our appetizer and entrees. When the steaks did arrive the plates were swimming in juice from the meat. I ordered mine medium well and classifying what I got as rare would be generous. I requested that it be cooked more and when I got it back it was still under cooked, but I didn't feel like asking again. The meat was next to flavorless and the potatoes were runny. Overall an awful experience and I can recommend staying away especially for a special occasion.

Reviews.Author: Jeana C.
Reviews.Content: I love Tango Sur.Byob.. Romantic atmosphere.  Dark.I love the El filet. There's a wait though, so plan ahead!

Reviews.Author: Joann V.
Reviews.Content: Definitely a restaurant my boyfriend and I want to try again. I had the Bife Vesuvio, absolutely delish. We brought our own wine bottle and also loved that there was no corkage fee. Only bad thing was the wait, about an hour and 30 minutes.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer S.
Reviews.Content: Loved this place! The food was great. Service was nice and I never felt rushed. BYOB. I had a beef empanada. And then my friend and I shared the flank steak. I'm glad we shared because it was about a 12 oz steak and huge. Perfectly cooked, juicy, with deliciously seasoned potatoes and chimichurri sauce. We sat outside on the patio. The perfect place for my friend's birthday. For three of us we paid $45. Great deal. I'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Linn L.
Reviews.Content: Love the cozy ambiance at this place - it's dark, only lit with candles, and at every table there's a young couple looking deep in one anther's eyes. That said - this is a good spot to bring your date for a tasty dinner, in casual setting.Food then? Must say I am not a huge steak eater. That said, I went for Norwegian salmon. It was a huuge portion with very creamy (yet delicious) sauce and mashed potatoes. Presentation, again very casual. Felt like something my mom would have put together a Tuesday night - in a good way.Our waiter was good, and as with this whole experience, his service felt very authentic. It's a BYOB which you can like or not - at this place it works really well and our waiter quickly came out with a cooler to keep our white bottle at good temperature, and gladly gave us an extra set of wine glasses since we had a red bottle too.Make sure you don't eat up everything on your plate cause you will most likely fall asleep - which does not make a good date!

Reviews.Author: Michael P.
Reviews.Content: One reviewer says "The best steakhouse in Chicago."  Really?!?!?!?!?!?!  I would suggest that you need to get out more.  A LOT more.  Understanding that opinions and tastes vary, I think the opinions of this place are significantly skewed by the BYOB policy and the likelihood that most people are drunk by the time their meat comes.  I have been here 4 times, and there are no less than 20 other steakhouses in the City I have been to multiple times that I would EASILY put ahead of Tango Sur.  IMO this is the most over-hyped place in Lakeview and one of the most over-hyped in the entire City.  Each time my meat was at least a full level of doneness away from what I requested.  The meat itself is nothing special.  Yeah, it's o.k. ambiance, yeah they can do bigger groups, but there just ain't nuthin' special.

Reviews.Author: Mud B.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went there yesterday for our 18th anniversary. We went there back when we were dating. While my wife really enjoyed her flap steak, he vesuvio potatoes tasted old and gross. I ordered a veal t-bone and was insanely disappointed. It was filled with gristle/silver skin. My steak knife could get through it. I pointed it out the the waiter and he told me I was wrong and it was fat. When I pointed to the fat, that I could cut through and then the gristle that I couldn't cut through, he repeated that he was fat and that is what give veal it's flavor........ Really? Are you fucking kidding me? $28 for a scoop of mashed potatoes and an inedible steak. Also, it was very hot outside and they served us water with no ice.

Reviews.Author: Erica D.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur, you had me at BYOB with no corkage fee! You literally can start drinking as soon as you get there. I was waiting for my group to arrive, and I was seated in the back waiting room where there are tables, wine glasses, and a corkscrew ready to go! I mean, waiting sucks, but drinking while waiting makes things a-ok. On to the food ... man are the portions generous! Let's start off with the empanadas. They really are what everyone claims them to be : amazing, delicious, tasty, mouthwatering, appetizing.. you name it. I ordered 2 empanadas for $2 each and they were really filling! My group had fun sharing our empanadas with each other. Also, where else can you get an appetizer for $2?! So the steak ... again, believe what everyone tells you when they say the portions are huge. Thanks Tango Sur for not only cooking up a delicious steak, but for also being pretty generous with the portion. I ordered the Churrasco and it was like 3 servings worth of meat for me. I had plenty of leftovers for the next day! The prices for the steak do seem a bit on the pricier side (my entree was around $23-24), but think of it as 2 meals in one and it justifies the price. (Not to mention the quality of the meat! I believe our server said the meat they use is grass-fed). I would have given this place five stars except for : -the dim lighting : It's nice and intimate, but is kinda straining on your eyes -our server was kinda touchy: every time he spoke to us he would touch someone's shoulder or arm. Other than that, it was a great experience. This is the kind of place you would go for a romantic evening out or an intimate dinner with friends. tl;dr: BYOB, large portions, and feel free to overload on empanadas. Also, bringing night vision goggles wouldn't hurt.

Reviews.Author: Dimitris K.
Reviews.Content: Maybe they had a really (really) off night. But we had a terrible experience. The good: empanadas and eggplants in vinegar both good. The bad: the rest. We got the mixed grill for two ($40). The meat in that combo was unchewable. Flavor was ok -  just had to spit afterwards since there was no breaking apart the meat with our teeth and using water to swallow meat as if it were pills is probably not how it's supposed to be done. Told the waiter, he offered fillet and some unintelligible excuse for the other meat. They brought 2 large plates with fillet (4 large pieces total) to replace the $40 combo. The cost was something like $56 for the 2 fillet portions. I'm ok with paying extra but the server always needs to explain  what he will replace the original order with and if there will be a difference in price. I wasn't expecting 2 separate portions, either.  Last but not least - the fillet had no flavor. Yes it's not the most flavorful cut in general but the lack of flavor in this case was pretty epic even after liberal amounts of chimichurri and salt...Probably won't be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Bea K.
Reviews.Content: LOVE this PLACE!!! We eat here all the time because it's always fantastic! I love the spinach and beef empanadas (the ham was good but it's not my fav). Love the churrasco steak and the eggplant marinara dish is awesome.

Reviews.Author: Regina M.
Reviews.Content: The waiter was rude and placed the wrong order. We didn't like the food. The empanadas were OK, the provoleta cheese had no taste at all and we couldn't even finish the veal milanesa because it was too greasy and chewy. The experience was very l disappointing and over-priced.

Reviews.Author: Gus F.
Reviews.Content: I came back to tango Sur after 7 years (I used to be a regular before moving to the burbs) and it was a pleasant surprise. Food was great. The atmosphere is candle light. It is a nice (if not the best)second date restaurant and also cool enough to share with a group of friends! You must order their empanadas. they are fantastic! I order a "bife de chorizo". The steak was cooked to perfection. Their portions are super sized so, come hungry or be prepared for a doggy bag home. I really recommend it. Love that place

Reviews.Author: Sam M.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite places in town.  I could go on an on about the food, but the service and atmosphere need mentioning too.  Both are some of the best in town.  Great on Sunday's when less crowded.  I wish they took reservations, but they would be booked for months.   The empanadas are the best around and  the steaks with that chimichurri are fantastic.

Reviews.Author: BforBulky B.
Reviews.Content: I SO wanted to love this place! It was a disaster from the beginning. Our waiter was beyond creepy - so creepy that we didn't want to look at him. He placed the wrong order for both of us, only correcting my friends order and conVINCING me that what he brought me was steak when it was so clearly veal...or an albino cow. Nothing made this experience worth returning.

Reviews.Author: Crystal S.
Reviews.Content: Love the cozy vibe with a candle lit delicious meal and eating on there outdoor patio is absolutely fabulous. I recommend all there steaks. For the price it's definitely worth it and the staff is great and I also enjoy the music they play there. Great place to go with friends and your loved ones.

Reviews.Author: Katy S.
Reviews.Content: Went to Tango Sur last night, party of three. When we walked in we noticed that the restaurant is very welcoming, cute decor, candlelit, dark, and romantic looking. That's one star right there! The second star comes from the server being a genuinely nice guy with our needs on his mind and very attentive. And also because the chorizo app. was really good.However, here's where the problem with Tango Sur begins:1. No alcohol, zero, zilch. You MUST byob if you want vino. No choice. 2. We ordered two filets which are purportedly the best choices on the menu. The meat came out extremely chewy, RARE (even though we had ordered medium), and not seasoned at all. I am a veteran at Argentinian style steak. Unfortunately, this meat was very bland & much less appealing to our Spanish tastebuds than say...Outback Steakhouse. The experience was very lackluster and disappointing. I had heard great things and was uber excited to try this place out. Sad Katy, sad. :(

Reviews.Author: Carol L.
Reviews.Content: The food is great, but the service is even better.  I planned a birthday dinner for my boyfriend last night.  There were 8 of us and the restaurant was so helpful about1. scheduling the reservation, which I had to change the party size for a few times2. suggesting menu items appropriate for sharing 3. getting the cake I brought ready 4. taking group photos 5. bill-splittingThese sound like small things but having all of them done right made the birthday party a stress-free time for the planner (me) and lots of fun for the guests.  Lastly, I will definitely come back here because the food itself is THAT good.  the melted cheese app and rib-eye were amazing.

Reviews.Author: Kate U.
Reviews.Content: I went here on a date night with a guy a few months back.   The date wasn't so great but the food definitely was!  The filet mignon was excellent, not the best I ever had but definitely worth the money for what you get.  This restaurant had the best romantic atmosphere of any restaurant I've been to in Chicago; dim lighting, candles, etc.The great part about this place is it's BYOB so we brought our own red wine to go with the steak.  Also the green mashed potatoes are really tasty!  So gentlemen, if you need to plan a date night in chicago, take your significant other to this restaurant.  She'll feel like a queen and enjoy it.

Reviews.Author: Beth P.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing - but be ready for a wait.  We knew we would be chancing it on a Saturday night so we put our names on the list and hung out at one of the local bars, though 2.5 hours is quite a long time!  We met up with some friends from our Argentinian and Chile trip this past fall and were not disappointed by the authentic menu.  My husband and I both ordered different steaks (both from Argentina).  They have both US and Argentinian meat on the menu - just make sure to ask your waiter which is which (if you care)Though the long wait is a bit of a deterent, the food is so good that I know we'll be back again soon!

Reviews.Author: Phillip M.
Reviews.Content: Best steak in Lakeview!! This place is amazing! A carnevor's dream!!Phenomenal food, fantastic service and its BYOB. Go with an appetite as everything is generously portioned and you will definitely need a box at the end. The waiters are extremely knowledgeable and can provide great recommendations and insight as to what you are in the mood for. Make a reservation or dont, its up to you. If you get there early enough just put your name on the list and the host will call you while you pop into the other bars for a drink prior to dinner. We sat outside which was great however the atmosphere inside looked equally amazing. Definitely the date night spot in the neighborhood. You wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Allie S.
Reviews.Content: I have been here 5 times in 4 years. My birthday, girl gatherings, family get togethers etc. I'd say it's a wonderful place to hang, have a couple bottles of wine and eat some empanadas. I work on "meat station" at work. My job is to ensure the customer receives their steak, chop and so on; cooked to their liking. I've ordered 4 steaks out of the 5 times I've been there. Not once was it cooked to my liking. 1.Filet MR- came out black and blue (I can handle it, I refused to send food back so I dealt with it) $28ish2. Skirt steak MR- it was well done. Inedible  $20ish3. El filet MR- comes with two filets, other person didn't want MR, I explained it's the only way to eat it. Came out raw. $28ish4. Bone in ribeye Medium- came out rare as rare can be. $27ishI love food. I love meat. I LOVE byob. But I can't spend the money on something (with a cooks bank account) on food I need to send back. Sent back the rib eye tonight- came back well done (microwave job I could tell). All in all. Go on a first date, eat some empanadas and cheese. Go home (chew some gum) and make out.

Reviews.Author: Jannette P.
Reviews.Content: The best steak and very affordable and it's BYOB!!!   This place is good for group or date night!!! Our server is excellent!!! We have a reservation but there is still a wait, waiting room is small and we are big group 9 ppl!!! Over all is good place, we will be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Hitomi A.
Reviews.Content: The BEST steak house in Chicago.  (Deliciousness + Service) to Price Ratio is Maximum at this place. You will not be sorry.

Reviews.Author: Lily F.
Reviews.Content: Made a yelp account so I could write this. So it's saying a lot. This place is an absolute must go to! The beef, chicken, and spinach empanadas are flaky, light, and so delicious for $2 each!! The para uno is a great deal and a great way to try a couple things. Everything was so so yummy with generous portion sizes. If you're still hungry definitely get the French fries/papas fritas, perfectly fried and have a delicious kind of breading on them. The people working here were all adorable and great too. In other words: GO HERE NOW STOP THINKING AND YELPING JUST GO .

Reviews.Author: Eric H.
Reviews.Content: Amazing! They've got great steaks.Went here for an anniversary with my girlfriend. Everyone says that there's a really long wait, but if you call ahead, you'll have no problems getting a table. The restaurant really does get crowded pretty quickly, even on weeknights. We brought a bottle of wine, because they're BYOB with no corkage fee. We were sat at a nice, candlelit table at the window. We started off with some empanadas, which were good (but there are better ones elsewhere). Both of us got steak (which is what they're known for), and they came out cooked perfectly. The spinach mashed potatoes were great. The portions were massive, we both had leftovers. The prices were really reasonable for a steakhouse and for how intimate the place was. Service was attentive and friendly. Tango Sur is a great date night place.

Reviews.Author: Dani M.
Reviews.Content: After years of having this place on our "Must Try" list the boyfriend and I can finally cross it off. As the restaurant is BYOB we brought a nice red wine to enjoy with our red meat. Our server, Martín, was wonderful and very attentive. We started off with the beef empanada and the antipasto. I would order the empanadas again to try some of their other options, but we would probably skip the antipasto. The antipasto wasn't bad, but for $10 we would prefer to just load up on empanadas.  For our main course we split the Lomo Relleno which is a large filet stuffed with ham sauce and chimichurri and topped with a portobella marsala. It was AMAZING. One of the best steaks I have had in a long time.  Typically we like our steaks medium rare, but Martín recommended that we get it served medium and he was right on the money. Great food, romantic atmosphere, and decently priced. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Pete V.
Reviews.Content: Best steak on the north side. The meat was seasoned well and cooked to perfection. Their empanadas were fantastic. The ambience is cozy and intimate. The service was very good. The best part is they are a BYOB. I would go here every week if I lived closer.

Reviews.Author: Giorgio F.
Reviews.Content: This places is yummy.  The green looking mashed potatoes are tasty, and yes, the pictures are real, when you order a filet mignon, you actually get to pieces.  I shared a plate with my girl friend.  Given the portions and taste, the price is right.  I will come back here again. I look forward to trying the skirt steak next time =)

Reviews.Author: Cass P.
Reviews.Content: Food, delicious.  BYOB, great. The half hour turned one hour turned two hour wait even with reservations.... Not too nice.

Reviews.Author: Andrew M.
Reviews.Content: Great service, appetizers and entrees were great too, Couldn't believe the portion sizes, Prices were great as well, can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: A M.
Reviews.Content: YUMMMMM! This place is so goooood!  The empanadas are amazing.  The steak portions are ridiculous!  It is such a little romantic, candle lit place.  I would recommend this place to anyone wanting to take a date to a nice dinner.

Reviews.Author: Catherine P.
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful evening at Tango Sur. The Argentinian music was exceptional and set the mood. The darker atmosphere with the candles was romantic. Brought two bottles of Pinot noir and enjoyed the saganaki cheese appetizer and two empanadas. The ham and cheese was terrific. I would skip the spinach one and try the beef one next time.I ordered the filet entree and it was enough food for two. Easily the best entree at the table. Cooked medium rare and served with spinach mashed potatoes. Loved the chimichurri sauce. Just a touch of that took the steak to the next level.Enjoyed the cheesecake dessert and it was great as well. Was hoping for chocolate but this didn't disappoint. Spent two hours at Tango Sur and the service was on point. We never felt rushed and it was truly a great "hole in the wall" here in Chicago. Worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Kara B.
Reviews.Content: Eh. Could have done without. Would have been 2 stars if it wasn't BYOB and we didn't polish off an entire bottle of Chianti and a bomber of beer. We were really excited to go here because what's better than decently priced steak and BYOB in Chicago on a Friday night? The fact that it was BYOB was truly one of the only saving graces of this place. It has lots of hype and great yelp reviews, but our experience was different.We got there at 6:30 on a Friday night and the restaurant wasn't busy yet, which was nice thinking we were going to have to wait a few hours. That being said, there were plenty of open tables, but we got seated at the table right next to the kitchen which was not an enjoyable atmosphere and kind of a bummer since there were plenty of open two tops. For starters we got one of each empanada which were all really good. For dinner, my husband got the bone in ribeye which he literally couldn't cut without shaking the table and I got a filet that was good and flavorful, but again SO TOUGH. We both took portions home, me because I was stuffed after 1/2 of the filet (which was the normal portion of a filet meal....not complaining though) and my husband because he was getting self conscious of knocking the table over trying to cut his ribeye.I mean, it's BYOB...and steaks were around $25. You get what you pay for...

Reviews.Author: Brian B.
Reviews.Content: So last night the wife and I went to Tango Sur in Chicago. We arrived just a few minutes before 8pm. I hand my keys to a valet  and he says, " Just so you know we close at 11pm." ( At the time I found it a bit odd considering it was not even 8pm yet.) I walked up and put my name in, the man there says, " hour to and hour and a half." I give him my telephone he will call when our table is ready.. my wife and I walk down to the irish pub about 2 doors down to kill the time. At roughly 9:45pm (about 15 minutes later than the latest time I was quoted) I got a call saying,"please come back your table is nearly ready".. we walk back the 200 ft to Tango Sur to claim our table and the guy says " please step to the left sir".. we got behind one couple who within minutes was moved right in, then 10 minutes go by and its 10pm, my wife asks the man, "how much longer do you think it will be?" He replies with some suave and predetermined answer," Terribly sorry for the wait but we have guests who have paid their bill, we are just waiting for them to leave their table and we will get you right in.".. just then a guy behind us walks up speaking in Spanish and suddenly after a few chuckles he and his date are swept right in. I had enough, I began telling the guy off, more than a few choice words were surely included, the manager comes out apologizes and takes us right in and offers to comp our appetizer.. it is now roughly 10:05ish.. we sit down and our waiter comes by.. he brings water and walks straight away.. 5 more minutes go by(I'm watching every minute at this point I have to grab my car by 11pm) he finally comes back and we say" Yes we are ready to oreder. Can you bring the appetizer out with the food, we've waited a very long time and have to pick up our car in less than an hour".. the waiter looks dead at me and says, " ah the kitchen is backed up it will be at least an hour til your food will come out." I said" but the valet closes at 11pm do they come in at least to give you your keys or basically am I losing my car potentially at 11?" He nonchalantly shrugs at me and says " hey were busy food will be an hour at least I dont know about valets" I stood up middle fingers in air and walked out.. Thank you Tango Sur for providing THE WORST SERVICE I have ever experienced at ANY PLACE AT ANY TIME, thank you for all acting like you run a big shot vegas night club instead of a quaint and humbled Chicago restaurant, thank you for setting the bar to an ALL TIME NEW LOW STANDARD of disrespectfulness, and most of all thank you for nothing, I essentially spent 45 minutes driving into the city, and hour and 45 minutes waiting for a call, another 15-20 minutes to be sat and waited on, all to find out I could lose my car foir the night while waiting yet again for another hour to see food much less eat it.. I will never be back and whenever I'm asked about my personal ALL TIME WORST EXPERIENCE IVE EVER HAD I WILL BE SURE TO TELL PEOPLE ALL ABOUT YOUR ESTABLISHMENT.

Reviews.Author: Jeff S.
Reviews.Content: Maybe it is my age, but at just over 50, there are few places I think are good enough to wait an hour and a half to eat at.  But neither my wife or I could come up with a better idea, or were really motivated to go elsewhere, PLUS the Yelp! reviews were strong and a friend who is a suos-chef recommended the place. So we decided to wait.  Turn off number one, the waiting room was full, what is your phone number we will call you at whatever bar you'd like to go to when we have a table for you.  The place is dark, loud and jam packed.  It is only because it is so noisy overall, that you can't hear the conversations in the tables all around you.  And this is fine, we were up for that scene, but know this before you wait 60-150 minutes for a table if you think you are about to have a romantic, quiet, meal.  The food was good, but it is probably not something I would wait this long for again.  Glad they are doing this well, but no dedicated foodie (which I am not) would wait this long for a meal that was only this good.  We began our meal with the Provoleta, an "Argentine provolone cheese cooked on the grill with olive oil and roasted peppers."  Fine, I was hungry, I like cheese, it filled the stomach.  Note, it was actually better with the very simple, and frankly bland, lettuce and tomato salad they begin your meal with.  My wife, a pesce-vegie, ordered their highly recommended Berenjena, or "oven baked eggplant layered with spinach, provolone, parmesan and ricotta, served with a delicious tomato cream sauce" and found it delightful, but also good, not great.  I thought the flavors were interesting, and was enthusiastic to share a few bites. I had a happy stomach of Bife Ancho, ribeye from the grill, done just a bit more than rare.  Not sure why I have to feel this way, but I was just impressed that it was simply done as I had asked, this is so rarely the case ANYWHERE one orders steak.  But here is the simple truth, I can make a steak as good as their's at home.  Glad to have someone else cook, steak was good, but not a WOW Argentinean delight or anything.The wait staff was warm and friendly, but rushed, the door person was also kind and gracious as he basically told us to take our six pack of Revolution Anti-Hero IPA to a bar and wait for 90 minutes.  If you were not aware, this is a BYOB restaurant.  It was a fine dining out meal, and yes, I would even go back with only a nudge (as long as it was no more than a 45 minute wait), but if you are expecting a blow your hair back Argentinian meal, well you won't' find that here.  Just a typical Chicago neighborhood place with an Argentinean theme where you can BYOB and be lost and get drunk in the crowded and noisy chaos while enjoying a good meal.

Reviews.Author: Andy M.
Reviews.Content: This was easily my favorite dining experience of 2013. The food, service and overall vibe were all 5 stars. Combine that with the Company of my lovely Wife and my two of my closet friends and you have an evening to remember.  The four of us were a hungry group. We started out with a couple of orders of Empanadas and the Provoleta. The Empanadas were delicious, but the Provoleta stole my heart. This is a dish of hot cheese served with Olive Oil and roasted Peppers. It was amazing.   For my entree, I decided to go with the Bife Vesuvio. It was a delicious cut of Steak stuffed with Cheese and Spinach. It was served with slices of Aregntine style Potatoes. It is one of the best Steak dishes I've ever tasted. And Yes...I even ate the Spinach.   Here's the delicious bottom line: Ive been to many places that serve delicious food, but Tango Sur has one commodity most eateries lack. That commodity is the staff. The staff at Tango Sur bend over backwards to make you feel at home. It seemed there was nothing they wouldn't do to enhance our dining experience. That my friends, is what makes Tango Sur great. If you haven't tried this place, you should put it at the top of your list of places to dine. Yes folks...Its that good.

Reviews.Author: Andre W.
Reviews.Content: This is one of those places everyone and there whole family has been to....except me of course.I have a very good friend that is from Argentina and she swears by this place when it comes to authentic Argentinian foodWe met up there on a Fri evening and of course they do not take reservations for parties of 2 so we had a bit of a wait. Its byob, so I brought 2 bottles of wine for our enjoyment. They have a very intimate waiting area that is very dim and candlelit.After about 25 mins our seat was ready and we were hungry. I followed her lead on food as she has been here numerous times.We started out with the empanadas (spinach, chicken & beef) which were all good. For the main course we wound up sharing the Para Dos which includes grilled short rib, black sausage, beef shortbread, sausage & flap meat. Basically meat overload! Everything was delicious and packed with awesome flavor. More than anything I enjoyed the hell out of the grilled short rib. For dessert we had a caramel flan type dish and it was very good....it was huge so we shared with our dining neighbors.Service was really nice and they definitely made sure we had everything we needed. Very crowded but intimate setting which is one of the reasons the place is appealing...the other being he food..lol...I really dig this jointDefinitely will return for the chilean salmon!

Reviews.Author: Ben S.
Reviews.Content: Amazing steakhouse!  We had a couple empanadas to start, and they were delicious. I was recommended the "El Filet", and I'm so glad I went with it. It was one of the best steaks I've ever had. The sauce it sits on top of is perfect with it. And the side of spinach mashed potatoes are great. The service there is very good and attentive. I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Author: Pete M.
Reviews.Content: My friends and I enjoyed a good night here tonight. This was my first visit and I have to say I would return again the service was great and food as advertised. It fills up fast on Fridays so I recommend reservations.I had the churasco (Steak & Potatoes) and recommend it. The portion size is large, so make sure your hungry if you order it.

Reviews.Author: Brittany B.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were looking for somewhere different to go and a friend recommended this place. We went on a Friday night (in June 2013) around 6 PM, and we were able to be seated right away. There were also a lot of empty tables around us. By the time our empanada appetizers came out, all of the tables had filled up and there was a line out the door. The wait staff was attentive and able to recommended some shareable options for us. We ordered the filet with spinach mashed potatoes. Our waiter told us that this was a popular dish. It came with 2 salads, 2 seven oz pieces of filet, and a large portion of spinach mashed potatoes (which are GREEN!). The salads were nothing special. I had a few bites then passed the rest to my BF. The steak was juicy and tasty. My medium ordered steak came out on more of the medium rare side, but it was still good. The potatoes were pretty good once I put some of the steak juice on top of it. We also ordered some carrot cake to finish the night, which was good. Our check was $46 without a tip. All in all, it was a romantic location with good food and a great location!

Reviews.Author: Matt T.
Reviews.Content: The filet for 2 was amazing and was a great deal! Had to wait a while to get in, but the food was worth it. We went late on a Saturday night and the service was pretty slow, but our waiter gave us a free dessert for our wait. Love that it's byob. We'll be back here for sure.

Reviews.Author: Mike M.
Reviews.Content: Ambiance is great , dark and moody. The meat is over seasoned , a little tough, but all plentiful. For the true carnivore experience, order combination platters for 2 or more. Also order the better grade of meat which is offered. Of course the BYOB makes the overall experience even better.

Reviews.Author: Allan M.
Reviews.Content: I liked this place, but maybe the 2nd visit here I did here could've been perhaps a wrong choice for a main entree? Also, it seems like with all the reviews, that I must've been one of the few who never quite got here, till about a year ago. Went here a 2nd time a few months back, as well.Still really do enjoy the empanadas here, and I think I may've made a bad choice with getting the Befe Vesuvio(Prime Steak with Spinach) my second time here. The Argentinian style potatos were a little tasteless to me, as well. OTOH, I did like the El Filet(Filet Mignon), and preferred the mash potatoes that came with the filet mignon over the Argentinian style potatoes that come with the prime steak with spinach.And how did I almost forget the decent chimichurri you get with the empanadas? I did like the fact they give you that along with the empanadas. Also, I agree that the music is a tad loud, and it wouldn't hurt to turn it down slightly. Glad I did knock going here off my Chicago bucket list, though. I wonder how its competition(El Nandu) stacks up for an Argentinian restaurant?

Reviews.Author: C W.
Reviews.Content: **** Vegetarian ReviewThis place certainly isn't lacking for good reviews, but I'm going to leave one anyway so that I can keep on on personal list of great dining experiences.  The corn empanada is incredible.  Just go ahead and order a mess of them.

Reviews.Author: Lindsey A.
Reviews.Content: My wife is Chilean so she loves her some South America fare with Latin flare. (Too much?)We came here for a date night last Friday. The sole reason I'm not giving this place four outta five is based on one person - the door/patronage guy. Mr. Leather Jacket with his black rimmed glasses and slightly balding hairline whose ego and presumptuous nature were enough to fill the entire empty restaurant. Cause I got there at 6 p.m., yanno, before the place was even 1/8 full. "Party of two, please," I said. "Is the other person here?" he quipped. "No, she's about ten minutes behind me."Instead of seating me (really. it's not a party of six. or a party of four. OR a party of three. just me and one other person), he takes me to their 'waiting area' which is a dark room with four benches and a table in the center. Fine. I'll sit here alone and pop the wine I brought, alone. And twiddle my thumbs while I wait for my other half.When she arrived - five minutes earlier than I predicted - we were immediately seated, but come on! Thank you for wielding your awesome power, Mr. Leather Jacket, but you're all I pretty much 'recall' from the restaurant. Sure, my chicken was tasty and my wife said her steak was some of the best she's had in a while, but can you curb your self-imposed cool for a while, Leather Jacket, and be more down-to-Earth? No? Well, you stuck out like a sore thumb and instead of the mood lighting and nice service from our waiter, no corkage fee and amazing dessert.... I wrote this entire review about you.Crap, I probably just made his day by doing so.

Reviews.Author: Cait C.
Reviews.Content: Tango sur exceeded my expectations. First off the service was phenomenal! We went there on a Tuesday it was packed, we opted yo sit on the patio so there was a wait, however there is this little back room called the drinking room where you can start drinking your byob! The room is dark but it makes you feel as if you left Chicago and are in Argentina. The steaks had great flavor!! I've been to many steaks house..maestros Ruth Chris... This was not the change your life steak but it was very good don't get me wrong! Great prices awesome staff, amazing atmosphere, byob, tasty steak makes me highly recommend this place ! Oh yea the empanadas are the bomb!!!!

Reviews.Author: Ina B.
Reviews.Content: Packed on Saturday eve,  but oh so worth waiting!   Loved the eggplants vinaigrette, warm bread and the Bife Ancho, to die for!  Excellent service,  nice job in the BYOB section as well.

Reviews.Author: Sara S.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! Went there with a big group for some friends who were in town and we couldn't have been happier. The service is phenomenal and they were very accommodating around our party size changing a couple of times. The food is delicious and all freshly made. Plus since it's BYOB the bill wont break the bank. It can get very loud and the lighting is mostly candles so just keep that in mind when considering this place. Overall a great find and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Cindy G.
Reviews.Content: This was one of the sexiest restaurants I have ever been to. We came here for a Yelp team dinner and when we walked in I think everyone felt like we were in a little mom and pop restaurant in Havanna.  The ambiance is dim lit with a single tall standing candle on each table. The music is strange and very sexual with heavy bass. Honestly though,  I think this is what I liked most about the place. It was so different, and I know between the music, atmosphere and it being BYOB there are some babies being made after a night out here. Now on to the food. Jiminy Christmas! To start we had a few meat and cheese platters which hey, how can you go wrong there. Then we had the empanadas, which I was not very excited about until I took one bite and almost orgasmed. I guess I have never had a really stellar empanda but trust me out of everything we had these were my favorite. Especially drenched in that home made chimichurri (rolls eyes in back of head and sighs--SO GOOD!)We also had a few other apps that were great. By time my filet came, I was sad to say I only could stomach like 5 bites, but dayyyyum. P.S. some good advice: Split the steak. This thing was gigantic and took up an entire entree plate and it was only around $30 bucks. I just kept thinking you could come here with you hunny and have a night out for under $50 when you BYOB. At the end of this meal, I was more than satisfied and the service was fantastic. Seriously if you are looking for a date night, look no further, this is your place!!!

Reviews.Author: Yoel J.
Reviews.Content: This place usually gets packed fast.  So I highly recommend getting table by 6 pm.  They accept reservations, but I typically don't plan ahead to eat here--just not that type of place for me.  It's also BYOB and there are many places that you can get wines around Tango Sur--no corkage fee.  Food - Their sweetbread is mind-blowing--for its simplicity, my favorite place to get sweetbreads.  For a well-known steakhouse, the prices are very reasonable for the quality you get good.  But even though the steak is tasty and well cooked, it isn't overwhelmingly impressive either--when I think great steak dinners, my mind doesn't come here.  When I think convenient, affordable, and BYOB though, definitely.Service - a friendly good-looking staff who are very knowledgeable and helpful with picking the right cut for you.  Our waiter kindly recommended that we should stick to medium when we requested medium-rare as the cuts we ordered we're on the fatty side--which I appreciated.They dim down the light quite a bit and it's super dark.  Each table is set with a candle, which makes for a nice vibe.  Not romantic though, with the tables rather tightly packed and easy to overhear your neighbors.Tango Sur is always predictably good while affordable--a nice local standby in an area where it can be hard to find a good steak.  The super cute servers certainly don't hurt.

Reviews.Author: Claudia D.
Reviews.Content: Went with the daughter and son in law.  The shrimp were a reasonable choice for me as an entree but the bed of spinach upon which they were served was far too salty and oily for me to eat.  I let the others enjoy it.Pork, beef and chicken dominated the menu.  Lamb also was available as well as one veal dish.My meat eating fellow diners were very happy with their huge portions and enjoyed their meals.I enjoyed the company of my fellow diners.The service was attentive, unobtrusive and took good care of us.Street parking was difficult, but not impossible.  Just allow plenty of time and pounce on the first available spot!  You may not find another.The washrooms were clean.The ambience was very dark, crowded, and I was unable to see much more.  The crowded room was very noisy, but we enjoyed ourselves.Just be prepared for a meat-centric, crowded, noisy atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Jen R.
Reviews.Content: The food here is good, not great, you can definitely cook these cuts of meat better at home. The bread are those previously frozen white roles and the salad looks like it should be on a burger.The ambiance is dark, cheerful and drunk. The service here is usually good to start but they don't check back much after that- especially not to inform them our filet was essentially raw (ordered medium rare).I have a theory that people always end up liking byobs that make you wait forever because your pretty sauced by the time you finally eat.

Reviews.Author: Cheryl F.
Reviews.Content: Came here for an early dinner and enjoyed everything. We ordered empanadas for our appetizer and the parrillada for 2. The meats were juicy and cooked perfect. We also had our first sweetbread experience and it was so good. If you've never had it, don't be scared. You will love them. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Author: Mikee R.
Reviews.Content: This was our third year visiting this place.Also the last. The base of the music was so loud it made the experience unenjoyably.The food was OK but not amazing as I had remembered it.The wait and the noise level was extra-ordinarily loud.This place is expensive, and in my opinion not worth it.We will be trying another place next year.

Reviews.Author: Danny W.
Reviews.Content: On a date with someone from the show True Blood? You're guaranteed some steamy hot vampire love after a night here. The lighting is low, the music is hip, they serve Sur-real portions of rare filet for about $25, and it's BYOB. If these things alone don't get you some serious suck face then you probably smell like a werewolf.  Everything on the menu is under about $30 including filets, strips, and skirts. The vibe is cool but intimate at the same time and the staff all speak with an accent that you'd imagine out of a cheesy romance novel. If you want a wallet watching way to impress a person whether human, vampire, werewolf, or whatever Tango Sur is your spot!

Reviews.Author: Candice G.
Reviews.Content: I don't like calling myself a vegetarian because I eat fish. I don't like calling myself a pescatarian because it sounds like a made-up-ass word....also because I'd totally eat human and I don't think there's a word for that yet. Webster's: Keep me posted on any developments. This place... it's for the meat eaters. Like, Fred Flintstone-style meat eaters. Our table must've had at least a wooly mammoth's worth of meat on the table. Glorious. Ok, not so much for me, but I can still appreciate a plate of two juicy, fist-sized filets and a side of pesto mashed potatoes for $25 at BYOB place. It was absolutely enough to induce meat sweats on at least two people per plate. For me, I'd say the spinach and cheese empanadas with that chimichurri sauce. Soooo good and I heard the meety ones were good as well... or at least not a crumb was left. I'd originally wanted the tortilla/egg/pepper dish on their tapas menu but our server said it would take 45 minutes and I was there with a big group so I opted not to make everyone wait. My next choice was the grilled octopus dish but the server noted that it was just a cold appetizer and didn't recommend it for a meal, so then I went with my third choice (really narrowing the menu down for me) which was their salmon entree special, but they were out of that completely. Bummer. I guess I'll just take the spinach ravioli. Womp womp. But I also tacked on that grilled octopus salad to treat myself. Boom.Both were great but the meat dishes are the absolute stunners here. Perfect meat sweat date spot. Also, there's a menu item called a 'Flap Meat'... super gross sounding, but I gotta give credit for originality.

Reviews.Author: Rich W.
Reviews.Content: Off the hook empandas, matambre and salads.  I brought my girlfriend here who has an extensive knowledge of Argentinian cuisine (born in Spain, studied in Argentina etc).  The meal was rockstar.  We ordered one of the larger meat dishes to split for two and it was fantastic.Friendly service.  Definitely make a reservation so that you don't have to wait.  We just walked up and put our name in while we dipped into a bar to buy a beer.

Reviews.Author: Nataliya A.
Reviews.Content: I came here with a group of 12 for a friend's birthday. We made a reservation well in advance, but still had to wait for a table for over a half an hour, in the smallest waiting area I have ever seen...by the only 1 person bathroom the whole place has....Clearly the start wasn't the greatest, and some aspects as well, but the food and the service make up the 4 stars.After we were seated the service was speedy, and good. Our food orders were taken in a timely manner and we got our food pretty fast too..My boyfriend and I got the empanadas to share, 1 spinach and cheese and 1 beef. I wasn't crazy about the beef one, just not my taste, but I did enjoy the spinach and cheese one.We also ordered the filet sharing dish, and subbed the mushrooms for mashed potatoes... We got the meat cooked medium, and it was cooked exactly how we asked.. pink on the inside, and oh so tender. I do wish that we would have ordered the filet for 1 person and shared because there was so much meat that it lasted us for lunch the following day, and I still have a piece left in the fridge.The BYOB aspect is great, bring whatever alcohol you want and joy it with your meal.This is NOT a place for a large crowd, and I have to say a group of 12 is too large for this place. It is soooo loud inside that you have to yell when you speak, so it would be much easier if there were 2 or 4 people together, not a big group trying to celebrate a birthday.Also, it is extremely dark here. I mean, beyond it being romantic. The main light supply is the candles that they place on the tables.... and a candle lit dinner is only awesome in movies, in real life you need to use your phone's flashlight setting to see the menu..I would recommend for people to try this place, just expect to have a long wait even if you make a reservation, prepare to have to speak loudly, come in a small group, expect great service and prepare to eat so much delicious meat that you will roll out of the restaurant :-)

Reviews.Author: Brittany S.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant screams sex. I'm talking heavy bass music, candlelit tables, big chunks of meat, BYOB with no corking fee and, in case if you missed it the first time, heavy and hot bass. It's quite the wait- even on a Monday- but well worth it. Indoor and outdoor seating available with meal price point ranging between $17 and $30 - extremely fair given the serving sizes. We started our feast off with a few recommendations from the waiter: a variety of empanadas and melted provolone served with red peppers. The meal wouldn't have been complete without the outrageous amounts of chimmichuri (an oil and herb combo packed with flavor). In true family style fashion, my coworker Breanna, and I went half died between the chicken with lemon sauce (served with buttery spinach mashed potatoes) and the filet which ended up coming our more like two full sized filets. Both were delicious;however, the chicken took the cake for me. In foolproof terms, go here if you fall into one of the following categories:1.) you love meat2.) you're hoping to get some action/impress a date for circa 50 bucks3.) often find yourself turned on by heavy bass

Reviews.Author: Kristen L.
Reviews.Content: Sorry folks, but I really don't understand the hype about this place.Food: Eh.  Ordered the "para dos" and shared it with the bf and everything seemed like it was something we could've done ourselves on the grill at home.  EXCEPT for the sweetbreads...good God those sweetbreads.  I've had sweetbreads before but these were bombdotcom.  They had a nice, almost char taste to them and they didn't have too strong of an earthy taste as other places' sweetbreads.  Other than that (and the BYOB aspect with no corkage fee!), everything else was just "meh."Service: I understand this place is insanely busy, but after we got our food, we didn't see any servers once.  We had to flag someone down every time we needed a refill of waters or the check.The icing on the cake: Made reservations for a friend's birthday for a party of 10 on a bustling Saturday night.  Now, I'm more than understanding that it may take longer than expected to seat such a large group, but damnit, if we make a reservation for 7:30, don't have us waiting until close to 9pm!  When we asked the host multiple times, each answer we got was, "it should be 10 minutes."  Dude..you told us "10 minutes" 45 minutes ago.  We were told that there was a "waiting room" inside and as we went in, we noticed a large table being cleared.  As soon as new place settings were set, we immediately sat down without even asking if the table was ours.  Dick move on our part?  Yes.  But, if we've been waiting for more than an hour, then I think we deserve to sit more than the couple that's been waiting for 5 minutes.Meh.

Reviews.Author: Joanne H.
Reviews.Content: This place was not good. Maybe its because my friends and I have never tried Argentine food. But goodness gracious, how can five people (including myself) not like their dish. For appetizers:We got the lengua a la vinagrette which was okay. They gave a generous portion of tongue, about 7-8 thick slices.The Jamon crudo con melon on the other hand was delicious. i really liked this. The Proscuitto & the melon went very well with one another.For entree:I got an El petite, medium rare. it was raw, it looked like i just bought it out from the store, and not only that it was chewy. It came with spinach mash potatos that were cold as well. (not good) I tried the Costeleta my friend ordered and that was chewy and a tad bit salty.The para uno, a dish that came on a grill with several different meats, sounds cool right? but it was too salty and the food was cold. the only thing that was okay was the sausage. My friend ended up spitting a piece of meat out. It was so dimly lit because the candle was so low that we werent able to make out what food was on the grill.Dessert:Flan. Now that was good. it was not too sweet but decadent. i enjoyed that immensely.

Reviews.Author: Bex A.
Reviews.Content: Favorite place so far. Steaks are amazing. Cooked so well. Their entrees are great.The atmosphere is romantic perfect for dinner dates.Brought my family here for my moms birthday dinner. They gave us a complimentary cake. Thanks!You have gotta order their empanadas Everytime you come here,It is so delicous!Service was great. It was hard to find the waiters at times when you need something.But other than that I love love love this place. And it is in my neighborhood which totally rocks!

Reviews.Author: Cara L.
Reviews.Content: Holy meat in your face. No--but really. The portions are family-style.. wait. Was this a family-style restaurant and no one knows it? Maybe. But by the time we finished our feast, I couldn't move. I needed my bed. I needed to be still and digest. Oh. My. God. They made a great first impression with the no corkage BYOB-ness. But I think the music could have been turned down a notch. It was a little too bass-y/cluby for me and I found it difficult to have a conversation with my friend across from me.There are two dinning areas and the one we weren't in seemed like a full-blown party. It's like everyone just wanted to have a red meat fiesta and with a BYOB mentality, the dranks were definitely a'flowin. Definitely get the mashed tators and any steak is good steak--just keep in mind they are the size of your head, plus some. I got a steak stuffed with all sorts of yummy things. I made it through maybe 5 bites before my body almost exploded. Did I mention we got apps? Yes--they were all delicious, but just don't. Trust me--it's too.much.food. Yes, I know there are so many restaurants in Chicago, but this one I'd definitely come back to. And don't forget to bring some wine!

Reviews.Author: Alex L.
Reviews.Content: I'm still recovering from what seems like an IV line of red meat, iron and protein at this Argentine Steakhouse. I'm not quite sure what an Argentine Steakhouse entails, but if it's huge slabs of meat, sexy lighting with candlelit tables and decor that practically does all the work for you if you're coming here on a date ;), consider me a fan.My coworkers and I came with some wine (BYOB!) and indulged ourselves with delightful appetizers and a main course fit for royal feasts. You better come here hungry and anticipate leaving stuffed because the portions are huuuge and the meat bleeds delicious flavors.Being born in St. Petersburg, Russia, I grew up with stories of the WWII siege on the city and my grandparents successfully instilled me in a fear of wasting food. After all, who knows when I'll have to kill a man for that last potato? So when my main course of Filet Mignon came out with 2 ~8oz pieces of filet and a slew of mashed potatoes, I knew what had to be done. Those stuffed empanadas and melted cheese appetizers made the job of finishing off this steak that much harder, but I pushed forth; full will ahead.The steak was delicious and cooked medium rare (and was even more on the rare side which I loved). I savored every bite with its delicious flavor and eating both pieces was a joy. I saw some of my coworkers covered with meat sweats after devouring their meal and I stood proud. Job well done; plate cleaned.This place is busy and the prices are really reasonable for the portions received ($15-30 per entree). If you're a meat lover, this is definitely the place for you. The only thing that could have improved the entire experience was having the restaurant source their meat from local farms or at least having some menu options for those seeking humane-quality sourced meat.

Reviews.Author: Carmelo R.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing !!!!!!!! BYOB  Great service and everything on the menu is so good.

Reviews.Author: Jin K.
Reviews.Content: I think I sat in the coldest seat in the house! Went saturday night and we had a reservation for a party of 6 at 7pm.  we were walked in around 7:30 just to wait some more in the back room...15 minutes and finding someone's set of keys later (which we turned into the restaurant)...we were sat...45 mins after our reservation.  Not sure why they even have a reservation system if they don't stick to it...annoying.  What if we had somewhere to be afterwards, like a show, I would recommend that you allow yourself plenty of time to get somewhere cause you are going to wait. My girlfriend sat across from me quickly to realize that the vent was directly below her and being that it was freezing, I changed seats with her.  Normally I can handle the cold and actually prefer it but this was meat locker cold...my leg felt like it was frost bitten after sitting there for an hour and a half...couldn't even stick it out through dessert. Awful experience trying to eat a meal while half frozen. the appetizers were delicious...we ordered 6 empanadas and 2 tortilla de papas and they were so good.  Then we went on to our entrees...I order the platter for two and my girl and I split that, after a few bites (maybe the cold was too much for us) but we thought that we should have ordered something else.  The meat was too fatty for my liking or hers and that platter of meat didn't have anything to help cut the grease (unless you count Sausage and black sausage to be vegetables, which doesn't sound too bad of idea).  after the meat sweats that couldn't materialize cause I was half frozen, I notice the table next to us left quickly (sat after us/left before us) because they couldn't handle the cold and I watched another group come in and sit down at that table next to us and complain how cold it was, too. I am happy to report that my leg has finally thawed out - two days later.    If I ever go back - I'll bring a book to read (for the long wait) and a blanket (to keep from being half frozen) or I'll just find myself at Las Tablas without the book or blanket.

Reviews.Author: Marco H.
Reviews.Content: I don't normally go out for steak (because it's so easy to make a juicy tasty one at home), but what the hell, I wanted to give Tango Sur a shot. Plus, a steak house with a BYOB policy is a big plus.Well, I was really disappointed, starting with the appetizers. Ordered the chicken and the spinach/cheese empanadas. Epic fail on the chicken: they came out COLD inside, almost still frozen. Hey I kinda figured the empanadas would be frozen then deep-fried, but this was totally unacceptable (my waiter was surprised and agreed).On to the steak: The filet was reasonably flavorfully and cooked, but nothing amazing.On a good note, I got a free "sorry for the frozen empanadas" flan caramel dessert that was AMAZING. I'd come back to Tango Sur just for that.

Reviews.Author: Sam N.
Reviews.Content: First off before you come here...come with a stomach that is empty or almost empty.The portions are very generous. The ambiance is 2nd to none.I have been here 3 times this year.Due to the USDA's argentine beef ban a few years ago places like this dont exist in North America today...We are very lucky that this place exists in Chicago.YES ITS BYOB...In the summer its is good to bring some friends and eat on the patio.Call a few days ahead of time to make a reservation because this is a very popular spot. People like eating on an outdoor patio in the summer time. Can you blame them?This is an old world place. There are not many girls who are waitresses. Not sure if they are doing that on purpose although I should say the waiters here are very knowledgeable about the food the serve.Things I reccomend: Beef De Cherizoand I am a huge fan of the chicken that is grilled with white wine and a mixture of lemon sauce.Yes I think I will go back...but not too many times in one day...Come here for the meat, the people watching and the ambiance.

Reviews.Author: Hillary P.
Reviews.Content: We were told an hour and half wait. After waiting 2 1/2 hours for a steak the waiter stated, "we prepare this well done, is that ok?" The steak was still breathing when it was served... It was soaking in oil!!! I would prefer Outback. Never again!!

Reviews.Author: Mandi G.
Reviews.Content: The food is still delicious and the BYOB policy makes this a great place for group dinners. However, service has definitely gone down hill. Just went a week or so ago and I had to beg for my water to be refilled because for some reason they had the windows open and no a/c on when it was in the 90's.Also, all the waiters are all beautiful men that ALL LOOK ALIKE! So it's really hard to figure out who you should be asking for what. And I always feel rushed. I get it. It's a popular place and people tend to linger over BYOB, but it's still a little tacky.Save room for dessert! They are worth it! Especially the cookies with the dulce de leche (that's caramel for all you white people).

Reviews.Author: Ruby R.
Reviews.Content: Maybe I've heard too much about this place, but I wasn't overly impressed. There are a lot of small details that tell me about the quality of food at a place, so I start at the top. Butter and rolls at the table. The butter came in little foil packets, that industrial restaurant stuff. The rolls were slightly warm, but cheap white bread. I don't eat bread anyways, so I just let them sit there. We were sitting outside on an early fall night that required the heat lamps to ultimately come on. The water guy was obsessive about constantly filling out our glasses with ice water even though I'd ordered a cup of hot water with lemon. The "salad" was a joke. It looked more like the toppings for a burger. Two big pieces of lettuce (that was really bitter!) and two slices of mushy grocery store tomato and a big slice of raw onion. What kind of date joint serves raw onion at the top of a meal. The "olive" oil in they served on the side of the "salad" looked like that over processed half olive/half canola crap that comes in big jugs and the red wine vinegar didn't really add much to the already pathetic salad. We ordered the "Para Dos" grill thing for the two of us. I've had better blood sausage. The chorizo was good, well formed but not actually spicy. The sweetbreads were alright. I haven't had a lot to compare to, but I ate a few. The flank steak was alright, but between the flank (flapmeat, as they call it on the menu) and the short ribs, I wouldn't confused "range fed" with "grass fed." This meat is most certainly grain finished. It's heavily marbled, gristly and fatty.We ordered a side of sweet potatoes. Looks like they cook-em just like I do at home, but I'd say they were slightly under-done. Throwing a sweet potato in an oven and peeling the skin off is pretty damn easy. I can do it. Preparing it in an interesting way would have made it worth the $5. It was not worth $5. I grilled mine on the little grill to give it some added flavor.The waiter was over attentive at the beginning of the meal, offering us wine glasses after we said we weren't drinking and didn't bring wine. Came back and offered to make suggestions on the menu. I usually accept suggestions and often request them, but I could tell that he was going to drive me nuts by talking excessively. At the end of our meal as it got colder and colder, we waited a long time to be brought the check. Even after another waiter packed up our food for us, we sat there with a packed up meal and no check. My partner went to the bathroom and asked for the check. We received it, but then that sat there too. I walked the check into the restaurant and told them that we'd like to finish paying. Honestly, for what I can produce on a grill, AND have my choice of cuts and preparation, I'd save the money and grill at home. Nothing special happening here.

Reviews.Author: Breanna B.
Reviews.Content: This was a meat fest. I've never seen so many cuts of beef on one table. With BYOB/no corkage fee, it was easy to think it'd be a tipsy evening for our team dinner. No. Never. There was so much food that there wasn't even a chance. We really went for it and ordered appetizers, then each had an individual dish. Was it intended for us to share? Of course. We did it wrong. It was more like: "I'll order this and you order this and we'll share bites." Seriously, there was so much food on our table and somehow we ate nearly all of it. I was full off the appetizers. My entree - the filet mignon - came with TWO huge cuts of filet mignon. Last time I checked, you order a filet and you get one. This was overkill, but in the best way (oh. so. good.) All in all, sharing is the recommended approach to dining at Tango Sur.I'll list off some of my favorites as there was so much to be enjoyed that evening:- BYO-wine, always a plus.- The spinach mashed potatoes are spectacular. Thick and textured and really green. The spinach and garlic add a lot to this traditional side dish.- Ham and cheese empanadas with chimicurri sauce; I preferred this pairing to the spinach and cheese. It was like a fancy homemade version of a hot pocket. No arguments when there's flaky crispy dough involved.- Filet mignon - as I mentioned above the dish comes with 2 large cuts of filet. There's a tasty red wine sauce that's drizzled a top the steak that just enhances the melt-in-your-mouth tastiness.- Order the provoleta. It's melty cheese and superbly savory. I love the addition of the roasted reds. I haven't seen that elsewhere. I will replicate at home.If you love steak, please come here because it will be heaven for you.

Reviews.Author: Tim S.
Reviews.Content: BYOB Not sure what else I can add to the 1281 reviews before me. I must be the last person in Chicago to have come here. For some reason it never made the priority list until we were invited by another couple last month. Service was great, portions were generous enough that each couple split a filet (you get 2) and salad with out feeling hungry afterwards. Good stuff and worth the wait on a busy night. With plenty of bars to visit on the street or a comfortable chair in the small waiting room one should not feel put out by the wait. BYOB

Reviews.Author: Lina P.
Reviews.Content: I heard many great things about this place, and had a bottle of wine that I've been wanting to pop open, so I thought it would be a great night to check it out. I went on a Sat evening which was very busy. The host took down my name and phone number on his little note pad.  He didn't really let us know about how long the wait was, but recommended us to go to the bar down the block and wait. I asked how long was the wait.  He said 2 hours. I was like, "What?! - Two hours, " I gave him a hard time about quoting that to me.  We stood there waiting for 5 minutes, and then they seated us outside.  Clearly he didn't know what he was talking about. The food was amazing. I ordered the Churrasco and it was real flavorful. I am not a huge steak person, but enjoyed it very much.  The food is average to high price depending on what you order. My friend had the empanada as an appetizer and  loved it. I would definitely come back, and recommend it. Have to go back with a date next time!

Reviews.Author: Alli W.
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to try this place for years! I thought they never took reservations, but I was wrong and my husband and I took an earlier reservation on Friday night. We got the pollo empanada which was delicious, as well was the provolone appetizer (which was huge, but super tasty). I had the el fillet which was tasty, the potatoes could have perhaps been a bit better. Our table had some shelf next to it which cramped my space a little bit more than to be desired, but overall this was a great experience and a lot more budget-friendly than I thought. BYOB is a major plus. Huge portions that could be split instead of individually ordering!

Reviews.Author: Olivia L.
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely delicious, but not the best place for talking. I went here with a group of friends for my friend's birthday dinner. Not having seen each other in a while, we were looking forward to catching up, but it was not very plausible with the loud music and everyone trying to talk over the music. I could barely hear what my friend across the table was saying to me.However, the food just blew everything out of the water. I had yelp'ed this place before, which is why we chose to go, but I was so delighted about the food. We had a few of their empanadas and they were delicious. We devoured them because we were hungry and we couldn't get enough. For main entrees, the majority of us had Bife Vesuvio and one had a chicken dish from the Chef Specials but I don't remember which. The beef was divine. I was in meat heaven if that exists. It had a lot of moisture, and the flavor wasn't overpowering. After a few months, I can still taste it in my mouth... It was that memorable. I recommend it! Be sure to have an empty stomach though because most of us took the rest home. For dessert, we had flan, but all of us were so full that we took tiny bites out of it. The flan didn't let us down either because it was delicious. It was just creamy enough. Overall, I really liked Tango Sur because of the food, but it was far too loud. I may go back just to return to meat heaven.

Reviews.Author: Partha A.
Reviews.Content: Why the 4 stars eludes me. But possible I did not get the right dishes.Firstly parking was a nightmare. I will not be able to go back because they don't have valet and there is simply nowhere to park - except a pharmacy a couple of hundred yards away where one literally has to wait stealthily for someone to leave.they pack the restaurant to the brim. the inside of the restaurant is extremely dark and extremely loud. Had the empanadas. So, so. The melons with proscuitto. There was no need for this dish. Three slivers of melon with the rind with 3 proscuittos draped over it. $10. No effort made to prettify the dish.Vesuvio potatoes were dull. They were the oiliest wedges doused in flavorless spice. No heat or flavor - just oily.We had the fish which was unmemorable.

Reviews.Author: Sara F.
Reviews.Content: Tango sur was recommended by a friend as her and her finance's favorite restaurant in chicago and though it may not be my favorite.. It was definitely pleasing! My boyfriend and I started with the provoleta based on popularity in other reviews and it was delicious. I mean,who doesn't love an ooey gooey plate of cheese?! On to our entree... we split one of the chefs specials, the lomo relleno. Ideal for two, this slab of filet comes out juicy and filled with flavor. The best part-we were sent home with an entire serving which isn't usual with my boyfriends very large appetite! This could definitely be a meal for three or four with the addition of some al a carte side dishes.The atmosphere of tango sur, matched with the delicious food and BYOB option makes this the perfect place for a date or to get together with friends! All in all, we will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Author: Miranda L.
Reviews.Content: AVOID THIS PLACE IF YOU DON'T WANT TO WAIT INTERMINABLY.As a New Yorker, I am neither shocked nor immediately turned off by absurdly long waits. In fact, if I'm told that there's a 2-hour wait, I usually think of it as a testament to the restaurant's popularity & potential quality, and not as a nuisance. (If I've done my homework right, I also usually know to expect it.)What I absolutely CANNOT stand, however, is an obnoxiously cavalier attitude about wasting my time. Yes, I get that your restaurant has lots of people who would really like to be seated. But no, that doesn't give you the right to give us APPALLINGLY INACCURATE wait estimates.As always, rants can get long, so I'll summarize all you need to know before the jump:Food: 3 stars - average. The cheeses were bland, sauces were pools of oil mixed with chimichurri, and the meat was nothing to write home about (though there was a lot of it).
