Severely disappointing, given how good Argentinian-served meat can be ... and how hungry we were (don't people normally think everything tastes good, if they've been waiting 2.5 hours to eat?).Service/Seating: gets NEGATIVE stars, because:1. the system is SO disorganized - the guy scribbles onto a pad, but there's little order (he just flips back and forth, to whatever he feels like), Even better, apparently THERE ARE MULTIPLE PADS - and you may be in one book, but not the other.Example that I witnessed:Maitre D.: "Ma'am, I can't find your name in this book..."The lady looks pissed and is about to start speakingMaitre D.: "but that doesn't mean you're not on the list! Don't worry. You're probably just in his book, another book which is over there. Don't worry.."[Hmm, if there are two separate books, and they're kept in two entirely different locations, how is coordination possible? (Here's a hint: it isn't.)]2. This terrible, terrible seating system results in ridiculously inaccurate wait times. Now, I have enough friends who have been wait staff and etc., and I understand that not everything is in their control. But to be told it's a 1 hour to 1.5 hour wait, and then only to be seated 2.5 hours later (which is a 1-1.5 hour underestimation - basically a 100% margin of error) is simply unacceptable.-----------The details - aka why I'm so angry that I'm using capslock:3:00pm - I call as soon as they open on Saturday, to get a reservation and avoid the reportedly long wait. I am told that they are not accepting reservations, and that the wait for a party of four arriving at 7pm shouldn't be bad, about 45 minutes.7:10pm - My friends and I arrive at the restaurant, we're told it'll be an hour to an hour and a half wait. Nevermind that it's about double of the 40 min estimate I heard on the phone, and nevermind that this other girl just says "we have a reservation!" and gets seated - I'm trying to be understanding, and just "put my name down," which was essentially watching as the dude messily scribble in a small 3x5 notepad (aka that 50 cent Staples pad). We head to Dairy Queen to kill time.8:30pm - An hour and a half later, my friends and I go back to Tango Sur. The dude haphazardly flips between pages, occasionally ripping them out (and losing them to the wind) before locating mine. "We're running behind today," he says. What does that mean? "It'll be 45 more minutes."... uhhh, whoa. My friends look annoyed (which always stresses me out, especially since I chose the place) but when we've already waited 90 minutes, what's another 45, am I right? My friends are starving, so we order drinks & appetizers at another place.9:15pm - We still have not gotten a call from the restaurant, and it's been the full 45 minutes. Frustrated, I call the restaurant to inquire about how much longer. The guy tells me to come over.9:17pm - We arrive at the restaurant, and the dude (.. same one it's been all night) tells us we can (FINALLY) go in ... to the waiting room. Can we order food? No. But we wll get the privilege of waiting inside!Oh my god, after TWO FULL HOURS OF WAITING, I actually get to wait in the heat?! It's our big break!By now I'm SUPER pissed, because this waiting game is getting really old, really fast. I tell him that waiting inside is pretty much the same as waiting outside, and we came over here under the impression that we were going to be seated soon. He gives me sass: "sometimes customers take longer - what do you want us to do, kick them out?" (uh, no - but you could certainly try proactive management?)By the time we're finally seated, it is 9:40pm. That is a full TWO AND A HALF HOURS that we spent waiting, basically DOUBLE the time he initially quoted us. If we had known from the start, we definitely could've explored an entire neighborhood and come back, as opposed to seeking shelter in the DQ ...... aaand, that's the character limit (wow, anger really can be motivating ...)

Reviews.Author: Carolina M.
Reviews.Content: If you want to eat an amazing steak then Tango Sur is the right place to go! It's usually very crowded but you can make reservations which is awesome! Prices are great and you get high quality meat. Love the service too!

Reviews.Author: Phil W.
Reviews.Content: This is a great Argentinian steak house that definitely gives you plenty of bang for buck. Love the BYOB policy (the Jewel-Osco that is two blocks away has a good selection of wine.) Parrillada was great appetizer to share. Tried the filet mignon (comes with spinach mashed potato) and their rib eyes. Both were decent. They also have the best flan I have ever had. Overall, Tango Sur is a very solid place. But if I can change two things about the place, I would probably suggest better lightening inside the restaurant (it is extremely dimly lit) and for them to carry better mustard than the just regular hot dog yellow mustard.

Reviews.Author: Eric H.
Reviews.Content: This vegetarian approves of Tango Sur!We started with a bunch of appetizers so I basically took my entree (a spinach-stuffed pasta with marinara sauce) to go. I enjoyed the Spinach Emapana. It was delicately crispy and piping hot. The provoleta was a pipping hot plate of provolone cheese that you just stab with your fork and shove it into your mouth. YUM! We also tried the Berenjena En Escabeche (eggplant and tomato dish that reminded me of lasagna.) Definitely recommended.The one drawback is the dinner salad. It was literally lettuce, slices of tomamtoes, and onions. We came here after a Cubs game (note that the kitchen closes at 10:30p on a weekday, and it's BYOB), so hurry on here after a cubs game, and stop by 7-11 or Jewel to grab a bottle of wine on your way over.Overall, I'll be back here for sure! It's great with a big group too, as it's not incredibly expensive for what you get! The carnivores in our group loved it!#vegetarian review

Reviews.Author: Paul L.
Reviews.Content: Being a Yelper, of course I scoped out reviews for the people's favorite steakhouse in Chicago and came across Tango Sur. I thought I deserve the best for my first visit o Chicago and made my reservation a month in advance for this place for 2 people at 7:30pm. When we arrive at this quaint sidewalk steakhouse, the person up front told us that they were running an hour behind. So me and my friend went to walk down the block to a supermarket to get a bottle of wine and then went to a neighborhood bar to have a drink. When we came back, we were told that we would need to wait another 30 minutes. I wasn't happy but I already invested in a bottle of wine and an hour, and we were hungry, so what's another 30 minutes, right? Wrong. It started to rain... hard!The outdoor patrons were moved indoors one by one, and the wait turned into another hour and a half. So we waited for about a little more than 3 hours. The horror. It's not just the wait though, it's the attitude emitted by the very smug maitre'd who couldn't care less if you leave because they will always have business. It's the rain dropped into water containers and then poured into glass of customers, it's the paisan who jumps the line without a single word. It's the total lack of empathy towards customers. Once we got inside past 10:30pm, we had bread to help with the long sufered hunger. I ordered the Parrillada Para Uno and my friend had the El Filet. The Parrillada was good other than the chewy and tough skirt steak and the overly soft blood sausage. El Filet is pretty soft and scrumptious. It's really good value for the price. I would be recommend this place if it wasn't for the horrible wait, but I just can't right now.2.5 Stars.

Reviews.Author: Matt M.
Reviews.Content: Awesome, awesome place. BYOB, steaks are delicious and huge portions. The heart of palms in gulf sauce is amazing. If you have a party over 6 definitely make a reservation for peak hours well in advance. If you don't have a big enough party you will wait a bit, but it's well worth it.

Reviews.Author: Hannah H.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I came here for an early dinner.  We started off with the Empanadas (Argentine turnover with beef; this came with a side of chimichurri sauce; the exterior pastry shell was okay, but it was a little soggy due to the filling inside with the diced meat and the potatoes; I thought it was slightly bland).  For my entree, I had the Entrana, which was the outer skirt that was cooked on the grill, served with a side salad.  The steak itself was very large and was literally hanging off the plate.  It came with baked diced unseasoned potatoes and a side of chimichurri sauce.  The steak itself smelled really good, but I was a little disappointed as it was all mostly fat rather than meat. It was a cute restaurant and the place seemed to get packed to the gills, even though it was an early dinner time.  I'm glad I was able to check this place out!

Reviews.Author: Mike S.
Reviews.Content: We went here for my birthday bc we heard and read nothing but great things. I've never been more disappointed with a meal in my life. I've had better meat at Chili's. The only food we could agree on that was decent, were the empanadas. They were delicious. I would never go back.

Reviews.Author: Eduardo M.
Reviews.Content: I make it a point to visit this place every so often - the food here is generally too rich to visit this spot too often without worrying about what all that delicious red meat may be doing to your insides...That being said, this place is well worth any artery clogging that may temporarily ensue.  The food is always delicious, from steaks to filets the food here is well done and fantastic.  This place is BYOB, darkly lit, and perfect for anything from a date to a celebration (provided the group is cool with a lot of candles...).  I recommend this place wholeheartedly, go there with an appetitte.

Reviews.Author: Maggie H.
Reviews.Content: I was totally under-whelmed by this place.  I decided to have my birthday dinner here after hearing such great things about it.  I made a reservation a week ahead and asked if I needed to call and confirm later and they said no.  The day of they called me and said "feel free to call us if you have any questions about your reservation for tonight."  I didn't have any questions and did not call.  Later, about an hour and a half before my reservation, they called again and said if I did not call them back and confirm my reservation they would give the table to someone else.  I immediately called back and confirmed.  We had a group of 11 and waited outside for 15 minutes past our 9 o'clock reservation.  We were starting to ask how long we were going to wait and they said the table would be ready for us shortly and then said we could go inside and open our bottles of wine while they got the table ready.  They didn't give us the table that was open and then also didn't bring us glasses until we asked for them at least three times.  When we asked what the hold up was - they said it was my fault for not confirming and we would have a table shortly.  We finally got seated at 10.  After waiting an hour we were given free appetizers.  The food was all pretty good, minus the salad which was laughable.  I don't think anyone was blown away by their meals, but good portions for a price.  The service after we were seated was decent.  Not the best, not the worst.  Maybe I will try Tango Sur again...maybe.  I would not count on them to be prepared for your reservation ever.  If they are going to make me wait an hour past my reservation time - they can at least provide stellar service in the meantime.

Reviews.Author: Jeff K.
Reviews.Content: The first time I came here was years ago during a trip I took with some friends. And although at one point I almost completely forgot about my experience, coming back to the Chicago area awakened my meat loving senses.I don't think you can get a better meat value than Tango Sur. Also a BYOB, they're more than happy to accommodate you. The server we had was awesome and was constantly making recommendations for us, but not in a "I'm trying to up-sell you" kind of way. We were planning on getting the Paradilla for 2 and the NY strip, but he suggested that we get the filet instead of the strip to get two differing cuts of meat. We're glad we took his suggestion.Tango Sur = Meat lover's paradise.

Reviews.Author: Mike H.
Reviews.Content: This is probably my favorite place in Chicago. Tango Sur is a BYOB Argentinian Steakhouse on the Southport strip. I know it's probably been said many times, but there really isn't a better place to take a girl on a date if you are a guy: it's classy, it's meaty, and it's BYOB.  (Side note on BYOB, is there anything better if you are a guy trying to impress a girl? It looks swanky, you can pretend you have wine "knowledge", and it's cheap as s***) Anyways, there is always a pretty long wait for this place (hour on weekdays, 2-3 hours on weekends), although I always seem to get in quicker than what they tell me. There are no reservations, but they'll take down your number to call you when a table is available, so you can go to any of the bars around to pass the time. My girlfriend actually doesn't eat red meat, but she's a trooper and will still go along for the ride. She had the Gnoqui pasta one time we went, and had some kind of eggplant appetizer dish for her entree, which was actually pretty good, and I'm not an eggplant fan. My go to dish is the Bife Angosto, or the strip steak, with spinach mashed potatoes on the side. It is always a huge portion, and always amazing. Also, be sure to get some of the empanadas to start, they come in a variety of options and are really good.If your date eats red meat, there is some kind of huge tray of meat you can get for two. I've never had it, but it looks like something one could only dream about.This is definitely a must go to place in this city!

Reviews.Author: Ivan D.
Reviews.Content: Great quality food ... Inefficient service.My group of 8 went to Tango Sur after a Cubs game, tired and hungry, and we left with a food coma. In all, it was a 4 of 5 exprience, very intimate. I ordered the MEDIO POLLO AL JAMON (half chicken), it was season and cooked to perfection, enough for 2. My wife ordered the CHURRASCO (12oz. steak) medium, it had an extremely charred exterior and rare on the inside. It was sent back for additional grill time (I grill a good steak, so I wasn't impressed).BYOB keeps the bill to a reasonable amount, $18-20/person. Although there's much WAITING in this place (with plenty of employees), the food is delicious. Also, like most places around Wrigleyville, parking is an issue, but it's not the fault of this Argentinian steak house, just be prepared if you have reservations.

Reviews.Author: Tommy H.
Reviews.Content: This quaint little roadside diner serves up some seriously southern-sized portions. (Its name literally translates to "I have South!")If classic country cookin' and old time hospitality is your thing, look no further south than Southport and Grace .But if you're looking for something more than plantation sized steaks and generous helpings of mashed potatoes you might need to keep exploring. *disclaimer: I am a bit pretentious when it comes to steaks.

Reviews.Author: Genie B.
Reviews.Content: I give this place 5 stars because the food is amazing and  it's byob. It's the perfect place if you want a cool date or you just want to have a great dinner with friends. The service is also great! Amazing atmosphere! Grab a great bottle of red wine and a date, and come here for dinner! You won't regret it!

Reviews.Author: BurtReynolds D.
Reviews.Content: Burt thinks this place is OVERRATED, OVERRATED, and SUCKSI read all the good reviews and was expecting a great dinner.  NOT.  The place is crowded.  Thats a good sign.  So we had a reso.  The reso is just to get you in the door and if your lucky they usher you to a small closet space in the back to wait, and wait and wait.  We tipped the door guy !!!!   Still waiting.  Just when we were about to leave they call us.  So we get to the dinner.  Empanadas for an app.  Bad !  We get our steaks.  A filet which is large, but not a good cut of meat.  Veiny with cartilage and tough.  I repeat, tough filet,  NOT GOOD.  The other steaks were not enjoyed either.  The coffee sucks.The only 2 good things I can say about this Shi!hole is the dessert and the wine was good.  Oh yeah, its BYOB, the wine came from The Wheelhouse, down the block. If you suffer through a dinner here, at least order a the flan for dessert.   Burt says skip the joint.

Reviews.Author: Hauwei L.
Reviews.Content: Excellent Argentinian food at a very reasonable price. Tango Sur is a Chicago institution and a visit will show you why. Dark, romantic ambiance, outdoor seating on the patio on Southport, and no fee BYOB all help make this place a winner. The wait for a table can be long, but they have a room where you can get a head start on whatever bottle you brought with you. Service during a recent visit was competent, but not great with some difficulty communicating about wait times. However, the highlight of the evening was the food.We ordered 2 empanadas (beef and corn, $2 each!), El Fillet, and the salmon (sadly, my friend is a pescatarian). The salad that came with the entrees was nothing special, but the bread was good: crunchy on the outside, soft and warm on the inside. The empanadas were delicious. The biggest surprise was the entrees, they were huge! The El Fillet came was two sizable pieces of tender, well-seasoned, delicious filet mignon accompanied by a mound of spinach mashed potatoes. The steak was probably 1.5 to 2x the size of the filet mignon at other steakhouses. The salmon was similarly massive and while it didn't rise to the level of the magnificent steak, my friend thought it was excellent. Though we were both hungry, we were left with almost half of the filet and more than half the salmon to take home.For the money ($27 for El Fillet, $25 for the salmon with many other entrees in the high teens or low twenties), it's hard to think of a better deal in Chicago.

Reviews.Author: Matthew H.
Reviews.Content: I've been eating here at least twice a year for 10 years, and I'm from the far West suburbs.   I just love this place so much.  Aside from BYOB which usually alone gets a couple more stars from me, the food is so unique.  I would've never considered myself the kind of person to go out of their way for Flap meat, sweet breads, and blood sausage, but you gotta respect good nose-to-tail cuisine.  In my book their Chimichurri is the best I've ever had; heavy on the Oregano.Even though I love fried empanadas their baked ones are still heavy on the butter (think pie crust.) so they're full of flavor.  The Ham and Cheese are the best in my opinion.; usually overlooked by most people.The provoletta with roasted red peppers is great, but can fill you up pretty quick so I would only order that with 4 or more people if you're also going to get Empanadas which are a must.I always get the Parrillada para dos and if getting a few appetizers is enough even for 4 people.For Dessert definitively get the Flan.  I'm not a flan fan typically, but this isn't your normal, dainty, light, bland, jello-like flan like you'd get at a Mexican restaurant...oh no, it's a dense, rich, creamy, full flavored custard topped with Cajete (goat milk carmel) that is soooo delicious.Just expect a wait.  I see bad reviews based solely on the bad taste left in the mouths of people who couldn't get past it to focus on the food.  Get there early, or expect to go to Cullen's for some drinks beforehand.

Reviews.Author: Hannah J.
Reviews.Content: I loved Tango! I am not much of a meat-eater, but everything I had was delicious. I highly recommend the chicken empanadas. We also got the provoleta, which was fantastic, but far too much cheese for two people. Our appetizers were spaced out, which was nice, but by the time the main courses came we were pretty full. The atmosphere was romantic and casual, and we sat outside, which was perfect, and was certainly a little less noisy and crowded than inside. BYOB with no corkage fee. We were pleasantly surprised when I got the check-- the food was very affordable. We got so many left-overs and the food was all incredible. My only complaint was that the service was a little slow. The main course took over an hour to come to the table, and we felt slightly forgotten. However, it's hard to complain too much because the food was great and we enjoyed the appetizers and atmosphere while we waited. We will certainly go back!

Reviews.Author: Gwen D.
Reviews.Content: I've lived around the Southport Corridor for almost a year now, but I never felt like I could lay claim to the area until I tried Tango Sur. I finally belong in the neighborhood!I'm not a fan of steak or hunks of meat in general, which explains my initial disinterest in Tango Sur. But over time, after seeing crowds surging at the restaurant, I decided I wanted in on the hype. And besides, I couldn't read through the appetizer section of the menu without my mouth watering.My friend and I ordered the addictive Provoleta Argentina, provolone cheese cooked on the grill with olive oil and roasted red pepper, almost as soon as we sat down. Melted cheese is my version of ambrosia, y'all. I do wish the provolone were served with something to dip besides the crusty, just-okay dinner rolls that come complementary at the table.For my main dish, I went with the Berenjena, oven-baked eggplant layered with spinach, provolone, parmesan, ricotta and a tomato cream sauce I'd gladly drink with a straw. Given the option of an inexpensive eggplant dish so divine, I can't imagine even wanting to order a steak at Tango Sur. (Seriously, that tomato cream sauce!)

Reviews.Author: Melissa M.
Reviews.Content: Ive been to Tango Sur three times. Out of the three times I have actually ate here once. When it comes to the food I have no complaints BUT I feel that they think of themselves very highly. I have been to better steak houses where you actually are treated better. They aren't very accommodating to theirs customers. I went recently without a reservation and was told that the wait was 2 1/2 hours. I understand that I didn't have a reservation but even the times that I did have reservation I still had to wait very long to get seated and quite frankly the way they treat you here is not friendly. The doormen have dry piss poor demeanor. The food is good but I do think that it is overrated. Ive been Capital grill and Ruth Chris steakhouses and never been treated how I was here. Their customer service skills and whomever schedules reservations need to definitely improve.

Reviews.Author: Angelina C.
Reviews.Content: Absurdly delicious... Best filet I've ever had. Bring your own wine which is a winos dream... The spinach mashed potatoes were to die for as well-- I tried to replicate the recipe at home but unfortunately it wasn't as good. I will definitely return!

Reviews.Author: Jeff N.
Reviews.Content: Finally made it to this great restaurant. The four of us took the suggested entrees-the flank steak and filet; shareable by the whole table. Very tasty! Love the BYOB option at $0! A bit on the noisy side, but heck, it was Friday nite at 7. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Author: Mei K.
Reviews.Content: With all the great reviews out there, there's really not much more insight to offer. Just some notes from my visits:- Posted a pic of the entree menu with prices in case you're wondering if this is gonna cost you an arm and a leg. Spoiler: It won't!- They only accept reservations of parties 6+ on Fri/Sat. So if you're going with a smaller party, make a reservation to go on a weekday or Sunday and avoid the 2 hour wait I experienced on Sat evening  (yep, it's literally 2 hours!).- El Filet was probably the best steak I ever had but my friends enjoyed the Costeleta (bone in rib-eye) more since it was fattier and, of course, more tender. The Lomo Relleno came out a little overdone but the yummy portabella marsala sauce made up for it. If you manage to save room for dessert, which you probably won't :D, the flan is amazing!

Reviews.Author: Douglas P.
Reviews.Content: First of all, the waiter said there are no substitutions so be prepared for that. The "Salad" consists of a half-plate of bits of romaine, two slices of tomato, and three circles of white onion. Not a great start to the meal.The portion size of my steak was small for the price. The other three members of my party received very generous portion sizes (including two petite filets for the party member that ordered their filet mignon). The food was pretty good and was prepared well. The service was top notch; rare was my glass empty. They also don't have an uncorking fee for your BYOB.I also wanted to share that it was too loud for conversation less than shouting. I've heard this place can have a bit of a wait but we arrived early enough to avoid any wait ourselves. The place is pretty cozy so it doesn't take much to fill it up quickly.

Reviews.Author: April N.
Reviews.Content: Quite possibly one of the best restaurants in Chicago. Awesome atmosphere , delicious food, great wait staff.

Reviews.Author: Anne M.
Reviews.Content: 3.5I was looking for a meat-tastic place to take my man for his birthday - Tango Sur topped the list in my steak search and I was anxious to try a smaller, more intimate place.I made a reservation for two, but I don't think it mattered because we showed up shortly before the place maxed out so there were plenty of empty tables.  We enjoyed our byo-wine at our little table complete with lit candlestick and started out with some empanadas.  The empanadas (spinach and cheese; chicken) were the highlight of the meal for me...  Birthday boy ordered some side sausages + a big steak that came with a heaping pile of mashed potatoes.  They were completely out of all fish options for the night (what??) so I went with lemon chicken and potato spears.  I thought the chicken was over-seasoned / too salty, and it was swimming in an oily sauce - I didn't end up eating much of it.  Before entrees were served, we had a very simple salad of greens, onions and tomatoes. Because of the birthday, we were presented with a cute little flan before getting the check.  This was very rich and tasty - a nice end to the meal. Verdict: Loved the interior - small, cozy, candlesticks everywhere.  Service was attentive and prices fair.  Wasn't that impressed with food (with the exception of the awesome empanadas) - steak was pretty fatty / not a great cut.  I would go back, but would order a different entree.

Reviews.Author: Sasha D.
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I had a great experience at Tango. Our waiter was really nice, and had some good suggestions for us. We ordered a strip steak a bone in ribeye and two chorizo sausages. The meat was cooked perfectly, you can tell its high quality. My only complaint would be to turn down the base a little, the sound system has to much base.

Reviews.Author: Stacy H.
Reviews.Content: Ahhhh Tango Sur...  This restaurant has been a favorite of mine for a few years.  I used to live almost literally behind it, so I have frequented it.  The very intimate, dark, candle lit atmosphere is just about as romantic as it gets!  The BYOB makes the delicious dinner so affordable for a night out.  The steak is amazing.  The entire experience is a seduction of the senses!  I just love it.Tips:  1.  Be prepared for a noisy atmosphere, 2.  Be prepared for 1-2 hour long waits.  (Both of these are very worth it!)  3.  Don't forget your wine (if you do, there is a lovely little wine shop nearly across the street--I highly recommend it)

Reviews.Author: Michael K.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this place! The food is fantastic, the ambiance is cozy, and the wait staff is excellent! Although the seating is fairly tight, I did not feel rushed or cramped. I especially liked the candle lit dining. Our waiter had a great sense of humor and was attentive and very knowledgeable of the menu. If you don't know what to order, you can't go wrong with the para uno. It gives a good portion sample of their meats and generous sides as well. Because it's BYOB, it doesn't break your pocket and I'm able to bring my favorite bottle of Cabernet souvignon! My first time coming was in February and have been back twice since. Every time a great experience! I do, however, recommend coming early. This place gets packed quick and their is no waiting inside. They will take your cell phone number to call when your table is ready so you don't have to stand outside which is convenient, but if you can come early is best. Just writing this review is making me crave some more! :)

Reviews.Author: Joe B.
Reviews.Content: If you haven't been here you need to give it a try. Given the number of reviews ahead of me this will only serve as white noise but I'll run you through what we ordered anyway. For starters the Spinach and Cheese Empanadas were pretty amazing. The filling had a nice blend of both and it was delicate and smooth while the empanada dough itself was tender, a little buttery and also delicate. These are a must try for sure. For a second app for our table we tried the Provoleta....Argentine provolone cheese grilled in a skillet with olive oil and mild roasted peppers. I don't recall if it was served with a bread of sorts but it should be, if you want to scoop this up even faster...though it was fantastic alone or laid over the empanada.For my entrée, I tried the Bife Vesuvio....a prime steak stuffed with spinach and mar del plata cheese, a garlic white wine sauce over that and then served alongside an Argentine style wedge potato. All I can say is, this dish is decadent on so many levels it's a little ridiculous...my only complaint was that the potatoes weren't cooked enough for my tastes giving them a little more bite than al dente. My entrée came with a simple salad that was a nice beginning to the end of the meal.The food aside, the ambiance is dim and a little romantic but maybe a little boisterous making it nice for groups. Given it is BYOB, and as Lucy G. noted...no corking fee, a group can have a pretty tremendous night here especially if you want to stay awhile and enjoy your evening with friends over some good wine and great conversation. It can be a little noisy as mentioned and the space is a bit cramped too but settle in and order what piques your tastes...you'll likely love this place and need to return again for more.

Reviews.Author: Haris D.
Reviews.Content: Simply terrible. The only place where you will make reservations and show up with other guests in your seats. This place gets a zero for customer service, and the front door guys scratch piece of paper for the guest list looks like a 3rd graders homework.

Reviews.Author: K M.
Reviews.Content: My husbands favorite place in town! He always gets el filet. I'm not a huge red meat eater, but I've tried about 6 different meats. They are all good, just don't ask for it well done unless you want it charred. We've been with large groups many times, or groups of 4. It's a great group place since it's BYOB. I highly recommend the hot appetizer of veggies topped with tomato cream sauce. Kind of heavy, so we usually share between 4 of us, but it's so good every calorie is worth it! Not a place to be rushed. Last time we went we were there 4 hours...

Reviews.Author: A I.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite restaurant... numero uno! Amazing steaks and I love the byob option.  I only wish they take reservations because there is always a terrible wait. It's so stupid... i have to go there put my name down and wait for them to call my cell phone!! we usually go to a bar down the street and drink and wait for the call which  usually takes 1.5 to 2 hours! if the foods wasnt soooo good i would never waste that kind of time.i hope they don't raise their prices or eliminate the byob otherwise it's not the the long wait for a table.

Reviews.Author: Beau G.
Reviews.Content: Everything was great food and service. We had veal t bones, and ride eye. Byob is alway nice as well.

Reviews.Author: Rustygirl M.
Reviews.Content: For 7 people is was 15$/person for large apps! Everything was great. We sat outside on front patio. Busy streets but not too busy on a Friday night. We didn't have a res so had to wait. Went to another bar for a drink while we waited. They called our cell when they were ready! Super nice!!

Reviews.Author: John F.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is a great place to dine when craving steak.  Mmmm steak...  I recommend coming here for a date or small group.  They really pack you in here, but that's part of the fun.  The steak here is really good, not the best I've had, but for the price you can't beat it.  They don't take reservations here, unless you have a party of 6+, and this place is always packed so expect to wait.  However you can leave your name and number and they'll call you when your table is ready so you can walk to a few different bars right around there for a drink while you wait.  It's BYOB here which is awesome so make sure to stop by the liquor store if you plan on getting your drink on.The staff here can come off as rude, but they're always crazy busy and they do their best to get you seated and your food out to you without a long wait so I can put up with it.  The ambiance here is cool - dark, intimate, good music.  Overall this is a great place and will be one of the cheaper steak dinners you'll have in Chicago that doesn't sacrifice quality.

Reviews.Author: Liam R.
Reviews.Content: Great steak and Byob place. Be sure to bring red wine as the menu is mostly steak. We ordered the melted cheese appetizer but it really wasn't necessary. All you really need to get is the special flank steak for two. It comes with salad and potatoes and the tastiest chimichurri sauce. Highly recommended.  The atmosphere is daty. Low lights small tables and music.Came a second time and only ordered for myself. Had the flank steak again and it only added to my love of the place. The single serving was big enough for two meals.I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Bonita G.
Reviews.Content: So...I've been here several times before. I thought I knew what I was getting into again, and I was okay with that. Great food, shitty service.Well, this time the food was horrible and the service was even worse. My date and I waited almost three hours to be served (we finished a six-pack and my date had time to go buy more alcohol and come back before we were seated), and then we had to sit outside at night in October...they claimed it would be fine because we were next to the heater but I was freezing the whole time (and the chairs are metal...). Our food came out tough and chewy.So long, Tango Sur, it's been mediocre knowing you.

Reviews.Author: Evan H.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite places in Chicago. Great food and staff. Byob option makes for a great meal and solid wine for a price.

Reviews.Author: Lauren T.
Reviews.Content: Very good. The filet is tender and flavorful... They give you two. Definitely enough to share. Also byob. Extremely slow service and extremely busy. The food is worth the wait though,

Reviews.Author: Jay W.
Reviews.Content: I had a lot of expectations going into this visit as everyone I know raves about this place, it totally lived up to the hype.We ate outside on a beautiful day, I'm glad we were able to sit outside because the only negative thing I can say about this place is the inside is pretty small.The service was outstanding, we brought a bottle of wine since its BYOB. I had bread beef, top with baked ham and mozzarella. The baked cheese was also a good appetizer. Both came in big portions. Perfect place to bring a date. Cannot wait to come back.

Reviews.Author: Jane K.
Reviews.Content: I want to marry the man that brought me here on a date, then divorce him for not bringing me here sooner.This place is amazing. And romantic. And soooooo delicious.So we get there, put our name down, and the wait was probably close to an hour and a half. Luckily my date is a great conversationalist and it went by pretty fast. We were called, so we headed back and were seated immediately.Yes, I get that this place gets a little crowded but we got an adorable corner table by the window and quite frankly, the tables were close but not close enough that I could hear other conversations. It was very intimate. However, it is ridiculously dark -- I had to practically feel my way to the ladies' room at the end of the evening. But ambiance, whatever.We ordered empanadas for appetizers, and then steaks. The salad that comes with it was just whatever. Basic romaine, onions, tomatoes, with two vinegars. But good God -- my filet was honestly probably one of the best steaks I've ever had. Cooked perfectly, drowning in its own delicious juices. The spinach mashed potatoes were good too, but the chimichurri sauce was to die for. I'm drooling just thinking about it... ready to go back again.Anyways, fantastic service. Attentive staff. Plus it's BYOB (yes!)Really great place for a nice date, highly recommend!

Reviews.Author: Jenny T.
Reviews.Content: the food was delicious, for sure, but i'm not sure it justified the 1.5 to 2 hour wait (no reservations allowed for a party of 2) my friend and i endured for it.we ended up going to cullen's for a drink, went to jewel osco to get bottle of wine, and still sat in the waiting room in the back with other possibly slightly disgruntled customers. by the time we got to the table, however, our server was really en pointe and the food came relatively quickly. got the bone in ribeye, the flavor was amazing but i'm not sure if i'm cool with the medium temperature the server suggested (i'm normally a medium rare person). slathered the delicious chimichurri sauce on everything, including the still-warm bread at the beginning (hack tip: ask for chimichurri sauce instead of the butter they give you). if it weren't for the loooooooooong wait, it would have been 4 stars.

Reviews.Author: Lucia R.
Reviews.Content: So for years my friends talked about Tango but I had not gotten the chance to make it there. So finally decided to do an early dinner to beat the mad rushes that people talk about.I called when they opened to make reservations which they do not take same day. However they assured me I would be seated with no problem (8 of us in total). I got there and the host was standoff - ish and asked if I had called and left my name? I explained that I did call and did finally get seated but annoyed by his attitude. The server was super nice so that offset the host.We had churrasco which was good. I don't eat steak often but this one did not blow me away. The empanadas where great, we had a variety brought to the table and we enjoyed them all. The bread was super yummy and we closed our early dinner with complimentary flan. The flan was delicious. Nice close to our dinner...Overall good food but way too much hype when there is so many options in Chicago.

Reviews.Author: Courtney C.
Reviews.Content: I lived nearby and there is always an incredible wait/line. My boyfriend and I wanted to go on our Anniversary, but showing up at 7 means we didn't get a call until 9:30 for an available table.The second time we attempted it we were lucky, one spot left, but it was outside on a rather cold day and the heaters kept being blown out. Oh well, no big deal. The food was okay. For all the work to go to the place, it ended up not really being worth it. The potatoes served with the Filet Mignon were delicious, I mean, they were great and they were the favorite part of my meal -- but the steak. Oh gosh. It wasn't good at all -- I ordered it Rare, but the meat lacked flavor and was incredibly chewy. I'm used to having melt in your mouth kind of steak.I mean, if you catch them when they aren't busy, I'd say it's worth trying. Otherwise, don't bother with such a long wait.

Reviews.Author: Jamie R.
Reviews.Content: Wow, this is a romantic, little gem.  Candle lit and facing Southport.  I have been going here for years, and have had an overall great dining experience here.  I would guess that I have dined in the restaurant 10 times.  It is a difficult place to get into on the weekends, unless you can make a reservation for 6 or more.  So that you aren't disappointed, for first time diners, I would recommend trying the place mid-week, or very early (like 6 pm) on the weekend.  I have only had one slightly off dining experience here (my most recent visit), and that was on a very busy weekend night, when the steaks were just not prepared correctly.  I will forgive Tango Sur this misstep and continue to dine there.  Admittedly, I should branch out and try more of their menu.  I generally order the empanadas and split the El Filet .   That this place is BYOB makes it a terrific value.  The steaks do not compare with the major steak houses, but neither do the prices.  It is a great date place mid-week or large group place with reservations -- and a good value for the price.

Reviews.Author: Luis J E.
Reviews.Content: If I could give it a 0 I would. The guy at the door is a d-BAG, he feels like he is SUPER Door Man!!! Give a loser a little power and look what happens.. terrible!!

Reviews.Author: Julia W.
Reviews.Content: The Empanadas is highly recomended.  Other menu is delicious, the steak is huge in a very affordable price.but it's too loud, definitely not a good place for your first date..Service was good, quick and friendly.I definitely will go back there.

Reviews.Author: Grace C.
Reviews.Content: Steak was good. I like the fact that many Chicago restaurant participate in BYOB. Wish more restaurants in LA had that option. This place reminded me of few places I've been to in LA. Waiters were attentive, fast and friendly. I can see why this place popular. Just be prepared to wait, even with a reservation.

Reviews.Author: Soli A.
Reviews.Content: Love this place. Friendly staff, great atmosphere, delicious food for a great price....plus BYOB ... the only bad thing is that its always packed and they dont take reservations...but its worth the wait! Hands down one of my favorite restaurants in chicago

Reviews.Author: Danny M.
Reviews.Content: Came here 2 times and the service has always been good. First time we came with a huge party and they were able to seat us right away with a reservation. Not bad from a place that is always packed.Empanadas - they have a few choices, but so far I have tried most of them. My favorite is the chicken and the ham and cheese, but you cant go wrong with any of them. They are really good and I love coming here for them. Absolutely the best!Jamon Crudo Con Melon - thin slice of ham served with a cantaloupe. This was good, but I could pass on this next time.Berenjena - oven baked eggplant with spinach mixed with a delicious cream sauce. This is my second favorite thing here.El Filet - fillet mignon topped with red onions. This was pretty good and the fillet was juicy and perfect.Lomo Relleno - fillet mignon that had a lot of fat and tendon to it. Definitely not what I was expecting from a fillet. This was a huge serving that could easily serve 2 people. I was disappointed in the quality of this steak and I wouldn't get this again.Overall, this place gets packed and they only take reservations for bigger parties, but they were nice enough to squeeze me a reservation for 2 on a Monday. Another reason I will come back is because it is byob. This place is good for groups and it does get loud inside.

Reviews.Author: Joshua S.
Reviews.Content: I usually have a good time/meal here but this is the second time where I have brought people from out of town here where they don't deliver on the time they quote.  We came and gave our name at 700 today and were quoted a 930-10 table time.  We weren't called until 1043.  Will not be coming back and will be telling our friends of how poorly mismanaged the door is.

Reviews.Author: DBIGCAT C.
Reviews.Content: One of the best steaks I have ever had!We had two Beef Empanadas as the appetizer  and one Lomo (Argentinian beef tenderloin). They were both awesome!  Lomo was big enough to share, with a flavor and tenderness you will not find anywhere else!Flan with dulce de leche and doble con crema (double espresso with foam) for desert.Waiting time is long (when we arrived around 6:45PM we were told the seating inside will be around 9:30).  Luckily,  we decided to stay outside and we got seated in 5 minutes.Seating inside is pretty cramped, but outside is perfect.  For chilly evenings, they even have gas heaters.This is a BYOB Restaurant, making life even nicer!

Reviews.Author: Habibi S.
Reviews.Content: Tried coming here tonite, actually JUST left after walking in and being told by some guy (I hope he was the host, even tho he was dressed like some college student) that the wait was an hr long. When he heard the bf and I thinking out loud about the wait, he somehow "realized" that it was now "an hour and a half". Funny, since there were open tables that were very visible, with no reserved sign or anything. Was it bc I looked a certain way/Hispanic/middle eastern? I don't know. Guess we won't find out, bc I will take my business elsewhere!!!

Reviews.Author: Susan D.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is our favorite steak-date place in the city. The filet is honestly the best I've ever had (you get two!), the spinach mashed potatoes and chimichurri are fabulous and plentiful and the service has always been top-notch.I honestly can't say enough good stuff about this place. We usually put our name in, then scoot down the street for a drink while we wait. Normally we get the call that our table is ready before we finish our first drink.Last summer when we were there, the table next to us (of 8) played CCR for the tab - hilarious and awesome.

Reviews.Author: Dominic F.
Reviews.Content: I'm rather critical of my dining experiences, I enjoy being this way, and I'm thrilled when a business meets my expectations.  If you're like me, then Tango Sur is not the place for you.Overall, the entire experience is of a lower quality; especially for the price-point.  The music was an overly loud loop of bass-heavy pseudo-latino dance music befitting of the byob vodka and red bulls at the table next to us, but clashing with the candlelight.  The service was mediocre.  I had to ask for another plate and 2 more sets of silverware for our party of 5.  The waiter was sufficient, but disinterested.The food was okay.  The salads are horendous.  They look like a plate of condiments for a cheeseburger: bagged iceberg, two circular tomato slices, and a handful of onion rings, undressed.  The lengua lacked flavor, the empanadas were rather plain, and our steaks were unimpressive in flavor, cut, and internal temperature.  A medium rare fillet mignon had to be sent back, as it was cold in the center; but all of the entrees were decidedly underdone.All things considered, I definitely won't return.

Reviews.Author: Amanda B.
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a romantic place to go for my boyfriend's birthday and Tango Sur was suggested to me by a friend. From the reviews it seemed like just the kind of place I was looking for so I went with it. It was a Monday night, but I called to make a reservation just in case. The guy said it probably wouldn't be busy but I could put my name down ahead of time, which I did. We still ended up waiting for about 45 minutes, but at least they have a nice area in back where you can enjoy some wine (BYOB!). The waiter was somewhat helpful in explaining the menu, but seemed to be pushy about ordering the more expensive items. The menu is certainly meat-focused so I wouldn't suggest bringing your vegetarian pals here.I went with the short ribs and my boyfriend had a filet, I believe. Both were great and the spinach mashed potatoes were different, but also good! The amount of food you get is ridiculous so sharing it definitely a good way to go if you're not a big eater. Like the other reviewers said, it's fairly loud but romantic and sexy. Great date spot and since it is BYOB, you won't spend a ton of money on dinner. Overall I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the food, but I felt like the service was not super impressive.

Reviews.Author: Terrance H.
Reviews.Content: Excellent restaurant, if your a meat eater, and still good if your not I'm guessing. Been here a few times and just thought to write a review. I'm sure of the multitude of reviews people have already indicated the known's...1. NO reservations taken. can be a long wait.2. very busy, tight waiting area. find a neighborhood bar to wait.But that doesn't deter me from going, I've just adjusted my expectations and times when I go. I can eat dinner around 6 to beat the crowd, on any given day. lolthe staff is always helpful, the ambiance is that of an uptempo restaurant. Here's an interesting plus the last time I was there.. A patron that was sitting next to me offered me and my date each a glass of a wine they had brought cause it paired well with the bone in ribeye. nice bonus, good selection. later found out it was a $50 bottle. anyway. Tango sur is great except for the wait if you get there to late, but it's worth it for the great food.Enjoy

Reviews.Author: Oscar G.
Reviews.Content: Food was great, but especially the empanadas which were one of the best I've had (almost like my mami use to make). However, I think the lighting and layout of seating could se some improvement. Not enough space to have a drill st the bar while you wait for your table when there's a wait. I would go again just try to make reservations ahead of time otherwise you'll be waiting... Awhile. Also is BYOB.

Reviews.Author: Kathleen C.
Reviews.Content: For some reason, I've never wanted to go to Tango Sur.  I'm not sure why - probably mostly because I don't often go out for steak and I like places where I can get smaller portions (if I want...obviously there are those days where you want LOTS OF FOOD!).However, a friend wanted to go here and I agreed.  I wish I would have known it was BYO because I have plenty of wine at home, but Jewel is just down the block, so it's not really an issue.  Also, having a 30 min or so wait allows for drinks at the bar next door or a trip to buy wine at Jewel (or both!).We shared a few things at the restaurant and I had never been there and was pretty hungry, so I opted to let the waiter give suggestions.  We shared 2 empanadas, the hearts of palm with prosciutto and then shared a (massive) traditional steak.  We ordered the steak off of the 'special' menu and I thought it was delicious.  The potatoes were also lovely.  All in all, it was a great spot.  I noticed that most everyone in there was on a date or else with a large group of friends.  It's dark and dim and very boisterous and fun.  Definitely a good spot for a friend's dinner, date or group spot.Service - 5 (spot on with the wait time, too!  Also awesome since I think we were gone longer than we were told the wait was and they didn't give away our table).Food - 5Bathrooms - 4Value - 5 (yay byo!)Atmosphere - 5

Reviews.Author: Sao-Mai N.
Reviews.Content: My recommendation for this place is to bring an Argentinian with you. According to her, probably the best Argentine restaurant in Chicago. Caveat: the long wait. No joke, 3 hours, but if you bring an Argentinian they will at least get sassy enough with the host to move your wait along. The place is cramped with a closet-sized "waiting room" or do what we did and run next door to the pub.The food is good, really good. Skip out on the fluff and head straight for the meat. The empanadas are amazing. They come with a chimichurri sauce, which I loved but was scolded that it really doesn't go with empanadas. Who cares if you love it, drown your food in it. We shared a charcoal grill of different meats and beef parts (sweetbreads, blood sausage, flank, skirt). All delicious and mind you very heavy. You could feel the heartburn. The restaurant is BYOB which is a plus for you alcoholics on a budget. I haven't been here enough to figure out the best method for avoiding await but it appears that if you travel in groups larger than 8 you can make reservations, but please don't be the obnoxious party of 20 on Saturday (you know who you are, and yes death glares were directed at you!)

Reviews.Author: Lisa Z.
Reviews.Content: I'm really just not a fan of this place.  It seems to me that everyone in Chicago who is fairly new to the city or is younger has heard of this place and lists it as one of their favorite restaurants in the city.  I disagree, and here's why.Wait: This place is always super crowded and I think they only take reservations for large groups.  Even when my group has had a reservation, we still wait, and not just for a short time.  I'm talking 30 minutes to an hour, with reservation.  Further, the doorman was not friendly or helpful regarding wait time and whether any of my party had arrived and was in the waiting room.  He also said the wait room was crowded and full, so I had to wait outside, despite that the rest of my party was inside waiting.Atmosphere: Even when I have been seated, the place is dark and crowded.  We had a reservation for 14.  But they gave us a table for 10, which makes for an unpleasant dinner.  My hips were in one spot, but my shoulders were twisted to be able to fit everyone.  Every table is crowded together, and the room is far too dark.Service: I'm underwhelmed.  They aren't friendly or helpful.  And the service here is slooooow.  Expect to wait longer after ordering.Food: If I want my breath to taste like garlic for the next five days, then yeah.  The food is generally good, but it is also not overpriced.  The food is not really my issue with this place.  It's fine, I think people find the concept of a steak for $20 or less to be awesome, but you're not getting a Joe's quality steak.  I think people like this because you can get a tasty steak for a very low price.  You pay for this however in the form of poor service, crowded room, and wait time.  I'd honestly rather pay three times the price, get a top quality steak, be seated at the time of my reservation, and have friendly service.  Not to mention actually having my own space and the ability to move my arms to eat!

Reviews.Author: Lucy N.
Reviews.Content: El Filet is El FANTASTICO! muy muy bueno! Absolutely love this place. Definitely worth the wait. Prices are amazing for the quality of food that is served. Big portions!

Reviews.Author: Steven U.
Reviews.Content: It was my first stop on my Chicago trip.  We shared the chorizo and empanadas (spinach and cheese).  Honestly I didn't feel like there was anything special with those two.  I ended up ordering the consteleta.  Ordered it medium and I was pleasantly surprised.  I had no complaints, perfectly cooked and seasoned exactly how I wanted it.

Reviews.Author: Adam K.
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Go here, you will love it. Sergio is the owner and made my party really feel welcome. It was my homey's 30th bday and we got crazy with some large bottles of beer from Half Acre, amazing steaks and dude time. Great atmosphere, service and food.

Reviews.Author: Rob L.
Reviews.Content: Loved the food as usual.  Huge menu, a literal meat-heaven.Super loud this evening, a Wednesday night.  It started loud and ended louder as people had to shout just to be heard.  I'm on a Keto diet.  I skipped the potatoes and added veggies, but had to pay extra.  Would be nice if we were able to replace them for the potatoes.  I love the garlic mash, but just can't eat them now.I will continue to dine here, I can get over all those other things.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy C.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars knowing that you're going to wait.  Do what everyone else does, get a Mickey's 40oz to chill on the corner and shoot a little dice up against the wall while you wait. Or you can just go down the street to Cullens to have a few drinks to kill the time with your company.  This is one of those places I always want to go on my birthday. Where else on earth are you going to get that much meat, at that price, can bring your own wine, and they have delicious empenadas? Get out of here. This is a GREAT place to go, but you should know, it will be your night. Don't make any other plans except for eating, drinking, and taking home leftovers of meat!What do I order - At least 1 of every empenada depending on the size of the group. Try them all! Then it's automatic double filet every time! Once they looked it up with a Flan for desert, I don't like FLan, but this was awesome! EAT HERE EXCEPT FOR THE NIGHTS WHEN I'M GOING.

Reviews.Author: Hang N.
Reviews.Content: im not gonna lie, i have dreams about the filet mignon from this place. but before i get to that, lets talk about the restaurant:Restaurant notes:-BYOB!! (yes this deserves 1 star in itself)-friendly and attentive service-cute setting and ambiance-prices are fairfood:-i love love love the filet mignon and the spinach mash potato that it came with. each bite left me feeling like i was in heaven. this is the dish that i would come back here for-tongue: most people would be scared to try this, but i bet if you did, you'd love it. they served thick slices of the tongue but it was very tender. not chewy or tough at all. -empanadas were delicious, i tried all of the flavors- the meat plater: it's a lot of meat! i didn't fall in love with this plater. probably because i was already in a meat coma from the filet. if i come back, i'd just eat the filter and not worry about any other meats. 4 stars instead of 5 because not everything was amazing, most things were. maybe a 4.5 stars if i could.

Reviews.Author: Kozue M.
Reviews.Content: Never been to an Argentinian steakhouse before so I didn't know what to expect. This restaurant is very small but in a good way, it gives it a more cozy feel! The staff were friendly and attentive. We didn't make a reservation but I heard its highly recommended especially for bigger groups cause the wait can be long. We went around 9pm and got seated in 30min. It was a BYOB place so you can buy whatever drinks you want, bring it to the restaurant and drink it while you wait! We ordered provoleta for our appetizer. It is Argentinian provolone cheese cooked on a grill and it just melted in your mouth.Also had the tortilla de papa- so good! These two made a good combo. Put the melted cheese on top of the tortilla, amazing!!I had the El Filet which was the filet mignon special. It was so good. The beef was Argentinian beef, which was cooked well (juicy and full of taste). It came with a side of mashed potatoes.At the end of the meal we were so full we couldn't order desserts but the waiter was so kind and gave us a flan on the house. The flan had caramel on top of it and it hit the spot! This was a very fun experience. The noise level is loud-you have to talk loud to hear each other but it's fun! Not a place to go on a first date but great for friends night outs!

Reviews.Author: Stella A.
Reviews.Content: I came here last week for my birthday and of course everything was amazing.  Lucky for me, there was no wait.  In fact, we arrived to a practically empty restaurant and were seated immediately.  I've been here once before and had to wait awhile then.  Maybe it was my birthday luck!  Anyhow, this place has great quality food and great atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Luquin S.
Reviews.Content: Great place, great food, great pricing, I am a huge fan!

Reviews.Author: Felix L.
Reviews.Content: Tango Surrrr....yumm....thinking about this place makes me drool again; that being said, unfortunately none of my other dining companions seems to share the same sentiments,,so let me just give some advice on how to enjoy this place to the max!!!1) this is NOT a prime steakhouse,so don't expect to get meats that melts in your mouth a la wagyu beefs...their beef can get a bit grainy, but my steak came out fine and my wife's veal was pretty good.2) they are NOT known as a salad joint either,so if they say the foods comes with salad, and all they bring is a small plate of lettuce,onions, and tomato slices with not even a dressing; that's probably because they probably expects you to be carnivores and the salads are just there to make your wife....or your teenage daughters happy.3) Be adventerous. When you see tounges served as appetizers and sweetbreads as a sidedish...Go for it!!!! I never had sweetbreads before and I'm not sure I really want to know what it is..but I thought they were pretty good.4) Bring your own wines!!! They don't sell wines, but they allow you to bring your own,so next time I'm here..I'll be bringing bottles...heck, if you see me in the restaurant, I might be selling one of my wines for a hefty profit..gotta find a way to pay for the meal somehow!!!So overall...the place has a nice ambience, excellent for big crowds..service was pretty good, they did spill some meat juice on my lap at the end of my meal, but I was so high on meat that I didn't really care by then...and the foods were more than edible...good in my opinion, not as much according to my wife and friends.. but I was more than happy to finish their foods, even after I got done with my Lomo Relleno, which was meant for 2 people...what can i say? I have a huge appetite for life!!!!

Reviews.Author: Nicole M.
Reviews.Content: BYOB w/ no corkage fee! Yes, Please! Got my bottle of wine in hand!So my boyfriend and I wanted to try a non traditional steakhouse for his birthday and this seem to fit the bill. For the both of us it was about $60 with tip for 2 steaks! We went there on a Friday night and got there at 5:45 and were seated right away. Parking also wasn't bad because we got there early.My boyfriend got the Bife vesuvio steak filled with spinach and cheese, I grabbed a bite and it was pretty yummy. I got the vacio, which was the flap meat steak. It had good flavor but a little to chewy for my liking. I didn't care to much for the potatoes that came with the meals. I saw someone else get french fries and I wish I had known cause I would have preferred french fries or even mashed. It is a little to dark in there and the menu is kind of confusing, the waiter did his best trying to explain the menu to us.

Reviews.Author: Justine L.
Reviews.Content: Over a year later, we finally came back to Tango Sur. It is such a deal for your money, I can't believe we don't come more often. In this go around, I discovered that their eggplant parmasean is amazing - a blob of cheesy and smooth perfection. I also found that I always order my steaks medium-rare, but at Tango Sur, where they are serious about their meats, I should order medium. As to which, I now attribute myself not a true steak eater :)

Reviews.Author: Justin B.
Reviews.Content: Empanadas (tried all except the ham & cheese) were the big surprise here; while not as strong as 5411 Empanadas, the Tango Sur versions were pretty solid.  That and my beef-steak-in-mushroom-laden sauce were both incredible...the token salad and the desserts were pretty underwhelming.  But low prices and BYO have me set for a return visit in 2014!

Reviews.Author: amer a.
Reviews.Content: I hope there is less than 1 star so I can give it to them.I agree that the food taste good but before you go to eat there just go to next grocery store (Elmarcado) which is connected to restaurant by the back door and see in your own eyes how dirty the meat there, the place is dirty and they sell the same meat which they cook in the restaurant in the grocery store, the tall guy with mustache who sell the meat is very dirty and rood, I will never go there again, I am sure if the city health department inspect this place it will never reopen again.The empenada which they sell is frozen for many months and they deep fry it, many times you fill it is still frozen inside.

Reviews.Author: Sean P.
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely incredible. It's has such a cool, local Chicago feel. Group dinners are money here. The food is delicious, the portions are huge and it is not very expensive (2 filets, mashed potatoes, and a salad is like $27). BYOB adds that much more to the experience. With that said you must go in knowing a few things: 1. They can be a little rude2. You will always wait, even if you have a reservation3. This isnt a prime steakhouse, they under/over cook the steaks slightly sometimes

Reviews.Author: Maudie B.
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of good reviews on yelp for this restaurant so my boyfriend and I decided to try it out. From other reviews I saw that they didn't take reservations and the wait is long, which was true. We got there around 6:30 on Saturday night and waited for an hour and a half. There isn't really a waiting area and they didn't seem to like us standing around so we walked to pick up our wine and grabbed a drink a bar next door. Even at 9 we saw people coming and having to wait a while.The restaurant has a fun and lively atmosphere. I'd have to say the wait was worth it. The food was amazing and you will have plenty of leftovers. We got the fried provolone cheese as an appetizer which was awesome would definitely suggest getting that. I got the half chicken limon-delicious and he got the El Filet-got two huge pieces. Overall I'd highly suggest going to this restaurant even with the long wait it was totally worth it, affordable, and PLENTY of leftovers. Plus it is BYOB :)

Reviews.Author: Water F.
Reviews.Content: I had never heard of this place before (forgive me as I am relatively new to the city). My friend decided to make reservations here on a whim Sunday night and the place was busy (good sign!). Certainly a "happening place." There were at least 3 large parties there. We seemed like we were stuck in a corner against the wall where we may be forgotten among the crowds and the dim....very dim lighting. however, the service was very attentive and helpful. I wasn't even hungry after my Easter lunch but the strip steak...BIFE ANGOSTO... was flavorful. It came with roasted potatoes and a very unimpressive green salad with a tomato and a few onion slices and a vinegar and oil dressing. Besides the salad, everything else was great. The green garlic sauce (forget the name...chimichurri?) was tasty but oily. the added bonus is the BYOB with no fee as we did bring in a bottle of red wine. Priced well for flavorful steaks.Would certainly go back.

Reviews.Author: Mookie S.
Reviews.Content: It's always a treat to eat at Tango Sur!I have been there several times over the last few years, I have yet to have a steak that wasn't yummy!  The fact that it's BYOB makes this place affordable.  It can get crowded, but I like going early on a Saturday and have always been seated right away.  Oh did I mention that they have outdoor seating?

Reviews.Author: Lynn N.
Reviews.Content: My sister and I yelped this place before coming on our trip to Chicago and are very happy we did- it was the best thing we ate during our trip! We got a chicken and beef empanadas, which were delicious, especially with the chimichurri sauce. I got the bife vesuvio, which really lived up to its name! The steak was sitting on a plate full of the garlic and white wine sauce- it really looked like there was a lava explosion. The steak was stuffed with a white mar del plata cheese and spinach. Every bite was so flavorful. It also comes with that awesome chimichurri! I can't get enough of it! I had to give up on the potatoes so that I could finish my steak.It was my sister's birthday and they gave her a birthday flan with a little candle in it, which was very yummy too and not too sweet. I wish we had brought some wine, but we didn't because my sister doesn't drink wine. But EVERYONE had a bottle or two, so definitely bring a bottle or you will feel out of place! lol! Its super dark inside and all the tables are lit with candles. There were a lot of couples on dates as well as some huge birthday parties. The servers are really friendly and efficient. I can't think of any other steakhouse or restaurant that is SO worth it for the price! I would definitely recommend this to anyone coming to this area!

Reviews.Author: Denise C.
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the very few places I will wait for more than an hour to get seated. The ambience is romantic and relaxing, lit by candles and intimate seating...intimate as you are probably more than likely to rub elbows with the person next to you! Typically this would bother me, but the food is too amazing for that to be an issue. I love the feel of the place, I imagine this is what a small intimate restaurant would be like in Argentina. My husband and I normally start out with ordering one of each of the five empanadas on the menu. Firstly, they are a steal at $2 and secondly, it would be wrong not to indulge in all of the equally delicious empanadas :) I have tried most of their steak entrees and my favorites are Bife Vesuvio and El Fillet. Amazing dishes that can't be touched by any other steakhouses in the city. The ambiance, food, coupled with a zero corkage fee..Yep ya can't beat it!

Reviews.Author: Maxine W.
Reviews.Content: This is a sad review. It's sad because I was so excited to eat the amazing food that 1200 other yelpers convinced me I would find here at Tango Sur. And I was severely let down. It's become a pretty well known fact that I hate going into the city. The older I get, the further I want to be from the hustle and bustle and the weird smells and the non existent parking. But alas, one of my very dear friends was celebrating his birthday and chose to host his party here. The things I do for love. I spent an hour and a half in the car, then spent $16 to park in a lot because there was no street parking to be found. Dinner was a set price of $38 per person including 10% tip, so make it $45 per person because I'm not an a-hole.There were some appetizers. Meaning I had half an empanada. And there was a salad. But I was totally confused because the salad looked like what you get on the plate with a lox platter. Lettuce, two slices of tomato, and some raw white onion. Uhhh... Kay. For my entree I ordered the bone-in ribeye. I ordered it rare because there were like 20 of us and I figured my food would sit under a heat lamp. So it came out and I took my first bite and it was dry and tough. Second bite was no better. It was really dark in there, possibly to make it difficult to see an overcooked steak. But I didn't need to see it to know it was cooked to at least medium well. I consulted with the people around me and all of their steaks were overcooked too, with the exception of the girl who had the filet. That filet looked amazing. So I definitely ordered the wrong steak. The mashed potatoes were unforgivably bad. They tasted like they were 25% real potato, 75% boxed potato flakes. Mashed potatoes are like my favorite thing on the planet, but not when they come from a box. Dessert was flan. I had a bite and I didn't care for it but flan is definitely an acquired taste. 2 stars because the service was excellent. Was my dinner worth the money? No. Was the company worth the effort? Absolutely. Will I come back? Probably not.

Reviews.Author: Nick B.
Reviews.Content: Very good service and food at a very affordable price. Both the warm interior and awesome patio offer a great atmosphere in a pretty cool area of the Southport corridor . It's BYOB, and the menu in general is great to pair with wine.The salad looks like hamburger toppings, but that's more of a funny observation than a complaint.

Reviews.Author: Courtney J.
Reviews.Content: This is one of Chicago's gems! Always a treat to go to Tango Sur because the Argentinian food here is truly fabulous. It is located in a beautiful location with lots of boutique shopping and the Music Box theater. The outdoor patio is a perfect setting for a date. And NOBODY does chimichurri better than Tango Sur!!!! Went here last night on a whim (I visit a couple of times a year) and was not disappointed. Do try the El Filet.....where, I ask you, can you get two filet mignon steaks cooked to perfection for under $30? And they have a share option! The spinach potatoes that come with the dish are great and have something in them I can't put my finger on. Also had the empanadas, tomato and egg salad, and the flan for dessert. All were delicious but, the flan is simply the best mouth-gasm I've ever had. The ambience is sexy and provides the perfect backdrop an intimate evening. The candlelight is something more restaurants need to get back to doing. Word of advice, unless you show up before 6pm, THERE WILL BE A WAIT! Plan accordingly, and if you are hosting a dinner here, perhaps you should go early to make the reservation and allow for them to accomodate your group size. I also would not advise taking the little ones to this particular restaurant, it is not child friendly. It is BYOB (what is better than that!) so feel free to tote in your beverage choice, I've even seen tequila bottles and tecate cans on tables so, there ya go! The service is warm and efficient. This place is run like a well oiled machine and has never disappointed.Go to Tango Sur, they have some of the best steaks in Chicago!

Reviews.Author: Jenna M.
Reviews.Content: I really struggled between 4 and 5 stars. The ambience was great-- granted we went on a Monday night when it was quasi-chilly so we were the only outside table. We got the provoleto or something like that--- it was a giant bowl of provolone cheese with roasted red peppers, way too big for two people... Four people it would've been PERFECT. It is a BYOB restaurant so we brought two bottles of wine and they graciously corked them for us. We opted to share the Lomo Relleno between the two of us. it was more than enough meat. We initially asked for it to be cooked medium-rare but it was recommended that we go with medium. When we got it, it was obvious that it was still cooking at the grill that was out our table. We wish we would've gone with medium-rare as medium was a bit more than what we desired. The very innards were will pinkish red; however not much beyond that was pink. There was just more flavor in the very center. I recommend that you ask for more chimmichuri as it is DELICIOUS.Service was good. Food was good. We'd go back.... Maybe with a party of four. There was just too much food for two people. We have leftovers in our fridge. :)

Reviews.Author: Adriana F.
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Tango Sur since 1990, now it is one of my son's favorite restaurants.  We celebrated his 30th birthday there with family and friends.  I miss my country's food, so I go there occasionally.  This time I was disappointed.  I order Molleja, chinchulines, and chorizo (this is something most people would not order) because I only have it when I go home to Bs. As.  and lately it has not been often.  They did not prepare the Molleja and chinchulines like in Argentina, we grill it, there is no breading, sautéing, or baking.  Molleja did not melt in my mouth and chinchulines were so dry it was like eating chips.  The chorizo on the other hand was spicy and well cooked, I placed it inside one of their buns, which were warm and fresh, and made myself a ChoriPan.   My husband did order a milanesa de pollo, not sure why since I make at home often, and he was disappointed as well.  Was lacking of flavor and was a bit oily.  I will recommend the Lomo Relleno, it is always tender prepared with mushrooms and spinach on what I believe is a wine sauce.  The portion is big and satisfies two hungry people, maybe three.   Well, I hope next time they grill the molleja as it is done in Argentina.  Service was fantastic, our waiter Piero was right on top of things and very accommodating to our needs. Oh, forgot to say that the empanadas' dough is too thick and they are fried, however the spinach and humita (corn) stuffing was excellent.  Provoleta, was not a la parrilla (grilled) it was more like fondue, still yummy but not Argentinian style.

Reviews.Author: Fred B.
Reviews.Content: This place has been reviewed a million times.  So I don't have much to add but I'll try.The place is crazy busy on weekends.  They don't take reservations and after 630pm or so, expect a 1 to 2 hour wait.  I went recently on a Monday and there was no wait.There are two excellent cuts of steaks, I'd avoid the rest.  The two best are the filet and skirts.  AVOID THE RIBEYES.The salads are meh, so skip them unless you love iceberg.The starters are very good.  Recently I had the prociutto with melon which was fresh and excellent.  The grilled provolone and the sliced eggplant are also excellent.  The one item I find to be very average are the empanadas.Service is always good and the people are nice.  Gotta love the byo.  And don't forget to tip well, as it is byob (so the bill is way lighter than a typical restaurant) and these guys work hard!

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth A.
Reviews.Content: I have heard really good things about this place and have wanted to try it for a while so I took my boyfriend here for his birthday this year because he loves steak and it's a BYOB (no corkage fee!)...perfect match! Because it was his birthday, I did make a reservation (just the night before) even though it was a Monday. However, my friend said she waited for an hour and a half on a Tuesday, so I played it safe. They also told me I could bring in my own dessert for a small fee.I've been told and read it is one of the best spots for an intimate date, but it was nice outside so we took advantage of that instead. Service was a little slow at first (took at least 5 minutes for the waiter to come over). We started with some empanadas (beef, chicken, and spinach). They were very good and pretty large. I ordered MILANESA A CABALLO with a side of vesuvio potatoes and my boyfriend ordered the T.Bone. Mine was good, but the flavor of the T. Bone was delicious and it was very juicy. I think if I got back I will order the El Fliet. We ended up saving the dessert I brought for home because we were stuffed.All in all, it was a good experience! The bill only ended up being about $50 which was awesome (I bought a 750ml bottle of craft beer at Binnys). BYOBs are great for cheap meals while still being able to enjoy alcohol

Reviews.Author: Theresa V.
Reviews.Content: 1-star only because our server was top notch...but I've been here 3 times over the past 15 years, and three things have not changed:1)  The staff (except for the servers) is cocky, condescending, and thinks they are the shee-tos.  They run their wait line like a club, and could care less about their patrons waiting 2-3 hours. The only reason my date and I got seated right away during my first visit to this place was because my date happened to know the owner.  Thanks, but  uuummm....no.2)  My dad was a butcher, and I grew up eating meat regularly.  Does that make me a meat expert?  No.  But I can sure tell the difference between meat and rubber, and the meat here qualifies as rubber.
