Over or undercooked, or just right... it's all the same....tough, chewy, and .....just wrong.  These fools have you convinced that this is good meat because it's presumably from ....well...Argentina...ho-hum.3) The place is dark and loud.  So, you have to yell all night to have an understandable conversation with your friends and/or date.  I think they do this to distract you from the #1 and #2 above.  Throughout the night you have to be so focused on trying to listen and be heard that you forget about the long wait and the bad food.  I couldn't even tell you what the place looks like inside because that is how uninteresting it really is. So, why have I a gone back after the 1st and 2nd bad experience?  I was being accommodating to my friends.  But believe me, last night was the last time.  Never ever again..."Don't cry for me Argentina..."  because I know I won't, and I'm sure neither will you.

Reviews.Author: Matthew A.
Reviews.Content: 3 hours to eat on the sidewalk, and nothing about this place was worth it. I don't get why people flock to here, there are lots of great places to eat in the area that don't require such an outrageous wait. Don't get me wrong, the food isn't bad by any means, just avoid at all costs on the weekends.

Reviews.Author: Colleen C.
Reviews.Content: Well, as this is the 177th (were all 177 of you at the restaurant last night?) review for Tango Sur, I am going to take this opportunity to provide the diners of Chicago with brief lesson on BYOB etiquette. So listen up...If you are seated at a table, and are finished with your meal...it is only appropriate to linger for 15 minutes MAX if there is ANYONE waiting for a table. If you proceed to drink your cheap wine past this period of time, then it is acceptable for the staff or the crowd that has been waiting for 2+ hours to physically remove you, and throw your wine bottles out behind you. So other than the nearly 3 hour wait last night (which I will not fault the establishment for, as they are too friendly to tell people to get the hell out), the place was obviously...wonderful. Ambiance, food, presentation, service....BYOB! But, OY VEY...the wait. Just take note, if you wish to drink your wine from home well after the meal has finished...GO HOME, or pick a less busy restaurant. They are not making any money on you taking up space to drink your own wine, and there are others waiting to eat. It's beyond rude and thoughtless...though, the crowd is decidedly "Southport" so I am not entirely surprised. :)

Reviews.Author: Stacey A.
Reviews.Content: I don't go on a whole lot of dates.I know, I know, this is a huge shock to everyone, but bear with me.It took this guy and I a whole effing year to decide that we should go out. And he was all, "Maggianos?!" And I was all, "It took us a year to go on an actual date and not put a frozen pizza in the oven. Fuck that, we are not going to a chain that I went to before Homecoming in high school."So I suggested Tango Sur, based on Jenny A's recommendation, and my own love of steak, and figured that, as a boy, my date would be psyched to hear about going to a meat-centric place. He was.He had gotten there before me, so he put our name in, and we walked down the street to go get some wine (since it's BYOB), and when we got back, they were ready to seat us on the patio.I have no idea what my date ordered, because I was SO FIXATED on my fillets. Both of them. They were perfectly cooked and perfectly flavored and each one was roughly the size of my face. It came with some mashed potatoes and this great sauce that played on the flavor of the meat.It was, in a word, amazing. I'm only giving it four stars because our server was hard to find (the busboys run their asses off, though) and we were seated directly behind the guy who plays random background music on his guitar and I could barely hear anything my date said to me.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan H.
Reviews.Content: Usually a 5 star review does not accompany a 2.25 hour wait. But you have to hear me out as to how to have a great time. 1.) Bring lots of booze. A bottle of wine isn't going to cut it. There is a line when they open a 5pm, and the wait times start at 1.5 hours. If you are lucky and get there early and get a table, good for you. I had 4 people with me. 2 girls, 2 guys. So we brought, a six pack of nice bottle beers, 2 18 oz crafted beers, a bottle of champagne, and a bottle of wine. We had most of it before we sat down. Alcohol makes waiting easier. If you can't get into the little back waiting room they have, use the park bench at the Dairy Queen next door. (I cannot be responsible for open container violations if they happen to you.) 2.) Be prepared to wait. Just know your going to wait so you don't spoil it. 3.) Order the Empinada's. We had the meat ones, but I've heard the others are tasty as well. Sweet Fancy Moses! They are incredible! 4.) Flap Steak. It's a weird name for a delicious part of a cow. Many of there dishes are recommended for 2. Listen to them. Also, allow them to tell you how it should be prepared. It's a giant hunk of meat, and it cooks differently than a steak. So don't say medium or well done. Just ask. 5.) Bring a coat until May 25th. It was cold this weekend. And the back room may be full. 6.) Order the plate of cheese. Since you saw what we drank, I really don't remember the name of the cheese dish. It's just that. A giant plate of cheese. Eat it and shut up. You're welcome. Best steak, sweet potatoes, empendads and cheese I've had in a while. I will be going back. Might try going early. Loved it. You will too. They DO NOT TAKE RESERVATIONS at this one!

Reviews.Author: Patrick K.
Reviews.Content: Amazing date night restaurant! The atmosphere is more catered to mid 20s, the service was probably the best part, and the Para Dos was phenomenal. BYOB is definitely a plus being about to bring your own wine for the different meats made the experience that much better. Definately recommend this to others out there looking for good food and service.

Reviews.Author: Amy H.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is meat-tastic! A meat-gasm of flavors! Meat-o-rific! I came on a chilly night hoping that the wait wouldn't be too long, and it wasn't. We waited for about an hour, but walked down to Toons and enjoyed a couple beers while we waited. I was starving by the time we were seated and couldn't wait for the food to arrive. Once I bit into the beef and the ham and cheese empanadas I forgot all about the cold weather outside and the wait for a table. Oh my!! They were the best empanadas that I have ever had! I ordered the Bife Vesuvio entree, which was steak stuffed with cheese and spinach in a garlic wine sauce with potato wedges. It was a perfect combination of my two favorite foods: beef and cheese. Yum!! The portions are HUGE! I couldn't finish my entree, but I took it home and can't wait to reheat it for dinner tonight! :) I saw a lot of other things on the menu that I would like to try so I can't wait to go back to Tango Sur again. The next time I will make sure to bring along 5 other people so that I can make a reservation and not have to worry about the wait, even though the wait is totally worth it.

Reviews.Author: Kristin R.
Reviews.Content: Oh how I wish I actually LIKED meat. Don't get me wrong, I've tried on numerous occasions. I am not the kind of person that turns my nose up to a particular food group without at least giving it a shot. I have never been an avid meat eater; well, I haven't really eaten meat at all over the past 28 years or so. But, every once and a while, I give it one more try. And that is exactly what I did at Tango Sur.This is obviously an Argentine steak house and most of my friends ordered a steak dish. Each person's fillet looked absolutely scrumptious! So, I tried a bite. It was good, nice and tender, but I still just could not order an entire dish of red meat and eat it. It's not good enough for me. But again, I am an anomaly. Every person that ordered a steak absolutely loved it and as the outsider, I thought they all looked very good, with a very appealing presentation, and some tasty spinach mashed potatoes on the side.The BEST part about Tango Sur, is the BYOB. How many times have you gone out to dinner or brunch and have found your drink bill exceeds your dinner bill? This has happened to me a number of times, and it is disconcerting to say the least, but also a bit comical. Drinks are just expensive. But at Tango Sur, you can bring your own booze and that is just awesome in my mind. So, kudos to them for allowing this.They do have an assortment of poultry and fish. The tilapia looked amazing but after having ran/walked 10 miles that day, I felt like a good hearty pasta dish. So I ordered the fettucine alfredo with a side salad of mozzarella cheese, spinach and roasted red pepper.My alfredo was phenomenal. One would think this is such a simple dish and how could one screw it up? Well, this is true but there were so many interesting and complimentary flavors, that it was quite different than other alfredos I've tried. And my tastebuds where happy. The ambiance is quite cool as well. It's very dim inside, has a sort of romantic feel to it, and just seems the perfect setting to enjoy a nice juicy steak, or in my case, cream-covered pasta.

Reviews.Author: Carol J.
Reviews.Content: I know, everyone will be amazed that I didn't give the big star rating but I have to say,  in this case, believe me I did.  And let me explain:Made an 8:00 reservation for 6, all of us arrived at 7:45, together, holding hands, making nice, with vino.9:15, we're finally seated, on a Tuesday I might add.  I call Bullshit.We sit, the friends order some ridiculous grilled contraption for the table.  All the meat is over done and some of it is scary.  Some of it is grizzly.  Some of it is tough.  Some of it is repulsive.  I shut up and eat what is edible.  Some of it was decent.Server is invisible, busboy is amazing (he's a star and a half if that tells you anything.....) I try to order something ala carte because the group grill crap is nasty, yet I can't for lack of acknowlegement.  Another table sees my distress and send their waiter over...who at least makes an effort, but it goes no where.   Okay, I'm resigned to the bad, grizzly grub.  Just drink more wine....We want to order dessert.   Send up flares, lighters, wave, pretend to be in a diabetic coma for lack of sugar, alas, nothing but a busboy saying "uno momento".  We order what we can from him while we have the chance.  Anal retentive waiter comes over with attitude and snippy insults in spanish not realizing 4 of 6 habla espanol....Desserts blow and then check takes another half hour, at this point we are wagering on when condesending and worthless (this kills me to say this because I try to see the good in everyone......) waiter slaps down a check ...but does so with  not only corkage fees (not a problem) but an automatic gratuity.  So I basically took one up the ass for being with five friends and getting horrendous service.    Shame on him for being such a poor waiter when he could have doubled his grat since we all own or work at restaurants.  And shame on him for providing the worst service I've ever had and you know what, that is really a huge accomplishement because I've had some of the crappiest service in the world but he topped it, above and beyond.  While he may have thought he got away with something with the horrific service and auto grat, the bottom line is this:They lost a good customer base in all of us,He halfed his potential tipThe busboy skated with an extra $30 for at least trying.The manager never bothered The food was mediocre at best (I tried, I really did).I am embarassed to ever leave this kind of review, I really am,  but no one in that entire building seemed to care (except the table next to me) and isn't that what the service industry is all about?  Please bear in mind that the wait for the table did not bother me at all, that is not even remotely the issue here.I'm sorry Tango Sur, but you broke my heart!

Reviews.Author: Nathan W.
Reviews.Content: I have to start this by saying when I go out, I go ALL OUT.  So when it's the middle of one of the most bitter winters in a long while and 3 of my closest bros call me with the first good news we've all had in a long while, ladies & gentelman, it's time for steak!So being juiced up on testostebrone we set out to find a quality joint that didn't require us to trek all the way to River North, but still get melt-in-your-mouth meat.  In our mouths.  Not to mention you can refer to this place while doing your most accurate impression of lead Top Gun character Maverick.  "Alpha Tango Sur Delta Foxtrot.  I've got two filets on the line and they've been dry-aged!"  All this comraderie without the need for the buzzkill of killing our wingman because our ego's writing checks that our asses can't cash (we paid credit).There were some problems with our afterburners going out for a seond there as we weren't sure if our steaks were cooked as specified.  But everything turned out well with my el Filet.  Hey Tango Sur, you can be my wingman anytime.  BYOB thank goodness because the airspace around here is tight and high flying.

Reviews.Author: Mahsa T.
Reviews.Content: I added Tango Sur to my bookmarks in 2009 and I finally made it over there just a short three years later in 2012. I think it was the no reservations/long wait that kept me away for so long. But that was then, now I had a connection, and it pays to have connections at places like this....so my friend and I were celebrating her birthday and I decided to drop some names and get us seated in 20 minutes rather than the hour and a half that we were quoted. Tango Sur is every bit as dark, romantic and incredibly cramped as others have told you. But the meat is worth it. Just thinking about the "el filet" makes me drool. Very juicy and tender and goes perfectly with the spinach mashed potatoes it is served with. The Argentine provolone cheese was unbelievable. The caramel flan for dessert was so good I had to restrain myself from licking the plate. I've never tasted pure caramel like that---oh so good. The only thing I was disappointed with was their famous empanadas. They were just too big, the crust was too much and too fried and the fillings were too much. Tried the trio, did not like the ones with meat in it, the plain was the best. I'd say skip the empanadas and save room for your entree, the portions are huge. Love that it is BYOB. Service was fantastic. Glad I made it here at least once.

Reviews.Author: Melanie S.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I settled on Tango Sur for our somewhat regular dinner out and I was excited to cross this place off my list of restaurants I'd been wanting to try. I'd previously picked La Gondola and Indie Cafe, and it was her turn to pick.Maybe I didn't order the right thing, because I didn't love my meal as much as my dining companion, who gushed about her hunk (of meat, that is).Admittedly, no one can hold a candle to Joe's Stone Crab for a bone-in ribeye, but when I saw it on the menu, I decided to go for it. Filets tend to be too bland for me, and the ribeye gets rave reviews so I figured it would be pretty good.It's near impossible to have a bland bone-in ribeye, but that's exactly what it was. I substituted roasted potatoes for the spinach mashed, and those were like something from a school cafeteria.I didn't even eat half my dinner, but I wrapped it to-go, and it ended up sitting in my fridge for 3 days. I knew I would never end up eating it, so I tossed it. Never before in my life have I thrown away half a steak.As my dining companion enjoyed her meal, I would likely give TS another chance, but I'm in no hurry.

Reviews.Author: Joanne W.
Reviews.Content: I've died and gone to meat heaven. Ok, maybe not but I came pretty darn close. Me and 13 of my meat loving pals decided to ring in the New Year (and the day of my birth) with lots and lots of meat (and booze). I'm going to keep my review short & sweet b/c I will not be telling you anything that has not already been said. Tango Sur is MEAT heavy. The empanadas are delicious. The Parillada is a crazy delicious portion containing blood sausage, sweetbreads, chorizo, and two different cuts of MEAT! The sweet breads were some of the best I've ever had. The chimichurri sauce was the bomb and the flan (bought out for yours truly) was creamy and sublime. One of my fellow diners claimed it was almost as good as his grandma's - now THAT is something! We ordered a couple other appetizers for the table along side the empanadas. Total with tip came out to $28/per person which was quite the deal considering the amount of food that was ordered...many people walked out with to-go boxes. Tango Sur is BYOB with NO corkage fee! Score! I read about long waits at Tango Sur, while this might be true...that was not the case for us as we had a reservation. You thought they didn't take resos? Well they do...for parties of 8 or more. Knowledge is power. Stay hungry my friends!

Reviews.Author: Kieu V.
Reviews.Content: The best GNO w/ BYOB :) Be ready for meat.. Lots of meats!! Delish & cute ambience perfect for date night.

Reviews.Author: Helena B.
Reviews.Content: The Deal: Tango Sur is an Argentinean restaurant specializing in meat. This place is a Meat-ropolis. Meat-pocolypse. Meat-ageddon. You get the picture. (Vegetarians - they do have pasta. I spotted someones gnocchi and almost went that direction with dinner. But, I eat meat. If you eat meat and you come to Tango Sur, you order meat.) The Yes: First, it's BYOB. That always deserves a mention. Second, it's fairly romantic. The interior is dark and candlelit, and our table was tucked in a corner. Perfect for making goo-goo eyes at one another until we passed out from massive meat consumption. The No: Service is notably sub-par - slow and vaguely indifferent. Our appetizer (melty cheese intended to be eaten with bread) sat, uneaten, on our table for quite awhile as we struggled to get someones attention to get some bread. I aged considerably as we waited for our check. I'm a slow eater who does not like to have her meals rushed, but this was bad.

Reviews.Author: Adriane P.
Reviews.Content: Several cows died in vain.I hadn't had Argentinean food and was on a date, so we giddy-upped for some good eats and ambiance. Unfortunately, our excitement ran away with us. It's BYOB and we didn't know what would be a good pairing; so brought a bottle of red, a bottle of white (Billy Joel advised as such and I'm an Uptown Girl; so why not?).The candlelight and live tango music were sooo romantic. The vibe was less so, more of a party atmosphere; boisterous and loud. Which doesn't underwrite romance, but is however fun, as one feels like they are at a boisterous, loud party. 2+2 folks.My date was a restaurateur and wanted to try everything on the menu, so, accordingly, we ordered the menu. Even the server charmingly advised one or two entrees, not 6 plus items. I wish the menu was online so I can bullet point each tasting, and unfortunately my photographic memory is cluttered with literature, history, and film references, so I apologize. What I do recall is the hot cheese appetizer- sweet Argentina makes saganaki?! But it was unremarkable and kinda greasy (yes, most hot or warm cheese is duhviously) and bland. The veggie and olives plate appetizer was good.As for the meat, I ate a lot of meat that night. And threw out over 15 pounds of beef leftovers. The potato and veggie sides were good.Inspite of the evening escaping the lasso of my expectations. . . I like to be satisfied and won't let the cattle stand in my way, so I will return. Moo!

Reviews.Author: Jeff A.
Reviews.Content: HUGE FAN!The empanadas are the best I have ever had with out any reservation!  I feel like if this place wasn't so darn busy I could go drink a couple bottles of wine and just eat these little delights all night long...  Only 2 dollars each really?  Yes really!The atmosphere is great!No corking fee!Juicy flavorful amazing cuts of wonderful beef, we split a bone in ribeye and filet...Note to self bring bottle and smuggle out as much chimichurri as possible, this sauce is just amazing!  I really want a jar of it on my counter!  Drizzle this on everything, pour it on the floor and roll around in it and find yourself lost in an aromatic flavor boosted nirvana!The dessert was good too!  we split three of course!I will be back!Tango Sur just found its way onto my list!

Reviews.Author: Amanda Z.
Reviews.Content: "We're going to steeeeak nightWe're going to eat it right,We're going to steaaaak night..." (Thank you, Turk and J.D.)That's how I felt coming here last night with my friends for dinner last night.  (Only one cared to join in my singing the "Steak Night Song," that's why he's my favorite.  Obviously.)We figured a way to get around the wait....wait for it...go at 5:30 on a Friday.  Seriously.  No wait.  (They open at 5, so that's pretty common sense, but seriously, for those looking for their meat without a ridonkulous wait, do it this way.)The atmosphere is great: dim with tapered candles on the tables.  Service is fantastic.  They really have the whole thing down to a well-oiled machine.  We never were thirsty, they were prompt with the ice bucket, and ready with the opener when we were ready for a new bottle.  Superb, truly.And the food...ahhh, it was wonderful.  And the price was even better.  The bife vesuvio went down wonderfully (easily split between two girls), my boyfriend and I shared the lomo relleno, which was delicious.  Served on a grill, sauced sufficiently, it was just what the meat doctor ordered.The only thing I wasn't mad about were the empanadas.  They weren't bad, but I've had better.  I think I'll try another appetizer the next time I go back.And yes, BYOB, NO corkage fee, they politely took my huge box of cupcakes into the fridge upon our arrival.I'll definitely be back the next time I need some meat...well, of course, when it's "Steeeeaaaaak night..."

Reviews.Author: Emma K.
Reviews.Content: Came here for New Years Eve dinner with a party of 11 and had an amazing dinner!  The BF and I got there first and we were shown to a back waiting room that had corkscrews and empty glasses waiting - win!  We were seated on time although the position of our table wasn't the best (right in front of the door that kept opening in the freezing cold).  It was a bit tight fitting everyone but we're all friends anyways.The server was helpful and didn't make us feel rushed.  We started with empanadas and the spinach and cheese one was definitely my favorite item of the night.  I could have eaten about 5 of them for my dinner.The salads that came before our entrees were underwhelming and looked like they belonged as burger toppings.  But the entrees were delicious!  I got the Bife de Chorizo which came with amazing potatoes.  I'm sad I lost the leftovers box somewhere along the night during the New Years festivities.  BF got some sort of chicken with baked ham and cheese on top which was yummy.Love that it is BYOB and prices are definitely reasonable.  I'm putting it on my list for when my family comes to town next.

Reviews.Author: Lorna S.
Reviews.Content: This lovely restaurant would've received 5 stars if it wasn't for the 2 1/2 hour wait. I called ahead as recommended, and was told that my table for 3 would be ready within 20 minutes. When we arrived 15 minutes later, we were asked to wait, which was fine. However, when more than 2 hours past, and other groups that arrived after us were being seated, I became angry. Not just one or two groups that arrived after us were seated first; five groups of people who arrived after us, were seated before us; groups of 3 as well.I waved the host down a couple of times to ask him what the deal was, and he kept telling me that our table would be ready soon. (In Spanish, or Portuguese)When we couldn't take it anymore, 2 1/2 hours later, I walked up to the host to tell him we were leaving, he said, "Your table is ready." I would've just left on principle, but was starving, so we stayed.The server was a very flirtatious man...too flirtatious. He was a close talker, and stared way too long into each of our eyes when talking to us. It was totally uncomfortable! The food turned out to be very good, but in my opinion, not worth the wait. It wasn't just the wait, it was the dis, and the uncomfortable situation!The other problem was that the host did not speak to me in English. I told him each time we spoke, that I didn't understand him, he continued to do it. This was aggravating, and in my opinion, a bit passive aggressive.Honestly, I could go the rest of my life without going there again.To sum up...good food, terrible service!

Reviews.Author: Donna K.
Reviews.Content: I only give it one star b/c their eggplant appetizer was fantastic.The service on the other hand is what will keep me from going back.My table, without knowing had ordered four of the same dishes.Lomo something.A filet dish with some chiamunga (??) sauce meant to be shared between two people. (BTW, that sauce just tastes like herb in olive oil with LOTS of garlic)We had all ordered it medium rare.Two of them came out perfectly.Two (on my side of the table) came out medium, tough and disgustingly dry.We tell our waiter this.  That it seems to be overcooked when we had ordered it medium rare.First he tells us it is medium rare.Then he pokes at it.He stares at our dish for 5 seconds and walk away.  He didn't ask if he can replace it or anything,We sit and wait while the other half of the table finishes their meal.The filet has turned cold and is absolutely disgusting at this point and we finally see the waiter....30 minutes later AFTER we ask for the check.We complain again about our filet and he, again, stares at it and walks away without a word leaving us to wonder what is going on.He then returns with the manager who does not seem to understand what is going on.He tells us the waiter did inform him of our complaint.Yea, AFTER we get our check and we repeatedly ask what is going to be done with the dish we hardly touched.He finally comped it after we bugged them about how terrible it was.I really had high hopes to this place but after this horrid service and their disgusting filet I'm really not sure if I'll ever go back.

Reviews.Author: A W.
Reviews.Content: Maybe it was the place being mainly lit by candles, the lively tango music playng, or the room filled to the brim with laughter and jubilant conversation. It all was meant to give the patron the feeling of an intoxicating dining experience. But, when the pixie dust cloud fades away a few days later, you think back and angrily say "Hey!"I believe the cloud completely faded when I was eating my leftovers from dinner there and I was reminded of how much I didn't like it. I ordered the El Filet which is two filet mignon pieces in a red onion wine sauce and a side heap of spinach mashed potatoes. Let me make you aware that I mainly got this dish because of the raves about the spinach mashed potatoes when I was reading reviews on this place. This was the only dish that came with them.Ok, now that we have that established, let me then tell you the mashed potatoes came cold at first. My whole plate had to be taken back so I could get a hot heap of mashed potatoes. It comes back, I try them, and they are ridiculously bland. B-L-A-N-D. Oh and then the meat? I've always been used to a filet mignon being a very good cut of meat. Usually great texture, firm, and easy to cut. The two pieces of meat I had on my plate masquerading as filet mignon were mangy, rather soft with being cooked to med-well, riddled with grizzle, and rather difficult to cut. It took me dipping my pieces I worked hard to separate from the rest of the meat in my chimichurro sauce to be able to chew it. At $24 for this dish, that is just theft!I went with my mother who had the shortribs which she felt were salty, but took the rest home feeling I may still like them. When I tried them, not only were they super salty, but had even more grizzle than my filet mignons. What's up with all the grizzle? Cheap meat or bad butchering?? Probably both. They sure have a good pixie dust cloud floating about in there.Our waiter was nice, but the guy clearing our table seemed to be rushing us. Just as I don't expect anyone to hurry up with their eating so I can sit down to take my time, that shouldn't be expected of me to do for other people. As soon as we got up he pounced on the table clearing it off and taking up the paper while I was trying to put on my coat. I had to snatch my to-go bag before it ended up on the floor, or in his bin. So rude!I'd have to say the best part of my meal was the bread and my Inca Kola pop I had. How sad is that? When I was leaving I felt I would definitely be back. Now that their magic has worn off, I know I most definitely will not.

Reviews.Author: Joel M.
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews, I expected to wait at least an hour when my wife and I headed here on a Saturday evening.  We got there early (5:15 PM) and there was absolutely no wait - there were actually a handful of tables available.  This must have been perfect timing, because within 30 minutes there was a crowd forming outside of the restaurant. The first good sign was that we were the only English speaking couple in our section (always a good indication at an ethnic restaurant.)  The second good sign was when I took a bite of my steak and blacked out for a few seconds.  Wow.  It was seriously that good.  I've had steaks $30 more expensive than this that didn't even come close.  I honestly can't remember ever having a steak this good in my life.  The flavor, the tenderness, the cut (Filet Mignon), the way it was cooked, and even the little side of spicy oil mix all made this thing perfect.  I don't think my wife and I really talked much once the steaks came out, we had work to do.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly L.
Reviews.Content: As a former vegetarian, I'm always very conscious that a steak comes from a beautiful living creature. So I want to respect that lovely cow by making sure I'm really thankful for the meal that I am eating. Nothing is more heartbreaking to me than to bite into a mediocre steak knowing that an animal gave up its life (albeit unwillingly) for no good reason. So imagine my delight upon dining at Tango Sur. This place is meat-tastic!Now I know someone's going to be all "it's not free-range, grass fed blah, blah, blah" and I get that this is probably a more important factor in respecting the cow than just the oh-my-god-it's-delicious part. But then feel free to write your own review. I will now proceed with mine...I came here on a Thursday evening around 6-ish. I was meeting a group of 5 and we were seated immediately, though not everyone was present. I'd have to say that if we tried this about 30-45 minutes later, we'd have been met with resistance. The joint was packed within a half-hour of our arrival.The atmosphere was charming and fun and I loved that we were going to be dining by candlelight! It felt very festive. We brought our own wine (yay for the BYOB policy) and we were brought glasses immediately. The waiter opened and poured the wine for us as we perused the menu. Bonus points to the waiter for being peppy, nice, and kinda hunky.We ordered an extremely tasty and cheesy-rific appetizer. Most of us then ordered El Filet, which comes with a salad (meh) and spinach mashed potatoes (also just okay). The beef, however, was totally worth the guilt trip I always feel when I partake in meat eating. Super mega carnivores will not think twice, I'm sure. This was one delicious feast! And you will (you will!) have leftovers. This serving was ginormous.So a very reasonable and incredibly delicious BYO experience means that I will be back, Tango Sur! I will be back!

Reviews.Author: natalie r.
Reviews.Content: I had a great time here with my boyfriend. Definitely coming back another day. Everything we ordered was very good.Apps: Melon with the prosciutto-good, fresh melon, and although I did enjoy the prosciutto, I've had better elsewhere. We also had the empanadas (chicken and spinage/cheese) both very good. The chimichurri sauce that came with it was the best I've ever had. Main courses: I had the "El Filet", was cooked perfectly and the wine sauce that it was lightly swimming in was delicioso! Spinach mashed potatoes were decent. I enjoyed my BF's seasoned wedged potatoes a bit more though. He also had a steak (though the name escapes me) that he loved as well. Dessert: First off, they present you a whole tray full of their goodies so you can eat with your eyes first.  They all looked delicious. We ended up getting the Flan which was very tasty but unfortunately we only had a couple of bites because we were so full. Last but not least, the service. The guys there were very nice and helped us out with recommendations. Thumbs up Tango Sur!

Reviews.Author: Damian C.
Reviews.Content: I can't believe it has taken me THIS long to get to Tango Sur - I've sure been missing out on an excellent restaurant!  I've tried making reservations in the past for this place, but they have never been accepted, so we finally lucked out, got their early, and got seated last night without having to wait.We ordered the melted provolone ("provoleta" on the menu, I think) to start, which reminded me of the queso fundido I track down at every Mexican restaurant I eat at.  I then was at an impasse between myself and the menu when deciding on an entree.  I was stuck between the filet and the sirloin, but ultimately decided on the sirloin (since I eat my steak medium-well, I was told it'd be a CRIME to get a filet cooked that way).  The date got the paradilla for one.Instead of getting a measley-sized meal, our meals could have easily fed 4 people instead of 2.  I ended up taking leftovers from the restaurant because it was just too much.  My steak was excellent and the garlic butter parsley or whatever it was sauce that came with it was a nice added touch.  I noticed there were some chicken and seafood dishes also, and next time I have my eye on the roasted chicken.Factoring in the bottle of wine with no corkage fee, all this came under $50.  I can't believe it took this long to get there, but I have a feeling it won't be nearly as long for a return trip.

Reviews.Author: Ray L.
Reviews.Content: Let me make mine a little different from the other reviews.Keyword: ValueThey start you off with some tasty bread and butter on the houseI recommend that you order some steak at this time. Although the other food is great as well, the steak is what makes me go at least once a month.  You can get an amazing steak for only $15, I tend to stick to my fave: the $20 rib-eye. The portions rock and are served with delicious potatoes.Cons: greasy & heavy, so popular that wait-times on weekends are over an hour always.Tips to avoid the cons: workout earlier in the day and eat some salad or something light during lunch to counteract the feeling of doom later in the evening.  Also here's a tip: if you're looking for a romantic dinner and MUST sit inside - go Mon-Thurs and the wait isn't bad at all for in-door seating.  For those of us that don't care, just sit in the front of the convenience store. Tango Sur has spread their tables all the way down and it seems weird at first but it's definitely worth it.  I skipped many 1+ hour waits with my friends by taking the ghetto-table no one wanted at the corner in front of the convenience store (which you can grab some booze at since it's BYOB).Tip: Although there aren't reservation, if you show up in person they will tell you the wait-time and take your phone #.  Then they call you when a table is about to be free.  This is good if you have out-of-town guests and you don't want them to wait a long time.

Reviews.Author: Penny S.
Reviews.Content: It goes by many names. Meat coma. Meat-cation. Meat-o-rama. MEEEEAAAT. Vaca del oro. But here's the thing, folks: you have to ask yourself exactly what IS worth a two, three hour wait? And really, how amazing can grilled meat actually be to merit such torture? The answer is, I don't know because I was lucky enough to be part of a party of 10 so there was no waiting because they took a reservation for us. HA! Ohhhh I'm a jerk.Yes, the steaks were really, really delicious. The chimichurri sauce was delicious. The baked sweet potato I poached from my friend's platter was also right up there. The flan, I hear, is also good but the texture of flan inspires my gag reflex so I took their word for it. Where I think Tango Sur nails it, is the minimal service. They really only pop up to fill your water, take your order, then bring you your food and check. The place is perfect for groups despite the volume, and the BYO element rounds it out perfectly.My four stars are mainly for service, their willingness to take a reservation for six or more (and seat you on time), no corkage fee and the perfect temperature for my steak. Is it worth that long of a wait? Not really, not if you have already had a well-cooked steak in this town or anywhere else. (Little tip from me to you: arrive after 8 on a cold Monday night. Lots of parking. No waiting)

Reviews.Author: Jen A.
Reviews.Content: Brandon C has been going here for years and he JUST NOW told me about its existence. I'd be mad at him for not telling me sooner, but I was so happy with last night's dinner that all is forgiven. I took a look at his Yelp review before we went, and was completely confused when he said "The BYOB is tremendous." How does that make sense? Yeah, well, it makes perfect sense when you arrive. There's a wait. Even late on a Sunday night, there's a wait. But while you wait, you're tucked into a cute little room in the back, and they bring you wine glasses and open your bottles for you. So when you realize that you've been waiting for an hour and a half, but it didn't feel nearly that long, that BYOB is, indeed, tremendous.The portions! Oh my. Two filets when you order one, and at 23 bucks, that's pretty damn cheap. They're delicious, too.I have a special place in my heart for restaurants who will make my steak blue. Our waiter asked if I was sure that I wanted blue, and I was worried that I'd just get rare. Nope! I could have brought that cow back to life if I had some paddles. Perfect :)We're going back. Often. I'll probably update this review with more waxing poetic about blue steaks and the Argentine magazine pages plastered to the bathroom walls. Did I mention those? They're spiffy.

Reviews.Author: Emily G.
Reviews.Content: Went to this restaurant for a friends birthday on a Saturday night. We had a large group (12) but had made reservations ahead of time for 9:00. We showed up at 9:00 and were told we would not be seated right away because they were still waiting on a table and they offered for us to begin enjoying our BYOB in the waiting room in the back. After waiting for more than an hour a couple of members of our group went to find someone to inquire about the wait. The manager was extremely rude to them and told them to just go back an sit in the waiting room. About an hour and fifteen minutes after our reservation and after watch two other groups of similar size who arrived after us get seated we were finally given a table. Service was extremely slow (we didn't leave until 12:30 after a 9:00 reservation) and the waiter made no effort to try to impress us. Additionally, when the bill finally came two members of our group were surprised to find that their meal was $8 more than the menu indicated. The waiter had encouraged them to get it Argentinean-style over American style with no mention of the extra $8 by the waiter or on the menu. While the empanadas were amazing and the filet mignon I got was decent (but nothing special). After the service we experienced here I will never return!

Reviews.Author: Al D.
Reviews.Content: Apparently I am Tango Sur reviewer #640....Apart from that, I went here with a birthday party. I've read many low-rated reviews, and a lot of 5-star reviews. My experience at Tango Sur merits a big, fat 2 stars. For starters, this place is always busy. Allow the hurried waitstaff to do their thing; they'll get to you sooner or later.The food is yuppiefied Argentinian cuisine - no question about it. If you never had Argentinian-style meat, then you'd probably think you're having a great meal at Tango Sur. However, Argentinian steak is supposed to have a crispy exterior with a soft interior. Hard to do without a wood-burning spit, but it can be done as evidenced at other restaurants.At Tango Sur, steaks pretty much all taste like each other - all mainly gummy, thick American steaks with a bit of seasoning to be less American. I don't know why the menu lists so many variations of steaks and prices when they all appear to be the same, slightly improved versions of what you'd get at Morton's. One member of our party brought along cupcakes for after dinner. I know this irks some restaurants, but most allow it to occur with big parties.Not at Tango Sur.Our waiter saw the container of cupcakes and threatened that he would add $1.75 on the bill for every cupcake consumed. I am not exaggerating.We then politely asked for the dessert menu. He said he'd get it.35 minutes passed, no dessert menu arrived, and our group of 14 decided to leave. I'm usually pretty cool with the shortcomings of restaurants as it's a crazy business, but I'd never expect such a low caliber to every aspect of our dining experience from a highly-esteemed restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Kyung P.
Reviews.Content: This place was just mediocre - I would say overrated.Maybe it was because I had such high expectations...We went on the Friday before Christmas.  We got there at about 6:45, no wait.  Excellent.  The space is overly crowded...I think this place is better for large groups, not for date night.  You can hear every conversation going on in the entire restaurant, and if you're not the loudest, then too bad.Service was also very rushed, and they were definitely trying to get us out.Food was also very average.  Skip the sides.I won't be back.

Reviews.Author: Tom D.
Reviews.Content: I know I like to give out 5 stars, but you really have to earn it with me! This time, Tango Sur gets 4 stars. I have given them 5 stars before, I'm sure I will again, but this time they didn't deserve it. Sorry! I like you guys so much, I love the atmosphere, but this last visit wasn't as great as my previous experiences. I think the main thing that was off was the steak. I don't know, usually your steak blows me and my guests away. This time it was just okay. And, you know what? Your prices are so reasonable, I don't even care! I will definitely come back. Without a doubt.

Reviews.Author: Natalie S.
Reviews.Content: Dear Tango Sur, I love you. Yes, I have loved you for as long as I've been able to partake in your lovely BYOB policy. But your rushed, surly waitstaff grate on my nerves. And how the Hell am I supposed to read the menu when it's so freakin' DARK inside?! We vowed to bring a flashlight next time so we can actually see what it is we're eating. I used to complain about the noise level. However, now I enjoy it because my baby was screaming away and no one heard him over the deafining dining roar. That being said, your chimchurri sauce is liquid heaven and I could drown in it and die a happy girl. Invest in more candles, Me

Reviews.Author: Christina S.
Reviews.Content: I bet lots of people are going to be very upset by my review of Tango Sur because everyone seems to love it.  But, honestly, I thought it was horrible. Ever since I visited Argentina I have been busy trying every restaurant that serves empanadas.  I love, love, love them!!  I have been to some restaurants where the empanadas are so good I almost feel like I am back in Buenos Aires.  The empanadas at Tango Sur made me realize that I was at some crowded, annoying restaurant with bad service in Chicago where people think they are eating quality argentinian steak.  And by the taste of this steak, it's not from Argentina.  And, lots of people say this place is a good bargain?  I don't consider paying $20 for cheap steak that was served to me overcooked a good bargain.  Then, some say this is a good date place?  If some cheap guy ever took me on a date to Tango Sur, I definitely would not be talking to him again. I know good steak, and this place isn't it.  It doesn't have to be Kobe beef, but come on.  And call me a snob, but give me a decent wine glass. And people actually wait 2 hours to eat here?  Everyone who loves this restaurant can hate me for this review, but, really, have you ever had good steak?

Reviews.Author: Daniel B.
Reviews.Content: My 100th review is for a restaurant that smacked a grand slam out of the park. This place is fantastic. I'm just going to list everything that is great about this restaurant because I am a no talent ass clown that shouldn't be allowed to write reviews. -BYOB -The El Filet is softball sized and it melts in your mouth -Gerado the singer of Rico Suave was our waiter -Dinner by candle light so everyone can't see how hammered I am -The empanadas are delicious(jamon con queso being my favorite)-BYOB-Very reasonable prices -Spinach mashed potatoes are a funky green color and tasty-Did I mention BYOB? This place is great, as you can tell from my list.  I'm disappointed it's taken me this long to try this place out.  Bring your appetite and a bottle of wine and be prepared to wipe the drool off your face. This place is a meat lovers dream. I will say it gets really loud in there, but who needs to talk when I have a juicy steak staring you in the face.  I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Justin G.
Reviews.Content: It is true, and I have to rant about this for just the first part of my review: waiting/getting reservations here is a joke. Not only do they not abide by the time you reserve- but you can't reserve unless you have a large enough party. Reservations for 8:30? Well we sat down at 9:30 -so don't make any evening plans after dinner. Just plan accordingly. BYOB is a great option , but you will get the corking fee, which is fine and if you have a birthday - its also $1.75 a plate for any cake that you bring. Just worth noting.Pricing seems on par with what you receive. My filet was pretty fatty and not terribly delicious compared to other places in the city. Coupled with some pretty good spinach mash potatoes though. The empanadas were good but not great.  The salad was just simple greens as well; no special dressing to note. Your rolls at dinner are maybe warm, depending on the basket, and are on par with a 24 hour diner-this was probably the most disappointing.  Nothing unique that would push me to come back.I think the hype surrounding this place has gotten the best of it. I assume at one point in time this was a great place - but now it seems all the little details that make a restaurant charming are absent. The staff is not very friendly or helpful in ordering. I'm not asking for a new friend when I meet a waiter, but maybe a "have you been here before? Might I suggest XZY" Just a "what do you want?" followed with a "What?". Atmosphere is extremely dark- to the point I used my phone to light portions of the menu. The candlelight is nice, but seems a little out of place for the menu/staff/decor. For a place that is so pushy on no reservations, and long lines I see all the time outside - this is most definitely not worth it to me at this point. I will probably try again, and order a different selection off the menu.If the wait and reservations wasn't such a circus, and the staff was just a little more inviting - I'd think about coming back to try again. But I can't help but feel like this is all just a way to generate hype and make it seem more exclusive and unique that what it really is. If you have some time to go here, give it a shot, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here or make special arrangements. Plenty of other nice places are close enough for a much better dining experience.

Reviews.Author: Molly O.
Reviews.Content: I am totally between 3 and 4 stars on this one. Our party of 12 (Yes, 12) made a 9pm reservation and weren't seated until 9:35. That kinda sucked;  there's not anywhere to wait but on the sidewalk....we were thinking about strolling to another bar, but as Lakeview haters, we decided to just wait and peruse the menu.  As soon as we finally got seated, the Beaujolais started flowing, candlelight was a-flickerin', and I already started to feel better. Okay, unless you are STARVING, skip the bread, because you will have two meals and then some no matter what you order.  We started with some empanadas which were a pleasant surprise.  I don't normally go for these, but the ham and cheese were outstanding...smothered in chimichurri of course. But then some salads came out, if that's what you would call them. A few wilty lettuce leaves, puck-sized under ripe tomatoes (c'mon, it's AUGUST!), and rings of white onion.  Dressing was on the side in the form of red wine vinegar and an olive oil bottle. Yuck. This was terrible, don't know why they bother with this.But then...da da daaaaa....El Filet! Two large filets, mine were cooked to medium rare perfection, and they were delicious.  My only issue with this is that I would have liked just one filet and the cost knocked down. That's just way too much for a petite lassie like myself, or anyone really...nobody who got the el filet went home without a Styrofoam container.   I am still eating Friday's leftovers. Lots of steak burritos. So, yes, it's a good deal for the amount of food, but jeez. Somehow I walked out of there paying $33 incl. tip! Zow.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer P.
Reviews.Content: Valentine's Day: My date and I decided Tango Sur was the place to go. Bad decision. I understand that this Hallmark Holiday turns a bustling city full of restaurants into a madhouse. There's a difference between a restaurant being busy; and a doorman that can't be honest with you. This review will not be about the food. This is dedicated to the staff, and level of service.First of all, I had no trouble with my waiter. The rest of the staff that was directing traffic was overwhelmed and clearly not prepared to handle the kind of customer flow in the restaurant. I am an office manager. Part of handling busy crowds is learning when you're about to bite off more than you can chew. You don't want to turn customers away; but you have to put your foot down at some point and recognize when you're compromising quality of service, and over promising on wait times. These yahoos had no idea how to run a business.First of all, it's almost like a club when you walk in. Instead of a cultural experience, you feel like you're watching a bunch of dudes pretend to be F.O.B. Eastern European when clearly they're not. I felt like every person working, who wasn't serving food, or involved with the kitchen; had an attitude like their job was beneath them. I don't normally criticize people in the customer service industry, as I work in it myself. You have to put up a front while you're working; and you need to show some compassion for the customers that are willing to wait.My date dropped me off to put our names down for a table while he hunted for street parking. I walked in the door and the look I got from the door guy came across like, "I don't see your name on the guest list." Strike 1. I ask him for a table. Before I can even finish my sentence, he cuts me off and speaks condescendingly to me. "We have a wait. It's going to be an hour." I respond, "That's fine. Do you think it's possible that the wait could be longer than an hour because I don't want to wait longer." I didn't get a straight answer, just lots of arm gesturing, and stumbling over sentences. It was a simple question. The man is dressed like he's been working in a corporate office, with the slight flare that says, "It's Friday and I am hitting happy hour after work." Pretend pretend pretend... The door guy couldn't promise me anything. I invite him to be frank, yet he still chooses to stick to his YOLO attitude, and he refuses to take accountability for any time. "I'm sure it will be an hour, but if it runs over an hour I refuse to take blame for it." What the heck is that?I decide to leave my number on a list for the door guy to call me when the table is ready. I know my companion loves this restaurant so I opt to try and tolerate the staff attitude. My date and I decide to grab a drink at a bar across the street. An hour and 15 minutes go by. No phone call. So we call them. Still the same run around. By this time I am starving.  We gave it 10 more minutes and walk over. We get up to the door, and their faces automatically frown when their same lackadaisical attitude isn't tolerated from me for the third time. I am understanding. If you've made me wait an hour and a half and I have not gotten a table, then you should have been able to tell me that the wait was going to be longer than an hour when I first walked up. I expressed my distaste with whom I believe was the manager on duty. He had long hair pulled in a pony-tail. The man looks at me like his feelings are hurt. Really? Your doorman can't be realistic with me and you have the nerve to look at me like I should be keeping my mouth shut at this point? Seriously, I would have been ok with taking my business elsewhere instead of these heathens giving me the runaround, wasting my time.   The manager's resolution to the matter is to shove my date and I into a tiny room, serving as a waiting area, already filled to the brim with unhappy couples. It was ridiculous. I wish my date would have suggested for us to leave before even going to the restaurant. After waiting in the room, the manager starts addressing me as "senorita," thinking that is going to charm me into submission. I promptly responded to his dismissive attitude with what little Spanish I know; basically letting him know I am not impressed. This manager obviously thinks his appearance will compensate for his lack of experience. My date and I finally got a table. If you go, expect to dine to techno music. I really think the staff wants to be in the Nightlife industry. Not foodservice. Even then, they would be inept if they had to run a club. They'd be too busy checking their faces in the bathroom mirror. What a narcissistic staff all around. The food is just meat and potatoes, nothing special. My parents can cook the same way so I grew up on this kind of food. If possible, order it to go.

Reviews.Author: C P.
Reviews.Content: Bless you, Tango Sur!Steaks - win.Salad (even though it's a basic lettuce, tomato, onion) - win.Empanadas - double win (they also sell empanadas during the day at the Latin American market next door - same owners).Wine - BYOB - win.I love the outdoor seating too. I went to Tango Sur for my graduation dinner and, even though they don't take reservations for the outside tables, they accommodated my large party. Thanks!

Reviews.Author: Lauren C.
Reviews.Content: After waiting for a steak for four hours, it was bound to be disappointing.I came here on a date a few months ago, planning on waiting for at least a couple of hours for a table.  I arrived shortly before 6, and put our names in right away for a table.  I was told it would be about an hour and a half to two hour wait - totally fine, given how crowded this restaurant can be.  We went across the street for drinks, and the host said he'd call us when our table was ready.About two hours later, he called me to let us know we'd have a table in ten minutes.  We headed over there, checked in with him, and waited for our table.  And waited.  And waited.  Half an hour later, my date asked the host how long it would be, and he said it would be at least another half hour.  I'm not sure what happened, but we didn't want to be horribly rude to him, so we headed back across the street for more drinks.An hour later, the same thing happened, except this time we stuck around outside of the restaurant with everyone else who was waiting.  Apparently, there was a party of about 15 people in the restaurant that wouldn't leave, even though they were clearly done eating.  I had seen the group go in when I originally arrived before 6, and then had been in there for more than 3 hours.  The restaurant is not huge, so they were taking up about a quarter of the seats.Rude.When we were finally escorted in, 4 HOURS after we had originally checked in, I was starving.  My steak (bife vesuvio, my usual) was decent, but I've had so much better at this place.  My date liked his steak, but for me, the wait time had left a bad taste in my mouth.(Why did we wait the 4 hours?  Because I insisted it would be the best steak ever.  I'm an idiot.)The party of 15 was still in the restaurant after we left - so they were there for at least 6 hours.  I really, really feel that the restaurant should institute some sort of policy on having people leave within half an hour of closing out their checks.  Because it's BYOB, people are going to stick around because they want to finish their booze, and it's not fair at all to those who are waiting for tables.  If I go back, I will likely stick to weeknights, as the weekends are way too crazy for me.

Reviews.Author: Kenneth M.
Reviews.Content: All I have to say about this place is awesome! Tango Sur is one of the greatest steak places for the price, and same level as the high name steak houses downtown, with a different feel. Because of how great this place is, and they do not take reservations here are a few helpful hints to get a table quickly:1. Dine before 7:00 PM, after 7:15-7:30PM the wait can get as long as 1  1/2- 2 hours longs. 2. It is BYOB, so don't forget the booze. Utilize a screw top as you will be full from dinner.3. It is loud.4. If you are a light eater most entries are big enough to share. If you are on the fence, consider different dishes, you can't go wrong. 5. Try and empanada or two.

Reviews.Author: Tricia L.
Reviews.Content: If not for the food, this would have been one, totally disappointing experience.  Instead, it was disappointing.  Thanks beef empanada and el filet steak. Strike 1: rude host.  We walked in, and since there's no waiting area in front, the host both dismally and snarkily barked at us first about pulling the door behind us to keep the cold air out and then something about whether we had reservations.  Hello to you too.  Cold and rude.Strike 2: the waiting area was inconveniently way in the back corner room of the place.  It, and the whole establishment, is super dark and lit pretty much only by candlelight.  It's like dining in a bat cave.  A bat cave with loud music and highly energetic sound level.  The host or some staff member would randomly come back to bring wine glasses for parties, but we had to specifically hunt down someone to get said wine glasses... which we wanted especially because the wait was 45 minutes at 8:45 on a Thurs. night!Strike 3: dismal service.  The waiter only came to our table for the bare necessities (taking our order, checking if we wanted dessert, dropping off the check).  Each table had a huge tin of butter, but bread was nowhere to be found until I asked for it .P.S.  It's BYOB, but I'll be tango'ing with my B elsewhere in the future.

Reviews.Author: Monica L.
Reviews.Content: I can see clearly now that...I've tried Tango Sur steak.Two words: Bife Vesuvio. It's hard not to fall head over heels in love with this baby. Grilled prime steak, stuffed with three of my favorite things: spinach, cheese & garlic. Served with potato wedges drowning in this to-die-for sauce of some sort. One of those things...where it doesn't even matter what's in it because it's THAT damn good.  So the answer is...YES, I do smell what THE ROCK is cooking...BIFE VESUVIO!!! Very intimate & romantic setting (so yes, it is very small)-- suitable for both a steak date, dinner with the girlfriends/homeboys, or even a small family gathering. And it wasn't as loud as you'd think it'd be...I had no problem listening to my girlfriends yakkity-yak about this-or-that ;). And come prepared. BYOB, no cork fee. So prepare wine pairings appropriately.But wait, there are cons. -Hard to find parking (and no, there is no valet). -Even harder to get a table on a Saturday night. I advise going as early as 6pm if you don't want to have to wait for a table for 1.5-2hr (and nope, they do not take reservations).-Very awkward way of seating people. I was asked for my number but since there wasn't much space in the "waiting room", we had to leave the restaurant and come back. Sort of feels like...being at a dance club sober. Given what I have learned my first experience there, I would come back...and dodge the aforementioned cons Matrix-style.

Reviews.Author: Kristin C.
Reviews.Content: 245 Reviews?  Holy Crap-a-roo!  I have always wanted to try Tango Sur but did not do so until just recently. . . for brunch.  Odd brunch choice, right?  I will say that the wait was short and the place was empty - good news for a party of 15!I LOVE steak.  So meaty.  Of course when I came here I was going to order it. . . but not without trying the empanadas (mmmm tasty).  Thanks to BYOB (and with brunch and brunch beverages on the brain) I brought a bottle of Prosecco and a tiny pint of OJ.  No one noticed this tiny OJ until another diner stole my idea and dashed out for more mimosa materials.  Seriously, why did he have to buy TWO large cartons of OJ (everyone knows the best mimosas are made with just a *splash*).  Anyhooch, we had to order OJ since they serve it at the restaurant and tose big cartons ON the table drew a little bit of attention.  Still, this was OK (except for the guy with all that excess!).  I ordered the outer skirt steak and to be honest, I found it really fatty and tough. . .nothing like a skirt steak should be.  I will definitely opt for the filet next time.  And I will go near the evening and bring a good bottle-o-red.  Tango Sur?  Good concept, and lots of meat, but not the best place for brunch.

Reviews.Author: Erin B.
Reviews.Content: I had been here once before (years ago), but went again recently for a friends birthday.  Everything was solidly good, but not great.The ambiance is fantastic, and the byob aspect instantly give this a major pump up, but I wasn't as impressed by our steak.We opted for some empanadas as starters- which were, in fact, delicioso, however the main entree (the Bife Vesuvio) was not evenly cooked.  The middle was practically still moo-ing, and not the medium we had asked for.  I did try a bite of my friend's steak (el filet), and realized that the boy and me chose the wrong menu item! The filet was prepared well, and tasteeeee!Our overall experience was average, and while  I don't think I'll be back anytime soon, I definitely wouldn't hesitate to try it again!

Reviews.Author: Matt S.
Reviews.Content: I'd been wanting to try Tango Sur for quite some time now. Every time my girlfriend and I had wanted to go, the wait was at least an hour for a table! But we recently took her parents there on a Thursday night, and the restaurant was more than half empty.The food (especially the Argentine beef steaks) was fantastic. Exceptionally flavorful, and the pricing is excellent for the amount and quality. The total bill for four of us was about $80.Tango Sur is BYOB, so make sure you go accross the street to Que Syrah to pick up a bottle or two of wine to accompany your meal.

Reviews.Author: April P.
Reviews.Content: About once a month, me and the bestie get together for a new restaurant to try out.  It seems that lately we've been on the Japanese and Korean bbq train, so we decided to try out some Argentinean fare based on an article that was recently released on Chicago's best restaurants for Foreign Cuisine.  The place is sexy in ambience; abundant in steaks (make sure your date thinks you chewing on a 40 ounce of steak is sexy) and the waiters are SEXY.  Ummm hmmmm....come here on girls' night out  Now this is one steak place that anyone can go to and load up on appetizers alone.  The cheesy appetizer is hot oozy provolone cheese  with warm break and chimichuri sauce.  Simple, non-elegant, but all pleasing. Empanadas are small but flavorful, my favorite being the spinach filled pocket.  Yes, order the spinach mashed potatoes, it'll make your meal seem somewhat healthy.  The steaks are juicy, but my Entrana steak in particular was on the chewier side even though I ordered it medium rare.  Skyler was our waiter and he was helpful with our choices since we were newbies.  I won't hold it against him that my steak was chewy, because he did warn me.  I'll just have to order type on my next visit.  He gave us a complimentary flan and it was polished off by me and dinner mate #2.  I'll agree with Skyler on the flan....very light and delicious This place is a great steakhouse, but has great options of entrees other than red meat

Reviews.Author: James K.
Reviews.Content: Honestly, the rave reviews for Tango Sur make me question a lot of my fellow Yelpers. This place reminded me of a place that a clueless high school guy would save up for weeks for to take a girl to. In short, Tango Sur delivered an experience of: inattentive staff, the crappiest wine glasses I've ever seen at a restaurant, bread that was made with an EZ-Bake oven, and overcooked, poor-quality beef that is barely edible unless lathered with copious amounts of the chimchurra sauce. At 20 bucks for a terrible a steak, I'd far rather walk over to East Bank Club's restaurant (open to the public) and get their delicious delmonico for 8 dollars more. (personally the spread is even more favorable as TS was a 30 dollar round-trip cab ride from River North.)Personally, I try to frequent restaurants that are good values, ie give me a good ratio of food/service/experience to the money. Tango Sur may be relatively inexpensive compared to other steak houses, but, when everything that you're paying for is shitty, the price doesn't matter; it's still a waste.

Reviews.Author: Timothy W.
Reviews.Content: The ONLY thing I did not care for was the wait, it was 2 hours but it was a Friday night and I really think it was worth the wait.  Our party of four met here around 8pm Friday night and were told the wait time, so we went to a bar down the street and had cocktails.  When it came closer we walked to a nearby Jewel and bought 6 bottles of wine, this was my first BYOB experience (not offered in texas) and it worked out very well.We started with 2 apetizers, empanadas (one of each - beef, chicken, ham/cheese, spinach/cheese) and the tortilla de papas.  The servings were small but effective and the flavors were delicious, my favorite was the spinach & cheese empanada.Katie and Natalie split the Vacio steak, this portion was huge and plenty for both of them.  I did not try theirs but they both enjoyed it very much.  My buddy Aaron ordered another steak but I cannot remember the name.  I ordered the Bife de Chorizo medium rare.  I was wondering if I should have ordered sides to accompany it but when the serving came out I was surprised at the portion size, sadly I could not finish the entire steak.  The olive oil/garlic sauce that came with it was delicious and I thought the steak was cooked very well.  The total bill for the 4 of us was right around $95 including tip, well worth it and I'll definitely come back.

Reviews.Author: Rachel W.
Reviews.Content: This spot was recommended to me by a friend who doesn't even live in Chicago. 8 months after living there in the city I finally make it. It's definitely worth all the hype, for the main course at least. Plus, there was no wait on a Thursday, 7PM. I got the spinach and cheese stuffed filet = delicious. Salad leaves MUCH to be desired (iceberg + tomatoes+onions+oil and vinegar). Come on, try a little harder. Please. I can whip up something in my kitchen in 5 minutes thats 50 times better. It's a great date place. I can't wait to come back in the summer and sit on the patio!

Reviews.Author: Bryn R.
Reviews.Content: As if it requires repeating, the governor of South Carolina is an idiot. No need to leave the country in secrecy on a state-funded visit to Argentina. Just go to Chicago and visit Tango Sur. You could write it off as a legitimate travel expense...hey, you're just visiting the Illinois governor to gather legal advice for your inevitable impeachment. I forgot how much I miss Tango Sur. I was here about 5 years ago, and yet the same host was still guarding the entrance, feigning interest in my reservation and my party of eight....pretending to record my name is his little notepad...telling me (with a smile) to chill out and go play in traffic on Southport for awhile. He'll give me a wink when my table is ready. It's worth the wait. You get inside and you feel like Anthony Bourdain in a foreign country....a country where people sit very close together, talk very loud, and drink to the revolution. It's boisterous. It's extremely dark. Servers are not well-practiced at the queen's English. All this chaos amounts to a completely impractical place for entertaining my aging parents and in-laws...who hate noise and couldn't read the menu with the Hubble telescope. Call it the Father's Day Revenge dinner. They're annoyed and I'm ecstatic. But their annoyances quick fade once the steaks arrive. The steaks are monsters. This grass-fed beef is way tastier than those corn-fed Kansas fatties, even if it's cooked a little more well done then you'd like. This is steak how god intended it. I have to make fun of the salad, though. They must loathe salad in Argentina. It was the most basic, crude effort at a salad I've ever seen. One type of lettuce and some vinegar and oil. Maybe a tomato or onion on the side...I don't even remember. It was less like a salad and more like a spread of optional hamburger toppings at a backyard cookout. The Argentinians were clearly mocking the formality of serving a salad prior to the main event. They were making damned sure that you would have plenty of room for steak by delivering you the weakest-ass salad they could conceive that still could be technically referred to as 'salad'. I'm pretty sure it was intended as a joke. I got it.

Reviews.Author: Rick F.
Reviews.Content: Price: Amazing!Service: GoodAtmosphere: Dark, CoolBathrooms: CleanFood: GreatThe front of the restaurant is understated! You'd never know your entering a steakhouse! Empanada's were excellent, Filet with the Spinach mash were great. We had a party of 10 service was smooth!Great for a romantic evening or first date!Rick

Reviews.Author: Rosanna L.
Reviews.Content: 7 girls, BYOB, great food & service = an unforgetable evening!The beef dishes are extremely juicy and cooked to order, perfection! The chimichurri sauce is absolutely delicious! The spinach and cheese empandas were tasty and crispy. I love that they serve their bread fresh from the oven! If you are an eggplant lover you MUST to try their eggplant pasta! Have to be the best pasta I've ever had.We had reservations, but still had to wait about 40 minutes because it was extremely busy. Thank goodness for BYOB. The service was quick and helpful.Noise level is quite loud so not ideal for romantic dates if your partner is the quiet type.

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is my favorite South American steakhouse.  I;m not really big on the whole "all you can eat" bit; I'm much more of a believer in quality over quantity.  Did I also mention that I'm a pretty carnivorous chick!  From what people say, it seems as though there normally is a huge wait on the weekends to get a table.  I live right around the corner and frequent Tango Sur quite a bit and have never had a problem.  During the week, I've always walked in with no wait, but I do make reservations on the weekends. Apparently that is a wise thing to do.When you walk into the place, its dimly lit, very quaint, very tight.  I must say that there is not a lot of wiggle room, but I think that that just adds to the intimacy.  Just try not to get up and go the washroom a lot, as you may knock over the wine on the table next to you...oh yeah...its BYO.   When I eat here, I feel like I'm in a little place in Argentina or Spain...very rustic and simple.  As for the food...EXCELLENT!!!   I always love to start out with the procioutto and melon.  I love that combination and their prociutto is perfect.  On to the main course, I love to get the parillada for two.  I shre it with another hungry person, obviously.  :) They bring you a skillet thing with the flames a blaze below and the meat sizzling on top.  It comes with short ribs, flank steak, chorizo, blood sausage, sweetbreads, maybe something else too...not sure.  I go nuts for the stuff and drench everything in their chimichurri sauce.   Their chumichurri sauce is probably the best I've ever had.  They do it right here.

Reviews.Author: Annie S.
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I came here on Friday and have a great time.  They don't take reservations, so my one friend came early and waited an hour for a table.  How nice of her =)  It basically took one hour and 15 min for a table.  The restaurant is very small and dark.  The servers are very nice and attentive.  Waters were always filled and our waiter answered all of our questions with a smile.  And definite plus- it's BYOB!This is what we ordered: Media Pollo Al Limon: grilled half chicken, marinated with wine lemon sauce, served with vesuvio potatoes and saladChurrasco: 12 oz, sirloin steak, cooked on the grill, served wtih saladAsado De Tira: short ribs, cooked on the grill, served with saladMilanesa a Caballo: beef, breaded and topped with two fried eggsI loved my chicken, it was super juicy and the portions were HUGE!  It was 2 huge pieces and I barely finished half of it.  My friends loved their meats and potatoes.  Everything was cooked well and tasted great. We ordered this caramel cake for dessert, they liked it but I didn't eat it since I don't like caramel.  The prices are GREAT- only $14/meal and the portions are HUGE.  I would definetely eat here again.  The only down side is that there are long waits.

Reviews.Author: Amy R.
Reviews.Content: I've been here three times and every time there has been:-Amazing rare steak. Juicy, bloody, red, but still, you know, cooked (barely... just how I like it).-Lots of noise. A great group atmosphere, not for date night.-Much wine. It's BYOB. -Small bill. The steak is definitely enough for two. If you're not a pig like me, then maybe even three. Since it's BYOB, you walk out stuffed on steak and wine for $15.Try the empanadas. Best I've had in Chicago.

Reviews.Author: Lynee L.
Reviews.Content: The best part were the empanadas and that its byob.  i ordered the $25 bife vesuvio and it was an overcooked piece of meat drenched in sauce.  we waited 2 hours for the worst steak i've ever paid for.    there is no way i would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Author: Shannon P.
Reviews.Content: Our own booze is what prevented us from leaving. There is no sharing of loved cuisine but full frontal food mugging. I'd bet the $25 grass fed beef-- rife with tendons was a cheaper piece of a$se cut than the menu admits. So, you love meat but don't touch it or butcher yourself?  Maybe this will pass as high quality since fire licks it. It's tough my friend. As tough as octopus done wrong. Steak gum with collagen not making things happy and tasty.Aloof servers, hosts that visibly count head money per table and the worst burger garnish passed off as a salad--ever.  No wait. Monday.

Reviews.Author: Dan B.
Reviews.Content: 2.5 hour wait.  Service was atrocious.  Very loud.  Was told that I incorrectly ordered my steak, and that I dont know my meat temps.Was really looking forward to this place, but severely let down.

Reviews.Author: Kate H.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is the perfect date night restaurant. In fact, it's nearly flawless in all aspects. I love that it's BYOB, and the entrees I sampled here were generous and rich. We had enough left over to create a second meal that was just as filling as the first.When we dined here last November, we started with two empanadas: the spinach & cheese and the beef. We followed these up with two entrees: el filet (fillet mignon topped with a red onion wine sauce and served with spinach mashed potatoes) and bife vesuvio (prime steak filed with spinach and mar del plata cheese and garlic).Although I knew the servings were going to be heaping, I was still stunned to see that my fillet mignon was actually two perfectly prepared steaks, well complimented by the spinach mashed potatoes. The green lump on my plate was a little odd-looking but tasted heavenly.The bife vesuvio was also delicious, although, quite honestly, we felt it was even better the second day.Tango Sur is a bit noisy - my boyfriend initially thought that his parents would enjoy the restaurant but decided it was a bad idea since his father would not be able to hear a word anyone was saying. We even struggled a bit, and this was on a Monday night.Still, I liked this aspect of the experience. Even on that snowy Monday night, the room was alive with conversation, as diners enjoyed their exquisite food and wine.My time at Tango Sur was so wonderful that I cannot wait to go back. I am hesitant, though, to do so on a weekend. I wish they took reservations, as I can see from other reviews that this seems to be one of their failings. I can only speak for my own experience, though, which was perfectly fine. Fortunately, our anniversary fell on a Monday, so we had no problem getting a table. The restaurant did fill up, though, so if you're planning to go at a peak time, be prepared to wait.From my experience, though, it's definitely worth it.

Reviews.Author: Kevin A.
Reviews.Content: W...A...I...T...I...N...G...I don't know about you, but I (heart) cow.  This place has good quality beef at great prices and of course the BYOB policy is fantastic.  Only downsides are the wait (bring extra booze to pass the time), the claustraphobic environment (if there's a fire, there's no way you're getting out alive), and the sometimes difficult waitstaff (wouldn't take back a well-done steak that was ordered rare).  That said, still a solid place to grab dinner with friends and clear out all the oddities from your liquor cabinet (wtf do I do with Frangelico?).

Reviews.Author: Drew S.
Reviews.Content: My first trip to an Argetinian steak house and I loved it.  Giant sized portions of properly prepared steak in the low $20 range.  A nice atmosphere inside and, when the weather is nicer, outdoor seating as well.  Plus the whole BYOB thing really pushes it over the top.  I ordered veal here for the first time in...ever.  It was labeled free range which was the main selling point for me though I'm not sure how they managed to sell a T-bone (kind of- it was missing the tenderloin side) of free range veal for $21.
