Reviews.Content: Cheap steak but huge opportunity cost in terms of wait.  I put my name down at 7:15pm and we weren't seated until 9:15pm.  They do take your cell phone number so you can wander around the area (though nothing is open past 7pm besides the CVS), but they then do this weird thing where they call you to tell you to come - then usher you into the "waiting room" where you have to wait for ANOTHER 40 minutes.The good thing about loitering at the CVS is that you have plenty of time to pick up a bottle of cheap wine or beer to go with your cheap dinner.  BYOB is always a plus.We started off with some tasty empanadas.  Though they were both good, I highly recommend the beef one (juicy and flavourful) over the spinach and cheese one.  Our steaks came with complimentary salads and potato wedges.  My 12 oz sirloin was barely ok - though decently seasoned, it was cooked into medium well territory even though I had specified medium rare.  My friend's strip steak was better - less well done, thicker, and juicier.Good and plenty big caramel flan dessert.  Service was decent considering how busy they were!  Bill including tax & tip was $60 for both of us.  Great price but probably would not come here again due to wait and mediocre quality of the steak.

Reviews.Author: Susan F.
Reviews.Content: Finally made my way to Tango Sur. After hearing about this place from a gf of mine who always took her bf here, I don't know why I never made it here soon. Especially because I love meat, and BYOB any place-- even if it were a prison...ok, bad joke.The space is a little cramped, but maybe that is because I came here for a large party. From what I can tell, the general consensus is YUM on the "El Filet" and empanadas. Almost everyone at the table(couples) split empanadas (spinach/cheese ones are great) and the Filet. It was quite the suitable dinner, accompanied by rolls, an amazing pesto sauce with just about everything AND a side salad (though not impressive).Some others got a huge chicken dish and the gnocchi which could feed you for 2 more meals. Leftovers galore!BYO plus super cheap to split, this place is def. a dating staple.

Reviews.Author: Justine M.
Reviews.Content: Argentinian steakhouse with a very romantic/dark atmosphere. Came here for New Years Eve dinner at around 5:30. It wasn't that busy although I heard a staff member say there would probably be a long wait later on. I would avoid coming here around 6-7ish for this is a popular place and is only open for dinner time.I ordered the El Filet ($24) and bf ordered the short ribs ($19). Both very good! My filet came in 2 and with a side order of spinach mashed potatoes. So good!It's BYOB with no cork fee. They open the bottle for you and they even asked if we wanted an ice bucket! Awesomee.I would come back!

Reviews.Author: Jenn G.
Reviews.Content: Warning - this is a vegetarian's review of a steak house.Took the boyfriend for his bday dinner at Tango Sur a few weeks ago.  It was top of his list of Chicago steak houses to try.I called a few weeks ahead of time, and while they don't do formal reservations for parties less than 6, they put me on the "wait list" which basically means you get priority to people who walk in and put their name on the list.  We made a "reservation" for 7:30pm, got there around 7:15pm and were seated right at 7:30pm.  While waiting, we sat in the back room, and since Tango Sur is brilliantly BYO, we cracked our first bottle of wine to enjoy a glass before being seated.The ambiance of the place is fantastic - very small with exposed brick walls.  However the other reviews were dead-on in terms of noise - the place is incredibly noisy!  Not a huge detractor, but it just doesn't really fit wtih the cozy ambiance of the place overall.For appetizers, we shared the corn and spinach empanadsas - AMAZING.  I'd go back just to order those!  The fried provolone plate was fantastic - literally just a plate of fried provolone cheese, which we devoured at an alarmingly fast rate.The meat-eater boyfriend ordered El Filet, which he deemed "very good."  He said it was covered in a delicious sauce, but that usually points to a lower quality cut of meat when they drench it in sauce.  His assessment was that it was excellent for the price, but fundamentally not the best steak he's ever had - more similar in food quality to the steak houses you'd see in Vegas.As a (pesca) vegetarian I ordered the salmon.  Not so wonderful.  Not bad, but just not good either.  I won't complain as I don't think most people go to Tango Sur for the fish, and I knew my meal was secondary to the birthday boy's dinner.Overall - you can't beat the price and service at Tango Sur.  With the BYO option, it's probably the best deal in town for a steak dinner.  Absolutely worth checking out... but I think we'll continue to try other local steak houses before returning.

Reviews.Author: Angela J.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is the (Mt.) Everest of Chicago restaurants.  Many will come, few will eat.  Luckily there's this little back room (think of it as the supplemental oxygen) where you can booze to you hearts content while waiting out the masses.I came at 10:00pm for a reservation for 8, they conveniently messed up my reservation and we weren't seated until 10:40... I'm not sure if it was the 10 prior drinks or the recent trip to Buenos Aires, but I thought Tango Sur was the SH*T.  Seriously, if I actually lived in this remote barren wasteland I would be there every night.  Alas, I live in the land of overpriced dates and can only dream of my next summit.  Go here once.  That's probably enough.

Reviews.Author: Brandon C.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely one of the top places in the city. I wish it was still 3-4 years ago when Southport wasn't such a popular destination so i could keep this place all to myself. I'm selfish that way.The BYOB is tremendous, the portions are enormous, the food is fantastic, the service is top notch...I'm running out of adjectives. This is the perfect date place (as long as the chick isn't a veggie) and I would even recommend going here with a group of friends. The portions are so big that you can even split them with someone or take home an entire meal worth of leftovers.

Reviews.Author: Johnny B.
Reviews.Content: Earlier this year, I visited Tango Sur and had the Filet (Filetto?). It consisted of two large filets that were VERY average - but you get what you pay for.  For only 22 bucks, there was a LOT of meat, and the sauce was good.  Based on that plate of meat, I was going to give Tango Sur an overrated 3 stars.  However, I was brought back by some out-of-towners who had heard of the Tango Sur legend.  We split a couple of the grilled platters for two.  These things were gi-frickin-normous and seasoned and flavored exquisitely.  The cuts themselves were nothing to write home about, but the flavors and seasonings made it more than worth it.  And I brought home enough for a couple more meals.  Definitely stick with the plates for two!

Reviews.Author: min. r.
Reviews.Content: Ah Tango Sur... I love you and your Argentine foods. What can I say about you that hasn't already been said?Yes, there's a long wait--every night of the week.Yes, they take reservations for parties of 6 or more.Yes, it's BYOB.Yes, it's worth the wait every single time.Their empanadas are delicious. I'm a huge fan of the Vacio steak. They've got a hot eggplant appetizer right now that is orgasmic. They handmake pastas. Their chimichurri sauce is amazing. Go. Now. Tonight. Just bring 5 other people with you so you can make a reservation and avoid the wait.

Reviews.Author: Anne W.
Reviews.Content: We booked a table for 20 on Sat evening to celebrate a special occasion.We have visited many times in the past , usually in large groups and have always been thrilled with the quality and taste of  the  food.I was so very excited to visit again as it has been a few years since I last dined here.I must tell you that we asked our waiter for suggestions and he recommended  a sirloin and a bone in ribeye.Honestly, I am not one to complain but my steak,  was one of the toughest cuts of meat I have ever eaten. I took a few bites but could not finish.My friend  ordered the bone in ribeye, very tough and he sent it back. My sister had the short ribs. Very tough also.It was disappointing to say the least especially when we mentioned this to our waiter and he replied,' well that is how we cook the meat here'.After hearing that response we felt we should say no more as we did not want to disturb your other guests or cause embarrassment.I have never had a bad meal here so this experience was shocking.This is the second time in a month we have experienced this. Tough steaks, rude  staff . Overall it was very disappointing .  One of my old favorites has taken a nosedive.

Reviews.Author: Kathleen C.
Reviews.Content: Great food at decent prices and it is BYOB.  I will never suggest to go back though.It is so dark, I have always had to wait a long time, and the waiter once seemed to leave me and my dinner mate for way too long without food.  I would have preferred to be in and out quicker.  And really, do not go here if you have anything private to say as you will be squished between a lot of people.

Reviews.Author: Amy S.
Reviews.Content: Ok, this place is a gem!   Where else can you eat good steak and have byob?  I love getting the filet mignon and drinking a good red wine with it.  I normally split the meal with a friend because it's actually two large pieces of steak and it's way too much to eat on it's own.If you live in Chicago and you haven't been there, you have to go!  GO NOW!Seriously, we had 4 people in our group, we all ate healthy portions and drank way too much wine and spent $88 with tax and tip.  AMAZING!

Reviews.Author: Tiffany G.
Reviews.Content: Changed to four stars.  I still love the place, but I was on a beef-induced high when rating last time....  The spotty service and long waits (along with the hassle of street parking) should, by rights, earn a demerit or two. Regardless, Tango has become one of my very favorite restaurants.Here's why.  Excellent quality steaks (although I've had the occasional run in with some unnecessary gristle at times), seasoned exceptionally well, cooked perfectly. Portions that could easily feed three people happily. A WONDERFUL BYOB policy with NO corkage fee (this includes liquor). Bustling, high-energy atmosphere. Dark wood, candle light, romantic enough for two but boisterous enough for a large party. Price cannot be beat for what you get in terms of quality and atmosphere.  Did I mention it's BYO?My recommendation - head to Trader Joe's to pick up a great bottle of red or, two... (Malbec preferably) - arrive at Tango EARLY (unless you don't mind the very long wait) - try to sit in the front dining room if at all possible (ha! as if you'll have a choice with the crowd!) - order the beef and cheese variety of empanadas (they are fried yet haven't even a trace of grease, very well prepared) - for the steak, order the Vacio for two and when the waiter asks how you'd like the steak prepared, do not ask that it be cremated.  Or perhaps just leave it to the cook to decide, as he'll know which temperature/preparation brings out the best in that particular cut of meat.  I've heard the flan is excellent, though I have yet to try it myself. This place truly is a GEM.

Reviews.Author: Hector M.
Reviews.Content: Tango surI have heard much about Tango Sur, the Argentine restaurant in the Southport nieghborhood where I grew up. As a youngin' I would go to the store for the amazing empanadas and leter for other Spanish products. They have also always had a butcher shop there in the store. This same family started Tango sur after I moved away from home.  The restaurant next door was a real disappointment. Tango Sur is a Argentine style steakhouse that is BYO. The restaurant is cramped with the tables really close to eachother, which sometimes makes for an interesting place to go. But these tables are so tight that not even the waiters can get through let alone the people trying to come and go from there table. People were brushing arms (and asses) against me throughout the evening. At one point I found myself tugging on a guys sportcoat that was leaving because his ass was literally on my table. The guy was cool and apologized. Ok no big deal on that, again a crowd sometimes makes a place fun. On to the food. I started with the empanadas, which were ok, not fabulous. We ordered an equal amount of spinach and of ground beef. They were half as good as the ones sold at the corner store. The chimichurri sauce, a sauce with olive oil, parsley, garlic and other things was pretty bland. I then ordered Berenjena (Eggplant) for another appetizer. The ingredients of prociutto, rio de plata cheese and the tomato cream sauce sounded like a nice marriage ok, scratch good marriage, they sounded good, but this too was not tasty. Then came the meat dishes. Upon the waiters recommendation for the most tender meat, I ordered something called 'vacio' which served two. The presentation of this looked great, brought out on a platter that keeps cooking on your table it was in a nice sauce and with sweet potatoes in the sauce. But the meat was horrible, like a really big, poor quality cut and really chewy. After a bit or two I left it. The serving could have served many people. Like five or six. My son and girlfriend ordered the 'parillada variado'(assorted grilled meats) which comes with sausages, a few cuts of different steak, morsillas which are a blood sausage and pork sausages. Morsillas which are I think Spanish, but made in many places in latin america were just ok with each adding their own touch. The steak on the platter contained was really fatty, like unhealthy to eat due to the amount of fat in each bite. When I told the waiter that what I ordered but far from what he described, he removed it and later returned to say he would take it off my account which I didn't expect but which I appreciated.Service I found was better than the food, as waiters were courteous and very attentive. In spite of this, I could never go back.

Reviews.Author: Jacob Y.
Reviews.Content: Be hungry...be very hungry.This Argentine restaurant serves great grilled food.  Get there early or expect LONG waits.  The portions of the steaks were enormous...but very tasty.  And for those who like tongue...excellent choice for appetizer.On the other hand, the place is very small.  It was very tight in there!

Reviews.Author: Melissa R.
Reviews.Content: I went there Friday night with the bf. Needed a romantic night out. Tango Sur won the vote... Ok, we were quoted 40 minutes. Great. Not bad, right? So the door guy wouldn't let us go in the back "drinking room" because he said it was full. The bf wanted to check it out himself and found seats available so came back up to get me. The doorman again was hesitant to let us go back there. What gives?So we sit in the back and share a six pack. Meanwhile, they shove an 11 top of dudes in the room for their meal. WHAT? 11 dudes sharing a 3 top table. They couldnt move and were shoved in there like sardines. I felt bad for them.Another group of 6 came in after us, and were sat almost immediately. The one dude in the group said, wow, we only waited 10 minutes... hmmm...Finally TWO hours later we get a table. Only after the bf went to check to see how much longer... Then we get our food. YUM! It made the wait worth it. Our server was amazing. We both ordered steaks. They were freakin' amazing. He even gave us dessert on the house. YUM! It was sooo good. :)

Reviews.Author: Neal K.
Reviews.Content: Do you remember when Homer went to the land of Chocolate and simply couldn't contain himself?  He tip-toes, twists, and twirls through delicacies made of chocolate upon chocolate. and just as his dream is ending, a cute little chocolate dog jumps into his arms and he takes a nice juicy bite out of it's hindquarters.  In my dream I'm Homer, Tango Sur is the Land of Meat, and the ribeye with chimichurri is that cute little obliging pooch.  Tell you what, leave your veg-ina at home and bring an expensive bottle of Napa or South American Cabernet to this restaurant, order that ribeye and some empanadas and you'll be in the Land of Meat.  Hey, I might even see you there - look for the guy lounging in a comfy meat-made Eames lounger gently caressing a doe-eyed tennn-der veal lap calf.Go on a weeknight as soon as you can get there after work for best results.  If you don't bring interesting company that's your own fault, so be prepared to kill some time waiting for your food.  Obviously, it's worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Chi N.
Reviews.Content: This review is based solely on service quality. For a place that charges 26 bucks for a steak- I expect more...much more.    After being seated by the host, my husband and I waited 15 minutes to receive water. We waited another 15 minutes to receive menus. We were only one of 4 occupied tables. The entire time we waited, the server stood in clear view of our table, doing nothing. Boo to that.

Reviews.Author: Katie S.
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to having dinner at Tango Sur after a long week at work.  We rushed from our parking spot 4 blocks away in order to be there on time for our reservations.  The guy at the door (who appeared to be more of a bouncer kind of guy, than a host) was snobby and short with me.  After a 45 minutes wait, we were seated at our table.  The quick water refills, patient wait staff and ambiance made me feel like I was in for a wonderful meal.  Sadly, that was about the only thing Tango Sur had going for it and is why they received 2 stars from me.  We got the meal "Para Dos" which is a variety of different meats for two people.  When I cut into the steak I quickly realized why the only lighting provided is candlelight-so you can't see the HUGE amounts of fat on the meat.  Every piece I tried to eat had large sections of fat.  There were 7 of us and no one took anything home with them because of it.   Needless to say, we won't be back anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: Sarah R.
Reviews.Content: This BYOB restaurant was the perfect venue for a date this week. Atmosphere: I loved the darker setting of the place and how everything was pretty much just left to candle light to set the mood (oh la la).  There's two separate rooms and then a back area were you can sit and wait for your table. We had a reservation and our table was ready right when we were so there was no wait, but I can see the back area as a good place to be able to start drinking your wine if you're waiting for your table and you're not in the way of everyone else that is dining.   Staff: Our server Daniel was great, he was incredible patient with us since we took a long time to order. (too busy talking) He was attentive during the entire meal, as were the other staff that was quick to make sure our water glasses were full the entire time. (both worse than an empty water glass when you're thirsty). Food: The food like everyone else says is beyond amazing! The portion sides are huge (yay for left-overs for lunch, which had co-workers drooling).  We both ordered the filet (med rare) and it came out perfection.  They use the perfect amount of seasoning and the meat is just so great.  Exactly what I wanted. Ask at Tango Sur, and you shall receive.  We decided to pass on dessert, but Daniel surprised us with some amazing flan.  Unreal.  The littlest things can add OR take away from a good experience. To me adding in a dessert was just the cherry on top!  We were one of the last people in the restaurant that night, and never once did I feel pressure that we needed to hurry up and leave, but left us to our own time, which I feel was much appreciated.  This is definitely is a place I will return to again, and again, and again.

Reviews.Author: Dan H.
Reviews.Content: Mmmm, meat.You know the kind of place that you want to write great things about because it's got great food and great value but on some level you don't want too many other people to know because it's only going to make you have to wait longer for a table so you feel really conflicted but ultimately you decide to be honest about it and write something great and figure karma works so it will all be OK in the end?  That's this place.

Reviews.Author: John C.
Reviews.Content: Overrated.Big Time.I tried this place a few years ago and was thoroughly unimpressed.  I gave it a second try 2 years ago.  Things had not improved.  But still the lines outside the place were 2 hours long every weekend.  Surely I had missed something.  I tried a final time a year ago since I live close by.  I am sorry, but I do not understand the lines or the reviews of this place at all.  while I understand that the meat is supposed to be a different kind of cut, mine was more like rubberized roadkill.  I seriously could not chew it.  While there was some decent flavor, I wasn't there to chew and spit out every bite like it was some new concoction of Wrigley's gum.  Yes, the price can be all right since it is BYOB but if you can't swallow your food what's the point?

Reviews.Author: Garrett A.
Reviews.Content: Contrary to popular belief, Emma Lazarus originally wrote The New Colossus with the lines, "Give me your hungry, your poor / Your huddled masses yearning for steak" while she was thinking about Tango Sur.  For no trip to the New World of the Southport Corridor is complete without the Parradillo Para Dos, an orgasmic journey through five distinct yet all deliciously flavorful meats.  You'll find yourself moaning through the juicy tenderness, and just when you thought you'll have to say good-bye, the server comes around with a hushed, "Would you like that wrapped, sir?"  And with that, the journey continues in your microwave.  You're welcome, America.

Reviews.Author: Mickey F.
Reviews.Content: Awful bad service after we finally got seated the steaks took an hour to come out and were under cooked. Is there broiler section really that small? Choice meat at a choice restaurant you pay for what you get. If you want a decent steak stick to down town this is the minor league.

Reviews.Author: Lori G.
Reviews.Content: This place is ridiculous. Went with another couple on a Friday night for dinner b/c we've always heard wondeful things. We arrive about 8:30 and expected to wait. We walk up to the host and he informs us it'll be an hour wait. Sure, no problem! The host just looks at us. I ask, "Is there a wait list we can put our name on so you can call us?" The host pulls out the infamous pocket notebook and starts looking at ths names on his list. I ask, "Do you need my name and number?". The host says, "yes" so I give him my name and number. He then says, "I hope I got your number correct" so I repeat it to him and he doesn't even look at me and says "Yup". I felt like I was in a scene of the movie Date Night. Our group seriously thought that we were not going to get a call. Lucky for us, they did after about 45mins. Get seated, waiter showed up 15mins later, ordered appetizers. Waiter came back with appetizers 15mins later,  placed entree order. Served us salad (blah). Then the waiter brought our entrees. All our entrees were good. We were never checked up, constantly had to ask for waters to be refilled. One at our table ordered a diet coke- waiter "forgot" about it.  I read someone elses review about their waiter disappearing into a black hole i the back, and that's exactly  how we felt about our waiter. The only time we came back to our table within 5mins was when he dropped the check off.  All in all, stay away, there's much better places for steak (ex: Las Tablas)

Reviews.Author: Abe Z.
Reviews.Content: Seriously One Of The Best Steaks I've had in Chicago!! Must try the El Filet.. It comes with two pieces of Prime Filets so tender and juicy.mmm always has me coming back for more. The prices are also Very reasonable and there's no corkage fee?? In the city this is unheard of lol. Great date spot or nice steak house to go with a couple of friends. Highly Recommend This place

Reviews.Author: Emily Z.
Reviews.Content: Definitley a must try !!This place is adorable, the atmosphere is hard to pinpoint, its all lit by candle light which I love, the tables are packed in and there are quite a few groups with pretty much unlimited wine since its BYOB, so it did get pretty loud in there and as people walk by its seems to get a ltitle croweded even while your at your table, aka the waiters walking by kept knocking our menu off our table !It says they take reservations, but I called to put my name on the list for a table for 2 and he said they don't take reservatiosn over the phone just to come in. When I got there the host met us at the door, he picked up the phone in his hand making us wait outside, it is winter, not the most chivalrious thing I've expereienced, and he took down someones name on his sheet for a table for 2, when I confronted him about this since he wouldn't take my name he said it wasn't him I spoke to and that this person was his friend and he does that for them every week. okay. We got offered the option to wait in the 'holding room' it has 3 tables and is quite small, when we got there at 7:45 on a Friday there were a few chairs left, but by the time we finally got seated 30min after the 30 min they quoted us it was sooo packed you couldn't move. annoying. but glad we had a table so we weren't getting shoved around.Tables do not move becuase everyone has to finish their 4 bottles of wine !!We finally got seated, our server was a hunky Argentianan man, he was super sweet, and definitley understood little of what I said, everytime I would try and make a joke he would laugh uncomfortably and say thank you.They let you drink your wine in the holding room so after drinkig more than half our bottle and an hour wait we got to the table and devoured the baby baugettes they gave us... which are unlimed... though I guess you should save room for the meat since this is a steak house right.There are a few options on the menu that say perfect to share between 2, they are not kidding they are huge cuts of beef. My friend and I shared one that came with sweet potatoes, I thought it was good she loved it. Though I do love the chimichurri, atleast thats what I think its called, its a garlic herby sauce they give you with everything... yum !!

Reviews.Author: Thompson L.
Reviews.Content: Secrets out.  Don't forget to make a reservation!  The maître d' was very good with the line.  I was impressed.  Only waited for about 10 minutes for a table but the poor girls next to us had already waited more than 40 minutes without a reservation.  oops.Also don't forget to BYOB!  There's a liquor store by the train station a few blocks away.  No corkage fee!This is very affordable steakhouse and the meat is ridiculously good.  I ALWAYS order the skirt steak when I dine at Argentinian steakhouses and it was really good.  Portions were great too... platter for 2 plus the skirt steak was able to feed 6 ppl.  woot!

Reviews.Author: Allen B.
Reviews.Content: Probably the only "5 star" worthy restaurant I've ever been too....so far.I'm a HUGE fan of meat and potatoes and Tang Sur definitely fills my appetite. I just wish it wasn't so busy at times. It's all good though because there are some choice bars around the area in which you can grab a drink and just come back when they call your cell. The BYOB touch is also what makes this place worthy of checking out. Enjoying your favorite glass of wine along with a tender filet of meat definitely goes without saying.

Reviews.Author: Daniele N.
Reviews.Content: Berry Gooooooood!!!!We went there 3 times already, I believe.Very good food, environment, food, people, food...did I mention food?Meat...oh! Meat! I love you!The restaurant is a little too dark (basically only candlelight) but its all part of the charm.

Reviews.Author: Cameron H.
Reviews.Content: I am generally a fan of latin american restaurants.  So, when my foodie friend and I decided to go out, we wanted to go to a place that was new to both of us and has good eats (lots of meat).The is a very intimate, well designed, not loud, great place to eat.Since there were three of us, we started off with the:EMPANADASArgentine turnover in chicken,spinach & cheese, and corn.Then for the main dish we ordered:Pork Chop, Steak, and grilled Chicken.Everyone loved their food choices thus far!!We really weren't sure on dessert so the waiter brought out a free flan.  I don't like flan so my evening was dessert free.  I was totally ok with that.  However, the other two thought it was delicious!!I would go back and try a few other options!!

Reviews.Author: Alisa M.
Reviews.Content: Spinach and Cheese empanada- They are small, but we split with 3 people and it was about the size of one bite each. Very good!! We decided to start with a seafood salad. I couldn't find it on the menu, but it was a fresh salad topped with grilled seafood (calamari, squid, shrimp, mussels/ oysters, crab). It was very tasty. It's served cold with lemon wedges and topped with sun dried red peppers (at least that's what I think it was). We ordered the Lomo Relleno and the Milanesa a Caballo. The Lomo Rellano was huge. Even sharing between 2 of us, we had about half left over. I guess it depends on how big of an eater you are, but it was more than enough for two. The meat was tender and the sauce was sooo good. I guess being asian, it would have tasted perfect with a side of rice. Their Milanesa was ok. Nothing special. It was a beef breaded and fried and topped with 2 eggs. If you come here, I would recommend trying their grilled steaks!We arrived at 7pm on a Monday night and the place only had people sitting at one other table. By the time we left (around 9pm), the place was completely packed. Very romantic ambiance with candles lit. I hope to come back here in the future and try their Bife Vesuvio!

Reviews.Author: Paige W.
Reviews.Content: Not the best experience, I'm sad to say. First, the goods:We were underquoted for our wait time--and they DO get major points for taking cell phone numbers and allowing you to go grab a bottle of wine from Que Syrah or drinks from Take Five or Cullen's while you wait--and had a table after 20 minutes.Our service was wonderful.And the prosciutto with melon appetizer was divine. Just as delicious in mid-December as it is in the heat of summer!All the flavors in our entre (Bife Vesuvio) were balanced perfectly.I had a lovely date and a beautiful bottle of wine, and we had a table in the corner where we never felt rushed to finish our meal and get out.The not-so-goods:I burned my thumb striking a match to light our candle. Which they should have done but didn't. (But the burn's my fault.)The tables surrounding us were filled with self-important finance guys shouting over one another to be heard. We could hear them (very clearly) but apparently it wasn't enough for them.The salads that came before our steak were ridiculous: big pieces of lettuce, four slices of mealy, out-of-season tomatoes and a few pieces of sliced white onion. And bottles of oil and vinegar. Maybe that's Argentinian tradition, but I sure didn't like it.And the bad: Our steak was huge (some people see that as a good thing) but lukewarm at best, and unevenly cooked. The spinach was nearly cold and cheese practically returned to its solid form by the time it came to us, and the potatoes were overcooked and dry. It just didn't live up to all these amazing reviews I've read.Which is why I'll give it another try sometime. Empanadas and some steak that isn't quite so complicated. And dessert.A note on reservations: You can make them if you have more than seven people in your party.

Reviews.Author: Kathryn M.
Reviews.Content: Holy good lord, I'm still dreaming about the platter of meat that covered our table at Tango Sur.  That's right, a warm, 6 inch tall grill was set on the table, filled with the juiciest, most tender, and LARGEST portion of meat I had ever seen presented to me at one sitting.  This Chef's Special, called the Lomo Relleno ("a half slab orgentine filet sliced and filled with chimichurri ham sauce cooked and served on a grill with portabella marsala) was to die for.  My meat-loving companion was excited about the leftovers before he even took his first bite! It was reeeally good.  Mushrooms were cooked just right, good flavor, and we enjoyed this feast over a BYO bottle of red wine, all for just $32.  If you live nearby (or even far, far, away) go to Tango Sur.  You must.  Grab some wine on the way. Order the Lomo Relleno.  And enjoy.

Reviews.Author: tina m.
Reviews.Content: I would give Tango Sur 5 stars if it weren't so loud!  I swear I am not being an old women; if you have party of 5 or more, good luck hearing your friends talk!Other than that, I am in love with this place, even as a non-meat eater!Our reservation was set for 8:30 on a Friday night.  We had about 7 girls total, and waited all of 5 minutes to get seated which was VERY impressive for this place.  I know all women will agree with me on the lighting, nice and dark candlelight which is EVERY girls best friend!  We got seated right at the front which was nice seeing that it was jam packed with people in both the front and back room.  The service was FANTASTIC.  Our server was there the second we sat down, opening all 6 bottles of wine and even giving us champagne glasses for the big bottle my friends brought. :)He took our orders ASAP and we didn't wait very long for our salads to come out.  Then came the Eggplant--holy holy.  It was delicious...melted in my mouth...  Then the table next to us heard it was my bday so they ordered me a piece of cake with a candle on it--thanks boys :)It was SUCH a fun night out with the girls, the service and food could NOT have been better.The only other thing I would change is that there is only ONE bathroom in the entire place so the line of girls were 4 deep each time a friend went back there.  Time to add one more TS!

Reviews.Author: carolyn h.
Reviews.Content: I love this place.  I have been here more times than I can count because it's so good.  i recently went here on a Friday night with a group of 14.  I was very impressed with their ability to manage the group.I must admit, I lived in Buenos Aires for 1 year and a half and this place is the essence of a Steak Place in that city.  It really makes me feel like I'm back in Argentina.  The empanadas, the steak cuts, everything.  I think it makes me biased in my review so keep that in mind.   I must say, this place does a TON of business.  Friday night (and pretty much every other night of the week) is packed.  Waiters are busting their behind and it's definitely a fast paced environment.  I've noticed that with Tango Sur I have to go in expecting a loud, fast environment.  If you are looking for a quiet romantic dinner, this isn't the place.  Their are simply to many tables, to close together and to much going on.As always, the food was fantastic.   I highly recommend the berenjena appetizer with the sauce and the cheese.  It's to die for.  I think it's technically on the special menu but every time I go they have it available.  i also love the empanadas.  My favorite is hands down the carne.  The steaks are HUGE.  You could share one with someone else and be fine.  I usually get one for myself cause I love left overs.  My favorite side is the spinach mashed potatoes. I've never tried a dessert here because I'm always to stuffed.

Reviews.Author: Matt R.
Reviews.Content: I had actually not heard of Tango Sur until one of my friend's suggested for a Saturday night dinner with friends.  I enjoyed my dinner and think Tango Sur is great for a red-meat glut when you feel the desire.  First off, we got there at about 6:30 on a Saturday night and waited until around 8 (with a party of 6).  The nice thing is that they take down your cell phone number and call you when a table is open.  We chose to go down to Blue Bayou and have an Abita while we waited...definitely a good choice, especially on a 90 degree night.  The menu consists of reasonably priced, gigantic portions of well seasoned, red meat.  Sure, they have chicken options and maybe 2 vegetarian options, but I don't really think it'd be worth going if you didn't plan on consuming beef or pork.  I started off with an appetizer of prosciutto and melon.  It was simple and a good beginning of the meal.  The prosciutto was decent, but nothing to write home about.  I would go with empanada's next time.  For my meal I had the "Para Uno".  The "Para Uno" which consisted of flap steak, short ribs, beef sweetbreads, chorizo and black sausage.  The flap steak and short ribs were perfectly done, tender and seasoned well.  The beef sweetbreads were good, but nothing special.  The chorizo and black sausage were too seasoned for my taste.  This is not Tango Sur's fault, this is my fault...I'm just not a big sausage fan.  The chimichurri was awesome and leaves you with garlic breath for at least a day.  Unless you are a professional football player, I would definitely recommend sharing one dish between two people.  They are way too large for just one person.  I'm a big guy, and I had no chance at finishing my meal.  Two people at our table shared a dish and still took some home.

Reviews.Author: Jordan K.
Reviews.Content: The search for a great steakhouse continues.  Yelp has led me astray yet again.  Maybe it's that I'm from Oklahoma and we have steaks that were probably mooing yesterday, but this place was just ok.  Had a long wait despite a reservation, and was unimpressed with the food and sides.

Reviews.Author: Vanessa L.
Reviews.Content: We ate this restaurant for my future sister in laws birthday & it was pretty interesting. Great atmosphere with low lighting.  I don't know if I have ever been to a restaurant that had a BYOB policy. It's awesome. We got to bring our own liquor and drink it at the restaurant & they didn't charge any kind of fee. Saved us a lot of money on the bill. The food was delicious & a bit different. The free bread was warm & soft. The chicken empanadas were delicious. Also, I had "el filet" w/ spinach mashed potatoes. The filet was tender & had a nice onion sauce. I gave this place a 4 star because of the service. I felt like I had to constantly repeat what I wanted. Also, we were there & had a party of 10 & they were rushing us stating that we had to be done with the table by 9. I thought it was a bit rude especially because we were there for a birthday party, but the BYOB made up for it.

Reviews.Author: Brady H.
Reviews.Content: While not sure what I can add to the numerous reviews, I've ate here a few times over the years and have always enjoyed this place. The meat quality is decent, the prices are very reasonable, and of course its BYOB. We recently brought some out of town guests - they loved it. I got there first and added our names, so by the time the rest of our group came, the wait was not quite as bad, but still bad. The main downside is the massive waits. Oh my massive waits.

Reviews.Author: Cheryl B.
Reviews.Content: DO NOT GO HERE WITH A GROUP!Whatever you do, DO NOT try to go to TANGO SUR with a group or with anyone you'd really like to impress. Yes, It is a great place, but horrible for groups. Their reservation and seating system is awful!I argued with them on the phone for 30 minutes last weekened about their reservation policy (each person I talked to in the past told me something differently.) and when our group went up there Friday, there were 8 of us and we were told they would not be able to accomodate us at all the entire weekend. They were completely booked with parties of 6 or more. Not even at 5pm or 10pm. When I had called earlier they had said they already had 7 large parties for the evening and had to restrict it at that so they could still accomodate walk-ins. They told me to walk-in and wait. We were willing to wait 2+ hours, but they said even then it didn't matter we weren't going to be seated. They desperately need a new system!!

Reviews.Author: Amy Elizabeth S.
Reviews.Content: Oh my god, A group of friends and I dined here last week and it was amazing.  We went on a Friday night, so we did have to wait for an hour and a half (which we totally expected), but the host offered to hold our wine (BYOB) so we could have a drink at another bar while we waited...  and he called our cell phone to tell us the table was ready. Now, I have never had Argentinian food, but I think Empanadas might be my new.favorite.thing. ever.   Besides that, the table ordered tons of meat and we all kind of shared... everything from the El Filet to the Lomo Relleno and it was all delish and came in large portions.  I ate so much meat, I thought I was going to have a steak hangover.  They offer very tempting fish entrees for the  non-meater as well.  The service was awesome, and considering our table was out for a celebration and we consumed copious amounts of wine, they were really hospitable ( We were that  loud, annoying table that probably made other people leave and our server seemed to enjoy us).  I had such a good time at Tango Sur, and the food was out of this world... I cannot wait to share this place with friends.

Reviews.Author: Allie B.
Reviews.Content: Four stars for excellant group atmosphere (we had a reservation for a party of 8 and were seated right away), prompt service, yummy basic salad with oil and vinegar, plentiful rolls and quick water service.  Just shy of a fifth star because of the meager bathroom situation and the failure to actually get to "medium" on two of my friend's steaks.If you're jonesing for red meat for about $22 per person, this is your place.  I had the outer skirt with yummy chimichurri sauce and it was delish.  Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Mrs. W.
Reviews.Content: I am a true carnivore.  I can't live w/o meat.  And I will go back.  Because Tango Sur delivers some really good meat, and it tastes sooo yummy.But the service is horrible.  Everyone knows it.  The entire city knows.  Hell, Tango Sur knows it, but apparently they could care less cuz they know they have tasty food and people will continue to come, whether or not they treat their guests with respect.  Which they totally don't.  And you can't get a straight answer out of anyone working there.  I worked in the industry for YEARS throughout college, and I know how stressful it can be.  Therefore I am usually more than understanding towards servers.  But I actually got into a verbal altercation with my server.  He ignored us and I called him out on it.  This happened a long time ago, and this is why I haven't been back.Again, what stinks is that they are completely aware that their high volume takes away from service.  But it's a different dining culture and I take that into consideration.Still not going back anytime soon though......

Reviews.Author: Tabitha G.
Reviews.Content: Yum yum give me some!  I had the pleasure of FINALLY dining here this past weekend when my friend chose it as the place to celebrate her birthday.  I was so excited and had heard such great things that I was really hoping I wasn't going to be disappointed - and I wasn't.First and foremost it's BYOB - need I say more?  We came each equipped with 2 bottles each and they were in no rush to kick us out, despite the fact that there was a LOOOOONNNGGG line of people outside waiting to be seated.We started with the empanadas, as recommended by my friends and they were amazing.  The beef and the ham ones were my favorite, but what really made it delish was the chimichurri sauce.....just don't plan on making the move on anyone after eating it.  It's enough to keep Edward Cullen away.Luckily one of my friends warned me ahead of time that the portions would be humongous so I split the filet dish with my friend.  Let me tell you this meal could have fed a family of 4, no joke.  The portion came with 2 pieces of steak what looked to be about 10oz each (if not more) and a VERY generous helping of the spinach mashed potatoes.  It was so big that I couldn't even finish half of one piece of steak...but was it oh so good.  Since everyone seemed to have order different things I was able to try some other items and let me tell you, it usually isn't my first recommendation, but the sweet breads were delish.  So good and tasty.In fact I liked this place so much that I've asked my hubby to take me there again this weekend.  The only thing to be worried about when dining here is the meat sweats you'll get shortly after, but that definitely should not keep you away!

Reviews.Author: Jourdan S.
Reviews.Content: 10,000 X's better than it's sister location folklore (holler at my review). Tango sur's menu is almost a mirror image with the difference of being BYOB versus folklore's full bar.The obvious alcohol thing aside the food preparation here is far and away better than folklore. Again see my review of folklore. Everything that went wrong food wise there was righted to near perfection here at tango sur.As with folklore, the value is incredible.

Reviews.Author: Amanda C.
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this place and would love to go back.  Definitely try to make a reservation if you can as it does fill up. Luckily they took a reservation for 5 people when we went- if I had to wait hours for a table not sure I would have had the same opinion.The atmosphere is warm and inviting, and entirely lit by candles. The tables are close to one another but it didn't feel crowded. The table is given rolls and salads came with all of our dishes. We ordered a sampling of empanadas for an appetizer which were awesome and came with this amazing herb olive oil for dipping. My friend and I each ordered the flank steak and were surprised to see them come out as 2 inches thick which was weird.  It was still very good and came with Vesuvio potatoes. Other entrees included the steak breaded with ham and cheese and eggplant parmeson which were both great.  Because it was my friend's birthday they gave us a complimentary caramel flan dessert which was one of the best desserts I have ever had. The service is attentive and they're always asking if you need your wine opened, etc. BYOB is a nice feature and the meals are very reasonable for the quality.  I saw our waiter coming out of the women's bathroom which I thought was weird. Overall though great place.

Reviews.Author: RJ W.
Reviews.Content: I do not understand some of the other reviews. Maybe it is because some folks up here have not had a real Argentinian experience. Having moved back to Chicago after living a number of years in Miami, which is where the concept started in the states, this is a really poor example of the true Argentinian concept. They do it perfectly there. Just as I would not order a Chicago style deep dish pizza in Miami, I would really not suggest this place as a great example of this style of dining.I can share with you that, while the ambiance is nice, and the BYOB is not a bad thing, the quality of the meat was very very disappointing.  Please do not confuse just having meat on a skewer as that being a definitive Argentinian experience.Again, I understand the concept and ambiance are very good, but sorry, I have to respectfully disagree,. We found, on BOTH occasions we went, ( we were hoping the first time was an anomaly)  the quality of the meat was very poor.  I really suggest you look at some of the other views of the quality of the food, particularly the meat. Large portions do not equal quality, sorry

Reviews.Author: Corinne W.
Reviews.Content: Went there with my friends recently, tried the eggplant appetizer(on special) and the short ribs. FANTASTIC eggplant, and the best ribs I've had from a restaurant in my life  - warm bread, BYOB, it's fantastic! The desserts also looked great, but we were all too full to try any.  Absolutely fantastic!

Reviews.Author: Eddie L.
Reviews.Content: On weekends, the experience at Tango Sur is like a visit to the doctor.  It starts with an hour long wait and on your way home, you'll feel like you learned something about yourself...but unlike a visit to the doc, you get to drink wine.   On that note, bring plenty of wine because you won't find issues of Highlights in the waiting area.This being a steakhouse, you'll find meat preparation to be their obvious specialty.  Steaks for one should really mean two and a steak for two could mean six, but a meal of Tango Sur leftovers is just as good as the first.  Their salads are nothing more than a mere formality, but take a chance on their appetizers which range from extremely cheesy, to oily and garlic crazy.  The restaurant itself is cozy and charming with attentive waitstaff managing tables as a team.  Food is brought and taken away swiftly and you'll never find yourself with an empty wine or water glass.  Quarters may be close but that's just fine because you'll be too busy conquering your meal to eavesdrop on the diners next to you.Reservations are accepted for parties of 6 or more and there's a wine shop nearby should the need arise.

Reviews.Author: Carolyn S.
Reviews.Content: We showed up at 6pm on a Saturday night and we had an hour and a half wait. PERFECT! We wanted to get some beers beforehand anyway so we went up to Toons and waited until Tango called.When they called we came in and sat down right away. We started off with an appetizer of melted/fried cheese. MMMM, Cheese...... After that we ordered dinner and got HUGE portions. My friend got El Filet and- no joke- there were 2 huge chunks o' meat on her plate. The hubby and I got the Vaccio for 2 and are having it again for breakfast. YUM!The ambiance is a little crowded, but it was nice to eavesdrop on others' conversations. Go early, put your name in, and head to another bar for some drinks. YAY!

Reviews.Author: Dima M.
Reviews.Content: Hand down, one of my favorite steakhouse places of all time.First of all, anyone complaining about how small the place is needs to go to Denny's where you get all the space you want.  Everyone in the US is so obsessed with having their personal space everywhere.  If you want personal space, stay home!Now that my little anger is out of the way, let me tell you why I love this place.BYOB is usually a sushi place thing, but this is brilliant.  You're not stuck to only the drinks they have to offer.  Bring whatever the heck you want.  Not to mention how that keeps the meal price reasonable, as most restaurants mark up alcohol prices but at least 100%, if not more.Speaking of prices, this is one of the cheaper steakhouses you'll find, especially when compared to the quality of the meat.  Most of the meat, if not all of it, actually comes from Argentina.  It's very good quality meat, and it's prepared really well.  If you want to try different types of meats, go for the parillada.  Keep in mind though, the parillada for two, is enough for three or four people, especially if you get appetizers, which you should.The best of the appetizers has to be their empanadas.  All of them are delicious, but my favorite are the spinach and cheese empanadas.  Also, their spinach mashed potatoes are very good.This place is really good, so you will wait if you go there for dinner, especially on the weekend.  You can only get a reservation if you have a party of more than 6, otherwise, you'll wait.  If you go with the expectation and knowledge that the wait is an hour or two, then you'll have nothing to complain about.  There are a ton of places along Southport to chill at while you wait, and they will call you when your turn comes.  So you don't have to stand around and wait by the restaurant.Most of the time when we go there, we inadvertently start talking to someone at a table next to us, and they're always foreign, from a Spanish-speaking country, mostly South America.  To me, this says a lot about the place, where you always find "natives."The staff is super nice and friendly, and authentic.  There are plenty of servers, so you never have to wait around too long for them to pay attention to you.  Also, ladies, they're not too bad to look at for the most part.  Hey, I'm just saying :)

Reviews.Author: Anna B.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend might tell you differently, but I didn't love Tango Sur.  I didn't hate it, but I certainly didn't love it.We got there nice and early, so we easily got a table, but we had no idea it was BYOB (my fault for not Yelping beforehand!).  Thankfully, some lovely people who were sitting next to our table gave us half of a bottle of a lovely red that they didn't want to take home with them.  That's never happened to me before at a BYOB joint, and I loved it.  I'll definitely pay it forward someday, should I ever have leftover wine, which as an Italian American...not so sure if that'll ever happen.  The meat was....just ok.  The portions are huge and my boyfriend and I split....I can't remember the name right now.  It was a roulade-style steak, stuffed with diced shrooms and other veggies.  I didn't like the texture or the flavor of the stuffing, but that's a personal preference thing.  The meat itself was surprisingly tough for something that was also so juicy.  It came with roasted sweet potatoes which I could not stop eating, and I don't usually love sweet potatoes!  Very savory and delicious.I'd try Tango Sur again, but I'm definitely not letting my boyfriend order for the both of us again without me looking at the menu and I will DEFINITELY try the empanadas.  I feel like I did it all wrong by not bringing wine, ordering food that I don't like anyway, and not getting what they're known for, but I also feel like if I have to have that much inside knowledge to enjoy a restaurant, meh.  I wouldn't miss it.

Reviews.Author: Will T.
Reviews.Content: Tango sur is one of those great city restaurants someone has to tell you about.   They have no liquor license so BYOB with no corkage fee.  There is a great wine shop a block south and on  the opposite side of the street.Two of you can have an appetizer, dinner and desert and easily get out with a 60 dollar bill.   I would highly recommend the appetizer with cheese, herbs and red pepper.  Can't remember the name but you can figure it out.They have steaks, chicken and pasta.   Never tried any of the fish dishes.They do not take reservations for less than eight folks.  They will take your cell phone and call you when ready.   Nice Irish bar just south for a drink while you are waiting.Plan on 45 minutes on Friday and Saturday.Great spot

Reviews.Author: Heidy C.
Reviews.Content: I've been there over 5 times and every time its great. Its a BYOB place and they don't charge a fee which is amazing! I've had the lomo relleno a bunch of times and that is my go-to dish there really flavorful with mushrooms and a side of chimichurri sauce which is to die for. All there food there is overall amazing though i had the short ribs and those came out kinda bland. for apps I am prone to the empenadas though delic! The servers are attentive and nice some are more knowledgeable then others so if you have questions hope you get someone who is  knowledgeable. Expect a wait if you're going during prime time dining hours (6:30-8) but there are a few bars around the area that you can wait at and they'll even call you when the table is ready...a stupendous idea!

Reviews.Author: Terri N.
Reviews.Content: Make sure you call in a day or two beforehand and make reservations. Be prepared to wait at least 15-45 mins to be seated even if you are on time. BYOB.7 of us gals, three bottles of wine, a bottle of dragonberry, a case of beer was given to us by a patron of the restaurant equals a wonderful night filled with laughter and a table spread of excellent tasting food. My heart just melts for the El filet with spinach mashed potatoes. More like the steak literally melts in your mouth. It's tender and delicious. Their eggplant pasta is hands down the best tasting pasta I have ever had in Chicago.  How about their empanadas? Oooooohhh child, dip that spinach and cheese empanadas in that delicious sauce of theirs and you are in heaven!Love the experience, ambiance, food and service. Definitely not a kid friendly place in the evening. It's a great place to gather with friends/family. Romantic dinner?! As long as you are okay with the noise level. If your date is a bit of a talker this could be the deal breaker restaurant. The talking will be be swallowed up by the noise level in the restaurant. =)FYI: keep an eye on your tab because a server might overcharge you since you are all filled with alcohol by the end of the meal.

Reviews.Author: Halleh C.
Reviews.Content: Although this is the same as folklore, I absolutely prefer dining here.I still get the same thing every time, the filet with spinach mashed potatoes, it's just so good I can't stray! my boyfriend also loves the beef vesuvio every time. Call it predictable, but we say it's delicious.The great thing about tango sur is that it is byob, and when there is a  wait, they have a great waiting room with wine glasses to begin enjoying your wine.Something about this restaurant lends itself to the most intimate and amazing dates. Since my move to chicago a year and a half ago, this remains my favorite restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Chad V.
Reviews.Content: A MUST GO! Great food, exciting and obscure ambience , and attentive service.This is one of the only places I would actually order a steak (what would be the point in going if you didn't). However, I have had the poultry and the fish and it is just as good. The empanadas are buttery, flakey and delicious. And it's BYOB. I would give this place 5 stars, however the wait can be exhausting... bring someone you can talk to because you might be in line for a bit!

Reviews.Author: Rosa B.
Reviews.Content: It would be 5 stars if the wait wAsnt always so long just bc I'm so impatient but the long wait proves how good it is. Love this place its awesome that it is byob. I had a bday dinner here not long ago that we were able to reserve a table and the service is always great. The food is so great and if you're in the mood for a good steak come here. I lived in argentina for a few months and this place does a great job of incorporating the authentic argentine cuisine and culture

Reviews.Author: Josh J.
Reviews.Content: I really like this place.  True, the cuts are not that great, but the seasonings are excellent.  I would not suggest this place if you: don't like meat and/or spices, regularly dine at expensive steakhouses, or want to be treated special.  However, if you want a very tasty, large and meaty meal, it's great.Yes, there is a wait.  It's very good, and people like to go there.   But they take your name and number; just go wander down to a nearby bar.  No problem!And it's byob.  steak tastes much better with good wine, and I won't shell out for good wine if I have to pay 3x retail.

Reviews.Author: Michelle C.
Reviews.Content: One of the most romantic dinners I've had in a long time. I was concerned that there would be no way for this restaurant to live up to the hype, but fortunately I was not disappointed. The empanadas were flaky, moist, and generously portioned. There is something to be said for a fresh, crisp salad dressed with nothing more than oil and vinegar like the one at Tango Sur. My boyfriend and I split the parradilla for two with more leftovers than we could ever consume. And for a 45 dollar price tag, we still had plenty to catch a show and Improv Olympic. The ambiance on the sidewalk was spectacular, and I loved the candle lit exuberance inside. The entire experience was well worth the wait. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Author: Bryant H.
Reviews.Content: Pros: BYOB, No Corkage Fee, Reasonable prices, and...............thats about it.Cons: The service needed to step their game up just a little a bit. They tossed my steak out that I was going to take home with me and the manager told me " The next time you come in Ill take care of you. I will give you 10% off on your entire meal." So i thought about it and I said to myself " Lets see I paid about 38 dollars for the steak and I was taking about 3/4ths of the steak home.......mmmmm." All in all it just didn't add up. The steak was also bland with no type of seasoning but I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Author: Nettie K.
Reviews.Content: gave me an awful cut of steak and then tried blaming me for wanting it medium well. I explained that medium well doesn't account for tendons in a filet mignon, so he said it was my fault for not telling him when he never came by after the food came. they didn't offer anything as an apology for bad food (not even a recook).just awful...

Reviews.Author: Alaena H.
Reviews.Content: This review is solely for the arrogant owner who would not even attempt to accomodate my food allergies. I called to make a reservation and to see if I would be able to dine there with gluten, soy and sulfite allergies. He refused to tell me how they marinate their meat or simply confirm these ingredients are present or absent in the specific menu item I asked about. He said it's a SECRET. Bud, I don't need to know how many tablespoons of minced garlic you use. You turned away a viable new customer and the opportunity for other guests. Foo'.

Reviews.Author: Alex M.
Reviews.Content: Incredible!  This place is great!  Where else can you get 2, yes I said 2, filets for $20???  Tango Sur is always packed and if I remember correctly, they only take "larger parties" for reservations.  It is also BYOB which is fine by me.  You need to try this place!

Reviews.Author: Emily A.
Reviews.Content: Yes there was a wait - Yes it was small - BUT THE BEST ARGENTINIAN FOOD I HAVE EVER HAD!This BYOB was a wonderful night out for me and my husband. After reading several reviews we decided to get down to Southport before we were too hungry. We got on the list, gave the front doorman our cell number and went for a stroll through the neighborhood. An hour and half later the host called us gave us another ten minutes to get back to Tango and our table was ready. The food was wonderful and the atmosphere was perfect for a romantic evening together. The next time we go to Tango we are bringing four friends so we can get reservations. With the warmer weather around the corner, I can't to try the outdoor seating.

Reviews.Author: Hector R.
Reviews.Content: Jesus Christ. What a delight this restaurant is!First of all, it is located in a very beautiful neighborhood. Secondly, the patio is very appealing. Lastly, the food is rich and mouth-watering. Never have I had better-tasting potatoes anywhere else. The steak is very nicely cooked. I do have a suggestion: can you add waitresses instead of an all-male service?This restaurant is BYOB. It is compelling if you are looking for a mid-scale restaurant to take a date to or simply to treat your mother to delicious Argentine steak.

Reviews.Author: Michelle W.
Reviews.Content: Great dining experience. Amazing bang for the buck...we spent 46.00 and had enough for lunch the next day. It is a little bit loud, but not too bad and of course you can bring wine which is great (no corkage fee). It's a must! we are taking our friends there when they come to visit.

Reviews.Author: Pilan C.
Reviews.Content: I love BYOB places, because you usually get pretty good food for pretty good prices.  Tango Sur didn't disappoint.  I had a HUGE STEAK stuffed with cheese and spinach I believe (Bife Vesuvio) with these really good Argentinian-style potatoes (or at least that's what they claimed - whatever style they were, they were great), for about $20.  They also had really good empanadas, and I like the fact that you can order them individually (instead of having to get a whole plate of them).The wait was a bit long, but the good thing is that they take down your cell phone number and call you when your table is almost up, so you can go home or go to one of the nearby bars while you wait your table.  Also, since it's BYOB, they also have a back room where you can just uncork your wine and drink while you're waiting, although if we had been drinking for the entire hour and a half wait, we wouldn't have been sober enough to eat anything.This place would get five stars, except for the fact that my girlfriend's filet wasn't as good as filets at most places.  The quantity was great, but the quality on her steak was not as good.  Overall though, it was a great, fun dining experience that I'd recommend to everyone who likes meat (and I've heard great things about the vegetarian items too).

Reviews.Author: Nancy T.
Reviews.Content: I would have given this place 4 stars, but for the interminably long wait of well over an hour (they do not allow reservations which makes no sense to me) and the obnoxiously LOUD noise level. It was headache-inducing. Too bad because the Argentine food is delicious and it's a great concept. The staff is doing their best, but they can't do much about the fact that there are too many people who want to eat here and too few tables. If you do decide to eat here, expect to have to shout and I mean SHOUT to be heard. Not exactly a place to go for a romantic or relaxing evening out. Sadly, however good the food is, I would not go back due to the unpleasantness of the waits and the excessive noise levels.

Reviews.Author: Robyn F.
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned, the BYOB here is great!  Even with appetizers and sides, our bill was a nice surprise.  We also brought our own cake because it was someone's birthday, and they charged very little for that.  However, the food was extremely disappointing.Steaks: I tried the Lomo Relleno (half slab argentine filet, served on a grill, serves 2), Vacio (half slab of range grown flap meat, serves 2), and the El Filet.  The Lomo Relleno was extremely bland and wasn't grilled for long enough.  The meat was also really tough and not at all what I expected of an argentine filet.  The Vacio was slightly better, but not by much.  It was still bland, but at least it was slightly more grilled.  The El Filet, which does not come served on a grill, was better but still on the bland side.  In any case, if you are going to get steak, get the individual portions. Fish: I didn't get to try this, but two of our party got the fish.  Even though they were sitting right next to each other and got the same thing, the girl's fish was half the size of the guy's fish.  They comped us for something because of that, but it seemed a little odd that they were missing some fish. Appetizers and Sides: We tried the empanadas and the chorizo.  Both were pretty good and come with a sauce made of oil and maybe pesto(?).  We tried all the empanadas, and I would recommend the spinach and cheese ones.

Reviews.Author: Meridith H.
Reviews.Content: Our original plans for the evening didn't work out, so we were on the hunt for a place to eat.  I'd heard people rave about Tango Sur, and we were in the area, so it seemed like a perfect choice.We sat outside, ready to order wine.  Alas! It's a BYOB place.  We sadly agreed to stay sober and ordered our food.  Alas! My choice of entree was not available that evening. I chose another, the El Filet.Hungry, we dug in to the bread rolls.  The empanadas came, and we dug into those delicious pockets.  The pesto they served with the empanadas was also delicious.Soon after, we were served a plate of garnishes: bitter greens, large slices of tomatoes, and rings of fresh onion.  I thought that this was a prelude to the entree, that everyone got a place of fresh veggies to go with their meal.  But no...it was the pre-dinner salad.  The salad was fine (who can go wrong with fresh veggies), but the presentation was way off - since when do I have to cut up salad ingredients into bite size pieces?  Very odd.After the salad, I was full (my own fault, having eaten 2 bread rolls in addition to the empanadas) and cursing myself for having ordered a heavy meat entree.  I was sure that I'd have to ask them to wrap it up to go.A loooooooooooong time later, our entrees arrived, and the portions were huge!  Huge as in, had I not filled up on bread and empanadas, I would not have been able to fit it all into my stomach.  The meat was juicy & very good, and the spinach mashed potatoes were simply green colored garlic mashed potatoes (good, but spinach colored, not spinach flavored).  Overall, the food was good.  The empanadas were special.  The lack of alcohol was a bummer and the wait for the food (on a Tuesday night) was excessive.  I would recommend coming here for a quick & lighter meal (i.e. order the empanadas and nothing else) unless you want to spend your entire evening at dinner (and hey, sometimes that is exactly what you want to do).

Reviews.Author: Jess L.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is definitely one of those restaurant experiences that make me miss Chicago. (And eating meat!)I had a great, crowded time with three friends. I remember feeling cramped but not caring much because the food was all delicious. It has a dark interior, but its lively patrons brighten up the room.The prices are high, and the wait is long, but Tango Sur is worth at least one visit if you're in the mood for amazing meat.

Reviews.Author: Lauren F.
Reviews.Content: I can't even count how many times I've been here-as I said in my previous review, we always bring out of town guests here and they always ask to come back.  Their steaks are amazing-and massive.  We went with some friends this weekend and I ventured out and tried the Pork Chop.  Best. Pork Chop.  Ever.  Seriously, it is so easy to dry out a pork chop so I was worried but as soon as I cut into this beautiful piece of meat my worries were out the window.  Not only is the pork chop itself amazing, the sauce is ridiculous...RIDICULOUSLY AWESOME!!  This was the most delicious pork chop dish I've ever had, everyone in my group tried it as well and they all agreed-seriously, a must try!My recs:  Pork Chop, El Filet, Lomo Relleno, Bife Vesuvio

Reviews.Author: Kathy P.
Reviews.Content: To put it kindly, my father is  thrifty man. He was also raised on good old fashioned farm cookin', so he knows his food (jealous, locovores?).  When I decided to take my family here, I expected his usual "These prices are crazy!" and "Eh. I've had better." Wow. I have never seen the man enjoy a meal so much. And who could blame him? Tango Sur is the real deal with grass fed beef that will melt in your mouth and will NOT give you mad cow disease due to stricter testing standards in, um, every country in the world besides the US? The empanadas are delicious and are available filled with spinach, ham, or beef (of course!). Vegetarian options are also available in beef dreamland, with pasta, veggie, and fish dishes available for non-carnivores. Make sure you get the potatoes, whether they are spinach mashed or fried. Save some of your bread for dipping in the to-die-for aioli sauce that comes with the steaks.Portions are HUGE as most meals come with two fillets. I will never forget when my Dad turned to look at me with the joy of a 10-year-old boy with illegal fireworks and said "You mean...I get TWO?" Dad's pleasure was further enhanced by the fact that this place is a BYOB beauty. We even got up in the middle of dinner to go restock at the CVS down the street. That NEVER happens.Tango Sure has definitely become a family tradition. Also, contrary to popular belief, Tango Sur does offer reservations, but only for parties of 6 or more. If you DO have to wait, the staff will take your cell phone number so you can go hang out in one of the numerous bars on Southport. Since Argentines eat later than most Americans, you will have better luck with seating if you go earlier, around 6 or 7PM. Weekend afternoons are also pleasantly vacant. And trust me, you will encounter lots of Argentines. After this dinner of champions, my brothers and I took my parents for a drive down Sheridan Road to gawk at the houses, houses which I may be able to afford one day if I continue to indulge in Dad style/Tango Sur frugality. Maybe, if I'm lucky, one of the hot Tango Sur waiters will live there with me. Sigh....

Reviews.Author: Janna V.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Tango Sur a couple of times with my old co-workers.  Every year my boss and I would take our Captains (I worked for a catering company) out to dinner to thank them for their service.  They almost unanimously chose Tango Sur time after time.  First of all its BYO- but when the boss is payin' you want to make sure you are getting his money worth and we definitely did.  I actually wasnt a meat eater at the time but I often lost bets that meant I would have to try meat at these get togethers and I got to say it was always delicious.  We always had good service and had never had any problems with our party of 10-15 people on a friday night.  It also seems fairly romantic....

Reviews.Author: Lauren D.
Reviews.Content: es buuuueeennnoo.I took my boyfriend here for his 25th birthday and I cannot wait to go back!  It is a fantastic place to go on a romantic date or fun for a group of people.  The atmosphere is quaint and I love how it is small and cozy - kind of like a small Italian restaurant or something similar.  The vacio is incredible, and could probably be split amongst 4 people, and I loved the empanadas as an appetizer.  Bring your own wine... the bill was surprisingly cheap!!!

Reviews.Author: Natalie M.
Reviews.Content: Tango sur............I had a BLAST!!!!!!!!!!!!The food- WONDERFUL, huge juicy cuts of meat(says my friend Howie), tender salmon(says Ginger), flavorful pastas(says ME the resident vegetarian). Unlimited rolls of bread warm from the oven!!The service- FANTASTIC! Although the restaurant is as busy as possible, my water glass was always kept full and the plates were cleared ASAP(but it didn't feel like they were breathing down your neck). The restaurant is filled with attractive Latin waiters(yes I'm being shallow I know) who speak to you in a sexy accent!!Now the bad...........   Yes the candles are nice, however for some it would be hard to read their menu. In pictures the restaurant SEEMS like it would be uber romantic, but its so loud its hard getting a word in edge wise. Further more there is ONE bathroom per gender, which leaves a few women standing in line during peak times.All in all I thought the place was WONDERFUL and would definitely go back. I was sooooooo stuffed I didn't even have room to TRY a dessert(which looked DELICIOUS). If you wish to go during peak hours, be prepared to wait, ladies don't wear uncomfy shoes(as the waiting area is the side walk) or better yet, give them your name/cell number and go pick up your BYOB while you are waiting for your table.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie H.
Reviews.Content: Had no problem making reservations on the same day for 9 people.  Of course, I had to order the Para Dos again (asado, vacio, chorizo, molleja y morcilla con ensalada for two: grilled short ribs, flap meat sausage beef sweetbread and black sausage)...how could we not when it's only $27 for two people?  We also tried the "Jamon Crudo Con Palmito Y Salsa Golf Prosciutto served with hearts of palms accompanied with an argentine golf sauce" (just because I love prosciutto and hearts of palm).  And the chimichurri sauce is to die for.I still love it just as much as before...and even more so that we can get a big group together and share some wine without a long wait.

Reviews.Author: Julie T.
Reviews.Content: A must try when in Chi-Town!! We came in on a very cold Tuesday night and this place was still super busy. I hear they don't take reservations so first come first serve basis and you could wait up to 2 hours. Though I must comment that they keep the place pretty damn dark! I like to see what I'm eating. Aside from that the food is pretty good.We had 2 different types of steak on the table and both were amazing!!Empanadas were sooooooo freakin YUMMYBread must have had crack in it. It was that addictingI'm drooling just thinking about this place

Reviews.Author: andy b.
Reviews.Content: Very good steaks and romantic atmosphere. Small quaint place perfect for the summer and sitting outside bring your own etoh. Once you get over the charm you realize the food is just a little better than average. The price about 30$ per person.You will love it the first time you go here

Reviews.Author: Stacie K.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely adore this quaint, cozy restaurant.  It gets pretty hectic though because everyone wants in.  It can be a good hour and a half wait on a week night..so get there early.  It's dimly lit, with a candle...sometimes there's a live guitarist who plays romantic music...it's BYOB...servers are always totally swamped...so be prepared to go, sit down, relax, and have a nice meal.. (not the ideal place to go if you're in a rush with the wait to sit and the wait for service).. The food is amazing though!!  Never in my life have I ordered a filet and been so surprised at the portion given!!  It was awesomeWhile you are waiting to be sat, though, there's a room in the back with benches, wine glasses, and a corkscrew to help the time go by a little faster.

Reviews.Author: Corinne M.
Reviews.Content: The food at Tango Sur is soooo delicious. The salad was fresh and light, the rolls crispy and well flavored and the steak (Voci..sp?) for two is in my opinion, one of the best flavored in the city. The sauce that the steak comes in is really delicious and what makes it even better is the oil sauce to dip it in. I can see how people have claimed Tango Sur is overrated, b/c it does get a lot of Word of Mouth (setting the expectations high) and the wait is a around an hour (weekdays) to 2 hours (weekends). But the price of the steak and the quality and flavor of the food are really pretty fantastc.It's fun to BYO wine too.

Reviews.Author: Minna A.
Reviews.Content: Came here last night, did not have to wait for a table at all and received some of the best service I've had in a while!  The place is super small and we sat at one of the tiniest tables, but it fit the "romantic" setting perfectly!We brought two bottles of wine and was not bothered or rushed to move on as we finished both bottles.I let my dinner date choose what we were going to eat since it is one of their favorite restaurants so I don't know the names of the dishes but i'll describe what we ate below?We ordered:melon prosciutto appetizerand... a HEART ATTACK MEAT PLATTERhahahhaha the meat platter comes out on a grill with about six different cuts of meat on it.  Grilled and seasoned to perfection!  It was indeed tasty, but a bit too meat-astic for me.I was told that the desserts are also very delectable but did not have room for that in my stomach.  Definitely will be coming back to try more of their menu!PLUS the b.y.o.b. factor made our bill minuscule in comparison to our other dinners!

Reviews.Author: Eric M.
