Reviews.Content: As an omnivore, I thought steaks grew on trees until Kimberly L. set me straight.  Thankfully there are former vegetarians in the world to teach us all The Way of the Meat.  Also thankfully it isn't always the case that only ignorance is bliss, as even knowing these bits of muscle come from lovely cows who gave their life to be "meat-tastic," I was able to thoroughly enjoy my meal.All was going well until a fellow diner pointed out I had meat juice running down my chin like some sort of ravenous neanderthal devouring his former neighbor.  At that point I realized I had to actually be mindful of my table manners despite being made ravenous by the nearly hour-long wait for a table on a Wednesday night.The food is very good.  The wait is excessive but likely unavoidable for most people, although making reservations and going in a group of six or more seems to greatly reduce the chance of a long wait.  Once you're seated, the food does come at a reasonable pace.  Not speedy, but not super-slow.  It would be more romantic if it wasn't Friday-night-bar-noisy in the dining room.Overall, I am a fan.  The staff, the food and the general environment are all very nice.  The only two things they could improve in my mind are to replace forks like a fine dining restaurant would do instead of putting dirty forks onto the table and install some sort of sound-absorbing material to keep the noise level to conversation-capable levels.The wait time is more a function of their immense popularity than it is anything else.  All the other restaurants on Southport last Wednesday night were practically empty - none were over half full, while Tango Sur packed them in all night.  That alone should tell you the experience and food is worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Janet X.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur makes me glad to be an carnivore.I've come here twice now,  and both times have been fantastic.  If it's summer time, I would recommend getting there early and snagging a seat outside for some great people watching.  Winter time, this is a lovely place to take your significant other.  The restaurant is split into two parts connected by a small hallway, and is lit only by a soft chandelier and candles.  Add some bottles of wine (no corkage!) and soft music, and you've got yourself an oxymoron -- a romantic steakhouse.I highly recommend the chicken empanada and the Parrillada (do Para Dos if you can!).  The meat is always flavorful and well-cooked, and we always end up taking half of it home (and we can eat A LOT OF MEAT).  The only thing I would advise against the Ensalada Paesana because it contains, literally, three huge balls of mozzarella, a small handful of cooked spinach and a few slices of red peppers.  Uh... not exactly the plate of veggies I expected.Server was helpful and friendly but never hovered, and best of all, he never tried to push a particular dish or dessert.  This has got to be one of my favorite places in Lakeview!

Reviews.Author: Marissa b.
Reviews.Content: How have I not written a review for Tango Sur yet?? I've been here about a million times, and it's by far my favorite steak place. Sure I could say Morton's or Ruth Chris or some other renowned steak house in Chicago... but Tango Sur is different. First of all, it's BYOB, and secondly it's Argentinian (not to be confused with Brazilian). They don't take reservations for parties of 6 or less, but they will take your phone number and you can grab a drink down the street while you wait (yes, I have waited up to 2 hours for a table!) You just have to go early, like before 6, if you don't want to wait. I always get the same thing... the Vacio for 2, so I always end up having to convince one of my dining companions that there's nothing else on the menu I could possibly comprehend eating and they must share with me! I think I tried one other thing before and didn't love it, so I keep going back to the Vacio. It's filled with with olive oil, garlic, parsley sauce and served with sweet potatoes that soak up all the delicious juices, and their chimichurri sauce is to die. Their empanadas are also amazing, and can be purchased at the bodega next door any time. Now that I'm not living in Chicago anymore, it will be one of the places on my list every time I go back because nothing compares!

Reviews.Author: Veronica H.
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect date night spot! The room is dark and candle-lit. It's BYOB so you know it'll be affordable! They even have nice waiting rooms where you can drink your wine or beer at while you wait. My bf and I had the blood sausage, marinaded tongue, and steaks. All were tasty. We both like our meat medium rare and they were perfectly cooked. My spinach mashed potatoes were a little lacking in flavor, but all in all it was a nice evening.

Reviews.Author: mcquake j.
Reviews.Content: Yeah, blah blah Tango Sur blah blah "OMG!" blah blah, etc.They overcooked my medium rare ribeye--easy to demonstrate, as one of my dining companions ordered the exact same steak and hers was perfect. The side-by-side comparison shut the waiter up pretty quick, and sent him scurrying back to the kitchen.Whereupon about 15 minutes later he brought me a new steak... now UNDERcooked. Sorry guys, but you're supposed to know how to cook these things--that's the point, right?But apart from fucking up the primary reason for me being there, everything else was as others have described; nice atmosphere (albeit a little loud at times), no corkage fee for BYOB, delicious potatoes and exceptional empanadas. The side salad was a bit of a disappointment (soggy tomato slices on a bed of very uninspired lettuce), but the eggplant salad appetizer we ordered was simply phenomenal. It reignited my taste for eggplant, actually, and for that I applaud you, Tango Sur.Oh, and at 6:30pm on a Wednesday, we had no wait. So there's that.

Reviews.Author: Mike M.
Reviews.Content: yeah, this place is just flat out great...The service is always really accomodating, and the lighting is really romantic (really dark and barely lit by tapers at each table).BYOB, no corking fee. We always get the Vacio. It's a huge flap steak rolled and stuffed with fresh herbs and garlic, served for 2 and along side moist sweet potato wedges that taste like they've been basted in butter. There's always plenty to take home for dinner the next night. It's terrific, and a great place to take your partner or a great friend. note: if there's a long wait, walk down to Toons and have some drinks and they'll call you when your table is ready.  How's THAT?!

Reviews.Author: Ellen D.
Reviews.Content: I've eaten here multiple times and have LOVED every single experience.  First, it's BYOB which always makes things more interesting.  Second, it boasts extremely dim lighting and candles everywhere, which makes for a very romantic date spot.  Third, the steak is incredible (or so I think, as it could very easily be the wine talking at that point in the evening).  Fourth, it's fairly cheap - bringing your own booze always helps lessen the blow of a dinner bill, but this place is still pretty inexpensive in light of the quality of the food and the dining experience.  Although I can hardly stop raving about this place or telling everyone I know that they MUST go there, I do have one complaint: figure out how to take and honor reservations.  The last time I went was with a large group of people for my birthday.  We had made a reservation a week in advance (which took 5 different people to finally confirm that we had actually made one), and were still not sat until 45 minutes after our confirmed reservation time.Other than the staff's inability to figure out how reservations work, this place is amazing - my favorite restaurant in the city!

Reviews.Author: Shaakira J.
Reviews.Content: Hidden gem, for a sexy night! Priced just right- the food was so good! Wound up here one Tuesday night- skeptical of the BYOB and live music! This place is not stuffy or pretentious at all. The ambiance was so perfect- Steamy!I always pick where we go for dinner, but this time I decided to fall back and let my date pick...We did have a reservation, but still hd to wait 15 minutes o_O. The place as jam packed! To me that's a good sign of GOOD food! On the night I went it was raining outside, there was someone playing a Spanish guitar- playing amazing music- dinner was by candlelight...We sat right in the window- watching the rain fall, giggling from all the wine we injested and becoming hypnotized by the rifts escaping from the Spanish guitar. The food was so good! I had steak stuffed with cheese and spinach- with halves of sliced potato's... sooooooo good...Don't recall what my date had- we sampled some sort of tuna appetizer- the bread was too hard, but other than that it was good.There was a birthday dinner going on- there were seriously 20 or more people at this one long table on the side together- they were BEYOND loud, drunk, and obnoxious! I was having such a good time with my date- I didn't even mind! We started whooping it up with them too! I usually don't hit many $$ price point spots for dinner dates- but this place, that my date picked out was the exception! I had a ball- I'm def going back- hopefully on another rainy night! A relaxing dinner with, hearty comfort food! Winning!   2 steak dinners, one appetizer and 3 bottles of wine (BYOB): $70 plus tip...A good ole time! Go check it out :)

Reviews.Author: Michelina D.
Reviews.Content: Estaba muy rico!!!! Tango Sur has become one of my favorite restaurants since my then-boyfriend-now husband took me there for our 2nd date. My husband really knows what is good Argentinian food because he is from South America and enjoys good food!The empanadas are amazing and I love the fact that they serve a simple delicious salad before the main course. The CHURRASCO PARRILLA with chimi-churri is fantastic!  The waitstaff are courteous. The decor is pleasant with a very dated wall map of South America that my hubby always finds fascinating. The only down-fall is that it gets quite busy on Saturday nights with wait time for about 30-40 minutes. We prefer to go for lunch on Sundays when it is nice and quiet and we can talk. Definitely a great steak restaurant to check out! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Author: Mia P.
Reviews.Content: Came here for our Christmas party this year..There was over 25 of us and everything ran so smooth! Great ambiance, attentive servers, and delicious food. Everyone was raving about what they had. For a place known for their red meat, their salmon was a huge hit. I heard the terms, "to die for", "incredible", and a few others. Super huge portions, almost everyone had to wrap up their entrees. Overall, it was a really amazing experience and I'd like to thank them for being so accommodating for such a large group. I think everyone who went will be going back.  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: Katie D.
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, I love Tango Sur just for the fact that it is BYOB. There wasn't even a corkage fee which was amazing!The menu is in Spanish, so luckily I am proficient enough to somewhat know what everything was. The food ended up being amazing. We all split an appetizer of baked goat cheese in a tomato sauce, and the bread was delicious too. I ordered the filet mignon (medium rare) with spinach mashed potatoes as my dinner. The meat came perfectly cooked but instead of one filet, it actually came with two! So one entree of filet mignon is actually enough to feed two (which is amazing because I think the entree was $24, so split two ways is only like $12 which is unheard of for an amazing filet mignon). I would definitely try to go during the week because the wait can be ridiculously long the weekends (even if you have reservations). I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Laura H.
Reviews.Content: I feel that I owe it to Chicagoans to expose the true Tango Sur,  or Tango Sucks, as my friends and I like to call it.  The place continues to get good reviews, but I wonder...do these reviewers ignore the service because they are dazzled by the food?  I've been to Tango Sucks three times and on each visit, I was offended by the poor service.  On my last (and final) visit, the waiters completely ignored us and refused to accept a $50 gift certificate despite the fact that we had called earlier that day to make sure it was accepted.  They were terribly rude to us (and I've heard from others that this has happened to them) and I think it's a chauvinistic problem.  My service was still bad, but better, when I went with a guy.   With my girlfriend, we were invisible.  I honestly think the wait staff is sexist and for this, I will never, ever go back.  The food was good, but I was also very sick the next day... bye bye Tango Sucks.

Reviews.Author: Erin M.
Reviews.Content: My parents are from Michigan so I was hoping to surprise them with a BYOB and a cheaper bill!  They love their wine.  I forgot to make reservations so I called on Saturday hoping to get in that night and they said we might be able to get in around 8:30.Well we got in BEFORE 8:30 with a ton of people waiting.  We sat outside and were pleasantly surprised by the fast, attentive service (aka - how fast they opened the next wine bottle).And then came the food.  We had the melted prosciutto with red peppers, which was amazing.  And I can't speak for everyone, but my entree was great.  The beef vesuvio was stuffed with spinach and cheese and was tender and cooked to a perfect medium.  It was absolutely delicious.Definitely will be back.

Reviews.Author: Amy K.
Reviews.Content: We were told that if we arrived before 5:30, we would not have a problem obtaining a table for 6 within a short wait. Well unfortunately that was not the case, and we were quoted a 2 1/2 hour wait. We decided to stick it out and headed to Cullens for a drink and appetizers. After 2.5 hours, someone in our party checked back and we were told that our table was "ready." What this really meant was waiting 30 minutes more in their waiting area while starting on our wine. So, after 3 hours of waiting, we finally sat down (minus one star). Food was very delicious of course. Loved the ham and cheese empanada and el filet. If you share, they charge $5 split plate charge, but definitely worth it because portions are huge.

Reviews.Author: Todd R.
Reviews.Content: HOLD THE PHONE BATMAN. riddle me this - if you're a slick chicagoan lookin' to get in the pants of some naive hotty from podunk, iowa, this is your place. the filet is bloody, you can bring your own wine, they have records on the wall. but after months of serious introspection coupled with a healthy diet of couch sitting and food network television shows, the intelligentsia (me) have started to discover flaws in tango sur's business model. we had planned on going to the eric copeland show at schubas. however, as a result of THC-induced signifcant short-term memory loss, i forgot to get the tickets and it sold out.  there was barely anybody in there, and still the doorman wouldnt let us in just to check out eric copeland. f'ing lincoln park man. hey eric - PLAY AT ENEMY SOUND NEXT TIME. you're from new york, we know you'd dig it.  so anyway, we said "hey, we're in lincoln park, we might as well get some good food if we're down here. there is that nice little steakhouse place just north of schubas.  its very romantic inside, and you get huge cuts of meat."BULL-HORN NOISE. server's taking too long because they're smoking cigarettes and having sex in the alley. a confusing menu. prosciutto with artichoke hearts and thousand island dressing? nice try, but i havent smoked THAT much weed.  so we're thinking "ok, the beef will make up for these flaws."  the strip was inconsitently cooked. and you know what? cooking steak with cheese and spinach stuffed inside doesn't work. the spinach ends up tasting all gross with the fat of the cheese.  the filet was well cooked, but not well-seasoned. sorry tango, but i agree with zackharian on this one. give me some salt.  40 minutes later we get the slice of chocolate cake. not fresh. kinda sloppy. sorry tango, but i'd rather waltz right out of your restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Bridget I.
Reviews.Content: I think this is my favorite restaurant in Chicago. It's one of the best values on the north side - beautiful setting (candlelit and bustling), good food and BYOB (no corkage fee).  It's no Morton's or David Burke's, but you can bring a decent bottle of wine and have an elegant meal for under $30 per person.  You get a basic salad and bread with your entree, and though the appetizers are good, you can skip that and save room for your enormous plate of meat and potatoes.  I order El Filet almost every time I go - you get 2 fillets mignons for $24.  I bring the 2nd home and eat it for breakfast.Great for groups - I think they take reservations for parties of 8 or more, just make sure you're all there on time.  It gets incredibly busy on weekend nights - put your name in and wait an hour.  Luckily there are a lot of bars and cafes on Southport.  This is the perfect place for a date - impressive but not stuffy.  Not great for vegetarians, they offer a couple pasta plates, but it's a carnivore's paradise, I think a vegetarian might be a little grossed out.They have a patio but I prefer to sit inside - I just love a dark and loud restaurant!  The staff is great, too.  Young Argentine men... one night we sat on the patio (in front on sidewalk) and after the place closed the 2 musicians that sometimes play inside sat with us and we had a great time.I wish they would sell the t-shirts that the staff wears!  I tried to buy one a few years ago and they weren't for sale.

Reviews.Author: Jillian H.
Reviews.Content: Overrated. I heard so many great thing about this place. Ambiance is nice. Meat is low quality except for the filet. Language barrier is used against you. First three times you go are good. After that, youre pushing your luck. Bravo tango dude. You suckered me out of about two hundo, but due to your non English speaking waiter who made me order a salad I didn't eat or even want and then refused to do anything about it, I would rather make my own mouth watering steaks from here on out. My marinade is better anyway.+BYOB- It's like pulling teeth to try to get a bucket of ice for your beer or wine.+ Filet size- Almost every other thing about this place.Get it together southport. Quit hiring fucking morons who can't do their jobs.

Reviews.Author: Ashley G.
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful.My boyfriend took me here after I begged him to. We had the empanadas, cheese appetizer and split a filet. That was plenty for us.We plan on taking our friends in the next few weeks!And we will definately bring a bottle of wine next time!

Reviews.Author: Steve L.
Reviews.Content: Decent meat, decent value, nice atmosphere. So a lot of people here say the meat is GREAAATTT.  It Isn't.  It's a good value though, you can't really get two 8ish oz filets for 20 bucks.  The question is the quality and how it tastes.  It is definitely not the best steak I've had, it doesn't even compare to Mastro's or other casual dining restaurants for that matter...  The spinach mashed potatoes were decent though.We also got appetizers, the empanadas were quite tasty.  We went on a Wednesday evening and got there around 6, and there was plenty of space with no wait.  The atmosphere was definitely chill though, dim lighting with candles, not overly loud either.I'm not sure if I would go there again though.  It's a nice restaurant to get together with friends, but the food just isn't that GREAT.

Reviews.Author: Chris B.
Reviews.Content: All-in-all a fantastic place (but always a wait which sucks!). I love BYOB, it saves so much money. But the steams are phenomenal. I did notice someone mentioning they are a little greasy, but that is what makes then taste so good. I love the salad they give at the start of the meal, it's so simple just lettuce onion and some balsamic vinegar and olive oil on the side, but it's really good.I love the atmosphere, although dark and giving an allusion of a romantic place, it's also really great for parties or even just a couple friends. But try to go early or on a weeknight because they wait is crazy long sometimes. In the summer the advantage is there space almost doubles with outdoor seating.

Reviews.Author: Lover Of Food And Culture Z.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went her last weekend for our anniversary. We got there at 5:45 and waited for an hour to be seated as they only seat/take reservations for large parties! Urgh...I was starving and we were supposed to so to a show and we could not do that. So get there early.The food came pretty fast though. It's great to BYOB as you can bring your fav beverage. We tried the empanadas and they were delicious! Also loved the meat and cheese tray. It had really great tasting ham and prosciutto and cheese. For our entree my husband had the stuffed beef and he loved it. I had the filet Mignon for $24! with veggies and they were two big steaks and I could only eat half of one and I brought the other one home. It's def a lot of food for the money and the steaks were SO delicious and they just melt in your mouth.The ambiance? uhm..it's very dark and really loud and they should not play music in there as it's too much! Next time I go there I think I'll get there when they open at 5:30.

Reviews.Author: Bri A.
Reviews.Content: Oh Tango Sur, how your meaty smells taunt my hungry belly every day as I walk home from work!I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet. This is one of my favorite BYOB places in the city. The food is amazing and affordable. The menu has plenty of non-beef options for those who aren't into that. I've had chicken, eggplant and fish dishes that were delicious. Definitely get the hearts of palm wrapped in prosciutto or the provoleta for an appetizer! I've seen insane amounts of people waiting during the weekend, so go during the week or before the dinner rush. There are plenty of places nearby to pick up a bottle of wine, too.The only drawbacks are not being able to make reservations, spotty service and cramped tables....but that doesn't stop me from coming back to feast on a plate of melted cheese!

Reviews.Author: Toni D.
Reviews.Content: Argentinean  and BYOB - I found out about this place on the show "Check please!"  It was highly recommened so I had to check it out.  I ordered steak and OMG they give you large portions.  The menu is moderately priced for a steak place. It's small but great atmosphere especially if you can sit outside.  Advice - call ahead and ask how crowded they are.  I don't think they accept reservations but at least you know ahead of time how long the wait will be.

Reviews.Author: Parisa S.
Reviews.Content: YUMMM YUMMM YUMMM YUMMM YUMMMI can't say it enough.  Yummy yummy yummy food here!  I absolutely adore Tango Sur.  The meat is fantastic, the vibe is awesome, the prices are dirt cheap, and best of all - BYOB.  Seriously, I freaking love it here.  I don't love the ridiculous wait for a table, but even I (Miss I Don't Do Lines and I Don't Wait) can understand the wait for this place.  Yes, there's even a wait if you've made a rez.I just wish it wasn't so far from River North.  We all know I get nervous leaving my 6-block radius.

Reviews.Author: Nishan P.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is a meat lover's paradise.  The Parillada, a table-top mixed grill stocked with short ribs, chorizo, blood sausage and sweetbreads, will leave you reeling in its decadence.  The portion size is huge with enough meat for multiple meals.The wait at this restaurant can be very long.  My favorite ways to pass the time are: 1) savoring a delicious cup of coffee at Julius Meinl a couple of blocks away.2) enjoying my favorite wine while making friends in the cozy waiting room.  Tango Sur is BYOB and the shared long wait seems to build a sense of camaraderie.This Argentinean restaurant is worth visiting for its well prepared meat at a reasonable price.  If you don't mind the long wait, Tango Sur is sure to please.

Reviews.Author: Christine S.
Reviews.Content: I went back to Tango Sur last night, still FAB! Had to wait an hour and fifteen minutes, but in the end the wait is always worth it. I love their steaks... Had El Filet and spinach mashed potatoes again, bruchetta, and some provolone cheese appetizer, simply amazing...  Had the peaches and cream dessert which isn't exactly up my alley but it was still good. The flan is amazing, BTW. The servers are great and on top of everything. Lots of drinks flowing, great company, and an amazing meal made for wonderful night!

Reviews.Author: Teri Y.
Reviews.Content: What's more to say when this place is reaching 300 reviews?1. Excellent steaks. They come a little underdone so if you usually get rare, go for medium rare. Again, excellent steaks.2. Make a reservation. Prepare to wait.3. Sweetbread.

Reviews.Author: Winston G.
Reviews.Content: Argentinian steakhouse serving up various cuts of beef, all of which come with some of the BEST chimichurri sauce I've ever had - I mean, I would come back here again just for the chimichurri sauce.  I'm confident you can order whatever you'd like here in terms of beef and it would be decent - I ended up going for their flank steak, which seemed to be broiled in sauce rather than just grilled - going to try and get the grilled steak next time.I liked how they had Inca cola and usually Guarana (Brazillian soda - they were out this time).  I did not like their plate sharing fee - everyone needs to order an entree or they tack an extra $5 per person to share dishes.  A group of us came at 4:00pm and just wanted to try out some meat - not eat a full meal, so that was frustrating.All in all, solid meal, and a great place to get meat.

Reviews.Author: Ted C.
Reviews.Content: A large group of us came here for a birthday party. Fortuntaely, Tango Sur now takes reservations and it felt pretty BA that we just got to walk through when the couple ahead of us were held back. We ordered a bunch of appetizers since all of us can't seem to stay on schedule. We started with the prosciutto and melon, which would probably be best for no more than 4 people-not that the serving was small, quite the opposite, it's just with more than that number it's a pain to pass it around. The empandas were tasty with the chicken empanada in particular. We also split the eggplant which-was different from what I expected, served cold but still tasty-not crisp but with a little bite to it. Delicious. The chimichuri is simply AMAZING.The birthday guy and I decided to split the Vacio-because that was the only dish that came with sweet potatoes and he was the one I managed to get to split with me. Keep in mind there are a couple of dishes named Vacio-it not being the only one with multiple dishes under the same name. Our Vacio came on a grill which dominated our table and was got it rare-which it was and it was oh so good-the olive oil marinade really made the meat and the sweet potatoes stand out.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie L.
Reviews.Content: I have turned into a meatatarian....from a vegetarian....dont ask how it happened, but I love meat now.We went here with a party of 14....very large party...Tango Sur accommodated us well.  We were loud, obnoxious, inattentive to the servers and they were pretty good about keeping on top of us.  I had some chicken....I dont remember what it was because I was a couple of bottles in (BONUS to BYOB!!).  It was great...with some veggies and of course, more wine.The bill was so freaking cheap too...I think I paid like $20 for a huge meal, booze, a bite of dessert (it wasnt good, dont waste your time), tax and tip.FANTASTIC!

Reviews.Author: Kris L.
Reviews.Content: Love love love this place. Classic Argentine flavors + BYOB + outdoor seating in the summer cannot be beat.Went with a party of 4 on a Monday night. Sat outside, kicked off with some wine and empanadas (my fav were the chicken ones). We also (stupidly) got the Para Uno app to split among the 4 of us and an entree each. Not sure what we were thinking as these portions are out of control. The Para Uno could easily have been eaten by 2 people. Anything with chimichurri is the way to go.

Reviews.Author: Grace N.
Reviews.Content: Sigh....the irony is that the more you love a restaurant, the more loveable it is, and then it becomes annoyingly crowded, which makes you love it less.  Hence, the 4 (and not 5 stars).I took my meat-loving husband here for his birthday, and we got here early to avoid the wait.  However, the longer we stayed, the less personal space we had.  This did not detract horribly from the awesome and huge slabs of flavorful, perfectly cooked meat that graced our plates.   Just stick your elbows out, turn your utensils in, forego the dinner conversation, and get to it!

Reviews.Author: Kristen D.
Reviews.Content: Consistent with most other reviews, this place is romantic, delicious, and awesome. BYOB, completely candle-lit, and always busy. We came here on a double date with my roommate and her bf. They put their names in around 5PM and by about 6:45 they were ready for us. They took our phone number so that we would  be called when ready, so it was easy to walk down the street to another bar and grab some drinks beforehand. Seating is a bit tight, but it kind of adds to the experience of Tango Sur. We ordered the chicken empanadas and melon with prociutto as appetizers. The empanadas were absolutely the way to go!I ordered the bife vesuvio (prime steak filled with spinach, cheese, and garlic) and was not able to finish the whole thing. A couple of tough spots in the meat, but delicious nonetheless. When I reheated the food the next day, it was almost better than it was when it was fresh! Not sure how that works out...The spinach mashed potatoes were to die for. They come out looking like bright green mashed potatoes, but taste SO GOOD. By the end of the night, our table was filled with bottles of wine, tons of meat, bread...it was a very indulgent night, for sure. NOTE: you get two filets when you order the filet. There is certainly enough food for 2 on that entree! I will most certainly be back here and can't wait for that time to come!

Reviews.Author: Heather L.
Reviews.Content: What a great find. Well-stocked wine shop only a block down and BYOB -  it's bound to be a merry matrimony. The price, like everyone said, is unbelievable. Despite being BYOB and affordable, Tango Sur still manages to keep it classy with a moody ambiance.The meat itself can be a little on the saltier and greasier side. However, when has that ever stopped you from enjoying your food, O Hypertensive America? For a change, I highly recommend the Berenjena.

Reviews.Author: Lois C.
Reviews.Content: We tried all the empanadas but my favorite was the ham and cheese, a bit small but it was a nice little appetizer before their huge portioned entree. I can't remember exactly what entree I had but I can say that my whole party of 6 were satisfied with their meal and nobody had any complaints. A huge plus is that they are a BYOB establishment (always a plus!). Their flan desert and waffle cake were absolutely delicious and were devoured in minutes.

Reviews.Author: Kristin S.
Reviews.Content: Went on date with husband last weekend to Tango Sur and I cannot stop thinking about how delicious our dinner was!We started by sampling the empanadas. We had the spinach/cheese, beef, and chicken. The spinach/cheese and beef are amazing, the chicken I could live without. My husband and I split the El Filet (two 7oz fillets served with spinach mashed potatoes). There was plenty of food for us both to share, we both left stuffed!Tango Sur has the best chimichurri sauce...there wasn't a drop left on my plate.I can't wait to go back again. Great plate to take out-of-towners.

Reviews.Author: David L.
Reviews.Content: I'll be brief.  I've been here twice.  Once for a bachelor party.  And the second time with a small group of friends.  First time was great.  We were all drunk so it would not have mattered if the food was terrible.  No cork fee so we brought our own wine which was great.  Lots and lots of cheap bottles of wine.  But the second time was when I was sober.  And boy was I wrong the first time.  First, it was too dark to see anything let alone distinguish what you're eating.  The hot plate meat dish we had was simply a pile of meat and I couldn't tell if I was eating cow's testicles for all I knew.  Whatever they call "Sweet Bread," do not try it.  It's tastless, I felt like chewing on a chunk of fat and I had to spit it out.  I would advise against going here.Update:  I found out that sweetbreads are the name of a dish made of the thymus gland or pancreas of a young animal, usually a lamb or calf.  It was a new experience for me but had they EXPLAINED what it was I would not have gotten it.

Reviews.Author: mike l.
Reviews.Content: Yes, there was a 2 hr wait. But, that actually worked out well since we were able to hit a few bars & spend some time taking it easy & decompressing. we all had meat & everything was delicious. after reading some of the reviews, we were a little worried, but Tango Sur did not dissappoint.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer K.
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this Argentinian steakhouse?  Well, the place is very relaxed, where tables are crowded together, and people are damn near shouting and laughing all the time.  It's also BYOB, which is frickin' fantastic.Well, our table was tucked away in a corner, so we had a bit more privacy than other tables nearer the center of the room.  Wineglasses were filled with reds, perfectly complementing the meal.  I had the El Filet, in which reduced onion red wine sauce was poured over tender filets and accompanied by spinach mash potatoes.  The price isn't that bad either.The entire atmosphere is pretty fun and relaxed, so it's a great place for friends to come over for dinners, especially if there's plentiful drinks!

Reviews.Author: Andrew B.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur deserves some balanced reviews. Let's start with why you go. As a steak lover, you cannot beat their prices for a tasty piece of beef. Not all the cuts are good every night. I would recommend asking your server which cuts are the best that evening. Although the steaks are not exceptional, they are quite good on average and at least $20 cheaper than a steakhouse. Also, the chimmichurra is delicious and, in my personal opinion, a much better compliment to good steak than a soupy-sweet tomato based steak sauce. Now there are some things they should do better. The bread and dinner salad are stunningly boring. Like something you'd get at a diner along the highway in Oklahoma. The cooking can be inconsistent, particularly when they are busy. The service is inattentive.I give Tango Sur four stars because I love steak and appreciate the low prices. I don't go there for the uninspired dinner salad or crappy dinner rolls, so I don't let them get to me. That being said, if you don't love steak, you probably won't be quite as enthusiastic.

Reviews.Author: Cindy D.
Reviews.Content: Went here last night on a double date.  So we shared empanadas (spinach and cheese) and cheesy eggplant (it's on the chef's special).  I thought hte empanadas were delish, however, not sure if I liked the sauce that came with it.  The cheezy eggplant would have been good it it weren't so salty.  Kinda disappointing, because it looked delish and it was a good portion for four people.  Then we all had seperate entrees. I had the el filet, which was also disappointing.  Normally filets are tender and succulent, this was polar opposite.  It was chewy (even when medium rare) and grainy.  The portions are huge as I had two portions of meat.  However, I would have rather had one small delicious portion, than two mediocre, huge portions.  My bf got the T-bone.  That was delicious and flavorful.  Try that, if you are going to go here.  The fat content is higher, but it's def. worth the cholesterol.Then the other couple got one of the specials.  I think it was the el relleno.  It was a dish that is big enough for two people.  Once again, meat was tough and chewy.  It was a HUGE portion, but quality is always better than quantity people!Finally, the ambience was basically darkness with tapered candles.  It was hot and muggy, so I think if the lights were on it would just add on to the heat.  Not the most comfortable dining experience, I've had.  Overall, it was ok.  Not great by any means, but it's not going to break the bank either.  $120 for four people is a reasonable price for steak.  I just don't think I would come here again though.

Reviews.Author: Robert F.
Reviews.Content: All the praise you've heard about Tango Sur is true.  Make reservations.  I say again:  MAKE RESERVATIONS.  By 7pm this place has a line up out the door.  What are they lining up for?My guess is the meat.  Being an Argentine steakhouse, Tango Sur has an impressive variety of meats done just differently enough to make steak taste like some magical new food from the Gods.  Benevolent Gods.  Because Tagno Sur doesn't mess around with quantity.  Don't bat an eyelash at the price, you can easily take half your plate home and have an extra full meal out of it.And speaking of price, you can look forward to slightly less damage on the bill due to the no-corkage BYOB factor.  Burgeoning wine snobs are free to make their own selections without the ridiculous markup.... and if you're looking for a dirt cheap but exciting new appetizer, try the empanada.

Reviews.Author: Shannon S.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Tango Sur a couple of times now. I have to say, I am not as impressed with this place as much as some of my other friends are. This last time we went, we found out that they now take reservations. However, we got there and they claimed that they did not have us written down. The worst part about it was, instead of then writing our name down on the list, he forgot, and then was seating people who came in after us before he sat us.The entrees I will say are pretty large in size, I was definitely able to take home some leftovers. The food was pretty good for the price. Another good thing about this place is that it is byob. I will maybe go back if others want to go but it wouldn't be my first choice. There are much better places to go.

Reviews.Author: Emily S.
Reviews.Content: We received a gift card, so we did go back, despite my earlier vow not to do so.I am still just MEH on Tango Sur.  I just don't get waiting for nearly 2 hours for a mediocre steak.  The service is good, and BYO is nice, but I just can't get amped about the food...or waiting that long to eat it.

Reviews.Author: Alison M.
Reviews.Content: Cozy, romantic, great steaks and empanadas...and to top it off, BYOB! It would be 5 stars in my book, but I just can't get around the wait. I had a 90 min wait at 6:30 on a Saturday night for 2 people. They said they would call when my table opened up but never did. And when we went back 90 min later, they seated us immediately but didn't make any reference to why they hadn't called.I've gotten around the long wait by going with a large group (they took a reservation for that), but we were SO crammed at our table that it was a bit ridiculous, really.If you can put up with a wait, the food is excellent and reasonably priced. And did I mention it was BYOB?!

Reviews.Author: Linda T.
Reviews.Content: Food is great. Big enough portions to share!The layout of the restaurant is really bad. I had to climb over people just to get out.

Reviews.Author: Matthew S.
Reviews.Content: Sorry to say, but didn't live up to the hype. The BYOB on the front porch was nice, but we were huddled for over 90 minutes after having reservations. If you want to go for the food, shoot for an early dinner (or, bundle up in the winter). The steaks were also good, but not great... the saving grace was a fairly-priced menu for what you get. Nice, dark and cozy atmosphere, but also usually packed shoulder to shoulder while seated. Hopefully you'll like your neighbors :)Perhaps the best advice is that around the corner, the owner runs a butcher shop that has some excellent cuts at great prices. And they're very helpful in making suggestions as well.

Reviews.Author: Ji-In L.
Reviews.Content: Great date place.  I'm pretty sure I fell in love in this place.  And with it!  Steaks are so so good.  And reasonably priced!  I'd take an out-of-towner here over some of the more famous steakhouses downtown any day.  Be prepared to wait.  I mean a long time.  I usually factor in at least a 2 hour wait.  Browse through all the great wines at Que Syrah down the street (toward Addison) and pick up one (or two) for dinner (BYOB).  There are plenty of great wines for $10-15 and they know a lot of people pick up wines for dinner at Tango, so they have a bunch that go well with the food.  Then I'd grab just one appetizer and a couple beers nearby Tango at Take Five (everything on the menu is $5... but don't over order / overeat because you want to save your appetite for Tango!).  Order the vacio.  It's huge and meant for two.  (Bring some breath mints because it's garlicky).  I love love love this place.  YOU MUST GO.

Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: Pretty good restaurant.  Not the best steaks in the city, but still pretty darn good and nicely marinaded.Sunday night is a good time to avoid the crowd.BYOB is yes and the wine shop next door is double yes.

Reviews.Author: Rajiv H.
Reviews.Content: I don't get it. I've been twice now, and was severely underwhelmed both times. The idea is great: an affordable BYOB Argentinian Steakhouse. The problem: the steak ain't that great.The first problem is that the wait on weekends is off the charts. We got there around 9pm on a Saturday night and were told the wait was an hour and forty five minutes. The interior and the patio especially are cool, so I do like the overall feel of the place.The last time we went my wife and I shared the El Filet (for two). The presentation was great and my mouth was watering before diving in. The love affair ended there. I've never had a tougher filet mignon. Heck, I've barely had steak that was this tough before. My wife gave up on it at some point because it was literally so much work to chew.I hate that I don't like this place because I love steak more than any other food on this planet, but it's just not very good.

Reviews.Author: April A.
Reviews.Content: If there's any advice I can give about this place, it's just this: do not come here. My party of 13 had a reservation for 8:30, and we didn't sit down until 9:45. During that time, they kept telling us that they either didn't know when the table will be available (but isn't having a reservation GUARANTEEING availability?!), or it'll be "just 5 more minutes." Meanwhile, we had to stand out on the sidewalk around a heap of drunk people who were stumbling in the street.The music is so loud and obnoxious you can't hear yourself think. The place is lit almost entirely by candlelight (there are a few VERY dim chandeliers that hang from the ceiling..very high up, mainly for decoration) - it's just stupid. You can't see the menu, you can't see the food. I had to hold up the candle while people got the food from the plate because it's so dark in there. It's also terribly cramped. And there's only one bathroom, so there was always a line.Our party ordered a few steak plates for two. Most of it was bone, and inedible. Definitely not worth the price.I ordered a chicken empanada on the side and it was ok at best.I'd say the best part of the meal was the bread. It was warm and soft (at least on the inside). They also served it with a plate of cheese to go with the bread so it tasted like pizza.So in the end, I regretted the night entirely. Do not go here if you want to see and hear and actually enjoy a well-portioned meal.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany P.
Reviews.Content: This place is always a sure bet!  I suggest going straight for the $15 steak (sauteed potatoes, bread, and house salad included).  They offer up a cup of dipping jus' of butter, oil, and seasoning that will make your toes curl.  The atmosphere is intimate and the waiters are hot, hot, hot.  Sometimes if you flirt hard enough you a free desert.  The BYOB factor with no corking fee makes it an easy choice and keeps the price for an AMAZING dinner relatively low.  The wait is more than worth it...even at 10 pm.

Reviews.Author: andrea m.
Reviews.Content: The portions are huge, the food is wonderful and the setting is very cozy. The empanadas were fantastic, as was my filet mignon (they give you TWO servings of it, omg). The service was great as well. They are very attentive.I am a bit confused as to why I'm reading on here that it is better for groups rather than dates. Every time I have been here it has been very romantic, dimly lit with candles on the tables. The space itself is very intimate. There were more couples than groups of friends when I went as well. To me, this is not where I would go with a group of friends.I am counting down the days until I can go back to this place. I only wish I knew it was BYOB before I had gone the first time. It kinda sucked not having any wine to sip on.

Reviews.Author: Melanie M.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur has some amazing dishes on their menu, I really enjoyed the food.  Portions are enormous for the price.  Ambiance is nice inside, though we went on a Friday night and it was rather crowded and noisy inside.  We brought our own bottle of wine which was a great way to save some money as well (and no corkage fee!).The one big downside to this restaurant was the service.  Our waiter was not at all friendly or attentive, and never bothered to explain much of the menu to us.  He was frequently gone, and after we finished our entrees merely asked "Anything else?".  We had to ask him to see a dessert menu.  He also never refilled our wine glasses.  I would still definitely recommend it, though it may be better for a weekday night!Also, they don't take reservations for less than 6 so keep that in mind!

Reviews.Author: Virginia T.
Reviews.Content: BYOB with no corkage fee AND the best steak I've ever had. My husband and I chose to dine here for our 5th anniversary...we brought a few bottles of red, had an appetizer (the provolone with red peppers) and two amazing steaks that were more than we can finish for around $50 with tip! The service left a little to be desired...we had to wait a very long time for our check, but that is really my only complaint. I agree with the other reviewers that the decor is romantic, and we appreciated a great meal by candlelight. We made a reservation, and therefore had no wait at all. I'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Author: Art C.
Reviews.Content: There are too many good things to write about this place. First, its cheap for what you get.  A gigantic plate with two filets and spinach mashed potatoes ran me 24 bucks.  Second, its BYOB with a bevy of decent wine shops nearby.  Third, we had the empanadas and the antipasto appetizers and both were amazing.The only downside for this place is the tight quarters and the wait time, but I think it adds to the experience (re: hot doug's). Its really dark inside, but the decor is perfect for a nice date night.

Reviews.Author: Maura S.
Reviews.Content: I finally made it to Tango Sur and am happy to report that it lived up to the hype.  We went early on a Thursday night and did not have to wait for a table at all.  The atmosphere was cozy (although I could see how it could get crowded/noisy later in the night).  Prices were good, and the fact that it was BYOB definitely kept the cost down.I had the Berenjena, an eggplant parmesan dish, and it was DELICIOUS.

Reviews.Author: Naveed R.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE Tango Sur! I was here for a LARGE party- only about 19 or so of us got together to celebrate my cousins engagement. BYOB definitely helps for large groups and I dont believe there is a corkage fee. The staff was quick and on top of it without any errors- impressive if you consider a party of our size. The food was unreal- I had the filet- it was enough food to feed a small village, and the steak was among the best I have ever had. We also ordered the empanadas- very good, and the melted argentinian cheese, which was topped with roasted red peppers- it was amazing. I was pleasantly surprised with this place. Prices were excellent, ambiance and decor of this place would imply that it was much pricier than it is. Great place to go out to a nice dinner. FYI- we had reservations for 9pm, and didnt get seated until 930 or so.

Reviews.Author: Eliza Z.
Reviews.Content: I don't often have steak cravings, but when I do, Tango Sur is the top of my list for a restaurant to go to.I've been here twice now, both times on a Friday night. While the wait can be long (the last time they said 45 minutes) they have a waiting room in the back with tables where you can open up the bottles of wine/beer/liquor you brought, which makes the waiting time seem much much less.Both times our table ordered some empanadas to share. They're pretty good, I wouldn't order them myself (probably try something a little more interesting, there are some delicious sounding other appetizers) but in general everyone loves an emapanada. My favorite so far has been their spinach and cheese.I have tried two of the entrees: one of the "for two" entree specials (Lomo Relleno) and the last time I got the T-bone (veal steak). I fell in love with the T-bone. It was cooked perfectly (medium rare, please) and was about 3 inches thick, covered in some kind of delicious spice blend. I was the smallest person at the table and yet I was the only one who managed to finish my entire entree, buttery mashed potatoes included. Other things I've had bites of: Vesuvio (filet stuffed with spinach and cheese, not really my thing, I like my meats straight up) and Filet Mignon (it's filet mignon, it tastes good).It's usually pretty busy and loud, so don't expect your waiter to be overly attentive. I was satisfied with the speed we ordered, and we didn't want for any water or a waiter to uncork our next bottle of wine.Best part about this place: leave stuffed for about $50 a couple. Plus whatever money you spent on BYOB wine. An affordable place for a steak dinner.

Reviews.Author: Diego M.
Reviews.Content: This will be my shortest review ever.BYOB, great meat, great service and above all, great price.If you haven't tried this place, give it a try today!

Reviews.Author: Adrienne C.
Reviews.Content: the candlelit atmosphere is conducive for all sorts of gatherings--romantic dates, intimate reunions for friends, and even big group dinners (though i'd suggest you plan those for after 9pm since you may feel like you're imposing on the quieter tables around you if it's during regular dinner hrs)I ordered the BERENJENA (oven baked eggplant layered with spinach, provolone, parmesan, ricotta, & tomato cream sauce) and it was absolutely delicious - SO FLAVORFUL - & only $10! my other friends who got steaks even admitted that my eggplant may be better than their dish. i had to agree. waiters were A+! they came around regularly to fill up the water & bread, accommodate extra people/chairs without fuss, and generally left us alone otherwise :) minus 1 for making our group wait 30 minutes even though we had a 9pm reservation all set....i mean, isn't that what reservations are for? you can tell this place is very confident of their cool factor, which probably explains why they can brush off (in a rather cavalier way) that they're running behind. the waiting wouldn't necessarily be an issue except there's nothing to do except block the sidewalk in the meantime..then again, when i got inside and started settling into the Argentinian ambiance, I could see why people would want to linger....

Reviews.Author: Sarah M.
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on Yelp, we went to Tango Sur on Saturday night for date night. I knew the wait would be crazy but we went anyway. After waiting 90 minutes they sat us right next to the door. So close to the door infact, that anyone who came in or out of the building knocked into our chair because we were so close. I thought, well, maybe the food's really good and I won't mind this. The ambiance was fine. Candlelight... of course the wind was so strong and we were seated directly next to the door that our candle kept wafting smoke into my face, but I guess they can't control that... The tables were really close to one another. And it was very loud, which is to be expected on a Sat. night at a BYOB place but we spent most of the dinner having to listen to our neighbors who were seated a foot away... I give them one star because the service was extremely prompt. Whenever we needed our water refilled the staff was there immediately. The other star is for the food. It wasn't anything to write home about.  My fiance ordered the ribeye steak. He said it was okay, but that there were parts of it that just sucked. I had the Milanesa A Caballo, which was beef, breaded and topped with two fried eggs. Again, maybe we had really high expectations, but it wasn't amazing. All in all, the food was decent, but not worth the 90 minute wait and the cramped surroundings.

Reviews.Author: Rachel R.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur has been one of my favorite restaurants for years. It's great for dates, for group celebrations, and I've even taken out-of-town family there.  Consistently amazing and reasonably priced food, coupled with BYO.  I love the patio in the summer and the cozy atmosphere inside during the chilly chi winters.No reservations means strategic timing is necessary, but always worth the visit!

Reviews.Author: Claire G.
Reviews.Content: I've been to this place three times now and feel confident giving it a solid "meh".  Really, I have no idea why people enjoy waiting 2 hours for mediocre-quality meat and subpar service.  Each visit here is worse than the last one, which leads me to believe this place is somehow getting rewarded for bad restaurant behavior.  The last visit was the final straw.  We arrived at 8pm on a Thursday night, thinking the wait would be around an hour or so.  This is precisely what the host told us - hour and fifteen, he said - and fools that we were, we believed him.  We wound up waiting 2.5 hours.  The restaurant was supposed to be closed by the time they sat us.  We were starving and they were quick to take our order (plus), but the food they brought was pretty much crap (minus).  Very tough cuts of meat, well seasoned, but not high quality and not cooked well in order to facilitate eating.  It was like gnawing on stew meat.  Actually, I wound up taking our portion home and using it as stew meat later.  Just a couple of adults getting their stew on.Honestly, I wouldn't have such a problem with the place if it weren't for the wait.  I recall there are some tasty empenadas on the menu.  BYOB is always nice.  My problem with the restaurant lies in the staff's inability to gauge wait time, move tables, and control their customers. Case in point, there was a party of 10 that arrived just ahead of us with one raving lunatic of a woman who was insisting she made a reservation, and was very clearly lying her Citizen jeans off.  They ran around and finally sat the party of 10.  That upped the wait time for everyone else by at least 1/2 an hour.  Those people should have never been seated.  Ok, I'm off my rant.  I'm never going there again, because I can get great beef stew meat at Paulina Meat Market cheaper and more efficiently.

Reviews.Author: Margaret D.
Reviews.Content: Dining here was a real pleasure.  I loved both the food and the atmosphere.  They only use candle lighting, which makes the place feel cozy and warm.  The place was packed and everyone was full of smiles and laughs--no doubt fueled by the ability to bring your own bottles of wine!  The food was FANTASTIC, especially the spinach mashed potatoes for some reason.If the wait is long, I recommend leaving your cell number and getting a drink at the Mexican place next door!

Reviews.Author: Little R.
Reviews.Content: Not impressed. Not even slightly.  After a 2.5 hour wait (which I would never normally stand for, but we were there with a larger group that was willing to wait, and we snacked on appetizers at a pub several storefronts down to kill the hunger), we were seated at a tight, tight table, in a very loud (and very dark) room - so loud, I had a hard time hearing what my closely seated dining companions were saying.  Not the ambience I was hoping for...Service wasn't the greatest, either. Part of it was the fact that our waiter kept pressuring us away from our entree choices in favor of the specials (man, was he pushy!), but what killed me, and I mean KILLED me, is that he straight lied to me about the empanadas. Granted, I'm a bit of an empanada slob having lived in Buenos Aires, but when I ask you whether the empanadas are fried or baked, just tell me the truth! I was assured by our waiter that they were baked, or "al orno", but when these crisped up, greasy suckers were delivered to our table, I was less than thrilled. Further, the beef empanadas didn't have the traditional raisins mixed in, and they served them with a chimichurri sauce - what?! Blasphemy!  Get those fried pockets of grossness off my table!While the grilled meat entrees were satisfactory, the beef ravioli we ordered were sub-par. Tough, chewy outer pasta, and tasteless beef filling left us pretty disappointed.The only thing this place has going for it is that it's BYOB.

Reviews.Author: Erin V.
Reviews.Content: I am a vegan and I love this place. That should be all you need to go. But for real -- it's BYOB, excellent food (I've had pasta, salad, and eggplant. and all my friends won't shut up about the steak and chicken), and a fun atmosphere that works for any situation. I've been here on a date and with a group, and either setting works perfectly. It can get irritating when you put your name in and have to wait longer than they tell you, but that's because no one wants to leave which says something. Because it gets so packed, I'd recommend dressing for some roasty temperatures. Bring a couple bottles of wine and some good company and chances are you will leave happy and full.

Reviews.Author: Wesley L.
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of living in San Martin, a small city in the Mendoza region of Argentina for a little while.  During my stay, I subsisted on fried empanadas, pastries with dulce de leche, amazing mate, Fanta Naranja, asado and simple salads that are representative of the German, Spanish and Italian heritages that form the Argentine culture and population.  My host father would man the grill for hours making asado in the form of chorizo, steaks and of course, morcilla.  My host mother made an amazing milanesa that I still salivate over when I think of it.So when I called up a few friends in Chicago that went to Argentina with me, I suggested we do a mini-Mendoza reunion and find an Argentine restaurant to do it at.  They both had one place in mind: Tango Sur.I gave them fair warning that living in Columbus, I had not had a decent empanada since we got back from Argentina.  Ruben's in SoHo NYC has great empanadas, but they are baked and don't have that same flavor and texture as fried Argentine empanadas.  We ordered four at Tango Sur.  Felt and tasted like home.I also gave them fair warning that I had every intention of ordering way too much and having leftovers.  I was not lying.  For the table, we ordered the four empanadas, their cheese and tomato dip, and under the parillada section, the para una.  The para una is a table top grill that has chorizo, sweet breads, two cuts of steak and a very impressive serving of morcilla (blood sausage.)  In addition to this, one person ordered the veal asado, another ordered the flank steak, the third ordered a chicken dish and I ordered the milanesa ternera (veal milanesa.)  Everything was delicious.  The only thing that disappointed me about the milanesa was that it was not smothered in the vegetable puree that my host mother always served with it.  This puree is something that I keep a batch of in the freezer at all times since it is a simple accompaniment made by simmering carrots, onions, potatoes, celery and tomatoes in water with just a little salt and water, pouring off some broth and then blending.Of course, after that meal (we all left with half of our entrees in to go boxes), they brought out the dessert tray.  What immediately caught our eyes were the mil hojas (layers of thin waffles and dulce de leche) and the pionono (vanilla cake rolled with a thick layer of dulce de leche.)  They.  Were.  Beautiful.  I could have sworn that I was back in Buenos Aires, enjoying a coffee in the Recoleta, watching the tourists try to find Evita's grave.  It was that perfect.We also ordered the mate, expecting and hoping that it would be served in the traditional cup with the silver straw.  Mate is a wonderfully communal drink because you pass it around the table to all your friends and enjoy it together.Unfortunately, it came in a tea bag, served in a regular tea cup.  So that was very disappointing.  However, we had plenty of our BYOB Malbec to enjoy instead.  No corkage fee at Tango Sur either, which is wonderful.All in all, it was a wonderful experience.  They lose one star because of the lack of vegetable puree (which I suppose is not traditional) but mostly because of the mate.  That may seem harsh, but an Argentine restaurant should really observe what is a integral part of serving mate.Definitely check it out.  And maybe bring your own mate.

Reviews.Author: Samantha K.
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I, who enjoy trying new trendy places, arrived at Tango Sur for late dinner after we both got out of work about 9 pm. We walked up on the outdoor patio open with a guitarist performing and acoustic session. We were sat right away on the patio and we brought our own bottle of wine (if you are in need of another bottle there's a Jewel about a block away). We always share so we get our top choices from the menu. Our waiter, Saul, was well informed on the menu and gave us some great suggestions. We took his advice on our appetizer and entrees. We had two different types of empanadas which came with an awesome chimichuri sauce! For dinner we had the El Filet and Bife Vesuvio. Both entrees came with salads and we had plenty to share!  Of the two entrees the filet was my favorite. The filet was PERFECTLY cooked (medium) and the spinach mashed potatoes were fantastic!! As dinner came to an end and the restaurant came a close at 11, we were encouraged to take our time finishing dinner and offered dessert and espresso! Overall the experience was more than I could have asked for. Definitely one of my new favorite Lakeview culinary detonations!!

Reviews.Author: Christopher F.
Reviews.Content: Great restaurant in the Argentinian/South American churrascaria vein. Keeping that in mind, focus on the meat and empanadas - don't bother with the salads. It's BYOB so bring yourself a nice bottle of red wine and enjoy. Ambiance is dark and sleek with candle-lit tables/dark wood, and brick walls. A bit noisy so not a first date spot, but maybe one a little later. Do expect to wait in line if you're looking for a table on a Thursday, Friday or Saturday night - I don't think you can make reservations for two.I went here on my birthday and I was pleased. In fact, I think this place is perfect for birthdays and bachelor parties. We had a large group and got reservations ahead accordingly. We were seated promptly, and the staff was very accomodating, especially with our large group. All in all a great experience.

Reviews.Author: April F.
Reviews.Content: Can't wait to go back to this place!The hubs and I did not have a reservation, but got seated right away.  Very nice cozy romantic table (despite the kid at the next table trying to pull down the curtains).    We ordered the filet to share, and I thought there was no way that would be enough food for two of us.  Well, I was wrong.   They brought out this ridiculous huge slab of meat on a metal tray.  The meat was covered in delicious spices and a mushroomy juice.  We just cut off chunks as we went and couldn't stop talking about how delicious it was.    We didn't get dessert because we were in a meat coma.   The service was great- very attentive.   And we couldn't believe how cheap it was!  $50 for two people, awesome!Can't wait to come back to you, Tango Sur!

Reviews.Author: Ryan M.
Reviews.Content: Unimpressed.It's a bit upsetting considering the sheer quantity of positive reviews of this place, but when it comes down to it, the atmosphere wasn't enough to get me to come back.Tango Sur, I tried you back in the fall/winter of 2009, and we ate inside. We were cramped next to an awkward first date (as your tables are so incredibly close to one another), so while it was entertaining to listed to hilariously painful first date questions, it was not what I would call private. The salads were disappointing, the steak was somewhat gristley, and the wait was almost not worth it.And then friends told me to go back and sit outside. I bought a bottle of wine from the little wine shop on Southport, and and we sat and waited for our food. And we waited a little longer. The wait for the food was pretty ridiculous, around 30 minutes for my steak and my wifes ravioli. Again, the food wasn't great, and the wait time between order and getting food was long. The wait time between finishing food and getting our bill was even longer.Long story short, I'm so over this place. You can go here for dinner if you want, but be ready to wait.

Reviews.Author: Ryan W.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Tango Sur 5 or 6 times, and here's the deal:I give it five stars because I'm combining price and quality.  $22 for almost a full pound of VERY good filet mignon cooked in a simple, delicious juicy sauce, and it includes tasty potatoes.  I take half my steak home each time- it's that big!Don't get me wrong, if you'd like to spend easily 2 or 3 times as much at Gibson's, Joe's, Morton's or any one of the numerous more expensive steak houses in the city, you might get a better steak.  And for $10 extra, your potatoes might be better too.   It's rare that it's not crowded from 6-10pm at least, especially on the weekend- plan accordingly.  It can be loud inside.  I love sitting outside.  I try to go on off nights, or after a Cubs day game.

Reviews.Author: Veera R.
Reviews.Content: We came here on a Sunday evening to end my eventful weekend back at home before I head back on the road for work and to have a nice dinner with some friends from Florida staying with us for the weekend.We had a party of 5 and since they do not take reservations for party's of 6 or less, I had my doubts on if we would be able to eat there that night. However, to my delight, the guy taking names said the wait would only be half an hour. Just enough time to walk over to CVS and grab a bottle of wine and head back.Much to our delight, we were seated within 30 minutes. The place was crowded, but not to the point where someones butt would be in your face if they were passing by your table.First off, I do not remember the place being so dark. If the place was any darker I would have to use night vision goggles to get around the place. Even when seated at our table, the candles were so small, I could barely see the person across the table from me or my food which I needed to cut, a little annoying, but I will just have to work around it.The wife and I ordered: Lomo Relleno half slab Argentine filet sliced and filled with a chimichurri, ham sauce then cooked and served on a grill with portabella marsalaI never had this, as I always order the T-bone. I was not sure if it would be enough for my wife and I (even though the menu said it is ideal for two), my wife always says that my stomach is a bottomless pit. When it came out, I thought the menu should have read (ideal for three), it was a big portion of meat, which i was praying would not be dry. Much to my pleasure the meat was not dry whatsoever and was absolutely delicious. After cutting each slice, I made sure to dip the slice in the ham sauce the meat came in and then the chimichurri sauce, but some people might want to skip the chimichurri sauce altogether because the meat already so much flavor with the ham sauce. The portabella mushrooms that came with the dish were veeeeeeeeery good. This is coming from a person who only eats mushrooms with his deep dish pizza, again the mushrooms were very flavorful.I completely forgot about the empanadas, the wife and I had the chicken ones and they were gone before I can blink. I had eaten mine. They were sooooooo good. I will not even try describing it. If you are there, definitely try their empanadas.Lastly, I loved the fact it was byob. This not only cuts down on the check, but it also allows you to drink something that you know you will like.A great, dark place to bring a date or go with a group, it doesn't matter because the food was absolutely delicious and the wait staff is very quick and prompt when you need water or something else to go with your meal! I will definitely be coming back!

Reviews.Author: Debbie P.
Reviews.Content: Came here with a few friends who were smart enough to BYOB - always a perk, especially when it's a great restaurant. I got "El Filet" which is so, so good. Two thick pieces cooked to a perfect medium rare. Gorgeous. Generously top them with that herbed oil they send out and you've got a good 2-meals worth of greatness.I was not impressed by the spinach mashed potatoes, but they were a nice green color, so at least they looked pretty. I'm also not a fan of mashed potatoes in general, though.All in all, love it, but I will say that the same owners opened up Folklore in Wicker Park. The menu is really similar, if not identical, and I like the ambiance in Folklore more than here.

Reviews.Author: Yaw N.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite steak restaurant in the city. I would go there just to eat their empanadas, which have to be the best in the world. I don't know what they put in them, but those chicken empanadas combined with their chimichurri sauce are ridiculously good. The last three times we've been here, my girlfriend and I have split the Vesuvius which is really good. There isn't much I can't say about this place that hasn't already been said. The wait can be long and they typically only take reservations for large parties. Regardless, grab a good bottle of Argentinian wine and head to the best BYOB restaurant in the city if you want an excellent dining experience.

Reviews.Author: David D.
Reviews.Content: Simply amazing one of my favorite places in Chicago.  The food and service is great! and it's BYOB. :)  I highly recommend Tango Sur

Reviews.Author: Kristina V.
Reviews.Content: Amazing Byob! This is my go to place when I have out of town visitors or want a special night out with friends.

Reviews.Author: Paul M.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur was my first Argentine dining experience... it blew me away.  You've got to try the steak--I preferred it over both the Chophouse and Gene&Georgetti's... sure, it's a totally different atmosphere, but they do an EXCELLENT JOB and the prices are definitely reasonable.  Also, it's BYOB so you can grab your fav. Shiraz for half of what you'd pay for it at a restaurant. Who can say no to that?I was there with a sizable group (10 or 12 maybe?) for a late dinner, and service was not lightening-fast.  I was informed that this is normal, though--especially when you factor in the authentic Argentine cultural influence that is present throughout this establishment's service.  Slow is just the way to go--savor your meal, spend lots of time with friends, drink an extra bit of wine... and life is good.  Tango Sur!

Reviews.Author: Aubrey L.
Reviews.Content: Since I have never been to Argentina, I cannot evaluate the food's Argentinian bona fides. I can state emphatically, however, that both times I ate here I left rubbing my belly in satisfaction and making soft mewling sounds. If this is how they eat in Argentina, book me a flight!A word of warning: Tango Sur is not a vegetarian establishment. It is not even flexitarian. In fact, had Scott Pilgrim filmed in Chicago versus Toronto, he would have invited Ramona's 3rd evil ex to dinner here. I was seriously nervous about going here the first time (it was for my brother's birthday dinner) since I generally do not eat a lot of meat and I refuse to put my lips to factory farmed protein. Imagine my relief when the waiter confirmed that all the beef items (I cannot vouch for the chicken or fish) are sourced organically from a traditional farm. So far, so good. Now, onto the real reason you are reading this: the FOOD.Start with the pressed tongue with roasted peppers. If you have been waiting anxiously to try tongue but it just never seemed like the right time, I have happy news: it is unlikely you will find a better version than what Tango Sur prepares.Next, order the empenadas. One of each flavor should do it.Skip the a la Milanese stuff (I thought we were in Argentina?) and head straight for the Beef Vesuvio, Lomo Relleno, or El Filet. The Lomo is a great candidate for splitting with your fellow diners. Finally, indulge your craving for a taste of sweetness with the flan. Awesome.A solid 4 stars.

Reviews.Author: Roberto M.
Reviews.Content: I love Tango Sur.  I have been coming for years.  It is good but it is not great.  Thus, 3 stars.Tango Sur is a BYOB steakhouse with excellent and large cuts of Argentine beef.  The service will be slow as it is in Latino America.  They do not accept reservations and it is small (very small), dark, loud and very cramped on the inside.  I ordered a breaded steak that was covered with cheese, a tomato sauce and served with potatoes.  It is a large cut of beef and I strongly recommend it.  Order each type of empanada to start and share while your food is prepared.People love Tango Sur, and do not get me wrong, I do too, its a solid dinner option but it is a restaurant where you love the food, but will have doubts about the extras (service, wait lines, small bathrooms, lighting, etc).  I am sure you understand what I am trying to say...Cheers.

Reviews.Author: may o.
Reviews.Content: If your looking to experience a different ambiance to eat that is relaxing and enjoyable either as a cute date or with friends this is the place. if you love food and are willing to wait by all mean this place will be well worth it.TIPS:But... you must plan this dinner ahead of time by that I mean a whole day ahead. Parking is ridiculous, we had to park 6 blocks away and that was after an hr of looking for parking, side streets are no help they are permit parking only. AND the wait... The wait was 2 hrs for a party of 6 and that's that we called to check up on our wait, we got "lucky" with that . FOOD:The "Empanadas De Pollo" are really really good , you must try them if you go and also the "Tortilla De Papa"! For dinner I had "The Fillet" which was ok but the meat was a little dry and to much meat for a girl, best idea would be to split the plate because they give you two pieces. Happy eating :)

Reviews.Author: Karolyn S.
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend here for his birthday a few weeks ago. I hadn't been in years mainly due to the fact that the wait is always so long and they don't take reservations. We arrived at around 8:30 and were told it was about a 90 minute wait. I was ready for this and so was my bf. But then, the host looked at us and said, "Hold on. I'm going to be able to help you." He shuffles us to a back waiting area and opens our bottle of wine for us and says it'll only be about 30 minutes now. I have no idea why, but wasn't about to question it! I do believe that there were so many larger groups there that night that the turnover for a two top was just faster. Yay!We were seated outside, which I love, as the inside can be crowded and very loud. If you want to hear your date/eating partners, I'd recommend outdoors. The waiter was amazing. In fact, I wish I had gotten his name. I also love to compliment the waitstaff to the manager. Unfortunately, I just forgot. We ordered one beef and one chicken empanada. I don't know what the green sauce is they serve with it, but it just really bumps up the flavor. We also had the melted cheese plate. What's not to love? Melty cheese, bread. yes please. For our entree we split one of the steaks for two. The one with the chimichurri. It was fantastic. My bf was a bit skeptical on getting it medium rare (he wanted medium), but both I and the waiter said it was the right way for this. Medium rare was definitely the way. And there was the fantastic green sauce again! We didn't even finish half of the steak. It was so big. We did take it home and the next morning made some steak and eggs for breakfast. Cooked up quite nicely. For dessert, the waiter brought out a caramel flan that he gave us for my bf's birthday. AwesomeI love that this place is byob. Really cuts down on the cost. For all of what we ate, it was 54 bucks. Seriously, why are you not going right now? Anyhow, I can't wait to go back, sooner rather than later. Just be prepared to wait a bit. It is worth it.

Reviews.Author: Alice M.
Reviews.Content: No question that this place is awesome.  Great steaks and byob.  Expect to play anywhere between 15-30 for a big (12 oz) steak.  A little pricey, I guess, but the fact that it is byob makes up for it because that means there are no costs for alcohol.The ambiance is hectic yet romantic like others have mentioned.  It feels like a hip place to go.It definitely gets crowded BUT they will take your phone number and call you when your table is ready.  Since it's right on Southport that means you can go across the street to the bar to have a drink while you wait.  So really, even if you end up waiting for an hour, it's not too bad! There is no question I would go here again!

Reviews.Author: Ian M.
Reviews.Content: A few things to expect.  Long waits, especially on weekends, and its BYOB.Food was solid.  Ordered the steak that resembles a new york strip and my gf ordered lemon chicken.  Both were great, and had both as left overs and still delicous.Service - we had a great waiter.  Didn't catch his name because of the accent but everyone seemed to be kind tentative and had good recommendations.  What makes this place?  BYOB.  Cuts a normal steak dinner in half.  Bring your own wine, if white they will bring a small wine container to keep it chilled at the table.  Candle light set a relaxing mood and the meat will be cooked how you want it.About the long wait - if you expect it, won't be an issue.  Give them your name and number and they will call you once you are next.  My friends and I went a neighboring bar to have a couple of drinks then strolled over when they called.  Relaxing way to begin dinner.Four stars because the service/food were great, but 5 stars is top notch and only a few places earn that extra star.

Reviews.Author: Alan A.
