Reviews.Content: When I think steakhouse, I normally think of big tables, fancy service, and relaxed dining.  This place definitely does not fit that mold.The atmosphere inside was dark, crowded, and bustling.  Not surprising for restaurants in Chicago that cater to young crowds, but I just prefer a little more breathing room if possible.  The tables were lit by candlelight, which was great for ambiance but terrible if you like to see what you are eating.  That being said, the food was fantastic.  My special Argentine fillet for two was outrageously large in portion size (enough for a dinner for 2 for leftovers), well cooked, flavorful, and a joy to eat.  The service was also good considering the size of my party (12) and how busy the restaurant was on a Saturday evening.  Thankfully we had reservations; if I came back with a smaller group I would try to hit a weeknight so we would not have to wait.  Because the food is worth coming back for.I will give it 4 stars for great food at a good price.

Reviews.Author: Jeff P.
Reviews.Content: Everybody loves this place, I was NOT a fan.  I wish I had take advantage of the BYOB during the 45 minute wait, it possibly would have made the night better.  I got a "prime" steak that was stuffed with cheese.  This was no way near a prime steak.  I ordered it per recommendation from a friend who loves it and I ordered it at the temperature the chef recommended - Medium.  Typically I order my steak Medium-Rare but I went with their recommendation.  AWFUL. It tasted like well done skirt steak.  It was so tough by the end of the meal my jaw was sore from all the chewing.It is very dark, loud, and close quarters to the other guests.  The darkness didn't bother me so much but all the tables are within an arms reach of another so you can hear your neighbors conversations loud and clear.  I didn't mind this so much, but its good for you to know ahead of time.  Maybe during the weekday as opposed to a friday night would be better.Lastly the service was terrible.  It took 15-20 minutes to order after we sat down, the server never checked on us once, and another 15-20 minute wait to get our check after we were done.  Clearly it wasn't my favorite place.

Reviews.Author: Esther P.
Reviews.Content: This is not a traditional steakhouse, which is why I think it's so good. The food is delicious. The berenjena appetizer - it's sort of like eggplant lasagna - and the provoleta, which is essentially baked cheese - have become our appetizer mainstays. Yum! The spinach mashed potatoes are also delicious. They aren't overwhelmingly spinach-y, so friends who don't like spinach still think they're wonderful. In my opinion, the lomo relleno (a thick steak smothered with mushrooms and a chimichurri sauce) and bife vesuvio (steak stuffed with cheese and spinach) are the best entrees.The servers I've had (and I've been here at least 8-10 times in the last four years) are always friendly and efficient. This might be mistaken by some as brusque, but I appreciate a waiter who gets to the point and doesn't waste time with chit-chat. I don't come to Tango Sur to talk. I come to eat steak. Delicious, mouthwatering, melt-in-your-mouth steak. And so much steak, too. Seriously, wear your eating pants, folks! Pro Tip: When you go to this restaurant, you need to go early (at 5:30 or 6) or be prepared to wait. They will take down your phone number and give you a call when your table is ready. It's not so bad if you live close by or want to spend an hour or two drinking. We always put our names in and walk back home. I understand how someone might get frustrated by a long wait, but that's why you read Yelp reviews!

Reviews.Author: Ellen P.
Reviews.Content: Honestly this place is great.Came here with a group for a friends birthday, managed to get reservations which was great because there was a street fest going on on Southport and so this place was THE place to be!What a great setting, almost entirely lit by tall, long stemmed candles, felt like I was sitting somewhere established in the 1800's, amazing.Empanadas were delightful, heard rave reviews about prosciutto/melon and beef tongue appetizers but did not try either. Am dying to go back and try the grilled provolone (grilled cheese? sign me up, sadly I was the only taker for the evening).Boyfriend and I split the pork dish for two, way too much meat, but made delicioso left overs for dinner the next evening as well. Waiter was delightful, albeit absent, but the place was mega crowded so I gave him a pass.Only complaint was that it was SO GD HOT! It felt like the air was off, I don't really understand that. But, it was super hot outside and people kept opening and closing the front door letting all the air out, so ok, I guess I CAN understand.Totally reasonably priced, for 4 couples (8 people) it was $60 a couple including a 20% tip (plus cost of the $10 bottle of wine we brought), was more than pleased to say the least!Am planning to come back with the man in the fall, good romantic atmosphere, BYOB (love love love BYOB) and food was delicious. i've got my eye on the giant filet mignon everyone was eating.

Reviews.Author: Sarah V.
Reviews.Content: Best empanadas I have ever eaten.  The fillet could feed an army - and those spinach mashed potatoes are unreal.Yeah - a great place that isn't insanely pricey is gonna be packed on a Friday night.  They'll grab your phone number and you can head to a bar like Dag's or the Blue Bayou for a beer while you wait.  Chill out.  The outdoor seating is the way to go in the summer.This is my favorite date night restaurant, it is amazing.  Oh and did I mention BYOB - classy.  Pop in that CVS and grab yourself a bottle of something.

Reviews.Author: Gigi L.
Reviews.Content: The setting sucked... noisy and super crowded... but the food was BOMB!!!!! It was my first time in chitown and my first time having Argentine food. My god, it was sooo scrumptious!! the steaks, salmon,empanadas were all delicious!!! i wished they had one in San Diego or LA!!Chicagoans... you gotta go if you have not...Out of towners... make this one of your dinner spots!!!! you won't regret it!!!! PS: byob. no corkage fee! (=

Reviews.Author: Laila C.
Reviews.Content: how is it possible that I haven't reviewed Tango Sur yet? Oh...yes I know. Probably because of the 770 reviews before me. Because I can't possibly add anything new to the reviews. But you know what?! I've been here about a dozen times. I waited once on valentine's day for over 4 hours for a table. I have drunk countless bottles of wine here, with so many different people. I deserve to have a review go down in history!um...that's pretty much all I can say? Get the mixed grill for two, if you're into 10 pounds of meat shared between two people that is. Try the beef tongue. Definitely leave your number and get a drink. Don't stand around like an idiot for 2 hours thinking they'll miraculously give you a seat early. And enjoy ALL the delicious meats your little carnivorous body can handle before you pass out from a blocked artery.

Reviews.Author: Edwin L.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is one of my favorite Argentine Steakhouses in Chicago! The elegant and classy candle-lit atmosphere brings this storefront BYOB restaurant to every meat lover's dream! Grilling large cuts of Argentinian beef topped with chimichurri is my order of choice! They never fail to provide excellent service, both indoor and outdoor seating , exquisite fresh food.Ideal - for second date...

Reviews.Author: Kate N.
Reviews.Content: I'm giving Tango Sur two stars: One for my experience on Saturday night (I can't give it less, though I'd like to) and one for the benefit of the doubt because I never actually got to eat here.However. Pretty much the ONLY reason to wait more than two hours for a meal is if you are in a refugee camp. I'm convinced that people are so enthusiastic about this place because they are suffering from Stockholm Syndrome. After hours of waiting -- hungry, cold -- at the mercy of the snoot-tastic maître de, one surely begins to "express empathy and have positive feelings towards their captors, sometimes to the point of defending them." I couldn't have said it better myself, Wikipedia.And it's cheap, you say? Well, we put down about $50 for appetizers at Deelice and went through 5 bottles of wine, a few pints of beer, and some whiskey during our three hour wait. (Which was spent at a number of bars up and down Southport, because naturally there was no room at Lame-o Sur itself.) How much did YOU spend during YOUR wait??By about 10:30pm, my group had only made it as far as the tiny, dark, cramped, weird backroom. Where I finally cracked and decided "F*ck it, I'm going to McDonald's." And I tangoed on out of there.Naturally, my friends were seated exactly three minutes after I left. But I don't regret leaving at all.

Reviews.Author: Ginger D.
Reviews.Content: There are so many reasons why I love Tango Sur; where should I start??? I am so glad my friend discovered this place and invited me because my life would be a little sadder without it. The first time I ever went to Tango Sur was on a Monday night and the place was slammed! After going there more, I realized that they are always servery night of the week. If you do not like a loud, fast paced restaurant, you will not like Tango Sur. The atmosphere it dark, candlelit, and romantic, with every table so close that you could definitely touch the people at the table next to you; not that you would want to, but for the sake of description... What adorns the romantic atmosphere are the beautiful people, called waiters that glide around the restaurant. Ladies (and fellas too), this restaurant has some of the most beautiful men working as wait staff that I've seen in the city of Chicago. So down to business...One of my favorite things about this restaurant is the warm bread they give you as soon as you sit down. The rolls are so fresh. Perfectly crusty on the outside and soft on the inside. I could just eat bread here. For appetizers, I would recommend any of the empinadas. The garlic oil they give you with the empinadas (as well as many entrees) is fabulous! Entrees come with a salad. It's not your run of the mill salad; it's lettuce, two tomatoes and some onions. You get oil and vinegar as a dressing. Simple, classic and perfect because a lot of people tend to get full on salads before the meal. I always get whatever special fish they have because I don't eat steak, but everyone who I have come with who ordered steak found it to be wonderful. At Tango Sur, you really get your money's worth of steak. A favorite is the Filet mignon, in which you are served TWO filets and it's only $24. It's a steal! I've seen many people order the dinner for two, in which you get a hot plate of a variety of scrumptious meats. I generally don't order dessert here because for one, I'm not a huge dessert person, and two because i'm so FULL and satisfied that I don't need dessert! But the dessert I have tried has been good. There's a peaches and creme dessert that is heavenly. Tango Sur is a great restaurant with awesome Argentinian food. The restaurant has a great ambiance that is perfect for a date. The only downsides are that it is ALWAYS busy and the tables are close together. In addition, if you don't have a party of 6 or more to make a reservation, you will probably end up waiting. Try calling ahead to put your name on the list, and if you do have to wait, take a stroll to Jewel or CVS down the street to buy some drinks for dinner...it really makes time go by. However, everything you experience at Tango Sur, makes up for these downsides. This restaurant is a MUST GO!!!

Reviews.Author: Rob S.
Reviews.Content: We decided to eat here after reading rave reviews on Yelp.  The wait was pretty decent for a Friday night (only an hour) however the only thing I remember was not the food - it was the astoundingly bad service.  Not only was it slow, it was just bad.  We asked 4 different waiters (ours was nowhere to be found) for some sauce to dip our dry bife vesuvius in and nobody came back.  The empenadas were good, the spinach mash was just OK and the bife vesuvius (stuffed meat) was dry as a bone and cringingly salty.  After a long day of flying in from Cali, we just wanted to get the hell out of there.The meat was way overdone and to be honest I'd write more although I'm just trying to forget I came here. You'd figure for Chicago, the meat reviews would be on point... totally not worth the wait.The highlight of the night was that the review we read pointed us a few doors down to Sensational Bites, a great dessert place.

Reviews.Author: Michael B.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is definitely not for the weak-stomached, serving up generous portions of meat prepared in a uniquely Argentinian style. Also, it's affordable! Move over expensive South American steakhouses in Chicago! My recommendations are to try some empanadas, the melted cheese appetizer, and then take half of your steak home, because you need to have the house flan, too (I hate flan...Hate it. But I couldn't help but eat all of the flan the server recommended...it was delicious). My only complaint is that large groups tend to drown out conversations from smaller tables (The BYOB contributes to their rowdiness? Sure.). Also, the wait can be staggering and there isn't a lot of room to wait for an open table.Still, it's a very cool experience and worth checking out.

Reviews.Author: Nick S.
Reviews.Content: We came here with a large group for a Christmas party.  FYI, they only take reservations for large groups, otherwise the wait is long on the weekends.   This place is very busy.I like the ambiance, mainly for the lighting.  The service was very good.  The food was just good, but the meal is so reasonable you can't complain.  BYOB is a big plus when you're with a big group.  We all pigged out and it came out to less than $40/person  meal, tax and tip.

Reviews.Author: Jessica Y.
Reviews.Content: Voted #1 date spot and being BYOB, what more could you want?! Well, maybe that the space was a little bigger, but that's why you need to keep in mind to go early, or else you'll be waiting for quite a while! But it's definitely worth the wait!After popping our bottle of wine (no corkage fee by the way!), we ordered the Provoleta, which is good, but just a little too much cheese for me! For our meal, we ordered the Bife Vesuvio, which is meant for two and even though I was with a guy, we still had leftovers! Oh, and the leftoveres tasted great the next day!Tango Sur is well worth your money for the food, atmosphere and it's BYOB!!

Reviews.Author: Kwoky L.
Reviews.Content: I am not a fan of their no reservation policy but I would wait for their delicious piece of meat. It's probably the best steakhouse that give you the best value for your food.My friend and I waited for an hour at a nearby coffee shop and another 40 minutes in the waiting room inside when we were finally seated. I realized that it was BYOB when I saw people started drinking while waiting. I was like, "Dang it!" before my friend went to the nearby CVS to get a bottle of Malbec.We ordered the pickled tongue for appetizer. I didn't expect them to give us so many of them. It could very well be an entire meal! We both ordered the mixed grill for two people and it came with sweetbreads, short ribs, steak and sausages - enough to keep us both happy. They were perfectly done but a little on the oily side because of the sausages. I would come back and just order the short ribs because it was SUPER THICK and juicy. Delicious!My only advice is to come early, before 6.30pm because it starts to be crowded after that. There is also not a lot of room to walk around on the inside and the tables are very close to one another. I would suggest to come with friends. If you want to come with families, Folklore would be a better place in my opinion. They have essentially the same menu but the ambience at Folklore is more comfortable.

Reviews.Author: Quantas G.
Reviews.Content: Delicious Food. Great Service. Vibrant Atmosphere. BYOB.Tango Sur did a great job of accommodating our group for a birthday celebration. Our group was well served by the staff and the food was great. We dined on flavorful empanadas, antipasto, and awesome provoleta. (Argentinian cheese with olive oil and roasted red peppers) Then the meatastic feast began. Para Dos is the way to go. ($31 for two people) It is meatful, meatnormous enjoyment for two. Grilled chorizo, short ribs, blood sausage, beef sweetbreads, and my favorite, flap steak. The flap steak was perfectly cooked, well-seasoned, moist and came in a generous portion. Me and my meat buddy could not even finish all of the meatness. And oh yea, the one vegetarian at the table enjoyed a eggplant parmesan-type dish and even she was satisifed.The service was top-notch. Our server made sure all of our needs were taken care of. Whether it was more bread, opening one of our many bottles of wine, taking pictures, retrieving errant balloons, etc. The rest of staff made sure our water glasses were filled and dirty dishes were removed. And we were entertained by a live guitarist.It is BYOB with no corkage fee. It also cuts down on the bill as you can stock up at the nearby CVS. Make a reservation if you're going during the dinner rush, especially during the weekend...and enjoy the food.

Reviews.Author: Pascal M.
Reviews.Content: I'm drooling as I dream back to my experience at Tango Sur. I often go through their pictures and find myself crying as wish to be back in front of a plate of their delicious meat. I could see a tyranasoraus rex geting a table for one here. It was January and there were people eating outside with coats on. Thats dome devoted fooddies right there. Jokes aside, tango sur is no joke. Let's get this out of the way, you're gonna wait. So what? The food is worth waiting 3 days for. Plus, the placei is BYOB. We started with their Spinach and Cheese Empenadas and their Provoleta. Both were great, especially the empenadas. I'd say it's a must get. For dinner we did the Lomo Relleno and Para Dos. My oh my. The Lomo is huge, bursting with flavor, incredibly tender, expertly cooked (mid-rare), and a sauce that's unlike any other.The para dos is so fun to eat with friends. I love sweetbreads, so it's a personal treat that they include this with all the other meat. The short ribs, flap meat, and sausage are all really good too. Dont remember what we had for dessert, but  I think they change it up infrequently.It's going to be difficult going back and not ordering the same thing. The menu is full of awesome items I'd love to try. Their steaks look fantastic and I'm willing to bet their chicken is phenomenal too. Long wait, really nice lighting, suprisingly intimate setting and warm decor, and some of the best grilled meat you sink your teeth into. Bravo Tang Sur, BRAVO!

Reviews.Author: Brent D.
Reviews.Content: We were real lucky when we decided to give this place a try on Halloween.  It was a last minute decision and it turned out to be a good one.  Things started off well with some semi-rockstar parking on Southport.  Next, we stroll up to the restaurant, 2 bottles of wine in tow.  Much to our surprise there is no line and, in fact, they are clearing a table which will be ready in moments.  While waiting for the table, the masses arrived and the wait ballooned up to 30-45 minutes.The interior is a bit cramped, but the lighting adds to the ambiance.  It's got a great low-key/semi romantic, yet festive vibe.Onto the food.  Being a carnivore, I have been looking forward to dining here.  The menu was a nice mix of your standard steaks, as well as some other, lesser-known cuts.Not fully grasping the large quantity of beef heading our way, we ordered the provela appetizer.  This was a molten plate of provolone cheese, olive oil, and red pepper.  So bad, yet soooo good.When it came time to order our entre, we asked our waiter, and he quickly recommended one of the dishes best suited for two.  There was no hesitation even though it shaved .$25+ off our tab.  This was a refreshing change.Out comes a large pan over a flame that contains something that would make Fred Flintstone blush.  It was a generous serving of flank steak with a wonderful chimichurri sauce with sweet potato wedges sprinkled throughout.  It may not be in the same realm as a David Burke's in terms of quality, but it was a damn good steak and an absolute steal for the price.  The two of us ate, enjoyed our wine, and the atmosphere for a solid 2 hours.  The cost?  About $50.  Unbelievable.  I cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Author: Moe f.
Reviews.Content: We tried to go on Sat night and were told of a 2 hour wait. Unfortunately this is often the case here and why I do not eat here more often. If you have a large group, you can get a reservation. And that is one of the main problems with this place. You have all these large parties lingering for hours drinking their BYO so that tables never seem to open fast enough. But I digress, the provoletta and empanadas are great. As are the huge steaks. And no they are not "Chicago" quality steaks but what do you want for under $25. Still have had many great evenings here and it is what it is. Oh and the hosts can be really, really rude at times.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie D.
Reviews.Content: MY FAVORITE DATE PLACE!!I absolutely adore Tango Sur. A great place for a first date - cozy, dark atmosphere, candle light casting shadows, and some great dishes that are perfect for two. It's BYOB, which is nice - share a bottle together and dine on some great beef. Heck, bring two bottles and stumble out on to Southport after for some people watching or bar-hopping. The wait staff is very accommodating and the music is soft, but fitting for the atmosphere. I try something new each time and have yet to be disappointed. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Reviews.Author: Marie S.
Reviews.Content: A group of us just got back from Buenos Aires about two weeks ago and were craving BEEF. Thank God for Tango Sur... it really hit the spot and brought us back to Argentina !!Our server was dead on with every recommendation so we enjoyed alot .... Delicious empanadas - perfectly seasoned and you can tell they are handmade. Rockin chimichurri that I wanted to put on EVERYTHING.   And most importantly, great Argentine steaks that made your taste buds do a tango.  The filet is to die for (and I usually dont care for filet since its not as flavorful as other cuts).  The rib eye was just as good too.  And to add to its authenticity - I really loved the fact that alot of the meat was flown in from Argentina. We ended the evening with an alfajore topped with a little dulce de leche.  If I didnt look out the window, I wouldve sworn I was sitting in a parilla in Buenos Aires!

Reviews.Author: Erika W.
Reviews.Content: Last time I went here was during a very awkward time in a relationship with a friend. The fact that I felt that awkwardness with every bite and sip of my dinner and am STILL giving Tango Sur a positive review speaks volumes. The atmosphere is wonderful - festive while still feeling intimate. Wonderful music and people having a good time, but you can still hear your dinner companions. I've never had a problem getting a table in a reasonable amount of time, but they'll take your cell number if you want to leave while you wait. And then, of course, there are the steaks. Huge. Inexpensive. Delicious, melt in your mouth.  The salad that comes with meals is pretty disappointing, but let's face it: we don't come to Tango Sur for the salad. Did I mention the BYOB, thereby making your meal even more of a bargain?

Reviews.Author: Jennifer G.
Reviews.Content: What can I say that hasn't already been said? This is by far my favorite restaurant in Chicago. While there are many downfalls to this place, one being the awful wait, it is well worth it. The bread alone is almost orgasmic, but never fear because the meat is out of this world. Like I can't cook this meat at home and really isn't that what you should go to a restaurant for, something you can't make yourself. While it's nice to go out and eat pasta (which I love), ultimately I can make pasta at home.Please note that, I do not recommend this for a first date and here is why:Because this place is crazy popular it's super loud in here. It's in no part the fault of the owners, it's just that crowded. While the dim lights look romantic, shouting at each other in a getting to know you kind of way might diminish your chances of a second date. Take your new lover to Tango Sur once you know they are truly spacial.

Reviews.Author: Lisa H.
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer: I am a vegetarian and did not personally partake in steak consumption. Also we forgot to BYOB. However, I am heavily taking into account the feedback of my fiance and his mom, who both had the meat (and enjoyed it)   :) MEATLOVERS - you really need to try this place! My fiance and his mom both got the El Filet and were impressed with the quality of the meat. And they give you TWO filets, not one. My fiance also loved that they did not overcook his "rare" steak. Be prepared for crappy service and the snotty host with his hair tied back. Our waiter was nice, but he was MIA for most of the night and he did not understand that I wanted the appetizer with the main course.  We were baffled by the house "salad" which looks like burger fixings. It took us 40 minutes to get our food.I got the smoked provolone cheese which was yummy, as was the house mashed potatoes.  However, the sauteed vegetables were just terrible. They were actually steamed, unseasoned and clearly not fresh.  I also had a bad experience on the phone with the host. I called to make a reservation days in advance for a weeknight, and he said, "We aren't taking any more reservations." I asked him why not, and he said "We have two parties coming in at 7:30."  Tango Sur opens at 5 pm, so I said "OK we'll make reservations at 5 pm, two and a half hours before your parties come in." He replied they had plenty of spots open but just would not take reservations, and that we could "take our chances" to come in before 7:30. He then hung up on me. Of course when we arrived at 6:15 pm, the front room was only 1/3 full. I don't understand why restaurants like this need to pretend they are more popular than they actually are.

Reviews.Author: Chuck K.
Reviews.Content: BYOB Steakhouse! That should sell this place right off the bat! Was here a couple of nights ago when my parents were in town. Had an amazing meal yet again at this Argentinian Steakhouse. Everything I've had here has been great and the people I've gone with have enjoyed their meals as well. But here's the basic recommendation that you need........ El Fillet Two fillets in a red wine reduction sauce that is amazing over spinach mashed potatoes. I never usually take steak home but had to the first time I had this dish, it was still great the next day heated up. The place is always packed on the weekends, so best night to go is Thursday. Make a reservation! Otherwise you could be waiting a while to get a table. Prices are moderate, but you really get the bang for your buck by bringing your own wine or alcohol. The staff is friendly and the restaurant is set in nice neighborhood which makes for an enjoyable dinner experience. If you live in Chicago and have not been here yet... Shame on you!!!

Reviews.Author: Tim C.
Reviews.Content: I love Tango Sur.  It's my favorite restaurant in Chicago.  The food is plentiful, delicious and it's BYOB.  What more can you ask for?  The only drawback is the wait.  But, there are plenty of places nearby to grab a drink.  Give yourself an hour wait and you won't be upset.  Try any of the empanadas.  They are all delicious.  I usually get the El Filet, and it is incredible.  The spinach mashed potatoes are a must get, no matter what you order.  Any of their steak or meat dishes will make you happy.  At Tango Sur, sit back, relax and enjoy the atmosphere and bring a bottle or two of wine.  It will be a night well spent.

Reviews.Author: Jennie P.
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to give Tango Sur a try.  I've heard the restaurant is amazing however I think amazing might be a little generous.We walked in on a Friday shortly after they opened - they open at 5pm and we walked in around 5:30pm.  There was already a 1 hour wait to sit inside so we opted to sit outdoors where there was no wait.It's BYOB - BONUS!  I love byob's!They start you off with warm bread that has a bit of a garlic taste - I liked it quite a bit. The salad I think they just shouldn't bother. It's a few leafy greens, a slice of onion, a slice of tomato, and no dressing.The main part which receives rave reviews is the meat. We ordered the filet for two and it was huge!  You definitely get your money's worth.  The mushrooms served with it were to die for.  BUT, it was marinated in a tomato base of some sort and while the meat was delish, it did seem a bit oily at the same time.I had to end the dinner with dessert which was a slice of carrot cake for me - I've definitely had better in that department.All in all, you definitely get your bang for your buck - portions are large which means you can share and it is BYOB so a steak dinner can be pretty reasonably priced.I'm glad we tried it but overall, I think it's only "ok."

Reviews.Author: Maria B.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite restaurant in the entire world. Ultra romantic and BYOB...and there's a great wine store across the street (Que Syrah). Last time I visited, there was a Spanish guitar player which was incredibly sexy. You need a reservation and even if you get one, you'll have to wait a bit and you will be pissed off...just go next door and grab a drink. The filet is worth it. And you will get sexified.

Reviews.Author: Nana H.
Reviews.Content: i almost had my first overeating experience here. My friend's parents were visiting and took all the kids out to eat-- 2 adults and like 4 college sophmores, 7 bottles of wine and a steak/whole chicken each. I think I remember the waiter mentioning that the meat is actual Argentinen beef (I can totally remember my childhood, with its bi-weekly rare steak tasting like NOTHING i've had in the states, even the mcdonald's in argentina tastes better).And to affirm that this this probably the best Argentinen Restaurant in the city, my cousin from Mar de Plata visited this past week and confirmed with me that this place is 100% real deal delicious and authentic. We had the weird stuff, intestines and shit!! Still all yumms.BYOBBBBB!!! BOOYAKAAA!

Reviews.Author: Amy T.
Reviews.Content: BIG MEAT!!!  This place freaking rules.  BYOB rules.  Going on a week night and getting a table right away rules.  And getting three meals worth of delicious steak at a decent price rules.  A word of warning, though:  know when to stop.  You can get sick.  Also, a word to the ladies and boys: hot hot HOT waiters.  I think I drooled more over the boys than my yummy dinner.

Reviews.Author: Wally P.
Reviews.Content: The food is great, the prices are acceptable, the atmosphere is not my cup of tea, and the long wait is a bummer.A friend and I tried the Parillada Para Dos (Thanks for the tip Yelpers!), and I was blown away. It was my first taste of sweetbread (beef throat meat), and I don't think I'll ever have enough. The flap meat steak was as good as any I have ever had. I could go without the black sausage next time, but it was an interesting experience, as I had never tried it before. As for appetizers, I only got a bite of a chicken empanada and it was predictably delicious, though nothing extraordinary. The Provoleta (fried provolone with roasted peppers) tasted more like Mozzarella, but it made for a great combo with those peppers. We did not have any trouble finishing our huge meal, though that was partly due to the fact that our 7 o'clock reservations were moved to 9. Of course, by Tango Sur time, we were not seated until a little after 9:30. Needless to say, my already-huge appetite was on a whole other level that night.I prefer to enjoy my food in a quiet, well-lit room. Tango Sur is basically the opposite, as our lighting consisted of one puny candle, while the packed house provided quite a bit of noise. Luckily, the food, especially the beef sweetbread, was so good that it offset any problems I may have with the place. If this was purely a food review, it would be a sure-fire five stars. Next time I go, and there will certainly be many "next times", I'll make sure to avoid the Saturday night crowds.

Reviews.Author: Josh G.
Reviews.Content: I went here on a date and the Staff was very knowledgeable about the food and how it should be cooked best.  They have a great selection of Steaks and the El Filet was incredible!  It was also large enough to save some for lunch the next day, a rarity imo with filet mignon!  Prices a little steep but it is a steak house so you get what you pay for.  Make up the saving on the fact is byob!

Reviews.Author: Chantal J.
Reviews.Content: BYOB that has class and ambiance! I took a friend visiting me here and we were lucky to get a seat outside (while the weather was still warm.) We both had pasta, but it was perfectly done. The service was great as well. We did have to wait for a little bit, but we waited inside a room, that looked like more a room from an old Spanish house. Different for sure, but if it would be any dimmer, it would've been completely dark! I would recommend it for a date night, or to take parents/ family out for a little classier than Potbelly's or a pub.

Reviews.Author: demian s.
Reviews.Content: So there's long lines, and no where to wait! bet trust me its worth it, byob and the only place to really get a true taste of what a CHE BOLUDO dreams for. Dont fool around with any individual plates, get the Parillada (pronounced PAH-rri-SHA-da.. say it with me now), and dont bother asking what anything is. You may not wanna know you're are eating blood sausage or sweet breads.. but you'll miss out on a mouth-gasm if you do. Snack on some empanadas and matambre if you are really hungry and even try the lengua if youre feelin' saucy. OK.. one last thing, for desert, order the multy layer ojaldre cake made by Anita. Think flaky buttery filo dough intermixed with an even every-layer distribution of dulce de leche, topped with a homemade chanitlli whipped creamed and chocolate sauce (aka mouth-gasm #2). I'm biased however my gramma (born and raised in buenos aires) makes these cakes and sells them to this restaurant every week.. and they're so good it'll make you wanna slap yo' pappy. Salud!

Reviews.Author: Christian M.
Reviews.Content: i have been visiting Tango Sur for a year now.  My girlfriend and I came here, the first time, for a steak-date and it became an instant favorite.We have sampled much of the menu.  We have never had a bad meal.  The filet, the ribeye, the marinated eggplant and the grilled provolone plate are some of our favorites.  Our unquestioned number one is the filet for two.  For around $30 an enormous filet is presented on a table-top grill.  A portobella mushroom wine/garlic (I think) sauce is bubbling around the outside of the steak.  It is big enough to feed two and enjoy leftovers the next day.  As if that weren't enough, a small house salad is included beforehand.  The service is always at the top of their game.  We've never waited too long for anything.  The wait staff is always polite and prompt.  They do everything that they can to make their guests satisfied.  Since there isn't ever liquor on the bill (being a BYOB joint), I think it's important to remember to tip accordingly.  They deserve it.There is almost always a wait for a table.  Give the gentleman at the door your name and number and he will call you when your table is ready.  Go a few blocks West to a great Irish pub for a beer while you wait or a couple blocks South to a number of other bars (namely a cajun place with a big red sign). If you haven't tried Tango Sur yet, it's time.  You will be so happy that you did.

Reviews.Author: Stephen B.
Reviews.Content: Frequent diner here - in the past.Came in with a group of 4 on a Saturday at 7:30 and was quoted a two hour wait time.Normally I'd go someplace else since as a personal rule, I don't wait 2 hours for any kind of food; but the couple we were with hadn't been here before and I raved about the place so we decided to put our names down.We went down the street and had appetizers and drinks then came back two hours later ... only to find out that we need to wait longer.Half an hour later we are ushered inside - not to sit, mind you but to wait in the "waiting room." The waiting room basically looks like an antechamber to a David Lynch crackhouse or whorehouse ... dim, bleak and dungeonesque.Another half hour later we are still waiting and looking around while groups of 4 that just walked in are being seated.So after a 3 hour wait, I swear at the seating attendant, I swear at the "host" and walk out.We ended up going down to street to Sushi Mura which was fantastic - as usual.TL;DR version: food & BYOB good but not 3 hours wait good. Service & hospitality is awful.But given that the place is always on a wait AND it averages 4 stars on Yelp with 1000+ reviews I'm sure it will continue to do just fine ...

Reviews.Author: Anna M.
Reviews.Content: Food was good but the lighting is TERRIBLE! It's loud, and can accommodate larger parties. Make sure you get the complimentary bread with chimichurri... I swear that sauce pairs well with everything on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Kate C.
Reviews.Content: We went with a group of six on Saturday night around 9.  The wait was two hours but we decided to wait it out since we had brought alcohol with us to drink.  They take your cell phone number and call your phone when your table is ready so we just went to a bar down the street and had a few drinks while we were waiting for our table.THIS PLACE IS WORTH THE WAIT!  They finally called us around 11 and we got in right before the kitchen closed at 11:30.  We got our food and ate and drank there until they literally kicked us out at 2!  We ordered about three dishes to share at the table and it was more than enough food.  The salads are meant for sharing and the meat is amazing!I will definitely be going back!  BYOB steakhouse is the best idea ever!  Great for groups, dates or just about anything!  Just go knowing you will have to wait!

Reviews.Author: Jason A.
Reviews.Content: If you're a meat and potatoes type of person, you must try the Churrasco.  This place offers a great cut of meat and the chimichurri is such a great compliment to the steak.  The potatoes are so delicious.The dining area offers a great date setting and BYOB is a plus.Be sure to make a reservation on the weekend or be prepared to wait up to an hour.

Reviews.Author: jay c.
Reviews.Content: Hands down, MY FAVORITE RESTAURANT IN CHICAGO!  The empenadas are amazing and the steak is always perfectly seasoned and perfectly medium rare.  You can take your girl with a bottle or two of vino cuz its BYOB, get the filet which is actually TWO filets, its costs $24, split it for $5, and they bring out bread and salad for both of you.  Order a couple $2 empenadas for starters and BOOOM, you just went out on a date and impressed the lady, had one of the best steak dinners of your life, got legit stuffed, and pretty drunk for $33!!!  I'm a big eater and I can't count the times I've dropped $100 on dinner easy, had like 3 beers, she had 2 glasses of whatever, and walked away from dinner still hungry and barely tipsy, we all know what we want and its not that.  Don't get me wrong will wait for this amazing meal and you will wait for at least 1 hour, but it's worth every minute.

Reviews.Author: Melissa B.
Reviews.Content: I love this place.  I truly do.  However this past weekend I went there with some friends from out of town.  We check in with the guys at the door at 9:11pm and we were told it would be an hour and half wait.  We gave him our number and set out to kill some time. Shortly after 10pm we stopped by to check on the progress of our wait.  The same guy at the door told us that it will be an hour and half from the current time.  We had him check where we were on the list and he had our check in time at 9:42pm.  When we tried to explain we were her earlier, he basically laughed at us and told us to go away and he would call.  We were disappointed, however my friends wanted to eat here badly.  We hung around for a bit longer then decided to go somewhere else.  We never received a called telling us our table was ready.  This it a great place - however not worth the time -especially on the weekends.  I have been during the week and you are able to get a table (with an hour wait).  But I would suggest not trying this place on the weekend.  Why they don't take reservations is beyond me.

Reviews.Author: Daniela L.
Reviews.Content: Loveeeee this place! I've had almost every steak and the spinach empanadas are amazing!

Reviews.Author: Jen S.
Reviews.Content: You have to loooove meat to eat here.  The food was so good and the portions are huge.  The wait staff were super nice and me and my sister got 1 free dessert because we couldn't decide which one we wanted.  I give it 4 stars because when I came here I had a reservation (and only for 2 people) but we still had to wait 15-20 minutes.  But the food and service made up for it.

Reviews.Author: Heather V.
Reviews.Content: The wait is totally worth it!!  Go as early as you can to put your name in then head to one of the cool bars or coffee shops on Southport...or you could go grab a couple bottles of wine if you didn't realize it's a BYOB place.  Tango Sur has a romantic but lively atmosphere...candelight dining at its finest!  The service is pleasant and laidback so don't go if you're in a rush.  And the food...outstanding!  Empanadas is a must try and any of the chef appetizer specials.  Be sure to get dinner for two with steak on a hot plate.  You'll definitely have leftovers!

Reviews.Author: Geoff C.
Reviews.Content: Oh, Tango Sur, how I miss you.  Que lastima.After Tango Sur (and 10 days in Argentina), you'll never find yourself wanting to go to an American steakhouse again.Service and wait times can definitely bah-low, but its worth it.Haven't found anything as good in SF or LA but if gladly accepting recommendations.  Guacho Grill seems a bit too corporate.

Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: If you can avoid the crowds, give this place a try.  We got here on a Saturday around 4-5ish to avoid the crowd and were seated immediately. The restaurant is BYOB so drink up!  (Note, if you get there and there's a wait they'll give you wine glasses so you can drink while you wait.)  Portions are huge!  I got the El Fillet which looked like two 16 ounce fillets with some mashed potatoes. This dish could've been split between two people.  The sauce they used was super yummy.  You can't beat the price either, the El Fillet came out to $25 bucks and I promise you, you'll come home with 2 meals worth of leftovers.

Reviews.Author: Ed L.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur was my first Chicago dining experience right after I got off the plane. It was 11PM, I was starving, most places were closed but Tango saved my stomach. This Argentinian restaurant had a great atmosphere: dimly lit with candles on each table, themed art and seating, Latin music in the back ground, groups of nicely dressed yuppies chatting the night away while enjoying the BYOB aspect. That's right peeps, BYOB and no corkage fee. A couple next to me definitely went hard and destroyed 2 bottles of wine, very impressive.Food was also quite excellent. Started with a couple empanadas which were freshly baked and piping hot. The ham and cheese one tasted like a Hot Pocket so I would go with the beef. It comes with this awesome garlic pesto-like sauce that's so off -the-hook good you would dip anything you can get your hands on in it. The main attraction was the Vacio, a cast iron baking dish loaded with like 5 pounds of flank stake smothered in a herb oil and capers and surrounded by wedges of sweet potatoes. The menu claims it serves 2 but I think it can easily satisfy an entire 3rd world country. Lets just say, I don't usually take doggy bags home but this monster owned me. Prices are great when you consider the portion, service, and ambiance. This was an awesome start to my vacation!

Reviews.Author: Jessica W.
Reviews.Content: It's a BYOB Argentine Steakhouse. Need I say more? Well, I'm going to.I went with 4 other people and we split 2 beef, 2 chicken, and 1 spinach and cheese empanadas, all of which were good and worth the $1.75 or however much each one is. I especially liked the spinach and cheese ones. We also got the provoleta (provolone w/ roasted red pepper), which was good, but nothing special. My friend and I split the the Vacio, which was a gigantic piece flap meat (that came w/ really good sweet potatoes!), and we could not finish even half of it.The rib-eye, which two of the guys ordered, was definitely the tastiest. But they'd been there before, so they knew what to order. And now I know what to order the next time I come. And I've learned not to order so much food here also, cause we left with lots of leftovers. And I've also learned that maybe 5 bottles of wine for 5 people is too much... In total, our meal was about $130, which I think is so reasonable considering the massive amounts of food served.

Reviews.Author: Pamela M.
Reviews.Content: Almost 600 reviews already... need more be said?My steak was ginormous and around 12 bucks. Service very good. Liquor store close by for BYOB. Dark place, get cozy. It's Lakeview - take public tansportation.RECOMMEND!!

Reviews.Author: Kelly C.
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Tango Sur after hearing rave reviews.  All in all, I thought it was good but not awesome.Highlights:  The empanadas were really yummy, and the chimichurri sauce is amazing.  I love to put it on everything I ate.  BYOB and the location in the cute Southport neighborhood are extra pluses.My mistake:  I ordered the Beef Vesuvio which was just ok - primarily because I like medium rare steaks and the Beef Vesuvio is thoroughly cooked with cheese inside.  Bad order choice.  The steaks (i.e. El Filet) look much better with the spinach mashed potatoes on the side (plus the opportunity to put more chimichurri sauce on).  The grill plates to share also look tasty (that's what I would try next time).The downside:  the place is totally packed with tables squeezed into every spare corner which makes it fine if you are the big group, but a little too much if you are trying to go for a 2 person meal.  I also found the candlelight lighting a bit too dark.

Reviews.Author: grace y.
Reviews.Content: Took my boo here after I won money from my fantasy basketball league. The BYOB was clutch and definitely helped made this meal affordable. I've only been to one other Argentinian steak house in frisco which was pretty tasty so I already had a pretty high benchmark. We had the following:-empanadas: while these were good.... The fried ones that they sell for a dollar in LA were much much better. These empanadas were quite doughy and had a lot of crust that had absolutely no flavor.-Bread: while I wouldn't normally review the bread, this bread was an exception because it was rock hard. I literally took one of the mini loaves and made a knocking noise with it against the table.-El fillet: ok I have no complaints about my dish. It was a delicious filet mignon with spinach mashed potatoes that were both cooked and seasoned perfectly.-Ribeye: I love me some red meat but my boos steak whch he ordered medium rare was slightly undercooked. It tasted almost like beef sashimi.So the real winner at this place was the chimichurri sauce. Garlicy with delicious herbs (parsley I think?) I pretty much used the sauce on just about everything.

Reviews.Author: Jon H.
Reviews.Content: MEAT MEAT MEAT MEAT.We walked in on a Saturday night, no reservations, table for 2 immediately. NICE. Romantic setting, candelight, and MEAT.  Our server was a little pushy in telling us to get the "specials" which for the life of me I couldn't really figure out the difference. Anyways, we settled on beef & spinach empanadas, the tortilla argentine, rib eye for me, and sirloin for her.The empanadas are super affordable ($2 each) and very tasty, served with a chimicurri sauce. We had the beef once (very good and spiced ground beef) and the spinach one (so-so). The tortilla espanola like dish was very flavorful (but lacked some punch) and a great portion size.Then came the rib eye. OMFG it was good. Cooked perfectly medium rare, aged, tender, juicy, and HUGE. This thing was like a baby, prob 15+ oz. DId i mention they cooked it perfect medium rare? So good. I had like two bites of the potatoes (which are like roasted potato wedges doused in butter), but focused on the meat. They also give you a great red wine / shallot/ garlic sauce to dip the meat in. So good. She found the sirloin to be really good as well (although I still prefer the rib eye for its tenderness). Overall, good meat, nice setting, BYOB (no corkage fee), and also great prices (we got out under $70 with tip for a full on steak dinner). The only reason why I take a star away is the service. I found our server to be WAYY to pushy in the specials, and when i ordered he cut me off and said "i really think you need to order the specials". when i conceded to ordering the meat off the non-domestic page, he hurriedly swept my menu up and said "okay fine".LEGIT meat.

Reviews.Author: Emily B.
Reviews.Content: Get the filet and order it medium rare. It won't be as tender as a steakhouse version, but the Argentinean juices and potatoes it comes with are delicious. You will walk out stuffed.The place is very romantic, BYOB. They kind of have strange, small "wine glasses," so bring your own of those too if you want to avoid spilling on yourself.

Reviews.Author: Khadijah L.
Reviews.Content: We did make reservations. BYOB no corking fee. Beware, we were going to bring a birthday cake but there was a fee for that.I had a wonderful, satisfying meal here. The empanadas are good. The steak came with a salad (simple lettuce tomato onions).I had the El Filet. Which is super super tender and simple, with a side of spinach mashed potatoes. I definitely think it was great value for money. The place is kind of crowded, though. Can't wait to try Folklore in Wicker Park.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer E.
Reviews.Content: If you love meat, then this is heaven. I went with a friend on a Wednesday night and we waited for a half hour. It was cool because we brought wine with us so the servers gave us some wine glasses while we waited.We started off with the empanadas...yummm!Then we ordered the Para Dos which is basically a sampler of all their meats. We didn't even got through half of the meal because it's ginormous. Oh well I made steak and eggs for my leftovers the next morning. Overall, it's pretty noisy and crowded so it's not good for dates but if you love good food (esp. meat) then this is the place for you :)

Reviews.Author: Joyce C.
Reviews.Content: We came here with a party of 4 a couple weeks ago for the first time.  Damn was it dark in there. The tables were pretty close together. It's BYOB. There are taper candles lit  on every table without a guard. The owners must like to live dangerously!! Onto the food. They start you off with bread and starter salads.  They also give you oil and vinegar to make your own dressing. We got 2 each of the beef and the ham and cheese empanadas for apps. Tasty!! I thought the beef tasted better and as a bonus added surprise they have a hard boiled egg inside. Yummy!! The ham and cheese empanadas were good too, with lots of gooey cheese but it reminded me of a more classy version of a ham and cheese hot pocket.  The chimichurri sauce that came with the empanadas was freaking delicious!! We got the Lomo Relleno and the Para Dos. The menu said each dish served two people. Between 3 big guys and me, it was rough finishing all the meat... quantity is not an issue here! The Lomo was a large hunk of meat that was cooked with portabella marsala, whereas the Para Dos was a selection of meats, sausages and innards that are simply seasoned and grilled.  Everything tasted pretty good with the exception of the sweetbreads. They were way overcooked, super chewy and greasy, definitely the worst thing that night.  Total of apps and 2 entrees came out to about $88 without tax and tip.  Not bad!!I'd stop back again, but next time I'd definitely get a side or two to break up the meat fest.

Reviews.Author: Michelle M.
Reviews.Content: Girls night dinner...check Two bottles of wine...check No corkage fee...AWESOME! An awesome night with the ladies what better place to go to then Tango Sur. I've heard so much about this place and we decided to head over to TS for some dinner, wine and great convo. We walked into this dark lit place and asked if we could be seated for a party of four. Lucky for us there was a table right by the window. We asked to have our 1st bottle of wine uncorked and we started to figure out what we wanted to order. We started off with an order of Spanish and chicken empanadas. I have to say that I've had better empanadas but I can't say that it wasn't good. OK, dinner time. I ordered the breaded chicken with a side order of potato's. I didn't eat any of the potato's so I can't comment on how those tasted but I can say that the chicken was very delicious. Over all I have to say that my first experience of Tango Sur was a wonderful time but I believe its because of the great company that I was with.

Reviews.Author: Leah B.
Reviews.Content: Holy cow was that good.  We took our daughter here to celebrate her birthday.  I was apprehensive about trying something new for a birthday meal but boy were we happy we did.  The place is dark as its only lit but candles on the table.  Its kind of hard to read the menu but our awesome waiter Eduardo made suggestions that were right on the mark.  We started with a chilled seafood appetizer.  It was $10 and we got a huge plate of crab legs, octopus, mussels, shrimp and we also ordered 2 empenadas, 1 chicken and 1 beef.  After eating that alone we were pretty full and we only ate about 1/2 the seafood.  The Chimichurra sauce that came with the empanadas was awesome and we put in on everything served to us.  For our main course we ordered the La Filet which me and my daughter split, and my husband ordered prime strip steak that was a special for the evening.  The filet came with 2 steaks and was $24.  It was tender and seasoned perfectly.  The spinach mash potatoes that accompanied the steak was so good as well.  My husband loved his strip steak and the roasted potatoes that accompanied his dish. For dessert we shared a Flan and had espresso with milk.  I have never ate Flan that tasted that good.  If I would have known how awesome dessert was I never would have eaten so much of my dinner!!The meal was amazing, the prices are extremely reasonable and our server Eduardo was perfect.   We went on a Sunday at 4:45 and it almost full when we got there and when we were leaving at 6:30, there was a wait for a table.  Also, its a BYO with no corkage fee.  Cant go wrong at this place!!!

Reviews.Author: Nic N.
Reviews.Content: Unlike anything I've every experienced. I'm convinced that bathing in their Chimichurri sauce may have rejuvenating qualities, similar to the fountain of youth, but for now I'm content with dipping my steak in it.Everything we ordered was delicious...everything. Order as much as you can and bring an extra stomach. The atmosphere is great, I love the fact that its BYOB, and the location rocks. Tango Sur is a MUST visit if you enjoy steak and live anywhere near Chicago...and by 'near' I mean anywhere in the United States...or Canada for that matter.

Reviews.Author: Tera D.
Reviews.Content: I went to Tango Sur this weekend with a group of 7, and it was good. Not great, but good. It definitely served it's purpose, which was accommodating a big loud group that wants to get extremely drunk off BYOB wine, and enjoy some good food while doing it. We had no reservation, so our wait was about an hour and a half, but that's not bad for a group of 7 on a Saturday, plus we waited at a bar down the street - hardly painful. We split a bunch of appetizers, with the only standout being the marinated eggplant, which was very flavorful. Provolone cheese dish and empanadas were just ok. On to entrees. When it comes down to it, I guess I'm just not that into huge slabs of meat. I'm really picky with steak and generally only order it at top notch steakhouses, so I played it safe here and split the Para Dos with the bf. For me the highlight was the fried sweetbreads, which were super addicting dipped in chimichuri sauce. It's so dark in the restaurant that it was kind of hard to differentiate the meats on the platter, but I think my bf's favorite was the flap meat. Overall, go with a group, but don't go out of your way.

Reviews.Author: Carla G.
Reviews.Content: The service at Tango Sur was good. The host seated us pretty quickly (outdoor seating so I'm not sure what the decor/ vibe is like inside) It was a great evening to be outside so I was happy about that, but the tables were a little too close for comfort- started to free like we were talking over the table behind us.The waiter gave us his recommendations (we ordered both recommendations).  It might seem silly to mention but the bread was really good. The salad was a complete dissappointment. Our meals came out looking and tasting pretty good. Our server kept checking in on us from the moment we were seated which was nice, but we were starting to feel a little rushed. I yelped Tango Sur before I went there and I have to say it got my expectations up.. sad to say it was a little overrated. I would consider coming back here to check out the inside.

Reviews.Author: Cherie O.
Reviews.Content: I don't think there are words. I'm still stunned.Argentinean steakhouse.Always crowded with people lined up outside trying to get in. Worst parking ever, and there is no valet. But they tell you to use next door's valet service. Inside is super dark and loud. Friendly service (with the exception of the manager/owner).Salad is not impressive. Very simple.Main course: Parillada Para uno/Para dos: Heaven is really a place on earth. Steaks are huge, chicken dishes the size of your head...it is a must go.BYOB...how much better can it get??And the cost is super reasonable: $22 for the Para Uno. The only downside is that if you bring in your own cake (as my friend did for her husband's birthday, they charge you $1.75 per person to serve it).So why five stars? Because the meat is just out of this world.

Reviews.Author: Mary H.
Reviews.Content: If you have given this place a bad review, there is simply something wrong with you - and I don't even like red meat! After coming here for the first time last year, I consider myself a changed woman. This is the only place that I have EVER (literally, ever) ordered a steak for an entree and the only place where I have shoved so much of said red meat into my belly that I nearly exploded. I consider myself to be among the pickiest of picky eaters and I look for any excuse to return to Tango Sur (so long as I have nothing important to accomplish afterward and can fall into a pleasant meat coma). Not only is the place affordable and serve amazing, unbelievable, finger-lickin-good food, but it's a BYOB. AS IF IT COULD GET ANY BETTER. And yes, as with all good things there is normally a bit of a wait, so make a reservation for the larger parties and come early or during the week for a date.

Reviews.Author: Alison T.
Reviews.Content: Although I rate Tango Sur 5 stars on food and service (once you're seated), I must say that as a frequent diner here, we were extremely disappointed with our last visit. We were heading to a early concert and I called at 5pm to see if there was a table available for 4 and to say we'd be there within 20 minutes. The gentleman who answered the phone was very nice (per usual) and said we would have no problem at all, yet he didn't take my name or anything. We got there and while one of us parked the car, the rest of us came in and said we had just called. The gentleman said as soon as our 4th diner came in, we'd be seated right away. 5 to 10 mins later, all 4 of us are accounted for and head over to the host to get our table. He then tells us that there are no tables available and the wait is now an hour. For a landmark neighborhood restaurant in Lakeview who's customer loyalty far exceeds any other's, we were extremely disappointed to be treated that way. While I understand that they don't take reservations for more than 6 people (which doesn't quite make sense anyway), the entire restaurant was pretty much empty with tables for 10-12 set up. While I understand that they do cater to large parties, dismissing a group of four, who has dined at the restaurant 20+ times, is just bad business and bad customer service. In the past, I have raved about Tango Sur... and I'm afraid to say that this last experience will have me not coming back.

Reviews.Author: Liz K.
Reviews.Content: Let me set the scene: Cold March evening, group of six, armed with wine, and ready to chow down on some serious food...and we were not disappointed. Our server, Peter, was attentive, polite, and had great recommendations for appetizers - he definitely did not steer us wrong with the empanadas (one each of the five different types), provoleta, and lengua. Most of us were full after the appetizers! Then for dinner we collectively ordered the pez (salmon), two churrascas (12-oz sirloins), the berenjena (eggplant), and the vacio relleno (not sure exactly, but some sort of flank steak with great flavor). Everyone was impressed. I cannot wait to reheat my berenjena; it was like a vegetarian lasagna but with 10x more flavor than you would ever expect. I also had multiple bites of the vacio relleno and it had such a flavorful yet tender bite, that I was truly impressed! Food and table service aside, I was a bit disappointed with the cramped table situation and the noise. When I saw that it was "intimate" on Yelp, I kind of expected a quiet and subdued place, but it was just packed, loud, and dimly lit. Just not exactly what I had pictured in my mind's eye - but that only knocks off a star.I'm saving this for the last because I don't think it's quite as important as the fact that we had a delicious meal, but the front of house service was not my favorite. I made the reservation two weeks in advance and got a confirmation call the day of; great, right? But we got there three minutes late for our reservation and only then did they tell us that they were 15-20 minutes behind with their reservations - and on top of that, there was no room to wait in the restaurant! They had my number, so why didn't they call? I'm sure a large percentage of their patrons are within walking or a 15 minute drive range, so why wouldn't they let us know beforehand? That's really my only complaint. I love the fact that it's byob (I'm new to this whole byob-in-chicago thing) and we saved a ton of money but still had a great meal. Definitely add it to your list of places to try.

Reviews.Author: Mark T.
Reviews.Content: After hearing so many good things about this place, I added Tango Sur to my "most wanted to try" restaurant list. It had been on there a while until i finally made it for dinner last night.Dinner was a "Grub With Us" meal with a group of six others (it was booked for a group of eight. Simple math: two people don't show up=more food for us!). The place looked great from the inside: map of Argentina on the wall, various paintings on other walls. Plus there was a "roving" guitarist playing various salsa and other types of Spanish music. (I think a Gypsy Kings tune was played once during the night). The waiter was very pleasant as well.Now of the food. The special menu that we had included chicken empanadas (I'm a big fan of empanadas, whether it be here or any other Spanish restaurant), spinach ravioli (yum), berejena (eggplant w/spinach, cheese, and tomato sauce), and three meat dishes(short ribs, skirt steak, and flap steak). The flan that we had for dessert was nice and creamy. The only bad part about the experience (and the reason for the two star deduction) was the noise level. I hated screaming across the table to my dinner companions. The live music was nice, but to me it added to the noise that drowned out the conversation. Considering that this was a weekday night, I can only imagine how weekends at this place can be. My sister went to this place on a Saturday a few months ago, and she had the same review as me: great food, but uncomfortable noise level. I'd go back for the food; but I know how the conversations during the night would turn out.

Reviews.Author: Rowena M.
Reviews.Content: There are a couple of pluses to this place - being a BYO joint is a huge plus.  The ambiance, being dim and having candlelights definitely add to the romantic vibe.  The chimichurri sauce is to die for - honestly, I think you can put that sauce on wood and it will taste fabulous.  The prices are quite reasonable especially if you order the steak that serves 2 people.  We ordered some empanadas, the eggplant, and the prosciutto with hearts of palm for appetizers.  All of those were good; the empanadas were a tad salty but good.However, the steak was just ok.  We had a group of 6 and just about everyone ordered something that was highly recommended - el filet, vacio, lomo, the ribeye, etc. and the steak, while tasty, was just ok.  The vacio, which I ordered with a friend, actually came out tough.  So yeah, this place was ok but I can't say I'll be running back anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: Love You O.
Reviews.Content: This place is SO overrated! I was really excited to check it out after seeing the great reviews. Maybe I just got unlucky here? But the food was really nothing special and wasn't very tasty. I got the churrasco and thought it was really bland and fatty. My mom got the porkchop and it was super dry and again, very bland. My brother and dad got some steaks which were just also very sub-par. (My dad can make a WAY better steak). On top of that, the service was awful. I had to get up and ask a bus boy for our check because that's how MIA our server was. We didn't even bother trying to ask what was on the dessert menu. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Piya P.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this place!! I always get the Argentinian churrasco. Oh and the flan is to die for!!! Four stars because of the 2+ hours of waiting on Fridays/Saturdays. But if you go in on a weekday around 5/6, there's no waiting. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Brad M.
Reviews.Content: This place really impressed me. From the atmosphere to the service to the food Tango Sur was the best meal this weekend. I ordered El Filet, and couldn't have been happier with my choice. It was cooked to a perfect medium rare, tender enough to melt in your mouth. That was the first time I had spinach mashed potatoes, and now I wonder why I ever ate regular mashed potatoes! Around our table everyone seemed to agree that this place was top notch, you can't go wrong with great food and BYOB. Definitely a great place to bring a date as well.

Reviews.Author: Ivonne Marie C.
Reviews.Content: The food is not bad, but I've had better. I came after lots of hype from a couple of friends, so I was expecting the best meat in North America - not quite. I've been to many many Argentinean restaurants, and can honestly say, I've had much better. The place is too cramped, we were sitting in a table right next to the door - cold air coming in with every patron. The wait staff was nice for the most part, but there was a waiter that didn't like us very much until we started speaking to him in Spanish, before then he seemed annoyed at every request for water we made. The desserts were also not very impressive. I will say - I LOVED the spinach mashed potatoes :-) they were delicious - I want more. I'd go there just for that... but given I don't love potatoes that much, there goes that. With all honesty however - Please take my review with a grain of salt. I've heard many many wonderful things about this restaurant, it is actually too bad they don't take reservations. I am not the person to listen to when deciding to go here, since I don't particularly love meat - I'd rather have fish any day, than cow. So with that said, do know that the waits are usually super long, they don't take reservations, and don't sit at the table near the door if it's open - it is super uncomfortable. Try it... most argentineans I know in Chicago love it.... and that's enough for me... but I wont be going again - not really worth it in my book.

Reviews.Author: cassie r.
Reviews.Content: If you are an impatient person, Tango Sur is not the restaurant for you. The wait is pretty heinous, especially in the summer and on weekends, so in order to fully enjoy this place you have to be willing to stick around for an hour, possibly two before even sitting down. That being said, the food isn't bad. Since this place is BYOB (with no corkage fee, which is nice), make sure you have some good stuff on hand. We had an excellent Pinot Noir that paired nicely with most everything we ordered. If you do have to wait for a table, you may be lucky enough to score a seat in their waiting room (essentially a tiny, very dark enclave with a few tables) where you can enjoy said BYOB while hoping a table opens soon.When I went, I started with the scrumptious chicken empanadas. I then partook in the Pechuga De Pollo - chicken grilled with chimichurri and veggies. It was a bit bland, but not awful. A serving of German Chocolate Cake certainly highlighted the evening (actually, just looking at the tray of delectable desserts was memorable enough - they ALL looked so good). A lot of people heart this place - and those people are typically of the beef-loving variety. As I am not, my interest is a bit more subdued.

Reviews.Author: Valerie M.
Reviews.Content: I've been dying to try this restaurant. Its a really small restaurant, not a lot of seating. I had the El Filet and it loved up to all the rave review. Tender and well seasoned. I like the spinach mashed potato's just added a little salt. It's byob. There's a jewel and cvs down the  street just in case you need to stop and by some wine.

Reviews.Author: Belmar S.
Reviews.Content: I had a great time with my cousin at this place. First time eating Argentinian food and it was really good.We started off with Fondu. Melted cheese on bread mMmMm it was the first time I ever had Fondu.  We later had our main course, it was a Pork course para tres and man that was such a HUGE platter of meat! The pork was juicy, tender and flavorful but I wasn't amused by the blood sausage haha. Finished the night with some good wine and Flan. Very very good.No corkage fee and there's a wine store right across the restaurant. Very good. =0)

Reviews.Author: Nina B.
Reviews.Content: Don't say I didn't warn you...you WILL have to wait.  A very long time.  A very, very, very long time (up to 2 hours) if you come for dinner on a busy weekend night.  The downside: waiting is tough, especially if you are hungry.  The upside: you've been forewarned, so you will come earlier know, with the expectation of waiting.  Is the wait worth it?  Quite simply, yes, it is.  This authentic Argentinian steakhouse serves up amazing beef dishes (I recommend the filet mignon) for a very reasonable price.  Plus, it's BYOB, so you can bring whatever bottle (however fancy, or not) you'd like, and there is no corkage fee.  The portions are VERY generous...we ordered the filet mignon "for 2," and there was still at least a 1/2 pound of meat left when ordering.  Keep this in mind when ordering....you may even be able to split an entree meant for one, if you're not super hungry and you've had an appetizer or two (I recommend the chicken empanadas...crispy and delicious)The atmosphere is relaxed and romantic, everything a great BYOB should be.  The atmosphere is delightful, with low lighting (only candlelight on the tables), adding a warm glow to the place.Insider's tip:  If it's cold outside and you need to kill some time, there's a bar a few doors down.  You can put your name down as well as your number, and they will call you when they are ready for you.  Remember to keep your phone out, though, so you don't miss your chance!

Reviews.Author: Jessica O.
Reviews.Content: I actually lived in Argentina for a while, and was craving a little taste of home... so! I decided to try out this Argentine place.  It definitely reminded me of Buenos Aires.  The empanadas are highly recommendable, especially the corn.  I love me a jumita empanada and this was just right.  The bife de chorizo was ginormous.  I went with a teenage boy, and he wasn't able to eat it all.  That is saying something.  The meat is actually from Argentina and therefore is grass-fed and just tastes different.  Like it should.  I don't eat meat except for very rare occasions, and this was worth it.Afterwards we ordered the alfajores with dulce de leche.  Truly authentic wonderment of the mouth.  Yumz.  BYO. Come here.  Split entrees.  Feel like you're in BA, and go for a little tango afterwards.

Reviews.Author: Doe L.
Reviews.Content: i LOVE tango sur! but that's probably because i'm as carnivorous as a girl can get! It's true the wait is long but it all depends.  I just went on sunday and we were able to make a reservation because we had 6 people. Even so, there was no need for one because we came in at 6:30pm.  Don't get me wrong though, when we left at 8ish, there was a LONG line to be seated! (so don't be surprised if they start itching to get you out!)The service was actually very quick and attentive. Of course that's because it wasn't completely packed when we came in.  We brought our own wines to drink so we were set for that!  We also brought in a cake to celebrate a birthday so BEWARE, there's a dessert charge!!  they didn't warn us of that so that was lame considering all they did was grab some plates/spoons and handed us one regular knife.I love the short ribs there.  it looks like giant kalbi (korean) but a LOT thicker.  unfortunately, one was extremely salty but the others were absolutely delicious!  if you're VERY picky about that, maybe you should mention "not too salty" when you order, but in my opinion...  i wouldn't risk it.  I'd rather get 1 salty one and 2 good ones....  then 1 good one and 2 plain ones!!  but that's just me! =P

Reviews.Author: Jane T.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE STEAK!  And this place is just to die for.  I swear I go through withdrawals if I don't make it out there within 5 weeks.  The chimichurri sauce is amazing, some places like to add vinegar to it but they serve it without, which is just purely delicious.It gets insanely packed during the weekends and they do not accept reservations.  So bring a bottle of wine and enjoy it in the waiting area while you wait to eat.  Sure your stomach will growl from the aromas around you but it's totally worth the wait! (NO CORKING FEE!)  Or try to head there around 5:30 or 6pm, just as the crowd is forming.Service is a little slow but the wait staff is extremely helpful and friendly.  Portions are huge and you'll have plenty to take home, but make sure to ask for extra chimichurri to take with you.

Reviews.Author: Cindy K.
Reviews.Content: Ever eat so much meat that you feel like you're sweating the oil out? Yeah, that's me right now. I rate restaurants in proportion of taste to price. My entire meal including tax & tip was $24. I got empanadas and the sampler of meats shared between two people. I would have liked a little less oil, but otherwise the meats were all savory and delicious. The meat was surprisingly tender. The portions are huuuuge. I'm talking The Flintstones huge. But I was a trooper and managed to eat most of my food. I even ate those two little slices of tomato, just for variety.Also, it's BYOB with no corkage fee! Pick out a nice red, prepare to wait quite a while for a table, and enjoy your evening.(fyi, it's expect a long wait after 7 every night.)

Reviews.Author: Linda SingaSong S.
Reviews.Content: Decided to check out this quaint spot on southport since I've heard so many referrals from my buddies. I went with a friend, who happens to be a chef, and really loves his meat :) Since he's been here couple times, he knew exactly what to order. We had a beef and veggie empanada and the sauce it came with was excellent! I don't remember the names of our entrees, but we ordered 3 different meat dishes. They were hugeee, really tender, and flavorful. I would recommend this place to anyone who has a hearty appetite and loves their meat :) Next time, I'll def go back with a bottle of wine

Reviews.Author: Mike B.
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to go here for YEARS, but for some reason it would just never work out. We finally made it for an anniversary dinner.Appetizers: Chicken Empanada was awesome - crispy, flaky, well spiced and all around perfect, but the prosciutto and hearts of palm fell a bit flat. More than anything, the prosciutto was fairly bland. We also ordered a side of the Chorizo sausage. Order this. Seriously. I nearly fell out of my chair it was so good.My wife and I shared the Vacio, which is a large portion of meat (flap meat? Not familiar with that cut, but..) that's highly seasoned and very tasty. There are some fatty/gristly parts, but it wasn't too bad in that regard. We ordered it medium, and it was more of a solid medium rare, which pleased me but not my wife. The pesto-like sauce they give you is excellent, and as a hint, try it with the bread! I think it was a bit disappointing to eat on a brown sheet of paper in a place like this. I understand the food can be a bit oily & greasy, but...It was dark, but overall seemed clean. The bathrooms were well maintained. Service was forgettable - slow and inattentive, especially for a fairly uncrowded Monday night. We sat for long periods of time with empty water glasses. It took 15+ minutes after we ate to get our server back to order dessert. Dessert was served on a table full of food & bread scraps (my wife is the slob!) and nobody made an effort to clean them up at all. I sat with my credit card hanging out of my check for probably close to 10 min, and it wasn't picked up until the host saw me looking annoyed. Price - very reasonable! Especially since it's BYOB w/o a corkage feeI'll be back - even if it's just to get more of that chorizo sausage

Reviews.Author: Kelly B.
Reviews.Content: Based on everything I heard and read I decided to try Tango Sur.  It was a first date and I picked this restaurant because I heard the food was great and it was BYOB which meant we could keep the bill down.  We had to wait an hour.
