However, they call you when your table is ready so we simply headed a few doors down to a bar and had some beers.  The atmosphere is intimate and romantic, the food was fabulous, and the service impeccable.  Be warned that the portions are HUGE!  We could have easily split something and still both been full.  But we simply took the leftovers home and had a second meal so that was fine.   I had the steak cooked rare and is was mouthwatering good.  THIS PLACE IS WORTH THE LONG WAIT.

Reviews.Author: Diana S.
Reviews.Content: I love the empanads here. In the summer it can get really hot since they don't have A/C and it gets pretty crowded. The food is really good, but I actually like Las Tables better. Also, it's BYOB, which is great for most ppl but I don't really like wine and I like going to a place that has a liquor license and makes great cocktails.

Reviews.Author: Annie W.
Reviews.Content: Great service: efficient and cordial. BYOB has got to be the best invention. Complimentary table bread comes warm and is actually quite good! TORTILLA DE PAPAS! Ok, I loved this in Spain and it's kind of like quiche. It was very tasty with a nice dose of onion and potatoes--my favorite dish of the night. Was superexcited to eat its leftovers today. Ensalada Tango Sur: very basic and actually quite plain. A few fat round slices of tomatoes and onion rings atop romaine greens. Came only with olive oil and vinegar. El Filet: Two big pieces of filet with spinach mashed potatoes. Our medium rare was closer to a medium and charred on the surface. The mashed potatoes were too wet--would've preferred it more chunky.

Reviews.Author: Ian S.
Reviews.Content: The wait here is extremely long, but honestly, who cares. Tango Sur will take down your number and let you wander off to the numerous bars down the street on Southport. Plan for an hour+ wait to get a table, and at least 2 hrs for the meal.I got the filet at the recommendation of the server and was not disappointed. It was one of the juiciest steaks I've had. The meat wasn't the highest quality in the world, but the price/performance ratio was up there.Our bill came out to exactly $100 for four people who ordered meat entrees with a pile of empanadas to start off the meal. BYOB makes it all possible. Can't beat that!When I visited, my group was fortunate enough to get a table outside, so I'd recommend that if you aren't on a date. The inside is dark and cozy, leading me to believe that it is probably not as suitable for a group.

Reviews.Author: Lesley G.
Reviews.Content: I went to this place with a big group and it was totally awesome. My review may be distorted by the fact that it was a great group and we were at various stages of drunk by the time that we got there, but I really had a great experience. We had ten of us and since it is BYOB we had ten bottles of wine. And since my friends are super classy and some were further along the drunk spectrum, we also had a case of miller lite, a bottle of jager and a six pack of red bull - because that seemed like a good idea to a drunk person in a liquor store on their way to a nice dinner. They get a five partly because the staff was very nice and dealt with us well, considering I can only imagine we were a bit louder and more obnoxious than they would have liked. (Yes, we drank all ten bottles of wine and did serious damage to the case and jager.) [At this point I should probably apologize to anybody else that was there that night trying to enjoy a romantic dinner - sorry!]The food was awesome. Everyone loved their dishes. My friend and I split the fillet, which was plenty for two people because they give you two medallions and tons of mashed potatoes and such. It was cooked perfectly and really not expensive since we split and it was BYOB. I think the meal cost me like $15, unheard of for the quality.The vibe is cool and great atmosphere for a date, a small group of friends, or a large party. For bigger groups you gotta call way in advance, the place isn't that big and it's super popular. I'm pretty sure they don't take day of reservations on Friday or Saturday, so you should plan ahead, or get there early. Or just bring an extra bottle of wine and settle in for the wait, it's part of the experience.

Reviews.Author: William K.
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, quaint place with great food, and the waiter even laughed at my jokes. Top it off... you can bring your own wine.What more can a yelper ask!Tango Sur is a steak place. I had the filet stuffed with spinach and cheese. Even typing it triggers an immediate Pavlovian response. Holly had a regular filet, which was great but easily bested by my (drool drool) spinach-stuff steak menagerie.Our appetizer was some meat-filled pastry concoction. Sorry, I don't remember the name. They had 4 flavors: beef, chicken, spinach, and ham. Try them all. Oh, and they're bigger than you'd think. So, bring someone to share all the goodness with.In fact, all the portions were large. Holly had a whole 'nother filet, it seemed, to take home to her skillet. Prices for a Chicago restaurant were very reasonable.Tango Sur is a 4+/5- experience. The place's nice vibe put me over the edge into 5-star territory. Check it out.drool again... yow, bill

Reviews.Author: Rosie S.
Reviews.Content: I went to Tango Sur last friday and it was absolutely amazing.  The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that it took forever for our waiter to bring us the check.  I have no idea what our meal was called but it was to die for!!!If you are a meat and potato person...then you have to go here!!And it's BYOB!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Dom G.
Reviews.Content: I am a fan and thank all the review before me for the raving recommendations that helped a bit....We ordered the Argentinian fillet steak, naturally reared and grass fed, these fillets are mouth wateringly tasty when they cook them with the amazing chimichurri sauce.  Get it medium rare not medium well...it is suppose to be red and delicious!3 not 5 cuz....Better yet 5 for food and 1 for host!The atmosphere is dark, the place is crowded and extremely noisy.  The host is VERY rude...(as I am writing this I am reading some reviews...and boy the host is really a D@CK!)   I like that I read "if you can afford to be humiliated by Mr. Nobody at the door..."But all in all...we had a good time and where it is hard to cook on a grill in the winter in Chicago, we will enjoy the food here till summer if we want grilled meats!..

Reviews.Author: Andrew T.
Reviews.Content: We had an appetizer, the grill for two and the lomo relleno and a desert and it came out to about 100 bucks - but it was totally worth it.  Leftovers were good for another meal too.The lomo relleno flavor is good, but it it alot of one thing, so I suggest ordering if you have at least 3 people at the table.  The mushroom sauce is tasty.  The best to me was the flank steak (close second were ribs) on the grill for two combined with the chimihurri sauce? yummmmmmm... no rice here though for those that might want some.recommend the brazilian soda guarana to wash this tasty meal all down!

Reviews.Author: Anna V.
Reviews.Content: A weird sexy bizarre place that helps itself bigtime by being BYO.Walked in on a Sunday night after the premiere of Urbanized at Music Box and didn't have to wait. The empanada was underwhelming and these salads, though traditional, serve an empty purpose for me... so I was meh. But my steak was really good. I think it was flatiron. GIANT piece of grilled meat that I loaded up with their chimichurri, which I love (it is garlicky - that's chimichurri). Mostly very tender. My date for this had the meat parillada and loved it all except the blood sausage. Atmosphere here was great when we came here. There's a little outdoor section but inside it has that small dark South American feel... hiding away, being intimate. I bet a number of children are conceived after coming here. Everything about it is sexy and people seem to get very intense with each other while they are on dates - I know, because this is a great place to people watch, and the close-together tables make it very easy to hear their personal conversations. In my head this is a 3.5-4 but really, the BYO changes things. After a bottle of wine, I think everyone feels warm and fuzzy about this place, and I bet it's why the reviews are so great. It's also nice to be able to just choose something you like, pay at-value for it, and get pretty plastered by the time the meat arrives.

Reviews.Author: Meghan P.
Reviews.Content: WOW.  You will not leave hungry!  This has been on my list of places to try for quite som time.  So when we decided it was a special occassion to live it up and go it was totally worth it!Strangely enough we picked a really great wine!  It was an argentinian malbec so it was of course the perfect occassion being at an argentinian steak house with no corkage fees:)Service was a little slow and odd to start.  Upon our arrival we had called ahead to put our name in, but it was a bit later in the evening on a Tuesday that it did not really matter too much.  Although there was no real host... it was just like you want to sit here? Is this is ok?  I was like sure I guess... I don't know what the other options are considering I have never been here, but meh.  When we sat we waited slightly longer than a table that sat next to us to be waited on.  Perhaps our server was busy.... We were presented with waters before he came and when he did reach us he had a corkscrew ready and was ready to take orders and see what we needed help with.We decided to get some of the empanadas a la carte (beef and spinach/cheese).  These were probably just about the best empanadas I have ever had.  They were delicious and the sauce that goes with them is like heaven. Our meals included a salad however we were extremely underwhelmed with it.  It looked like garnish on a plate.  White onions, sliced beef steak tomatoes and lettuce not tossed just placed... it was very strange.  Later, we discussed how they did have appetizing salads on the menu so it was odd to receive... and honestly quite unecessary.  When we received our meal, we received a FEAST.  If you want meat.... this is it!  This is a coma that you will never come out of:)  We ordered from the specials... he got the filet which was like 2 filets!  And I got the vesuvio so it was a stuffed ribeye with spinach and cheese.  We both came out of there stuffed to the brims and with leftovers in hand.  The ambience of the candles, the live guitar, and the overall bustle makes you feel like you have escaped from the city.  But then you bite into the flavors of your food and it surpasses all expectations.  The service is a little touch and go, however they mean well.  The food is great, except for the unecessary salad that was stuff on a plate.  We will definitely return and SHARE.  THE PORTIONS ARE HUGE!

Reviews.Author: Kristen M.
Reviews.Content: Really great food and service.  It gets crowded and there tends to be a wait.  The food is amazing, I wasn't very familiar with the menu items and ended up ordering essentially a massive plate of meat which was really good, and I learned what sweet bread is...not so good (in my opinion).  Really great place for a date night, the atmosphere is great.

Reviews.Author: Ginny D.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur - how I worry when I bring folks here! This weekend you were great again - maybe our last visit was just an off night?  Empanadas are delicious and the el filet is hands down your best dish ever followed closely by the bife vesuvio. Thank you for a lovely experience!Oh and props to the wonderful guy when I called in who actually offered to hold us a table for 4 if we were going to be in within the hour (we were right down the street in a cab en route) - the service is improving I hope! Waiters still need to work on their table side dialogue as they can't give much if any descriptions but glad to see the improvement - for the first time ever our waiter actually told us what he would recommend! :)  When in doubt, go with the el filet and start with the empanadas. You don't really need to know much more than that to enjoy this place.

Reviews.Author: Eric B.
Reviews.Content: Amazing. Go. So much meat. The Filet Is $28 and you get two oversized, delicious filets. My gf and I typically over-order, but we split this and couldn't have been more full. The empanadas were fantastic, as well. Plus it's BYOB. Go early though. Wait can be long.

Reviews.Author: Misse D.
Reviews.Content: We went to dinner here with another couple.  Since we were too late to snag reservations, we had to show up and put our names down on the list.  They said it was a 90 minute wait but it was closer to 2hr.  The dining room was a tad too loud for my taste.  It might have been because there were several large groups.  Once the food came (empanadas, steak), it was well worth the wait.  Although we brought 2  bottles of wine with us to drink, a group offered us their leftover wine.  Sweet!I was entirely too full to try the dessert.  The dinner was extremely reasonable considering the cost.  I will definitely come back when I'm in the area.

Reviews.Author: Hass L.
Reviews.Content: Excellent Argentinian meats, though they tend to be a little salty. However, great value for money, and they were one of the pioneers of the whole BYOA thing back in 2005.The inside can get really loud - the acoustics magnify the sound of drunk buffoonery especially, so outside seating is recommended.

Reviews.Author: Dana M.
Reviews.Content: I love this place!  I think Sunday night is the best day of the weekend to go.. it's not as crowded as a Friday or Saturday night even when reservations are made.  It's dark inside and the only light you get are from the candles on your table.  It's also very loud inside so don't expect to have any real conversations or you'll just have a lot of people nodding and pretending they understand.As a part-time vegetarian, meaning I order fish or vegetables whenever I can, even I have to get El Filet every time.  It's super tender even when you order it medium-well.  They give you a generous portion of meat with spinach mashed potatoes and I usually have leftovers for two more meals after my dinner there.  Don't forget the chimichurri sauce even though it gives you garlic breath.  It's delicious with the filet!Don't forget the red wine!  It's BYOB.

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: Two and a half hours.  Yes.  Two and a half hours we had to wait to get into this place on a Saturday night!  Tango Sur came highly recommended to us by a friend living in Chicago.  We put our name down and the host told us the wait would be two hours so we decided to go to the nearby dessert place (see below review).  We closed down the dessert place and we still didn't get a seat at the restaurant!  At that point, I was going to be really pissed if this place wasn't absolutely delicious.Anyway, we were finally seated around 10:45pm!  Our waiter, Martin, was fabulous.  I told him we waited forever and he comp'd us the provoleta (?) cheese.  It was melted provolone cheese and it was yum!  Between five girls, we ordered the empanadas - one of each.  I actually only tried the spinach one but it was good.  My girlfriends thought that the empanadas here were the best they've ever eaten.We also ordered El Filet and the El Vaccio.  I think El Vaccio was pork (I don't remember...maybe too much wine?) and of course El Filet was steak.  What I do recall is the the filet was very good. We ordered it medium rare and it was grilled to perfection.  The seasoning and sauce they made was amazing.  El Vaccio was huge but I wasn't as big of a fan.  For dessert, our waiter comp'd us yet another item: the flan.  It was a bit on the sweet side for me. We were all so full that it was hard to finish the dessert.  By nights end, we were all happy and thought the restaurant was well worth the wait.  The best part?  The entire meal only cost $80!  We were so impressed with the service and all the comps, we ultimately gave our waiter about a 30% gratuity.  I would highly recommend this place and despite a plethora of restaurants I still have yet to try in Chicago, I actually would come back again!  One final caveat though.  This place is really small, really noisy, really dark, and quite humid when there it's a full house so dress in layers so you can take off your clothes as you eat.

Reviews.Author: Sid V.
Reviews.Content: This place can really vary from one of the very top BYOB places in the city to disappointing and frustrating.  But I've had many more good meals over the years than bad so four stars it is.  First the bad: lately they've been undercooking the steaks, this never used to be a problem.  They also sometimes char them excessively on the outside to the point of being burnt without even being done inside.  And the salads are always terrible with the mealy tomatoes that are so common in Chicago.  The service is all over the place from attentive to MIA to rushed to decent...it all depends on the night, how busy they are and who your wait staff team is.  The waits can be horrific.  Finally, the prices have crept up over the years, it is no longer the bargain it once was. OK, enough of the bad.  The good includes delcious red meat in many forms (mixed grill, el filet and lomo are some of my favorites), killer sweetbreads (not for all), awesome empanadas, above average ambiance (I happen to like dark and noisy myself, some may not), the best chimichuri sauce in the city,  the pineapple cake desert and the BYOB service is usually on top of things, bringing you an ice bucket for your beer, etc.  And when the kitchen is on and you bring the right wine, you simply can't beat it for a good, reasonably priced meal in Chicago.

Reviews.Author: Christine N.
Reviews.Content: Two words: absolutely fantastic.BYOB? I wish more restaurants in San Francisco were BYOB. Anyway.....We ventured over to Lakeview for this gem of a restaurant from a recommendation of a friend that lived in Chicago for 6 years. Tango Sur is, hands down, the best restaurant that I've been to in Chicago so far. Granted, I've only been here for 24 hours. We had the empanadas (my first time!) with spinach and cheese, and beef. The spinach and cheese empanadas came highly recommended by the waiter, but to my surprise, both me and the boy preferred the beef. Regardless, the empanadas = fabulous. They were fried, but the dough was light and perfectly crisp. The waiter took the time to walk us through the history of empanadas, which was appreciated.The name of the steak for 2 that we ordered escapes my mind, but it's safe to say that if you say, "I want the steak for 2 with all the yams around it," the waiter will understand. It's marinated and surrounded by a DELICIOUS chimichurri sauce that I repeatedly scooped on to my sweet potatoes. Warning -- the portions of this steak are HUGE. 22 ounces. Yowza!The only reason why I give Tango Sur 4 stars instead of 5 is because our silverware was repeatedly dirty. And by dirty, I mean that there was leftover spinach on our forks. Yuck.If it's warm in Chicago, take advantage of the outdoor seating - it's perfect for people watching.For out of towners, please do NOT miss Tango Sur. It's a must.

Reviews.Author: Mary d.
Reviews.Content: Ay, dios mio! This restaurant is magnifico!My friends and I gathered here for a girls' night of meat and wine. We were seated very promptly at a table inside.The four stars is for the fact that it took our server about 20 minutes to finally come over and interact with us. In the meantime, we'd had to flag down someone to open the wine, and we asked twice if we could put in our order (hungry ladies!)But, ah....the wait was worth it! Each of us had a different type of empanada, which all disappeared in a matter of seconds. My ham and cheese was QUITE sabrosa!And then we come to the steaks. I ordered a sirloin, medium rare, which arrived perfectly cooked. It was HUGE...easily three steaks in one! With a salad beforehand and potatoes on the side. The chimichurri on the side was so fantastic, I could have swam in it!So, having gorged ourselves on our steaks and guzzled back almost all of the MAGNUM of Yellow Tail shiraz we'd picked up at CVS (class!), our thoughts turned to dessert. Well, our waiter had assumed we were celebrating someone's birthday (I mean, four cute ladies feasting on steak?? Obviously it HAS to be a momentous occasion!) and he came out with a flan covered in fabulous dulce de leche.Simply.heaven.(And I lived off the leftovers for the rest of the weekend...)

Reviews.Author: Diana T.
Reviews.Content: I came here last night and didn't feel like my experience lived up to the hype. I figured that coming here on a Tuesday night would give better service because the wait staff has more time to spend on each patron. Who knew it would be that busy still. However, I think I saw my server a total of 3 times. And I had to ask for him 2 out of those 3 times. The quickest item that came out on my table was the check. I noticed that other tables were having issues with server attention too. I guess it just comes with the territory.The grilled cheese (not sandwich) was delicious. Beef empanada was really good with the chimi sauce. And our meat that was served on a grill was huge. The food was good, but I prefer Las Tablas steakhouse. I would go back, but when I can go to Las Tablas...why should I?

Reviews.Author: Cynthia L.
Reviews.Content: Let me first start out by saying that I absolutely love this place but I only love it for one dish... Vacio.  I would give it 4 stars but because I only like one dish, it's not really worthy of 4 stars.If you go here and order the Vacio, it's very reasonable. The salad unfortunately looks unkempt (if that's even possible).  It's just a bunch of lettuce with a few onions on top.  The oil and vinegar is tasty but rather meh as far as creativity is concerned.I've ordered other steaks here but I always go back for the Vacio!!!It's the only dish that's worth any money.  It's that good. Don't order anything else.

Reviews.Author: Christine M.
Reviews.Content: Been meaning to go here for quite some time and was finally able to make it a couple weeks ago. Every time I pass, it's packed to the gills - no matter the season or the day of the week. I definitely know why now!This place takes me back to sitting in Argentina, delicious steak, red wine and french bread...nothing more simple or more delicious of a meal. Start off with the simple salad and go for the steak -- you won't be disappointed. Makes a great spot for not only a hot date, but a group evening as well. Added bonus is the BYOB factor, bring an extra bottle or two because the ambiance will suck you in most definitely.

Reviews.Author: Kari E.
Reviews.Content: While in Chicago my guy and I were looking for a reasonably priced steak place - yelp led us here. The place was busy, but we only had a short 5 min wait on a Sunday night. We were crammed in to our table but no one was moving around much so it wasn't really a bother. We ordered a scallop starter. The scallops were TINY, but tasted good. The warm crusty rolls sopped up the remaining liquid. We both ordered the 12oz. sirloin, cooked medium rare. The meat was very tender and well prepared, but with out the chimichuri sauce, lacked flavor (sirloin isn't the tastiest cut, but even some salt/pepper on top would have done well). And the meat was BRIGHT RED, yet there was no sign of blood which leads me to believe the meat is pumped full of dye at tenderizers like the steaks I get from SuperTarget when I'm in a pinch. The roasted potatoes that came along with it were very good and tasty. The salad left a ton to be desired though - just lettuce, tomato and onion with oil and vinegar dressing. Maybe this is traditional? I don't know. For the price it was fantastic - we got out for under $50. And it's the type of place we usually wouldn't choose to eat at. If I went back, I'd maybe be a bit more adventurous and get one of the combo plates.

Reviews.Author: Danny M.
Reviews.Content: Holy mother of meat, Batman. This has been the greatest meal I have had in Chicago - hands down. Started with empanadas - waiter recommended spinach and cheese. Went with it, probably would go beef next time. Shared the Vacio which is a half slab of range grown flap meat sliced and filled with olive oil, garlic, parsley sauce, then cooked and served on a grill with mashed sweet potatoes ideal for two. This was probably the greatest thing I have eaten in a long time. Meat was perfectly charred, cooked to perfection, resting in a beautiful sauce that I wanted to slather on anything, and high quality. I could not stop eating. I am still having the meat sweats from this experience.Recommendations - Always busy. Try to get it on non-peak hours (for dinner, get in before 6). Sit outside if you can! Go BYOB because, well, why not? Limited parking on Southport but not impossible....And, if nothing else, its next to Dairy Queen. What more in life do you need?

Reviews.Author: Jeanie P.
Reviews.Content: Candelit dinner... huge chunks of roasted meat.. BYOB! what's not to like? Sigh I really wanted to love this place...Unfortunately, the meat was rather chewy...which has been mentioned in other reviews. I had the El filet (most popular dish) which is a filet mignon with side of spinach mashed potatoes. And it was not as tender as expected. Filet mignon is supposed to be like the butter of all steaks but this was not. Sad.Anyway everything smelled tantalizing and delicious, but at one point it became like overwhelming. It's like that feeling when you first walk into a Chinese buffet and you are like HOLY CRAP THAT SMELLS GOOD! and then you walk out never wanting to smell that chinese food again. It was something like that on a smaller scale.  And I had tried bites of my other friends' dishes which were all good but not mind-blowing. The presentation for the dishes for two looked like an amazing smorgasbord of meat meat meat. The flavors were great especially the chimichurri sauce which was like crack. Even though my dish didn't come with that sauce, I asked for some, and the waiter was great about accommodating (and brought me TWO!)  The service was excellent even though it was very hectic inside. They do charge a plating fee if you bring a dessert/cake for a birthday etc. ($1.75/person). They also take reservations for larger groups (but not for smaller ones! so beware). Overall, not particularly enthused one way or the other. Love the BYOB of course, but the meal felt really heavy. And the salad was probably the worst salad concocted that I've seen at a restaurant (lettuce+tomatoes+onions--- no dressing-- just vinegar and oil on table). Maybe I just don't get it? Is this an Argentinian thing? Overall great, fun ambiance just sorta disappointed in quality of meat.

Reviews.Author: Dan N.
Reviews.Content: Yet another Lakeview establishment that I should have visited much sooner.  I went here for a late dinner with one of my buds, although to most outsiders, it probably looked as if we were on a romantic date.  The place just exudes that kind of romantic vibe: dark, cozy, candle lit tables.  It's also BYOB, so it only makes sense to split a bottle of wine.  Anyways, onto the food.We started with the empanada's (one chicken and one ham and cheese).  You HAVE to try these--absolutely delicious.  I might even say these are the best appetizer's I've ever eaten.  We then split the "Vacio for 2".  Although I was a bit nervous about it being described as "slab meat", it was super good.  It was cooked well and best eaten slathered in their amazing chimichurri sauce.  The meat was delicious, but definitely not as tender as a nicer cut of beef would have been (filet, ribeye, etc).  I'm not going to take away any stars, but I gotta say, the service here was TERRIBLE.  We literally didn't see our waiter for the last 45 min of our meal--no exaggeration at all!  Never asked how we were doing, never offered dessert--I'm not even sure why we still tipped the guy 20%.  Either way, the food here was delicious enough to make up for it.

Reviews.Author: Nadeem P.
Reviews.Content: So this place is pretty hyped up, from all of the yelp reviews to the 2 hour wait in the evening. To be honest I'm not sure why this is the case. The ambiance is definitely the winner here, the food was OK, nothing special. The prices weren't bad, and compared to an upscale steakhouse you'll pay half, however the quality of the meat is proportionate to the price...This is a great place for a date, however I don't see myself coming back anytime soon. Next time I want an amazing slab of meat I'll shell out the additional dough for capital grille...

Reviews.Author: Ben D.
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere is amazing, bring a bottle of wine and enjoy a great steak! The wait was about an hour but the are several nearby bars to pass the time.  The dessert is to die for as well!

Reviews.Author: Annie S.
Reviews.Content: This place is great. The atmosphere is really nice and romantic, the food is fantastic,  its BYOB and it is extremely reasonably priced! What more could you ask for? I had the entrana and it was awesome - as I'm sure all of their steaks are. The vesuvio potatoes that come with are great also. The empanadas were amazing, I tried the ham & cheese and chicken, and at $2 each and very close to my apartment, I'm going to have to come back and try all of them. By the way, portions are ENORMOUS - my leftovers were enough for two meals the next day. $19 for three meals? Hell yes.

Reviews.Author: Jane F.
Reviews.Content: Noqui was dish, beef a little chewy. Overall atmosphere was great. Candlelight, romantic setting. Love that it's byob!

Reviews.Author: Anna P.
Reviews.Content: I love..absolutely love this place. I came here about 3 years ago at the urgence of a friend and have been coming back again and again.Where do I begin? A wonderful ambiance...attentive staff...unpretentious attitiude and a great deal for amazing food. It's BYOB, so there is always pleasant acknowledgment when the check comes.

Reviews.Author: Angie C.
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing first experience here last Friday for date night.  You can't make reservations - we got there around 830 and the wait was 45 min to 1 hour for 2 people.  We were in no rush, so we went to a nearby bar to grab a couple of drinks.  Just as we ordered our 2nd beer (less than 30 min. later) they called that our table was ready!  We were happy to chug our beers and scoot back to get our table.  Once we arrived we were promptly seated to a quaint table for two outside.  If the weather is nice I highly recommend eating outside - it's more private and relaxing than inside which is loud and very crowded.We brought our own wine (BYOB) which was great; we shared the Argentinean tortilla for appetizer (having studied in Spain, I love tortilla espanola) - it was cooked to perfection and delicious.  We got the filet steak (came with 2) and the steak stuffed with spinach and cheese.  The stuffed one was better, but both dishes were amazing (and huge).  The staff was also very attentive and courteous.The bill ended up being less than $60...for a hot date night and amazing steak, you can't beat it!  Will definitely be back and would love to bring friends or family.

Reviews.Author: Jarrad M.
Reviews.Content: Wowee!I went with my wife and a friend on a Sunday night. The places was packed but the 30 minute wait wasn't a problem. We went over to Blue Bayou for a drink and to pass the time. We were finally seated and after that it was golden! The service was outstanding with great recommendations made by our server, Cristian. My dining companions both had filet mignons that looked fantastic. They were effusive with praise for those filets. I had the backed salmon with penne pasta which was also outstanding. Coffee and dessert rounded out the night.It had a great atmosphere and vibe, despite the close quarters. The food was exceptional, especially considering how quickly it arrived from the kitchen. The staff was superb - attentive without being intrusive. The crowd was good, too, with a nice mix of young and old. It was relaxed and casual environment. Prices were surprisingly affordable - bordering on cheap, really - given the quality of meal. Complaints? If I had known it was BYOB I would have brought wine. The coffee was a little too weak for my tastes. Um, that's about it. If this  is all that I can take them to task for then they are definitely worth your time and money. Go. Eat. Enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Author: Robin C.
Reviews.Content: Thought this place was great.  Expect it to be crowded and if you're going there for dinner on the weekend, bring your patience.  Don't worry, it's worth it.  It was pretty crowded and a tight squeeze - definitely a good date place with dim lighting and candles.  I, of course, was NOT on a date so that made it actually a bit awkward because there seemed to be couples everywhere.The service was prompt and the food was incredibly tasty and a GREAT value for the price.  We had the beef empanadas which were hot and fresh and our steaks were so delicious - perfectly cooked and seasoned.  Nothing too complicated, just great tasting.  You won't miss all the traditional steakhouses and all of their a la carte sides - I was stuffed from some great steak with a good amount of food to take home as leftovers.  May want to consider bringing your fatmanpants.

Reviews.Author: Adam V.
Reviews.Content: Worth the wait.  Put our names in at 6:20 and went down the street to the local tavern.  They called 40 minutes later and we were seated at a table shortly after. Recommendations: Get there early.  They were turning away tables of 4 for the night starting at 6:20.  Don't sit by the windows, the atmosphere is lost by the street lighting.

Reviews.Author: J T.
Reviews.Content: The food's great and well priced.  I'm a huge fan of the provolone appetizer and when it's offered, the shrimp app.  Perfect.I know, people complain abut the wait here.  Oh well.  Leave your number and head down the street to a bar and have a few cocktails while you wait.  And yes, the serve seems "spotty" to some, but the evening isn't exactly about how the servers entertain you here.  Bring a few bottles of wine and enjoy some convo with your dinner mates.

Reviews.Author: jenna p.
Reviews.Content: After scouting this place out on Yelp, I decided to give it a try. The wait was an hour long, and my boyfriend did nothing but complain about it, so we(HE) decided to go to D'Agostino's instead. I was so disappointed. But, they had taken our names down and wrote down our phone number and were told they would call us when they were ready to seat us. Good thing! We had just ordered our drinks at D'Agostinos when they called. It was only about 10 minutes later! Needless to say, I made the BF leave his pizza place for some delicious Argentinian food (and a MUCH better atmosphere).We were put in a waiting room where wine glasses were provided with seats all along the wall. We were a little disappointed about that, because they acted like we were going to be seated right away, but we were only in the waiting room for about 10 minutes.I am so glad we waited. I had the 12 oz. Churrasco. It was way too big for me to eat, but it came with delicious dipping sauce with olive oil, garlic, and parsley. Sooo good! My boyfriend had fettuccine, booorrrring. Oh, well. We also had the Brazilian soda. We have had it before at a Brazilian friends' house, and we have never seen it anywhere else so we were SO excited that they had it because it is SOOO delicious. If you have never had it (it's called Guarana, which reminds me of something gross because it kind of sounds like guana, but it's NOT!), you should definitely try it.We didn't BYOB, but next time we definitely will. And their WILL be a next time. I'm giving this place 4 stars because we've only been here once and I was only able to try one plate. I'm sure I will be making it 5 stars some day.

Reviews.Author: Tyler W.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic dining experience at this cozy Argentinian steakhouse. Servings are well portioned, and the price is just right for the delicious food you consume. And the place is BYOB, too, so feel free to bring wine!You must understand that this place is a bit popular, so be patient when waiting to get seated or place food orders!

Reviews.Author: Candice R.
Reviews.Content: I was starving when I sat down. I mean, seriously, eat two rolls and load on the butter starving. There was no silverware on the table, so I got creative. I dipped the bread in butter. We got service pretty much right away, but were only given water and menus. Once they found out we were waiting for two others, the service dropped. But they were crazy busy. It was a nice night, about 60 degrees, and the patio was packed, as well as the inside of the place. It had a great ambiance, darkly lit inside and very cozy. Once our other friends got back, we got service right away. Finally some silverware! And, an appetizer. The baked cheese with red peppers. Oh, yum. Did I say that I love baked cheese? The entire table was in love with it. I mean, you can't go wrong with cheesy goodness. The salad that comes with your meal is basic. Lettuce, tomato and onion, and they give you oil and vinegar to dress it. It was lame. I love an oil and vinegar dressing, but I don't like raw white onions, and the tomatoes were gritty. Ew. We had a nice break before the main course, which was awesome. I don't like rushed service. The entrees were all delicious. I had the bone-in rib eye, my friends had the lomo, the beef vesuvio and the filet entrees. We shared all of ours, and there wasn't a single thing that tasted bad. The spinach mashed potatoes were so so good, and my friends beef vesuvio was probably the best out of the table. My rib eye was cooked perfectly, and our portions were so huge that we all had enough for a big lunch the next day.A great experience. I can't wait to come back and try other things. Plus, $24 for a salad, rib-eye steak and mashed potatoes, and NO corkage! Hands down a winner.

Reviews.Author: Eric M.
Reviews.Content: As you arrive to Tango Sur do not be afraid of the line, it's always there (or so I'm told). We put our names in and were told it would be an hour and a half. Not a problem, we just went down to a bar and had a few drinks. They take your cellphone number to call you, which I first thought was great, but discovered a flaw in the plan. We were under my friend's name and they called it at some point and either a) someone else had this name or b) said they were my friend and go seated. When we left the bar to check on our name, they said they had already seated us. We then waited another hour until we were seated.The dining room is packed with people and you will probably sit very close to another group. The walls are decorated with nice posters, albums, and murals of Argentinian culture. Our waiter had a very thick accent and it was difficult at times to not only understand him but just hear him in all the noise. We didn't peruse the menu long b/c we were starving, but luckily we all found something right away. I had the bife visuvio, which was a piece of butterflied steak filled with cheese and spinach. I will admit the steak was good and Tango Sur is BYOB so we had some good wine too. Unfortunately, I found the service to be so-so, the plating is very rustic and can come off sloppy, and our desserts weren't anything to write home about.If you can somehow avoid a long wait, I would recommend, but not sure it was worth over two hours.

Reviews.Author: C T.
Reviews.Content: Yeah.  No.  I didn't like this place very much, I'm sad to say. I don't like writing bad reviews, so this is not an enjoyable thing to do, especially when so many people seem to like this place.WAITINGIt was Wednesday night at 8:30 and there were people waiting to get in, so I thought, "This place must be good."  Well, I think people wait there so long, not b/c of great fanfare, but because once you're in the restaurant, they keep you captive with the incredibly slow and unresponsive service.SERVICESlow, so slow. Something as simple as bringing out the salad after the appetizers took a long time. We sat there staring at the crumbs on the empty table for a very long time (the crumbs from the crumbly, unsubstantive bread that is provided), of course all the while making sparkling conversation, not JUST staring at the dumb crumbs in silence... We saw waiters with salads whizzing by and placing a ton of them on other tables, but not ours. We thought maybe our meals didn't come with the salads. No. It just took about a half hour to get after our appetizers. And then it was another long wait for the food.My water glass stayed low throughout the night with our waiter no where in sight to ask for more.FOODNot so great. Not impressed. At first, you're excited b/c it LOOKS great. The portions look HUGE and flavorful. But while the steaks are large, they were all tough (and we ordered ours medium-rare). We all needed to drown it in chimichurri sauce to try and compensate. The meats we had were: strip steak, sirloin, veal chop, bone-in ribeye. All tough.We also had the empanadas (beef and a spinach/cheese) and were disappointed. We drowned those in chimichurri sauce as well, to compensate.AMBIANCE:Nice, we were outside. I recommend it if you have the choice, weather permitting. Otherwise, it's VERY LOUD inside the restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Wendy L.
Reviews.Content: This place is AMAZING. After reading tons of great reviews on Yelp, I was really excited about going to Tango Sur. My boyfriend had been there before and said the food was great. So we went on a Friday night. Yes there was a wait and yes it was crowded, but considering it was a full house, the service wasn't as slow as I expected. The place is small and very dark. There are candles on the table and it's a BYOB. (Guys: This place will score you some points with the ladies.) The food is fairly priced for the large portions that they serve. I had the Bife Vesuvio, which was a large prime steak stuffed with spinach and cheese. The cheese melted so nicely, it was almost creamy. The meat was served with a side of roasted potatoes and what I believe was a chimichurri sauce. That plate was more than enough food for me and it was delicious! I HIGHLY recommend this place.

Reviews.Author: Eman S.
Reviews.Content: Ordering steak at a restaurant is a rarity for me, but I knew I would if I went here and it got me really excited. We arrived on a Wednesday at 7:30pm and were seated right away (there were 5 of us). We brought three bottles of wine because they are BYOB with no corkage fee. Ordering off their specials menu was the easiest and I got the filet with salad and potatoes. My serving was HUGE and could definitely be split with two people. I ended up taking my one of two fitets home with me. The salads that came with the meal were pretty bland and I probably would not get them again. My wife, a vegetarian, actually recommended we go to this place because she loves the eggplant appetizer as a meal. So she got that and I tried it and it was so good. Another couple that was with one ordered the dinner for two with sweet potatoes and they said their meat was delicious and I tasted their sweet potatoes and they were so good! They ended up taking a bunch of it to go also.As for the prices. My meal was about $25, the appetizer was about $10 and the 2-person meal was $36, so a little pricey, but worth it.

Reviews.Author: Tammy H.
Reviews.Content: Let's start by saying I really want to give it 4.5 stars.  Joe and I always walk by this crowded restaurant on our way to Dairy Queen and I've always said, "Let's go!  Look at that huge chunk of meat on the table!" (Sorry Trinidad!!)  So, we read some reviews and were warned of how busy it is on weekends, and we've seen the people crowding the sidewalk waiting to eat.  We went on a weeknight and were told we had to wait, which was also expected.  What wasn't expected was that they seated us within the time that they had told us we would be waiting - I can't remember exactly, but something like a half hour to 45-minute wait time or something.  The menu is beautiful, and by beautiful I mean full of different cuts of steak and all kinds of delicious meats and sides.  We also read the empanadas were great, so we tried a couple of those... I think a spinach one and a ham one... Both very delicious, especially with the sauces given to you. Then, our meat came!  Both of ours came with a different kind of potato.  Joe's potatoes were very, very dry.  Mine were delicious.  So was my meat, I didn't care for Joe's because it was covered in a red sauce... Also, the waiter didn't look at us funny when we told them we were good with just water.

Reviews.Author: Alex F.
Reviews.Content: You won't exactly believe your'e in Buenos Aires, but you'll have a great meal. The empanadas were pretty good, and the steak I had was great... for corn-fed American beef. I brought the GF here for a nice date. The portions are big so we split the empanadas and the steak. It worked out perfectly. It's really nice to sit on their patio in the summer.I dont know if you can make reservations or not, but you should try because it gets really packed.Don't forget to bring a bottle or two of some good malbec.

Reviews.Author: Jason P.
Reviews.Content: We went here for a friend's bday dinner and the place is a little quirky.  First of all it is not a huge place, but they were able to squeeze us in at 5pm, which was nice.  It is byob and they have no corking fee which is another plus.  They did however make up for this by charging $20 for allowing us to bring in a cake.  My meal consisted of a spinach empanada, the berenjena, and the papas vesuvias.  The empanada was good and the chimichurri sauce complimented the spinach and cheese filling nicely.  The berenjena was excellent.  It was baked eggplant with spinach and a few different cheeses topped with a tomato sauce.  It was almost like an eggplant parm, without a lot of the unhealthy parts like the breading of the eggplant.  My friend who frequents this place, and actually orders the steak said the eggplant was the best thing on the menu.  The potatoes I could have done without.  They were just ok and really I just used them to soak up the extra tomato sauce from the berenjena.  The service is a little off here.  At the start of the meal I felt like it was just bad.  The waiter just seemed to give a 3 minute monologue without taking a breath on the menu and specials and then just left.  When I ordered a meal without steak, I got an incredulous look and he asked me twice if I was eating eggplant as my meal.  At the end of the day, it wasn't too big of a deal.  The steaks seems to come out rarer than were ordered.  Most of our party of 12 had this happen, so I guess order accordingly.

Reviews.Author: Brit M.
Reviews.Content: Hella romantic.  I went here with my friend Marco, and literally fell in love that night.  It passed as soon as we left.We sat outside, and I honestly believe if we sat inside we'd be married.  Tango would make a killing if they had a live in priest.  Anyways, on to the food.  It was a BYOB which is cool, and we sat outside.  It was kind of rainy, but the service still kicked through.  We ordered a couple empanadas which, to be honest, I could of eaten about 10 they were so good.  He ordered steak something, and wasn't happy about it.  I ordered some chicken and veggies dish - I am horrible with fancy names for dishes, but essentially that's what it was.  It was delicious!  I didn't want to share a desert, and end up a parent so we left.  Overall, the service was great... no complaints.  I know where to bring my husband of the future if he doesn't put a ring on it fast enough.

Reviews.Author: Jeannine T.
Reviews.Content: Reasons to love Tango Sur:1.  Great Ambiance - perfect for a date.2.  BYOB3.  Generous portions4.  Flavorful steaks.5.  The chimichurri sauce6.  Outdoor seating during the summer.That sauce is to die for, and the only restaurant that I know that prepares it without vinegar.  They do not take reservations so brace yourself when visiting during the winter.  Wait time can extend way over an hour for a part of over 2 on the weekends.The preparation and the texture of the steak is sometimes inconsistent, and 9/10 times I get the rib-eye.  Medium seems to be just right.  However, to me flavor is everything and this place is close to perfection.  I could have given it a 4 star due to this, but this is one of the few restaurants that I actually revisit several times a year - maybe even more.  Speaking of... I haven't been back in quite some time.  Think I'm due for a Tango Sur dinner soon.

Reviews.Author: Aaron L.
Reviews.Content: Had a nice experience at this place. From the moment I walked in, I had to survey everyone else's' food and I knew I was going to like it.We had a reservation but had to wait for about 30 minutes in the back room. It was like a maze walking through a tightly cramped front room to get to a tiny back room where it felt like everyone was pre partying since it's BYOB. There is a lot of hustle and bustle in this place which gives it a good feel; like you're in a hot spot. Celine and  I split one of the main dishes ( I can't remember the name but it is advertised as for "two") and there was a ton of flavor. The presentation is fun as it is on the tray/stand so it's on display for the world to see. Problem is the meat was really tough. I ordered it medium rare and they cooked it medium rare, so it brings me to the conclusion that the cut of steak just wasn't right. I wanted to really like it since the flavor was so good, but damn, my mouth was getting tired of chewing. The other group we were with order a similar plate but their meat was very tender. Take it under advisement that you should ask your waiter what dish is the most tender so you don't get stuck chewing some rubber.The main reason why I give this place 4 stars is my glass of water was filled 20 times and I'm not even exaggerating. I love when people pay attention to the little things, because in the end it's the little things that really count.I will definitely come back to this restaurant next time I come to Chicago and hope I have better luck

Reviews.Author: Mindy S.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite restaurants in the city, Tango Sur is really the best and is always a go-to place for a meal that I know I will enjoy.  It is perfect for a date, special occasion, group party, whatever you're in the mood for.  The food is really amazing, and everything is a must-try.  I mean everything! I have been there so many times, I can't review all that I have eaten, but it's all been wonderful.  The portions can be large - so you might want to consider sharing, and the food can be filling, so don't plan on going to the club for dancing afterwards.Try things on this menu that you have never heard of, because you will not have them anywhere else.The restaurant is dark.  I think it is only lit by candles at each table.  They serve food late (11:30pm) on Saturdays.  They don't take reservations, and I have waited upwards of 3 hours on a Saturday night.  But you can go there, put your name in, give them your #, and they'll contact you 5-10 minutes before you will be seated.  You can leave during this time, or drink it up in the back room while you wait.The outdoor patio in the summer is one of the best!

Reviews.Author: Hoang L.
Reviews.Content: Love the steak here. I went here for my friend's birthday and had a table for about 10 so it's nice for bigger groups. Not much room, but it was doable.We found out it was BYOB so we walked to . Probably the darkest setting ever. The place is lit up with a candle. I guess this would be nice for a first date. But you need that candle to see your food, otherwise you might end up eating your napkin or utensil.Either way, I would definitely come back one day. I made a short video at Tango Sur that night to test out my new lens. Enjoy.vimeo.com/11453308 (password: byob)

Reviews.Author: Candice S.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend suggested we go to Tango Sur for my friend's birthday dinner because it's BYOB. The Yelp page says it takes reservations, but it seems otherwise. The only reason we got a reservation was because we told them we had a large group. We started with an appetizer:Prosciutto with hearts of palm and Argentinian golf sauce - it was ok, didn't really stand out. The golf sauce tasted very similar to thousand island dressingMy friend and I shared our entree:El Filet - the meat was cooked perfectly. The spinach mashed potato was really good. One order was enough to feed both of us at a very inexpensive priceThe restaurant gave my friend a flan on the house for her birthday, which was really nice! The flan was delicious. It had a layer of what tasted like dulce de leche on top.Pros: Good food, reasonable price, BYOBCons: small tables (had to squeeze stuff onto the table), doesn't take reservations (?), entrees took a while to come out

Reviews.Author: Kristy N.
Reviews.Content: You really can't go wrong at this place.  I have been here a few times and I always leave with a smile on my face..and a doggy bag.  First off, BYOB and steak are a wonderful combination and a great way to enjoy a fantastic meal at an affordable price.I am not a huge steak eater but they really do it right here.  My friend and I ordered the El Filet and the Pork Chop to split.  I have ordered the El Filet here in the past and it is always tasty..and a TON of food (literally 2 steaks).  The Pork Chop was to die for.  It was perfectly cooked and the sauce was unbelievable.  The empanadas are always a solid choice and hard to pass up at $2 a pop.  The corn and cheese was surprisingly delish.This place is crawling with staff which makes me wonder why the service is so slow.  I wasn't in a rush but waiting 30 minutes for our check and then receiving it without an apology was a little much for me.  If they are able to improve on this, they deserve every inch of 5 stars.The atmosphere is very dark and romantic..literally candlelight only.  I am happy to come back here any night of the week...as soon as my body processes the protein overload.

Reviews.Author: Van L.
Reviews.Content: I am in love with Tango Sur.I don't know what took me so long to get here, and that is my only regret with this place.Yes, there's a wait, and no- no reservations. So grab wine and head to that cozy little dark room and wait to be called.Order some empanadas. Take your time with the menu. My favorite is el filet, but everyone has their own. The spinach potatoes...everything about this dish makes my mouth water. But I've tried other (people's) dishes, and they're all fantastic. Juicy, flavorful, everything dinner should be and more. And yes, you should try and share otherwise you'll fall into a food coma because the plates are not small.It's so reasonably priced, but I'd go here even if they bumped it up (knock on wood). It's great for dates, or for large parties. Service is just what I like...not too attentive or talkative, but there when you need them. They never rush you out and let you truly enjoy your meal....and now I just talked myself into going back this week.

Reviews.Author: Jason H.
Reviews.Content: Woot! What a manly meal.  Lots of meat and its quite delicious (not healthy but delicious).  The atmosphere is awesome and they have a patio, plus BYOB is always a winner.  Great place to enjoy a bottle of wine on a date.The weekends its packed and is a little louder, so if that bothers you I'd suggest a weekday.

Reviews.Author: Jeff W.
Reviews.Content: This is one of those places you hate to love. So frustrating to get a table sometimes, yet their food is so delicious you just can't hate it. It's like that ex gf that you just can't stop drunk dialing.Came on a Monday night at 8pm, beautiful weather so their patio was full. Host said 15-20 minutes for a table outside. Just as we thought it was our turn when we saw a table open up, he gave it to another couple. I swear we had been there longer, but I' wasn't going to complain. Just our luck, no one was leaving at that time and we ended up waiting an hour for a table. So incredibly frustrating, additionally because they had a table for 6 empty but they wouldn't seat us, a party of 2, at it. However, you just can't argue with the food. The menu is a bit overwhelming so just go with the recs from Yelp. Empanadas are brilliantly good. Flaky crust and oozing fillings, and very reasonably priced at $2 apiece. We got the ham and cheese and the spinach and cheese. I easily could have eaten all 5 varieties. We wanted to get the Provoleta, Argentine provolone cheese cooked on the grill witholive oil and roasted peppers... sounds and looked amazing. Oozing when it came out to the table next to us, but after eating the entire basket of bread, there was no way we would have room. Next time, but how will I pass on the empanadas?? As usual, the el filet did not disappoint. A perfect medium rare, this range grown fillet mignon, cooked on the grill then topped with a red onion wine sauce is simply delectable. The meat almost melts in your mouth. Two big cuts of filet, one for dinner and another for tomorrow's lunch. At $27, you think this may be expensive but trust me, it's incredibly reasonable for their portion sizes. The sauce and chimachurri sauce on the side is delicious.The Bife Vesuvio, another one of their most popular dishes, was also a winner. Slightly tougher since it is only cooked to one temperature. This grilled prime steak silced and filled with spinach, mar del plata cheese and garlic in a white wine sauce is not flattering on your breath so beware if you're on a date. I recommend the filet in that instance. I was able to bring ALL the leftovers to work with me today, so half of the el filet and half of the vesuvio. I must say, the filet holds up better overnight and is still unbelievably tender and succulent even when reheated. The Vesuvio was a little more oily but still very good as leftovers. Great date spot that you won't have to drop a fortune to go to. The entrees seem steep at $27 apiece, but with no corkage fee at this byob spot, our bill came out to $64. Even with the poor service (our waiter was slow and unattentive), the food speaks for itself here and will keep me coming back.

Reviews.Author: Marianne A.
Reviews.Content: The wait for a table can be really long (upwards to an hour after 7pm any night of the week).  This place is a 5-minute walk from my place but I only go a few times a year so that I cherish it.  Delicious, generously-sized Argentinian meats!  Reasonable prices for the quality.  We brought a bottle of burgundy and started with the procciutto with baby artichokes for an appetizer.  Then came the "starter" salad - couple leaves of lettuce with tomato.  Then we split the Vacio- half a slab of medium rare slab beef with sweet potatoes, it could've served 4 people!  The chimichurri sauce is a-mazing.  Bill for 2 for everything was about $50.  And remember, it's BYOB!The tables need to be bigger and the service a bit more consistent but overall - a great date spot and fun for groups too.  Go if you're any kind of carnivore!

Reviews.Author: Lisa M.
Reviews.Content: The food is great, but the service is quite awful.  I think they are just so busy that they don't feel the need to give good service.  We had a large party, and I had to literally get up and find our server to get everything we wanted/needed for our food. It's really frustrating that you can't focus on your dinner party because you have to constantly look for the server, which takes time and interruption.  Then they act like they're doing you a favor by getting you anything at all.I'm not pleased, the stars are for the food only.

Reviews.Author: Ricky W.
Reviews.Content: Great food. Terrible people.Went there a couple months ago for my birthday and enjoyed the food and had a wonderful time. However came with my mother for her birthday and the story really is terrible. Said it would be 2 hours unless I wanted to spend $40. When I elected to wait the 2 hours. 2 very quickly became 3.Tried again on a week night when they opened - they happily sat me outside without any wait.  Pick your time - don't feel bad about calling and making a reservation for 6 and bringing 4.

Reviews.Author: Keri W.
Reviews.Content: Everything was good.  Loved the caramel cheesecake.

Reviews.Author: Craig U.
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere and BYOB ability earned an otherwise unimpressive restaurant it's 3rd star.  The filet and meat sampler (parrillada) were very average and generally tough and chewy.  The wait staff was good, and the candlelit atmosphere was nice. It's packed with lots of people and long waits, but my group and I were left wondering what all the fuss was about.I wouldn't say it was bad, I would just be hard pressed to say what was good besides the atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Tim Z.
Reviews.Content: A delicious get-your-money's-worth menu.  If you're looking for a great piece of meat without having to pay out the mouth for it, Tango Sur is right up your alley.  That isn't to suggest that the food alone makes the restaurant though:  the candle-lit interior is a great place for a date, and the outside patio is perfect the summer.  Add to all this that it is BYOB and you're set.And if you're not sure what to pick, I have two words for you:  Bife Vesuvio.  Mention it to anyone who has had it:  their eyes will light up and their stomachs will growl.  It is one of the most satisfying meals I've had in a long time.  That garlic sauce... amazing.

Reviews.Author: Sarah B.
Reviews.Content: I have been here a few times now and every time I've gone we've had the vacio - huge delicious steak for two to share with sweet potatoes on the plate. The empanadas are delicious as well (especially the ham and cheese).The salad here leaves something to be desired, but since it's free, I can't take off a star for it.  The first time I came here I was sad and they brought us a free flan for dessert to cheer me up! (It was also delicious)This place is also BYOB which is great and really cuts down on the expense. Get here early or be prepared to wait - but they will take your cell phone number and you can hang out at one of Southport's many bars and they'll call you when your table is ready.

Reviews.Author: James R.
Reviews.Content: Wow!  This place is amazing.  The chorizo is perfect and the steaks are a dream.  Make sure to pile on the chimichurri sauce because it is a winner.  Be careful because the portions are huge, so come willing to share.  The BEST empanadas I have had in Chicago!Also it is BYOB

Reviews.Author: Christy H.
Reviews.Content: This place is only a couple blocks from where I live and I've walked by many a time and the tables are always full of people.  This past Friday night I was able to FINALLY able to try it- and what an amazing meal.We had a variety of appetizers- the fresh Mozzarella and all the variety of Empenadas - WOW all of it was GREAT.Then the salmon in the sauce with the capers melted in my mouth, and I though I am not a big beef eater I did try it and it was fairly good:)The BYOB was a new experience and when we first sat down I didn't realize that was their policy.  Since this kindda meal defiantly requires a nice bottle of wine- I walked back to my house quick brought one back.  I recommend planning ahead if in case you don't live close by- but there is a nice wine store near by in case you forget.For the $$$- the servings are HUGH.  I will be back for more:)

Reviews.Author: Aaron K.
Reviews.Content: Good food, good service, long wait, loud place.  If you don't want to wait 30 minutes to an hour (and that's even with calling ahead of time), go before 6:30P.  Otherwise, be prepared to sit in the waiting room with every other drunk, obnoxious 20-something middle manager with too much money and too much free time.  I mean listen, guy: I understand it was your birthday and all, but spilling wine on your boyfriend, cursing in front of those two children, and making sure everybody knew just how gay and 30 years old you were really made for a miserable wait.This is part and parcel of the problem with BYOB establishments that will cork your wine for you while you wait for your table.  There's no accounting for the obnoxious.  Apologies to all of the other 20-something managerial types out there who do have their wits about them.I also see that about half the respondents on the survey have said the restaurant doesn't take reservations while half have said it does.  The truth is, they will take reservations if you call in a day ahead of time, especially if you're a large group.  But if you call 5 hours before the rush dinner hour on a Friday or Saturday night, you'll simply be put on a list with no guarantee of a short wait.

Reviews.Author: Amanda T.
Reviews.Content: I came here expecting to wait a lifetime for a table. I called a week earlier to make reservations for a Friday night but I was told the next two Fridays and Saturdays were full on the reservations. When my boyfriend and I got there we were told it was going to be an hour and a half wait, but someone cancelled at the last minute and the host graciously sat us immediately. The food was superb. I loved the empanadas!! The portions were out of control!! The left overs were enough to be my lunch and dinner the next day. The fact that you're given so much food at such a low price almost seems like stealing! And because it's BYOB, it's really nice on the wallet, or my boyfriend's wallet rather. The candlelight and extra dim lighting makes it very romantic and cozy. On the contrary, it is extremely loud and busy. There's tango music blaring, and everyone is bumping into each other. The tables are positioned close enough for you to hear very intimate details of the lives of the people sitting at the next table. Definitely heard some interesting things. But yeah, Tango Sur, a carnivore's paradise.

Reviews.Author: Amy J.
Reviews.Content: Okay, of course I have returned to Tango Sur... :) And I had the best experience there that I have EVER had. It wasn't crowded so the waiters were very attentive, something you normally can't expect from this place (unless they have improved? I am not sure). Anyways, I was able to sit and wait for my friend to arrive by the window as they opened my bottle of wine... Awesome. I don't mind waiting if I'm sipping on some wine in a cozy restaurant.Anyways... we had the empanadas (spinach and cheese and ham and cheese) - awesome as always. We also ordered the provlenta appetizer (hot provolone cheese on the grill with olive oil and red peppers) - eh, I could have done without this one, but I can understand if people love it. To me, it was just too much cheese... And we split the lemon chicken... I still say this is the best chicken I've ever had. It is SO good, so moist, so flavorful, yum. And comes with vesuvio potatoes - and it's cheap. I think it's $13. So worth it. My only complaint: there is a $5 sharing fee, and I don't really understand why because they didn't even put it on separate plates? They literally put the chicken in front of us and gave us a plate each... so, I do not understand the fee. I mean, we paid it, but it was confusing.Anyways, the most attentive servers I've ever had here, and as always, great food. I was impressed.

Reviews.Author: Emily C.
Reviews.Content: I didn't notice some of the problems people have had here with service and the wait.  Though I'm reluctant to tell my secret, I'm a good Yelper and will do just that: Monday night at 5:15 it's pretty empty.  We came in and were seated and served immediately and treated well.The eternal praise I hold for all things BYOB remains the case here; steak and wine is awesome, but steak and wine that costs a third of what other restaurants might charge you for it is infinitely better.As for the food, here's my take:Empanadas - we split a ham & cheese one. extraordinaryChimichurri - glorious!!!!!!!Proveleta - It's a pile of melted cheese with roasted peppers and oregano.  What's not to like?!?!Steak- I had the filet and my bf had costelleta (bone in ribeye).  Mine was cooked perfectly, but his was a touch on the chewy side for medium rare. Both were an amazingly huge portion, but not really a "prime" steak.  Still, if you go in expecting this and are impressed with a huge and tasty pile of meat, then you will not be disappointed in any way, shape, or form.Dessert - just had the napoleon, and it was decent.  Not knock-me-on-the-floor awesome, but tasty.So that pretty much sums up my experience (and the beginning of a long love affair with chimicurri sauce), and chances are I'll be returning because, really,  BYOB + pile of meat is a thing of beauty.

Reviews.Author: Unknown
Reviews.Content: Been meaning to go here for quite some time and was finally able to make it a couple weeks ago. Every time I pass, it's packed to the gills - no matter the season or the day of the week. I definitely know why now! This place takes me back to sitting in Argentina, delicious steak, red wine and french bread...nothing more simple or more delicious of a meal. Start off with the simple salad and go for the steak -- you won't be disappointed. Makes a great spot for not only a hot date, but a group evening as well. Added bonus is the BYOB factor, bring an extra bottle or two because the ambiance will suck you in most definitely.

Reviews.Author: Jim D.
Reviews.Content: You've got to love the reasonable prices for big platters, BYOB, and most especially the chimichurri sauce from heaven that goes with absolutely everything.The meat was juicy, cooked just right, and served in man-sized portions, I haven't had a more satisfying protein fix in town for the prices they were running at. The parrillada para dos was the best $31 bucks my friend and I ever collectively spent. The waiters bent over backwards for us, almost literally as we were seated at the FAAARRRR end of the long outdoor patio in a very tight space. No corkage fee, A+ Tango Sur. As an aside: I learned something from this dining experience, restaurants have to open booze indoors before serving outside, so our waiters to walk indoors, uncork our wine, then bring it back. Another one to add to the list of confusing, pointless Chicago municipal regulations. Thanks Richie!The only knock against the place is where we were seated, looking into the local convenience shop with the flourescent lights on. Its just not worth the extra tables to take us away from the atmosphere of the place.

Reviews.Author: Blake B.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur, aka, heaven for meat-lovers, is an Argentinian stake house.  They are BYOB so be sure to bring a bottle or two of red wine.  You'll need it for the long wait to be seated, but you can drink in the waiting room, a room in the back of the dining area on the right.They have tasty empanadas and a fantastic selection of meat with some as large as your belly.  I like the churasco but I can't tell a difference between the American or the Argentinian beef versions aside from the price.The place is tightly packed and the host is impatient.  You might want to avoid sitting in front of the main door in the winter because you'll freeze while munching on your ice cold stake.

Reviews.Author: Kristin K.
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd experience with Argentinian food in the same month, and I have to say I liked it better than my local venue (which shall remain nameless until I appraise it once again).  But I LOVE the atmosphere here. The tango music and paintings on the wall are fun and exotic, and it smells delicious throughout the restaurant.  I also liked the waiters' shirts.  Very snazzy.Everything was deliciously flavorful EXCEPT 3 things: 1. A few of us got the fillets, and one of my mom's was literally a rubber tire on a plate.  I thought I recognized it from Petsmart, the same place I got my Rottweiler a toy tire to play with 6 months ago, and she hasn't even made a dent in it yet.  TOUGH.2.  A "potato tortilla" appetizer.  It was a potato omelet.  With eggs.  Not tortilla.3.  The bread was weird.  Some kind of bland, cheap rolls.  MEH.However!  The other fillets, the half-chicken limon, the empanadas, and the BYOB service was fantastic.  I would love to go back; it's very romantic and delicious. And easy to do low-carb, which I could always benefit from anyway.Just make sure you instruct them on how exactly to cook your steak.  If possible, specify that they are not to use an old shoe or a piece of a tire. Kidding... kind of.  One other thing was that it was FREEZING in the whole front room because of Arctic Blast Winds coming through the front door.  They need one of those door cover thingies, STAT, for the winter months.

Reviews.Author: Christine L.
Reviews.Content: Yes - SUR - e! This popular BYOB dining spot lived up to the hype and the two hour table wait. As a group we ordered two of each of the empanadas to start out. Very tasty little buggers but our waiter did tell us the wrong order and I ended up with a beef empanada parading as a spinach and cheese delight. I'm not a picky eater so this was a non issue. For my entrée I went with the El Filet and the hubs had the Churrasco sirloin. My eyes about popped out when our food arrived, there were not one but TWO filets sitting on my plate staring back at me accompanied by the scrumptious spinach mashed potatoes. Hubs had been drinking a few rounds of whiskey cokes by the time we ordered and ordered his sirloin rare. Needless to say, it mooed when the server set the plate down!  Other people in our party ordered meals for two and it should say two households because I have never seen such a huge chunk of meat at a dinner table. Rave reviews though. I loved the ambiance of the restaurant, so dark and cozy with the candle light. The byob aspect is fantastic but also a double edge sword - I put back a whole filet and potatoes and also an entire bottle of wine over our two hour meal. Good but good for you? I think not. Not a traditional steakhouse and definitely a trendy establishment judging by the long waits - try it at least once, it's a fun dining experience.

Reviews.Author: Mike Y.
Reviews.Content: I went here for a recent birthday party and after thinking about the food for a little bit, I decided to give it a 3. There were all sorts of things in play here that led me to the 3 star overall rating...We had a somewhat early reservation since it was a large party. We were rewarded with no wait when we arrived. Woohoo! The place was lit with candelight and the atmosphere was loud and fun. Definitely a romantic, have fun while you're here type of place. We brought a bunch of wine with us as this place is BYOB.The appetizers:Jamon Crudo Con Melon - prosciutto served with melon. To me it sounded like a strange combination, but they went well together. Pretty simple, but good. You can easily make this at home.Chicken empanada - A pretty tasty empanada.Wasn't so impressed with their Lengua a La Vinagreta - poached tongue marinated with vinegar, garlic and pepper. It was rubbery and not very flavorful. I've heard that if done properly, it is supposed to be tender and moist.Right after this, they served salads for everyone. To be honest, I'm not sure why they even bother with this. It was the cheapest looking salad I've ever seen. Lettuce, two slices of tomato, and a few rings of onion. Splash vinegar and oil over it and some pepper and enjoy!Seriously?My main course was the Bife Vesuvio - grilled prime steak slice and filled with spinach, mar del plata cheese and garlic in a white wine sauce, accompanied with argentine style potatoes - supposedly their second most popular dish behind the "El Filet".Ok. This thing was a huge portion.The marinade was very tasty. The spinach and cheese filling was very tasty. The downside was the steak itself. Not very tender, and even rubbery in some areas. The marinade and the filling definitely saved it from being disappointing to me.The steak was served with Argentinean style potatoes that were really awesome (I wish I could have eaten more of them).We tried some dessert as well. I tried a little bit of their flan and German chocolate cake. Both were pretty run of the mill. Not great but not bad either.As a side note, a few friends who had the El Filet said they really liked it. One friend that tried their salmon dish said it was decent. Another friend that tried a chicken dish was pretty disappointed with it.For the price, it is worth coming back. It is a fun atmosphere and the food is decent enough. Service was ok.

Reviews.Author: Donielle A.
Reviews.Content: This place was so good that a week after bringing a couple of friends here, one of them brought her husband back!  First off, you must try the chicken empanadas!  Ohmagosh...melts in your mouth and not in your hands.  And for $2, you can't beat the price!  If you are a meat & potatoes kinda girl, try the Bife Vesuvio.  It's the specialty of this place...can't go wrong with the item they do best.  And don't forget to finish the meal with flan.  I seriously want to go back right now...writing this makes my mouth water!This place can be a bit of a wait, so plan for that, but we arrived a bit before six and were seated immediately.  Get there early and expect impeccable service!  In the words of Arnold Schwarzenegger, "I'll be back"

Reviews.Author: Eric L.
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this place A LOT! The food was amazing, and this place really knows how to cook meat. I got the Vacio and my date got the Filet. Both were excellent choices. For the money and the quality of food, this place is top-notch. I'll definitely come back to this place again.  But, just be prepare to wait in line. We sat on the terrace so we didn't have to wait. Pros: Food, Price, BYOBCons: does not take reservations for small groups and long lines

Reviews.Author: Yashar Y.
Reviews.Content: K, so you really want stake, but really don't wanna break the bank and go to Ruth's Chris, Morton, Gibson, ....What do you do? well first you make sure that it's mid week. Then you head to Whole Foods and get some yummy wine, and then you head to TangoSur.We've been there for more than five times, and the more we go, the smaller our selection gets. These days, me and gf opt to get the Antipasti ... then we both get the Filet and call it the night. We tried their Argentinian shared dish, and honestly we hated it. So i guess tastes really differ, some people swear by it.Moral of this story, don't go there on weekends.

Reviews.Author: Leslie P.
Reviews.Content: I have been here many times and always enjoy it.  If there is a long wait, there is a cute wine shop across the street that does free tastings.  Plus you can choose a bottle or two for dinner with zero corkage fee.

Reviews.Author: Jayne K.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is phenomenal. A little gem amongst all the Southport burger pubs. A great place to take your significant other or a gathering of friends. The space is small and they don't take reservations for parties less than 6 so the wait, particularly in the summer, can be daunting, but have a drink at one of the bars across the street and please please please give it a chance. You will not be disappointed!I love the Bife Vesuvio! It's reasonably priced and you can eat on it for days!
