I've only been here twice and each time I've gotten it, but the rest of the menu looks awesome. Run, run, run to Tango Sur! They will have to roll you out I promise. Its that good!

Reviews.Author: SoCalSparky o.
Reviews.Content: This is the most authentic Argentinian restaurant my husband and I have been to other than in Argentina.  It's BYO for liquor,  but, amazingly enough, the CVS down the street has a decent selection of wine. Service is truly great and also,  authentic, because they are all Argentinian! If you are in the area this place is a MUST!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Erik O.
Reviews.Content: I was driving with my boo, and we were wondering where to go.  We tried Toro sushi, but that place was busy as all hell and about to close, so on a whim, we came here.  We were immediately seated in a super romantic, dimly lit dining room, playing awesome Argentine music.  The server put our beers on ice, and was super cool from the very start.  I must state this again, but Chicago's BYOB policy is AWESOME!  We don't have anything like it in California, and I LOVE IT. We asked the server for his opinion on an appetizer, and he told us to get this awesome melty cheese, roasted pepper dish, which went really good with their house bread.  We slammed the whole dish quickly, and we then asked his opinion on the main course, and he quickly said to get the fillet from argentina, for two.  This beast of a steak came out on a sizzling platter covered in an awesome brown reduction with mushrooms.  It was pure awesome.  Me and my boo ate the entire thing, and it was perfect.  The meat was ultra tender, and not the slightest imperfection in the quality. No stringiness, no gristle, and no tough spots.  It was awesome.  I went home and slept for 12 hours to process that behemoth meal.  It was a surprisingly awesome meal at a great price.

Reviews.Author: J D.
Reviews.Content: Love this place. Great food and atmosphere (romantic). I also like the fact its B.Y.O.B. A great place to take a date or meet a group of friends for dinner, especially if you're hungry for some meat. Only negatives is parking and that it can get pretty packed with people.

Reviews.Author: Gail B.
Reviews.Content: Just ate here for the third time, and every time has been a great experience. It is a beef lovers paradise. We shared the Lomo Relleno which they state is enough for two, but after feasting as much as we could, we took almost half of it home. Their chimichurri sauce is wonderful. I do wish that it had come with vegetables - in addition tothe portobello mushrooms. The service was great and byob makes it very affordable. Be sure and arrive before 6 unless you want to wait for a table.

Reviews.Author: B. S.
Reviews.Content: It get's 5 stars for the food, undoubtedly! it would get 3 stars for everything else, if I could separate the categories. be prepared to wait, park far away and its loud inside! Went there on a Friday night with 7p "reservations" or on a wait list, and sat down at 7:45p. We were allowed to "pop the bottle" we brought in the waiting area inside (BYOB is the shit!). I parked almost 5 blocks away for this place! We sat down and ordered Empanadas, they were prepared well and come with a delicious dipping sauce. I then moved onto the "BIFE VESUVIO"; HOLY F! it was great, but be aware you cannot order this as medium rare. I was told the spinach inside needed to cook and be prepared at medium or higher, no biggie. And it also came with this amazing garlic dipping sauce. The music inside was loud and we had to lean across our 2 person table and speak loudly to hear one another. That sucked the most about it, I thought I was to be enjoying a more intimate atmosphere.  Go to enjoy the food; but be prepared to walk from the car and wait a while for a loud atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Bobby G.
Reviews.Content: There's a wait pretty much all the time. Even 10:30 on a Friday night. But it's a byob with top notch meat. All the food I've tried is delicious. The service is just okay, but they open your wine, take your order, then leave you alone, which I'm fine with. I've got to say the filet is wonderful and so is the morcilla. Also, the decor is chill, the music isn't too loud, and the lighting is low so you can go there with a date and she might not realize you're wasted. Hooray!

Reviews.Author: David K.
Reviews.Content: Filet mignon was quite good. Not the very BEST I've ever had, but very good (I'm spoiled). There were TWO filets!Kinda loud and raucous at 11pm, extremely long wait, but how you can blame a place for being incredibly popular? Things cooled off by 11:30.Ambience for our 5th anniversary? Delightful. Go late, get seated around 11pm, then sit back with a bottle of wine, some steaks, and with the candle-lit table you can have yourself a 5-star evening.We'll be back; I can't wait.

Reviews.Author: Elyse W.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is one of the best values in the city!  Where else can you have such amazing food and no corkage fee for your BYOB!  Yes there is usually a wait but it is worth it.  I am a stickler for service but forgive Tango Sur because they are usually packed.  As long as my food gets to me hot I am a happy camper!  I am totally obsessed with the Vacio and would literally drink their chimichurri if that wasn't weird.  My advice for dining at Tango Sur is to first check in (the wait on a Friday or Saturday is at least 30 minutes)- and then head to Jewel on Southport to pick up some bottles of wine.  They will call you on your cell phone when your table is about to be ready.

Reviews.Author: Nicole N.
Reviews.Content: The food, ambiance and service was great once we were finally seated. I called a week in advance to make a reservation as we had a party of six and had never been there before. Upon arrival (5 mins. early for our 8:30 reservation) we were told there is a 30 min wait regardless of reservation. This was annoying, wants the point in making a reservation? Others were complaining and waiting as well but we quickly discovered that they put their names in just that evening. We grabbed drinks down the street and came back at 9, table still wasn't ready. Waited another 15 mins and were finally seated about 45 mins late. Not a good process so be prepared to patron the neighboring bars...

Reviews.Author: Maggie R.
Reviews.Content: Omg!! Where should I start...The empanadas are delicious, the filet mignon is humongous, mashed potatoes are orgasmic, and it's BYOB!!

Reviews.Author: Emily O.
Reviews.Content: Food: Really good steaks for a good value.  Plus, a non-sushi BYOB is always a nice change.BUT:  My party of 2 waited THREE HOURS and 11 minutes for a table...to be honest the food was quite good but not worth the wait.  Come on, you can't squeeze in two people?!?  The doorman was not accommodating (and kind of rude) and the estimated 1.5 hour wait dragged out even after we went back twice to ask what was up.  If he had said three hours from the beginning we would not have waited.

Reviews.Author: Keith C.
Reviews.Content: There is a reason why this place is a staple for Chicago dining. Great portions at a great price. Very good service staff. Bring a bottle of wine as it is BYOB. The dining area can get loud FYI.

Reviews.Author: Dana D.
Reviews.Content: I live in the neighborhood, and I've been wanting to check this place out for awhile.  This place is definitely above-average, but I wasn't astounded.My quick recap:Service: 5/5  - Very attentive staff, and no charge for corking the wine.  And even though they don't take reservations, the hostess (who is VERY kind) will take your number and call you when your table is ready.Atmosphere: 4/5 - Great location on Southport.  Nice outdoor seating area.  My mom commented that there was only one unisex toilet, though.Food:  3.5/5 - The general consensus was that our food was great.  The portions were generous, and everyone's steak was cooked as they ordered it.  My dad commented that his steak (strip) was fattier than he expected.  Also, he was dismayed that his meal didn't come with potatoes (which can be ordered for a small price)

Reviews.Author: Scott H.
Reviews.Content: We went here the other night after seeing a movie.  It had been a long time since I'd had a steak...and I was salivating at the thought of a big juicy steak.  This place did not disappoint.  And to make it even better, its BYOB, fairly cheap, and has a cool vibe/decor.They didn't take reservations so we had to wait 20 min for a table, but it was fine since we needed to get some wine.I dont recall exactly what we had but I do remember that the filet was huge (good enough for 2)The spinach mash potatos were interesting (in a good way)And the Sweet bread is neither sweet nor bread.Great place for a date, or with a small group of friends.S&JNov08

Reviews.Author: Nikki M.
Reviews.Content: Went here for the first time on Monday night.  I've always wanted to try the place but never had the patience to wait in line.  We went at 6:30 on a Monday night and sat right down.  I will say though, that by 7:30, the place was pretty full.  My husband and I had empanadas which were fabulous.  We also tried the eggplant appetizer which was really good, but large.  It definitely could have been a meal on it's own.  We couldn't finish it because it was very rich.  I had the noqui (b/c I'm not a big meat eater) and I loved it!  The portion was so large that I had it for lunch the next day, too.  My husband got the filet and said it was very good as well.  Service was great...our waters were always full and the waiter was attentive.  I love that there is no corking fee!The only thing I marked off for was that our table was very dirty when we sat down. They cover the tables with brown paper and ours had grease splatters and food all over it. Overall, I would definitely recommend Tango Sur.

Reviews.Author: Maria G.
Reviews.Content: There is nothing I can say that hasn't been said before about Tango Sur. I loved this place and can't wait to go back! We went on a Monday at 6:30pm- and were seated right away. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. To start off, we had some empanadas de pollo y de carne- delicious!I had the Medio Pollo al Limon- it is perfection! It comes with vesuvio style potatoes. My husband had the Filet Mignon and they gave him two huge pieces of meat with potatoes. We had a great time- polishing off a bottle of wine (me) and some beers (the husband) I love the atmosphere of this place. I know some people complain that it is loud and crowded, but I'm loud myself and crowds don't bother me :) Oh and the best part? our bill was $48.00 + tip. unfreakinbeliavable! We left stuffed, happy and without breaking the bank.

Reviews.Author: Naomi L.
Reviews.Content: The two stars are for the steaks and the cheese that accompanied the salad.The place is crammed not their fault, but they are over staffed and all the staff are men no women at all!There wasn't any emotion to the place it is calked the Tango for crying out loud where is that Allure?I would maybe go back but would rather spend allot more and go to Gibsons!

Reviews.Author: Adisak P.
Reviews.Content: Two Words: Steak OverdoseFor $24, I got the El Filet.  It was one of the most delicious filet mignons I've ever had.  Actually, it was *TWO* of the most delicious filet mignons I've ever had.  For some reason, all the portions here are reasonably priced and big enough to feed a small third world village.The steaks are huge, tasty, and inexpensive and BYOB is a nice way to save some coin during this recession.  The flan is unbelievable and the empanadas are good as well.  Heck even the bread is nice.I'm not sure what they use to make their potatoes a crazy shade of green but they taste normal and go well with the meat.

Reviews.Author: Nicole C.
Reviews.Content: I may be the only person in the city not impressed with this place.I recently got paid for a big job I worked, and we decided to try this place out. We walk by it all the time, and it always smells amazing.So, we got there around 7pm, early enough to only have to wait a couple of minutes for a table. A table that was very wably, and every move sent my glass moving across the able. It took about 15 minutes for our server to appear which wasnt so bad, but after we ordered, it took over an hour for our food to show up.I may have made a mistake by not getting steak, but the food I did order had little flavor.Our server seemed to care less, and was almost impossible to get a hold of.Its not so much that I think this is a bad restaurant, it was just def not one for me. Besides all the serving issues I just felt out of place.Oh well, at least I gave it a try.

Reviews.Author: Catherine H.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! Since you basically get two filets with one order, it's always an option to save money and split the meal (for a small fee). That's what the bf and I did and we got an appetizer (the melted cheese and bread, I forgot what it's called). So with splitting the meal and bringing our own booze we ended up leaving with a bill around $40. Not too bad for an appetizer and both of us getting steak filets and leaving with our stomach's full (a feat in and of itself for the bf). We sat right down and didn't have to wait at all but we did make sure to get there early and we sat outside and noticed that the line did accumulate quickly.

Reviews.Author: selena i.
Reviews.Content: Pros: BYOB, fabulous steak, ordered the one for two, and it can definitely feed Africa. I can eat the Chimichurri sauce with everything! and the flan, wow.....decadent!Cons: I couldnt see the steak while I was cutting it, because it is too frikken dark in there! hi, I know we are in a recession and we trying to save on electricity, but one candlelight???!!!! c'mon now, turn on some light!!!! and o yes, thankfully I wore a tank top, or else I would've lost 20 pounds of sweat just sitting in there.  Let me say, hello Tango SAunafood is awesome, despite its presentation. it looked like a big lump off poo with the lack of lighting. however, the they lose a star for the environment/atmosphere.I really would give the place a 3.5, would i go back? sure, for the flan :)

Reviews.Author: Laurie S.
Reviews.Content: Meat!  Glorious meat!Shared the Para Dos and stuffed my face.  I have a pretty *hefty* appetite and it was difficult for me to get through my half.  It was delicious though, so I managed.My recommendation: skip the salad.  You came for the meat and no corkage fee.  Tango Sur delivers.

Reviews.Author: Allen J.
Reviews.Content: This would probably be 3 stars, if it were not for the host.  Seriously, what is up with the @sshat of a host?  He was so off-putting when my party got there that we almost walked down the street.I digress.I have definitely had better steak in the city. I also am not one to complain about doneness of steak.  I know it's hard to get right in a large kitchen. That said, I was not asked how I wanted it prepared, and it came out medium-well.  Not ideal for me. My co-diner got the same dish, and his was probably medium.  And my friend who ordered her dish medium has a definitely RARE piece of meat.  When she talked to the waiter, he was gracious and took it back to the kitchen.  But, when it came back, it was as if the kitchen had nuked the plate, and the meat was inedible.

Reviews.Author: Zand S.
Reviews.Content: The food was excellent and the staff was friendly and will definitely go back as both  the quality of the food and the experience was beyond the average restaurant. However, we didn't like the following;-our host was pushy, and seems to like "window dress the restaurant" as he was forcing us to sit right next to all other guests by the window to show the restaurant was full, despite us being more interested in sitting in private (no need for this, we got their 20 min after the opening and within 40 min the place was full!)-do something about the lighting, half of the time we couldn't even see our food and the lighting was so low that even the car lights from the street were bothering our eyes-we had to send back our meat as medium-well ended being medium-rare to bloody in the middle and even after that we ended up with a medium only. But despite these we do like their food and will go back and hope for a better experience

Reviews.Author: Jen S.
Reviews.Content: I. Love. This. Place.Seriously, it's not everyday that I get an awesome piece of steak.  Sure, there's tons of steakhouses in Chicago, but Tango Sur stands out to me.  I dined on a Tuesday night, and this place was packed.  Apparently, everyone else loves Tango Sur, too.  My group of 8 shared our entrees of flank steak, short ribs and skirt steak.  Loved them all.I'll admit the service wasn't outstanding.  The host was a bit rude to me when I walked in, and the servers were also a bit out of it at the table, but the meal definitely blocked most of that out of my memory.Get to Tango Sur now.

Reviews.Author: Ryan M.
Reviews.Content: Very nice atmosphere with Candle lit tables.  BYOB is a plus.  Went here with a large group and enjoyed sharing the bottles of wine we all brought.  The filet was a little disappointing considering I have had the filet at the sister restaurant Folklore and thought it was amazing.  I ordered it medium and it looked like it was cooked how a medium should be cooked (red on the side but not bloody).  Not as tender as a good filet at a top steakhouse is.  I would recommend sharing the filet entree as they give two filets per order.  Also had the empanadas and the egg plant salad both of which were really good.Parking is difficult in the area and there is little room to wait for your table inside the restaurant so if it is raining or 100 degrees out u might be in trouble.

Reviews.Author: J and S.
Reviews.Content: My favorite BYOB restaurant in the city - atleast for a nice dinner!This is a great place for an intimate dinner (great date spot guys!) or a fun night out with friends.They do not take reservations and the wait gets long!  (Unless you have a group, then you can call for a reservation).  They have a small room to wait and start your boozing =)  Empanadas = FANTASTIC!  mmm I want one now!The steaks are really high quality and so well seasoned they are just so tasty!  The chimichurri is AWESOME.  I want some right now. Also try the provolone appetizer!  My family went for my law school graduation a few weeks ago, there were 9 of us, multiple appetizers and it was less than $300... not to mention a week's worth of lunch!  Now that is a great deal (well plus the price of booze at Jewel across the street!)This is a MUST TRY!

Reviews.Author: Keith C.
Reviews.Content: -Appies:  Beef and spinash empanadas with chimichurri-Bread & Salad: Come with the meal-Entree: My wife and I split the El Filet...this is enough beef for 2 people!-Finish the meal with an espressoWith the bread, empanadas, salad, splitting the filet, and BYOB wine we can eat out at a great place in Chicago for $30!

Reviews.Author: Samantha O.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this restaurant.First, the food is FANTASTIC.  I had a serving friend of mine recommend it, and he was totally right.  One of the best meals I've ever had (and for a great price).  Second, it's BYOB with NO corkage fee!  How awesome is that?  You can pick your own bottle of wine to pair with dinner AND it's easy on the wallet.I've now been there twice and my personal favorites are the Vacio and the Lomo.  BE CAREFUL - though the prices at first may be a little high, you get a TON of food!  I was expecting the Lomo to be one little filet, but it was TWO.  I couldn't even finish the other one.  When we ordered the Vacio the second time, we shared that, the Para Dos (sausages and flank steak combo), and two appetizers, and it was plenty of food.  I highly recommend ordering a stead with the chimichurri sauce.  It is so tasty!The ambiance is very romantic - all candle lit with dark walls, nice decor, and close-together tables.  I like that the music stays with the latin theme and isn't too loud - great for dates. The service is great and prompt.  I recommend dining there EARLY - they do not take reservations, so it tends to fill up fast.  I'm absolutely going to go again.

Reviews.Author: Cameron C.
Reviews.Content: Because I have a meat head badge I feel obligated to write a post. CandleLight only. Best Argentinian food around. Plenty of meals easily shared by two people. Juicy cuts of grass fed steaks. First date? Awesome choice.

Reviews.Author: Marcela O.
Reviews.Content: A local recommended us this place, and we loved it. The meat is outstanding.... Even the coffee. Marce

Reviews.Author: Kevin A.
Reviews.Content: Great spot.  Tango Sur can get very crowded on the weekends and the wait can be close to 2 hours but it's worth the wait.  You can easily get a table right away during the week, however. It's all about the filet. Two 7oz filets with a side of spinach mashed potatoes.  It comes with a salad and it's easily plenty of food to split with a date, if you add 2 apps (i recommend proveleta). Bring a nice bottle of wine and you're looking at a great dinner for around $50.Tango Sur can get busy and loud and the seating is tight but thats what i like about it.  Everyone minds their business and the wait staff helps you out with anything you need.  In other words, it is exactly like being in Argentina.

Reviews.Author: Josan K.
Reviews.Content: BYOB! Awesome place! Careful with the empanadas and chimichurri! You can fill up on this pretty quicly! My suggestion is getting a bunch of empanadas and splitting a steak a dinner! Bring some beer and wine. Staff is super friendly and accommodating. Great for a date night.

Reviews.Author: Dave D.
Reviews.Content: Best place to eat good meat in Chicago! always fun time!  A+

Reviews.Author: Peggy K.
Reviews.Content: i had 3-4 empanadas as the appertizer and vacio for my meal (which is, as it  literally says, half slab of range grown flap meat sliced and filled with olive oil, garlic, parsley sauce, then cooked and served on a grill with mashed sweet potatoes) Well, in brief..even their tomatoes were delicious. I used to hate tomatoe since kindergarten era but after that day,, i've mentally changed... it must have been magical tomatoes that they fed me. And that's enough to earn my respect.The only thing I disliked was the waitstaff service. it could have been more very friendly. Out of five, there was one person who was truly friendly to us. But that's life I guess...you can never have them all..

Reviews.Author: Jess S.
Reviews.Content: Would like to give 3.5 stars.So, this place is really great for ambience: low lighting, small and cozy tables, lots of people enjoying food and wine and conversation, etc. Also love that it's BYOB with no corkage fee. The food was just OK. The salad was more like the toppings straight off a burger, but then again I'm not a huge salad eater. I got the beef vesuvio, and my date got the filet. The portions ARE huge. Like really, my whole plate was covered by the massive steak, besides a few potato wedges on the sides. And they actually give you 2 pieces of filet, which was kind of a surprise :) I really liked the cheese and spinach stuffing for my steak, but the meat itself was pretty tough, and there was also lots of oils on the plate, which were kind of unappetizing. My date really enjoyed his filet, so maybe that'd be a better choice. All in all, a fun night, but wasn't wowwed by the food.

Reviews.Author: martini g.
Reviews.Content: Good food, great prices.  The wait SUCKS!!  And they won't let you make a reservation unless you have at least 8 in your party.  AND, the two guys who work the front door are completely rude, devoid of courtesy, and basically, not customer service oriented at all.  They don't have to be b/c everyone wants to get in b/c of the food.So, go early, and be prepared to wait at least an hour if you are going on the weekend.  Once you're inside tho, it feels just like how it did in Buenos Aires -- tight spaces, loud conversations, good food.

Reviews.Author: Josh H.
Reviews.Content: I was expecting better after reading the reviews and the Check Please video. The service was good, but the food was just average. I tried a lot of appetizers and entrees and nothing wowed me. The dinner salad was the worst! It was lettuce, tomato and onions. It was presented the exact same way that a hamburger garish plate is presented. The place is kind of small so can get pretty loud, especially with the techno-trance beats going on in the background.

Reviews.Author: Mark L.
Reviews.Content: Full of anticipation, I finally made it to Tango Sur.Pros:1. Delicious food.2. BYOB!3. Dark fun atmosphere.4. Very reasonable prices.5. Very authentic feeling (went to Arg 3 months ago).6. Good music in the background (albeit loud).7. The CandleCons:1. A little bit tight (about 3 inches from the next table on each side)2. It was very loud, almost to the point where we had to yell at each other.3. This was the biggest con for me: I felt like we were being rushed out the entire time, they were anxious to clear plates through each course.  I would understand if there was a wait or something, but it was a tuesday night at like 9 p.m. No reason for that.Still had an enjoyable time, but that can be attributed to good company and conversation.  I was really looking foward to reliving my Buenos Aires experience, but it wasn't quite the same.  The service in BA was much better and the people were more polite. This is really a 3.7, because I'm big on service, but I'll round up to a 4, because I really did have a good time.

Reviews.Author: Matt B.
Reviews.Content: And now, ladies and Gentlemen, what you've all been waiting for.... Review # 406. Yeah, yeah, Tango Sur is the shizzle. We all know that. I am adding this review because I want to testify to ti's authenticity. I spent winter break from law school in Argentina "studying abroad" - AKA enjoying summer in the southern hemisphere, gawking at the world's most beautiful women (Brazil Schmazil), eating steak almost every night for insane, ridiculous, almost criminally cheap prices, drinking LOTS of good Argentine wine, and not knowing how to communicate (I don't speak Spanish). But I digress. Tango Sur is EXACTLY like a meal you would get at an upscale Argentine steakhouse. First, the salad (which one reviewer described as "plain jane") is identical to the salads that accompany most dinner entrees- onions, lettuce, tomato, oil & vinegar- that's it. Second, the empanadas are crispy, flaky, tender, and delicious- just like the best ones I had during my stay. All of the fillings are delish. Third, the MEAT. Skirt steak, ribeye, filet, blood sausage- all wonderful and all authentic. Chimichurri is exquisite. I want it at the table for every meal from now on. But if you REALLY want to experience a true Argentine meal, order the Parilla. It's a small grill brought to your table, covered in all sorts of stuff like sweetbreads, intestines/ chitlins, sausage, chicken, beef- not for the faint of heart. You'll experience meat-sweats, your body will hate you in the morning, and you can forget about getting any post-meal action for a few hours, but it's worth it. If you're reading this you probably already know how amazing Tango Sur is. Bring some wine and a date you want to impress. See you there.

Reviews.Author: Joe H.
Reviews.Content: Whoever told you the happiest place on earth was Disney World has never seen my stomach after Tango Sur.  Do the math yourself:+ No corkage fee+ Meat, meat, and more meat (and other delicious food)+ nice atmosphere+ friendly staff = awesomeThe only drawback is that there is always an hour wait if not slightly longer ( which should be enough to tell you how awesome the place is)... the upside to the wait is that they take your cell phone number and you can wander the block and grab a drink at one of the many bars around while you wait.

Reviews.Author: Ryan J.
Reviews.Content: Just went here Friday night with a few friends in town for the weekend.  The wait was long (the full hour and a half predicted by the maitre d'), but he took a cell number from us so we could go to a bar down the street to wait. Always a great service.The steaks are huge, well-seasoned, and cooked beautifully. The chorizo was awesome, and for 3 bucks, worth adding to any smaller entree. Most entrees, though, you won't need it. Luckily, everything's cheap and it's a BYO. Prepare for a long wait on weekends and get a seat outside if you can!

Reviews.Author: Ted H.
Reviews.Content: I went on a Sunday evening with one guest and was seated immediately. The space was cramped and very loud, but comfortable. The service was good. I had the filet mignon and it was fantastic!Overall this was a very good experience and the quality of the food is high.

Reviews.Author: Krishna A.
Reviews.Content: Pre-meal: I went here with a group of 8 people on a Friday night. We had reservations thankfully (accepted for 6+ people). The expected wait time here sans reservation will likely be 45 min - 1.5 hrs. We finally got seated 30 minutes after our reservation. But I was with mostly guys who didn't care that much. So if you don't like to wait, you won't like this part. But apparently there is a back room inside where you can wait that lots of people don't know about - so go inside and don't freeze. Or there is a bar 3 stores down. Go have a beer....Ambiance:Very dark. Very cozy. I loved it. There are also a bunch of international diners here. The people are very eclectic and it feels like a small European restaurant (even though the place is pretty big).Food:Ridiculous. I love steak. I ordered the prime rib rare. They give you a ton of food here. It was mouth-watering. My friends ordered the filet with the red wine sauce - unbelievable. The best steak I've had in a long time. The sides are so-so. But we didn't come here for veggies. So I would recommend ordering the steak and just a small side rather than the pre-made combinations.Drinks:BYOB - enough said. AmazingService:This is the only bad part of this place. The service staff here rushes you and you feel like you need to clear the table for the next group. But it's understandable. They are packed and they need to clear space.  The waiter screwed up on the rare-ness of 1 of our orders and brought out a completely different order for another guy. But this is anecdotal - so whatever. Price:It's a steakhouse in Chicago...a GOOD steakhouse. We all paid around 25-30 bucks. This is insane. You will pay $70-80 for a similar quality place. Summary:All in all, I will definitely be back here - most likely on a weekday and I'll make sure I go with less than 3-4 people. and I'll definitely order the Filet.

Reviews.Author: Steve B.
Reviews.Content: I went here with my wife and another couple a few weeks ago. First, let me get the bad news out of the way. The wait for a table is dreadful. We knew the wait was usually long going into it, but still ended up waiting for 3 hours at the Blue Bayou across the street before our table was called. That long of a wait for a table of FOUR! Ridiculous. Needless to say, the bloody marys from BB might have clouded my vision for the night. Now for the good.The food was fantastic. The primarily focus on meals with a lot of meat in them, so if you're a vegetarian/vegan, stay home. The atmosphere was buzzing with chatter, and the lighting was dim, but comfortable. Oh, and it's a BYOB so you save a boat load if you tend to buy alcoholic drinks at dinner. A nice bottle of red goes with most of their dishes.I would definitely go here again, but next time I'd put my name in at 5pm and go home and get ready!

Reviews.Author: Lauren M.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is definitely worth the wait. The pace betwen courses is perfect to enjoy your BYOB of choice and the good company you go with! The Antipasto is a perfect start to get you going in your meal and the empanadas con carne were perfectly prepared. I had the Bife Vesuvio which did not let me down. I ordered it cooked medium and it was spot on (despite the reviews I've read of it being over done)! The cheese and spinach combination is to die for.  Oh - the chimuchurri sauce? You need to try it with everything. It's garlicky goodness will smack you in the face.If you don't like to wait, I suggest showing up around 5 - 5:30 as it seemed like no one had to wait. After that, the wait seemed to settle around 30-45 minutes around 6:30. Also, the waitstaff - also yummy.I'm ashamed to say that I've lived in the city for 4 years and this is my first attempt....I'll surely be back!!

Reviews.Author: Viviana R.
Reviews.Content: I've visited this restaurant twice. The first time, I was really disappointed with my Milanesa de Pollo which was really dry and tough. However, my boyfriend loved the Churrasco so I figured why not try them out again? So glad I did! Their steaks are hands down delicious. Lesson learned, do not come to an Argentian Steak House and not order steak. I will agree with the other posters, come early or come after 8pm to get seated quickly.

Reviews.Author: Charles C.
Reviews.Content: This place is just fantasticEverything from the layout, ambiance, BYOB and food was solidEveryone here is always having a great time and enjoying themselvesI would highly recommend coming here if you are in the mood for a social night of boozing and meat eating

Reviews.Author: Gregory H.
Reviews.Content: Yet, another great meal from Tango Sur! The service was good, food was very tasty and atmosphere perfect for a nice dinner! I got in at 6p just before the rush so we got the last table and had no wait. It amazes me how packed they are every time I go here.I had the strip steak (med) cooked perfect, strong seasoning and hot. I could barely finish this meal, in fact, I brought a portion of the steak home.  I will say I prefer the mash vs. the potato wedges. The empanadas (beef) were okay but, the Chimchurri sauce was excellent! The salad is very small, shredded and needs some culinary work. I would agree on skipping this if you can. Overall, another great experience and a good price!

Reviews.Author: Sally O.
Reviews.Content: I'd been dying to try this restaurant forever.  There always seems to be a wait outside, so must be good!However, I was pretty disappointed in my experience.  For one, it is SO dark in there.  As my company said, there's something to be said about seeing your food; about seeing the presentation.  Our table was pretty much only lit by candlelight (which made reading the menu difficult), but I didn't like that everyone's plate looked like a black silhouette of mystery meat.2nd, my dish, plus a couple of others at my table was NOT very good.  I got the platter of several meats, but they were SO tough I ended up chewing what I could and having to spit out the rest.Based on this experience I probably wouldn't jump to go back there again.

Reviews.Author: Tom R.
Reviews.Content: On a corridor that severely lacks any other worthwhile food establishments, Tango Sur really stands out. The wait can be a bit long, but, the host takes your phone number so you can belly up to a local bar. BYOB is a huge plus and keeps the bill reasonable.The food is the star. The beef is unreal delicious and the two preparations I've had have both been amazing. The empanadas appetizer are a must as well. If you're in Wrigleyville and want an upscale meal, this is your place.

Reviews.Author: Manda C.
Reviews.Content: I love everything about Tango Sur....the food amazing, byob great, dark lighting sexy and friendly and attentive staff makes it perfect for me!!! Only thing I will say is the wait can get kinda long on the weekends and they don't take reservations, they do take your number and call you when a table is ready.  I usually end up waiting at a near by bar and getting kinda buzzed since I have an empty stomach.  So my suggestion would be to go on a weekday....I've been seated right away on a Monday or Tuesday night. Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Melissa S.
Reviews.Content: I made my husband take me here last weekend on a Sunday night since we were going to see his friend's band play at the Elbo Room and its pretty close (not walking distance mind you, but only a short 5 minute drive). We got there around 7:45pm and were concerned about finding parking in the area. There is no parking lots in the area so you're left to find street parking in the surrounding neighborhood. Fortunately, we found something at the next block. We put our name in and the host informed us it would be a 30 minute wait. We could leave a cell phone with him and he'd call us or we could wait on the bench outside. Since it was fairly nice outside, we chose to wait. 30 minutes wait doesn't really seem so bad considering stories of people having to wait to 2 hours to get in. Beware if you are a "party of 2". This is a very popular date place and there are lots of "party of 2's" Since this place is very small, they do not have very many tables for just 2 people so you will have to wait for a table of 4 to open up. And they do not take reservations for any party under 6 so keep than in mind as well. You will most likely have at least 3 or more "party of 2's" waiting ahead of you.Be prepared for Tango Sur first timers to pull the old "but I'm leaving for Iraq tomorrow", "its my girlfriend's birthday today", "we are celebrating an anniversary", "we called earlier and were told we could get in right away" type of utter BS that people pull to get the host to bump them up in the queue. We were seated at around 8:45 pm and by this time were really starving. It would really be nice if the restaurant perhaps offered bread or even chips to patrons waiting. It certainly  would not cost them a whole bunch and might soften the blow of having to wait so long. Our server gave me a visual hello to let me know he saw us sit down but it seemed like a good 10 minutes passed before someone came over to cork our bottle of wine and get our order. We were sat at a table meant for 4 people dead center in the middle of the dining room.Tables are spaced very very close together. You really feel like you are on top of everyone. Since this place is so popular, I'm sure they want to squeeze as many tables in as they can, but honestly, they could do with removing some of the tables and just having people suck it up and wait longer. As others have mentioned, there is no cork fee so bring yer own. Be forewarned though that they do not leave the cork with you so if you are not planned to drink it all, you might not be able to take your remaining wine with you when you leave. I drank all but a half glass so I have no idea if I could have taken the remaining bottle or not. Bring your own cork or wine stopper with you if you foresee this happening. As to the ambience of the place, its very nice but with that many people in tight quarters, it can get a bit loud. The music is played at a reasonable level and the tables are all candle lit and the lights are down fairly low. I guess if you like that sort of thing, but honestly, I would rather see my food a bit better. I'm a bit of a picky eater, see, and I'd like to see what's on my plate a bit better. The bread was pretty standard. The butter at the table, to my chagrin, was not whipped butter but just regular butter packets that they bought in bulk. The problem with this is the butter packets tend to be a little hard and not easy to spread. But seeing as they were sat close to the candle, they were a bit softer. Still, nice whipped butter would bring it up a bit. My husband and I got the Provoleta appetizer which was delicious but definately a lot of cheese to eat for 2 people especially if you are also eating bread, drinking wine and having salads and your entree. It took quite a long time to receive our salads, which was questionable considering its really nothing more than some leaf lettuce, tomato slices and some red onion with oil on a plate. Not really a "salad" in my book. I ended up giving the husband the majority of what was on my plate. My husband ordered the Pez which was fish and potatos. And I ordered the Vacio which was flat steak and potatos. The Vacio comes with sweet potatos but if you prefer mashed, they will get that for you instead. The Vacio is meant for 2 people but since I like my meat and want left overs (which was enough for 2 more meals). The serving of meat was huge; definately much more than 2 peoples worth (unless those 2 people are really big eaters). Three people could easily have enough of meat but the potato portions might be slim. It was blood red rare just as I like it. Chimichurri sauce was abundant and I ordered extra to take with me. Our total plus tip was around $90, which is pretty steep. But I got 2 more meals out of it so its not that bad. Go here for the food, but suggest going on a week night to save yourself the wait.

Reviews.Author: Haley W.
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give this place 5 stars...but the wait time knocks it down a star. I love the atmosphere and idea of Tango Sur, and it helps that it is BYOB. We waited for nearly 3 hours before our RESERVED table was given to us. Not to worry, we went down the street to a bar to have a few drinks while waiting. Once we actually were seated, our table was extremely close to the table next to us. Understandable for a busy restaurant, and my friends and I didn't mind. However, I don't think the couple next to us was too thrilled to have made their intimate date into a group thing with us. Oh well! We started with the empanadas and the Provoleta (Argentine provolone cheese cooked on the grill with olive oil and roasted peppers). Holy smokes was that cheese amazing! Maybe we were just starved at this point, but we devoured it almost instantly. I can't remember what my friends had ordered for entrees, but I had Pechuga de Pollo. It's a grilled chicken breast with vegetables and served with a chimichurri sauce. SO GOOD! Overall, I love this place and I can't wait to go back. I just wish the wait wasn't as long and that they were better about reservations. Thank goodness it's BYOB!

Reviews.Author: Omar K.
Reviews.Content: short and simple: great great great food. very small, long wait, and very loud. good for groups, not dates.

Reviews.Author: Kais S.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite restaurant in Chicago, great ambiance, great food and great service once you are seated. The only problem that prevents me from giving it a 5 star rating is the wait time right before you get seated. I have been to that place twice and in both times we had to wait for more than half an hour although we made reservations.

Reviews.Author: Aminda S.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur and I are breaking up.  I've brushed some questionable service issues off my shoulder over the years, but last night was the final straw.  Just your standard case of unrequited love.   I loved you Tango Sur...for nearly a decade.  But you never appreciated me - I know this now.  Nearly nine years ago when I moved to Chicago Tango Sur was recommended to me by a co-worker and after experiencing their amazingly inexpensive yet divine cuisine, and adorable setting, I was head over heels in love (or as I would come to find out - blinded by love).  I was so in love I continued to frequent the venue for celebratory gatherings (birthdays, engagement parties, etc.) and anytime I had an out of town guest, Tango Sur was the first place I would take them.  While working retail on Michigan Avenue  I even recommended Tango Sur to tourists assuring them it would be worth the $20 cab ride to and fro.   Honestly, Tango Sur should have been paying me - I was a  referral/advertiser/supporter and never asked for anything back in return but average (often times less than average) service and meat - delicious, perfectly executed meat - and lots of it!  But looking back I should have seen the warning signs.  I mean, once a server argued with me when I politely informed him the empanadas he delivered to the table were cheese and spinach when we had actually ordered chicken.  "No, you ordered spinach and cheese."  Um.  What.  So I guess I shouldn't be surprised about the actions of the staff last night....I arrived with my parents, a couple of friends, and one Tango Sur virgin at 7:55PM for our 8:00PM reservation.  We were told we were the next table to be seated once a six top left so we were kindly escorted to the waiting area where we were told we could pop our wine while we waited - standard practice.  We waited several minutes for glasses and when none came, I sought out the host and asked if we could have a few glasses for our beverages.  I was told they were short on glasses but that some should be available shortly.  I won't go into too much detail about what transpired over the next hour of waiting in that room but let's just say, an hour wait when you supposedly have a reservation is made tolerable by drinking wine...however, because over that hour no glasses were ever made available to us, we sat staring at our full bottles of wine...and at each other...agitation growing by the minute.  I politely checked on the status of the glasses a few times while we waited always being told they were coming.  And when checking on our status in line - "you're next."  But once the clock struck 9PM, my frustration could no longer be contained.  My guests were yawning, and I was hungry.  So I approached a server and asked if we could get ANY glasses - whether that be a coffee mug, water glass, just something so we could ease our frustrations of waiting an hour with some wine.   His response... "PLEASE!!!  Can you have some glasses, PLEASE!!  As you can see we don't have any and NO we won't give you ANY glass.  We'll give you WINE glasses when they are available but we don't have any."   As if the hour we had already waited for our RESERVATION wasn't bad enough, tears welled up in my eyes from being berated in front of fellow patrons.  And with that, we packed up our belongings and headed for the door.  As we approached the host he pointed to our table thinking we were coming to sit, but we continued on, letting him know we would be dining elsewhere.  Management followed behind to find out why we were unhappy but the apology didn't feel sincere, nor did they make much of an attempt to convince us to stay and make things right - after all, they probably had another pissed off party of six they could seat once they wiped their hands clean of us.  All the while I was wiping tears away, completely embarrassed as diners observed our exchange.Honestly, my feelings are hurt.  After all this time, and so much loyalty to this business, in the end I found out I'm just another customer to them...really less than that.  Ironically, my server from my very first visit in 2004 happened to be the very same gentleman who followed us out to issue an apology.  I'm sure he sees so many people in and out, he probably didn't make the connection - perhaps if he had, he would have tried harder to save the relationship.Break ups are hard.  But there are plenty of fish in the sea.  Or in this case, steaks in the city.  And I intend to find one served with a side of customer appreciation.

Reviews.Author: Adam A.
Reviews.Content: I've never had a very pleasant experience at Tango Sur. (disclaimer: I gave it 3 tries) I find the food to be lacking in flavor and I honestly cant quite get over the lack of lighting or space. It's never a good idea to try and make a reservation as you will still wait only to be cramped into a table section meant for a few people less than your party. Overall the staff is always friendly so props to you guys for doing a great job. Its ok to have a little electricity every once in awhile ;)

Reviews.Author: Steve H.
Reviews.Content: One of the best spots in Chicago but plan on a long wait on weekend evenings. Go early on a weekday and enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Dariann L.
Reviews.Content: I went to Tango Sur with a few of my best friends for my birthday, on July 16th. My favorite appetizer were the empanadas (chicken and spinach with cheese). The entrees themselves looked and smelled delicious. I had the churrasco and the steak was pretty big. I wish I had ordered it medium, instead of medium well. It was a little tough to cut through, but it was still good. The servers were pretty attentive to our needs. So much so, I drank a gallon a water that night. My glass never got empty of water lol. I had the caramel flan for dessert and it was good, but a little too sweet and rich for me. Otherwise, the experience there was quite lovely.Tips And/Or Downsides:- Make sure to make a reservation. They won't sit you unless you're with your group. They gave me a bit of a hard time, but they were nice enough to let me sit with one of my friends at a table while I waited for the rest of my group.- Street parking might be a little hard. It might take you a while to find a parking spot, unless you pay for parking at a lot or do valet service.- Make sure to tip your server really well, especially if they've given you great service. You don't want them to be offended.- One restroom for the Ladies, from what I saw so far. I was able to hold it until after my dessert lol.- The lighting is really low (meant for a romantic and intimate atmosphere). If you have terrible eyesight, you may want to use the candle for lighting and/or have someone read the menu for you.

Reviews.Author: Pokher A.
Reviews.Content: BYOB at a steakhouse, enough said right? The food is great and the quantity they give you is enormous. Follow everyones suggestion to be a little patient since they do get extremely busy on the weekends but rest assured the experience will be worth it. Try the sweetbreads and then the bone-in ribeye.

Reviews.Author: Alissa S.
Reviews.Content: Perfect place in lakeview! Just walking by you can smell how delicious Tango Sur is! I am a veggie and this is a steakhouse but I don't care. Everything about this place is amazing. It has a romantic candle lit ambiance, great steaks ( according to friends ) that smell delicious, and they also have pasta dishes for non meat eaters . Give it a try, you wont regret it!

Reviews.Author: Angie K.
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to wow your date, bring them to Tango Sur. I came here with my fiance and out of town friend last night (a Wednesday) and had a phenomenal time. I read the yelp reviews beforehand (a MUST for a popular restaurant) and read that they now take reservations. I called and put this to the test. I called at 5:01 (they open at 5) and scored a reso for 3 at 8:30. I was jumping for joy. We got there 15 minutes earlier and was informed it would be about a 15 min wait. We were escorted to the back waiting room where other patrons waiting had already popped their bottles. As we were about to the do the same, my name was called. Just walking from the entrance to the waiting room and the waiting room to the table, I was already so excited to be here. It is completely pitch black and the main source of lighting is by a single candle on each table, making is extremely romantic. There's loud, sorta samba/electronic music playing that I would compare to Sushi Samba's or shopping at Express. It definitely sets the mood for a fun group or date experience without being too mushy, serious or cheesy. The tables were spacious enough that I couldn't really hear the couple next to me. The seating is half booth and half chairs. I sat on the booth side.Our waiter greeted us immediately and helped pop open our wine bottles (BYOB!!). We ordered 1 ham and cheese and 1 spinach and cheese empanada (I think $3 each?). I don't eat ham (pescatarian here) but my fiance and friend enjoyed the spinach one better. The chimichurri is to die for. I literally drowned everything in it and could drink it if I could. I even started googling "How to make chimichurri" at the table because I need this in my life on a regular basis. I ordered the eggplant ($10!) as my dish and LOVED it. Someone on yelp compared it to an eggplant lasagna and I would agree. It is drowning in a creamy, cheesy red sauce and is thinly layered with eggplant. Everyone loved my dish, and it was big enough to share. My fiance ordered the filet medium rare ($27 I think?), which he was impressed with and my friend ordered the churrasco ($22) medium rare as well. The churrasco was cooked well-done. He said it was extremely chewy and hard. My friend had split the filet with my fiance and was already full, so he asked the waiter if they could just take it off the bill. The waiter had to present the steak to the cook and sure enough, apologized and removed it from the bill. To make up for it, they gave us a complimentary flan which was pretty good and I'm not even a flan person. The portions are ridiculously large and I would suggest people split entrees with they plan to have appetizers and wine. There's just no way to eat it all yourself. The steaks came with sides. I had some of the mashed potatoes (awesome with chimichurri on top) and there were fries with the churrasco. I can see how crazy packed this place can get as it was at full capacity on a Wed night. I definitely suggest you call ahead and make reservations and get there a little earlier. Also, smiling and being super nice to the staff also helps, as I was. Because it's a packed house, our waiter was a little MIA for a moment, but that's understandable as I'm sure he was helping multiple tables at the same time. I definitely LOVE this place and can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Author: temeka w.
Reviews.Content: I've been here a few times now and have always had great food.   The music they play helps you a feel you're being immersed in true Argentinian culture   There has even been live musicians playing.  It's usually pretty crowded which makes it pretty loud and lively.  A lot of my friends really like that it is BYOB.  And, even my friends from out of town have really enjoyed the place overall.  I really liked the empanadas,  the steak,  and the lemon chicken dish.  Great food, great atmosphere what more can I ask for?

Reviews.Author: Jose M.
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to this place for years, Its a BYOB steak restaurant. Great food, specially the meat. The only drawback is that is crowded and the wait can be over an hour on busy night. Once you are seated the service is good and the food is original from Argentina. Prices are reasonable with ambiance being loud and the place is dark but if you are a meat eater this is the place to eat.

Reviews.Author: Lil C.
Reviews.Content: I went there after an afternoon cubs game with my out of town boyfriend at the time.  We cabbed it from Wrigley at it was not a far. I was impressed with the portions.  It was a little too much food for me but the prices and portions are hard to beat.  We had appetizers and entrees.  I hardly could finish my steak it covered almost the whole plate.  The restaurant is very small and intimate.Pros Romantic setting, BYOB, large portions, very affordable, close to WrigleyCons: smallOverall, I thought it was a great BYOB steak place

Reviews.Author: Charles F.
Reviews.Content: I am running behind in finally reviewing Tango Sur, but I wanted to sing the praises of my experience at this great restaurant.I was in Chicago for July 4th weekend, often eating on the fly with a few sit down options taken, most that were just disgusting. Finding Tango Sur was a great thing. My travel partner and I found the place when asking around in Lincoln Park, and headed there on the detail given by the random person on the street, and how they looked as they recanted eating there... almost like they went there a moment and left the sidewalk in front of me.  lolThe advice was good. I was uncertain about the place, as we arrived RIGHT at the time before the place gets busy, finding a place to park very close by. The wait staff was very good, with questions and the patience with the indecision of my cohort. The expediters and bus-boys very on it. Waters filled, and others wine bottles opened and served what seemed to be efficiently.  Being the only ones there when we arrived, the place was full by the time we were half way into our meal, giving a great ambiance to what was initially too quiet a place.I had 12 oz steak(rare) with the roasted potatoes. The steak was PERFECT, as were the potatoes. I am glad that I opted for them, as I have not been eating starches as often as I once did, so I had been reserved. They were worth the indulgence of carbs for sure.  The Empanadas before the entree were really good, but I would say that the included salad(a few leaves of head lettuce, a few sliced tomatoes, and rings of onion, with oil and vinegar as the only dressing option) that was with the entree was a bit disappointing, though I really did not need more with such a HUGE steak that seemed well over the listed menu weight. It was excellent and the seasonings of the Argentine influence were a nice change from the midwest traditional steak.The lack of a star to make it 5 stars is effected by the fact that veggie choices seem to be the only think lacking at this establishment.I will be back here, hopefully with a date vs a friend next time. One of the best finds so far on my exploits of Chicago.... which have just begun!

Reviews.Author: Andrew S.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur was wonderful in so many ways it is hard to begin.  From the music, straight from the tango salons in Buenos Aires.  To the beef, which was massive and quite tasty.  The wonderful intimate atmosphere of the place was just great.For American standards the service was a little slow.  However I did not visit this restaurant for the American experience, so I'd have to say the service level was an part with much of the rest of the world.  If you're in a hurry, why not visit Applebees?  I found it quite refreshing that I could just enjoy an unhurried dinner, without the usual rushed American restaurant feeling.After enjoying the meal, I was quite pleasantly surprised at how little the bill was.  I don't think I've ever paid that little for so much great food.

Reviews.Author: Emily D.
Reviews.Content: The best bang for your  buck in the city! You get 2 steaks with your order for the price of one very reasonably priced steak.  The staff is very friendly and attentive, and best of all it's BYOB!  Being able to get an excellent steak (the filet is fantastic) and a bottle of wine for the price of just one steak is amazing.The waits are very long, but there is plenty to do on Southport while you wait - so just go prepared to explore the neighborhood.  It is very small and crowded and gets pretty loud, but it is a fun atmosphere and excellent food.

Reviews.Author: Joseph G.
Reviews.Content: This place is the epitome of fine Chicago neighborhood dining. No corkage, great ambiance, great service, great meal, great cuts, great flavors. The menu is pretty comprehensive and my vegetrian friends always find something on it - usually a salad or fried appetizer that they can eat.Yes, you will have to wait - but, that is because it is worth it.

Reviews.Author: Lauren E.
Reviews.Content: How is Tengo Sur only getting 4 stars??!! This is one of Chicago's great dining experiences! Unique atmosphere, reasonably priced, BYOB (without a silly corking fee) and steaks that compete with the downtown steakhouses for half the price! There are very few places like it.The whole experience is great. They do not take reservations (which I am sure has been previously mentioned 389 times), but I absolutely love running over to Que Sarah for a few bottles of wine and then hanging out at one of the surrounding bars until they call my cell phone and tell me a table is ready! I have many favorite dishes, but my faaaavorite meal is the baked cheese (the name is escaping me right now) and the medium rare lomo for the main course. The deserts are fantastic as well! I always make a point of taking out of town guests here since it is so unique and fabulous!!! Seriously, talking about this makes may lead me to go there tonight!

Reviews.Author: Alexandra G.
Reviews.Content: Are you a meat lover? romantic? adventurer? and a dining out aficionado? Then put Tango Sur on your "must" list.Tango Sur is definitely one of Chicago's food gems. I recommend planning ahead so that a) you build your appetite, b) buy your favorite bottle of wine, and c) go at a descent time so that you don't experience a long wait. Only come here if you're in the mood to eat a LOT. I would start off with the cheese and chicken empanadas. Then, if you're feeling adventurous, order the Parrillada (different assortments of meat) or the flank steak with chimichurri. Caution, the portions are enormous, so you might want to share. My brother and I are always guaranteed to come out with a very satisfying food coma.The ambiance is dark and cozy. The aesthetics and decorations are old and rustic. Each table is lit with a candle which sets the mood perfectly. This is a great date place, so men take note.Finally, make sure to come at a reasonable hour- if not be prepared to wait. I've waited up to 2 hours for a table- in which case bring extra bottles of wine and be ready to squeeze yourself into the waiting room with a lot of people who've probably already downed a bottle of wine or two- so it gets rowdy!

Reviews.Author: a. b.
Reviews.Content: I love El Filet and the spinach mashed potatoes. The chimichurri is delish also! And don't forget the flan, totally creamy and carmelly and amazing.The wait can be awhile (up to an hour and a half on friday and saturday nights), but you can wait at the bar, and the host will call your cell! I think the wait is worth it, especially if I've been fantasizing about tender filets, tangy salads, peppers and cheese dip, and flan all week. One bonus is the BYOB: it's a great way to cut costs on a date (drinks are always a big chunk of our dinners). There's great little wine shop across the street too (que syrah) with bottles as low as $9 to go with your spicy argentinian meats.If you're daring and really into meat-experimentation, you can get the sampling of meat cuts that come on a little grill (warning: includes blood sausage!).If you don't feel like steak, there is also a delicious half a chicken with steak fries, or a eggplant stack like a lasagne that's filling yet guilt-free. I also had a great sea bass there one time, but always return to my El Filet.

Reviews.Author: Meg K.
Reviews.Content: Great prices, tasty meat and nice atmosphere PLUS it's BYO - what more could you ask for? Exposed brick walls, dim lighting and candles on the table make this a fun and inexpensive date place. There's outdoor seating, too, if the weather's nice. Service was good and unobtrusive. For dinner my friend and I shared the vascio and the currasco. Both were cooked perfectly, though the cut on the vascio was kind of gristly. The salad that came with was uninteresting to the extreme - almost not even worth having at all - it consisted of one slice of tomato and a few onion rings on a bed of chopped lettuce and was undressed (though oil and vinegar were provided, I think). You also get rolls, but they, too, are unremarkable. Anyway the whole meal came to $40 for 2 including tax and tip, and we had more than enough to eat. At that price, you really can't complain...

Reviews.Author: Eric G.
Reviews.Content: Demonstrating a true act of love, my Vegetarian girlfriend took me to Tango Sur for my birthday!  I ordered steak stuffued with spinach, mar del plata cheese and garlic in a white wine sauce.  I ordered it medium and it was one of the best steaks I have ever had.  It was a  perfect cut of meat and it lacked fat.My girlfriend ordered  the oven baked eggplant with spinach, provolone, parmesan and ricotta, covered with tomato cream sauce.  I tried it and it was almost as filling as my steak.  It was very rich and hearty.The atmosphere at Tango Sur is unique and intimate.  It was a great escape from the North Side and it resembled the types of dinning experiences that I have had in Europe.I look forward to returning to Tango Sur with my Carnivore friends in the future and trying some of the different meats on the menu.And yes its BYOB, no corkage fee....

Reviews.Author: Christopher D.
Reviews.Content: I recently dined here for the first time and will 2nd everything that the reviewer, "Quan L", has stated. It can feel a little crowded, but everyone minds their own business and it's a pretty laid back atmosphere. God knows my group got kind of loud with some very ill-timed joking around, but other tables seem to just giggle about it. Definitely plan on getting there as early as possible to beat the rush.

Reviews.Author: Rachel O.
Reviews.Content: BYOB's have a special place in my hear and Tango Sur ranks very near the top in my book.  Pick up a few bottles of Malbec and get on over to Tango Sur.  You'll flipr for the great steaks, great prices and great service.  No matter what you choose, you will be full and very happy with your meal.  THe portions are huge and you can definitely head home with leftovers for a few days.  The meat sampler (Parillada) platter is pretty tasty too and offers a huge variety of meats.  As a starter, you must try the empanadas.  I'm a big fan of the Spinach ones but they are all pretty delishDon't try this place if you're in a hurry since they don't take reservations unelss you're with a large group.  Come hungry!

Reviews.Author: Julio V.
Reviews.Content: My favorite place for a great steak.  Excellent place and value!  The wait is well worth it and it's a BYOB!.   GAINED MY BUSINESS!trhey also have a lounge called "ñ"  which is a nice cozy place. perfect for taking dates  to a nite with friends.

Reviews.Author: Francesca L.
Reviews.Content: I could have given them five stars, but minus one star is for the time when I was waiting to get a seat.  Last time when I was there for my birthday dinner with my boyfriend, I waited for about an hour I think.  I understand since this place gets a lot of people.  I know that they have great food; BYOB does a lot to this place.    Whenever I go, I always have a great waiter.  You know, you feel great when you are treated as you were supposed to:)If you haven't gone to this restaurant, please go and try.  You will have a great time with awesome food.  Oh, I just remember getting free dessert after the waiter asked me if it was my birthday.  See, you should go and try great service.

Reviews.Author: Nora S.
Reviews.Content: Mouthwatering Steak... Huge portions...BYOB..you can't go wrong if food and drinking are your focus.  My only caution to you is that it gets extremely loud in here so I wouldn't plan on a romantic date on a busy nigth.  This is a great place to enjoy on weekdays or early on weekends.  They only takes reservations for parties of six or more and even then we have had to wait a long time.   Highly recommend the red pepper cheese appetizer. Bring enough wine for the wait and you'll be just fine.Deal Tip:  Buy Wines at Costco or the Wine Discount Center

Reviews.Author: Rasmus P.
Reviews.Content: So much in doubt if i should give this place all 5 stars. There is really no reason not to as this was a SUPER experience. The food was so good - and by 'food' i mean the Steaks. Don't come there for the appetizers, the bread, the fancy servers / service or the interior but please go there for the steaks!On a Friday at 6.30 we (2 people) walked right in for a great experience! We might have been the last to make it before the line started forming outside - and when we left there was a huge line - so be prepared.I can 100% recommend this place for the food (seriously, the stakes are up there with Gibson's - which in my book is all you can ask for), but do me a favor and use this BYOB to bring a good bottle of wine (feel free to ask the dealer if you don't have a clue) - it makes me sad when the people next to me had Light beer with that meal...

Reviews.Author: Dustin C.
Reviews.Content: Oh yes, I love red meat & Tengo Sur delivers!Despite the loud noise level and close proximity of the tables, this spot has an amazing selection of dinner entres which are fit for two. The BYOB aspect is never too exciting for me personally, but how could one not understand the appeal.Four stars, great food, great ambiance.

Reviews.Author: Mike D.
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of my favorite steak places in Chicago with great prices, you definitely get a lot more then what you pay for!!

Reviews.Author: Vincent L.
Reviews.Content: Pork chop was okay. Veal tbone medium was delicious. Normally do nott eat medium but this was good. Really Good.

Reviews.Author: Rachel K.
Reviews.Content: Great food 4 stars for service and my steak was rare! I asked for medium but man what an awesome atmosphere!!!

Reviews.Author: Ravi P.
Reviews.Content: Boy do I love this place!! The food is great and the prices are actually pretty good for a steakhouse.  The only problem is that there are way too many tables and the place is congested, but this also shows how busy and great they are!  4 stars because it needs more lighting, sometimes can be noisy and hard to talk, byob, and super congested.

Reviews.Author: Chris G.
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for.  It's cheap steak, and therefore, not high quality...at all.  I've been here multiple times, and each time, myself and others received tough pieces of meat.  If you don't care about the quality of your steak, like to order it well-done, and just want gigantic portions at low prices, this is the place for you.  Most folks who eat here are frat bro's just out of college trying to impress a girl.  Nothing wrong with any of that, but it doesn't fit the profile of legit, good steakhouse.  If you actually care about how your steak tastes and don't want to wait forever before you eat, you should go somewhere else.

Reviews.Author: Stacey F.
Reviews.Content: Best Argentinian in the city. Comfortably chaotic and candlelit. Always get the empanadas for a starter. But be prepared for a wait. I recommend having a drink and waiting at one of the bars down the way.

Reviews.Author: Donna M.
Reviews.Content: Excellent place. Ordered a beef and a spinacn empanada and the filet with spinach mashed potatoes. It was awesome! BYOB makes this place affordable. Waiter was attentive and efficient. Definitley want to go back.

Reviews.Author: Geni S.
Reviews.Content: I've heard good things about this place and finally had a chance to try it out last night.  They do not take reservations for parties of 2 so you have to wait.  As it was a Saturday night we had about a 1 hour wait.  There is no bar here so you have to go down the street and have a drink but they call you with a 5 minute heads up that your table is ready.  That worked fine for us.There is a very lively atmosphere...in fact sometimes it gets too loud to hear your friends.  That said, we ordered the empanadas and they are big a very good.  We liked the Ham and cheese and Spinach ones best. For the main course I had the scallops and my husband had the Filet Mignon.  The portion size for the filet was great and it was cooked perfectly.  The scallops were tender but could have had more flavor.  We ordered the Argentine style Flan for desert and it was exceptional. This is a BYOB restaurant so remember to bring a good bottle of wine with you.  Overall, I recommend this place.  It is casual and rather inexpensive.  Our tab was about $58 for 2 people.

Reviews.Author: Eric P.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is the best steakhouse in Chicago that no one has heard of.  Problem is, now everyone has heard of it.I have been to Tango Sur many times, although I have only sat inside on one occasion.  The service is generally only okay, but you don't come to Tango Sur for the service.  You come for the steak, and lots of it.Just about every time I go, I get El Filet, a two-filet entree for a mere $25.  That's dinner and lunch for the next day folks.  Tango does not serve drinks, but it's a BYOB.  If you're waiting for a table, I recommend heading over to Que Syrah to grab a bottle of wine, just a half block south of Tango Sur on the opposite site of the street.

Reviews.Author: Katie M.
Reviews.Content: We went with a group of 8 and were a little early for our reservation so we had to wait. But that was okay because the waiting room had tables and benches and wine glasses - BYOB! The lighting was dim so it was kind of hard to see the menu or our food. We had empanada's to start - very yummy! I had the fillet mignon with spinach mashed potatoes - again, yummy! The rest of the group also had steaks of various sorts and they all said it was very good. We would definitely go back - the price is right and the BYOB is the cherry on top.

Reviews.Author: Prescott H.
Reviews.Content: Date number 3 rolls around and you want to make it romantic, but you are unsure of where to go...well, good thing you are reading this review. Tango Sur is a fantastic place to light that romantic fire.Warning: the following is going to sound cheesy: dimly-lit candlelight dinner. Not many places pull this aspect of a romantic dinner off as well as Tango Sur. But what's romance without a little cheese? And what's the next need to a romantic dinner: tasty food. Well, Tango Sur is definitely not lacking in the food department. Tango Sur is a meat-lover's dream (do not bring a vegetarian to this restaurant!) - a restaurant which does not shy away from cooking a rare steak! In this day and age - what, are they crazy? Plus, it's a BYOB restaurant...which I hear makes it even more romantic! What's this place missing, you wonder? Seating. You will probably wait for a table on a weekend. If at all possible, dine at Tango Sur on a weekday. Unfortunately, the sign of a good restaurant is the fact it is always busy.

Reviews.Author: Katherine c.
Reviews.Content: Well I'm sad in a way that all the yuppies (sorry) have taken over one of my favorite restaurants. I used to go here with my old boyfriend years ago. I'm glad it has gotten the recognition is deserves, but now it is ALWAYS jam packed. Reservations are only taken for parties of 6 or more, which leaves a mob of people waiting on the sidewalk and street. I find this distracting when you are trying to eat. The food is AMAZING. Having been to Argentina, I find the food to be very authentic and it does live up to all the hype. The restaurant is BYOB which is nice, it's just a little tight on space, and if you sit inside you may leave smelling like steak....but hey maybe your guy might like that : ) Try going mid week, when the crowd and wait is not so big....and it will be great!!

Reviews.Author: chicagofoodchic f.
Reviews.Content: Two words... Friggin amazing. I came here with my boy toy (yes I called him that- sowy andre =() a couple weeks ago. He picked some wine up at a whole foods and away we went. I'm new to chitown and I'm kickin myself as to why I haven't come here earlier! OMG. candlelight.... Im a sucker for candlelight. I mean REAL candlelight- like the only light in there hahah. We shared a steak between the two of us (a huge slab of meat). It was phenom. Didn't break the bank either. Try the jamon con melon. Best ap ever. Simple, refreshing.... The flan was great too. Good meal from start to finish, great, non annoying service. Oh did I mention there was a dude playing flamenco guitar too?nuff sed

Reviews.Author: Meagan L.
Reviews.Content: This is a very romantic BYOB that has a tavernous steak restaurant feel. I ordered filet mignon with salad. The steak was perfectly cooked, flavored and cut like butter. Although the food was pricey, you have to keep in mind that you are getting two meals for the price of one. My dish had two 4 oz. filets with a hearty helping of herb roasted potatoes. I was yearning for something more with the salad. It was a bit of lettuce that was supposed to highlight a large slice of tomato. The tomato was kind of grainy, just wasn't great. It is not the season for tomatoes. The meal would have been perfect if instead of surprise herb roasted potatoes (they were good), I got a nice salad with my steak. I really wanted steak with a bit of crispy lettuce, couple of onion rings, perhaps a cold boiled potato wedge, white raddish, and a high quality fresh tomato wedge or two with a light red wine vinaigrette. Finished the meal off with the carrot cake which was delectable. Go here with a date.

Reviews.Author: Steve V.
Reviews.Content: It was strongly recommend by a few co-workers that I visit tango sur. They said its BYOB, so bring a few friends, a few bottles of wine and enjoy. So I did just that. The food takes a bit, but it's worth the wait. Order a few things, drink some of that wine with your friends and before you know it a bunch of perfectly cooked, delicious meat will arrive. Overall, I will definitely go back. Reasonable prices, great food and BYOB with no corkage fee. One note: I would recommend saving this dinner for a night when you don't have any time restraints, as I said, the food takes a little bit.

Reviews.Author: Foster T.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is a truly unique Argentine steakhouse where the cuisine is as affordable as it is delicious.  After spending time in Buenos Aires, Argentina, I returned to the states craving more of the dark cuisine of cured meats, oversized steaks and blood-red wine.  Having  tried a number of Argentine restaurants from Kansas City to New York, I realized just how hard it is to recreate the mood of an authentic Buenos Aires eatery.  Only Tango Sur comes close.Mood: 5/5 -- With an dimly, candle-lit interior, the place feels like a different world altogether.  As the Spanish guitarist strums sad melodies, it is impossible not to get lost in the enigmatic charm of the far South.Food: 4/5 -- Giant steaks and meat of all colors. Delicate sweetbreads.  Chimmichurri sauce that tastes as if the recipe is 100 years old.  The food is incredible, and cheap. BYOB makes the price unbeatable.Service: 3/5 -- Typical Argentine service.  Slow, not terribly helpful, but nothing to complain about.  Professional.Verdict -- Wow.  Try this place as soon as possible.  Just be prepared for a wait.  And don't forget to bring along several bottles of the native Argentine Malbec.

Reviews.Author: Nelson A R.
Reviews.Content: Here's what I had:Spinach & Cheese Empanada (B+) $2Medio Pollo al Limon - Half Chicken  (A-) $15The atmosphere is terrific, the prices are appropriate for the food, and the food is very good. It is BYOB; I was not charged a corking fee. It was a slow Monday night and the waiting staff was super friendly and efficient. The area is very chill with other neighboring restaurants, shops, and movie theatres. I sat at in the patio area which is nice and has heaters available for chilly nights. Really good experience.

Reviews.Author: Haiku-Project H.
Reviews.Content: Meat.  Candlelit meat.Have fun with wine and your friends.Don't forget the meat.

Reviews.Author: Hakim K.
Reviews.Content: i don't like to waste the reader time..... all what you have to know that their steak with spinach and cheese is the best nation wideI went many places in California and east cost.......I think that u r missing a lot by not try it even for once ;)ask for beef vesuvio with garlic oil.....hmmmmmmm

Reviews.Author: Mark V.
