Reviews.Content: I have been coming here for almost nine years now and it is has routinely been the place to go for a special occasion at a not-so special occasion price.  In college, we came all of the time, often in massive groups.  But since then, the prices have gone up (although they are still quite reasonable), you no longer have the option of Argentine beef (at least I haven't been offered the option in a few years), and the waits have gotten to be prohibitively long, sometimes 3 hours on a Saturday.  I also might add that despite the candlelit tables and dark atmosphere, this is probably not the place for a date night.  The chimmichurri will leave your breath rancid.  You will wait...and wait...and wait for a table.  And then you will wait...and wait...and wait for your meal. But all of these negatives aside, I have never regretted a single trip to Tango.  I always eat my heart out, I always drink glass after glass of wine, and, most importantly, I always enjoy myself. The meal and experience make all of the quirks of this restaurant worth it.  I have fond memories of this place, and will keep coming back for years to come.

Reviews.Author: Amber K.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING!!! Great romantic atmosphere, excellent service, amazing steaks!! Plus its BYOB! What more can you ask for!

Reviews.Author: Kyle W.
Reviews.Content: Excellent.  Went last night - group of 3.  Took 10 minutes to be seated.  Its byob so make sure to bring in a bottle of wine. No corkage fee!   We started off with the antipasto and a trio of empenadas.  The empenadas were flame!  For my main dish I got the El Filet which also was so good!  The other 2 got steaks as well and enjoyed em.  Our total bill was $105 for the three of us which is not bad at all for such a good restaurant.  Will def be back!

Reviews.Author: Hannah P.
Reviews.Content: We came on V-Day and our waiter Martin was very kind and attentive.  I even got a rose. Thanks Martin.

Reviews.Author: Fernando T.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for the food. 1 star for the wait.I am writing this review, about a month after the bad experience. 2+ hours for a table for two?? Really???The food is great. I've been here a few times over the years. Just great! The empanadas, the meat, the fact that it's BOYB, service is good too. My favorite is the vacio...just awesome. The parrilla is also great. Just mouthwatering. Prices are great too. I think the problem with the wait is that the restaurant tends to cater more to large groups. Just my view of things. Saw very few couples (maybe 3) on my last night there. Went on a Saturday night, at 6:30 p.m., anticipating the long wait. Signed in, was told the wait was about one hour or so...fine, went to have coffee at the corner...came back at 7:30 pm, waited outside for about 45 minutes, was taken to the back room/waiting room, waited there for another 45 minutes approx. it was almost 9 pm. (the other couple who was also there got fed up and left); I had opened my bottle of merlot, to make the wait a little easier, but still....The staff has to find a way to get customers to get moving, politely of course...I mean, a large table was just wasting time after they had already paid their bill, laughing, taking pictures, checking their fb status, etc...sure, you're having a great time, but c'mon! there are other folks waiting, for hours, literally!So, if you don't mind waiting for over 2 hours...go for it! The wait is "easier" if you open your booze in the back room and if you're a large group.

Reviews.Author: Rochelle A.
Reviews.Content: If you don't have somewhere to be later in the evening, this place is a MUST try. The atmosphere is romantic for a couple and fun for a group. I've been to this restaurant 4 times now and every time I've loved the food, service and atmosphere. My fiance and I typically start off with a couple empanadas and then split the lomo. Its definitely enough food for the two of us and we always leave happy.Also, the back waiting room is nice, but be sure to bring an extra bottle of vino as its BYOB while you're waiting.

Reviews.Author: Jeff S.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is a place I want to like more but it underwhelmed me. After hearing great things about this place I was glad to finally try it. We had 845 reservation but we're not seated till after 9, not a big deal.  Our service was so so at best, food was the same. The empanadas were great but my steak which I order medium rare came our medium to medium well and was tough.  For all the hype I was disappointed, not a bad place but not worth the long wait.

Reviews.Author: Kristen B.
Reviews.Content: As much as I'd like to rate Tango higher, I do not appreciate how they treat their patrons. Tango gets great business (every time we go it's at least a 2 hour wait), so I think they take their patrons for granted and don't treat them as respectfully as I'd like. I always feel rushed and not appreciated. That being said, the food is pretty good - especially for the price. And the atmosphere is what keeps us coming back. It's very romantic - only candle light, great music, and BYOB! It's definitely worth going here at least once.

Reviews.Author: Alf O.
Reviews.Content: If you can come a little earlier on a Saturday evening, say 4pm, you're going to have a much easier experience with Tango Sur.This place is great, no matter what your price point is, you can find something here that you'll enjoy, from $15 to $50.

Reviews.Author: Patrick L.
Reviews.Content: Amazing

Reviews.Author: Heidi T.
Reviews.Content: I'm in love.  Incredible food.  Fabulous, unpretentious service.  And prices that made me double-check my bill because I thought they must have missed an entree when the charged us.  We brought two other friends and as many bottles of wine with us on a Friday night and only waited about 20 minutes.  Just...awesome.

Reviews.Author: Megan G.
Reviews.Content: This is the most overrated restaurant I have ever had the displeasure of dining at.  Yep, I said it.  I refuse to jump on the Tango Sur bandwagon.  In fact, it was truly and awful experience from start to finish and I will likely never ever go back.I went on a Friday night at 7 pm with my boyfriend and my parents.  I fully expected to wait at least an hour so we had planned to put our name in and go for a cocktail at Cullen's a couple doors down.  The person at Tango Sur taking names told us an hour and a half wait, tops.  Perfect.  We high tailed it down to Cullen's and bellied up at the back bar happily sipping on our drinks and listening to the bartender rave about how good the food was.  Slowly, time started ticking by and before we knew it our hour and a half had passed and our stomachs were starting to growl.  After another half hour passed we decided to go down to Tango Sur and wait inside, thinking surely it was about time.  They have a waiting room in the back area of the place and we mossied on back there.  We opened a bottle of wine and waited.  And waited.  And waited.  Finally 45 minutes later for a grand total of 2 hours and 45 minutes wait I signaled for the man seating people and as pleasantly as possible mentioned that if a table wasn't ready within 5 minutes we were leaving, never to return.  Magically a table appeared, although the 4 of us were barely able to fit into the table because it was so close to the people next to us.  Also, the music was so loud we couldn't hear a word anyone was saying.  I will make the rest of this review quick as I was pretty loaded at this point and just hungry.  The empanada's were absolutely delicious, some other cheese appetizer we had was really tasty.  That is where the goodness ends.  Our meat was terrible.  Really low quality meat that was soaked in seasoning that was good but didn't hide the fact that the meat was so low grade.  Oh, and there was a hair in my food.  Just in case you missed it the first time I said it, I will most likely NEVER go back.  End of story.

Reviews.Author: Joe H.
Reviews.Content: Went there 10/1 for my anniversary and the place is amazing. The staff is very attentive and my filet was great. There is not a better steak for the money anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Author: Reuben H.
Reviews.Content: Simply the best BYOBooze-a-mahol place in Chicago.  That is as long as you are aren't a vegan or vegetarian.No corkage fee, and just about any type of booze goes well with hefty chunks of cow.  And be prepared for cow, because I'd say about 85% of their menu is based on that hulking grass-eating beast of an animal.From my experiences here, you can come to expect not only a lot of beef, but also the following:- Very dark environment.  No, I'm not speaking metaphorically- but everything seems to be lit through these tiny candles.  Might be a good idea here considering the presentation tends to be a big chunk of grilled flesh on a plate, and maybe some sauce.- This will basically in no way be a quick meal.  Everything from being seated (unless you get a reservation), to the service, to the time it takes for that 8-pound fillet to arrive, and even the "recovery" time from your "meat coma" is going to take awhile.- Despite the servings being bovine-heavy, much like what you will find in not only Argentina, but throughout most of the world- you can be a bit adventurous and sample odds and ends of the cow.  Tongue organ meat, intestines, and right down to a sausage made from the blood of the beast is on offer- and definitely worth the try (especially that blood sausage, which is possibly the best I've ever had).- Did I mention a lot of meat?  Yes, it is true, but my point here necessitating a separate dash is that you aren't going to find much in terms of vegetables on offer.  They do have sides of potatoes (not REALLY a vegetable, right?) and some other things, and a very simple salad of lettuce, onions and tomatoes is brought to you before whichever cut of massive meat comes your way.- "Romantic" is maybe one way to describe a very dark restaurant, but I'd go ahead and say it isn't a very romantic place at all.  The volume gets very loud, and the place is always crowded.  They do a great job in their service and make things as comfortable as possible, but when you hear the sixth "Happy Birthday" ring out while you are trying to tell your date about that time you saved a puppy from a floating chunk of ice out in Lake Michigan on a frigid February day, you might have a hard time.- According to a few ladies at my table, and this became progressively obvious as more wine was drunk (and the meat coma was taking a firm grip on us all), the waiters are the best sweet thing on offer there (see: eye candy).  No matter though, as they ogled at Max the waiter, I drooled over my lomo relleno and sneaked more wine from under their aloof watch.- The best sweet thing there in my opinion though was the flan, with a chocolate caramel covering.  Very nice!

Reviews.Author: Jasmin V.
Reviews.Content: The place is candlelit, smells delicious, and is byob. Other viewers deduct points for loudness, and mediocre service, but I have to fend for this place.Think about it, on a business standpoint, if a restaurant only needs to be open a few hours a day to be successful, it's got to be good. Therefore it will be busy, there may be a wait to be seated even with a reservation. We waited 10min past ours. But hands down the best meal I've ever had. Ordered the Prosciutto wrapped Melon and Chicken & Spinach & Cheese Empandas for our App. The Empanadas were flavorful and piping hot, the melon was delicious and refreshing. For our entree we asked a recommendation from the waiter, between the Lomo relleno or the Vacio. Both are huge hunks of meat marinated a little differently, and served on a casted roaster, that serves two. We went with his recommendation, the Vacio. The meat was succulent and tender, with carmelized edges here and there. The roasted sweet potatoes were simply seasoned and soft, almost to a mashed consistency. Though the place was packed front to back including the waiting area, the staff was very very attentive. Our waiter visited us a total of 6 times, once to bring us a bucket of ice for our wine and beer and take our app order, once for our dinner selection & to serve, followed by the dessert selection and return, and last for our check. In between that the busser was there to take care of the apps, remove our plates and refresh the table. Any wait we had was not long enough to notice. The great chat, wine, atmosphere, and delicious food made up for it.

Reviews.Author: Evan G.
Reviews.Content: Best steakhouse for the price in Chicago.  You can easily split the filets and split an appetizer for a great date.  Plus you can sit outside and enjoy Southport.

Reviews.Author: Shin M.
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews that this place can get really crowded, even on a Tuesday so I called Tango Sur around 4:30 (they open at 5) and they had a ton of spots open for dinner time so I easily made a reservation for 6:00. When we got there, there were only a few occupied tables. By the time we left, around 7:30, it got pretty rowdy.To start, the place was REALLY dark inside. I understand "classy" places like to do that but it was too dark for my taste.We started off with drinks. My fiance got the cream soda ($2) and I got the fruit soda ($2). We both enjoyed our drinks very much.For our appetizer, we got the spinach and cheese empanadas ($2 each). They were pretty good. The crust was a bit too crunchy for me and I've had better at the Randolph Street Market.I got the Berenjena (oven-baked eggplant layered with spinach, provolone, parmesan, ricotta and a tomato cream sauce $10). It was really good!My fiance got the El Filet (Filet Mignon $27) that came with spinach mashed potatoes. He was not a fan of his dish. He said it was average and nothing special. We were pretty disappointed since we read how popular the El Filet was.I think one of the reasons this place is so popular is because you get steak with a BYOB policy.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer Q.
Reviews.Content: I ordered the fish and it was the most delicate, juicy fish I've ever had. We sat outside and, even though it was raining, the service was excellent and I totally enjoyed the food. Plus, it's BYOB which is a huge plus. The inside looked a little crowded, as it is a very small place. However, if you don't mind getting all up close and personal with your "table neighbors" the food is definitely worth the trip! Great place, good food!

Reviews.Author: Patrick W.
Reviews.Content: You get the idea by now: meat, meat, cheap wine because it's BYOB, huge portions of meat, meat meat, waddle out, go home, and dream about meat. I was there with a group of 9 to celebrate a friend's birthday. We split a set of the empanadas, which were amazing, along with a few other appetizers. For our entrees, we ordered six of the steaks served with salad and roasted potatoes, which were split among 8 of us (the other guy ordered salmon, the translated word for which is 'pez', which continues to make laughter well up inside of me still 48 hours later. Despite sharing six entrees among eight people, two of which were another guy and I who typically count for 2-3 people each when estimating portion sizes, and we still had a decent amount of leftovers. And the chimichurri sauce! Nectar of the gods.This place can be tremendously romantic, which was obvious to me, who has the eye for romance of an ogre. It can also do a dang fine job of accommodating a large group celebrating a birthday, which it did ably on Saturday night. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Author: Richie D.
Reviews.Content: Oh Tango Sur, you're extremely overrated.  It's all about the BYOB and yuppie location.  For those who have been to Argentina for a fair amount of time, you know good meat...and you realize that their steaks are fatty and well overpriced (so much that you think you're paying in pesos once the bill arrives).  It's bad when I need to turn to dousing my 'bife' in chimichurri salsa to ignore the chewiness.  I will give it to them that the interior ambiance with live music under candlelight is very Porteno.  Oh and their outdoor patio is pleasant, and would have been even nicer if one of the four gas lamp heaters worked.  With that said, I hope their new Argentinean steakhouse Folklore in Wicker Park is of better quality and will have more grass-fed (slim), prime (less chewy) and free-range (always a plus) beef options as they promise.  For now, try El Nandu in Logan Square.

Reviews.Author: Mickey A.
Reviews.Content: A little celebratory get together calls for a lovely dinner on a beautiful and very humid evening. When my friend suggested this place for dinner, I was pretty psyched. Tango had been on my bookmark list for months. Our wait was almost 2 hours. We expected this and were prepared with some ideas. To rehydrate and kill some time, we went down the street for a drink. In no time, we were seated outside for an enjoyable dinner. Big thumbs up to this BYOB establishment. Our waiter was quick to give us our water and wine glasses for our bottle as soon as we sat down. As busy as it was that night, we had such great service. We had one main waiter, but other guys kept stopping by asking us how we were doing. I think it was because we kept taking a "breather" between bites. I regret my attire choice that evening. It's definitely a wear-something-stretchy- kind of place. (Just kidding.)I would skip the bread and butter. I love the stuff but I cannot handle all that and save room for appetizer, salad, and main dish we ordered. We started with the eggplant in a vinegar / garlic sauce. It was a big appetizer and was easily divided up among three people. The sauce was spot on. It was creamy almost like alfredo sauce. I'm not very good at describing but hopefully you get the picture. The salad was a-ok, but at least we got some fresh veggies in with our meal. Next came the bife vesuvio. Holy hell. This was probably one of the best steaks I have eaten, and I don't eat steak often. It's stuffed with spinach and cheese (exact name escapes me) in a white wine sauce. The steak also comes with chimchurri (sp?) sauce, which I think I could have taken that as a shot because it was delicious. We asked for more chimchurri and were given a cup size of the stuff. See? Great service. Since I shared the steak dish, I don't think I would have made a dent with that had I ordered it on my own. Desserts...yes, desserts. As in more than one. As in, we couldn't decide on just one when he brought out a plate full of goodies. We went with the flan and this peaches and cream cake. I think I was in the early stages of a food coma because I can't remember the name of this one. It was made of some sort of yellow cake topped with a whipped cream and peaches filling. It melted in my mouth. The flan was good but really sugary sweet....well, I'm really particular about flan only because I judge every one I've had against my mom's. My mom makes some serious kick-ass leche flan. This one was good, but I've had better. ;-) Good company, good food, and nice weather (minus the humidity)  makes for a fun dinner night out. I'm definitely coming back because I want to try other dishes I had my eye on. Thanks to them for us lingering a bit longer at our table. If you happen to sit outside near this hanging candle holder thingy, Watch out. I must have bumped my head on that a million times I thought I was going to knock it all the way onto the street.

Reviews.Author: Erika G.
Reviews.Content: I went here so long ago that I really should go again before I review it. But I remember it being SO GOOD and meaty-licious. And Tango music  . . . what else do you need? To review: Meat + Tango = happy.

Reviews.Author: Amy L.
Reviews.Content: Tango, I really wanted to Love you. I was ready to give you a 5 star review. But alas, SALT was your downfall. And I'm not talking about Russian spy, ass kicking action woman Angelina Jolie.Location: Went on a Wednesday and the wait wasn't bad at all. About a 10 minute wait. Heard it was horrendous on the weekends so I avoided that at all cost. Good thing I did. Finding parking was another issue. Took us at least 20 minutes to find paid parking..... Everything else is residential. Inside tip: There is a cemetery about 2 blocks away and there is free parking across the street. If you don't mind walking. It's the perfect spot. Plus, it let's you build up your hunger. Decor: People say it's dark inside, but I thought it was cozy and mysterious. Since I was siting next to the window, the reflection of the street lamps help illuminate the person siting in front of me.  Food: I felt I was rushed by my particular waiter, like he had other things to do. He ran through the specials and left. Reflecting upon this, I don't even know what he said because he said it so fast. But then again, it was kinda loud in there. I got the Vacio for two and waited about 45 minutes for it. When it came out. It looked perfect with a big chunk of steak and sweet potatoes but unfortunately, when the meat hit my palate, it became a issue of "is there salt on here?" Did they even salt it at all? When I get steak, I expect my steak to be the main attraction in terms of taste and seasonings. There was a lot of sauce and sweet potatoes but I think the sweet potatoes sweetened or milled the flavor of the sauce. Overall, not the best thing I've had. I was sadly disappointed by this great cut of meat. I ended up salting the meat but it didn't help. If you have to salt your meat, clearly there is a problem. And by no means am I a salt lover. Maybe only the Angelina Jolie kind. As people said, the salad was pretty pathetic if pathetic was a word. Lettuce, sliced tomatoes and onions and vinegar and oil on the side. I was thinking to myself, where's my salad dressing? Oy vey! Empanadas were pretty good, both the meat as well as the spinach and cheese. The sauce went perfectly with them. Ahh, the only redeeming quality in this restaurant. Overall: Not sure if all of their food is like this or was this an off day but I was not impressed. From all the reviews, I was hoping it would blow my socks off but instead it went up like a puff of smoke. I'll come back next time and give it a second chance. Next time, hopefully they'll put some salt on my meat.Btw: It's funny to watch all the drunk people come staggering out!

Reviews.Author: Yuly M.
Reviews.Content: I finally went to check this place out last night after hearing about it and reading reviews.  The food was GREAT!  Steaks are pretty big and potatoes are good too. The parking around the area is HORRIBLE.  The wait is also pretty long, but like others mentioned you are in a strip of bars and you can leave your number and they will call you when your table is ready or there is a back waiting area where you drink some wine and hangout. IT being BYOB is also a plus!  It is pretty packed on a Friday night but the atmosphere is pretty nice.  i definitely recommend this place and plan on going back.

Reviews.Author: Carolyn L.
Reviews.Content: On Saturday night, I went out with three girlfriends to Tango Sur, the famed Argentinean restaurant in Wrigleyville on Southport Ave. For steak lovers, it's like dying and going to heaven. However, before you can get into heaven, you're gonna have to wait more than 2 hours. I will only say this once...GO EARLY. If you have less than 8 people in your party, you cannot make reservations, and the restaurant fills up very quickly. This fact in itself accounts for my mixed review. We arrived at 7:30PM and put our names on the list. After being told that we would have to wait for 2 hours, we walked down the road to Hye Bar for some pre-dinner drinking. Tango Sur is BYOB so I wasn't really bothered by spending money down the street. Once we were finally able to sit down and order, it was about 10PM and we were starving. Now, I don't know if it's because I was wearing over-the-knee black boots, but I seemed to get a lot of attention from the waiters at the restaurant, who are all male. I would also venture to say that 99% of them are from South America, which definitely adds to the authentic feeling of the place! Of course, I didn't mind the attention, and I might have even managed to get a date out of it! Saucy. Speaking of sauce, the first thing we ordered was a plate of empanadas on which we smeared delicious chimichurri sauce. It's a concoction of olive oil, parsley, salt, pepper, garlic, and probably a few other things. But Tango Sur is one of the few places that does not add any vinegar. It was to-die-for! We ordered two spinach and cheese empanadas and two chicken empanadas. They were the perfect appetizer. For the main meal, the hit at the table was the birthday girl's Vacio for two (shown above the empanadas). A grilled steak with sweet potatoes and a tantalizing sauce, it was big and meaty and delicious. I ordered the Bife Vesuvio, a well-done steak stuffed with spinach and cheese, marinated in a white wine sauce. I will say here that it was delicious. But I'm a rare steak kind of girl and I found my meat a little hard to chew. I kept the leftovers, though, so I still enjoyed it! Jessica got the best thing of all, in my opinion: El Filet, filet mignon with a red onion wine sauce. I managed to snag half of hers to take home in my leftovers. It was perfectly cooked and sooooo tender. Although it was annoying to wait until 10PM to sit down and eat, the staff were efficient and fun. They gave us flan with delicious dulce de leche on top for my friend's birthday, and their flirtation added to the sexy ambience. I would for sure go back, but maybe I'd try getting there at 5:30 instead of 7:30. Steaks tend to run about $20-$25 for one person, $35 for a two-person meal. Empanadas are $1.75 each. Run to the restaurant just to try the chimichurri sauce!!!

Reviews.Author: Liz X.
Reviews.Content: Once again...over 100 reviews for this place?  Would normally not review it, but I thought it was so good and rather authentic, that I can't help it.  I'm sorry to read Erin S's review and her disappointing experience.  I have recently had a fabulous trip to Argentina and am completely enamored by it.  And one would think, one would be able to find a fairly authentic Argentine resto in LA.  Unfortunately, that is not the case.  Carlito's Gardel comes close, but Tango Sur is so much better!  OK, Tango Sur is no Cabana Las Lilas in B.A., but TS serves up good quality meat at decent prices AND most of their stuff on the menu is quite authentic for your run-of-the-mill traditional Argentine cuisine.  So, the steak isn't Chicago Chop House or Cabana Las Lilas quality, but for the price and the atmosphere (which is much more inviting and charming) is top-notch!Admittedly, the proveleta was a bit oily, but was so satisfyingly salty and rich and a perfect way to start of a meal with bread and your BYO-wine.  Yes, it did take the waiter a bit of time to get over to us and open up the wine, but it's a beautifully lazy Sunday evening with friends...who the eff cares?  We have to remember that sometimes the American way is not the best or most enjoyable way.  Dude...and the salads?  Not even close to romaine.  I think it was head lettuce, baby!  And that's what I loved about it.  This is an establishment of flesh!  The veggies are there to cut the grease that you either just ingested or are about to ingest.  This is how they serve up most salads (head lettuce or something akin to it, a few slices of tomato, a few rings of onion and just plain ol' oil and vinegar) at mid-level restos in Europe and (westernized) South America.  I was actually hoping that I was going to a get a plain ol' salad (in Italy, they usually serve you the salad LAST just to cut the grease) instead of some fancy frouffy salad (don't get me wrong, I love the frouffy salads as well...but at the right time and place).  We also ordered the eggplant/cheese appetizer which was divine as well.  My friend and I ordered the lomo special which was basically an obscenely large hunk of lomo (filet) with grilled and marinated portobellos and of course, the chimmichurri.  We ordered it medium rare (if up to me, it would have been cold in the center) and they did it perfectly.  Actually, a little more rare than most American medium rares.  I was happy.  And dude...I'm a pig, and my friend and I could NOT finish it.  I can never NOT finish my dinner. I'm sorry that Erin S. had such a horrible experience, but I had a wonderful dinner with friends that night: fantastic food, laid-back atmosphere, dinner out on the sidewalk wtih good friends, and 2 bottles of BYO-wine...I'm not really sure what else one needs for a perfect night out.

Reviews.Author: Stella Y.
Reviews.Content: Do you want to try something new? new atmosphere? great service? quality argentinean food? BYOB? great price? romantic getaway dining? Come and join the many who have come to enjoy the meals at Tango Sur! I went last nite w/ my BF and had a great salad (mozzarella, spinach, red peppers, and lettuce).  Also, had a chorizo and seafood salad, a bit of my BF HUGE steak and vesuvio potatoes! Don't forget the Flan with Dulce de leche! Candle lighting and just authentic feel. Try the empanadas and also other smaller dishes! Its small and cozy at this restaurant. Be prepared for a line. But we got in at 8:30pm on Sunday!

Reviews.Author: Shannon H.
Reviews.Content: Really good food.  Dark atmosphere, loud music but could still talk to eachother. BYOB...stop at CVS before going. Hubby had steak, I had Limon chicken. Sauces were great compliment to entrees.  Terrific services, Martin was awesome! Would recommend!

Reviews.Author: Martha Z.
Reviews.Content: Oh beefy coma, what would I do without you?  The portions are huge and tasty.  Service is a bit slow.  Do sample the empanadas.  And don't forget to bring multiple bottles of wine.  Trust me, you'll need them.

Reviews.Author: Janette L.
Reviews.Content: What's not to love about a BYOB especially when it has great affordable food!  I have lucked out and always been able to get a table with hardly any wait (go before 7pm!).  Service is very fast and friendly - they uncork your wine almost immediately after you sit.  My steaks have always been cooked perfectly to order (medium rare) and the meals are big enough for 2 (2 Filets for less than $25 bucks!).  Empanadas (recommend chicken or spinach) were tasty especially with the accompanying sauce.

Reviews.Author: Karis F.
Reviews.Content: one of my favorite restaurants in the city, hands down (what does that mean anyway?)portions are enormous, yet the prices are so low for the city it's almost unsettling... almost.because tango sur is so wonderful, you will wait for a LONG time for a table.  but if you give them your cell #, they'll call you when your table is almost ready, so you can head to any of the numerous bars in the area for a drink while you wait.service is so friendly... just an overall wonderful dining experience.word to the wise: if you are not meatventurous (yes i made up that word) don't order the mixed grill.  sweetbreads are not sweet, or bread-like.

Reviews.Author: Lenka F.
Reviews.Content: Lots of great things have been said about Tango Sur.  I'm a definite fan.  Been going there for the last 6 years.  There's always a wait, but if you come just a bit before the traditional dinner time -- say, around 6 -- it pretty much takes care of the problem.  Service is always great, and the food outstanding.  The trick is to get the Argentine steaks, not the American ones -- they do import the beef from Argentina, and you can taste the difference.  My fave cuts are vacio, bife de chorizo (has nothing to do with the Mexican sausage) and churrasco.  My boyfriend loves the lomo relleno laden with chimichurri and grilled portobello mushrooms -- but that is a dish for two.They also have the sausage -- chorizo -- very yummy.  And for appetizers -- nothing beats the beef empanadas (they're much tastier than all the other ones).  For those that have been to Argentina -- mollejas and and morcilla taste the same as there!!!  Pleasant surprise, because the actual steaks in Buenos Aires are still better than anything here...Hint: at the Argentine grocery store (adjacent to the restaurant) you can buy the empanadas... and the raw Argentine meat cuts to grill at home.  Great alternative in case the waiting line at the restaurant is too long and you're craving the Real Meat!  (They sell chimichurri there, too -- it keeps for a long time in the fridge, and I love adding it to various dishes at home).The only thing I don't like about the restaurant: when it's too cold to sit outside, you have to be indoors, and it gets way too loud.  Other than that -- it's perfect.

Reviews.Author: Mateo S.
Reviews.Content: It seems superfluous to add a review (the 398th to be exact) but after finally dining here after years of lust, I had to join the cheering section. The steaks are fat and tender, the chimichurri piquant and garlicky. The convivial service is charming and drop-dead gorgeous. As the night steps into high gear the noise levels can get deafening, and reservations are a must unless you fancy a 45 minute wait at a restaurant with no bar (BYOB!). The salads arrived promptly, but there was a long wait in store for the entrees... For me it heightened the drama of anticipation, but to be fair, others at my table found their patience waning.

Reviews.Author: Amanda R.
Reviews.Content: I go back time and time again for the great atmosphere, the low lighting and BYOB no corkage fee! Staff is friendly and knowledgeable and the food is amazing!!! I love the simple salads that come with dinner, just oil and vinaigrette. Very good and it never gets old!! Now that the patio is open its even better!!!

Reviews.Author: James J.
Reviews.Content: Reading the wide-ranging reviews of this place and weighing them against my own consistent experiences, I think it's safe to say this place is not only "not for everyone," but it also seems to have some kind of learning curve. If you know what to order and are willing to follow other rules of thumb when dining at Tango Sur, you're going to have an amazing experience. If not, you're probably going to be miserable!So, since my experiences have been positive and getting better each time I visit, try this:BYO: Don't forget the red wine!GO EARLY: 5pm. 5:15 at the latest especially if it's a weekend. Don't bother with reservations as they seem to get backed up whether you make a reservation or not. I remember at one point being told they only take reservations for large parties.DON'T GO IN A HUGE GROUP: 4 max. 2 is ideal. The huge groups are always waiting and it takes an enormous amount of planning and luck to have your evening at Tango Sur go off without a hitch, so don't bother. They have tons of 2 tops so you have the best chance of a smooth evening as a duo.APPETIZERS: Get a couple of chicken or spinach and cheese empanadas, but you will be plenty full and taking home leftovers so take it easy.STICK WITH WHAT THEY DO BEST: Argentinian Steak. That means the center  "Chef's Special" menu ONLY for entrees. Ignore the domestic beef on the right. Fish and Chicken eaters? Go somewhere else. Seriously. My favorite dish is the Vacio for two. It's a HUGE hunk of "flap meat" (i don't know what that is and i don't care) in 2 layers. Between the layers is some nice chimichurri plus more on the side. It's served in a grill with melt in your mouth sweet potato. It's not a steak house steak. It's going to take a moment to accept visually, but just try a bite and let your taste buds show you the way. Get it cooked Medium. Safe and consistent. The Vacio comes with a boring salad. Enjoy if you're hungry, but if you're not, then tread lightly. You have no idea the amount of meat you are about to experience.If this is too many hoops to jump through and you feel that you shouldn't need a secret code to enjoy a restaurant, I hear you and you may be right. If you're willing to follow these directions, I promise your reward will be great and your belly full and satisfied.

Reviews.Author: Chrissy P.
Reviews.Content: This place will always hold a special place in my heart. It's served as the backdrop for my first nice meal in Chicago ever as well as the first date spot for the Manfriend and I. Now, I'm not going to talk about how I also almost burnt this place down thanks to a to go bag and candle fiasco but, the food is always good, the atmosphere always intimate and the BYOB factor is always a plus. Where else in the city can you order two of the best filets you'll ever have for $26? You will leave here full, with leftovers, and perhaps even smitten with someone.

Reviews.Author: Andrea R.
Reviews.Content: Everyone I know loves Tango Sur so I was very excited to try it with a group of friends last night. I thought it was a great atmosphere and a perfect place to dine with a large group. The food was OK, but I'm not a meat and potatoes type of girl so I'm not sure if I'd go back here again. We started with the epenadas and the cheese appetizer...the cheese was definitely my favorite thing of the night! Then I split a chicken dish with one of my friends, which was good as well. The entrees are definitely big enough to split.  My friends who had the steak absolutely loved it It's BYOB, which made the meal pretty cheap...it came out to $19/person and most of us didn't even split our entrees. If you're a meat lover definitely check out Tango Sur because you'll get some good meat for a very good price.

Reviews.Author: Nancy H.
Reviews.Content: I came here once for a b-day dinner, and our large table was all the way in the back of the restaurant by the restrooms.  I would say there are about 2 main rooms, but the back room was SO DARK (and so was the restroom stall!).  I could hardly see my food.  My bf & I shared this huge hunk of meat that sits cooking on a stone slab.  It was seriously the size of a small log, and it came with no sides.  We ended up making beef sandwiches with the dinner rolls b/c we couldn't handle any more meat by itself.  I don't even remember whether it tasted good, so I guess that isn't a good thing.  It is, however, BYOB, so that's always a plus in my book!

Reviews.Author: Valissa W.
Reviews.Content: Andrés Calamaro said it best:mi Buenos Aires queridoyo te quiero desde lejosy desde cerca te extrañopor eso vuelvo y revuelvo... I miss Argentina. Sometimes a lot, sometimes a little. But one of the few things that can always take me back is a good Argentinean steak. On a nostalgic whim, another BsAs aficionado and I got a group together for some porteño cuisine. For starters, I was exceptionally impressed with how quickly we were seated. Score one for eating out on holiday weekends!! Our table of 5 was seated less than half an hour after putting our name in. We were expecting to wait at least an hour or two, so it was a very pleasant surprise. I liked that they took a cell number with the name so, had the wait been anything like we'd anticipated, we would have been able to wander freely until the table was ready.The menu options could not have been any more authentic if they'd copied it directly from La Chacra!  Empanadas, jamón crudo, ensalada rusa, milanesa (even a la Napolitana!), and endless cuts of delicious, delicious beef. The authenticity of the dishes, however, is the only reason I wouldn't call Tango Sur a 5-star choice. Our group ordered empanadas to start ($2 each, sold individually so you can get any combo of flavors you like). They were tasty, but very deep fried and much smaller than what I expected for Argentinean empanadas. We also had some fresh-baked bread that was incredible! Because we couldn't stand to wait for the main course to taste a little chimichurri, we asked for some to go with our bread which they brought out in a soup bowl. Holy chimichurri!! It was delicious and ever-so-plentiful. We were also comped salads (perhaps because of ordering in Spanglish? who knows), which was a nice touch. For the main course I had the Bife de Chorizo, which was excellent but a far cry from the quality of beef I'd been dreaming of. Solo en BsAs se puede comer asi.... Diners of eggplant and chicken at our table all seemed very content with their dishes as well. Our waiter was very attentive and fun, playfully alternating between Spanish and English right along with us. All this paired with Malbec from Mendoza (BYOB!), and this was the perfect trip down memory lane. And at what came out to under $25/each, I can dine here every day for the next month before I could afford a trip back to BsAs for the real thing. ¡A aprovechar!

Reviews.Author: Nikki L.
Reviews.Content: I was in the market for a romantic restaurant that wouldn't break the bank, that wasn't fancy or pretentious but could still deliver the goods. I was recommended Tango Sur by my friend Cara P. Tango Sur is a quaint little restaurant tucked away in the Southport row, with surrounding restaurants and boutique shops. Tango Sur could easily be missed if you aren't looking out for it, however, what will catch your attention are the mass amounts of people waiting in line for up to 2 hours or more to eat at this Argentinean steakhouse. I've heard lots of good things and read other reviews about Tango Sur that were all consistent and positive. This is one of the few restaurants that don't have a corkage fee, therefore allowing patrons to enjoy their bottles of wine, spirits or beer, free of charge...that's almost unheard of. I came here with the intentions of trying their signature items, their steaks. For starters, I ordered two chicken and two beef empanadas. These are deep fried deliciousness served with a side of the BEST chimichurri sauce I've ever had, hands down. Following came the Provoleta which is Argentine provolone cheese, melted on the grill with olive oil and roasted red peppers. I've never seen a dish disappear as fast as this one. For the main course I ordered the filet cooked medium rare with spinach mashed potatoes, this dish came with two filets and were seasoned and cooked to perfection.I really enjoyed my first experience and look forward to coming back to try more items. The service was friendly and informative but not intrusive. This is definitely a place to take a date as it is dark and candle lit on each table, making it a romantic and intimate experience. If you are looking for something different, delicious, reasonably priced and BYOB with no corkage fee, I would definitely recommend Tango Sur. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Becky S.
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this place. It was seriously so good! I am not usually a steak person but I was like ok, I wont get the chicken like I usually do and I'll go for it. I have the stripped steak. It was HUGE and just $17!!! I didn't see anyone leave the place without a doggy bag. And to top it off, it is BYOB with no corkage fee!It is a pretty big place but it is so popular that we had to wait an hour on a sunday night! But it is well worth the wait. Plan to get drinks at a nearby bar though.

Reviews.Author: Joseph O.
Reviews.Content: Last night was my first visit to Tango Sur...and it will also be my last.  Over the years I had heard great things about this place and I was really excited to check it out, but I was completely disappointed in the entire experience.  Dinner was at 8pm for 4 people and right from the beginning things got off to a rocky start.  3 out of the 4 of us were in the entrance way "checking in" while my sister paid for the cab and we were quite rudely pushed outside by the doorman who told us that we would have to wait outside until our full party arrived.  And yes, we had told him that she was 15 feet away paying for the cab.  So there we stood outside on a cold night waiting to be let in to what now seemed more like an exclusive club and not a BYOB restaurant.  In the meantime, another party of two arrived and the "doorman" allowed them to wait in the heated entrance way.  That put me off immediately.  After 5/6 minutes of waiting outside the doorman came out and welcomed us back to the "waiting room" where we would sit for the next 15 minutes.  So now it's about 8:20pm and we are still sitting in this small back cramped "waiting room" without any idea of when we'll be seated. Next we were sat down at a very cramped table with one small candle.  Nice touch, but in the darkness you couldn't even see the menus.  A look around the room and more than one table was passing around their smart phones to give extra light for their menu reading efforts.  No introduction to the menu was made by our waiter, no description of the special Argentinian steaks was offered and we were left sitting there.  After a few minutes our waiter came back and offered to open the 2 bottles of wine we brought.  My brother ordered a Coke that wouldn't come for a half an hour.  And then the waiter disappeared again.  When the waiter returned we asked for suggestions about appetizers and he halfheartedly gave us confirmation that the two we had initially chosen would indeed be good options.  Thanks.  We had the fried provolone and the empanadas (beef, spinach, and ham) and both actually were great.  We ate the appetizers, but all throughout busboys kept coming by trying to clean our not-yet-finished plates.  "Yes, I am still working on this not even half-eaten appetizer plate thank you."Now it was time to order dinner...and we had some questions.  There are a few different kinds of steaks on the menu so we wanted to know what was the difference between them.  Our waiter immediately took a rude/snobby attitude with us and he sure didn't have any interest in wasting his time answering our questions.  2 of us initially ordered "domestic" meat and 2 of us ordered "Argentinian" meat.  Specifically domestic sirloin, Argentinian filet, Argentinian meat griddle medley, and domestic filet.  Immediately the waiter began to say how the domestic meat was not good at all and both of my dining partners should change their orders to the Argentinian sirloin and filet respectively.  My brother caved and switched to the Argentinian sirloin, but my girlfriend stuck with the domestic filet.  Even after she refused to switch the first time, the waiter tried again to tell her that the domestic meat was not that good and coerce her to change.  I'm being completely serious.  It was a bit ridiculous.  So dinner came and we started eating and of course we now wanted to see what the difference was with the steaks.  While I can admit that myself and the rest of my dining party don't have professional eaters' palettes, I can still tell if a steak is good or not and if it tastes similar to another.  Sure enough, there was no grand difference in the taste between the domestic and Argentinian filets - the only thing different was the price tag.  What a shame.  Additionally, all the meats had been doused in sauces and in my mind the meat's original flavor was truly covered up.  Totally disappointing.  The night wrapped up without anymore issues, but all in all I can honestly say that it was a really disappointing evening.  The waitstaff was rude and the doorman was also rude.  The food wasn't anything to write home about and the table was too dimly lit and extremely cramped.  Absolutely not worth the hype.

Reviews.Author: Bill M.
Reviews.Content: This Argentine steakhouse packs 'em in for dinnertime, so go early unless you do not mind waiting for a table. It's BYOB here, and the servers scurry about in their frenetic paces. The warm bread is delicious, and so are the steaks. The "bife vesuvio" is juicy and delicious, or a couple can share the substantial mixed grill combo platter that comes with its own special serving tray. The spinach mashed potatoes just look like green colored mashed potatoes. The desserts are good but not great, but I have high expectations from cake featuring dulce de leche and coconut.

Reviews.Author: Samantha H.
Reviews.Content: This place is so great.  It's not the best steak you'll ever have, but it's up there and for the value it can't be beat!  El Filet is actually two filets and you can take one home!  The juice at the bottom of the plate is just so tasty.  I recommend this place very often!

Reviews.Author: Noah B.
Reviews.Content: Not the best steak, but they were pretty good. I had the filet and the seasoning was spot on, but the meat itself was lacking. Good price for what it is. BYOB and good appetizers.

Reviews.Author: Margaret B.
Reviews.Content: This place totally deserves it's rep as one of the greatest date places in the city.  It's small, dark, romantic and BYO.  Most importantly it's totally reasonably priced and you get heaps of food for the money you pay.  And it tastes good.  For non meat eaters, there is this delicious lasagna like dish with eggplant that is mind blowingly good.  They do get really busy and do not take reservations so go on off days or off times to enjoy this place without the hassle of a long wait.

Reviews.Author: Arlene A.
Reviews.Content: Yummy! My boyfriend and I are total carnivores, so this was right up our alley.  Went this past Saturday, thinking it would be slow, with everyone else out drinking.  NOT! Our long wait was rewarded by an awesome Lomo Saltado (?) with a kickass mushroom sauce.  Even though we were sat pretty late 10:30, we were never rushed.  Also thought it was cool that the Host/Manager showed us the indoor waiting area.

Reviews.Author: sheena r.
Reviews.Content: i decided to spend my birthday here with my bf, early dinner to avoid waiting, and it was a great idea. 5:15 on a thursday night is when you wanna come here. no wait.  we started off with the ham and cheese empanada, effing tasty. spinach and cheese, is far out tasty as well. we decided to go with the para dos, because of the variety of meats to try. while we waited, we sipped our bubbly, and watched the table of guys next to us, cut into their big juicy steaks. yep, salivating does occur. when our meat did arrive, it looked glorious. i ordered the meat to my liking which is medium rare, and i will be honest. it was a little rarer than i'd like it to be, so next time i'll have to be specific. but i still did enjoy every bite. the fried sweetbreads were heavenly. black sausage i could do without, or maybe i just needed it wrapped in a bun for me to be able to eat. but it was the flap meat and short ribs that stole the show. god, i'm totally salivating as i think about it. and for dessert, they all looked good, but we went with the vanilla cake with dulce de leche and coconut. so tasty. a trip to tango sur is definitely in my near future again.

Reviews.Author: Jennie C.
Reviews.Content: Once in a while my craving for red meat becomes so bad I don't mind the tremendously long waits at Tango Sur. Where else can you get high quality steaks at a fraction of the price in a typical steakhouse? Whatever spices they use on the steaks must have crack in it because I keep on coming back for more. Or it could be in the flavorful chimichurri sauce. The vesuvio potatoes are probably really bad for my heart and arteries but I can't stop eating them anyways. It's super loud, but the lighting is low and romantic.

Reviews.Author: Mike G.
Reviews.Content: I have loved this place since it has opened. Always a great experience with good service and good food. Now having said this I was very disappointing with my last time here. I booked a table a couple of weeks in advance for my birthday. I ranted and raved about thisplace to my family and everyone was really looking forward to it. The service was good as we he had a friendly and helpful waiter. We all had a variety of the empanadas for an appetizer than we all got steaks. The empenadas were delicious but the steaks were sub par. I don't know if their supplier didn't come through but my steak in particular was terrible. I got the bone in rib-eye which had no bone; was about a half inch thick and cooked all the way through even though I asked for the steak medium rare. Besides the cut of the meat, the quality was terrible, most of it was fat and grizzle. For my birthday dinner I was really let down which completely took me by surprise. Most everyone with me had a similar experience with the quality of their steaks and I don't think I would give another chance even though I had so many good experiences there before. What really kills me is all the backlash I got for recommending this place.

Reviews.Author: Aubrey R.
Reviews.Content: My first time here and it was really good! We had a reservation at 7pm and got there @ 6:50 this evening and were immediately seated. I ordered the rib eye with garlic, olive oil and some other spices with a side of mash potatoes. It was really good. I ordered it medium and it was cooked to perfection. Juicy and tender. The bread the serve before dinner was also good, fresh out of the oven. The salad, not so great. Just lettuce and tomatoes with olive oil and vinegar. There were 3 of us, we all had steaks, 2 sodas and a dessert, $100. Not bad at all. The portions are huge! My only complaint is the music is really loud, so it's hard to have a conversation. Also, it's way to dark in there. They were very busy but our server was attentive. Can't wait to go back and try something else.

Reviews.Author: Jackie R.
Reviews.Content: Ambiance is great, steaks are amazing, and BYOB makes it crazy cheap. There's a long line, especially on weekends, because its just that good. Try the El Filet, or a sample plate of all 4 kinds of empanadas. mmm. I want to go back now!!! too bad it's the middle of the night  =(

Reviews.Author: elizabeth n.
Reviews.Content: This is probably the one place where I do order a steak.  And with good reason- the steaks are amazing, and they give you so much that you have another dinner for the next night from your meal.  They have great appetizers too- the bread is delicious and we had this cheese appetizer that was out of this world.  Then the steak came and it was two filets!  So much food and it was delicious!  It's also a BYOB place so you can bring in your favorite bottle of wine- what a great night!

Reviews.Author: Dave N.
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a great place for a first date.  It's very busy & loud and the women you take out probably will feel 10 lbs. heavier by the end of the meal.  I highly recommend the Lobo (filet with potatoes).  You get 2 6-8 oz. filets which is pretty much unheard of for just $20.  Entrees come with a house salad, as well.  Service is pretty bad (you may need to be a little proactive).  They don't take reservations, so plan to get there early or wait.

Reviews.Author: katherine ..
Reviews.Content: you have to be a carnivore.  the blood sausage is out of this world.  i would skip most of the appetizers, save the complimentary house salad to eat when you get the main course, and then eat dessert.  they have exceptionally good espresso there also.  the outdoor patio in the summer is fantastic, but people sit for a long time no matter where they are located in the restaurant.  be prepared to wait up to an hour for a table, but they will call you if you want to get a drink down the street if you give them a number at the host stand, which means you can save your wine for dinner.  the do take reservations for groups larger than 6 or 8, but it is usually for later in the evening, around 830 or 9.there is also an argentine butcher shop in the same building if you want a argentinian cut of meat and try lomo out on your own.

Reviews.Author: Neal P.
Reviews.Content: Some of the best filets I've ever had at a fantastic price.  Great portions, juicy steaks, and BYOB -- what else can you ask for.  Add some empanadas for an appetizer and you've got a great meal.  The place is cozy, so expect to have little room to maneuver.  Go on a week day to avoid huge lines.

Reviews.Author: Neecy T.
Reviews.Content: Solid 4.5.Tango sur is the place my man and I go when ever we just want some delicious meat and savory chimmichurri, and we don't want to pay seriously inflated Chicago steakhouse prices. It's byob and right across the street is a wine shoppe called que syrah. They are extremely helpful and even offer recommendations if you tell them you are going to tango sur. Also, down the street, there is a huge, new jewel osco and a CVS, that has an impressively extensive wine selection. No corkage fee, so drink away.They have solid empanadas but I wanted to try something new (and a tad healthier), so I tried the Berenjena En Escabeche which is sliced eggplant marinated in vinegar, garlic and olive oil. It is a cold salad dish. It was refreshing and a perfect balance of savory and flavorful. I was surprised with how much I liked it. Next came the salad, which come with everything. Nothing special though...lettuce, two tomato slices, couple of raw red onion rings served with red wine vinegar and olive oil.I had the el filet cooked medium rare. It's 2 pieces of filet 7-8 ounces, a piece! For $24! Which means you get darn near a pound of delicious grilled premium meat, mid-winter for less than what it would cost at jewel...on sale.I can only get through one and I substitute  the spinach mash potatoes for roasted potato spears seasoned with garlic, rosemary, salt and pepper. I always have a meal for the following day and there chimmichurri is the best in the city. I am aware they have dessert, but have never had the room for it. And believe you me, I can make room for dessert. Some day, some day.I have never had anything but stellar service and perfect pace of experience. My last time I sat in the front room, right next to the window, which I thought might have been chilly but I felt no drafts and the light from the street made it easy to read the menu (which if you are in the back room, you have only a single candle by which to read the menu).Overall, I love tango sur and never had to wait more than half an hour. Perfect!

Reviews.Author: L K.
Reviews.Content: I've had two very satisfying meals here. Both were on a Friday night - if you get there around 8, be prepared for a long wait, but on your most recent visit we went early (around 6) and there was no wait at all. if you do have to wait, there are a few bars down the block where you can go grab a drink. Tango Sur will call you when your table's ready. The food was delicious both times, the meat perfectly cooked and I think it's a steal considering the portion and the quality. Service has been polite, if rushed, and I appreciated our server's recommendations - he did not steer us wrong.

Reviews.Author: John G.
Reviews.Content: The first word that comes to my mind when I think about this place is DELICIOUS!  The second word is FUN!  First thing about this place is that the food is awesome!  Before I go any further let me first alert that VEGETARIANS BEWARE!  I love the empanadas here!  The crust is nice and crunchy, and the fillings are great!  However good the empanadas are, the real star here is the beef!  While I prefer the ancho or the churrasco, there are many other great options including the para uno (which has blood sausage!!!!).  Also, did I mentioned the tremendous portion size of the entrees, and the very affordable prices!  (More on the prices later)The next thing with this place is that its BYOB!  Nothing goes better with Argentine food than red wine, and you can drink plenty of it here and feel totally comfortable!  Be sure to bring an extra bottle though, as there might be a bit of a wait, the only downfall with the place.  However, you can pop open a bottle in the back room while you wait so it really works out well!  Lastly, the ambiance of this place is great!  Its dark, very romantic, and great for dates. I love this place!  As I mentioned before the portion size is huge, and the price is very very reasonable, especially considering the quality of beef you get.  To add to this equation is the BYOB fact with no corkage fee really helps the total bill at the end.  Add all these things together, and you possibly get the best value in Chicago!

Reviews.Author: A G.
Reviews.Content: I have been to Tango Sur on several occasions and I think it is a great place for a cheap dinner.  We had a steak, a salad and brought our own bottle of wine and it was under $50.  I can name at least a hundred places in Chicago that I have been to were that wouldn't even cover the drinks. The food is good, albeit the steak was a little rare, and I love my steaks rare. The only problem with the place is that they don't take reservations, and if you are not in the door by 6:45, you will have to wait and sometimes the wait can stretch for two hours or more.

Reviews.Author: Benjamin K R.
Reviews.Content: pretty amazing.  We waited about 45 minutes at prime dinner time on a Sunday, but it was totally worth it.  Definitely get a few appetizers as the packed house means relatively long wait times for food from the grill.  We tried all the empanadas and I think the jamon y queso and the spinach were the best.  The grilled provolone is a simple but delicious starter as well.  We got a large flap meat steak w/ roasted sweet potatoes which must have been almost 2 pounds, slathered with delicious garlicky chimichurri, and the beef vesuvio, steak rolled with spinach and cheese.  Both were drop dead amazing, although neither was cooked exactly to our specs (both were ordered MR, one was rare and the other came out medium) but I really could care less they were seasoned so well.  I will probably not be visiting another steakhouse in the city for a long time.

Reviews.Author: Ryan J.
Reviews.Content: Great food, great prices and BYOB. If you have not tried the chicken you are missing out. Best chicken I have had, with great dipping sauce for the bread. You can't go wrong with ordering a steak, and my wife was impressed with the eggplant. Long lines are a negative, however that is a sign for great food when people willing to wait. Recommend getting there early to miss lines. Excellent restaurant where the owner is present and takes pride in his food.Outdoor seating in summer which is a plus.

Reviews.Author: Brian K.
Reviews.Content: TANGO SUR (All Scores Out Of 5)Food: ****Selection/Variety: ****Atmosphere: **Presentation: ***Portion: ****1/2Service: **1/2Price: ****1/2OVERALL: ***1/2Let's start with the atmosphere. All I heard before this was about how romantic of a place it was. You only go there with a date. Also, we postponed this because if it was going to be too few people, it would look funny, because it's such a romantic place. HOGWASH! I failed to see anything romantic about this place. To get here, we had to drive through a really crummy area of Chicago, and then all of a sudden, this Yuppie-Ville arises (almost a hybrid of Wrigleyville and Lincoln Park). It's not a very spectacular street to look at, it's just surrounded by buidlings, not impressive either. Cars roam by and there's some trash on the street that isn't very appealing either. As we walked in, they asked us if we wanted a seat outside or inside. I looked inside, and it was pitch black, but a few specs of light shone through from an encased candle. As my eyes adjusted, the tables were really close to eachother, outside, at least it was separated from other people's tables. Also, the inside just looked horrible. If you turned on the light, it's like a rundown side shop on Lawrence, but with high ceilings. We chose to sit outside. It was better, but not much better. The street had some litter on it, and it really brought down the atmosphere. There was nothing romantic about it, or even elegant about this place. No different from the bar and grill just next door.Now, the food stuff. The menu, I remember, had a great variety of things to choose from. This place would be a perfect neighborhood restaurant, because there's so many things to try. Any person would be able to enjoy something on this menu. Even their appetizer list had tons of things to enjoy. It would take several visits to this place to really try everything it has to offer.One thing that's kind of cool too is that it's a BYOB place. Presentation was pretty standard. It's the least I expect from any restaurant, clean plate, and slightly garnished. Nothing special there.The food. Argentinian food is really spectacular. It makes use of a lot of herbs, and my favorite, garlic! There were garlic and herbs on every bite. There was no need to wipe your pallete or anything. Every bite was filled to the brim with flavor. Portions were very good. When something on the menu says "Perfect for 2," it means it! Even the single portion meals filled me up; however, you have to take into account that we got appetizers and sides. For a full course meal, it's a perfect buy.Cost was also not an issue, which makes it so great. The appetizers were a bit pricey, but the main courses, the prices were dead on. I couldn't tell you how much I spent, but I certainly didn't mind giving it to them.Service was very standard, the server checked up about the standard number of times, and the amount of service he gave was about standard. His English was a little substandard, and didn't do a great job of explaining a lot of things. He came by and cleaned our plates, and popped our beer bottles, and took them away. There wasn't anything spectacular about the service.Overall, I would come to this place again. Great food at a good price!

Reviews.Author: Erin E.
Reviews.Content: i am torn on how many stars to give. despite the truly excellent food, i can't bring myself to give them praise. so many things about our experience bothered me. read on, if you don't mind my rant. if you'd rather not, here's the quick & dirty: wait was long & frustrating, hosts unhelpful/unfriendly, room too dark.1- no one answers the phone. yelp says they take reservations... i'm wondering how, when all we could get was a recording.2- the waiting game. we are told 1 hr 15 min wait. we say we'll go to the bar down the street. they offer to call us when the table is ready. i think, "how nice!" then just as we sit down with a beer, we get a call. granted, normally this would be wonderful news- after only 20 minutes they have a table for us. but, umm... they said 1 hr 15 so we got a beer. so we chug chug chug and race back, only to find out they gave our table away and were not very nice about it. so now we wait on the sidewalk in the cold. then i have to pee. to my surprise i discover a waiting room in the back where people are lounging and sipping wine by candlelight. while waiting for their tables. hmmm... a waiting room. nice of the host to mention that.3- ordering = stress. i had not even looked at everything on the menu and all of the sudden the server was waiting. our friends had ordered so we were pressured to decide. i wanted some kind of steak but they have a bajillion kinds, and i don't know what's what. my girlfriend & i asked the server for help & he guided us into ordering the filet mignon for two, which was cheaper than each of us ordering our own cuts of meat, so that was good. but after the stressful experience of ordering was over, i wasn't even sure what we were getting. and at the end of the meal, i still didn't know (see below).4- the lighting. candlelight is romantic, sure, but this place is da-ark. call me crazy but i like to see what i'm putting in my mouth. i thought i was eating eggplant until my girlfriend delicately told me it was portobello mushrooms. seeing as i never eat mushrooms, i did not recognize the taste. and while i was enjoying it, the dish was totally not what we were expecting. no potatoes or nothin'. just a big slab of meat. with (what i found out were) mushrooms and sauce all over it. the darkness really affected my experience, since each time i put the fork to my mouth, i didn't know whether i was about to eat a piece of mushroom or a piece of meat.5- this is not so much a complaint as something i found odd: the whole restaurant does it's best to be trendy & upscale, but then the servers' uniforms were essentially thin white t-shirts w/ the restaurant logo.sadly, based on the sights and smells on the plates around me, there were probably things i would have liked better and would sure like to try. but i don't think it's worth the trouble.

Reviews.Author: Eric K.
Reviews.Content: This is by far my favorite Steak place in the city.  The quality, quantity, and price of their steak is second to none... don't waste your time at those overpriced Michigan Ave. tourist steak houses come here.  Great place to take a date with the candlelit atmosphere BYOB... seriously....  Service has also been great whenever I have been there not sure why others have had a different experience.Also, this place can have quite the long wait on the weekends I would recommend either getting a reservation or going with 4 or less people to minimize the wait.

Reviews.Author: Mindy S.
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to be going back to Tango Sur as I haven't been there in a few years and I remembered the food being amazing.  I was not disappointed at all.  We had a party of 6 so we were able to call ahead and get a table soon after we arrived.  The eggplant and provolone appetizer are great and the steak has so much flavor and melts in your mouth.  We only a few appetizers and 2 entrees and that was more than enough to feed the entire table.  We all brought a bottle of wine which makes the bill very affordable!  Can't forget the flan they brought for my birthday dessert.  I don't usually like flan, but the caramel sauce is to die for.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Author: Katherine P.
Reviews.Content: Why are you so deeeelicious?!!! We came on a Wednesday and the place was still packed! The atmosphere was really laid back with only candles at each table to set the mood. Very intimate setting so it was great for a romantic dinner for us. (Hit this place us for Valentine's Day people!)I ordered the El Filet (medium rare) while Jason ordered the Bife Vesuvio, medium because our waiter told us the chef suggests it cooked at least medium. We also ordered Guarana (Brazilian fruit soda) and it was yummy! I'm a sucker for exotic-ish sodas. The food took maybe 10-15 minutes to come out but we were nibbling on warm bread and sippin' our sodas so I didn't notice the wait at all. When the food arrived, my mouth watered instantly. The spinach mashed potato caught me a bit off guard since it's bright green (I have posted a picture of the food) My El Filet was FANTASTIC; large chunk of well cooked meat, the spinach mashed potato was a great  compliment, and the Guarana quenched my thirst and tickled my taste buds. I had a bite of Jason's Bife Vesuvio and it's a rush of flavors - I believe the Bife has cheese in it. Not my cup of tea but still good nonetheless. I made it through 3/4 of my plate before I was stuffed. Good size portions. Moving on to the best part, dessert. Our waiter brought out a bunch of desserts but I went with flan (my obsession). It was perfect, not too watery, not too hard. The carmel on top just made the flan that more irresistible. *drool* I give Tango Sur 5 stars because the food is a solid 4 but for the value and how affordable each dish is, I give it a 5. I need to go back and get more of this deliciousness and try the much buzzed about empanadas! Note: BYOB and no corkage fee - great!

Reviews.Author: Nick R.
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to wait for about an hour to get into this place, it is extremely popular because of the price and the fact that it is BYOB.  I went to Tango Sur during the heat wave a couple of weeks ago and the lack of air conditioning definitely took away from the meal.  On the inside it is very dark, the only light comes from the candles at each table, it also is very loud and hard to have a conversation with the other people at your table.  With that said, the food was very good and the portions were huge.  I shared an entre with my girlfriend and still struggled to finish it all.  I would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Author: Marcel M.
Reviews.Content: Great meats.  We always go back for the stuffed steak dish that's loaded with oil.  My only complaint is that it's loud as hell along with the crazy wait.  Go in groups of 2 though since you can barely hear what the other people at the table are saying.

Reviews.Author: Jason S.
Reviews.Content: There are now 250 reviews of Tango Sur.  I need say no more!  The fillets of meat are enough for 4 people!  Skip the mozzarella appetizer and head straight for the empanadas!  Ciao.

Reviews.Author: Anonymous F.
Reviews.Content: Wow, this place was really not worth it. We showed up at 10pm, hoping the line would be shorter. No luck - we weren't seated until 11:30. We all ordered steaks, and they were uniformly fatty and poorly seasoned. Even the filets were tough and super fatty. They weren't even cooked to the right degree of done-ness (is that a word?)  I'm giving it an extra star for the ambiance, which would have been great if not for the (literally) screaming group in the corner. Another plus was the BYO. Regardless, I won't be going back.

Reviews.Author: J V.
Reviews.Content: Great Steaks!  Though the beef is canadian it is still nice and tender.  Try their Vesio cut of beef to maximize flavor and tenderness.  BYO too.

Reviews.Author: Marcus V.
Reviews.Content: Walking into this restaurant shortly after it opened for dinner, I immediately found the smell permeating throughout to be highly revolting and nauseating...like the stench of old blood embedded permanently in the crevices of a slaughter house. The atmosphere is dark and gloomy, most befitting for a vampire. Illuminated by faint lighting and adorned by dark walls, white candlesticks centered on each table, and a cluster of old photos of Evita, Tango Sur offers up tender, juicy beef dishes in an atmosphere malodorous of death and creepiness. Even as the under-heated empanadas, and later the main course, were served and slowly filling the dining room with culinary aromas, the smell of old blood still lingered in the air. I did enjoy the filet mignon and spinach mashed potatoes, as well as the background Latin music, but everything else was mediocre, including the service, which was certainly nothing to boast about. Despite the fact that I walked out feeling very full, the dining experience at Tango Sur left me feeling emotionally blue and melancholy. Another trip to Chicago will not be met by another trip to Tango Sur. One experience was way too many, I'm afraid.Of note, the white T shirt look worn by the not-so-friendly, pretentious waiters (a seemingly sexist establishment considering there were no women working) is a really cheap look. The staff would be better suited--no pun intended--(and look more professional) wearing white button-down shirts.

Reviews.Author: David R.
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the food, but I am in no rush to come back.  After eating here I am a little surprised by all of the rave reviews.  Yes, the portions are huge, so its a great value, but the 4 of us agreed that the meat was a little tough.  Plus the service was not that good.  The appetizers came a lot sooner than expected, but then we waited forever for our entrees.  Overall... good, but not great.

Reviews.Author: Patty C.
Reviews.Content: Saturday night approximately 7:45 p.m. I called about the wait time for a table for 2.  The man over the phone said it would be 20 mins, but they do not take reservations over the phone.  So, we figured a 20 min wasn't that bad considering a Saturday night prime time.  And off we went, and we got there literally 5 minutes later.  We got there, and the place was packed.  We signed in and the guy told us the wait was going to be 45 mins.  I was shocked, and I told him I had just called and they said 20 mins tops, so what gives.  He said that a whole crowd of ppl just came in within the last 5 minutes, and it was a take it or leave it situation.  My husband figured it must be real good for all these ppl to come here, and we should just wait.  So, 45 minutes go by and still no table.  I leave the tiny back waiting room to ask about how much longer, and the guys says any minute now.  So I head back to the tiny waiting room, and waited another 40 minutes.  When we finally got seated we saw a few friends at another table.  They were a party of 6, and we asked how long did they have to wait.  They told us they waited about 5 minutes for their table to get set-up when they walked in.  I didn't know what to say to that.  I was starving and pissed.  We ordered right away because it was like 10 p.m. already.  The only thing that could save the night would be amazing food.  Unfortunately, that didn't happen.  The only thing that was really good was my own bottle of Ruffino Chianti Reserve ($32 at Costco, worth every penny).Heres what we ordered:Appetizers:  Empanadas - 1 chicken, 1 beef - both were very saltyJamon Crudo Con Melon prosciutto served with melon - just okay, I've had much better prosciutto from the deli Entree:Costoletta bone in rib-eye cooked on the grill then topped with an olive oil, garlic, parsley sauce, served with mashed potatoes - tough, not high quality cut of meat, and the seasoning was nothing specialBife Vesuvio grilled prime steak slice and filled with spinach, mar del plata cheese and garlic in a white wine sauce, accompanied with argentine style potatoes - this was the worst steak I've ever eaten.  It was tough, over-cooked, and the plata cheese was an over-kill.  I couldn't even finish half.My server came by to check on our food, and I told him the steak wasn't that great.  He was kind enough to offer me a free flan for our dessert.  Unfortunately, the flan was also the worst flan I've ever had as well.  It was so sweet that my tooth was aching.  I can honestly make a better one myself.  My husband and I each had a bite and gave up.The place is so over-rated that can't even begin to count the ways.  Needless to say, I will never be back, even if the meal was free.

Reviews.Author: Kevin M.
Reviews.Content: Can't even compare to Gibsons, but once you see the prices at this place you'll be very satisifed with the steak.  Try the cheese appetizer as well- it's awesome with the warm bread they serve.

Reviews.Author: Chris K.
Reviews.Content: Great Matambre.  And fantastic South American beef dishes.  One of my favorites.  Go hungry.

Reviews.Author: Laura S.
Reviews.Content: I love bringing out-of-towners to this restaurant. It's amazing food, not too expensive, and BYOB. The wait is enormous on weekends, but I love that they'll give you wine glasses to get started on your wine while you're waiting for a table. As others have said, it's a great date place too. And although it's not a vegetarian's first choice, they do have this eggplant dish my non-meat-eater friends friends really enjoy.

Reviews.Author: Rusty S.
Reviews.Content: Good, but it's no Las Tablas . Very crowded on a weeknight, and the service was just so-so...though I think it was more 'relaxed service' than 'bad service' .  Maybe that's just the way they do it there.  Food was really good, and I like that it's BYOB.  I may or may not go back - it was good, but I've had better.

Reviews.Author: Zach A.
Reviews.Content: The menu is a lot of meat and for meat it sure is cheap. However, like many of the other reviews say part of the reason it is so cheap is because of the BYOB.  It gets really packed and you can't make reservations (except for big groups). It's worth getting a big group together for dinner at Tango Sur.

Reviews.Author: Maija T.
