Reviews.Content: Delicious...  though I had food envy of Kevin G (see review).  I will definitely get "El Filet" next time.  We got a table within 20 minutes at 6pm on a Saturday and we were prepared for much worse.  I give it five stars for great food, fun atmosphere, and affordability!

Reviews.Author: Nate W.
Reviews.Content: Should come with the caveat, "Rated 5 stars by early 20 somethings who have yet to experience great food, great atmosphere, and superior service".  Based on reviews I expected superior steaks, an eclectic experience, and an overwhelming feeling of "I just had one of the best experiences in Chicago, if not my life".  Didn't happen that way, but good.Seriously, I don't know why this gets 4 to 5 stars other than the fact that it is packed with people who don't know any better.  The party next to us was drinking Barefoot wine.  Need I say more?  Let me explain the details:1.  Appetizer -  We got the antipasto platter - It was basically two slices of tomato on a bed of lettuce surrounded by cold cuts and slices of cheese.  I could make that at home in 10 minutes.2.  Salads - A bed of lettuce with tomato and onion slices.  Again, can be made in any kitchen with a knife and access to a grocery store.  Thanks for raiding my fridge.3.  Steaks - Yes, tasty.  Not unique or superior to other restaurants.4.  Desert - Again tasty, but not anything that most other average quality restaurants cannot produce.Based on reviews, I expected an atmosphere emphasizing the South American origins of the restaurant, superior steaks, a memorable experience.  Instead I received a platter with a steak and mashed potatoes, and a table with a candle on it...but BYOB.It is worth a visit, but don't let the ratings fool you.  It's popular with people who have yet to really experience a great dining experience and want to save a few bucks with BYOB (an honorable cause, but is bringing a $10 crap wine really worth the savings?).

Reviews.Author: Adam L.
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review on the service ONLY. This is my first yelp review, and I wish it could be under happier circumstances. My girlfriend and I, having moved to the Southport Corridor area a few months ago, have been excited to try out Tango Sur for a long time, and finally decided to indulge for a nice date Saturday night. I had read reviews and new to expect a long wait. We got there at 8:30, gave our names, and were told it could be up to an hour and half. No problem, we just went to a bar down the street, had a few drinks, stopped at Jewel for a bottle of wine to have with dinner, and then wandered back to Tango Sur at 10:00 to wait to be called.After 10:15 rolled by, my girlfriend decided to ask the host how many people were in front of us, just to get an idea. The host couldn't find our names until he pulled a list out of a cabinet, after which he assured us there were only four tables in front of us. At this point it seemed like we had been forgotten, but it didn't really matter. Like I said we were expecting a decent wait. Maybe ten minutes later we were led back to the waiting room where we could open our bottle of wine while we were on deck for a table.After that point, we watched seven (count em, seven) tables get called. The clock was getting awfully close to 11:00. Finally, we asked the host once again where we were on his list. He pulled out the list, found his spot, and then flipped back through three pages of names to find our name way higher on the list. At this point, we had clearly been forgotten about again, but he assured us we were next. However, merely five minutes later, he comes back into the room, and calls another name. Before he could leave the room, I quickly (yet politely) asked why we weren't next, and he quickly changed the name and said "oh right, you guys are up." Here's where it gets really good. I was slightly frustrated at this point (it was now 11:15, a full two hours and 45 minutes after their 1 1/2 hour TOPS quote) but just kind of wanted to make a point, so I asked him if he had forgotten about us or something. To which he replied "whatever" turned around and walked away. Needless to say, both my girlfriend and I were both pretty upset with this treatment. However, after we sat down, we decided to let it go, and enjoy the night, rather than taking it out on our servers (we have both worked at restaurants and know how it goes) over one employee with an attitude. Unfortunately, things kept going downhill. We ordered two empanadas, on recommendation from the waiter, and were brought the entirely wrong selections. At this point, we felt we had to say something, and asked to speak to a manager. Lo and behold, the unruly host approaches our table. I started to explain the situation before I realized in the dim lighting that it was the same person I was complaining about, at which point I asked again to speak to a manager, and here's the biggest thing...he WAS the manager!! I was shocked, and told him so, that a MANAGER at a reputable place like Tango Sur, could look at a guest, after skipping him and forgetting him for over two and half hours (which he admitted to) and say "Whatever," and walk away (which he also admitted to doing). He apologized once or twice, and then just started to walk away, nothing done! I had to call him back to ask if he was going to do anything to fix it, at which point he told us he "guessed he could get us some complimentary desserts after the meal." Fine. We just wanted to have a nice date, so we said OK, and ate our meal (which was delicious, but besides the point). Finally, the waiter came to clear our plates and we told him the manager had said we could enjoy some complimentary desserts. The waiter said OK, but instead of returning with a menu, came back with one piece of flan. And our bill. Regardless of the fact that my girlfriend doesn't even like flan, I think this is well beyond an unacceptable way to make up for the MANAGER of a restaurant treating us like that (a dessert each of our own choice would have been the BARE MINIMUM, in my eyes). Knowing I wouldn't get any farther with that manager, we left, angry and disappointed. I have been trying to get in touch with a general manager or owner since then in order to better resolve this, and my phone calls and e-mails have all gone unanswered. I will keep trying to contact someone in hopes that this will be made right, as the food was delicious and I am dying to love this restaurant, but right now my blood boils every time I think of the place.

Reviews.Author: Brette R.
Reviews.Content: The steak here is unbelievable! I didn't even look at the prices when I went, but just assumed it was an expensive restaurant like most steakhouses in Chicago. I was absolutely shocked when I got the bill- it's by no means cheap, but a great deal for some amazing steak!

Reviews.Author: Cecelia m.
Reviews.Content: As a person who works in the restaurant industry I know that service is just as important as the food.  First time I went here, I had no issues and the food was good.This past time (11/20/09) is the last time I will ever go.  I knew they only took reservations for parties of 6 or more, so as a party of 3, I went an hour earlier than the rest of my guests...7:35pm.The host told me it was a 2 hour wait, I agreed because I lived a block away so I didn't mind waiting.My guests and I check in at 8:25pm....host tells me it should be another half hour....we agree to wait.9:00pm-Host tells us another 20minutes.  No issue yet because he did say 2 hour wait.9:30pm-My aunt checks in and the host tells her that he quoted a 2 1/2 hour wait not a 2 hour wait.  This is when I got angry b/c this guy actually has the nerve to say I was wrong. Did I mention his reservation list was a pocket notebook?10:00pm- By this time my guests and I are standing in front of the host glowering  at him.  Host tells us guests are paying and if we would like to wait in the waiting area....guessing he couldn't take the evil eye anymore.10:15pm-still no table.10:30pm-This is when I lost it.   As soon as the host saw me coming he had some guy who looked like an overdressed busboy to talk to me.  Both times I've been here I have never seen a manager walking around nor are there any women.  This guy says it will be a couple of minutes and he's sorry tables are taking longer than expected.  10:45pm- We are finally seated. Now lets talk about the food. I ordered the filet-not great lacked flavor.  My aunt ordered her steak well done it came out medium.  So after waiting 3 hours to sit down, you can't even cook a steak correctly! WTF!Oh and to compensate for the 3 hour wait, we received a complimentary flan and that wasn't great. I honestly believe that because this place is run solely by men, they were unable to correctly manage the flow of the restaurant. At the first sign of long wait times, a manager should of been fixing things with customers and sending a lousy dessert wont do anything.  As a hostess that has worked at nice restaurants, my managers would have been sending in complimentary appetizers to guests sitting in the waiting room.NEVER EVER WILL GO BACK AGAIN!!!!

Reviews.Author: Raul B.
Reviews.Content: I'm"m not big on Argentinian food, but this place is something else. You pretty much get what you pay for. My friend and I decided to get the grill steak dinner for two. This amazing dish came with so much meat two of us would never have been able to finish it in one sitting. It came with a salad but who cares, we were here for the meat. The steaks and sausage came on a little tabletop grill and you got two skirt steaks, two short ribs and two Chorizo sausages. The steaks were cooked to perfection and very tasty. I also had their tongue appetizer and empanadas also very good. This would be a great place for a date and impress her/him but be warned the restaurant is dark and the atmosphere loud and make sure you get a reservation.

Reviews.Author: Sergio P.
Reviews.Content: I adore this place. Very authentic. I loved the parrilada, sweet breads, the empanadas, etc... I feel back in Buenos Aires. I would just suggest you to go during quite hours as it is incredibly noisy during peak hours.

Reviews.Author: Ji K.
Reviews.Content: First off, Tango Sur is BYOB so make sure you bring something along if it's a special occasion. A girlfriend and I just decided to come here for a random Wednesday dinner, and we had a wonderful time. The place is dark and intimate, the service is good, and the food is outstanding. If you like flavorful meat, you will definitely find it here. We tried two steak specials (one of which involved cheese!) and they were delicious. The portions are huge and we couldn't finish it all, but my friend went right ahead and took the leftover steak home for breakfast the next day. Haha. I definitely recommend this place!

Reviews.Author: CN D.
Reviews.Content: Very good food!  The atmosphere is a bit loud but plan ahead.  It is intimate still even as crowded as it gets with the noise and all.  The wait is a bit long but well worth it.  I'd say it's definitely a must in the city! BYOB, good.

Reviews.Author: Hamilton B.
Reviews.Content: It was well worth the wait. As we didn't have a reservation, we first got appropriately buzzed on Margaritas a few doors down and leapt up as though we'd been zapped by a cattle prod when the host called us on the cell. I was lucky enough to find myself in the company of three lovely women from Colorado, so we got extra special attention from our beefcake waiter - if you know what I mean. Despite the stellar service, the dude was making me feel very inadequate, so I compensated by ordering up the Costoletta (ah shoot! I just drooled all over my keyboard thinking about that gorgeous slab of seared meat). By about halfway through the second bottle, I think we entered the "this is the best dinner ever" zone. We were all thoroughly happy that we'd trekked up north from our hotel. I will go back someday for sure. Five stars!

Reviews.Author: Tina S.
Reviews.Content: The first time I went to Tango Sur - everything was decent.   The food was good, but I would not call the staff very "inviting" - I would've given it about a 3 1/2.  Mainly because the service is touch and go and they don't take reservations.My latest visit is the reason for my 1 star review:We got there around 4:00 on a Saturday - this is not a "rush" period for this place, so we were seated within a few minutes.  Our server was not friendly at all.  He offered no greeting, no menu recommendations - he barely spoke.  His tone turned to more annoyed when we told him we only wanted to order a few appetizers and one entree (again, it was late afternoon).  The appetizers came out as ordered, but after that our already cold service went from annoyingly tolerable to horrible.  Our server would disappear for 20 mins at a time and even when he was around he never checked on us or brought out the entree.  People around us that came much later were already eating the exact same thing we ordered.  When we inquired he said "well done items take longer" like we were idiots (and for the record, well done adds like 3 minutes, not 30) rather than the obvious which was that he forgot to put in our order.  Another 20 minutes passed before we had to ask another waiter to find our waiter and another 10 mins passed before he came over - without the entree.  When we inquired about the entree again he said "I'll let you know when its done."We finally asked to take the entree to go and to get the check, which of course, took him another 100 years to give to us and then even more time passed after that before we got the entree.I used to be a server and I don't take zero tipping lightly, but this guy was arrogant and incompetent and I wasn't about to let him squeeze 20% out of me on a very unpleasant dining experience (that he caused).  This is only the 2nd time in my life I haven't tipped someone.Here's the best part...when he saw that I stiffed him he actually had the balls to chase me down the street to get in my face about it.  Yes, a grown man chased three women (one of which was 63) down the street to get in my face.  I told him flat out why his service was horrible and what was his reply "You must not be from around here." I responded, "I live two blocks away, what's your point? I should know better?"  Comfortable with the fact that I really did think he just sucked and I wasn't a clueless tourist his last words to me were "I hope you choke on that steak."And that will be the last time I ever go to Tango Sur.  There's a lot of steak houses in Chicago.  I don't need to waste my time on a place with service that is tolerable at best and threatening at worst.

Reviews.Author: Paul C.
Reviews.Content: I had dinner here with someone I absolutely hate and still had a great time.  That's how damn good the steak is.  It makes all petty things go away.  At least for a little while.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca H.
Reviews.Content: Good atmosphere and the food is worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Kelly W.
Reviews.Content: I went here with a super large group (16 to be exact). We had reservations and everything worked out pretty well. The no-corkage fee definitely was an added plus with the large group. I'm not a big steak person so we all kind of munched on different appetizers. They were all delicious. However, without the steak, it didn't really feel like a full meal. We were chatting and gossiping the entire time but I thought the service was pretty decent. If I was with a group and they wanted to go here, I would probably go again. However, probably not by my own first choice.

Reviews.Author: Rico T.
Reviews.Content: Yep not much more to say besides what has already been said.  Great intamate place, great prices, BYOB with no corkage fee.  Can be a long wait and no reservations.  Order the combo meat platter.  Everything you are not likely to order for yourself.  Blood sausage, head cheese, sweet breads, and some great marinated extras.  Anthony Bourdain and Andrew Zimmerman would approve!

Reviews.Author: Cara H.
Reviews.Content: YES to great BYOBs like this.  Came in with a large group, we were all late and didnt order til about 10 minutes before kitchen closed. We all work in the service industry and felt horrible but we've dealt with late diners before so we knew they could handle it (plus we tip like its going out of style).  These steaks are amazing. Friendly patient service, beautiful patio, excellent atmosphere. Would like to go back on a date (any takers?) with a nice bottle of Grenache.

Reviews.Author: Lee J.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur was delicious and the perfect place for a surprise birthday party with a big group. The empanadas, provoleta, and salad were a wonderful beginning to our dinner. Our entrees were huge and the steaks were savory. I had the filet with a side of spinach mashed potatoes, which was fantastic. All for about $40, you can't get any better than this popular BYOB.

Reviews.Author: Erin J.
Reviews.Content: I went here last night and I had a horrible time. We arrived around 5:30 and were sat promptly outside, which was nice. We waited 10 minutes to be acknowledged with water and menus.We waited another 10 minutes for the waiter to come by and uncork our bottle of wine.We waited about 15 minutes for the waiter to take our appetizer order (the provoletto, which is essentially a handful of provolone cheese, some cheap-tasting olive oil, a few strips of limp roasted red peppers and a hit of dried oregano, all stuck on a plate under a broiler for a few minutes). The waiter falls into a black hole.About 20 minutes went by before we got greasy coagulated disc of aforementioned cheese. Said waiter has apparently found his way out of aforementioned black hole and only THEN takes our order for the main course. We ordered a HUGE steak dish for 2 with portobello mushrooms and then we sat. And sat. And sat. Someone brought out our salads, which were the most disappointing and boring salads I have ever eaten in my life; it was cut romaine lettuce, 2 slices of watery tomato, and 2-3 small rings of white onion. It was served with oil and vinegar. I wasn't sure if it was supposed to have been a palate cleanser or what, but it was pretty much useless. I've had better salads everywhere else I've ever eaten.The two tables that had come in 10 and 15 minutes after us (respectively) had already been served and were making good progress on whatever hunk o' meat that was in front of them. Finally, I looked at my watch and figured out that we had already been there for over an hour, and we still hadn't gotten our entree. I flagged down a wary-looking guy who was having trouble opening bottles of wine the next table over and asked him what was up. He fetched our server (there HAS to be a black hole inside the restaurant somewhere) and the server came out, all defensive, saying that HE didn't make a mistake; the dish WE ORDERED has a 35-minute cook time. A 35-minute cook time? For a 16-oz steak, cooked med-rare? OOOkay... Then he proceeds to tell us that that was why he asked us if we wanted an appetizer, because that dish takes so long to cook. Um, he brought out our appetizer before he even took our entree order! So I call bullshit. Twenty minutes later, we had our dish; an unappetizing hunk of steaming beef set in an oily sauce with a bullet of admittedly good chimichurri on the side. And it was cooked to approaching shoe leather on the outside, and on the inside it was well-done. Nowhere near med-rare. At that point, I was more focused on just getting the fugg outta there...and it was nearly 8:00. I wanted the last 2.5 hours of my life back. I felt like they should have paid me.I really disliked this place. The wait and inattention to service was so distracting. Good thing was, our bill only came out to a little over $50. I thought $4 and the change was reflective of the service, and, as a former waitress, I usually tip anywhere between 15-25%. Everything about this place was bad, from the uninspired menu to the lackadaisical service. Just awful, really. Had the food been outstanding, I can tell you there would be at least 2 or 3 more stars up there, but really? Nothing special. Greasy, oily...just not the right stuff. I would recommend not going here. Consider El Nandu on Fullerton instead; much better service, better-tasting food, and you won't be in a hurry to just leave and be anywhere else but there. Not going back. Ever.

Reviews.Author: Sarah A.
Reviews.Content: I took my family here several months ago and they absolutely LOVED it! Not only was it reasonably priced for a steak place, but its BYOB - which saved us a ton of money on wine. I also love how while you are waiting on the table you can sit in the back room and open your wine and drink while you are waiting. The food was fantastic and we had enough leftovers for all of us to have lunch the next day. I can't wait to go again in the summer, when they have the patio open!

Reviews.Author: Joyce P.
Reviews.Content: Not a lot of places can get away with both being byob and no reservations taken, especially the no reservations part. The servers are not going to check up on you as often as you are used to so keep in mind to order anything or ask any questions when you do get them at your table. Otherwise, if you are going to a restaurant for the good old fashion reason--good food--then this place is definitely worth checking out. Great steaks!

Reviews.Author: angelica r.
Reviews.Content: NEVER ever fails.... amazing steaks. BYOB... love this place.

Reviews.Author: Jin Joo L.
Reviews.Content: I came here a while back, like last summer.  We went for dinner and it was very very cozy and dark inside with long white candlesticks lighting your table.  Very romantic atmosphere with great patio seating.  I remember I had the Matambre appetizer, an argentine specialty - veal rolled and cooked with vegetables served cold.  Then me and Bernice split the Lomo Relleno half slab argentine filet sliced and filled with a chimichurri, ham sauce then cooked and served on a grill with portabella marsala (ideal for two).  It was HUGE.  I think they served it with like some sort of sweet potato too.  The meat was juicy and delectable.  I would love to go again for dinner just for two.  Can't wait!

Reviews.Author: Charlie N.
Reviews.Content: Mediocre food. Terrible service.First the food: We ordered the antipasta. It wasn't bad, but at $9 for a small, uninteresting deli tray, I would not order it again. When we asked where the mortadella was, the server shrugged and said that he guessed they must be out.Good news: your $20 steak comes with a salad of lettuce, two rings of onion, and a big mealy tomato!My girlfriend and I both got steaks. My strip steak was good, but then it's probably harder to mess up a steak than make a decent one. One way you might do that would be to leave the membrane on my girlfriend's skirt steak. The provided knife was not wholly up to the task of cutting through it, but we managed to peel it off ourselves. The sides of Vesuvio potatoes were soggy.20 minutes after our table was bussed and we finished our wine, we got our check. Unfortunately, I messed up and forgot my card at the table. My fault. MAKE SURE YOU DO NOT MAKE THIS MISTAKE. I tried calling during the day the following Monday to make sure they had the card, but couldn't get anyone to answer the phone. I figured I'd just stop by, since it's not far out of my way home from work. I was kind of disappointed after I'd walked 6 blocks from the train station to the restaurant only to find out that even though it was 6:30 (they'd been open for an hour and a half), the manager "had stepped out, and would be back in 35-45 minutes". Well, these things happen, right? I didn't have time to wait around, but on Tuesday I made sure that I called and told them I was going to be there in 45 minutes to pick up the card, and wanted to make sure the manager would be there. "Oh sure. Come pick up your card." You can probably guess where this is going, right? He had just stepped out for 35-45 minutes.Now normally, this wouldn't be a huge deal for me, but both times I was left standing in the sun, outside for 10-15 minutes while some guy disappears inside. Their attitude was completely indifferent. Nearly every interaction I've had with them makes it clear they couldn't care less about their customers. Unfortunately, with 1200 reviews, this negative review won't pull their average down much, but I feel a bit better.

Reviews.Author: Rish N.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had the Vacio which came with a salad . Amazing flank steak with sweet potatoes and chimichurri sauce on the side. I would recommend to arrive at the restaurant before 7:30pm to be seated right away. The setting is romantic, definitely wear something to impress your date but don't come overdressed. Anyway, thank youTangu Sur for BYOB and great food. We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Author: J B.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is a small place, but surprisingly did not feel cramped once we were seated.  Lighting is romantic, overall comfortable feel.  I ordered the filet, which was AMAZING.  The portion size is HUGE (I received around 12-14 oz of filet) and the side dishes were great.  The empanada appetizer was delicious.  BYOB is great too!  Pricing is extremely reasonable.

Reviews.Author: Pamela M.
Reviews.Content: How has it taken me so long to review one of my go-to places in the city??Tango Sur has some of the best steak you will find in the city... and at reasonable prices to boot.  Did I mention it's BYOB, too?The warm eggplant appetizer (berenjena) is mandatory. Oh, and you're gonna need a second bread basket because you simply can't let any of that luscious sauce go to waste.I almost always go for El Filet because seriously, you get not 1 but 2 filets!  The portions here are VERY generous.  So not only do I get to enjoy my steak here; I get to take one home to enjoy the next day!  The steak is always cooked to perfection, and just thinking of the red wine sauce that goes with El Filet makes my mouth water.Oh, and that chimichurri sauce -- don't be bashful with it.  Dip the empanadas in it.  Bathe your mashed potatoes with it.  Just make sure to savor garlicky herby deliciousness.One tip: Call ahead for a reservation if you have a big group, but expect to wait otherwise.  They don't take reservations for just a few people.

Reviews.Author: Adlyyn Z.
Reviews.Content: By far my favorite restaurant! Absolutely love this place!!!!

Reviews.Author: Cynthia C.
Reviews.Content: What can I say? BYOB, no corkage fee, Great tender steaks, Reasonable prices??? The excellent recipe for exquisite restaurant! Yes there is usually  a long wait, but its definitely worth it. The "Berenjena" is my favorite appetizer, which can be also a great entree. "Lomo Relleno" is a great to be shared with 2-4 people. On my behalf no complains! =)

Reviews.Author: Ifi S.
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the best places to get your bang for the buck.  The meat is absolutely delicious and incredibly filling.  The berenjena- eggplant lasagna, is very rich and flavorful.  The empanadas are tasty as well.  The meat is so tender and picks up flavor very easily.  It's hard to find seating on weekends, but it is a charming byob place.

Reviews.Author: Freddy v.
Reviews.Content: At Tango Sur you will not find your typical American styled USDA CHOICE! prime-rib with mashed potatoes and A1 sauce. Some people experience a bit of culture shock when it comes to how different it is from the expected "Steak/Meat Place".Argentine  beef is known as some of the BEST in the world, these people really take their meat seriously. The enviroment and ambiance of the place is darkly dim, with  small candles on tables and they usually have various types of soft spanish pop or tango music playing thus providing a very romantic ambiance, ideal for a date or just a special night out with the inlaws (great way to impress someone with showing them  your sophisticated tastes). Beer is available but WINE is more suitable being that it does increase the dinning experience and flavors of the beef, but also can provide an even deeper more romantic or fun experience. Again Great for dates. Not only because the ambiance is right and inviting but because the food is also adequete. Order one of the special meet dishes , which come in their own small portable grill, with potatoes, ready to serve. its like having a mini grill in the middle of your table with a chunk of world class beef, surrounded with candles zipping on wine with your  significant other, sharing delicious TAPAS which are great appetizers and perfect finger food get a mix variety so  you can try different ones, also the eggplant salad is delicious. Budget wise it is pretty economical considering the fact you are eating PREMIUM beef, not just any Bull****. You can also bring in your own liquour since it is a BYOB joint, Bring a bottle of WINE, A girl, and about 30 bucks and you can call it a night out.Plenty of parking around and on site, IF you bring your grandma make sure u have her hold on to you, as it is very dim and she could trip and bust her ass. Cheers and enjoy.. Try the Sangria if you bring no wine.Check out tonsilcleaner.com join our breath forum!

Reviews.Author: Todd A.
Reviews.Content: Be careful what you order, because the MEAT can overwhelm you, the juices drip on your nice pants and you can happily drift off into a corn fed american beef coma with the delicious chimichurri dripping off your chin.  It's nice to be able to bring your favorite reds to a BYOB with no corkage fee.  Most folks seem to prefer the filet, a ginormous chunk of  beef and gravy, though I prefer the parillada - the mixed grill of steak, short ribs, sweetbreads, etc. and the sausage here is delightfully different.  Empanadas here are yummy too and dinner for two is very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Author: Christopher B.
Reviews.Content: If you want Argentina you found it. It's about as close to the real thing as you're going to get in NorthAm. This is a great place to bring a date and have a great steak. It's BYOB so that works, too! ;) And it's not an in-and-out type of place as someone complained about- try McDonald's if that's what you're after. It's a little dark and intimate. It's better they don't take RSVP because then you know you have a shot to get in, or if you don't want to wait, there are always weeknights! Salud!

Reviews.Author: Susan L.
Reviews.Content: Vegetarians back away.  The meat is sizzlin at Tango Sur.  Whatever you order, ask for extra garlic olive oil sauce.  I want to dip everything in it!  Bring a couple bottles of wine, get some glasses from the host/hostess and knock a few back while you're waiting for your table.  I really wish they took reservations.

Reviews.Author: Christian H.
Reviews.Content: OMG!!! I have eaten at Tango Sur several times during my two years of eating at restaurants other than McDonald's.  Tango Sur is one of the best places I have ever eaten at in Chicago.  First of all, it is a BYOB place and they do not have a corking fee.  Since this is an Agentinian meat joint, you must have a red wine with you.  They will provide the bucket of ice.  They have a great selection of food, but you have to have the empanadas as an appetizer ($2 each).  Get one of each and if they don't have the corn empanadas, then ask for one of those too.  They are the best.  I almost always order the Filet Mignon as my main dish.  It comes with two nice sized filets and spinach mashed potatoes and a salad ($30 something)... IT IS AMAZING AND COOKED PERFECT EVERY TIME!!! Yum my mouth is watering as I type and I just ate dinner... =P  There is always enough to take home for lunch or dinner the next day.  When I microwave it the next day (I know... destroyed it right), it tastes great and is so juicy still.  Only issues I would have with the place and the reason I took a star away is due to the fact they don't take reservations so you have to get there early or wait for over an hour to two hours. BUT, it is so worth.  Get there by 5pm to get in faster.  Also, the music tends to be too loud at times...BUT, it is a great date place or for special events.  If you have a group of 6 then you can make a reservation but you only get two time slots to chose from each night, so call early.Tango Sur - I love you!!!And as always.... Have Fun!!!

Reviews.Author: Samantha L.
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. Huge portions, good deal, BYOB, and candlelit. Romantic, good food, and just a great place for a date. I ordered the Filet Mignon and basically got two full Filet Mignons, which I was not expecting. Bring a bottle of red wine and a date, and enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Emily Y.
Reviews.Content: I went back and had the eggplant entree (kind of like eggplant lasagna for lack of a better description). The sauce tasted a lot like vodka sauce and I ate the whole thing in about 2minutes. The birthday girl was kind enough to share her flan and it is even better than I remembered. Magical, even.

Reviews.Author: Brandon H.
Reviews.Content: If you go during any normal dinner hour you'll probably be waiting, but stick around because it's well worth the wait! The steaks are fantastic, as well as the bread and provolone. When the weather is nice they'll open up the patio out front, it's very enjoyable. It's hard to go wrong at Tango Sur!

Reviews.Author: Kristin M.
Reviews.Content: It's pretty clear that I'm not the only one who ADORES this place!  The fiance and I went here for the first time Friday night, and it took all of our will power not to return Saturday and Sunday.  Amazingly scrumptous food and dark, romantic atmosphere for dirt cheap!  (Plus no corkage fee - yay!)  I won't go on and on cuz there are so many reviews here, but if you want to avoid the wait, go early-bird-special-style: head over there right after work; the wait doesn't seem to start until 7-ish.

Reviews.Author: C M.
Reviews.Content: So yes, I know that I'm not supposed to write a review if I didn't eat there, but as I have previously eaten there, I feel that I can still update it to say this.Last night my bf and I tried to go there for a nice dinner. I knew in advance that I wanted to go out, so I had him wear a nice shirt and pants to work. Then I got all gussied up myself so that we could go to Tango Sur. We were of course prepared for a wait as it was Friday night and having been there before/read many reviews, we knew what was coming. The problem was that when we got there, there weren't many people. We put our names down and were told 40 minutes to an hour. 40 minutes go by and still nothing. We go to the waiting area in the back which has zilch to do other than talk to the person you came with, which you can do just as easily outside. They don't seem to be too organized, so I insisted we go back outside so that they would actually see us. My bf spoke with the host not once, not twice, but THREE times and each of these times, the host had no clue who he was (I feel knowing your customer is part of being a good host and have never encountered that before). When we left the waiting room to go back outside, he thanked us for coming. We had to explain we hadn't even eaten yet, just moved back outside. While we were going back through the restaurant on our way outside, we noticed several large tables (by large tables I just mean lots of 2 person tables pushed together) being freed up. We thought we would soon be seated, but no. Rather than do what is right and separate the big tables for those couples who have been waiting a long time (there were 4 or 5 couples waiting just as long as we were), they chose to seat the groups of 6+ who arrived 30+ minutes after we did and put their names in. Not cool. After about an hour and 15 minutes, we left. We were super hungry at that point and I was getting crankier and crankier. We chose to go to Azha, another BYOB place (for we purchased wine to drink at Tango Sur) not too far away. They FINALLY called us to tell us our table was ready nearly 2 hours  after we arrived. It really made me angry that they so poorly underestimated how much time we'd be waiting. Frankly, we could've seen a movie at the Music Box down the street in the time that we were waiting for a table. It very much irked me that people who arrived later were given seats before us simply because they had more people and big tables were available first. It would be good business practice in that case to separate a freed up big table for the couples who've been waiting a long time. Needless to say, we were both completely disappointed. We took a chance with the Friday night (because they stupidly-in my opinion- still don't take reservations) and were fine with waiting 40 mins to an hour. No biggie. But the gross underestimation of time we actually had to wait was completely ridiculous. When they finally did call, we were already enjoying our appetizers at Azha. Maybe someday we'll go back, but never on a Friday night (or weekend night) again and not while we're actually pretty hungry. Totally disappointed I didn't get to have the wonderful food again, but frankly, when you're actually hungry it's just not worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Christina G.
Reviews.Content: This place is cute, BYOB, with pretty good food.  Crowded and a bit of a wait on a Friday night without a reservation.  Looking forward to outdoor seating when the weather gets warm.

Reviews.Author: Torrey S.
Reviews.Content: Lovely atmosphere. Generous portions. I love the small rooms, dark lighting, and candlelit tables. While I have gone with friends mostly, this is also a romantic spot. The prices are steep but two people could easily share one entree - particularly the chicken on the bone. The steak dish comes with two sizeable medallions and a generous portion of green mashed potatoes - yum! Definitely enough for two girls to split. Empanadas are tasty as is the Eggplant entree for vegetarians - delectable orange tomatoe sauce. Everyone took food home for meal #2! Also, the BYOB option is great.

Reviews.Author: Sasha T.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is our annual valentine day spot. It is very dark and intimate inside. Both the food and service are phenomenal. For appetizer we always get the empanadas (all the flavors taste good). This time I got a seasoned chicken breast with a side of mashed potatoes. The chicken was delicious and the mashed potatoes were made from scratch and absolutely amazing. Also, the filet is of very high quality and we get it every time we are there. The only downside is the wait. If you have a party of 6 or more you can make a reservation otherwise you have to wait in this small cute room where you can drink your byob while you wait.

Reviews.Author: Tina M.
Reviews.Content: This is smack your mama good.  Go hungry and get the Lomo.  Hmmm... Lomo.... (Homer Simpson).It can get really noisy on the weekends, but it is still wonderful.  Oh, did I forget to mention, BYOB.  Luv it.  You also have to try the Empanadas, anyone will do, but I recommend trying them all.

Reviews.Author: Simone G.
Reviews.Content: Oh my god, how did I pass this place by for so long.  I'm not going to repeat what practically every other of the 200+ reviews have said, so I'll simply say GODDAAAAMMMMMNNNNN!  Filet Mignon as good if not better than other more popular steak houses for $10-$15 dollars cheaper.  Spinach mashed potatoes, a chimichurri to die for, and never an empty water glass... what more could you ask for.  You can keep your "Old Boy's" style steak houses, because I just found my new "steak joint."  To Tango Sur, I'd like to personally apologize for not having given you the time of day sooner, If I'd known I'm sure our relationship would be so much deeper by now.  I'd just like to say thank you for that little thing you did, you know what I'm talking about, but we'll keep that between us ; )

Reviews.Author: Michelle S.
Reviews.Content: I like this place... good food, nice atmosphere (dark with candle light & some good spanish rock or lounge music playing in the background) - I really like their empanadas.  I've gone here a number of times with friends and have had some fun times.  I've never had a problem with the service - so far the hot waiters with the sexy Argentinean accents have been nice.  Although this is definitely not a place to go if you are starving because everytime I've gone there's always been an annoyingly long wait. If you go make sure it's not during cold weather - the waiting line is outside - but as a courtesy they give you glasses to drink that bottle of wine you've brought with you.  By the time you get seated you're already buzzed and in the mood for munchies and you can order their food  - YAY! It is a bit small inside though - if you push your chair back you're sure to bump into someone or something.  So yeah... good food, hearty portions, sucky wait - nothing life-altering but not a place that you couldn't return to... OH...and don't forget to take your leftovers... they're awesome the next day!

Reviews.Author: Jay B.
Reviews.Content: This place has great food, excellent atmosphere, great prices, and many cool places close by for a night out.

Reviews.Author: Jason S.
Reviews.Content: Went here again for a friend's birthday party.  Let's just say if you plan on coming with a large party and have minimal patience, this place is not for you.  Yes, the Argentinian steak tastes great/has great value and it's BYOB... but always expect the place to be packed and at least a 45 minute wait.  If you are just taking a date or going with afew group of friends, definitely check this place out... but if you are with a large group, expect to be there for at least 2-3 hours.

Reviews.Author: Jillian S.
Reviews.Content: Truly, I must make a return visit to this fine establishment sometime when I haven't been to an open bar beforehand.  And not on a Friday during Lent, when I am trying to not eat meat.  That said, the empanadas were so completely out of this world.  My friend and I also split the Berenjena -  oven baked eggplant layered with spinach, provolone, parmesan and ricotta, served with a delicious tomato cream sauce.  Words cannot describe how fantastic it was.  I will say, be sure to get reservations if you want to come here because it gets PACKED.

Reviews.Author: elizabeth r.
Reviews.Content: A complete disappointment  , I planned to celebrate my husbands 30 th birthday here and we all had a very bad customer experience . they messed up the orders  to being with we never got what we wanted infact we got what we never ordered for  , i had made reservations for all my guests two weeks in advance and yet my guests had to wait for a long time to be seated . The lighting is poor and its hard to see what you are eating . The management was poor and then they charged us way more money than the bill was.. I was very sad that my husbands 30 th birthday did not go well.. When I spoke to the manager in charge he seemed to care less and was not even sorry for the poor management .. never recommending this place  .

Reviews.Author: Gaston L.
Reviews.Content: the ambiance is gorgeously candle lit and romantic at night, and helplessly encourages bouyant celebrations with food and wine. the byob feature is fantastic and is a wonderfully novel concept for a los angeleno. it is a meat eater's paradise, so vegetarians, beware! there is a deliciously cooked salmon as an alternative, for those who wish for fish, yet will take forever to arrive with the heaps of meat. the beautiful male dominated servers will provide a glorious eyepetizers, meant to distract you as you wait a hundred million years for your food.

Reviews.Author: Justin S.
Reviews.Content: First off, BYOB spots already get a step above most other places. Off to a good start.  They have two rooms but the area is still a little crowded so don't worry if the people next to you are laughing at your funny story as well.  It's pretty low-lit but they do have candles to brighten up the mood.  Watch out! They're real haha!The beef empanadas with the chimichurri are a good starter and pretty cheap at $2 a piece.  As usual, don't eat too much bread.  Save that appetite!  I went with the Costeleta, bone-in rib-eye, and it was amazing.  It was just so juicy!  Nothing really special about the mashed potatoes but they were good.  I had some of what I think was salmon from the GF's dish and that was really good too. For the prices we paid, I thought the value was there.  The carmel covered cheesecake is a must-have.  Just don't make the mistake of getting one all for yourself after your large meal.  Sharing is caring.The service was not bad either.  The waiter was quick to answer any & all question we had on the menu.  He even made suggestions that did not disappoint.  And my glass of water never reached the bottom.

Reviews.Author: Courtney B.
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to go here for awhile but there are always long lines.  So my boyfriend and I went on a Monday night.  It was still packed but we were able to sit down right away- Couple things: 1. I am a meat and potato sort of girl  2. I am not a snob  3. I am pretty sure any meat you order in America will not necessarily taste like it was shipped from Argentina cause last I heard a steak is a steak.  So bottom line BYOB makes this place a fantastic place to go have a great fillet dinner for 2 under $50.  By the way, the empenadas are fantastic.

Reviews.Author: Allison S.
Reviews.Content: I've heard rave reviews of this place prior to going, so I was really excited to try it for the first time. I went with my coworkers, only to find out that they had lost our reservation (after my coworker had confirmed it that day). We were worried because there were 6 of us, and it's a smaller place. They were able to seat us after waiting for 20 minutes. Then I ordered "El Filet" and it was amazing the night of, but the leftovers gave me food poisoning. So it's not a place that I will try again soon. I don't know if I will ever eat that much meat again.

Reviews.Author: Nader E.
Reviews.Content: Watery spinach mash potato, probably powder... Filet minion not fresh cut - tasted terrible. Been there before - same dish tasted great, don't know what happened this time

Reviews.Author: Molly D.
Reviews.Content: Plain and simple - I love Tango Sur. I've been to Tango Sur a few times for dinner. It is one of my top 5 favorite places in the city to eat. Its unique, it has character and the food is excellent. True, you will wait....for a while....but all good things are worth the wait. There are plenty of bars around to have drinks at in the time being. In the summer, the al fresco seating can't be beat. Get a couple friends, pick up a couple bottles of wine (BYO) and head over to Tango Sur.

Reviews.Author: Lindsay D.
Reviews.Content: Im a huge fan of BYO, huge. BUt when I told the guy I wanted a vegan option, he looked at me like I was an idiot. Ok, ok....I was dining at f*ing Tango Sur, but it was for a work outing. I had ordered the eggplant appetizer, where they proceeded to give me their eggplant parmesan. Uh, no cheese please! They were quick at changing my order, but they looked like it didnt go over well. Everyone else loved their food, but I was kinda eh about the whole thing. I like the atmosohere and the BYO, but give me some more options at least!!

Reviews.Author: Kimberly M.
Reviews.Content: Most amazing (and largest) cut of red meat I have Ever had the Pleasure of devouring!! My friend and I ordered the Filet for Two with a chimichurri sauce that was big enough to feed the table of 6! The atmosphere was fun and dark and could be romantic if you found yourself in a dark corner. Reservations were not available for our party of 6 but we arrived at 7:45pm on a Wednesday and was sat immediately.. The food was amazing and now anyone starts talking about someplace with an amazing steak, I bust out my picture of the mound of filet that immediately brings tears to your eyes and drool to your lips!

Reviews.Author: Marianne S.
Reviews.Content: I just had dinner here with a friend. The food was good. The service was great - had a really friendly waiter, patient to explain to a first-timer like me.  We had the steak and the empanadas. I've had dozens of empanadas in my lifetime (pretty common food back in my country), but ended up still impressed by the chicken empanada I had. I seem to have smothered all of my food with pesto sauce, which was given generously. The place is great for dates. I like how unpretentious and comfortable the restaurant was. Our bill was $30+ ...not bad, with the fact that we left stuffed.

Reviews.Author: Elias H.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is where it's at. If you are vegetarian you probably don't want to go here. The steak is moist, flavorful, tender, and comes out to your table in massive quantities. Everything we had was delicious, and you can bring your own wine. The prices are great considering what you get. The only reason I didn't give a five is because it's a little bit crowded and the wait was 2 hours. I will definitely be going back though.

Reviews.Author: Brad F.
Reviews.Content: I came here last friday night, and I thought the food was excellent. I had a outter skirt steak, and it was excellent. I had a side of mashed potatoes which were excellent. But I thought the appetizers were even better. We had the dish with melted provelone cheese with red peppers and the empanadas, whcih were both out of this world!

Reviews.Author: Jessi B.
Reviews.Content: Worth every minute having to wait! Phenomenal steaks! Great prices! Best deal in town.

Reviews.Author: Christina F.
Reviews.Content: This place reminded me of places I've been to in Europe and South America, the candles on the table and the simple, shareable dishes. We had tried to go here one other time at around 7pm on a Saturday and there was a 2 hour wait so we came early (around 4pm) and was seated immediately. They had Inca Kola from Peru which I begged my bf to try (it's like a Mountain Dew but better). For apps we got empanadas, the spinach and cheese was a favorite and the chicken was tasty. We also got the cheese appetizer which was greasy and literaly a bowl of melted cheese. I had no idea how to eat it so I put it on the bread, and still got it everywhere. We got an assortment of meats to share that came with a salad (lettuce, tomato, onion, oil and vinegar-- no frills and pretty disappointing). The meats came out on this grill thing that was cool looking and had 5 kinds of meat. The chicken was alright, the steaks (there were two different kinds) were both really tasty, especially with the oil and parsley sauce that came with it, the chorizo was good, but the blood sausage was not, it exploded when my bf cut it open and when I took a bite it was a mouthful of fat....sooooo gross. Minus that, really can't complain we left very satisfied and had leftovers in tow.  A nice date spot, but not for vegetarians or the vegan folk.

Reviews.Author: Coleen K.
Reviews.Content: I love Tango Sur, so much that its steaks visit me in my dreams. I can't say much that others haven't already, but I would like to put in my highest recommendation for the lomo relleno if you're ready to go into a mushroom and saucy-meat coma (serves two...for about a week). Their empanadas are also awesome. I always head to tango sur at about 5:30... this is right before the gets too long and I'm able to open my wine and sip it in their nice wait room. Definitely plan to head there early, or be prepared to wait!

Reviews.Author: Jason C.
Reviews.Content: After being in Chicago 10 years and wanting to try this place, I finally went a couple of weeks ago.  I am still trying to figure out what all the hype is about - they dont take reservations, you can barely see the food its so dark (maybe that is part of the plan) and the food was very average.  My meat was tough and unappealing.  We had a couple of the appetizers which were good and we like the BYOB option but there are so many BYOBs in the city.  Las Tablas down the street is a better option in my book - better food and takes reservations.

Reviews.Author: Lucy N.
Reviews.Content: The evil little imps on the door have the kind of superiority complex that comes from being, I would imagine, really unpopular at school. Thus the false feeling of power they feel with the responsibility of getting people seated has unfortunately gone to their head. I would love to write a review about the food but unfortunately I never got in there. I was expecting to wait. I happily agreed with the 1.5 hour wait first mentioned. 2.5 hours later - for just a group of three, we admitted defeat and left. I don't care how good the food apparently is, the guys on the door are smug, rude little men with not a brain cell between them. Seriously folks, gives this place a miss and go live your lives - waiting in line is for people with nothing better to do.

Reviews.Author: Amy J.
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 7:30 on a Thursday night. Seated immediately- didn't see a waiter for 15 minutes. Thought about walking out. Server comes over. We place full order. Get our apps. Greasy and lukewarm. Seriously think about walking out. 20 minutes later get "salads" (skimpy iceberg, white onion and tomato slices). Wait AN HOUR AND 15 MINUTES before getting the "manager" who was chilling out in his unbrushed hair and cargo pants. He got the waiter instead of handling it himself. We told our waiter we would pay for what we ate, but did not want anything else. The manager told us to sit back down. The waiter said we could leave. What a horribly run place. Never again.

Reviews.Author: Leang E.
Reviews.Content: All the members of my immediate family came to town for my birthday and we waited 2 hours to eat at this place!   I know, it was horrible to make everyone wait and they won't let me live it down.  It was totally worth it though.  Every time I have been here, I've never been disappointed with the food.  The steaks are so huge and it looks so good when someone else gets their food, that you'll unconsciously be salivating.  Let me tell you, the Argentinians know how to do it!  It's BYOB, so don't forget the red wine - it's best with meat of this kind!  Oh, and beware of food coma afterwards.

Reviews.Author: Alan R.
Reviews.Content: I've only been here once, but loved it.  The empenadas were scrumptious. I especially loved the Ham and Cheese. The Skirt Steak (flank) was excellent.  You can order it with or without the skin.  They will de-skin it for you.  It is tougher with the skin on.  As is a tradition in much of Latin/South America, chimichurri sauce is served with the meats and Tango Sur's is very good. Their patio makes for great people watching on Southport in the summertime.

Reviews.Author: Julie A.
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to go here for at least and year, and I finally made it last night.  I liked it!  I was nervous because of the so-so reviews, but I thought it was really good.  The appetizers were great, and we were seated immediately.  The service was kind of slow, and next time I'll make sure we don't have somewhere to be after dinner  like we did last night.  When our food came, I had to ask for the check.  Other then the location (no parking) I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Author: Char Y.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is just not for me. I thought the meat was plentiful, but very greasy and over done.

Reviews.Author: ali a.
Reviews.Content: Great place! the food is amazing and its BYOB.  I had a steak and it was so cheap. The empanadas and appetizers were also amazing.  It was a little loud and very crowded, but I still enjoyed it. I would definitely go back.  Although they don't take official reservations, you can call ahead and put your name down.

Reviews.Author: Thongsy S.
Reviews.Content: I went here for a friend's birthday dinner.  It was crazy packed so I would recommend making a reservation.  It is also ridiculously dark in there.  Be careful of where you're stepping.  The steaks are decent.  Try the meal for two which is about $30 and it will fill you up quickly with a huge variety of meats.  Also, it's BYOB with no corkage fee so you can't beat that.

Reviews.Author: Cory C.
Reviews.Content: This place is my favorite restaurant in Chicago, hands down!Looking for a great place to bring a first date? Tango Sur is your best bet.It's dark and romantic inside-- great for an intimate conversation. But also the atmosphere is fun and young-- great for a small birthday gathering (as long as you're not obnoxiously loud).The food is to die for (bife vesuvio is my favorite). It's a BYOB which makes any date 100x better.There can be a long wait so be patient!

Reviews.Author: John O.
Reviews.Content: One of the great BYOBs out there...very high quality beef dishes that won't break the budget.  The wait on weekends is horrendous though so I usually go on slower weeknights.  Surprisingly, my vegetarian wife really enjoys the food here.   In the summer months, the best place to sit is outside, both for people watching and so your clothes don't smell like a BBQ afterwards.  If you forget to bring a bottle, stop by Que Syrah down the street.  Although they are a small boutique, their selection is top-notch.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie H.
Reviews.Content: After hearing about this place since I moved here....I went for the first time the other week on a Wed. with my girlfriends. It was busy...I thought for a Wed., we waited for about 15 minutes. They have a decent waiting room in the back. Bring your own...is nice.  We had a great table towards the front, by the windows it was nice. (The sidewalk/outdoor seating looked great too, it was cold and rainy when we were there = not an option).  I ordered the Filet, and it was 2!!! (leftovers the next day) Perfect to share, and the spinach mashed potatoes were great, I thought the steak was amazing. Also very reasonably priced.  I will definitely visit again soon, Great dining experience.

Reviews.Author: Donato C.
Reviews.Content: Upon entering Tango Sur, I knew I was in the right place for that night!  It has a very dark, intimate, yet animated atmosphere.  It was packed, yet we were able to get a table immediately.  The food was excellent, but the service was a little too slow that evening which prevents me from giving this restaurant five stars.  I had a perfectly cooked, rare filet.  I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Author: Allison E.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a lovely evening at Tango Sur. We went on a Sunday and it was still pretty crowded. The space is very tight. I can imagine that it's a zoo on Friday or Saturday.  For those reasons, I would not recommend it for a large group. There just isn't space.  We did decided, however, that Tango Sur would be an excellent and uber romantic date spot. Its dark and candle lit, quiet, with intimate little tables, which would invaribly result in brushed hands, deep gazing into one anothers eyes, and maybe a little footsying. Perhaps not every man would understand the appeal, but trust us lads, take your girl here. You will not regret it. The service was fantastic. The waiters were attentive, polite, and helpful. My water glass never was less then 3/4 full. (1/4 empty?). We certainly felt well taken care of. It may have taken a while for our entrees to arrive, but I didn't really notice. We had already had salad and bread to take the edge off and were having a good conversation. The food. Ah! The food. The food was delicious. My mashed potatos were green. I believe they included spinach. But there were so amazingly yummy that I didn't really care what was in them, or why they were green. I had the filet mignon. It was beautiful. Tender, melt in my mouth, and cooked just the way I like it with some pink on the inside.  My friend's meal was just as tasty. Both entree's were huge. I think between the two of us, we had the greater edible part of a cow. There are some items on the menu that are recommended for two people. But in my opinion, most of the menu can feed two people. We both had two entire steaks on our plates, and we certainly could have shared one entree and been plenty full. Not that I am complaining about having filet mingon again today for lunch. It is a little on the pricy side, at least for me. I am cheap. But, they certainly give you your moneys worth in amount of food. Overall, I had a lovely dining experience and would not hesitate to come here again. Ah yes! did I mention that it is BYOB? Bring your own bottle of wine. Which we would have done had I not been driving. No corkage fee either. As far as I am concerned, BYOB is the most brilliant thing to happen to nice restaurants. And I will pretty much award an extra star on that fact alone. So, pick up your favorite bottle and enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Patrick H.
Reviews.Content: Woohooo! If you're looking for an amazing steak for a good price look no further. This place is one of my favorite restaurants of all time. The atmosphere is very romantic and friendly. It's BYOB so you can bring a couple bottles of wine in and get a little tipsy before you have an amazing steak. The only downside is that I always spill steak all over my shirt because I eat it so ferociously.

Reviews.Author: Jordan M.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur used to be a 5+ stars.  I don't like steak, but I crave a good one at Tango Sur, BYOB and their empanadas are delicious too! Never had bad food or service from the wait staff.Sadly they will NEVER get my business AGAIN. This is a long review, but I am shocked by their door hosts.7:03 We showed up on a Saturday night expecting to wait an hour or more. We put a name for a party of 4 on the "list" (a tiny, unorganized notebook full of names and phone numbers... and scribbles). We were quoted an expected 1 hour to 1 hour and 30 minutes, first available. Fine. We had arrived about 45 minutes ahead of our friends for that reason. My husband and I go get drinks down the street, they will call when the table is ready.7:45 Our friends show up at the bar. We ordered a round.8:00 Another group (obviously from Argentina themselves) who put their names in just before us got their call and left. WE must be close!8:25 No phone call yet, but we decided to walk back to the restaurant; our time was almost up! We asked the host politely how much longer. The host flips thorough pages and pages of names and tells us. "Uh, there are about 3 tables ahead of you, so 20 more minutes." He stated, "There have been a lot of pay and stays tonight."  I have been a hostess and I have experienced slow downs on busy nights. I am understanding. 9:00 Ask again, how much longer. Host "I don't have your name in my book anymore, so the other guys have it. Very soon, very soon." We have seen the "other guys" call people, but strangely, they seem to get the numbers straight from the head host. Hmmm...9:15 It's 60 in July, and we have discovered that there is a waiting area inside, we must look miserable because we have been told "You're the next table.... inside."Us: "Could we just wait inside then in the waiting area (that is empty we have discovered)?"Host: " Someone will have to escort you in, we can't just let people inside." Really? What club did we show up to tonight?9:30 WE get called, this must be it, right? We were next.... 2 and a half hours? No, wrong. We were finally escorted inside to WAIT, meanwhile there is almost no one waiting outside anymore, we have watched tables be seated and phone numbers called. Quote "I feel like I have to be someone's cousin, or speak in Spanish with the host to get a table tonight." (This actually may be true....)We open one of our bottles of wine inside in the waiting area. We finish a bottle of wine. We go get another bottle of wine, two left to get four of us through dinner? Nope. Not after tonight.9:45 While half our party goes to get wine, it appears that we will get called. Nope, that was the group of six that came in to wait AFTER us.  Then, the one of the hosts comes to get us. Host: "2 for inside?"Us: "No, 4, but we've been waiting almost 3 hours, we will sit anywhere. They just went to get wine." The host turns and practically runs away. Did we have a table or not? It seems that everyone else is getting one!9:55 A group that has just arrived since the last is pulled to be sat. Desperately, I ask the last guy out of the room (they have a small party). "Excuse me, how long have you been waiting?"Guy: " Do you REALLY want to know? (Nodding yes.) 5 minutes... but we had a reservation."Us: "Really, for 3?" (They don't take reservations... read the other reviews.) Guy "Yeah... how long have YOU been waiting."Us: 3 hours..."Guy: "What!?! 3 HOURS? Hold on..."The guy walks away, one minute later, he comes back and says," That table is yours, right there."Us: "What?" (Completely dumbfounded.)Guy: "Yeah, right there." He points and sure enough a table is being frantically set and  in the background, the host who so rudely walked away from us earlier is snapping his fingers at us from across the room (so RUDE!) and pointing to the table.3 HOURS WAITING... Magically seated by a guy who got a reservation for 3 on a Saturday night at a place that doesn't take them? If not for this guy, who knows if we would have waited longer. WE have HIM to thank, whoever he is was. Does he work there? Is he related to someone who does?  Who knows, but HE was the reason we got our table. Why did you wait that long?  That's stupid. Agreed, but the promising "you're next" and "very soon" comments kept us waiting. If I had been given an honest time in the beginning or if there was a system that didn't just seat those from Argentina or other hispanohablantes (there were many groups) first maybe it would not have been so long, maybe we would have gone elsewhere, but now I will never return.The food is amazing and the only thing positive in the night, if you go, go early on a weeknight, then you will not have to deal with that DISASTER of a rude and unorganized hosting staff. Unfortunately they probably receive a portion of the hardworking and friendly wait staff's tips.

Reviews.Author: Mike H.
Reviews.Content: Went as a group of 6 on a Saturday night. Extremely busy as expected, but were able to get seated after only an hour wait (originally, estimated to be 2 hours).  Once we were seated, not a thing went as expected for a restaurant so consistently praised:* Waiter was completely listless and uncharismatic- likely because no effort was needed to earn his tip (party of 6)*No bread was provided- had to ask*Only 4 of us had place settings- had to ask for 2 more*Food was served warm*Mashed potatoes tasted like instant mixed with real potato chunks*Salad was pointless, as it seemed better suited on a hamburger condiment tray Overall, unimpressed with the service and food, considering this place comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Phil P.
Reviews.Content: Good food. Okay atmosphere.  Most of the food on the menu was heavy. Go here hungry and in the mood for something hearty. Service was not the best - not our servers fault. Just seemed under staffed.

Reviews.Author: SteamQueen Y.
Reviews.Content: Everybody knows of this small Argentinean place on Southport. I recently went to Argentina and had a lot of empanadas. I can say for sure that empanadas you get from Tango Sur are better than any I've tried in Argentina. I hate their salad though.. Long waits really bug me too. I've been there many times- weekdays and weekends. One time I went there with a couple of college buddies on a Sunday night. We waited for over an hour. Their meat is pretty good although they tend to undercook their meat. (I actually like this aspect. I like my meat pretty rare) BYOB.. always good.

Reviews.Author: Tom C.
Reviews.Content: Good not great. I thought that the steak filled with cheese was really good but the other food I had there was disappointing. I had heard so many good things from this place from people that I had imagined more. If you are going to go expect to wait. This place is popular and they don't take reservations so get there early or head down the street to one of the local bars to have a few drinks.

Reviews.Author: Dana J.
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind waiting 2+ hours or more on the weekend,  and you're looking for a tasty and inexpensive steak dinner ( I believe for 2 steak dinners our bill was $40), this is the place! I've now gone there three times and each time I leave I'm satisfied.The fact that it's BYOB (no corkage fee) helps to seal the deal!

Reviews.Author: Christian F.
Reviews.Content: Can we all start chanting over-rated?  For starters we made a 7pm reservation and were called twice to make sure we showed up on time.  Apparently, there was a group with our table coming at 9pm and they wanted to make sure we would get in and out without inconveniencing the next group.  I'm cool with that.  But when we arrived at 6:55pm we were told our table wasn't ready yet.  We were seated at 7:35pm.  Good thing we showed up on time.  If you are going to have the guts to calls patrons and tell them to show up and then leave by the next reservation, you should also have the guts to kick out those who overstay.  Poor form and a bad welcome to this hot spot.  Doesn't help that you have a couple of guys standing and blocking the door like this is some trendy NY night club.  Repeatedly they blocked folks from going inside to sit at their table with friends that had arrived earlier.  This place has clearly gotten too big for its britches.The food...meh.  I ordered the bone in rib-eye thinking this is the only way to have a steak.  Instead, it was boring and fatty.  Lacked flavor.  I will say that the eggplant appetizer was good but everything else was sub par, especially for the street cred this place enjoys.  I think people get loaded on their wine and that is why they think this place is great.  Either that or they are all coming after Cubs games and bombed.  Could be that they are all Wrigleyville folks who dine on bar food and think this is a fine steak.  BYOB or not, my friends and I won't be returning.

Reviews.Author: Kate M.
Reviews.Content: Amazing! That is one word that correctly describes this place.  Not only is it BYOB (score!) but the food is amazing and it's not pretentiously priced.This place does not take reservations and the wait could be pretty long.  There are a few bars within walking distance to go to while you wait, if you'd like.  Tango Sur WILL take reservations if you have a large group (everyone needs to be there in order to get seated).  One thing I highly recommend are their beef empanadas.  I have yet to find another place in Chicago that makes them as good as Tango. I should probably branch out and try some other things but I can't bring myself to! For a main dish I usually go with the Lomo (filet) and it's sooo yummy!  My boyfriend and I usually spilt this since we load up on empanadas and wine.  I did have a friend I was with try one of their pastas and wasn't impressed.  So I suggest stick with the meats here.This place is worth the wait. Trust me

Reviews.Author: Syngin A.
Reviews.Content: When there are so many different, ethnic and American steakhouses in Chicago, you have to be special and unique to really separate yourself from the pack.  The food is truly special with generous portions, but when I weigh that with the inconvenience of parking in the neighborhood, the long wait to be seated, served and checked-out, over-crowding and the unfriendliest wait staff in town, I find myself chosing someplace else.  I'm hoping someday, they will move to a larger space with more parking options than street.  I can deal with the staff that won't say two words to me and pretend I'm dining in Europe where it takes three hours to get in and out for dinner in exchange for the splendid food.  Until then, I pass.

Reviews.Author: Melissa S.
Reviews.Content: The food was about what I expected, great big hunks of meat. Yum. Most of it was pretty good, but then, if you start with good meat, it's hard to mess it up. Some of the beef at our table looked over-cooked, but then, it's hard to tell in the candellight. The appetizers we had were also OK, although nothing really stood out. I can't believe they sell a bowl of melted cheese and call it an appetizer.What I did not like here was the service and atmosphere. They have jam-packed so many tables and people in that I felt like I couldn't breathe. When I went to the bathroom, I had to take baby steps and say "excuse me" to about 15 other people due to the crowds. The servers were really rude. My chair/elbow/head was bumped into several times and no one apologized. I tried to scoot my chair in but it wouldn't budge due to the positioning of the table. I'm not a large person and I wasn't hanging out in the walk-way, but I just kept getting knocked around, so ended up crouching and leaning over the table for the rest of the night. In addition, the servers did something that really annoys me, which is agressively bus plates that they think are empty. I was asked 4 different times if I was done with my salad, and my fork was still in my hand! My dinner plate was taken from me without even being asked, and I was definitely not done with that.Tasty meat is no excuse for the service. I'm never going back.

Reviews.Author: Joe B.
Reviews.Content: Salad is meh, bread is hit or miss, steaks are awesome. BYOB and no res required for a couple. Solid date night spot.Can be busy during peak times, but the steaks are worth suffering through the wait, salad, and bread.

Reviews.Author: Sam C.
Reviews.Content: Came here with a party of 7 and it was on! Definitely a great place if you want to have a good dinner. It's true that you have to wait but what good restaurant doesn't make you wait? Turn down your snob and have some wine. Now, let's turn to the food. The followings are what I had:1) Empanadas - Beef, Chicken, Ham and cheese, Spinach & cheese2) Prosciutto & Melon3) Provoleta4) El FiletThe food overall is pretty good. my filet was a bit undercooked (I ordered medium rare and it came out more rare than medium rare). But the flavor and seasoning is there. I'd definitely come back for more rounds of BYOB. My table's service is actually pretty decent, so I understand the fuss that other people complained about.I think as long as you come here with the intention to drink some wine, have some good meat, enjoy a few great conversation and laughter, this is the place to be. Snobs...please save it and spend you snobby $$ at stuffy tie places.

Reviews.Author: Ashley M.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant has quickly become one of my favorite spots - and apparently I'm not the only one.  I live fairly close, and every time I walk by there is a huge line.  The food here is worth the wait!  The portions here are HUGE, and you can pretty much split most entrees between two people.  I prefer the chicken or beef Napolitana, and I can make about three meals out of it with left-overs.  It's BYOB, so grab a bottle of cheap wine at the Jewel just down the street while you're waiting.  The only thing stopping me from giving it the full five stars is the wait staff is a little slow.  Also know that they don't accept special requests or changes to the dishes.

Reviews.Author: Josie F.
Reviews.Content: Cate M. is on to something.  We had almost the same experience except everyone was being sat before us.  When we finally got sat I asked what happened.  He showed me the wait list and said their names where before ours.  I pointed to my name at the top of the list.  They just did not give a crap.  We really felt we could not get a table being three brown people.  All the groups that got sat before us yet came after us where white.  I hate thinking this but It was really blatant.   ***********TANGO SUR IS RACIST.  YES REALLY THEY ARE********

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth V.
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for 11 people, they had the table ready for us when we came in and they didn't do one of those "we can't sit you until your entire party is here" things because come on how can 11 people arrive at the same time. If you love meat then this is the place. Great service, amazing food and it's BYOB. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Jessa B.
Reviews.Content: This place was pretty cool! I went with a HUGE group for a birthday party and I must say the ambiance was amazing. It was BYOB and although the options were limited for a vegan, the food looked great!!! We all had a great time!

Reviews.Author: Christy A.
Reviews.Content: This place is a joke. Not worth it at all. Had to wait over 3 hours for a table for 2 and ended up leaving because they said it would be another 30 minute wait. The staff is rude and I dont see any restaurant worth this long of a wait unless they are giving you free food plus a hundred bucks.

Reviews.Author: Peter S.
Reviews.Content: I recently vacationed in Chicago, staying with my best friend (awwwwwww). One thing we discussed was going to a dinner somewhere that might be worthy of a review. Without hesitation he picked Tango Sur. I have experienced American steakhouses where dark wood and dim lights create ambiance for big steaks; and Brazilian steakhouses where meats (on swords!) are brought to the table in waves; and Japanese steakhouses where I get cranky if my Teppen chef does not transition the onion volcano into a choo-choo train. Tango Sur was my first Argentinian steakhouse. No gimmicks, just good food.We started with what my friend told me was basically an appetizer ritual when he goes to Tango Sur: Spinach & Cheese Empanadas. Not to detract from the rest of the meal, details still forthcoming below, but the empanadas we heavenly. The entire meal was delicious, but the appetizers stole the show. Luckily we ordered the appetizers and our entrees at once, so I did get something else to write about. I had the Bife Vesuvio - steak stuffed with spinach, cheese and garlic. It may seem slightly redundant to get something stuffed with spinach and cheese after the empanada, but I was tantalized by the garlic (I believe it was the only item on the menu that specifically listed garlic. What was a guy to do?). Ultimately it was the right order; it was delicious. The steak, actually, was fine. I feel like it was a hunk of flank steak or something similar -- tough and plain. It was seasoned perfectly so that I almost forgot how dangerously close it came to being dry. The stuffing was out of this world. I feel like garlic and cheese on anything is almost cheating, but I won't complain. I loved it. We both ate an incredible amount of food, but it is hard to pass on dessert so we decided to split a slice of carrot cake. Even the dessert was great. It was slightly more dense than what I consider a traditional carrot cake, which was right up my alley. We bought wine from the over-priced wine store across the street from the restaurant. Tango Sur is b.y.o.b. and they charged (I believe) no corking fee. As a practical matter, the over-priced wine from the store was still less expensive than it would have been off a restaurant menu, so take that into consideration if you go to the same store. This was a great restaurant and without his suggestion, I never would have found it on my own. Tango Sur is located at 3763 N Southport Ave, between Grace and Waveland. 773.477.5466

Reviews.Author: Nicole C.
