Reviews.Content: i'll admit i was wowed by this place about 2-3 years ago when i first came here. we willingly waited for an hour or so for table, loved our dishes, loved the byob, ignored the insane volume levels and rude service ... however the past two times I have gone here this year.....the food has just been well...AVERAGE at best. For a place that's tiny, cramped, and has a host who acts like getting seated at Tango Sur is equivalent to be seated at  Charlie Trotter's, I was annoyed. I'd be willing to overlook all those things if the food was great and it's BYOB. But, to me, the food quality here has totally depreciated over the past 2 years and I'm no longer willing to overlook those things. Too many good BYOB food places in the city for me to wait forever for an 'ok' steak.

Reviews.Author: Hector Y.
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely attentive, they were able to accomodate us even that the reservation was messed up and there was a waiting line of 3 hours.The food is superb, the cuts are flawless, it was heaven in my mouth...BYOB is always a nice feature, but I wasn't in the mood that day.

Reviews.Author: Kelly P.
Reviews.Content: It's my first yelp review and im so glad that im starting my review with tengo sur! everything was absolutely amazing! =D Loved the fact that its BYOB and that the portions are huge! My boyfriend and I celebrated our 4 year anniversary here and the food was just awesome as it gets. We started with beef empanadas which were so yummy~ and then we split a lomo relleno filet (a good suggestion from our server) and loved it! We both didnt realize that this entree will be so huge lol we ended up eating a half of the filet and took the rest to go =P The only part was that we had to wait over an hour to get seated and extra time for the food to come out, but it was well worth the wait! Cant wait to go back again!

Reviews.Author: Carri C.
Reviews.Content: I have been dining at Tango Sur for 10 years.  I just had a terrible experience there and will not ever be returning, which is sad given my history with this place.  I have experienced spotty food and the service in the past, but tonight just put me over the edge.  Our waiter was a space cadet and borderline rude.  I received the wrong entree.  Plus, my entree was raw on one part of it (really wierd) and hopefully will not be getting me sick after eating a couple bites of it. My husband received a steak that only my dog could have loved.  It was a tough, chewy steak that was of poor quality that had been cooked inappropriately and was $25.  We told management and while they did offer to give us something else, I had zero confidence in anything else.  There must be a new cook (chef is way too kind) and different cuts of meat being offered.  Pathetic.

Reviews.Author: Chicago I.
Reviews.Content: I came here for the first time on my birthday this year. I listened to my friends recommendations and made the reservation for myself and company I had in town- all of whom are from Missouri and Kansas-aka tough meat critics. I can honestly say we all loved this place! Sure it was crowded on a Sat night, but let's be honest you can't trust a restaurant that is empty... A few of our favorites were the grilled half chicken, strip steak and sirloin steak. All of which were amazing- so flavorful and tender! Not to mention this is a BYOB so you can make sure your favorite bottle of wine will always be there. This ia a wonderful place to entertain a group or go on a date.  This is one of my new favorites for sure!

Reviews.Author: Karen M.
Reviews.Content: I went here with a friend back in September.  We sat outside as it was a nice day.  The empanadas were very good.  I ordered the media pollo al jamon and my friend ordered Bife de Chorizo.  They both had the exact same sauce on them.  My chicken was very dry.  My friend was not thrilled with her steak.  Service was good, but the food was very disappointing.

Reviews.Author: Elena I.
Reviews.Content: I've been at Tango Sur few times, and always enjoy their food. It is delicious!!!! Always fresh-cooked and  flavored. BYOB also helps to keep your bill at decent level. I love their empanadas and a grilled meat. I can not give them 5 stars only for the reason that I can not make a reservation ahead of time for the party of less than 6 people, and the waiting time is unbelievable long, especially on the weekend.I love this place, and I hope that they can change their reservation policy.

Reviews.Author: Jessica M.
Reviews.Content: Today I went to celebrate my early birthday with my husband and it was our first time at Tango Sur. I left the restaurant speechless, the food was AMAZING, the service was outstanding. I thought I was gonna get a $100 bill for the quality of dinner we had, and we spent less than $50 with service. I totally recommend and I can't wait to let all my friends know about this place and come back very soon!! Our waiter was Martin, he was an excellent server and made sure our experience was the best possible, congratulations for the amazing staff you guys have!!!

Reviews.Author: Agnes P.
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying the chimchurri (spelling?) sauce is AMAZING! The wait here is a little long but there is a nice intimate area in the back to wait instead of being out in the cold. Amazing grilled chicken, steak, and veggies, loved it all. The only issue I had was the music, pretty loud so I had to scream across the table for my boyfriend to hear me, left with a sore throat at the end of the night.

Reviews.Author: Courtney S.
Reviews.Content: If you like steaks and haven't been to Tango Sur, you need to drop everything and go tonight.  Well maybe not tonight but soon.  It's a great restaurant and the steaks are delicious!  Service is good and they are very friendly.  The biggest problem with Tango Sur is that they don't take reservations and it gets very crowded but if you go during the week it shouldn't be too bad.

Reviews.Author: Wiston S.
Reviews.Content: I love this place. Hugely affordable food, BYOB, and great atmosphere for a date. Horrible waiting times on the weekend, though.  But they did accomodate a huge group of us in the back room for my birthday, and there's no corking fee.

Reviews.Author: Tom E.
Reviews.Content: What a great place!  I can only hope they don't change.  Keep it BYOB and keep serving the same food at the same prices and it will be a winning formula for years to come.  If you are in the mood for good steak but don't want to break the bank, this is the place to go.  The empanadas were very good, the bread was great, and the ribeye was massive and juicy.  Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Sam K.
Reviews.Content: I have been to Tango Sur many times, and I will continue to go back! I have taken out of town guests, gone on dates, birthday parties...etc.Always a wonderful experience. I know that the wait is long, but it is one of the few places that I really think is worth it.The food is so delicious! The price is great for the amount! I always get two meals out of the filet.Can't beat the BYOB and never had a problem with the service!

Reviews.Author: Beth W.
Reviews.Content: I really liked Tengo Sur.  Great food for cheap- and its BYOB!  The only really issue is that you WILL wait (even if you call ahead- they don't take official reservations).  We waited for 2 hours with calling ahead.  But the key is - just plan on waiting and hit up the near by bars.  They also sort of rush you  (probably because of the masses of people that they need to move through).  The food especially the steaks are really good and the portions are large. Overall-great intimate atmosphere for a date or close friends, good food, and great prices.

Reviews.Author: David H.
Reviews.Content: I love a good steakhouse. My friend recommended Tango Sur before a cubs game. It's a byob and I had a good bottle of Malbec so, I was down. We ordered this incredible cheese and peppers dish that wouldn't end. And then, I ordered this incredible skirt steak that wouldn't end. The portions are huge and the quality of food is great. I will be back with bottles.

Reviews.Author: Shannon S.
Reviews.Content: Took my sister-in-law out and had an awesome night. Picked up some wine (which they will chill for you...and give you glasses!!!) It is BYOB. Had an app, salad, bread and a HUGE piece of steak for less than $50. Sat outside and had an amazing time. LOVE THIS PLACE!!!

Reviews.Author: Meg J.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite, favorite place to dine in the world. I started coming here 8 years ago when I lived in Wrigleyville and we were celebrating a special occasion. I've since moved away but every time I come back to Chicago it's a must. Great food. Love the b.y.o.b. great service and its highly recommended to call ahead and make reservations. Winter is hardest to get a table. I've accidentally drank a bottle of wine before even eating. Strange that there are no ladies working. The chimichui sauce is heavenly an. Dip everything in it. Empanadas are yummy but I only fancy the spinach and cheese. I've recently discovered the meat ones have eggs in them. Not for me. My only qualm is I wish they sold their T-shirts. Tango Sur will always be my special place I like to share with loved ones.

Reviews.Author: J M.
Reviews.Content: Table of 7 is Lost in Translation? Stopped by Tango Sur last night, with a party of 7 @ 7.  When we asked how long it would be for our table of 7, the host very matter-of-factly said, "we don't do 7." I understand Tango Sur is a small, but popular place - undoubtedly because of the BYOB policy - but at least give us the courtesy of a professional answer. During an economic time where most restaurants are begging for your business, Tango Sur only wants it, if you keep your groups to parties of 4 or less, wait outside for ridiculous amounts of time, and once seated - ensure you are nearly sitting in the laps of the people at the table next to you.  Sounds like a great deal, huh?Skip Tango Sur and try Las Tablas on Lincoln where a table of 7 or more, is no problem.  Las Tablas is a Columbian Steakhouse with excellent food, friendly and efficient service, spacious tables, a better value, and no reservations needed (last night, they were completely booked and we waited only 40 mins. for a table).

Reviews.Author: N.P. W.
Reviews.Content: If you're new to Chicago, this is the best steak for your money. If you've been in Chicago and are yelping this restaurant, you've been wasting money at restaurants.Be prepared to wait to be seated. Don't worry, it's worth the time. With the amount of food you receive at the price it's given, you'll be more than happy! Order the Fillet and don't forget to bring at least two bottles of red wine.BEST RESTAURANT IN CHICAGO!

Reviews.Author: Falon G.
Reviews.Content: After hearing multiple people rave about this restaurant and reading the amazing reviews about Tango Sur, I was dying to get there and see for myself.  Two words capture my experience: EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED.  Luckily, I was there at 6:00 pm on a Sunday and was seated right away.  The waiter immediately seemed quite confused.  He kept stopping by the table and promising to open my wine, bring glasses, etc., but didn't.  It took him probably 15 minutes to open my wine and bring two glasses.  Even the host/manager stopped by and promised glasses, but didn't deliver.  By the time he was ready to take our order, I had already consumed an entire mini loaf of bread and had scoured the huge menu thoroughly.  The bread was delicious-- probably the best part of the meal.Upon reviewers' suggestions, I tried both the spinach and the corn empanadas.  They were good, but not great. The 5411 Empanada food truck makes Tango Sur's taste like a hot pocket.  45 minutes after ordering, our meal finally arrives.  My guest and I split the El Filet and the ribeye.  On the plus side, the spinach mashed potatoes were pretty good.  The plain mashed potatoes were ok--they tasted like a huge lump of butter with a potato in it.  The steaks?  AWFUL.  Both of them were so full of gristle that they were nearly impossible to eat.  The meat quality was terrible, more like grade C or D.  I could have purchased a better quality steak at Aldi for an eighth of the price.  The wonderful beef flavor was missing--all of the flavor came from the sauce they covered it in.  I picked around at my steak, trying desperately to cut out the fat and finally gave up.  We had to ask for the check twice, and thankfully could pay in cash.  I see why there is always such a wait--dinner for two took nearly two hours, most of it sitting and waiting.I'm not sure why everyone thinks this place is so cheap--maybe because the bill is missing the huge alcohol portion?  The steaks were $25-$35.  For a few bucks more, you could have a melt-in-your-mouth, non-gristly ribeye at Shula's.  And they take reservations.  Sorry Tango Sur, I was excited to add another delicious and fun restaurant to my list of favorite restaurants, but sadly, you are neither.  I will not be patronizing your restaurant again.

Reviews.Author: clare m.
Reviews.Content: I loooove Tango Sur! The byob factor and the food are great! The only issue is the wait!  Me and my friends come here and always have a reservation.  We always still end up having to wait 30 mins-an hour when we have a reservation, which gets annoying! But the food is worth it!!

Reviews.Author: HeerO A.
Reviews.Content: Ok my 1st ever review let's get sum basic ish out da way Fux ur spell check Lil things dnt bother mei keep it realAnd I do this 4 fun not cus I care what u think Tango sur 1st thing I like about it is how dark it was candle lit all over negative iam 6'3 310 so I bumped into every thing.Plus there was a waiting room were u can wait (duh) verse da damn cold outside. This place is small like dodge ball court small it's loud and dares 1 shitter in da whole joint (that I no of). Whn put in da waiting room if he says 20 mins he really means "1 hour and 20 mins" I went on a monday MLK DAY (black power) it was still packed by 6If ur a douche go here wit all ur friends 4 a birthday and take up 7 tables cus that's wat Mandy party of 10 did ( i will never 4get u Mandy) Once seated my waiter seemed confused whn I said I dnt drink so I like water he kept asking me am I sure as if I was lost? The waiters are nice fast but hard of hearing and I found my self asking for things da weren't  accustom to doing eg can I get a straw, ice, etc... But he will explain da shit out of dat menu haha take dare advise on everything TRUST ME Bread salad pretty plain for this to b such a nice spot doeMy meal I order el filet Mignon AS GOD AS MY WHITENESS I NEARLY CRIED on da first bite then da second 1 I str8 up nutted yea I said it. Great size mind u doe if ur a xxl u better get half way full wit da other ish cus dat meat want do it. I wanted to kiss da waiter and bang da chef for this masterpiece am I over reacting maybe will I fight sum1 who said da dis agree that the piece of angel food isnt in da top 5 best hell yes. I also  had sum crappy side order of chicken good wit da green sauce understand crappy not for it's taste but it's size if u big order two mayb 3Price fair 59.97 for two el filet Mignon and sum sides give or take my under wear Date noteIf u Wana wow her go her but not a great 1st date place if u are not well spoken cus of da time intervals hard work keeping her eyes on u and not her phone. Also gets loud so the phrase (say wat) (cum again) (mofo speak up ) will b used. Also note u may see ur mom friends there 25 is abd up joint But great place to get close and really gaze into her eyes wit sum wine. Damn my date was beautiful shout to GemSummary Great place nice feel horrible wait great food fair price the food saved this star ranking but I give it a 8.5/10 alone for the food

Reviews.Author: Chan K.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is amazing and is worth the wait. I had a filet mignon, and it was cooked perfectly and melted in my mouth. I would give four stars just for the portions alone! The steaks are very reasonably priced and byob saves you even more.The service isn't stellar, but I was so happy with my steak that I did not really even notice. We were fortunate to get a table outside. The inside was dark crowded and noisy.

Reviews.Author: Rob L.
Reviews.Content: The night I came here I can still remember, mainly because it was such a damn bun freezing night. I came with a friend and well we didn't know what to expect and we didn't know that it was a BYOB. Despite this set back we trudged on and made our list of orders. We ordered a bunch of the empanades. I freaking love the empanades here! I could eat them all day and all night here. I had gotten the breaded chicken and my friend had the steak. I wish I had gotten the steak, especially after having a bite of his. Damn.... I really, really wish I had gotten the steak, 'cause it was perfectly cooked and tasty. Great place for dinner, for friends or a date or a group. Service was great, very relaxed atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Dan T.
Reviews.Content: If you don't think this is the best restaurant in Chicago...  I will fight you.

Reviews.Author: Sofia M.
Reviews.Content: Changed the rules?...for 10 years we been coming to this place they didn't take reservations. Today they give attitude and bad service. My last day in Chicago and this is what you get....bad taste in my mouth and memory. Never again, and will not be recommending to my acquaintances in California. Did they changed ownership? And not even a sorry...bad, bad, bad.

Reviews.Author: wil h.
Reviews.Content: Ok. But after all the hype, it was just ok. Loud and cramped inside. Steaks were cooked well but all the red meat tasted salty. Decent/inattentive service. We corked 3/4 bottles on our own.

Reviews.Author: Mandy P.
Reviews.Content: I'm taking a star away; our service was downright snotty the last time we were there. Apparently ordering an apetizer as a meal gets you condescending remarks. Note they still get 4 stars. I still love this place, regardless of the wait time, but I'm over the attitude. BYOB and great food. Enough for me.

Reviews.Author: Sharon W.
Reviews.Content: Last night was my 4th visit to Tango Sur and it was even more impressive than the first 3 visits. Yes, there is a long wait (about 1hr) - even for a Wednesday evening - but it was well worth it. The bread was fresh, of which I definitely ate too much of. The salad was delicious. The Vacio steak my friend and I ordered was splendid! It cost about $35 and is usually for two, but I think could feed more. You honestly can't go wrong with this dish. It comes with this great garlicy, salty sauce. Yum! The service was average for a busy place. Just go expecting to wait and you'll have a great dinner. (It's also BYOB...)

Reviews.Author: jenise r.
Reviews.Content: give me meat and potatoes and i'm happy!both times ive gone we ordered the steak, sorry dont recall which one. but its served about 6 girls =) we also ordered the ravioli which was really good, they also have a good cheese appetizer, so greasy and cheesy! but worth it. The back waiting room is always nice to enjoy a bottle of wine while you wait.  The place gets really crowded so give yourself time or call ahead.the caramel flan is also something worth trying.=) its byob ;)

Reviews.Author: Rich K.
Reviews.Content: No reservations accepted by phone.  They have a very sophisticated system at their front door.  A guy with a pad of paper takes your name and number and promises to call you in 2 hours when your table is ready.  Not sure where he expected us to wait.

Reviews.Author: Nycole H.
Reviews.Content: YUM! I took my friend here for his birthday and I was prepared to wait a little after we did put in our reservation "walk up". I wish you could make a less then 6 person reservation over the phone. But it's ok we put our names in and went over to Toons down the street. We ended up waiting 2 hours and some change. FINALLY when we got seated we had our own little cozy table. Our waiter came over right away and he gave us a few suggestions to try. We started with chicken empanadas...YUM, they were excellent. I'd go back just for those!! We then asked our waiter for his suggestions and he told us Vacio steak would be good for us to share so we went with that. It was HUGE. I couldn't even eat a third of it, my friend polished off the rest. It was delicious and so tender and juicy...we had it done medium!They have excellent pesto sauce there...we were putting it on EVERYTHING haha...even our bread. It was just so sweet with a little kick! I will definitely come back...hopefully with a group of 6 so we can make reservations but if not the wait is worth it!!Oh and I almost forgot to mention it's SO INEXPENSIVE! I couldn't believe that for two people we had appetizers and a huge dinner it was only around $50. BYOB is so key because you save on liquor costs which would have doubled it!!

Reviews.Author: Mary V.
Reviews.Content: Haven't been back for a while, but several dinners here over the past few years have convinced me that perhaps the only place outside West Texas to get a fabulous, dreamy steak is Tango Sur (or Argentina if you have the budget). I deduct one star (though I really shouldn't) because every single time I go here, early or late evening, weeknight or weekend, there is at least an hour wait. Sometimes an hour and a half. Of course we wait - who wouldn't? But sometimes it's painful - we just want that spectacular steak! Other pluses, though, are the ambience: it's tiny, dim, and crowded, yet you can still hear everyone at your table ... and the fact that it's BYOB. So while you may be shelling out thirty or more for your DIVINE plate of cow, you can still rock the Two Buck Chuck and pat yourself on the back for escaping another overdraft fee. Excellent for small celebrations, and whenever you are feeling flush.

Reviews.Author: Verna L.
Reviews.Content: I haven't been here in years, but I do want to pay tribute. It's a really good deal. Great prices for quality meat, meat, and more tasty meat. I don't drink, but my friends like BYOB. Dimly lit place, very cute and cozy, definitely a great place to bring visiting friends or a date!

Reviews.Author: Ankan S.
Reviews.Content: Horrible place horrible service and looks like genuine attempt to screw up some good steak.

Reviews.Author: Melissa G.
Reviews.Content: The food is delcious, the alcohol is great (because it's BYOB - all your favorites at the right price!) and the atmosphere is fun.  There is often a wait, (no reservations) but they take your phone number so you can explore the Southport Corridor as you wait.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer G.
Reviews.Content: The prices are so reasonable, how can you complain.    I could have lived without the blood sausage but the meat was great and the empanadas were delicious.     We even loved the plain jane salad.   It just seemed to go with the meal.     2 adults, 2 kids, a bottle of wine, a grill for 2 and 2 appetizers - $64.00.    We all left full and one of us left quite tipsy (ok, that was me).

Reviews.Author: Megan H.
Reviews.Content: LOVE THIS PLACE!! THe steak is sooo yummy and the portion is huge!! I always have enough left over for breakfast the next day, lol.  I say breakfast because I love it so much I can't wait until lunch or dinner to eat my leftovers.  The sides are also very good, and the portions are generous (to say the least).  Definitely recommend this place!! Oh, and BYOB - you can't beat a steak meal for $25/pp including your own bottle of wine!

Reviews.Author: Justin W.
Reviews.Content: It took me a year of living down the street from here before I finally made it inside.  I am ashamed of myself, it's like having a Ferrari in your garage and driving a Yugo instead. The food is fantastic, the staff is amazing, and the setting is great, cramped but great.   Everything positive everyone else has said I concur with, a true gem in the city.

Reviews.Author: Haleh H.
Reviews.Content: Very great tasty steak. Very nice, polite waitersa. The doorman who gets your name is rude, but if you ignore it, the food is worth it.

Reviews.Author: Jennie M.
Reviews.Content: um...this may be my new favorite restaurant. I went here for dinner last night and now that my meat coma has ended, I can finally write a review for it. I went for a friend's birthday party here and we had a reservation, but were told the table wasn't quite ready yet. No problem, they have a waiting room of sorts with tables and benches where we sat and broke into our wine. Good thing we had all brought a bottle because we ended up getting sat an hour after our reservation time. Normally we would have been pissed and stormed out, but since we had a place to sit and chat and drink, we were more than fine. And the hostess was very nice about it, plus they sent over 2 appetizers on the house for our party of ten when we did get seated. We ended up ordering the exact same appetizers so that there was enough for everyone as well. We got the cheese which was pretty good (it's just melted cheese, people, but I do love it) and the eggplant dish which was super delicious. One of our diners HATES eggplant and didn't even know that she was eating it, plus complimented how great it tasted. We also got the empandas which were fabulous as well. Then, onto the entrees. Everyone seemed really pleased with their dishes (this may be biased due to the hour of drinking beforehand, but who cares). I ordered the steak that was stuffed with garlic and other herbs and had sweet potatoes. Thank God I decided to split it with someone as suggested. The thing was HUGE. And tasty.  The girls next to me split the other 'ideal for two' plate, and there's just looked like a giant piece of meat, but was no less tasty. Finally we ordered desserts to share: flan, german chocolate cake, and something else (i'm not sure as it was so good it never made it around to me before being devoured). It was an amazing meal and when our bill came I was shocked: 10 people ate and 9 paid (not the bday girl of course) and our total was 32 bucks including tax and tip. THIRTY-TWO BUCKS! And almost everyone had huge portions as leftovers, except maybe the girls who ordered the talapia. It was amazing.Now, there are a few things that I have to share just so that no one is surprised by them: yes, it is very dark (I had trouble reading the menu but again it could have been all that wine before food), yes, it is VERY noisy (I could barely talk to anyone other than the people directly next to me), and yes, it gets very crowded (one of our party noticed a sign that said it was voted 'most romantic restaurant' one year and it caused us all to scratch our heads), but the service and food is so good, that it more than outweighs these. And yes, the salads were pathetic (we referred to them as 'hamburger toppings' because that is EXACTLY what it looked like ), but if you are going here for their salad, you're just an idiot.

Reviews.Author: David G.
Reviews.Content: I came here last weekend for a bachelor party. WOW. I actually gave this place six stars but had to take one off because of the long wait and slow service. But when the food finally arrived it was great, portions, price, perfect. However the best part was the BYOW. That's right, bring your own whatever. We brought a mini key, a handle of vodka and a fifth of wine. The vibe was alive all night and would recommend this place to anyone traveling or living in this city.

Reviews.Author: Zhiyou D.
Reviews.Content: I went here with my gf and other friends for dinner on May 11th. We had BIFE VESUVIO and EL FILET. The food was great but the waiting time is a little bit long(2 hrs?) if you don't have much to talk about. Oh, I have to say the candle-lit environment was really awesome and made it so cozy! Had a very great time!

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M.
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to eat here based on reviews and recommendations from friends.  I have been here twice, and neither experience lived up to the positive reviews of this place.First of all, the food was average.  For being a steakhouse, I expected a really good steak.  What I got was a tough, fatty piece of meat.  Also, there was a VERY long wait (even with reservations).  It is also very loud in this restaurant.  I went back a second time for a friend's birthday dinner, and it was basically the same experience only with an even longer wait.  We had 9pm reservations, were not seated until 9:45 and did not get our entrees until 11pm.  To sum up, the food is okay, service is not good, it's BYOB, which is a plus, but I will not be back.

Reviews.Author: Jamie Q.
Reviews.Content: Omg amazing! Went with a party of 20 and the service and food were great. Highly recommend the filet. The only reason I'm deducting a star is because the hostess was a little rude. They were busy but  when I asked where to wait he had a lot of tude

Reviews.Author: Jennifer D.
Reviews.Content: best deal in the city $20 bucks for two 12oz filet steaks and it's BYOB!! It's a great date place.  The only problem is there is always a wait and they don't take reservations.  They will call you when your table is ready if you ask and you can go to the bar across the street.  It's really yummy you should try it:)

Reviews.Author: Linda E.
Reviews.Content: I went to Tango Sur last night to have dinner with my friend.  The food was FABULOUS!  You cannot beat the price!!!  We shared the eggplant appetizer (it was like eggplant parmesan).  It was delicious.  It was not as hot as I like my food upon delivery to the table but it was still delish!  I also had a chicken empanada.  The empanada was piping hot (I guess to make up for the room temperature eggplant).  The emapnada was tiny but it was quite good.  For an entree I had the Pez (Salmon in a cream sauce) and my friend had the El Filet.  We were both quite pleased with our dishes. So in summary, the food was full of flavor and the price was beyond right!  The place was packed and a little dark to be having dinner with a friend but I'd definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Author: Roy S.
Reviews.Content: So we finally made it to Tango Sur this past Saturday. What can I say? This little gem is located in a great neighborhood and it is an amazing place! It was very crowded and now I understand why you definitely have to have reservations. I was a little nervous about the service since I came across a few reviews that were very negative but the service was superb. It is BYOB with NO corking fees so this contributed to an even better experience than I expected. As for the quality of the food, my friend ordered this appetizer that I fell in love with. It was some sort of queso fundido which was creamy, gooey, and bad on so many levels but oh so good. The warm bread and butter they served at first wasn't far behind the quality of the queso. For dinner I ordered a filet mignon which was complimented by some rather large potatoes that resembled steak fries and to my surprise, there were TWO medallions of steak on the plate. Needless to say I had to take one home. On another note, at times it got a little noisy but this was mainly due to the tacky singing of the birthday celebration behind us. For a second I thought I was at the Olive Garden. Also, bring a flash light with you so that you can see the menu because it is a romantically dark atmosphere and only a few candles shed light. Finally, there was only one restroom for the entire establishment and there was always a line formed outside. I apologize in advance to all the ladies because some guys have horrible aim and they don't clean up after themselves.All in all, it was a good experience and although I would return I can't see myself running back anytime soon. One other thing, they don't have a website so do your research.

Reviews.Author: Angela G.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is definitely the place to go to hangout with friends and enjoy good food. The most important part its a BYOB so you don't have to be afraid of drink prices. The staff is friendly and attentive, a big surprise considering it was Wednesday and packed.  Your bound to have a great time!

Reviews.Author: Steven D.
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere, great food, BYOB. Call ahead (2 wks) for a weekend reservation.

Reviews.Author: Virgie B.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur has become one of my favorite restaurants in the city. I went there recently and the waitstaff was very nice. It was not crowded, which was a nice because the area is not that. The steak I had was a good size and very reasonably priced. It came with potatoes that were cooked just right. Try the empanadas!

Reviews.Author: Stacy S.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! BYOB! Huge portions! Great food! I will definitely be back soon. Loved the mashed potatoes.

Reviews.Author: Rachel B.
Reviews.Content: Definitely a great Argentine restaurant.  It is BYOB, but they do not have a corkage fee and they will chill your wine if needed.  It can get really crowded and they do not take reservations (at least not that I have heard of), however the hostess can take your cell phone number and will call you when the table is ready.  While we waited for our table we just went to a local bar until we got the call.  The steaks are very good and you must try the empanadas.  Tango Sur is pretty reasonably priced and definitely worth it!

Reviews.Author: Jackie M.
Reviews.Content: Reasonable price (great for Bday celebration) and BYOB is awesome. The dark lit restaurant and the usually overdone meat is blah. It's soo dim inside, that sometimes i really wonder what the heck I'm eating. NO kidding. But the flavor is good, just the chef needs to work the meat (usually overdone when i order medium rare)

Reviews.Author: Me M.
Reviews.Content: Okay, first I will say there generally will be a wait, but it's worth it! Put your reservation in and go down the street to a local watering hole or stroll southport. Southport is a great street to shop and sightsee for an early evening. Skip all the tourist spots downtown and hop in a cab to Tango Sur! I'll be jealous, I miss it!

Reviews.Author: Christina M.
Reviews.Content: GREAT DATE PLACE!!!! BYOB....you can't beat it! This place has HUGE portions delicious food and so intimate! I recommend it! I had dinner and lunch the next day!

Reviews.Author: Libby T.
Reviews.Content: byob delicious argentinian food.  a great date spot.  a little loud and crowded for anything but.

Reviews.Author: Hovik N.
Reviews.Content: I have easily payed 2-3 times more for food that does not compare with Tango Sur plus BYOB?!?!?!.....I don't know how they do it but please keep at it.

Reviews.Author: Guillermo M.
Reviews.Content: Excellent entrees and appetizers. I ordered the empanadas and the steaks and the two times I have been there I was not disappointed, I would love to go back again.

Reviews.Author: Ermelinda C.
Reviews.Content: Delicious food and lots of it, friendly and efficient service! One of the best BYOB I have been to in Chicago.

Reviews.Author: James L.
Reviews.Content: Been here a number of times and never seems to fail me.  The wait can be over an hour depending on when you go.  BYOB is a plus and the amount of food you get is great for the price.  If you're a meat lover this is the place for you.  The fish and chicken dishes are pretty tasty as well.

Reviews.Author: Nadia S.
Reviews.Content: The wait was pretty freakin long.. 2.5 hours but wow.. was it worth it.. the place is pretty small and verrry popular apparently so i can understand the wait... the guys taking ur name for the waiting list reminded me of bouncers lol.. its a shame they dont take reservations.  i think i got the filet mignon.. it was amazing. cooked PERFECTLY... def a pretty damn authentic argentinian place.. i used to live in naperville and i could never even compare this to Tango (their meat kinda sucked).  anyways, def wanna go back.. its just that long wait thats kinda annoying... esp when the surrounding stores have already closed!

Reviews.Author: Emily M.
Reviews.Content: A+++.  Quality steak  for a great price with leftovers to take home!  I love this little byob, and have made many trips back!

Reviews.Author: Boon K.
Reviews.Content: Steak lover heaven. Yes, the wait is just crazy here but once in a blue moon it is worth it.  You must come hungry which you are because you wait but at least it is BYOB.  Your meals comes with a light salad and some tasty hot bread.  The empanadas are pretty good. We usually order Vacio but sometimes we get the Lomo. The portion is costco size so I must warn you that it said for two but really it can feed 4.  The Flan is probably my favorite here.

Reviews.Author: Dax R.
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for groups.  I usually come here with a group of 12 or more.  We order 3 of the parillada para dos -shared grills, 2 orders of Vacio, and an assortment of empanadas.. We also bring about 8 bottles of wine.  it is great that they take reservations for large groups.

Reviews.Author: Selena L.
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of my favorite restaurants in the city. Great food and HUGE portions! You really can't go wrong with anything you order. If you're looking for a quiet night out with your lover, don't go here. It's SUPER DUPER loud and chances are you'll be sitting on top of someone at the table next to you. They only take reservations for tables of six or more. Expect long wait times if you are going during peak hours and don't have the required number of people to make a reservation. I mean VERY long wait times. Still worth the noise and wait though!

Reviews.Author: Nichole F.
Reviews.Content: I have been here three times and I always want to come back!  Last night, we went to celebrate my husband's birthday with his family.  We had a party of 6 so luckily we could make a reservation.   They only take reservations for big parties.  We sat outside because it was perfect out.   Our waiter was very friendly.   We had emphanadas to start with.  We tried the beef and spinach and cheese.  Both delicious!   Next, everyone had salad.  The salad was very bare bones but still good.   I had a bone in ribeye with mashed potatoes.    Yum, yum, yum!   Everything was cooked perfectly and was delicious.  Perfect place for groups or date night.   The waiters are nice eye candy.  A couple of cons are 1. The wait for smaller parties, 2. One bathroom, 3. Very dark and loud inside.

Reviews.Author: Lori Taylor R.
Reviews.Content: Su-Su-Sussodium!  If high-blood pressure is what your shopping for well look no further.  If the insanely long wait times don't elevate your blood pressure, then the exorbitant amounts of sodium will surely do the trick.  I don't mind to wait for delicious food especially when the spot is byob.  But please don't tell me an hour and fifteen when it really ends up being two hours - give me the longer wait time and surprise me when the table is ready early.  The four of us were seated at a great table outside, the service was very attentive and I thought, we are on our way to an amazing meal.  Wrong.  I ordered one of the specials Bife Vesuvio it sounded like a delicious combination of prime steak stuffed with spinach and cheese in a white wine sauce. (Being from the south I grew up on country ham, so needless to say, I love me some salt!)  This dish was the saltiest meal I've ever tasted.  I managed to choke down about four bites of it and couldn't go any further.  My husband and a friend shared one of the meals for two served on a table top grill.  The meat should have never left the kitchen.  There was so much fat and gristle they couldn't even cut through it.  The waiter was apologetic and corrected the problem by serving them a different meal.  The fillets served second time around were cooked to perfection and were much better cuts of meat (that's what earned the restaurant the third star).  All in all I doubt we will ever venture back to Tango Sur.  If two meals out of the three ordered needed to be sent back then that's not saying a lot for the kitchen and I think this is a spot we can live without.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly C.
Reviews.Content: Love, love love!This BYOB restaurant was one of my favorites when I lived in Chicago.    The food is a-maz-ing and priced extremely well.I recommend the Vacio, which is a large cut of meat that comes out on a platter designed to serve two.  The meat was beautifully seasoned and cooked just right.  The Vacio comes complete with mashed potatoes and 2 simple salads all for $35!  The empanadas are some of the best I have ever had, and are only $1.75 each!  I'm not sure what the garlic sauce served on the side is (maybe some sort of chimichurri?) but it was wonderful!  I wish I could buy a bottle of it to take home.  The two things keeping Tango Sur from 5 stars is #1, they don't take reservations for smaller tables and #2, the restaurant is small and the seating is very close together.  My boyfriend is a taller man with broad shoulders, and the poor guy kept getting bumped by each server and diner  that passed by our table.

Reviews.Author: Audra S.
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably great steaks!  To begin with, the bread was soft.  I'm not a big bread person, but pairing their delicious bread with their provolone appetizer made for an excellent starter.  My filet in red onion wine was cooked perfectly rare, the prime steak stuffed with provolone & spinach my friend had was tender and excellent.  We were both extremely happy with our food.  The spinach & garlic mashed potatoes were different, but surprisingly tasty.  A nice patio outside seats about 25, the indoor area accomodates about 25 as well.  BYOB, so bring your favorite bottle of wine, beer or liquor and enjoy the evening.

Reviews.Author: Joshua M.
Reviews.Content: El Filet is up to $24.  Better start campaigning for a meat bailout.  This was my third time at Tango Sur, and it's been a steady contender for me personally.  As I've mentioned previously my dish the El Filet (TWO filet mignon steaks) is never the absolute best cut of meat.  But it's 4 star lean, and tasty.  I really don't go there for anything else.  This last visit everyone else had something different, but I really don't remember much about it because I was so fixated on the meat.  The service is always so-so... even on a Thursday night (we were the very first ones there) the food took forever to come out.  But for as much as Chicago would seem like a badass steak town, I have yet to really experience anything phenomenal. Tango Sur is still a solid contender in my book.

Reviews.Author: Sylvia W.
Reviews.Content: Tango is an awesome BYOB spot in the very popular Wrigleyville area. The food is awesome. The steaks are huge and the provoleta is amazing. The waiters are hotties...so it is a great place for a girl's night out as well as a cozy place for a date. Make sure you get the flan or the delish Argentine cake. Right next door there is also a South American grocery store.

Reviews.Author: Victoria h.
Reviews.Content: The first time I was there, I was wowed. It was romantic, the portions were great, the food was good. The second time I went, it was entirely different. When my name was called, and the entire party was 2 minutes away - they wouldn't seat us. We had to wait another hour just to be seated. It was incredibly loud, the steaks were very rubbery, and the service was slow. I've never been there on weekdays, so it might be better. I highly recommend not going there on Friday or Saturday nights.

Reviews.Author: Monique O.
Reviews.Content: It was okay... nothing to write home about but the empinadas were delish.

Reviews.Author: Christina K.
Reviews.Content: Sure, it's BYO, but places that understand that "medium rare" still involves some blood on the plate are so hard to find. Try their two-person steak dishes with someone you're not afraid to go all pride of lions with over dinner, and you won't regret it. Service is invariably friendly and attentive, even though this place fills up fast, and stays that way any and every given evening.

Reviews.Author: Kristine L.
Reviews.Content: I've been hearing about tango sur since I moved to chicago and I finally made it there this summer for a birthday! It was deeeelicious! The atmosphere is such that it is perfect for a date or dinner with friends. I love that it is BYOB because then you have no problem splurging on delicious meats! We were able to make a reservation and everything was perfect when we got there and we all enjoyed a fantastic meal together!

Reviews.Author: Donna J.
Reviews.Content: love this place. meat fest! i will start with all the positives:-BYOB(!) and no corkage fee-cheap, good quality steaks-provolone appetizer-romantical atmosphere-will take reservations for large parties-down the street from my house-enormous portionsnegatives:-disappointing empanadas-no reservations for small parties, specifically date night-non existent waiting area-having to order your meat "doneness" appropriately (usually i like medium rare, but here i need at least medium)for large quantities of meat, this is better than the brazilian steak joints and at half the price.  i never feel like i eat my money's worth when i hit up the churrascarias.  will continue coming here as long as it's open.

Reviews.Author: Dusty K.
Reviews.Content: Small, cozy place that is BYOB.  Fortunately you can purchsase wine/beer nearby if you were not aware of this.  Great service and great food too.  I loved the empanadas.  I mean loved them.  I couldn't get enough

Reviews.Author: Jillian D.
Reviews.Content: if  i were a business owner, i would check out vacancies near this restaurant, lease one and set up a fantabulous waiting room/bar/liquor store/lounge. i would partner with tango sur, and have them send their hungry, waiting clients my way. they could have  a seat, have some drinks, maybe even some nibbles while waiting in an inviting atmosphere ( instead of milling about on the sidewalk, right in front of the outdoor diners, drooling on their food, and trying desperately to buy the host's favor.) and ts would call me when tables opened up, and i would let people know that it was time to return to ts to dine.that was the thought that crept into my mind as i milled about on the sidewalk, having been promised we were net, when in fact by next the host meant 30 minutes from now.ha ha.it was worth the wait of course - the romantic atmosphere, tasty eats and slow pace of the meal made up for the wait. we left stuffed and with carry out containers!the only sad thing to the wait was the lack of tilapia at the end of that rainbow. (i don't eat beef. i know, i know.) so i ate the eggplant dish instead. delicious! maybe next time i will get there earlier? only to wait, of course :)

Reviews.Author: John B.
Reviews.Content: C and I went on a date to Tango Sur last night.  Actually, we ate a late lunch/early dinner there about a month ago.  C had the Berenjenas and I had the chicken with lemon.  Both really good; we ate outside, which was perfect; it was BYOB and there is a handy store about a half block south; and, the service was very good.  Four stars for that experience.Back to last night:  Our friends had brought us a bottle of 2006 Norton Malbec D.O.C from Buenos Aires recently and we were saving it for a dinner at Tango Sur.  It's a favorite when we're in BA, which is often. We arrived at about 7:30 pm and were immediately seated (a Wednesday night) at one of the last two tables that were open. Tall lit candles established a romantic atmosphere, but the main room (i.e. where you enter) was quite noisy.  Fortunately, the second, larger room was a bit quieter, but the sound level was still quite high. The sounds of merriment.  The decor and atmosphere is very convincingly equivalent to restaurants in Buenos Aires.  Once I tasted the Malbec, I was transported 5,000 miles to Buenos Aires, where restaurants like this are ubiquitous.  Of course, the prices printed on the menus there are almost the same, but they are in Argentine pesos, so the cost is at least third less (i.e. $1 USD = $3.7 pesos).In addition to being seating immediately, our waiter was at our table almost instantly with bread and butter and to open our wine.  We were impressed.  The place is crawling with wait staff.  Okay, let's get to assigning STARS:Ambiance:  As I said earlier, visually, the ambiance is totally Buenos Aires.  Whoever put this place together is a Porteño or has spent some serious time in BA. Although I give Tango Sur a point for ambiance, there were a couple of disappointments. First, the music could barely be heard over the ambient crowd noise.  The only thing we could hear, seated by the window, was the bass line, which is annoying.  Lousy speakers and not enough of them; what else can I say. However, the music was good and what we hear in Buenos Aires. I almost want to give them a point for that!  Second, the bread is served with little plastic packets of butter, rather than actual pats of butter. That's simply inelegant, for a restaurant of this caliber. Too bad. Third, and this is unfortunate, when they cleared the appetizer plates, they took the knife (good), but left my dirty fork (bad).  It was deposited exactly were I would naturally lean with my elbow.  A fresh fork is in order.Food:  The beef empanadas were good.  The papas espanola so-so. For an entree we shared the Lomo Relleno, which is a "half slab argentine filet sliced and filled with a chimichurri, ham sauce then cooked and served on a grill with portabella marsala."  ($36, serves 2).  The piece of meat was enormous; enough, in my opinion, for four, or there is no ordering desert. The gravy was simply divine. I mean absolutely divine.  The lomo (i.e. beef tenderloin), shockingly, was awful; the worst piece of beef tenderloin I have ever had in my life. C was in complete agreement.  It was stringy like you can't believe.  I literally could not chew 50% of what I put in my mouth.  When the waiter stopped to ask how we were enjoying our beef, we told him the truth. He looked stunned. We described the problem, which he could see as I was struggling to cut the meat with a steak knife.  He immediately said, "one moment," and fled.  The manager returned and offered to order something else.  We appreciated the gesture, but declined, because we had had enough meat for the evening anyway.  He and the waiter were both very apologetic.  Clearly, this was not the norm.  We simply got a bum piece; it happens.  I don't know what the couple at the next table was having (it also looked large), but they were enjoying it!  Based on our first experience, I give Tango Sur a star for food.  I am sure that the lomo experience was an anomaly.  (note:  the menu states "argentine fillet." however, the manager conceded that it is not technically Argentine.  That they get beef from Canada and Australia.  Minor point."Service:  I have seen other posts complaining about the service. There are lapses at all restaurants, but our two experiences here were positive.  The waiters were friendly, courteous and helpful. Certainly deserving a full point.  BTW, at the conclusion of our meal last night, the check arrived with a deep discount, which was very much appreciated.  BYOB:  another point!In summary, we'll be back for another try.

Reviews.Author: Joel S.
Reviews.Content: Everyone has pretty much covered most everything about this place, but I can't emphasize enough how awesome it is to get the bill here.  Having just enjoyed a super nice bottle of wine (that we brought ourselves, BYO obv) and enjoyed all the steak you can possibly eat, leaving for around $50 just makes you feel awesome.Oh yeah, delicious food and great ambiance too.  But the bill... great for cheapskates like me.

Reviews.Author: Stefanie W.
Reviews.Content: Was here for my birthday and finally saved a wee bit of room for dessert - caramel flan - OMG.  Heaven in my mouth!  Staff was great with our party of 8 - our reservations were delayed slightly but they were very apologetic and set us up as soon as they could.  Meat coma lasted 2 days thanks to the leftovers.  Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Author: Angelica E.
Reviews.Content: Ummm can you say great place for a girls night out!  Yes this place is a great girls night spot!  The food was amazing, its BYOB, and all cute male servers.  Coming back very soon :)

Reviews.Author: a w.
Reviews.Content: Great SouthAmerican restraunt.  It's an outdoor experience, only open for dinner.  They have some great food.  The portions are really big and the food is delicious and filling.  It's a BYOB place so bring with you whatever you enjoy to drink!

Reviews.Author: Ren H.
Reviews.Content: I love this restaurant.. not only can you stuff your face until you're tired but you can also bring your own alcohol!  its perfect since the food can get a little pricey .. at least you save on drinks!  The only downside to this place is that even with a reservation you may be looking at a wait of an hour or more.. not good

Reviews.Author: Madeline L.
Reviews.Content: Wow what a great restaurant!  They had the best steaks and I left feeling so full because my filet came with two big pieces of steak on the plate.  It was so good and I was impressed with the appetizers as well.  And it's BYOB which I love, so we got to bring my favorite bottle of wine to enjoy.  The food is delicious and it'd be a great place for a date.

Reviews.Author: Paul L.
Reviews.Content: Hands down one of the best restaurants in Chicago.

Reviews.Author: Julia K.
Reviews.Content: Yea, its really annoying that they don't take reservations and sometimes the wait is several hours.  This can easily be avoided by coming on a weekday or getting a group of 8 or more.  I never liked steaks until I had one at this restaurant!  Even my vegetarian friends like this place for the atmosphere (they usually get empanadas and an appetizer).  Don't forget  to bring wine.  I suggest Malbec, an Argentinian wine to go with Argentinian steak.

Reviews.Author: Esther Y.
Reviews.Content: IT's hard for me to like a place that just is sooo crazy! I mean the no reservations makes it difficult to plan, but not only that, I just feel like it is way too busy.  The food here is decent, the service is good, the desserts blow.

Reviews.Author: Allie S.
Reviews.Content: Went here on a Monday evening with my husband and another couple. The place is so cute -- quiet, cozy, candlelit, and much smaller than I thought it would be. It's BYOB which really cuts down the cost, and so our friends brought some red wine. We had a great appetizer plate -- the antipasto, and everyone seemed happy with their entrees. It's really high end food at a very affordable place. Great for a date night! The *only* reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that the menu is really "heavy" and I tend to be a lighter eater. I think they're really known for their red meat options -- and I'm just not a red meat eater. But I would go back anyway, and bring out of town guests for sure!

Reviews.Author: James V.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur has everything you want.  They have a variety of delicious cuts of steak, it's cheap, BYOB, romantic, and well serviced.  Try it out and I can almost guarantee you'll be back.  You can't miss!

Reviews.Author: Vanessa G.
Reviews.Content: They must be doing something right here...hard to get in even on a Sunday night?? Hmm...this was the choice restaurant for a girl we were celebrating her first marathon ran and she deserved to eat what she wanted. This was the place. BYOB, OK score a few points for that! We didn't have to wait too long passed our "reservation" before we were finally sat. The waiter promptly opened our wine and took our orders and pretty much disappeared. After some long amount of time passed and us all apologizing for the stomach rumbles that were erupting under the tables, we finally got our empandada appetizers. I had a beef one and it was ok, a bit dry. We woofed them down in sheer hunger. Finally, oh finally, the meat I have heard about all night arrives and I was a bit scared at how big the portion was. Was this Medieval Times? It read "serves 2" and I swear it should have served a family of 5. It was known as Lomo Relleno...a half slab of Argentine meat covered in this amazing chimichurri sauce that I hope to find the recipe for, and a mushroom marsala type of sauce. It was delicious and my mouth was watering. There was so much of it that I had left overs for 2 more meals. Extremely reasonably priced too! After this we were so full there was no such room for dessert, sigh. Worth the wait...hmmm...maybe if I didn't arrive so hungry.

Reviews.Author: Mindy W.
Reviews.Content: I AM OFFICIALLY A FAN OF TANGO SUR!  Meat lovers, here is your destined haven.  I love steak, and for those avid steak worshipers, best believe that good steak that is cooked to perfection is hard to come across. Here at Tango Sur, they marinade their steak just the right amount of flavor--not too bland and not toooverwhelming.  I asked for the steak to be cooked medium-rare, and if I went to most of other places, that would have meant medium-well done which angers the living soul in me. Not here! They did as I said, and my $36 steak that they recommended splitting with my boyfriend was just the perfect size for two people with huge appetites.  The small portion of pesto sauce most definitely completed the taste. For appetizers, I was not disappointed one bit;  the empanadas surely exceeded my expectations. I've only had the chance to try the beef ones, but so far so good. Dessert was delightful. Don't contemplate about it. You'll regret not getting it.Two people for an enjoyable, romantic, delicious, satisfying, fulfilling meal = $50  (Note: Excluding drinks)If you've heard nothing but good things about this place, chances are that those people know what they are talking about, so do not hesitate to check it out. I was skeptic due to the hype at first, but now I'm a firm believer. Love you, Tango Sur. Wish I could eat you every day. xoxo

Reviews.Author: Nicole S.
Reviews.Content: Loved it here. Not terribly romantic because of the close proximity of tables. But 1 entree can feed two & same thing with the apps. So go in with your fave bottle and share an app & entree. Awesome food. And a waiting room!!!!

Reviews.Author: Sonja S.
Reviews.Content: On our way to Shuba's we decided that a little something something (aka Dinner) was in order... having walked by Tango Sur a few days before (on my way to the Mercury) and seen lines down the street waiting to get in to this little spot, I was pretty sure we were not going to be dining Argentina style... But my companion was adamant that we try , so we bought a bottle of nice champagne and off we optimistically tromped. As luck would have it, we were able to walk right in. Now let me first say my friend and dinner companion, has been to Argentina several times and the restaurant interior caused a jones to go back. there.. dimly lit with candles, everyone looked fabulous - completed the Argentina romance theme along with some fabulous music. The service was competent and handsome (always a good thing in my book) our bottle of champagne was opened and poured in blink of an eye , menus dispensed, suggestions made - we were well on our way to a lovely experience. The server suggested that we split the tenderloin - we agreed. First we received a totally uninspired green salad with a tomato and a few onion slices and a vinegar and oil dressing, b. o. r. i. n.g. Then we were served up the most enormous hunk of sizzling hot beef flesh I have ever seen. It was perfectly cooked and we just had to saw off the hunks we wanted. here is my problem, bad chimichurri sauce, favor-less and oily was unable to cut through the well, "meatiness" of the hunk o meat. Worse, by this time it was so dark in our little corner of the restaurant - I couldn't tell whether I was eating a piece of mushroom or a piece of meat until it was in my mouth. Color me old lady fussy - but I found this disconcerting. Now I was thrilled with the price - which was low for the quality of meat alone. But I have to say I have concluded that a hunk of meat is not my gig... I am sure Tango Sur brings the magic for meat lovers, but not for me.

Reviews.Author: Liliana S.
Reviews.Content: Great Argentine restaurant. Intimate setting. Great food. BYOB which is great. Wait staff is very nice some are great to look at! Good steaks! I would recommend this place for a first date. The ambience is fantastic.

Reviews.Author: Sara B.
Reviews.Content: Food is FANTASTIC. The wait staff tends to be friendly and it is BYOB. I love a good steak with cheap drink.

Reviews.Author: Kara G.
Reviews.Content: After 3 tries I finally had an opportunity to eat there, and it was well worth the repeated attempts! The food is incredible, and the BYOB helps you order more of their delicious food. The place is cozy, charming, and ALWAYS packed, but it's a great place to eat and hang out with friends and enjoy some good wine. Check it out, but be prepared to wait or go early!

Reviews.Author: Barbara D.
Reviews.Content: This place gets 3 stars for serving a plate full of tongues....yeah, they  did taste like I thought a tongue would taste....the texture in itself was pretty whicked....you can see the taste buds and feel the grainy bumps. With a bottle of wine (BYOB) and the outside seating....why not french kiss your plate? (Is there anything I won't try?...geez)

Reviews.Author: Bryant C.
Reviews.Content: I stopped in for dinner this weekend. We had a big group and sat outside. It was perfect weather to sit outside and I'm glad we did because the inside was dark and noisy. The food would have been good, but the experience would not have been quite as nice inside. The waiter was extremely knowledgeable with the menu. All of the suggestions were great. I was to only person at our table that didn't get the El Filet. It is 2 full filets and the beef tastes awesome. I had the spinach and cheese stuffed steak with chimichurri sauce. This was wonderful as well. Everyone had an empanada for an appetizer and they were tasty too. It was also more food than any of us could eat. I would say overall it was a great dining experience and you can't beat the prices at this restaurant .

Reviews.Author: Gabe L.
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this place.  We called at 7 during the week and asked if there  was any wait.  They said no, and by the time we got there at 7:20 it was an hour wait.  We were able to run across the street and pick up a couple bottles of wine.  It's nice that Tengo Sur offers a waiting area with  glasses and corkscrews for BYOB.  The highlight of the meal was definitely the meat empanadas we started with.  My buddy and I split the Vacio that was simply OK.  There was a TON of food, but it wasn't all that good.  The potatoes were OK and flavors were decent.  We definitely had a lot of leftovers and the meal was reasonably priced- overall though i have to say i was unimpressed.

Reviews.Author: Erik A.
Reviews.Content: Great little restaurant. Good date spot. Candle lit rooms, good service, BYOB and glorious steak. Glooooorious. 'nuff said. Seriously, best steak I've had in Chicago so far.

Reviews.Author: Jessica M.
Reviews.Content: Went back again - 6 for dinner.  I just overall felt like they had an attitude... like the host and waiters were too good for us.  The best part of the meal was the empanadas by far!  Don't miss those.  In fact if and when I go back, that is all I may order.  Bread - not as good as it was a year ago.  Meat, pretty fatty.  Atmosphere and sharing with the table was really nice though.  I will let some time go by before going back- fo sho.

Reviews.Author: Ross R.
Reviews.Content: Me and Tango Sur have a long and storied history together...not really, I've been there 3 times.  I am happy to report that each visit seems to have been a little better than the last.I should start out by saying that I have no issue with the staff (friendly, attentive), or the atmosphere (loud, but not too loud), and I like the menu focus (meat).Our first visit to Tango Sur was with friends.  My fiancee had the eggplant parmesan, which is an an entree sized appetizer...she said it was good.  I had the bife vesuvio at the behest of one of our dining companions, and to this day I cannot understand why so many people rave about this dish.  Sure, the steak is big, but it is super fatty/grissly, and is heavily saturated with oily cheese...not my idea of fine diningThe next time back, I had the El Filet...better, but the butchery of the steak was cockeyed, and the meat was not tender at all.  At that point it was strike 2, and I didn't think we would be coming back.  Lo and behold, a few months later, the same friends want to go back, I begrudgingly agreed to a return trip.This time, my fiancee got the crap dish, and I finally found one worth coming back for.  I split the tabletop grill (para dos) with one of our guests, and it was awesome.  Blood Sausage, awesome.  Sweetbreads, way awesome. Skirt steak, awesome.  I will be returning for the Para Dos, perhaps even the Para Uno, if my adventures were to bring me here alone.P.S.  The bread is lights out delicious.  Oh, and the salad is humorous (its always funny when someone orders one on the side for $5 then realizes that they only get 2 pieces of undressed romaine lettuce, a ring of onion, and a slice of tomato).

Reviews.Author: Megan R.
Reviews.Content: Best steak in the city, hands down. We had to pre-eat before we went here, which was a great idea because we had a 2 hour wait, but it was worth it.

Reviews.Author: Larah K.
Reviews.Content: This is hands down the BEST deal for a delicious steak meal in the whole city. The filet comes with TWO huge steaks, which means that you buy two meals for the price of one (about $24 total, WOW!). Plus, it's BYOB, which just makes it that much better. And the outdoor seating over the summer is divine. The prosciutto with melon is a delicious appetizer, and so is the eggplant vegetarian entree.

Reviews.Author: Aaron N.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur was my first BYOB experience at a restaurant and from what I remember it was amazing. Oh yeah, the steak was slamming too. I definitely recommend coming to this restaurant but make sure you make reservations, because this place is PACKED. Oh yeah and bring some extra candles or a flashlight cause it's dark as night in this place. Overall, the food was great, it wasn't terribly expensive, and I got to drink a 40 while enjoying my meal. Boom

Reviews.Author: Jessica S.
Reviews.Content: I oh so badly want to give them 3.5 stars but alas, I'll settle for the higher end of the spectrum since I'm such a nice gal. The food here is absolutely amazing. Well, except for the salad which looked more like a side platter with burger fixings (big leaf lettuce, tomato slices, and onion slices). Everyone who had a meat dish (except for three boys at our table) ate less than half of what was on their plate. YOU SHOULD SHARE. SHARING IS CARING. Plus, it makes this already inexpensive dinner (woot woot BYOB no corkage fee!) even less pricey. And be sure to try the spinach/cheese empanada. The sauce they serve with it is full of garlic but it's worth-avoiding-making-out-with-a-stranger-at-the-­bar amazing. I could literally go there just to order empanadas. But be prepared for the worst, rudest, slowest service ever. And make your reservations!

Reviews.Author: Dina L.
Reviews.Content: I've been here about 4 times in the past 7 years I've lived in Chicago...it's good, moist steak at a great price, plus it's BYOB...it's always packed and they don't take reservations, so be ready to wait!

Reviews.Author: Tiff H.
Reviews.Content: I really like this place and I want to love it, but I think it's a bit too big for its britches. BYOB and decently priced cuts of meat...so you can't really go wrong here. However, the service is a bit rude and they just ask you to leave instead of giving you a polite heads up. I have no issues with leaving if I've overstayed my welcome...but please, let me finish my glass of wine before rudely kicking me out into the cold. When I made the reservations, I was told my party could have the table from 6:30-9:30...but we were booted out at 9pm. It was a 10 person party and we were asked to leave as soon as our bill was signed. Could you not give us a 15-20 minute marker? I'll be back when I'm in the area but with a smaller party and during the week, instead.

Reviews.Author: Scott T.
Reviews.Content: Went here on a Saturday  night around 9pm. The place was totally packed. We waited about 30 minutes but that could be because we had reservations for 6 but 2 didn't show so we had to go to the wait list so we may have been bumped up. Most times you can expect 1-2 hour wait.Setting- This place is very small and always packed. Tables close together. there is a small waiting room in the back were you can drink what you have with you. (BYOB) No corkage fee. They will bring you buckets to chill your wine or beer. It is bustling and loud and cramped.Food- Vegetarians and Fish eaters need not apply. While there are a few items on the menu most of it is Meat. The Empanadas were awesome and each entree comes with a basic salad. We all had something different and it was all out of this world! The EL FILET might have been the best Filet I have ever had. 2 9oz Filets in a wine sauce (YES 2!) for $25..are you kidding?! Awesome. Others had the Flap meat (which was served on a table grill and was ginormous! Serves 2) Salmon and Ribeye (which looked like Fred Flinstone was carrying it) The portion sizes could feed 2 sometimes 3 people and the prices were reasonable for the amount of food you get. Also, everything was cooked to perfection.Drinks- BYOB. No corkage fee and the wait staff was more than happy to bring buckets to chill the wine and beer.Waitstaff- This place is super cramped and always busy so you can expect some problems. However we did not have any problems  whatsoever. They were attentive, the food came out in a reasonable time frame and we did not feel rushed at all. Could be it was after 9 but the place was still packed. Bottom line - Its going to be busy and crowded and you may wait a really long time. So bring some drinks get some friends together and expect to have some of the best Steaks and Argentinian food you have ever had. Run don't walk to Tango Sur!!!

Reviews.Author: Christa R.
Reviews.Content: Really cute. Dimly lit, great food, very reasonably priced. My husband's rib eye was pretty fatty but my beef vesuvio was delicious. Like everyone else said, it does get loud so I probably couldn't make it a first date locale. We tried all of the empenadas and they were all lovely. We had this chocolate caramel layer cake thingy and it was pretty amazing. The quarters are pretty tight, they pack'em in there. Try going on an weeknight and earlier is better than later. Plenty of parking. Don't go without a ressie.

Reviews.Author: Liz P.
Reviews.Content: Far and away one of the best meals I've ever had. The atmosphere: so intimate and cozy, I love the candle-only lighting. Beautiful decor. The service: all of the waiters are VERY attractive Latino men. Our server was super helpful and always seemed to pop up just when we needed him. The food: OUTSTANDING. The empanada appetizers were seasoned perfectly and weren't too big. I loved how simple the salad was, just oil and vinegar, as a palate cleanser. And the bone-in rib eye was the best piece of meat I've ever had in my life. Luckily we had reservations a week in advance but I would be so willing to wait an hour for a meal here. You have to try it.

Reviews.Author: Tricia R.
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I have really high standards for beef/steak, and I'm talking really high.  So to me, the steak at Tango Sur is far from the best I've had.  But the prices are pretty much amazing, and the portions are ridiculously huge.  Even better, it's BYOB with NO corkage fee.  Great place for a date or celebration on a budget.  If you want great quality steak, then pay the price at a better steakhouse, but if all you want is some beef and lots of it at a cheap price, then come to Tango Sur.

Reviews.Author: Daniel C.
Reviews.Content: Being a steak fanatic,  I have to say, this is one of the best places to get Steak in Chicago.  The prices are REASONABLE for the amount of meat one gets.  I would highly recommend taking any Texans here.    I've never had such delicious steak since I was in venezuela as a pup.   This place seriously went to one of my top 5 best places in chicago.  I pretty much bring anyone that comes to visit to this place, as its one of the finest places to eat.  Its quite dark and romantic, (seeing their italian is embedded in argentinian culture)  The place is always packed, and you should expect to wait even if you did make a reservation.   The plate for two really will stuff 2 people to death.  This is highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: Anna Y.
Reviews.Content: Oh tango sur I wanted to love you I really did but I was very disappointed. First the service is horrible, we had wait 20 minutes just to see our waiter and second I clearly had a bug in my food some sort of roach looking creature and when I tried to talk to the manager who may have been the rudest man known to earth he could care less and told me that they are clearly popular enough without our business

Reviews.Author: P S.
Reviews.Content: Twelve years later still delivers. The grills are awesome. Sweetbread, blood sausage, ribs..wonderful. Bring your own wine and have it uncorked for no charge. Flan is a must.

Reviews.Author: Sara S.
Reviews.Content: For food, ambiance and price you can't beat it.   El filet is a must get if you're thinking about getting steak. 2 huge portions of filet with spinach mashed potatoes. Provaleta and empanadas are awesome appetizers- Highly recommend. In the summer the patio is awesome but when it's cold the inside is nice and cozy.

Reviews.Author: Gary M.
Reviews.Content: Came to Tango Sur on a Friday night at about 7.45pm despite the fact that the place is notorious for wait times and doesn't take reservations. Got to the door, the host said the wait time would be about 30 mins for inside, longer for outside. Not too bad at all as you should do a couple of things while you wait 1) Go to the wine store down the street (a few mins) and pick out a decent bottle of Malbec to drink as the restaurant is BYOB (will come back to that later) and 2) kill the rest of the time sitting at any number of bars down the street.After picking out a wine and sitting down at the bar, I got a phone call as they had had some sort of cancellation and we only ended waiting 15 miutes for a table for two.The food is just volumous. We orded a steak for two that came with portabella mushrooms and the thing was no less than 2 lbs. It was $40. Tip and tax meant $50 for a pretty decent meal. Have I had better cuts of steak? Yes. Have I had better value steak? Probably only in Argentina itself.

Reviews.Author: Chi Girl L.
Reviews.Content: First time I went... I loved it!! 2nd time the meat was almost raw not medium and they didnt get it right when I sent it back. Due to my first experience here I still give it 4 stars. Next time ill mention they need to make sure they cook the meat medium and explain my last experience. Ill be back  . The service is still fantastic and I love the byob

Reviews.Author: Alison R.
Reviews.Content: Some of the best food in Chicago for the best deal.  Much better than Morton's.

Reviews.Author: Bridget L.
Reviews.Content: Very tasty meat dishes here, and decent pricing too.  (Latin people can really bang out some quality protein!)  The place is small, though, so expect to wait.  But hey, where's there's good eats, there's a crowd!

Reviews.Author: Kari H.
Reviews.Content: There's not much that can be said about this place that hasn't already been said.  The food is great and it's BYOB so you can leave stuffed full of great food with a pretty low tab.  It's usually pretty crowded.  I've encountered 2 hour waits on the weekend.  However, if you get there early on a slower weeknight you can get seated really quickly.

Reviews.Author: M R.
Reviews.Content: Let's start with dessert--- carrot cake was very good. I went with two other people who love a good steak. I however, do not care for meat. I loved my meal which was the gnocchi. The waiter was fabulous and very attentive without rushing us.  My friends enjoyed their meals also. Great place!

Reviews.Author: Vinifer D.
Reviews.Content: The chimichurri at Tango Sur is so effing good, it makes me want to smack YOUR mama! The food here is great, if you're a big steak person. The chicken dishes aren't bad either. But whatever you get, make sure you get a big a$$ bucket of chimmichurri on the side!

Reviews.Author: Matt D.
Reviews.Content: Empanadas, great steak, BYOB, reasonable prices, great intimate setting, the list goes on. I highly recommended this place, although be aware that they do not take reservations, so head there and put your name in and go enjoy the Southport area until you are called up. You can expect to wait at least a half hour to 45 minutes, but it is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Author: Becky R.
Reviews.Content: Great date place (but NOT for a first date).  Dim lighting, lots of candles.  Only major negative - always a long wait.  So obviously it's got something going for it.  On the up side, if you live close by or feel like wandering to a nearby bar for a drink while you wait, they'll take your number and give you a call when your table is ready, then I think you have 5 min to get back.  BYOB; doesn't get any better than that!  The happy, festive, talkative crowd there definitely agrees on that one.  I'm glad I perused yelp before heading there because the provoleta appetizer (aka giant plate of melted cheese) was fabulous!  My boyfriend and I got a meal for two and had plenty of leftovers to take home with us.  I would definitely go back, just make sure you leave yourself plenty of time to wait!

Reviews.Author: Lauren M.
Reviews.Content: Tengo Sur definitely has your taste buds dancing.  I've been to Southport's most popular Argentinian BYOB twice and would highly recommend the Vacio (definitely to be shared) and the Suprema (their unbelievable version of chicken parmesean).  However, the wait and the attitude of the matre'd left a bad taste in my mouth.  Granted, I could wait outside with a good number of other parties waiting their turn or head to Cullen's or Blue Bayou for a drink, but I wish they gave a more realistic wait time.  Too bad the food is too good to turn your back on the lack in host service.

Reviews.Author: Justin S.
Reviews.Content: An hour and a half wait  and for what? The wait here was rediculouly long so you get to stand on the sidewalk and breathe in the copious amounts cigarette smoke and we were lucky enough to have cigar smokers near us. (yes not the restaurant's fault just more of a commentary for those out there to quit this habit especially in an area where people are eating). Started with a delicious empinada, right choice. The steak i ordered for my entre was on the fatty side but not as bad as what my friends got. Their cut of steak which they shared seemed to be all fat. The restaurant did take care of it and brought them out filets instead. They did take care of the problem dish and correct the situation though I feel a cut like that should have never been served.
