I would give them 4 stars for taking care of the situation but still I don't feel the food was worth the initial hour and a half wait.

Reviews.Author: Lane P.
Reviews.Content: I went to Tango Sur on Saturday evening and this was my best trip here yet. Expecting a long wait, we arrived just before 7 and was told there was a 40 minute wait, only 20 minutes later we were seated. The only thing preventing this from being a 5 star review was that it took over 15 minutes once being seated for anyone to come to our table. The food was fantastic, from the chicken and meat empanadas to the flank steak for two entree, everything was prepared perfect. The flan is the best I have had in Chicago, topped with a caramel sauce that was delicious.Dinner, appetizers and desert for two only $60 with tip!

Reviews.Author: Joscelyn M.
Reviews.Content: Delicious grilled meat? BYO? Incredible eggplant thing appy (which I would definitely order - the 1st few times I came here I refused to order anything non-meat based which I now regret)?  What could be better?  Not waiting for it.  Alas, there's always a wait, but it's worth it.

Reviews.Author: Ray A.
Reviews.Content: It was ok... B.Y.O.B, that was the high lite of this place.  its over rated .   ( thats my opin )

Reviews.Author: Billy B.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is a solid establishment.  The wait can be a little daunting so come early to get seated quickly.  Overall I enjoy this place but the meat can be a little overrated.  Nevertheless, the restaurant offers great value.  Check it out!

Reviews.Author: Yvette F.
Reviews.Content: Dinner with sixteen or so in this place was a little tricky, but they did a great job keeping up with all of our orders and making sure everyone had just what they needed.  The food was fabulous and they even worked with us bringing in our own cake for the birthday girl.  Always crowded, but a great atmosphere and I love how they light the table candle when you sit down.

Reviews.Author: Luciana B.
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite (if not THE favorite) restaurants in Chicago. How much better could you get? Great service, DELICIOUS food (the empanadas, the provoleta, the chimichurri sauce, the steaks and potatoes...everything, and I mean everything I've had here is impeccable), BYOB, and no better romantic date atmosphere in the city. In the summer you can eat outside on lovely Southport - its fantastic. And the waiters are lovely as well.;) I highly, highly recommend this place for a date during the winter in the evening or for a fun dinner with friends in the summer outside. Fabulous for all occasions. And its walking distance to the Music Box and tons of great bars. Can't get better. Can. Not.

Reviews.Author: Nhu N.
Reviews.Content: I. LOVE. TANGO. SUR!!!!! So, to be quite honest.. my mouth watered a little bit when I looked at the empanadas picture on the top right. Then I thought -The empanadas are delicious. The crust is not to flaky and just crisp. I thought I hated chimichurri until I visited Tango Sur. Now all I wish is to have a tub of it, all to myself. I have tried every flavor and the only one that was not extraordinary was the chicken which was overly salty. All the steaks are great. Service is Great. The ambiance is SEXY. My favorite non-steak dish here would be the spinach ravioli served piping hot!! Party bursts of flavors on your tongue!

Reviews.Author: Robert P.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. The wait for a table can be long so make reservations. Everything that I have tried in my 3 visits had been exceptional. The atmosphere is a bit intimate because of the lighting. BYOB is a plus and outdoor seating is great in the summer. Last piece of advice, try the empanadas for an appetizer.

Reviews.Author: Paul K.
Reviews.Content: Great place for South American steaks.  BYOB with no corkage fee.  Great food and you don't have to break the bank for a good bottle of wine.  You can sit outside along Soutport Ave. in the summer.  A little tight on the inside.  If your claustraphobic you may not like this place.

Reviews.Author: David N.
Reviews.Content: My first time here for a friends birthday dinner.  I was very impressed.  We had about 15 people in our group and had made reservations.  We arrived and they seated us right away.  I like the atmosphere of this place, lit candles at every table, low lighting, very nice feel to the place.  The food I thought was excellent.  I was a little concerned I would not be able to find anything on the menu, considering I'm a vegetarian, but there was actually several options to pick from.  I ordered a corn and cheese empanada, which was fantastic.  They only have the spinach and a meat empanada listed on the menu, so you have to ask for the corn and cheese ones.  For the entree, I ordered the spinach ravioli with the tomato sauce.  Great flavor!  This place is also BYOB.  Definitely worth checking this place out if you are in the neighborhood.  Busy place though, so you may have a wait.

Reviews.Author: Michelle D.
Reviews.Content: Best value in the city.  One of my top 10 favorite restaurants in the city.  Wish is wasn't so popular though.  Only downside is the no reservations and wait time.  I always get the churrasco with chimichurri and mashed potatoes.  It is phenomenal.  I also always enjoy the rolls and fresh salad.  Wish I lived closer again.  When I lived down the street, we could call ahead, put our name in, and wait for them to call us when our table was ready.  So, if you live nearby - that is the way to go :-)

Reviews.Author: Jedd J.
Reviews.Content: At locationally blessed Tango Sur, BYOB is the primary draw, resulting in crowds, lines, and a scene, which is the secondary draw.  Apparently that's good enough for yelpers.  Tango Sur slings heaps of low quality meat, so if you're going for the food, prepare to be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Michael H.
Reviews.Content: What's one more review? Love the BYOB and no corkage fee. It's small in here, but if you're okay with that, it shouldn't be a problem. My only complaint is that the rib eye was fatty. I had to cut around a lot of fat to get to the promise land. I should have gone with the filet. Empanadas are delicious and filling. The check was very reasonable thanks to BYOB!

Reviews.Author: Lauren H.
Reviews.Content: This is a romantic place to have a date.  It's very dark inside but I certainly didn't mind it.  The price of the food is not bad at all give that they give big portions.  I had the El filet and it was cooked to my perfection.  I would definitely come back here again and service is great! The wait may be long but it is so worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Theresa C.
Reviews.Content: I love this place! However, I know it's not for everybody. It's incredibly noisy, the service is hit or miss (but mostly hit), and the wait times can be looooooong. But the steaks are good and affordable and it's BYOB. It's great for a fun night out with your really loud friends.

Reviews.Author: Adam R.
Reviews.Content: I was excited to try tango but was shocked when I got my steak....not in a good way.  I couldn't even cut into it. Eating it was out of the question.  I never had a piece of steak even close to as bad.  I would have returned it but i had already ordered a piece.. medium rare and returned it because it was well done.  I should have just kept the first piece.  Reading the other reviews I wouldn't rule out the possibility that they purposely gave me an inedible piece because I returned my first piece?  They did take it off the bill but I'm still giving them 1 star... any person would have found this unacceptable.  .. I seldom return food at a restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Monica M.
Reviews.Content: went here a couple weeks ago and it was awesome.i forget what we got, the one thats made for two people and it came out on its own little stand. HUGE slab of meat. im pretty sure 3 people can share.its byob too. i brought an Argentinian malbec blend, which happened to be our second bottle at dinner. you can bet it was a pretty purple color when it came back up later that night...

Reviews.Author: Matt P.
Reviews.Content: Best steakhouse in Chicago, hands down.  Also the singular influence in me wanting to visit Argentina.

Reviews.Author: laela l.
Reviews.Content: There isn't much to say that hasn't been said -- but anyway, this is the place to go if your family or friends are in town, or if you have a date. Very romantic, looks classy, but has that neighborhood feel instead of that downtown feel. It's truly a unique restaurant (ambiance) with a diverse menu, quality food, and beautiful music.

Reviews.Author: Emmanuel E.
Reviews.Content: Very intimate setting, a great place to go on a date or just catch up with friends. The food was superb, one of the best vacios I've had in a long time, juicy and perfectly grilled. Appetizers were great and their morcillas we're the best I've ever had. Had a great time, plan on returning soon.

Reviews.Author: Soo S.
Reviews.Content: By far the BEST steak I have ever had in Chicago. Steaks were perfectly cooked and the dipping sauce it comes with is the deal breaker! Had to wait an hour and half but was worth it!

Reviews.Author: Lucy B.
Reviews.Content: I was taken here for my birthday dinner on our trip to Chicago. It was delicious. However - those empanadas in that picture look like they are enormous, they are in reality little two bit suckers, don't be fooled! Anyway, skip the appetizers and go straight for the beef. Holy hell was this a lot of food.. and DELICIOUS food. My only complaint is that everything was sooooo oily. Try it though, you will not be disapoitned!

Reviews.Author: Donnie D.
Reviews.Content: BYOB and it has amazing food. Every time I travel to Chicago, I try to get into this place if I can since reservations are highly recommended. Be prepared as the interior can be very loud during peak times but I feel the food more than makes up for that. My favorite restaurant in Chicago, especially for the price.

Reviews.Author: Reiahnna J.
Reviews.Content: We were in a rush so we did take-out. Yes, Tango Sur does take-out. They even gave us breadsticks with our meal. I ordered ham and cheese empanadas. I think it was swiss cheese, but they were yummy so I guess I had two appetizers then. Also, my mom got milanesa del pollo (breaded chicken breast with potatoes and salad) and I got the suprema a la napolitana, which is the same only the chicken has baked ham, mozarella and tomato sauce on top for only $2 extra. I couldn't eat it all at once. I also got a mate because I learned about it in class. They give you sugars to sweeten it. It's the best tea I've ever tasted.

Reviews.Author: Nick C.
Reviews.Content: Worth the wait. The food is the bomb!  in your face!

Reviews.Author: Peter S.
Reviews.Content: Eh. Really. Not good at all. For $27 I would expect a bone in rib eye to be really good.  This was tough and but for the garlic and sauce, it would have sucked.  We won't be back.

Reviews.Author: Diane J.
Reviews.Content: This place is great!! Excellent service and amazing music on Tuesday nights. The steak was some of the best that I have had and to top it all off it was fresh and it's BYOB. It is a definite must as far as steakhouses and Argentinian restauraunts go. It is also in a quaint quiet neighborhood which makes it very pleasant to sit outside!

Reviews.Author: Amar S.
Reviews.Content: This place serves AMAZING food. The steaks and the fish dishes are just plain delicious. It is also BYOB, so bring your favorite bottle(s), and fully enjoy your culinary experience. The place is definitely not for the claustrophobic, as you will be in a dimly lit place with your elbows possibly touching the next table. If you're on a date remember that you will have to get close to each other to hear, so it may add to the dining experience. This place has never disappointed, and I recommend it to everyone. Be aware that parking in that area is rough, so plan on coming early or taking a cab. Note that they do not take reservations, and it is always crowded.

Reviews.Author: Ashley W.
Reviews.Content: I usually don't eat much meat, but it's so good and so cheap at tango sur. It looks like everyone is in agreement on Yelp that this is a great place for dinner...especially with a large group.  It's BYOB so don't forget your wine!

Reviews.Author: Kelsey M.
Reviews.Content: Far from stellar service, unbelievebly long waits, cramped seating but worth it!  Better steaks that the usual suspects (Morton's, Gibson's, Palm) and a refreshing atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Bridgette B.
Reviews.Content: The food here is amazing.  Steaks cooked perfectly, everytime (or so it seems).  The candlelit atmosphere coupled with BYOB makes it a steal for a "romantic" dinner.  I would love to eat here more often, if it wasn't for the wait, which is also the reason it looses a star from me.We showed up here at 900, and were told it would be an hour to hour and a half.  we came back at 1030 and they told us it would be another 30 mins.  They never called and we stopped back in at 1130 and finally got a seat.  But, the food was well worth the wait, just wish that they were a little more upfront about the wait til.All in all, a great experience.  I will be back (but probably much earlier in the day this time!)

Reviews.Author: Shelby S.
Reviews.Content: It started off a little bumpy but overall it was a positive experience.  The wait is incredibly long, and it's a popular place for birthdays and large parties so be prepared to wait about 1.5 hours for a table.  There is a great Tapas place down the street that serves a tasty mojito to keep you busy.  The food is delicious, and the portions are beyond generous.  You'll definitely have leftovers.  Our server was attentive and helpful, as was the host.  Not recommended to bring your family......but definitely for dinner with friends, or boy/girl friends.

Reviews.Author: J. T.
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations after reading the reviews.  I was, unfortunately,  disappointed, and I'm not all that finicky.  Read on:Pro's:1.  Proximity to where we live.2.  Dark, romantic, candle-on-table atmosphere.3.  BYOB.4.  Thickest steak I've ever encountered.5.  Attentive server and busser.6.  Decent price, especially for the area.7.  Good menu variety.8.  Able to sit two or large groups.9.  Bread basket with refills.10. Large portions of mashed potatoes, yum.11. Free dessert (patron birthday).12. We were able to reserve a table for two (but it's not exactly peak season and it was a special occasion).13. Server offered recommendations and explanations.14. Filet mignon thick, scrumptious, and done to perfection.15. Humongo-jumbo portions (plenty for at-home dinner tonight!).Con's:1.  Place filled considerably after 7:00, mostly with an under-35, wine-toting, I-can-talk-louder-than-you, female crowd.  2.  Extremely noisy; romantic atmosphere went down the tubes quickly.3.  Rib-eye was too fatty and somewhat gristly, although cooked nicely to medium-rare.  Felt I was "tackling" my food.4.  Spinach mashed potatoes are truly green, as in mint ice cream green, as opposed to having spinach mixed into the potatoes as with chives; the color is simply hard to view.  The Darling didn't care for the taste, either.5.  First bread basket held stale rolls.  Second bread basket held fresh rolls.6.  No additional butter packets were offered, although we had bread and potatoes.7.  Salads were - meh.  Lettuce, pale tomato slices, white onion slices, some flavored vinegar on the table.8.  Cheese appetizer was beautiful, but once in the mouth became instantly rubbery and hard to swallow.  9.  Tea was weak.10. White napkins often leave flecks of white linen on black pants and dresses; black napkins would be a most considerate offering.We might try it again next year, but all in all, our experience was not up to the hype.  Hope your's is better!

Reviews.Author: K X.
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind the wait (which is a good sign of a good place) then Tango Sur is it.  Its a BYOB and they have some of the best cuts of meat you'll find.  Their "parillada" for 2 people, could easily be split between 4 and you will still have food to take home.  The best nights to go for "quiet" and less wait are on Tuesdays and Wednesday, but even then, you may encounter a wait.  This is a place to go with bottles of wine, good company, and be ready to just relax and enjoy a delicious meal.  The only thing that I almost always pass on are their salads that come as part of a meal.  All it is is salad, onion, and tomato, but it has no flavor and are pretty bad. Note:  Don't fill up on their yummy oven-fresh bread because a good meal comes up after that!

Reviews.Author: lana v.
Reviews.Content: BYOB with no fee!!! The food is amazing and the portions are huge. If you like meat and steak, this is the place to go. The waiters are all friendly, and the service is great. The only problem is getting a table, this place is always packed!!

Reviews.Author: Zac B.
Reviews.Content: YUMMY! We sat down right away around 8:30 on a Monday and had a lovely candlelit dinner. Try the Pechuga del pollo, it was so good! The servers were quick and attentive, I think every time I set my water glass down someone came up and filled it. I wish I had known it was BYOB, I had a nice bottle of wine that would have been amazing with the chicken. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Grant G.
Reviews.Content: I'm just here to co-sign all of the other reviews... big steaks, low prices, great service. I even tried the blood sausage... not bad.

Reviews.Author: Ashley D.
Reviews.Content: The husband and I treated some friends to dinner here.  I really like the BYOB, but wasn't too sold on the food.  When compared to El Nandu, their steaks were way tough and empanadas were really small.  My DH and I got a grill with stuffed steak and mushrooms and the friends got the El Filet.  They seemed really happy with their meal, but we weren't too pleased.  Prices ended up being about the same even with the BYOB, and I liked the outside patio, but I think I'll stick with El Nandu in the future.

Reviews.Author: Nancy C.
Reviews.Content: PROS:  Cheap prices, 1 order of filet mignon comes with 2 steaks, BYOBCONS: Ridiculous wait, super loud inside, steak quality isn't that good, inconvenient locationI'd say it's good if you're with a group of friends and want to BYOB.

Reviews.Author: Cora B.
Reviews.Content: I've been here twice now, both times for birthdays, and both times were excellent.  The waiter and everyone on Yelp recommends the provoleta appetizer so we tried it, and it's really just a plate of melted cheese with red peppers - good, but nothing terribly special.The steaks, on the other hand - fantastic.  TWO, yes, TWO deliciously charred filets came with my $24 entree - could you even make that at home for $24?  The strip was a tad fatty, but was cooked perfectly, and the chimichurri which accompanied it was out of this world.Skip the spinach mashed potatoes and go for the Argentinian-style - like potatoes Vesuvio, but better!No corkage fee, no pretensions - definitely worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: J J.
Reviews.Content: What I liked best was the simplicity of the food - not overdone with seasoning, etc. Just natural flavor. Pretty large portions, almost burst my belly. Extra dark for the romanticos.

Reviews.Author: Law S.
Reviews.Content: Overrated.  Waited 2.5 hours and it was actually not that great.  I will give it another try, but I was disappointed.  Pasta was heinous

Reviews.Author: Kelly Joy P.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is simple and delicious.  Great quality steaks in an unpretentious atmosphere.  I happily spend my time waiting for a table in the small and cozy waiting room with a bottle of wine.

Reviews.Author: Sarah M.
Reviews.Content: This was probably the best steak I have ever had. Ever. I love that it's BYOB. It really saved some $ on the bill. Service was excellent and I'm amazed at how the wait staff zipped through the tiny spaces left between tables. They don't take reservations which caused some anxiety before hand but we got right in. Everything was delicious.

Reviews.Author: Grace J.
Reviews.Content: Went here before seeing a movie at the music box and im so glad we did! It was amazing. so delicious. when we first walked in around 6 there was a lot of space but by 7 its was full. The pricing is so good for the portions, food and atmosphere and being byob it great. I can not wait to go back because I want to try to much more. The salad we got wasn't really good at all, i forget what it was called exactly but its had lots of mozzarella cheese. Still it doesn't even matter because the other food was so good, we had the empanadas and the skirt steak with sweet potatoes. Thinking about it make my mouth water! The only bad thing i can say is that it was so romantic type setting, which isnt bad in any way but for a place that i loved so much a little awkward if I wanna bring all my friends for a good time!

Reviews.Author: C. B.
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is as good as you've heard.  Yes, you will have to wait for awhile.  I suggest heading over to Blue Bayou for some drinks.  They will call you when your table is ready.  Que Syrah is a fine wine store that is very close.  They will set you up with some nice wine to enjoy at this BYOB.  Or you can just walk down the the CVS if you're feeling less fancy. :)  I think at this point I have gotten pretty much everything on the menu and have not been disappointed.  My advice is to order the beef that is imported from Argentina.  It is a lot better - a bit more expensive, but so worth it.  Also...come hungry.  SO so hungry.  You will leave full.  So so full.  The downside about TS is that you do end up sitting on top of the neighboring tables.  This is by far one of my fav places and I always bring out of town guests here.  They are always amazed.  TS does not disappoint.

Reviews.Author: Ben B.
Reviews.Content: Lomo Relleno, Lomo Relleno, Lomo Relleno, Lomo Relleno, Lomo Relleno...AMAZING... 3 of us ate for $77. we bought some wine in advance and the beef empanadas were by far the best, corn is not too too far behind. but for basically $30 a person I challenge you to find a better spot.

Reviews.Author: Mayari G.
Reviews.Content: Get over it - the wait is going to be long for any good restaurant that doesn't take reservations.  If you want a reservation, go to Folklore (their sister property on Division St.).  Aside from the awesome spinach empanadas (just the right size), the chimichurri (yummmmm!) and sausage (made from scratch by Che Rodolfo, the owner's dad in the store next to the restaurant) and the meat, the FLAN is the BEST FLAN EVER!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Katherine W.
Reviews.Content: We went here with a party of 5 on a Sunday night at 7PM. We did have reservations so we were seated within 5 minutes after we arrived. If we hadn't had reservations it would have been at least an hour long wait. It would have been worth it. As everyone has said it's very dark inside, I think it lends itself to being intimate and romantic. Service was very prompt in opening our wine and getting us menus. There always seemed to be the right amount of time between everything. When we wanted our waiter there he was and when we were enjoying lingering he wasn't. We started with the empanadas and the antipasto plate. Both were great. Definitely get at least one empanada, they're all delicious. The salad to start the meal is really nothing special but that isn't why anyone goes there. It's for the STEAK!!  Wow!!  My husband and I split the lomo relleno and couldn't have been happier. It was shear bliss. Moist, tender, spicy and covered in the best portabella mushrooms ever. We couldn't stop raving about it. Everyone else had steaks and loved theirs as well. We all had leftovers to take home and the hubs and I enjoyed our leftovers just as much the second day as the first.  The prices were fantastic for the amount and quality of the food and you cannot beat a no charge BYOB.  We can't wait for another excuse to go here.

Reviews.Author: Colleen Anne F.
Reviews.Content: Great staff and best Grill platter and flan in town!

Reviews.Author: aldrich b.
Reviews.Content: You come here for the food and byob option, not the service.  Nice sized portions for the price.  I either get the lomo(filet) or the lomo relleno(large steak stuffed with chimichurri) which is meant to be shared by 2 or more people.  Good place to go if you're craving a steak but don't wanna shell out $50 at a fancier place.  They don't take reservations and the place is crowded, but well worth a try.

Reviews.Author: Naomi N.
Reviews.Content: Read the great reviews and came here a few weeks ago.  I ordered the chicken and my friend ordered a filet. The filet he loved but said it was probably top fifteen of the many steak houses he visited. My chicken was good but not great. Service is poor. They are very quick to take your order and you'll see them again when the food comes and that's about it. Small restaurant. We sat outside and inside is intimate and small. Had a Spanish guitar outside which was nice. BYOB.

Reviews.Author: Stacy G.
Reviews.Content: I went here for the first time with my boyfriend. It was our first dinner out in a while and we couldn't have been happier! We both got great meals (had the fillet Mignon) which were cooked perfectly and tasted exquisite. The ambiance of the restaurant was dark and smoky without being pretentious and snobby (which often happens in nicer restaurants). The only drawback to our experience was the level of noise in the restaurant. It can get a bit loud but wasn't unbearable. We loved that it was BYOB as well. No paying triple just to have a few cocktails with din-din. I'd definitely go again and look forward to our next night out there. If you love steak, then give this place a try. It may just end up being your favorite after your first visit!

Reviews.Author: Cassie C.
Reviews.Content: Awesome food! Decided to have a friends birthday dinner here and could not have been more pleased. There was no wait when we got there, granted it was a Wednesday night, and we were seated right away. This is BYOB--so we brought 6 bottles of wine and there was no corkage fee, they opened up all our wine and even put them on ice in a bucket. The inside is larger than it looks and is only lit by candlelight. There is also no AC. I did read that in someone else's review and just thought I would confirm that. I was in a dress and was still rather warm. The bread right out of the oven is Amazing! The menu has plenty to choose from and the empanadas are great to start with. The Vacio dish--flank steak--was cooked perfectly and the potatoes were good. The wait for the food was not very long and the food lasted the entire conversation. With the 4 of us it came out to be $34 a person with tip, which was not bad since we paid for the birthday girl as well. Great place for a date night or girls night :)

Reviews.Author: Jack B.
Reviews.Content: good food, great time, long waits to get in.  be prepared to put your name in and go next door to grab a drink, but they will call you when your table is ready so as long as you're not in a rush, you'll be fine.  The place is dark, only lights are a single candle on the tables and the music is loud.  For me, it is one of the best places I've been to for dinner with a date.  There's a reason why there is a wait and people are busting down the door to get in.

Reviews.Author: Ramona A.
Reviews.Content: The only downfall is the wait for a table, other than that Tango Sur is always a great time.  The empanadas are amazing, steak is fantastic and the atmosphere is romantic and fun - a little too crowded but worth it.  Love this place.

Reviews.Author: Alissa B.
Reviews.Content: I love this place!  I went with my family last night for my brother's birthday dinner. Thankfully, there were 6 in our party so we were able to make a reservation.  Definitely aim to get 6 in your party just for this reason alone!  As big fans of red wine, we very much appreciate that this fine restaurant is BYOB.  The food is amazing and I like that its a bit unique from your average steakhouse.  My mom and I split a filet made for two, and it probably could have fed 4 of us!  They brought us the most delish caramel flan for the bday boy and we inhaled it.  Not to mention the carrot cake and some sort of fabulous waffle pie thing we also ordered.  Get your friends and go to Tango Sur, you will wonder why it took you so long!

Reviews.Author: Katie S.
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed the other night as I called ahead and was told we would be sat at 8. My boyfriend and I finally were sat at around 9:15. (mind you, this is a Tuesday). We ordered right away and still didn't get our app till 30 min, and it was COLD. Finally got our steaks around 1030- at this point I wasn't even hungry any more. Steak was very tough, not very tasty.The only thing I enjoyed was the live music. However, not sure if I'll ever go back.

Reviews.Author: Gricelda R.
Reviews.Content: Wow!! This place is amazing great food and atmosphere! Candle lit very romantic! We went to a friends birthday on Thursday night but even though we had a reservation we waited an hour and a half! Even though our reservation was pushed back. But it was well worth the wait we got some free appetizers! N it was delicious! The server was amazing and very attentive he was Chilean because his accent was amazing!! The parillada for two is good for meat lovers! And the best part its BYOB!!! Yeah what else can you ask for? It's 4 stars because we had to wait! other thank that I will knock it up with  5!!

Reviews.Author: Janet L.
Reviews.Content: Amazing steak done perfectly medium rare, or medio rojo as they say. I had the costeleta, rib-eye, and a bite of the fillet mignon. Buenissimo! The appetizers are also delicious, we had: jamon crudo con melon (Prosciutto and melon!), lengua a la venegreta (tongue!) y matambre (veal) . We were a party of 7 and celebrating a bachelorette and received 2 flans on the house. The staff is extremely nice and attentive, pouring our BYOB wine. I especially enjoyed conversing with Martín. Would definitelg go again if I'm ever in Chicago. Great ambience for a date or a group. Last note is that we got there early and had no problems with seats. Otherwise, it gets super crowded.

Reviews.Author: Elvira G.
Reviews.Content: awesome!!! i love it!!!delish delish  delish!!!churrasco estilo argentino !!! delish!desert flan, peach crumble, yum!!!servers ...too cute

Reviews.Author: Jason C.
Reviews.Content: An orgasmic explosion of emotions for steak loving peeps like myself. Definitely get the fillet mignon, they give you two big ass fillets! You can't possibly finish that unless you're Homer Simpson.

Reviews.Author: Olivers Mom W.
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Tango Sur for years.  I cant say I am a regular but I definitely go a few times a year and the consistency of the outstanding quality of the food has NOT changed!  Over the past several years many restaurants cut costs and in turn let their menu and food go down the crapper.  Tango Sur ALWAYS offers the best meat, and appetizers!!!  Ambiance is romantic, but also good for a girls night since they are still BYOB!  I try to avoid them on Weekend evenings since the wait is usually lengthy, but If you really want to go its worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Jason B.
Reviews.Content: This is a quaint little steak house with a hip, yet romantic dining room, and ample outdoor setting.  The noise level was very bearable, and decor was laid back.  This was my first time dining at an Argentinian steakhouse, so I had many questions, as well as a pesky dairy allergy. Our server was friendly, attentive, and more than will to recommend, and cater to my allergy. I find that many servers become irritated at my allergy, which is ridiculous, because I'm am NOT a fussy eater.  My friends started with the antipasto, which was nothing special.  It was good, but neither the presentation nor the quality was to write home about.  I was torn between two allergy acceptable items, and our server helped me choose lengua a la vinagreta.  The beef tongue was braised nicely, and the texture and flavor of the tongue was to die for.  I have never been served cold tongue, and it's something I will try again.  My friends who were resident in trying it- LOVED IT. Prior to dinner, we all received a complimentary salad- plain, but I can't complain, it was free. Now to my main Chef's specials entree- costeleta which is a bone in rib-eye, which is then grilled, topped with olive oil,  and a garlic and parsley sauce, served with mashed potatoes.  Due to my allergy, they kindly substituted the potatoes with a allergy friendly potato side.  When my food arrived, my server was kind (this doesn't happen very often) and reassured that my entire entree was dairy-free, which includes butter.  He went one step further, and told me all the ingredients, and prep.  I shouldn't be worried when dining out, but too many times I do worry about my allergy. The best part of the meal was how the steak was seasoned and cooked.  It was a perfect mid-rare throughout, the cut was great, and it was seasoned absolutely perfectly.  I usually either want to, or go ahead and have my steaks returned to the kitchen, however this one was perfect :)  I'm very grateful of this, since I don't eat much red meat, this is a bi-monthly occurrence, so it was nice that it will be memorable. Oh, onto the BEST part. It's BYOB, and corking services are FREE!!! The servers were always attentive of the bottles, either opening the next bottle in line at your table, or filling your glasses.  From what I could see, everyone around us also had great service. This place is worth trying out, especially if you are not familiar with Argentinian cuisine.  Was it my best ever dining experience, or was the quality top notch? Well, no, but there are many things that they could teach to some top notch restaurants.  That's why they get a four-star. Maybe I'll change my rating when I return :)

Reviews.Author: Laura C.
Reviews.Content: I love this place!  Definitely worth the long wait that you will probably experience if you go there on a weekend night (not quite so bad week nights.)  Service is excellent; friendly, helpful and attentive.  Portions are beyond generous, especially for the price. The BYOB feature is fabulous and can actually make the wait kind of fun!  They'll open your wine and provide glasses while you wait for a table so you can stand along the sidewalk, sip your wine, talk with good friends and just hang out and people watch along Southport... that's not so much fun during the winter though :-(During a recent trip one of my friends was running late and we were starving so on the waiter's recommendation we tried the Berenjena appetizer (eggplant with spinach, provolone, parmesan, ricotta and a tomato cream sauce)... I don't really like eggplant but after tasting that, I think I've changed my mind!  I've tried a few of the different entrees but think I'll be sticking with the 'El Filet'... it is just sooo delicious!

Reviews.Author: Maegen R.
Reviews.Content: nice place for a romantic dinner, the space is a bit cramped...but the food is well worth it. BYOB!

Reviews.Author: amber p.
Reviews.Content: I went here for the first time last Wednesday.  It was 1/2 hour before they were about to close so I was kinda nervous that they would kick us out before we could finish our meal.  That WAS NOT the case at all.  They were sooo nice and said for me to take my time.  The food was really good, especially the empanadas.  My chicken limon was a tad bit dry but still flavorful.  Very affordable and has a great ambiance.  I will definitely return.

Reviews.Author: Becky A.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic restaurant and BYOB is part of the appeal. You will not walk away hungry. I'm not sure that the filet mignon I ordered was a tranditaionl cut for filet mignon, but it was yummy nonetheless. The spinach mashed potatoes were a perfect compliment. The appetizer I had, sort of like an eggplant lasagna was amazing. I could have eaten an entire pan of it! And I could not get over the prices! We ordered 6 entrees, 2 appetizers and 8 empanades and it was only $240 including tip. Really a good deal. The only drawback is that it can get loud, so just know what you are getting into. They only take reservations for large parties.

Reviews.Author: Allan C.
Reviews.Content: Went there last night with 8 people and had a great time.  It is a BYOB and there is a Jewel Osco right down the street.  We made reservations and got seated right away.  I have heard that there isn't much of a wait M-W.  The best appetizers are the Empanadas and Provoleta.  Most of us had Filets and you get 2 medium sized pieces for only $24.

Reviews.Author: Courtney W.
Reviews.Content: If you live in Chicago and haven't been to Tango Sur - something is wrong with you (unless you are a vegetarian, in which case ignore my review altogether). This place is the jam. I lived in Argentina for a year and Tango Sur brought me right back. The steaks here are fantastic, juicy, delicious and cheap. The proveleta appetizer is the most cheesy goodness I've ever put in my mouth. I could go on about the chicken, but c'mon its really all about the steaks. And the atmosphere. Romantic, and hectic and hectic and romantic. Go here. For sure.

Reviews.Author: Erin C.
Reviews.Content: I have been coming here even before I lived in the city. It was worth the drive from the north burbs. We almost always come with a big group and take advantage of the large platters meant to share. Its incredible how much you can get for the price if you know how to order. The salmon is my absolute favorite. Some friends swear by the roasted chicken, I've actually seen them devour it with their bare hands, (not recommended). There also aren't many places you can get blood sausage it seems, so if thats your style, dig in. This is a great place for a date. Hopefully your date is as charming as the atmosphere!

Reviews.Author: Sierra I.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Tango Sur numerous times, but it's been a while since I've been back. I remembered the steak to be one of the best steaks I've ever had, and well, while it was good, it wasn't the BEST I'VE EVER HAD.  It was good, but not phenomenal. Service was pretty great and we didn't have to wait for an outdoor table, which was awesome. Also, you have to know that the portions are huge. Split the El Filet if you are going to get it. It's 2 8 oz. filets, not one. For the most part, we really enjoyed our dinner. Oh, and don't forget to get the empanadas! They were fantastic.

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline F.
Reviews.Content: Yummy steaks!  It's a reasonably priced steak place that's BYOB so right there you save a lot of money.  If you're a steak person, which I definitely am, you'll love Tango Sur!

Reviews.Author: Damien J.
Reviews.Content: Yummy stuff. Atmosphere is great. Yes your table may be close to the next, but the warm atmosphere, candlelit tables and amazing smelling food will make you forget about it.  its BYOB heaven. Don't be in rush or impatient if you come for dinner. If you have impatient friends, leave em at home & make them jealous when you tell them about the great time you had.  Bring some wine, put your name on the list and relax or to to a bar next door until your table is ready. Its allll worth it, the food rocks.

Reviews.Author: Ashish G.
Reviews.Content: I'm quite surprised with all of the 4 and 5 star ratings.  I don't think I've ever had a really good steak here; however, I've had some great experiences.  The intimate setting works a for a date or even a small group.  The empanadas and chimichurri are delicious; however, the steaks are not very good quality.  Since there's a good hour between the time you order and actually get your steak, I think most people have gone through a couple bottles of wine and are just hungry.

Reviews.Author: Jenna P.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is delicious! If you go anytime on a weekend night without a reservation, be prepared to wait for a long time. The nice thing is that they take your cell phone number and call you when the table's ready. When we go we stop by Tango Sur to put our names on the list, then head over to one of several nearby bars to have a drink and relax for an hour or so. Once they call, we head over and our table is ready right away. It makes for a nice, long evening. Just don't expect to be done with the whole experience in an hour!The food is amazing. We usually get one of the meals Para Dos, the one with the sweet potatoes. The steak is wonderfully flavorful, in a way that is unique from other steak restaurants. And the sweet potatoes absolutely melt in your mouth, yum! I've also tried some of their chicken dishes and been equally impressed. There is always plenty of food to take home. Probably the best thing about Tango Sur is the excellent value. This is a rare steak dinner that won't empty your wallet! Add in the fact that it's BYOB with no corkage fee, and this place is really a steal.The ambiance is dark, lit by candlelight. However, I would not call this a terribly romantic dining experience. Tango Sur gets very, very crowded on weekends, and they pack a lot of people around tiny tables! I imagine this would be an excellent place to go with a large group. However, the food is so good that I don't mind being crowded!

Reviews.Author: susan d.
Reviews.Content: Love the Filet Mignon you get 2,spinach mash to die for.Spinach empanadas awesome.And the flan is the best I have ever had.Went for my B-day,byob.Good times.

Reviews.Author: Tony F.
Reviews.Content: We went on a Saturday night to Tango Sur for dinner. We arrived by 6pm, and the door man took our name and number down. They said they would call in about 45 minutes..They called as promised and were seated promptly.As we sat down, I gave a bottle of wine to the waiter and he opened it. We thought that was perfect. Once settled, we began overlooking the menu while in awe with the romantic atmosphere. Our waiter came back in a reasonable time (5 minutes later) and ordered. We asked for the Lomo (for two) as our entree. OMG the dish is made for at least 3. You definitely get what you pay for and some. Attention meat lover's, this place is calling. Anyway we enjoyed the atmosphere and the food. I recommend going in small groups (4 people -- give or take) or with a significant other. Depending on your timing, if you go in groups, you risk waiting longer than expected. (It's really hard getting people cycled out of there when they are having such a fantastic time.) Hence, this place is pretty popular. If you are someone who hates waiting don't waste your time. Or, if you don't like loud and crowded areas, then that could dissapoint. For me, I could care less.I think if you love the Argentinian theme...then you will absolutely love it.Be open minded, and enjoy!!!Cheers!!!T

Reviews.Author: Tiffany M.
Reviews.Content: I ADORED this restaurant.  Such a cool atmosphere. It's dark and romantic.  I loved that it was BYOB.  I didn't like the long wait, but it was worth it.  I got the ravioli and enjoyed it.  I'd go back anytime.

Reviews.Author: Timmy T.
Reviews.Content: This is almost certainly the best steakhouse in its price range ($16-$24 per steak) in Chicago. I don't think they age steaks for a month, like you may find downtown, but they do serve prime, and Tango Sur always presents the meat at your requested level of doneness. The seating wait will be long unless you get there early or late. It's BYOB, with no corkage fee, and if you have time to kill but no alcohol there are literally a half dozen bars on the same block, all of which also serve appetizers. The ribeye is huge and delicious with the chimichuri sauce, and the empanadas are a steal for $2 each. I could eat an entire dinner of those.

Reviews.Author: una g.
Reviews.Content: Pros -good food-prices r reasonable-i want 1 of dose tango sur shirts-service is good-I've only been a few times and the wait wasn't bad the times I wentCons-parking sux -

Reviews.Author: Jessica G.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I both liked this place. He doesn't care for foo foo food and this was different but not over the top. He raved about this place for days. Thanks to other reviewers we stopped for wine before we came. The restaurant is BYOB with not corking fee. The food was great and way too much. We split the filet for two meal and we had enough for a third person.  The only CON I can see is they did not take reservations for two.

Reviews.Author: Marc G.
Reviews.Content: Been here twice now and enjoyed both visits. Steaks and chicken were cooked perfectly. The atomsphere is intimate both inside and outside. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Author: Aneta K.
Reviews.Content: The only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is because of the rude host....I get they're busy and all, but please be nicer to people waiting outside...And don't lie-if the wait is 2 hours, tell me that, and don't say 45 minutes and when I come back to check on progress you're telling me another 30 minutes....The food makes up for it...never had a bad steak here, so tender and juicy...and the prices are very reasonable.

Reviews.Author: Scott C.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Tango Sur four times now and it's usually pretty good. On a Friday or Saturday night, you'll have to wait an hour or so for a table. Your best bet is to put your name down and give them your cell phone number to call when your table is ready. While you wait, I would recommend stopping in and grabbing a drink at Cullen's, this Irish pub a few doors down.One thing you should note about Tango Sur: it's cramped and very noisy inside. Not the type of place to take your grandma who wraps herself in a cardigan and complains about the cold draft when the hostess seats her by the door. If you want to have a conversation, I would recommend sitting outside. Now for the food. The steaks are good-sized, taste great and are extremely well-priced. When you're finished eating one you'll sit back and wonder how the Hell those places in the Loop get away with charging 40 bucks. In my experience with Tango Sur, I've only had one problem:  my girlfriend ordered the spinach ravioli (she's vegetarian) and after eating a couple pieces, she realized they messed up her order and gave her the meat ravioli. She immediately lost her appetite and stopped eating.Now to most people, this might be hard to understand, but she was raised vegetarian and mistakingly eating meat causes her to not be hungry anymore. Fine. We politely notify our waiter that she is vegetarian and that he gave her the wrong dish. But instead of apologizing or offering to get her something else, he denies it! We literally had to open up a piece of ravioli and show it to him. Dude, we're not trying to scam you out of two pieces of 12 dollar ravioli. He proceeds take it back to the kitchen and then returns to blame everything on the cook. But the worst part was, he didn't take it off our bill and instead brought us one plate of flan to split between four people. Weak. But besides that one mishap, this place is usually pretty good and I'll probably be back

Reviews.Author: Kyle P.
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is - Wow!  In terms of the quality and quantity of the food and the price, this is probably the best restaurant in the city.My wife and I ordered some cheese dish (which was amazing) and split the fillet.  We got two giant slabs of juicy meat, and were genuinely stuffed afterwards.  The final bill?  Only $40!The only negative was the noise.  The place was packed on a Saturday night, and it was hard to hear.

Reviews.Author: Shawn J.
Reviews.Content: Went here for an after work dinner with coworkers. Staff was super professional, extremely helpful and attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu and preparations! Ambiance was nice, dark and candle lit. perfect for a date! Had appetizers which were darn good. Got to dinner and felt it was just OK. Had a steak and thought it had GREAT flavor, but the meats tended to be a bit chewy. HUGE PORTIONS! We also had an array of desserts, of which I am not a flan fan.... but wow, was the caramel flan terrific! Would love to go back and try a few other things! Over all a great experience, and we couldn't have been treated any better! BYOB is great too... No cork fee!

Reviews.Author: V S.
Reviews.Content: Candle lights, deliciously prepared steaks, and you get to bring your own perfect wine!!

Reviews.Author: Tiff D.
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at Tango Sur, and everything was wonderful and perfect, just like I hoped! Perfectly cooked meat, wonderful price per portion ratio, water glass was never empty, friendly server, only one thing was off about our night...... I came with a date and when we entered, a tall, thin man approached the doorway, staring at us. At first, I moved out of the way, thinking he was trying to exit. After a few moments of awkward pauses, my date finally asked if this man knew about our reservation. "Go wait in the waiting room." Then he left. If my date didn't know where the waiting room was, I would have probably turned around and left. I have never felt so uncomfortable and unwelcomed by someone who is supposed to be a host. It changed the atmosphere and tone of the evening, I didn't feel like being there until I started eating. I'm glad I stuck around because, it's true what you hear about the food at Tango Sur.  EXCELLENT. I also have to mention that we came in at 8:30 on a Sunday night right before Valentine's day, so it was definitely packed. Even still, there should be some patience and professionalism from the host of a busy restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Brooke S.
Reviews.Content: awesome steaks, awesome BYOB w/ no corkage fee. no reservations, expect to wait. Check in then walk to Jewel to pick up your drinks to make the most of your time

Reviews.Author: Vivian B.
Reviews.Content: I mean, come on, as if this place really needs another rave review. But, I cannot help it. It is FANTASTIC! This is by far the best byob in the city. Vegetarians beware this is an Argentina meat place (they order their beef from there, free range not this factory farmed crap). The filet I ordered off the special list was simply divine. Best I have ever had. The sause was delicious and the spinach mashed potatoes-nice work never thought of combining the two. Thanks to the server that recommended it. My mom got the salmon and cleaned her plate. Best meal I have had in a while, and i go to a lot of very expensive and nice steakhouses. Ugh, I want to go back now!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer S.
Reviews.Content: Attempted to have dinner here last Friday (June 24). I was treating a friend, who had never been to this restaurant, to dinner. We arrived at 6:55pm and were informed it was a 20 minute wait for our party of 2--Not too bad, given it gets crowded. 30 minutes later we were told we could move into the inside waiting area and we were the next party of 2. After 45 minutes, I checked and was again informed we were the next party of 2. After an hour and seeing 3 different parties of 2 being seated before us I again confronted the host. He stated he informed me upfront the wait was about 20 minutes and the parties being seated were in front of us. (I actually saw two of the couples get out of their cabs, about 15 minutes into our wait) I unsure when about 20 minutes = an hour + but we decided to leave. Exceptionally disrespectful!!  Plenty of other great restaurants in Chicago.

Reviews.Author: Jordan H.
Reviews.Content: With all of the hype for this place, I was excited to go.  We showed up early on a Friday night (around 5:30), and were immediately seated inside.  We were the only couple at the time, but by the time we left, the room had filled entirely.We started with the empanadas - one beef, one chicken, and one corn.  The beef, although a bit greasy, was very good.  The chicken lacked really any flavor.  The corn was good, but I wish it had a bit more flavor - the corn seemed a bit muted.  Then came the salad - a total throwaway.  Why even bother?  The bread they served with it was good enough, although it was pretty run of the mill (and I hate when butter is served in packets).Entrees - I ordered the El Filet and she ordered some sort of seafood salad (with calamari, octopus, and mussels).  She was not impressed - don't get me wrong - it was a ton of seafood for $10, but it was pretty one-dimensional.  My steak was great, although whoever butchers their meat needs more practice - these things looked like they'd been hacked with a, well, hacksaw.  Cooked perfectly, however, and very flavorful.  Enough steak to feed two, for sure, so the $25 price tag was pretty astonishing.  The side (spinach mashed potatoes) was another throwaway - watery, lifeless and lacking any seasoning whatsoever, was a bit disappointing.We finished with a caramel cheesecake, which surprised both my wife and me in being very good.  Another steal at $5 for a relatively large piece of cheesecake.Aside from the food, we weren't impressed.  It was a hot day outside, and you could tell that inside - warm and muggy.  The waiters were still setting tables 30 minutes after they opened and not doing it quietly.  The candle on our table didn't fit in the candleholder, so it tilted ever so dauntingly, threatening to fall into our food or into our glasses of wine - we blew it out and moved it to the side (a good move, might I add, as there was little to no room on our table for our food, much less a candleholder).  Service was brash and surly.Honestly, I don't know if they had a bad night or if this is the norm and people give it a pass based on preconceived notions, but with all of the gems in this city, I wouldn't return.

Reviews.Author: Tony P.
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to this place, after several friends had recommended it, and the four-star rating (8/27/11) from Yelp was encouraging. Disappointed. The first time I called to make a reservation for a large party that same week, the person on the other end actually giggled, and hung up on me! As if I did not realize how busy they were. So, I called next time 3 weeks in advance - no problem. We still had to wait over 15 minutes past our reservation. No problem, it gets busy. Understandable. The problem was the whole package, including the food. Ambiance was lackluster. Closely packed together, noisy, and dimly lit (few candles on the table). I ordered the filet, and it was bland, and rubbery. Mash potatoes so-so. The saving grace is that the place is BYOB. So, our bill was reasonable. A good place to try for reasonable steakhouse. But, nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Author: Callie S.
Reviews.Content: My roommates and I finally went here after three years of wanting to try it.  Based on other reviews, I was expecting delicious unicorn meat with rainbows shooting out of it, and I was slightly disappointed.  Don't get me wrong, everything was quite tasty and came out much faster than I expected, but I was expecting fireworks and got sparklers.Cons: we had to ask a passing waiter if someone could take our order after sitting there for almost half an hour with no one acknowledging us, and it wasn't even that busy (we went on a Sunday evening).  Some of the tables are, indeed, smooshed up next to each other so you get to know the strangers beside you whether you like it or not.Pros: really warm atmosphere inside and the outdoor seating is lovely.  Also: MEAT!!!!

Reviews.Author: Scott R.
Reviews.Content: Tied for 1st as my favorite restaurant in Chicago.I love this place, and it's cheap if you compare it to going out to many other similar places.  The BYOB and affordable entres help keep the tab low, yet, it's hard to find an over all better dining experience in Chicago.The dimly lit, small rooms; all male wait staff; and welcoming ambiance give this place charm.  The long waits (no reservations) during prime hours simply gives my wife, family, friends, and I more time to spend together as we have a pre-dinner cocktail at a local bar--they call your cell when your table is ready, you just trot over.We've also popped a bottle of wine in the waiting room when I took my parents.  We enjoyed good wine and great surroundings as we spent time together waiting for our table.If you've never been, go!!!  Just don't expect a high class experience.  Expect a gem of an establishment tucked away in a great Chicago neighborhood.  Oh yeah, plan your night around this, it's not going to be a quick eat.

Reviews.Author: Rachel H.
Reviews.Content: This place. is. awesome.I'd heard good things so my expectations were high, and they exceeded my expectations.  The ambiance is just so cute.  Dim lighting, tango music playing, one long candlestick at your table.  Great for a date but definitely also can see it being ok for a group of friends.  Our waiter was awesome and the food was even better.  You could definitely split some of these dishes (especially the filet - there are 2 included), bringing the cost down even more.

Reviews.Author: Keli M.
Reviews.Content: Such an incredibly intimate setting.  It was like having 50 of your best friends sit in your living room for incredible steak.  I was a little thrown by how close the tables were at first, but once we sat down - loved the closeness and candle lit tables.  Hubby and I split one of the huge filets and let me tell you...it was delish!   Fun atmosphere with friends!

Reviews.Author: Karen U.
Reviews.Content: Best affordable dinner date for the meat lovers. Romantic candle lit atmosphere. BYOB. Make reservations 5-10 days early if you are going for dinner rush hours on weekends.

Reviews.Author: Kimi O.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite places for a laid back, romantic dinner with my husband.  Wait time is usually about an hour to an hour and a half if you arrive before 7 (it's easy to kill time by boutique shopping or hanging out at a nearby bar).  Can't go wrong with a couple of empanadas - we always order 1 beef and 1 chicken - and the filet dinner which we also share.  Waiters are always friendly, and the best part is being able to bring our selection of red wine.  Easily less than $50 for a fantastic meal for two!

Reviews.Author: Jessa P.
Reviews.Content: My beau thinks I am crazy because I love love love their black sausage. This place definitely has a romantic date atmosphere. It's dark, and loud. BYOB is nice, people usually bring a pre-dinner bottle just in case there's a long wait- the place gets packed during weekends. Service is definitely slower during rush times, but that is to be expected. Yummy food. Empanadas, black sausage, flank steak---yummy.

Reviews.Author: Ruki D.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this place! Discovered it about a year ago and have been a regular there since. Talk about bang for your buck!! Only problem I have with this place is that they take FOREVER to bring the food out. Not a good place to go when you are starving and want food right away. Expect at least a 45 minute wait for your entree's even on a slow day!

Reviews.Author: Jack L.
Reviews.Content: I'll keep it brief. The food is mediocre and overpriced. Nothing special about this place despite all the hype--as far as food is concerned. That said, service was fine and the restaurant is located in an amazing spot.

Reviews.Author: Dawnie L.
Reviews.Content: I am so impressed with what they do here.  They were spot on with every detail from there excellent service from Sky and the cooked to perfection filet.  Sky brought us the broiled argentian cheese with e.v.o.o. to try before our meal.  Simple salad which was nice with meal.  Flan to die for.  yummy yummy.  Prices are excellent.  $40.00 for two and you get enough food for four.  Look at posted pictures on their site.

Reviews.Author: Bryan H.
Reviews.Content: Simply amazing. BYOB and the filet for two...all you need to know.

Reviews.Author: iain w.
Reviews.Content: Best. Beef. Ever.

Reviews.Author: Aunnie P.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite restaurants in the city.  The atmosphere always has so much energy and the food is to die for.  As a BYOB, you would not expect the food to be as delicious as it is, but you can definitely head here with a bunch of girl friends, some red wine and not break the bank.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca M.
Reviews.Content: Amazing!!!Well worth the wait

Reviews.Author: Harry L.
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I, recently engaged in Argentina, were looking for a nice little BYOB place to enjoy dinner a couple of weeks ago when we stumbled on this gem.  We ended up ordering dishes which we had tried in Argentina, and they were authentic and very tasty.  I highly recommend the empanadas for an appetizer.  I guess my only complaint was that the waiting area was a bit disorganized, and two couples were seated ahead of us even though we arrived first.  But we were enjoying a nice glass of wine in the waiting area and were in no particular hurry anyway!  Total price of a meal for two, which ended up in leftovers aplenty for lunch for each of us the next day:  $38.  As satisfying as a meal in a fancy steakhouse, but a fraction of the price and a much more romantic atmosphere.  Give it a try.

Reviews.Author: Nick J.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago.  There is always a crazy long wait, but you can go have a few drinks at the bar a few shops down and they will call once they are ready.I usually order the El Filet , which is $24 ( think they raised the price from $20 recently) and it is actually 2 filets so I can split that.  The place is byob , which will save you a ton of money.  And most of the waiters are super friendly.

Reviews.Author: Alex G.
Reviews.Content: Great place!   I went on a Monday night and this place was packed.  That tells you how great the food is.  The place is small but that's what makes this spot a must.

Reviews.Author: calvin y.
Reviews.Content: wow, i couldn't believe how crowded it was on a tuesday night. the wait was like 40 minutes but it didn't seem too bad since i was with good company. the place was crowded and noisy but tolerable. the service was good. the food was good as well. the empanadas were light and tasty. for dinner, my friend got the chicken parmesan... wtf? argentinean steak house. he didnt get it but he's always been strange. me and the other friend got the grill plate for 2, but the portions were more like for 4. it was good. had a variety of meats... beef rib, sweetbreads, blood sausage, some other salty sausage and i think it was strip steak. i particularily like the blood sausage although my other friends looked as if they would yak. 55 bucks for dinner. crazy deal!overall, great value. the steak did seem like it was of a lower caliber but makes it up in price and quantity. no corkage fee makes this a real bargain.

Reviews.Author: Candice K.
Reviews.Content: Delicious. Great food and good service. It's a little loud so you should go with people you aren't trying to get to know (a.k.a. a date) because you won't be able to hear them. At all. Haha.

Reviews.Author: Sophia T.
Reviews.Content: Very dark ambience (which I liked) which made it a whole lot more intimate. There was also a live guitarist playing music. It was nice that it is byob.  On top of that the meat came in a huge hunk and was cooked well.  I liked the idea of sharing a large piece of meat over ordering separate steaks.  But again I think the atmosphere is what really made it great, on top of the food!

Reviews.Author: John I.
Reviews.Content: Wow.  I cant believe I have overlooked this place.. no longer!I went with three other people. I ordered my own bone in rib eye, which was great.  Two people split a large fillet mignon.  They were forced to pay $5 to split it, but they did get more salad as a result.  The 4th person ate the eggplant appetizer for their main meal, and loved it.  Combine the above meal with being BYOB, and our tab was only $66.  A great value!

Reviews.Author: Jeff H.
Reviews.Content: I wish you could give 1/2 stars for this very reason.  4.5 stars!  How have I never been to this place.  It was outstanding.  We had a large group of 15, and they were great with us.  I had a veal t-bone that was as good as the one I had at MK.   The byo factor was fantastic, and kept dinner per person under $35... i'll be going back soon!

Reviews.Author: Jim M.
Reviews.Content: At a great time. Best combination of steak and byob in the city.  Just  be prepared for the crowds.

Reviews.Author: A B.
Reviews.Content: I like this place, where else can you get two filets for $20 dollar range?  I always get the filet so I can't comment on the other menu items.  The food is good, it's an Argentine steak house, although the food does not really taste as great as the food in Argentina does.  It is BYOB which is good and it's a great value.  I typically go early evening when there is no wait and have always been seated right away.  Keep in mind it's a small space and pretty cramped, so if you're looking for an intimate dinner spot this is not it!!

Reviews.Author: ashley a.
Reviews.Content: This is one of my top places in Chicago. It was my first thought when I had my meat and potatoes loving brother coming to Chicago to spend his birthday with me. My sister and her boyfriend who flew in for the occasion would love it as well. Two hour quoted wait? Fine. We had drinks to get to while we caught up with each other and worked up an appetite. Three hours later, we figured we'd head to the door and see if we were near. This is probably where we made our mistake. Yes... ignorance is bliss. I wish we hadn't talked to the other waiting patrons that were eerily beginning to resemble an angry mob outside. I learned that our mistake was not slipping the door guy some cash. Even offering to break up our party, or squeeze into a smaller table produced no results. I watched as people that had been waiting less entered first. Sometimes I despise my naive trust in people. Four hours from the time we put our name in, we finally got the call. By this time we were gagging down fried appetizers from the late night menu at Blue Bayou. Yuck. I hate that one of two nights my family's in town has been wasted in what could have been fixed with twenty bucks. So, if you want delicious food in under four hours? Bring cash money.

Reviews.Author: Bill J.
Reviews.Content: What a good good day with that El Filet.  Poppin' bottles of vino, housing empanadas/blood sausage/fancy cheese dish/eggplant apps followed by the main course with the spinach mashed potatoes.Truly an unbelievable experience, I'll be back for another round of El Filet.

Reviews.Author: Scott H.
Reviews.Content: Other than the wait (which is totally ridiculous in a city with so many great steak restaurants), the service once seated is great and the food is very good (3 1/2 out of 5 stars).  It's definitely a place to go with a group (since I hear you can make reservations for 6 or more) and if you want to over-indulge in a carnivourous mess.  And, everyone probably thinks this place is better than it really is because you wait for 2 hours to sit down, so you hit the bar next door (Cullens or Blue Bayou), drink a ton, and then go back and have BYOB at Tango Sur and are drunk by the time dinner is over.  We went with another couple and had a great time though, although 2 1/2 hours is too insane to have me wanting to come back.  It's a good "experience" but I'd much rather hit a better steakhouse somewhere in River North of near the loop.  And yes, everyone is right when they say it's inexpensive ($60 per couple, including two appetizers, a ton of meat, 2 espressos, and tip)...but we spent $50 per couple at the bar next door during our wait, plus another $30 on bottles of wine, so it's a wash.Believe what everyone says on the wait...we got there at 7pm on Saturday night and were seated at 9:30pm.

Reviews.Author: Juan B.
Reviews.Content: Went on a Monday no wait, and loved the steak.  Got it as rare as humanely possible - great meat and the garlic sauce complemented the meal really well!

Reviews.Author: Brad S.
Reviews.Content: My favorite thing about Tango Sur is the setting: a small, dimly lit room with delicious aromas and good tunes.  I had a very relaxing candle-lit dinner with a couple friends on a cold winter night.  We had to wait around an hour to be called for our table, but there was a bar a couple doors down...so the wait wasn't a problem.  The food and service was really good.  The cuisine is hearty Argentinian, so make sure you bring your appetite.  The prices were reasonable too, so you won't have to worry too much about overdrafting your bank account.

Reviews.Author: chriss t.
Reviews.Content: I've been here over five times and it has become one of my fave places if I'm craving meat...I mean really flavorful succulent meat *drool.* Here are the pluses: 1. It's low key, lively, but still romantic, great for a date or to come as a group, 2. Food hands down awesome... 3. Service great 4. BYOB.  Only downside is they don't take reservations so the wait is usually long unless you come really early. I've waited anywhere between half an hr to 2 hrs. Yes 2hrs for food! But by the time we for got our food we forgot about how TS made wait so long as we stuffed ourselves with meaty happiness.

Reviews.Author: allison a.
Reviews.Content: Um... I don't get it.One Friday night over the summer, my bf and I were looking for a BYOB place and he mentioned Tango Sur. We picked up a bottle of wine, biked over... and found the wait was over 3 hours. I thought to myself, "This place must be awesome!" and couldn't wait to go back.Fast forward a few months. My bf and I decide it would be a good idea to to try again, this time right after work. We get in no problem and I immediately love the ambiance. The service was good, and the overall vibe was really cool.The important part - the food - was not so great. We ordered a mozarella, red pepper and spinach salad to start. It was mostly mozarella, and though the menu said "fresh," it tasted like it was off the grocery store shelf. I ordered the filet, cooked medium, with mashed potatoes. My bf ordered lemon chicken with Argentine-style potatoes. My steak was NOT GOOD. The seasoning was good, but the steak was not cooked properly and was incredibly stringy and chewey. I ate half and could not eat any more- my mouth was tired from chewing. I had to saw at it with my knife in order to eat it. I probably should have just eaten it with my hands. My bf said his chicken was good, and I liked my mash potatoes, but overall this place did not leave a good taste in my mouth (har har).I don't get it. Nice ambiance, but the food is not worth the wait nor the hype. I think there are far better BYOB places in Lakeview than Tango Sur. Maybe I'm missing something...

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth P.
Reviews.Content: I came here on Saturday with a group of 12 friends and it was a lot of fun, a very enjoyable dinner and experience! Not only was the food very good, but the service was outstanding. It is so busy in there, I can only imagine the stress of the waiters. Our waiter was really good to us. There were two other larger parties there at the same time as us and he told us upfront that if we ordered our food within 5 minutes, we wouldn't have to wait so long. That was really nice of him, he didn't have to do that!Everyone enjoyed their dinner. I do not eat red meat, but I highly recommend the lemon chicken, it was outstanding as well as the empanadas, the best I have had so far!Lastly, you can't go wrong with BYOB! I will definitely go back!

Reviews.Author: P H.
Reviews.Content: Pros: EXCELLENT STEAKS!!!Cons: Cramped dining room. Not good for large groups.What you should know: Make reservations/call ahead! or you will be waiting 2 hours or more during dinner hours.  Its a BYOB establishment.  If you show up and there is a wait, you can give them your name and cell phone number and they will call you when your up.The restaurant has a nice warm feeling to it, however seating is pretty cramped.  Candle lit dining which is nice. It could be romantic when its not that busy.  They have excellent steaks that are priced around $20-30.,

Reviews.Author: Luis S.
Reviews.Content: The restaurant is truly argentinian, and to some extent it is a symbol of argentinian culture in Chicago. They have a large selection of steak plates and it is quite inexpensive.The only problem is that the quality of food is not so great. The beef that they use is not the best you can find. And I would prefer if they offered baked empanadas.

Reviews.Author: Erin M.
Reviews.Content: AWESOME experience. Went early (530pm) on Saturday. No wait, the wait staff was super attentive. The food was amazing- huge steaks for such a reasonable price. Obviously BYOB with no corkage fee is a little slice of heaven. Absolutely no complaints. My new favorite restaurant in Chicago.

Reviews.Author: amanda M.
Reviews.Content: I tried Tango Sur for the first time last night with my roommate and we both absolutely loved it! The service was great, the food was delicious, and the whole experience was very satisfying. I will definitely be going back soon, and often.

Reviews.Author: Kelly M.
Reviews.Content: AWESOMENESS .. I always take friends there for big group get togethers or when people are visiting from out of town. Sometimes there's a wait, but I live close by so it's not bad. The customer service is good .. it's BYOB ... I love the atmosphere .. bit fan!

Reviews.Author: Amber N.
Reviews.Content: Were were a party of 6 and decided to try Tango Sur because they're BYOB and they take reservations. I was really looking forward to it because there is always a wait outside, and I love the kind of food they serve.It was just ok. First, they ushered us into this dark cave like waiting room and left us there for about 10 minutes. I would have preferred to wait outside instead of in an airless room. Second, they give you a dining window; ours was supposed to be 7-9pm. However, they didn't seat us until 7:20 and then were trying to usher us out at 9. Throughout the meal the server was hustling, trying to get us out of there quickly. I didn't appreciate that. The food was just ok. The biggest thing it has in its favor is that it's BYOB, but I won't be going back.

Reviews.Author: Eric S.
Reviews.Content: Food was good, but service pretty poor and lessened the overall experience. Reservations mean nothing; we still had to wait over 30 min. Fun for small groups too.

Reviews.Author: Bill L.
Reviews.Content: Great early Friday evening dinner. Arrived at just before 6:00 w/o reservation. Just in time. Packed by time we left at 7:45. Staff couldn't have been friendlier. Food great for $$. Made me want steak at Don Julio in Buenos Aires. Will be back BEFORE 7:00 or w/reservation.

Reviews.Author: Lisa P.
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful! We had a reservation on Sunday for 7:30 and arrived at 7:15. It looked like there was a long wait with how many people were standing outside. We were seated right away to the great little table for two. It was very busy so the restaurant was kind of loud but that really did not matter. There is no corkage fee and our waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu. ORDER THE EMPANADAS! They are so yummy and you have to eat them with the chimichuri they give you. I had the Tall Grass Sirloin and it was perfectly cooked with the spinach mashed potatoes...deeeelicious! The food was amazing and the price was awesome for what you received. I would say the need better steak knives though..Overall, excellent service and food for a reasonable price! I highly recommend making a reservation though.

Reviews.Author: Ryan W.
Reviews.Content: Get ready for MEAT! We didn't have reservations, arrived on a Sunday evening, and were informed of an hour wait for a table inside. (The decor is very quaint and tempted us mightily.) However, we took a table outside with no wait. (They had heaters; it was cool.) The service was authentic and attentive, the food was straightforward and delicious. TONS OF MEAT! Had a great steak, the Castaleta, while my partner had the filet, which was billed as smaller and more tender. Sure. But he was served 2 of these "smaller, more tender" options! Actually, we were quite satisfied, and everything was VERY reasonably priced. Haven't walked out of a steakhouse with an appetizer and entree in my belly for under $40 ever, but I did on this night.

Reviews.Author: Art H.
Reviews.Content: Love this steak house. Good quality meats & huge portions!

Reviews.Author: Stuart W.
Reviews.Content: I love this place.  It's warm, BYOB and reasonable.  The food is excellent, but the atmosphere is what sold me.

Reviews.Author: Irene O.
Reviews.Content: BYOB, great lighting, yummy food.. a place everyone should try!

Reviews.Author: Karen E.
Reviews.Content: One of the best affordable, BYOB steak joint. I always order the fillet which always turned out juicy and it simply melts in your mouth. Enjoyed their empanadas and flan as well. Ambiance is great for a date or dinner with a group of friends. The wait might be frustrating so be patient. The staff might be less than attentive but remember you are there for the food.

Reviews.Author: Debbie V.
Reviews.Content: We received a very good review from a friend and decided to try the argentine place. We arrived at 6:15 pm on a wednesday evening. They took our name and number of guest and placed us in the holding room. While waiting they popped our corks and gave us glasses while we waited for our table. It was only 30 minutes. Alot quicker than we have heard in the past. The service was pretty good and the food was outstanding. I would definitely go back and make sure you get there early and bring your own supply of alcohol. Great Job!!! The Carmel Flan was outstanding. The Fondu appetizer was out of this world. El Filet was delicious with spinach mash potatoes.

Reviews.Author: Eli G.
Reviews.Content: not for the weak of heart.  Also, literally.  Huge slabs of argentinian beef, cooked to perfection.  BYOB without a corking fee.  Awesome.  The only concerning part was the drastic dimming of the lights as soon as our steaks arrived - pure coincidence, I am sure.Oh, and trust me on this - when Argentinians say: "this steak is perfect for two" - that means "four".

Reviews.Author: t s.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. The portions are incredibly large,  food  for two days. The melted cheese app is to die for as are the empanadas. I have no problem waiting to eat a meal here.

Reviews.Author: Stacey S.
Reviews.Content: I went to Tango Sur this past Saturday with 13 other girls for my sisters birthday and it was AMAZING in both food and atmosphere. Bottles of wine were flowing all around us in the warm, packed candle-lit room. I had the bife visuvio and it was soooo freaking good. They also bring out this sauce for everyone to dip their food in and it was the topic of conversation for the rest of the night (delicious but woah garlic). The servers are all a pleasure to look at and speak with as well. WARNING: They are always super busy but only take reservations for parties of 6+ otherwise plan to wait in the "waiting area" in the back of the restaurant where you can drink too. Also, portions are very large so be prepared to have left overs if you don't share with someone.

Reviews.Author: Jackie V.
