Reviews.Content: Went there this past weekend for my sister's BDay! The Food was great & liked that it was BYOB :-) The pricing was reasonable too. My only complaint is the parking, everything is permit parking since it's near Wrigley...So I recommend to come early to find public parking & make reservations because it gets packed!

Reviews.Author: A R.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING!  You must be joking if you give this less than 5 starts!  Or just mad you had to wait for an hour to eat (totally worth it).  Don't miss this gem if you like steak (or food in general).  And the chimichurri sauce is TO DIE FOR!  Did I mention it is BYOB?  Worth every penny and minute you spend drooling thinking about the food before you sit down.

Reviews.Author: rabia c.
Reviews.Content: woohoo! NICE!My bf and I went there just to see what the fuss is about. we were there 5.10 / 5.15 pm. there was no wait we were seated right away.But in fifteen minutes the place was full. we had a very nice waiter who was Mexican - sorry forgot his name :( we had the grill for two and it was soooo nice. I liked that they serve salad before the main. About the grill: It was really delicious. We love red meat and my bf is really snob when it comes to food.We were both like; yeah!!!BYOB is a nice thing for that place.It's definitely a plus. You don't have to drink what the menu offers.You have your own selection.Another reason I liked that place is it's casual: you don't have to dress up to have a good dinner.And there were people - Argentinian more than likely- that makes you feel you're in a real ethnic place not an American version of it.We also had desert which I cannot remember what.It was something with peach in it. That was delicious too.The only complaint I might have is the grill gets cold fast.They can leave some ember in the grill which might keep it warm and you can just enjoy it even at the last bite!! Greedy? yeah may be Last word:Be prepared for leftoversGoing there again? OH YES!!

Reviews.Author: Kimberly C.
Reviews.Content: I say go on Monday nights.... Its not crowded and they cook your steak properly that night. Ive had other issues with under or over cooked steaks. I feel bad sending it back, and when i have it came back again under or over cooked... but you cant complain about a delicious $15 steak salad and bread rolls and BYOB... so i just go on Mondays when i know they are going to have more time to get it prepared just right.

Reviews.Author: Giraffee T.
Reviews.Content: I loved this restaurant and have been here a few times in the past year and the experience has always been wonderful. The steak is juicy and never overcooked and the wait staff is always courteous. However, it is getting one star now because I have been waiting for more than an hour for a table for two. It is 11:14 p.m now, Saturday. While we knew that the line is usually long for a Saturday night, I am very unhappy now because the host is an ass! He had been telling us that  our table will be ready in the next 5-10min for the last half hour. After waiting for an hour, he seats a table of 6 - and those people came in way after us. While I understand the restaurant is doing it for money, I still think it is very rude to make customers wait only to let others jump the queue. If you, like us, prefer to be respected as paying patrons, then take your money elsewhere. I'm sure there are other great steak places in Chicago where you won't have to put up with dishonest and rude host. Nope, not one word of apology from that curly hair pasty face ass. Just a smirk smile. The least he could do was be honest so we could have gone somewhere else for dinner!! I am never coming back again, but I thought others who are in parties less than 6 should know Tango Sur's seating policy.

Reviews.Author: Steven S.
Reviews.Content: Need a place to bring a date? This is the place. Great steaks, great value, and great atmosphere. Make sure to come early or you will be waiting to get a table...but dont worry though. They have a back room where you can start drinking since it is BYOB! Also make sure you get the provolone cheese appetizer...soooo good!

Reviews.Author: Eli L.
Reviews.Content: Great place and Great steaks. Its also BYOB as well..The food and service were good..make sure to set a reservation cause you mite wait a while since so many people go..

Reviews.Author: Maressa S.
Reviews.Content: Love this place. Yeah the wait can be ridiculous, but the food is so good. And its byo, which is always a plus. Try the grilled provolone appetizers. Amazing value. I went with a friend and we split the app and each got an entree. The total was under forty dollars.

Reviews.Author: Jenny A.
Reviews.Content: Love this place! Me and the bf went on a Sunday before the dinner rush and long waits. As soon as we got there we got a seat on the patio. Such a beautiful day to be on the patio and we brought our wine because its BYOB. We started off with the empanadas which are a must! We got the beef and spinach/cheese. For our entree we ordered the PARA DOS. It had an assortment of meat the beef short rib and steak were great. I tried the intestine? first which I thought was pork until my bf told me it was intestine then I stopped eating it :p. I wasn't a big fan of the sausages either. Its a great restaurant to get your bang for your buck.

Reviews.Author: Shareli A.
Reviews.Content: Getting a table was a bit of  wait but the Food is really good! Service is great (Our waiter was awesome)!  I would definately recommend this restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Megan S.
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to wait......but....you will be very happy you did. Definitely eat inside. I love the ambiance they have going on; date night perfection. The food was to die for. My boyfriend literally dreamed about his steak for a week (he's weird). Writing this review makes me want to go back right now. Ps...it's BYOB. Uh...yes.

Reviews.Author: Monica D.
Reviews.Content: No frills service but an amazing menu that will never disappoint. No reservations are taken, so get there early or be prepared to wait. Tango Sur is BYOB and no one looks at you funny if you bring in a bottle per person, even around 3pm.

Reviews.Author: Zachary P.
Reviews.Content: It was bazaar...I walked in to find my friends birthday party and was accosted (yes accosted) by the host...the fight or flight instinct kicked in and then I realized, WTF, I'm a guest in their restaurant and my first impression was one of near violence...there is something wrong with this picture.

Reviews.Author: Luis A.
Reviews.Content: Great food. Worth the wait. No wonder Argentineans take pride on their meat.

Reviews.Author: Michael B.
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment.  We wanted to love this place, but from start to finish, it just didn't live up to the hype.  Our first concern came when my partner put our name in while I parked the car.  We were told 20-30 minutes; however, if we wanted an outside table it "could be 2 hours or more".  Really?  And who is going to fill those tables?  No one had arrived yet, and when I called to get a reservation earlier in the evening, he said it was "first come first serve".  So, what's the story?  So...we stand outside for 15 minutes or so with no one around and then all of a sudden a man and woman come up to the host and say "two".  He says "inside or out?" and then ushers them to a prime table right outside.  Are you kidding me?!  So, I approach him and say, "excuse me, but we have been waiting and these people were just seated in front of us".  He interrupts me to say, "they came an hour ago".  You gotta be kidding me.  Not a minute after, he says to us, "this way", and proceeds to usher us to this table at the end of the outdoor area in front of a 7-eleven type store that lights up the tables in this area in a trashy sort of way.  So much for a romantic outside table.  So, we think...we're out of the woods.  Not so.  We sit for another 10 minutes, watching everyone around us who comes after us get served before our waiter finally comes up after 15 minutes.  That would be the 1st of 4 times the entire 2 1/2 hour meal that we see him.  So, we order...and wait.20 minutes later, our appetizer arrives. The empanadas were decent, although nothing amazing.  The salad arrives 20 minutes later (consisting of plain salad with two tomatoes and two onions on top - vinegar and oil containers, should you want dressing).  So, we finish this and wait.  And wait.  And wait.  And wait some more.  After about an hour (and one trip by him to say, "food should be here shortly"), our food arrives.  The steaks/grill, although it did have some flavor, was WAY overcooked on the grill, and the meat, as a whole, was extremely grizzly and hard to chew.  What a disappointment.  For a place that specializes in steaks, this place was a huge let-down.  After sitting another 45 minutes with no return of our waiter, I finally had to go find him inside the restaurant to let him know we were ready to leave.  What a joke.  While the prices weren't terrible for a steakhouse, what difference does it make when the food is disappointing and the service is terrible?  We won't be returning to this place.  If you decide to try this place (as we had been excited to do), be warned.  You're unlikely to have this raving experience people have been reporting on here (and I really wanted to like this place and the atmosphere - however, there are plenty of other places that can live up to the hype).  My advice, avoid this pretentious place and eat at one of the other restaurants along this strip.  You will never miss it.

Reviews.Author: xavier n.
Reviews.Content: Food is above average especially the steaks. Problems occur when dealing with the service and wait times. Worth a try

Reviews.Author: Casey N.
Reviews.Content: My favorite restaurant in Chicago.  HUGE portions, BYOB with no corking fee, and the best ribeye i've ever had.

Reviews.Author: Esmeralda B.
Reviews.Content: Great place! Came here to celebrate my dads birthday with 7other people on a Sunday afternoon. We got seated right away. we all tried different shared plates and they were all amazing. The empandas were great, my fav was chicken. You can't beat the prices! My husband and my shared plate was 40 bucks!!!! We all were stuffed and still had food lefts over to take home. We had not problems street par king either.

Reviews.Author: Carlos S.
Reviews.Content: Love this place! I always though as the BYOB places as somewhat subpar, but this place proved me wrong...  Walk down the street pick your fav bottle on wine before dinner..

Reviews.Author: Kimberly H.
Reviews.Content: I give the food a 5, but the process to actually get seated is a 1, so an overall 3 it is.  The food here is amazing.  I love the empanadas, and I've had the Filet and the Vesuvio, both giant pieces of wonderfully seasoned meat, the vesuvio oozes creamy cheesy, spinach stuffing.  I like the seasoned potatoes better than the spinach mashed potatoes, and the side salad adds a nice bit of greens.  Once seated the service was very good.The process of getting seated is a joke.  The doormen give the runaround about reservation rules, act like they've lost your reservation, then tell you you have to wait 40 minutes, then magically find a table.  I get that they can do this because everyone knows that it's BYOB (and you can crack your bottle of wine in the waiting room), combined with the deliciousness of the food makes it worth the wait.  Thing is, there are lots of great places to eat in the city where there won't be wishy-washy business to get seated, so I won't being going back to Tango Sur as often as my taste buds would like.

Reviews.Author: Matt P.
Reviews.Content: Great dinner spot...very difficult to get into though.  The portions were unbelievable and the quality of the meat was fantastic.  The meat was a little undercooked for medium rare and the restaurant is rather loud and crowded but overall a great experience.  Amazingly, no corking fee which is always a plus...byob!

Reviews.Author: Jennie S.
Reviews.Content: Fabulous- First time in Chicago and my boyfriend and I decided to try this place our since a friend recommended. The wait was very long (about 2 hours at 7 on a saturday). But we put out name in and just drank at the local bars until the restaurant called to let us know our table was ready. The food was great, the atmosphere was fun and unique. The portion sizes were huge (couldn't even eat half of our meals after we got our salads and app), and the prices were very nicely priced for what we got. Also, being out of town we didn't have any booze on us, but its BYOB which is always great.

Reviews.Author: Adrian G.
Reviews.Content: For straight up great grilled meat at a reasonable price!  The chimichurri is great.  BYOB makes it even more worthwhile.  La parrillada is the best bet for couples or groups.Keep it going!

Reviews.Author: Joe G.
Reviews.Content: Good deal, although the wait is a pain in the ass.  Get there early or late.

Reviews.Author: Simon N.
Reviews.Content: This is a place that I had herd a lot about, and I am a sucker for a great steak so I decided to check it out.  Wow, was I impressed!  Although its not a big place, and you might feel a little l "cozy" while dining, the food is KNOCK YOUR SOCKS OFF good.  The steak was made perfectly, and the chimichuri sauce is something you DO NOT want to pass on.  I am normally an A1 fanatic and will not eat a steak without it, but the chimichuri sauce made me forget A1 even existed!  I went for my birthday and had a good group of 8 or so with me, which was probably the max Id be able to fit in the space.  Great people, great ambiance and great food, I will definitely be back again and again and again.

Reviews.Author: Agnes S.
Reviews.Content: I went there on a weekend evening and we were seated outside about 10 minutes after we came in. The waiter was friendly and service was prompt. The food was delicious. We had steak (amazing and definitely enough for two people), the antipasto, a few other sides and brought our own wine. The price was right considering the location and BYOB, but the corking fee was about $7 which was a tiny downfall because that's about a third of what the wine cost from Que Syrah across the street. Overall, I would return at a non peak time for some steak and wine. Great date location!

Reviews.Author: Kat R.
Reviews.Content: I'm very disappointed to write this review because I've been wanting to try this place for a while and, unfortunately, don't have many good things to say.  I made a reservation for my birthday, so we had a decent size party.  Service was ok at first.  It's the food that killed it.  My mother orderered a steak that was half burned & half pink.  She's a very nice lady, so she struggled through it until the waiter came back.  After she told him, he did nothing.  We also told management; they did nothig.  As a matter of  fact, we sensed some arrogance as the manager said "ok" and walked away.  We paid the bill and left.  I don't think I'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Katalina B.
Reviews.Content: i last came here on a date in march (but before that, it had been years and i wanna say they were closer to addison). it was packed, as usual, but the wait wasn't too terrible. the ambience is great-- dark with candlelight. the tables are a bit close together, but still not too noisy. the service was pretty good. we brought wine, which is a plus to the whole BYOB concept. we had the spinach and ricotta empanadas and the lomo relleno-- absolutely delicious! my date is from south america and he was impressed, so i was happy that he enjoyed it. definitely check it out if you have the time. tango sur is good for groups, too.

Reviews.Author: Brian B.
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty cool little restaurant but I'm not sure what to do with it. I took the girlfriend out for a date night to plow through some beef. The wait was pretty substantial (Toons down the street is a great place to wait it out) but that was clear when I put my name on the list. The dining room was super dark and mostly candle lit which is nice for a date night but it was also way too crowded and loud which isn't ideal for the same purpose. The empenadas were a little dry but still flavorful. The real issue comes in with the steak I got. I don't remember what kind of cut I got but what does stick in my mind is how gristly it was. This really ruins a meat driven meal even though the sauces, sides and meat temperature were fantastic. I will definitely come back (probably with a more boisterous crowd) in hopes this steak was just a fluke.

Reviews.Author: Rob S.
Reviews.Content: I went here with some friends and had a blast, so much food!

Reviews.Author: Amy A.
Reviews.Content: I always leave Tango Sur happy. The wait can be long at times but being BYOB and designated seating in the back with wine glasses provided it really is never an issue. All the food is delicious but my favorite is definitely the corn and cheese empanadas and the 'el filet' which is such a great price for 2 filets! Perfect for sharing. Spinach mashed potatoes ... Mmm. The atmosphere is lively & loud.. Perfect for groups. Looking around the dining room whenever I come here, everybody is ALWAYS having a great time.

Reviews.Author: Andrew F.
Reviews.Content: I used to love this place but I ate there last week and the food quality has went downhill.  For steak being a specialty here it certainly didn't seem that way.  My friend and I both ordered the same cut medium rare and both came out charred.  Not only was it overcooked, more than half of the steak was gristle.  Anyway, I won't be back here for a while...they need to get their act back together.

Reviews.Author: Katie C.
Reviews.Content: This is a great date spot.  I've only been once because I couldn't stand the wait, but all in all, it's worth it!  Fantastic steaks, and nice music.  Make sure to bring a bottle or two (one for dinner, and one for the wait).  If you go back into the "waiting" room, they will set you up with some glasses and a cork screw.  I really can't wait to go back during the summer to sit on the patio.

Reviews.Author: Ryan J.
Reviews.Content: Food was good, but it took them two hours (!) to serve our food, and then they asked us to hurry up because they needed our table for another party.  Additionally, it's so dark in the back that I expected to find bats sleeping in there.  Good food, but would not go back.

Reviews.Author: Michelle J.
Reviews.Content: Can't find any juicy steak like the ones here in Chicago. And the price is very reasonable. I gave it 5 stars!

Reviews.Author: Ali C.
Reviews.Content: My favorite place and it's BYOB. Atmosphere is wonderful and reminds me of a tiny place you'd see in Europe with the small tables, candle light, and people packed together. All men waiters and even though this place is always packed the service is always good.No corkage fee either if you have a party with more than 8 they'll let you make a reservation otherwise it's first come first serve.

Reviews.Author: Bryan K.
Reviews.Content: I have had the steak and salmon here, both have always been excellent! You get a lot of food for a good price, and it's BYOB! This is by far one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago!

Reviews.Author: Leslie F.
Reviews.Content: I finally went to Tango Sur. I agree with most of the reviews - the food was great, the portions were huge, service was quick and helpful. And of course, prices are reasonable and it's BYOB. I would recommend you make a reservation, as many others have mentioned and we forgot. We had to wait 45 minutes for a table for two on a Tuesday, which wasn't a problem because we just walked around Southport and waited for the call.

Reviews.Author: Gigi A.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is a great place to enjoy a great dinner with friends. It' also a great date place. I love the setting and the food is delicious.  Make sure you make a reservation or you will be waiting a long time. I love the BYOB option.

Reviews.Author: CJ E.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is a staple of the South Port Corridor. The food is very good, and very well portioned, when reading the menu, the description of the items may all read the same, but trust me, what you get is very unique and different. I have frequented this place enough, to know the Vasio is very good plate, for a dinner for two. The meal is great and comes with Sweet Potatoes on the sides. In many instances am pretty certain you will not eat all the food provided as its so plentiful. The best time to visit this place is during the spring and summer nights when you can sit outdoors, the inside is very cozy and quaint, but also very, very noisy. You can go there with your significant other for a cozy dinner, but be aware, it's very loud, and tables are close to each other so, be prepare to share your intimate moment with your table neighbors. Best recommendations is to go there with a group of friends, have everyone bring a bottle of wine (BYOB) order different entrees, and appetizer the table can share, and also at the end pick the different desert to allow everyone to try something, the price is reasonable and wont break the bank. Once you have a meal at Tango Sur, be prepare to go back home, get on the couch and veg. Several times I've attempted to eat at Tango Sur and go down to the Bars on Southport and have been unsuccessful, as I am too full from dinner to go anywhere but home. Things to try: The cheese & spinach empanada, their side salad to me is always lacking and I rarely eat. The Deserter Options are very decadent and Rich. Things to know: Be prepared to wait for at least 45-60 minutes, during Friday-Sunday in the winter, and summer nights anytime past 6 PM prepare for a long wait. The cost is very reasonable, as you get more than what you pay for. Best Recommendation, go there put your name on the list give your cell number, walk down to the Jewel to get your wine, or stop by a local bar, and have a cocktail as you wait.

Reviews.Author: Dan H.
Reviews.Content: I think this place is great! The portions are huge and the cuts of meat are terrific! It is BYOB with no corking fee! It is always packed so a bit of a pain to get a table on the weekends. I also find it a bit dark, but truly worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: A B.
Reviews.Content: I would only come to this place if I was craving steak because that is the only thing I ate that I really liked. But as far as steak goes, it was delicious and very reasonably priced PLUS it's byob, doesn't get much better than that!

Reviews.Author: derek m.
Reviews.Content: Great steaks and sauces.  Be aware you probably have to tip the host to get sat on the weekends.  I had friends in town and raved about the place and we never got sat(4 hour wait before we left).  People that showed up after us got sat before us(with the same number of people).  Now, I only go during the week. P.S. My last experience last week was great.  The waiter was very attentive and the steaks were cooked perfectly.

Reviews.Author: Alex B.
Reviews.Content: If you like busy atmosphere with GREAT food.  This is the place for you.  The first time I went here I could believe how great the food was.  I also couldn't believe that there was no corkage fee.  If you are looking for a very reasonably priced steakhouse with wonderful food, this is the place!

Reviews.Author: Antonio F.
Reviews.Content: Churrasqueria! ...Fairly 3.5 stars.If you eat a meat lover, then go for the "parrillada para dos", it was very good, though  a bit salty for my palate. It's a BYOB place, so that's plus!Cons: it's usually crowded and is a relative small place. Parking is a nightmare.Suggestion: try to go early so you'll get a quick table and easy parking of course.

Reviews.Author: Miguel C.
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of my fav joints in Chicago. Any first timers should try their feasts. The food is amazing. Some drawbacks are that is really small and it's too dark at times.

Reviews.Author: Mike S.
Reviews.Content: Before I tried this place I had heard nothing but excellent things about the food, the fact that its BYOB, etc.  So I went into this with an open mind.  I knew about the possible long wait times, but was promised it would be all worth it when the food was served. Meh.The combination of the extremely cramped quarters, LOUD LOUD LOUD groups of people ( I'm talking drunk as a skunk laughing and almost fallin over each other loud ), and the HEAT made it a pretty unpleasant experience.  DAMN it was hot as hell in there.  I seriously broke a sweat just sitting at the table eating.  The candles didn't help.  It's a nice ambiance, but kick on the a/c could ya?  As for the food, the empanadas were good.  I had the spinach, chicken, and steak, and all were equally delicious.  The chimichurri sauce was excellent.  For the main course I ordered el filet, which is filet mignon with spinach mashed potatoes.  I ordered the steak medium, and wasn't very impressed at all.  Rather than the meat melting in my mouth, I had to fight my way through each bite.  And the potatoes, well they definitely had a spinach taste to them, but they were so green that I wondered if they weren't colored with food coloring to make them green.  The only reason I gave it three stars is the fact they allow BYOB, which saves a lot of money.  Otherwise, I was not impressed.  El Nandu on Fullerton had much better steak, in my opinion.

Reviews.Author: Dawn D.
Reviews.Content: I went here recently for a friends birthday.  The food was good, but the service was a little slow.

Reviews.Author: Kristen M.
Reviews.Content: Delicious and very reasonable priced BYOB. Portions are easily sharable and ambiance is perfect for a date night. If you have a large party you can make a reservation, however if you have a small party it is first come first serve. They are super nice and will take down your cell number and give you a call when your table is ready. With all of the Southport bars nearby, it is easy to grab a drink while you wait!

Reviews.Author: Chase F.
Reviews.Content: Food was excellent. We had a dish for two and it was reasonably priced. The food took a while to come out but that's to be expected at a steakhouse. The ambiance was very romantic, very argintinian and fun to experience. I would particularly recommend this to lovers (or soon to be) on a date night. Also, most have already mentioned this but this place is BYOB, really makes for a cheap night overall. They also don't take reservations so show up early before the line forms.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth P.
Reviews.Content: The food at Tango Sur is 3-4 stars, but we had such a long, frustrating wait for a table that it knocked the experience down to 2.  I wouldn't have minded the wait if they had given us close to an accurate estimate when we arrived, but first they told us an hour and then kept saying "ten to twenty minutes" for another hour.  It was a very nice Friday night and they are BYOB so we expected a wait - but the guys in charge of seating clearly had no idea which tables just sat down, which tables were getting ready to leave, etc.  Simply put, Tango Sur did a rotten job of managing the wait list.On the plus side, the empanadas were outstanding and my filet (a huge portion) was cooked exactly as I ordered it.  I was a little disappointed in the spinach mashed potatoes because I had heard such great things, but in the end they were, um, mashed potatoes with some spinach.  Go to Tango Sur and bring a bottle of wine or three - but either be prepared to wait for an indeterminate amount of time, or go during the week when it's not so busy.

Reviews.Author: Meyke K.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur definitely knows how to do meat. Super juicy, succulent, delicious meat.. Great price and portions... Highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: emily a.
Reviews.Content: I can't say much except they have out of this world's stakes . The price is so reasonable try Vacio with sweet potato. I would go to Chicago for having their stake!

Reviews.Author: Kim J.
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of this place I was very excited to go.  Unfortunately, my New Years Eve meal was not very good.  We ordered the cold seafood salad to start and that was tasty.  I then ordered the Bone in Ribeye and it was really bad.  It basically had no flavor other than the garlic sauce and the meat itself was very stringy and seemed to be of poor quality.  It was also too tough for that cut of meat.  My husband had the filet and it had good flavor but was also tougher than it should be.  We both had the spinach mashed potatoes and they tasted watery.  Not my favorite meal but it didn't cost too much and it was BYOB so that's good.

Reviews.Author: Tracy L.
Reviews.Content: Dear Amigos at Tango Sur,You are such a charming restaurant!  You are so fantastically popular that you always have a waiting list going.  As your neighbors around the corner, we salute your thriving business when so many others on the block have shuttered.And yet, we ask, dear amigos, why?  Why the salads?  Even though we are neighbors, we do not understand your treatment of the uncooked vegetable.  Why are there hacked pieces of lowly iceberg lettuce and out-of- season,anemic, pink tomatoes?  Whatfore do you throw chunks of fresh mozarella onto these tired greens and call it a salad?  Why do you not imagine an actual vinaigrette instead of a contemptuous shaking of the oil and vinegar?  WHY? we ask.Now we know Argentina is a muy macho culture and meat is your thing.  But, dear amigos, is there not one shred of respect for the tradition of bounty in your beautiful land or even pride  in your Italian heritage that could lead you to serving salads that weren't well...so hostile to the idea of a salad?Perhaps you should ask yourselves these questions.  Maybe your answer would be to dispense with the salads altogether.  You would save yourselves the cost of the produce and the washing of the dishes.  Perhaps your diners could skip the ritual of the "salad course" and go directly to the meat.  I'm sure they would never notice.

Reviews.Author: Laura M.
Reviews.Content: Great BYOB on Southport/lakeview! If you are a red meat lover, this is your place. The eggplant appetizer and the empanadas are my favorite dishes on the menu. I'm not a big red meat eater, but am always happy with their veal and chicken dishes. The portions are large enough to serve you and your dining partner. Anything with the Chimichurri sauce is delicious!It loses one star because the inside is a rather dark and noisy.Also...step into the grocer next store if you are in the mood for some of those empanadas or other meats from the deli!

Reviews.Author: David V.
Reviews.Content: Tried Tango Sur for the first time last Sunday based on a friend's recommendation.  All of the negative parts of reviews I read on Yelp totally did not come true.  If you want a relatively quiet, relaxing dinner, try Tango Sur on a Sunday around 5-5:30.  That is not too early, and much to our delight, our party of 4 did not have to wait one minute for a table.  Granted, by about 6:30 it did seem to be mostly full.  The staff and our waiter were all very friendly, and the food was excellent.  I had the Bife Vesuvio which garners my only criticism, because, while it was very tasty, the meat was a bit inconsistent, meaning some parts of the meat were cooked rare, while others were nice and medium.  I am not too picky about my steaks, as long as they taste good, but I would have liked a medium cooked steak all the way through.  On a side note, two people in our party did not order steaks, one ordered the eggplant dish, which was like an eggplant lasagna, and the other ordered the Chilean sea bass.  Both LOVED the dishes.  Not a bite was left by everyone, I even finished off the HUGE portion of Bife Vesuvio that I ordered. Overall, I would definitely go back.  They have a large menu with a lot of other cuts of meat I am dying to try!

Reviews.Author: rachel d.
Reviews.Content: Great place for a date or with a group- very cozy! Delicious food from appetizer thru dessert! Portions are so large I recommend sharing and if you do, you'll still leave satisfied. BYOB is also a plus.

Reviews.Author: CJ V.
Reviews.Content: Be prepared for a long wait, especially on weekend nights. My friend and I waited two hours on a Friday night. But the host takes your cell phone number and calls you, so at least we got to walk around and check out some of the places on Southport and Addison. To avoid the wait, I'd suggest getting there when it opens at 5 PM or getting a group of eight or more of your friends to go with you and making a reservation.It's bring your own beer and alcohol, but I don't think they charge a corkage fee.  The restaurant is dark and candle-lit. It's like the owners were trying to create a romantic setting. However, they fell short because the place is so loud that you have to yell so the person across the table can hear you. And the dining area is kind of cramped so your table is only a foot away from the tables next to you. You end up overhearing more of your neighbors' conversations than you would ever care to.As for the food, it was pretty good overall, except for el filet. But I didn't like how the waiters just assumed that my we wanted to share all of our food. In the waiter's words, "It's more romantic this way." Kind of awkward, to say the least. The appetizers and dessert really made the meal. The chicken and cheese empanadas were really good. I originally ordered la berenjena (eggplant and cheese baked in the oven) as my entree, but as I said before, the waiter assumed we wanted to share it as an appetizer. It was my favorite part of the meal. The flan was a nice way to end the meal, and it made up for a lackluster el filet. I'd steer clear of el filet.  It was way too tough.  Normally filet mignon is supposed to almost melt in your mouth, but it took me 90 seconds (I timed it) to force down a small bite of the steak.  Gross. I love steak but that hunk of meat was sick. It's kind of ironic that the steak was so horrible because Tango Sur is an Argentine steakhouse and is known for its steak. The spinach mashed potatoes were pretty good though.But, like I said before, it was pretty good overall.  I'd definitely go there again. Next time, however, I'll know to avoid el filet.

Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: This dimly lit gem is a perfect date destination!Although there is typically a wait for a table, their waiting area is just fine in the meantime.  It's a comfy waiting room where you are welcomed to begin enjoying your BYOB beverage.The service and food is always phenomenal.  I highly recommend 'el filet', the very reasonably priced entree consisting of two filet mignons!My girlfriend loves this place as much as I do.  A can't miss!

Reviews.Author: Steve S.
Reviews.Content: Went there on a Wednesday night with a group of 10 diners.  Some food was good for some of the party.  However, I ordered the pan-fried veal, very similary to a Wiener Schnitzel.  What I received, however, was inedible.  Hard, dry, shoe leather.  So bad I wouldn't even take it home to feed to my dog.  No manager every stopped by my table to see the problem.  The waiter simply whisked away my plate, and I never saw the waiter again. The atmosphere in the room is completely inconducive to any kind of talking softer than yelling.  The loudest restaurant I've ever been to.   I could barely hear the person sitting next to me, much less the birthday honoree 3 seats away.  Never again.

Reviews.Author: Mots M.
Reviews.Content: I was seriously disappointed on my last trip to Tango Sur.  I loved this place, really great steak (good replacement for the steak in Argentina), BYOB, good prices.  It was my boyfriend's favorite place.  But then we went this winter and there was one guy who was beyond rude; incredibly rude.  There was a major wait (common occurence) but then when we were trying to figure out where we were going to go next before we went out into the below zero weather, the guy who took our name kicked us out.  I asked my bf, where are we going to go, and the TS guy said, not here, get out of here. Rude.  Disappointing.

Reviews.Author: Teri L.
Reviews.Content: We've been going here for years & I wish I could still say I love this place.  But the service seems to be consistently bad and I've had issues with my food the last couple of times.  Today, I was enjoying my meal until my steak came out & it was over-cooked.  After about 10 minutes, the waiter came by to ask how we were doing.  I mentioned that my steak was over-cooked & he agreed.  He offered to get me another steak but that would have meant I would have to wait for another meal while the rest of my party already had their food. And anyone who has dined at Tango Sur know how long it takes to a customer to receive their food. The waiter brought me flan (without asking) & offered coffee free of charge.  This was nice, except I don't like flan or coffee, so it didn't really make up for the bad steak.  I would have prefered to have received a discount on my meal.  This place is OK, but keep don't expect too much.  I still think it's expensive for what you actually end up getting.

Reviews.Author: T. Lea M.
Reviews.Content: Fabulous place that is a "must visit" when I go to Chicago! I love to stop at the wine shop across the street (I believe it's called Que Syrah). You can do a little wine tasting there and then bring your bottle over to Tango Sur. I love the filet mignon with chimichurri sauce! Best piece of advice, if you're going to eat the chimichurri sauce, you might want to make sure that your date is eating it as well! It's wonderful but very potent. Totally worth it!

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth P.
Reviews.Content: After reading so many great reviews, I was so excited to try out Tango Sur. My husband and I took my mother there for birthday dinner, and to say the least, we were not pleased. We had to wait for over 45 minutes on the sidewalk, and it wasn't even worth the wait. We started off with the 'provoleta' which is the melted cheese with roasted peppers. It was so oily and chewy, we didn't even finish half of it amongst the three of us. We also started off with the 'berenjena', which was the chefs special, and that was kind of an eggplant lasagna in a yummy tomato sauce, which was definitely the best of the night. For entrees, my husband ordered the parrillada for one, which consisted of your own mini grill, served with grilled short ribs, sausage, beef sweetbread and black sausage. The meat was charred, overly cooked, and tasted like it had been ready for hours. I ordered the 'pechuga de pollo' a chicken breast served with vegetables and this oregany sauce on the side. The chicken was dry and did not have much flavor. My mother ordered a steak that was completely rare in the middle and we had to send it back to get cooked more. Each entree came with a salad, but I wouldn't go as far to even call it that - a small plate of shredded lettuce with slices of onion and tomatoes, and no dressing.It is overly priced and not worth the food. I did like the setting, very romantic, and the BYOB is a plus, but we will not be returning.

Reviews.Author: kurosh d.
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what Tango Sur these other reviewers have been to. It took 20 minutes before a waiter even stopped by our table. It took a full hour before our appetizers got there. The empanadas weren't bad. I would prefer McDonalds to everything else. The "salad" was two slices of tomato, three rings of onion and maybe a leaf of lettuce. The Vacio was a chewy slab of garbage. Take your business anywhere else. I don't think I've ever been so disappointed at such a busy restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Billy P.
Reviews.Content: Aawesome food awesome service definitely will be back. Also great place to take a date... BYOB Rocks!

Reviews.Author: Imagen F.
Reviews.Content: Yummy .. This place is amazing! Food was great and service was awesome. My boyfriend and I celebrated our one year anniversary here on Monday night and there were a lot of people but we had less then a 5 min wait. I definitely recommend this place. I liked it so much I plan on having my birthday party here in Jan =)   You can also place reservations if you don't like waiting.

Reviews.Author: Michael M.
Reviews.Content: When I have money to spend, I'm here. Amazing filet. Empanadas hit the spot.

Reviews.Author: Guadalupe G.
Reviews.Content: Love this place. Try the empanadas, chimichuri sauce and the Filet Mignon with Spinach potatoes. Amazing. This place is BYOB, how can you go wrong with it? If like me you like dessert try the Flan. I'm not even a fan of Flan but this is one not to be missed. Enjoy.

Reviews.Author: Mark C.
Reviews.Content: Best first date dinner spot. Great place. Sometimes a long wait, but they're open late, so no worries.

Reviews.Author: Sam A.
Reviews.Content: I heard mixed opinions about this place, some were bad and I can't understand why!  After coming here for the first time this week, we were pleasantly surprised. Tango Sur was such a relaxing & romantic evening. I consider myself to be very picky when it comes to service and their service was spot on. Our waiter was there the moment we walked in to uncork our bottle of wine (No corkage fee). Nice plus! He came back right away to take our order and within minutes our salad was in front of us. About ten minutes after we finished, our food arrived; my wife had the EL FILET range grown fillet mignon, cooked on the grill then topped witha red onion wine sauce and served with spinach mashed potatoes.I had the T. BONE, range grown veal t. bone cooked on the grill,served with mashed potatoes and red chimichurri. We tried both and could not stop smiling at each other. Both were perfectly cooked and totally satisfying. Our waiter (Ever Rios) was always smiling and asked every few minutes if we needed anything, which is always nice, very attentive and friendly.A total thumbs up and will return monthly!Not only is the place affordable and serve amazing, unbelievable, good food, but also it's a BYOB. AS IF IT COULD GET ANY BETTER, so make a reservation for the larger parties (6 or more) and come early or during the week for a date.BRAVO!!!

Reviews.Author: B h.
Reviews.Content: Arguably top ten in steaks.  BYOB.  Good vibe, always busy and always a good time.  I have never in my life had to share a steak, but almost always have to here.  Amazed on how little I spend when I walk out considering the experience.

Reviews.Author: Jeff G.
Reviews.Content: This is place is MONEY. First off, the food. Unbelievable, just as everyone says it is. Portions are massive for what you pay for, especially as it is often meat. As to everything else, just read others' reviews. The wait can often be a deterrent, but at least when my date and I went on New Years Eve around 10pm, they took our cell phone number and we just walked down the street and enjoyed Southport until they gave us a ring (it was about an hour later). The setting is definitely a bit on the crowded side, but I feel like that's just how it's going to be. Tables are very close and it often gets pretty loud. If you want to feel like you're in a bustling city restaurant with lots going on, you will feel right at home. If you are looking for a calm and quiet dinner, I would try and go during off hours. And the BYOB is a massive plus, although we didn't take advantage of it.The New Years celebration was especially fantastic/hilarious. The waiters cracked open bottles of champagne and gave a free glass to everyone, handed out buzzers, hats, and decorations, put on some music and had a dance line go throughout the restaurant that I (and other diners) gladly hopped into. Good times.

Reviews.Author: Jordan D.
Reviews.Content: WOW..  So I was in no mood for a wait.  I called the restaurant before donning my coat, gloves, scarf, and jacket (its 30 degrees out) and made sure there was availability for a table of one.  I was told "come on in, there's no wait"  So I walk the 8 blocks to the restaurant.  When I arrive I'm greeted by someone who's clearly not a hostess and am told there's a 45 min wait.  "excuse me?"  I say..  I explain to him the phone call and he puts his finger in the air and grabs a running by waiter(not a manager) I can hear the conversation and In Spanish the waiter says.. I don't give a shit, tell him he has to wait.  sorry bro, I may be white, but yo habla espanol..  The kid walked up to me and repeats the 45 min line and tells me he's sorry it's first come first serve.  FIRST of all, I'm industry there's no way you go from wide open to a 45 min wait in less than 20 min.  Second, there's a single man at a 10 top seated without his party, and next to that table is an open four top, when I told the guy to kick rocks and walked out  into the street I saw through  the window that the back room had 3 more open 4 top tables.. So where's the beef?  IDK and I don't plan to ever find out.  I don't need to try your food to give you guys one star; and frankly I never will.  I'll take my money to another decent steak house that actually cares about their costumers regard.  It's sad with service this terrible you average out to be a 4 star restaurant, I guess that's what happens when you have 300 mixed reviews.  I really enjoyed the mile walk back to my house hungry and carrying a stupid bottle of wine.  kick rocks Tango Sur...

Reviews.Author: Gavin Y.
Reviews.Content: this place is awesome

Reviews.Author: Jannson E.
Reviews.Content: The food and atmosphere once inside is amazing and would be 6 stars if possible.  Simply amazing authentic Argentinian fare.The part that is not fun is leading up to that.  Either go early (like 6pm) or have a big enough party to get reservations (6 or 8) and make them.  Otherwise, especially on weekends, it will be a 2 hour or more wait.  This is TOTALLY a place I would recommend.

Reviews.Author: Nick F.
Reviews.Content: Without question...the best steak I have ever had.  And I am a steak connoisseur .  You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Rachel H.
Reviews.Content: I'd say this is a 3.5.  After frolicking at the Montrose Beach and getting yelled at by the lifeguard, we were starving and wanted somewhere with outside seating.  We only waited a few minutes for a perfectly intimate table.  We started with an Inka Kola, which tastes like a combo of cream soda and bubble gum and is packed with caffeine.  It's like kiddie crack.  For a starter we enjoyed the empanadas and when they accidentally gave us two beef instead of a beef and a chicken, the waiter brought out a fresh chicken one at no charge.  Our waiter was friendly, but the service was a little bit slow.  My entree was very good, cooked nice and raw (har har) and absolutely huge.  It was like TWO filets instead of one.  It made a great leftover lunch.  However, my companion wasn't impressed with his meal.  He had the Bife Vesuvio and felt that the sauce was so salty it was almost inedible.  A couple of the rolls were also pretty hard.  The place is BYO which is nice and really the best part is embarrassing my companion by telling him I was going to ask the waiter which part of the cow "flap meat" comes from.  For some reason seeing "flap meat" in text form is extremely entertaining.

Reviews.Author: Mari Y.
Reviews.Content: This place was good.  As I mentioned before, I'm a former steak eater so my review isn't gonna be head over heels based on the fact that I was at a parilla.  However, I did used to live in Argentina so I could appreciate how authentic it did present itself with the items on the menu.  The proveleta wasn't as baked and thick as I'd had in AR.  The cheese was thin and reminded me a small pizza.  The blood sausage and sweetbreads were good - I typically don't like sweetbreads but these were delightful.  Must have been because they were deep fried.  I ordered the bife de lomo - it was a huge portion!  It was cooked spot on, medium rare.  The quality of the meat didn't particularly blow me away.   I liked that it was BYOB and had a very comfy, cozy feeling.  There are no reservations so we had to wait in a small back room.  You can open your bottles of wine back there while you wait for your name to be called.  Only thing was that the floor was wet and my friend and I both slipped. I probably wouldn't go back for the food but the ambiance was nice for a cold Friday evening.

Reviews.Author: Hayley H.
Reviews.Content: Went over to Tango Sur because my dad was in town and wanted some meat. My dad walks is and told the host we had a party of four. He was about to be seated at a 4 top when I walked in with a stroller. All of the sudden, the table was not available. The host was very condescending and told us the table was not available because they have reservations. Being a resident of the neighborhood and having been to the restaurant a number of times, I know they don't take a reservation for 4. It was quite clear they didn't want the baby in the restaurant, even though it was 6pm on a Sunday. I could almost understand if they just said that they don't accommodate babies. But they were rude, condescending, and flat out lied to us. We were happy to take our business to Crosby's, where we had a delicious meal.

Reviews.Author: Katie S.
Reviews.Content: I was really pumped about this place because I had heard so many good things about it.  So maybe my very high expectations set me up for disappointment.  The one huge plus is that Tango Sur is BYOB, so my parents and I stopped at Jewel for a couple bottles of wine.  When we got there there was about a half an hour wait, which was fine and typical for that time on a Saturday night.  When we were finally seated, we were practically elbow to elbow with the table next to us, making it somewhat awkward.  A lady came and corked our wine but it was 5-10 minutes before we were greeted by our waiter.  We were beginning to wonder if they had forgotten about us.  The wait time for the food was normal and it came out on a pan that was almost overflowing with juices from the meat.  I'm all about setting the mood and creating ambiance but the lights were so dim in this place that it was nearly impossible to see what we were eating.  And in the process of cutting the meat, the juices were spilling all over the table - it was really messy and gross but there was no easy or clean way around it.  The food was okay; the beef was kind of tough.  It wasn't a horrible experience, just not what I was expecting.  I would be hesitant to go back, although according to the other favorable reviews, maybe I caught them on a bad night.

Reviews.Author: Wes D.
Reviews.Content: Quite disappointed with this restaurant. I ordered the sirloin steak, and it was incredibly grisly and tough, so bad that I debated sending it back (which is something that usually never crosses my mind). My girlfriend had the grass fed sirloin which was significantly better, but still very over priced. The salad was a joke, a few pieces of lettuce with an under ripe tomato, onion, and oil and vinegar as the only dressing option. The potatoes that came with the steaks were bland and dry. On a positive note, I really liked the ambiance of the restaurant, and the chimichurri dipping sauce for the steaks was very good.

Reviews.Author: Maggie H.
Reviews.Content: I'll TANGO with Tango Sur anytime! I am a meat lover and thought this place was too good to be true considering the reviews.  It's not.  We ordered the El Filet and the Lomo.  Both are essentially two LARGER THAN LIFE pieces of Filet Mignon.  The only difference is the potatoes.  El Filet comes with (Green!) Mashed Potatoes and the Lomo includes Potatoes Vesuvio.  We favored the Mashed Potatoes especially dipped in the steak drippings.  Yummmm!  We also tried the Spinach and Cheese Empanada- $2 for 1 empanada.  It was delicious, but not necessary to the meal.  Next time, I will also try to hold back on the bread and olive and garlic spread.  I felt like garlic was oozing out my pours, but it was also delicious.  We skipped dessert and headed to the DQ with enough leftovers to feed us the rest of the weekend.  The only drawback is the wait. Southport Corridor can be pretty chaotic especially on a Cubs gameday.  We felt a little out of place in our dress clothes waiting for our table at  Take Five bar down the street.  It took us about 1.5 hours to get to Meat Euphoria!!!!

Reviews.Author: K B.
Reviews.Content: If Jesus was around...If Buddha was around...even if a plant or whatever other deity you worship was around they would be dining at Tango Sur.  This is the best restaurant in Chicago in my humble opinion.  The steak are out of this world, I don't know any other place that could make skirt steak taste like filet mignon.  The provelone appetizer is to die for and the crowd is great.  What a romantic place to eat....BYOB and the best deal in the city make this a landmark.  And for the douchebags on here who complain about "corking" their own bottles...IT'S FREE!!

Reviews.Author: Matt H.
Reviews.Content: This by far is my favorite restaurant and of the 20-30 different people that I have taken there, only 1 person did not like it and it was not because of the food.  They have great food for a reasonable price, it is basically a feast of steak!  To add to that, it is byob.  I usually get empanadas and the provaletta for appetizer, the para (meat heaven) for my meal and their tasty flan for dessert.  I also recommend the bife vesuvio, which is beef tenderloin stuffed with spinach and cheese.  The only problems I have run into is the wait and the inconsistency of good service...  Sometimes they seem to have their hands full beyond their capability...  Basically if you can deal with spotty service, the food will speak for itself.

Reviews.Author: Nancy R.
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation for party of 6 at 8:30pm, came only to find out it was not ready because they are packed. Ended up waiting for another 45 minutes before actually sitting down. Menu was confusing, ended up order the "Grill for 1" It was ok nothing too special, didn't know what was so "Argentinian" about it. Came here because we heard of the good reviews, but I think we left feeling BLAHHH. Maybe we just ordered the wrong food. The Grill for 1 was not all red meat. It was all part meat, part thyroid, part blood sausage. no thanks. Only ended up eating the 2 pieces that were meat. For what we paid, I didn't think the food plus long wait was worth it.

Reviews.Author: Josh M.
Reviews.Content: I have been to Tango Sur three times now.  So, my review is based on a collective consensus of my experiences in all three ocassions.  The first two times I came, I was very impressed with the food (can't beat BYOB at a steakhouse), atmosphere as well as the prices--I was sold! Although, the wait on a Friday is sometimes as long as 2-3 hours I was thoroughly satisfied with the experience.   Unfortunately, this third time around my experience was less than what I had been accustomed to.  I came here with a party of four and while we waited roughly 30 minutes it is not as bad as it seemed because we came prepared with our bottles of Malbec.  Once we were seated we ordered the empanadas which were delicious (I would highly recommend the 'Jamon/Queso'. We then ordered our steaks (asked mine to be cooked medium) and when I received mine it was overcooked (almost well-done).  I'm not a picky person and I might have ate it but my friends and girlfriend insisted I ask them to exchange it.  So, I asked politely if they could give me a steak that was cooked medium and the waitor said no problem as he did agree it was overcooked.  Once he returned 10 mins later he had another cut of meat and said that he recommnended this one instead as it was more tender and delicious--I wasn't too happy to be told what I should be eating but at this point I was way too hungry and had way too much wine in me that I ate it.  The food was good, my friends and I enjoyed it and were enjoying our time together when we were asked if we could move to the back as other people were waiting--This was literally 5 minutes after we had finished our meals.  My friend asked the waitor if he was kicking us out and he said..."Well, you know how things are in restaurants"  I definitely understand that they rely on client turnover but I thought that they could have been more polite and mindful that we had waited also.  We didnt even get asked if we wanted dessert.Anyway, overall I like Tango Sur and I am going to give them the benefit of the doubt that experiences are mostly pleasant and this was an isolated incident.  I will be coming back because It is a great steakhouse with good food and BYOB is a unbeatable.

Reviews.Author: Big R.
Reviews.Content: By far, my number one recommended 'date' spot in the lakeview area, if not in the city. Amazing prices & portions. The Spinach mashed potatoes are a must!

Reviews.Author: Evan F.
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I go here once a month or so.  No corking fee.  Great steaks, great value.  All the waiters are very knowledgeable and friendly.  I'll continue to be a regular here.

Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: the style of preparation will appeal to some; it might be worth a try given the general reception of this place on yelp:+ intimate atmosphere (perhaps to a fault?)+ outdoor dining pleasant even as it begins to get colder outside+ very interesting and functional presentation of meat dishes involving small grills+ no corkage fee- quality of meat itself is average at best- no reservations- often noisymy experiences there have led me to realize that their mode of operation is to take meat cuts of generally very ordinary caliber and deliberately overseason them, *perhaps* in the name of authenticity.  this is no greasy spoon steak, however neither is it one from peter luger's.  my dish during the most recent trip was the vacio, which is typically a tougher cut of meat (flank steak), whose flesh is beneath a couple layers of fat and nerve tissue.  these layers help moisten the flesh during grilling and provide, generally speaking, an impressive crust to the meat.  it can be quite delightful if only seasoned with salt, or perhaps pepper and a bit of ash (!).  what ended up happening at tango sur was a very, very strong melange of chimichurri, garlic, accompanied with a hint of flesh from the vacio itself.  you can scrape the overcoat and stuffing off the meat and end up with a considerable pile of overpowering flavor on the side of your plate--and then you're left with an unfortunately tough cut of meat with unusually bold seasoning.  the portion was big enough for three--reasonably priced to feed two people, but i'd rather spend a little less on something that not only fills, but fulfills one person.tango sur is quite consistent, however:  in the three times i've ordered steak from them, the medium-rare i always ask for was without exception returned to me as medium-well.  it essentially reduces the experience to one i, an absent-minded griller, can faithfully recreate at home at lower cost.  this sort of execution is not worth paying a premium for.the positive things i have to say about this restaurant are valid, but don't make up for a lack of what should really be the most important part of a steakhouse that's trying to make its name on a tradition of excellent meat.

Reviews.Author: Lindsay B.
Reviews.Content: I used to love this place, maybe even be obsessed with it.  It seems like in the past 1.5-2 years, it has been on a gradual decline.  The quality of meat isn't as good, the meals I've ordered have been very fatty.  The service seems to be getting bad too.  When we went this weekend, our waiter was very inattentive and the busers took plates out from under us that we weren't even done with yet!What really turned me off to this place (yet, I have decided to return...go figure) is the poor management.  A friend was particularly disappointed with her meal when we went last summer.  She ordered chicken, which admittedly, I wouldn't order at a steakhouse, but that is besides the point.  She said it was undercooked, something that should be pretty important to the staff who were obviously annoyed by her complaint.  She sent her meal back and it was returned cold and rubbery.  She complained to the manager, and he told her that they were an extremely popular restaurant, and he didn't care if she was disappointed, they were going to continue to make a lot of money whether or not she was happy.Again, I'm not sure why I chose to come back, but from now on I will be going to Las Tablas instead.

Reviews.Author: Adam P.
Reviews.Content: I have yet to enjoy a dining experience more in Chicago than I did at Tango Sur.  To begin with, they openned my BYO wine before I even had a table, which made the considerable wait seem like much less time than it was.  Then as soon as we were seated fresh rolls were brought to our table, and they were delicious.  From there the food only got better.  The Barenjena (sp) was just delicious.  The best way to describe it would be an eggplant lasagna Argentine style.  From there fresh salad was brought out, and it was simple, but the perfect precursor  for the steak that was to come.  The two person steak called the Vaccio was huge and delicious.  There was no way for me and my date to finish the steak, it would have been enough for three I think.  The atmosphere was great, as long as you don't mind being squeezed in a little bit, and the waitstaff was helpful and friendly.  As I said before, a great experience!

Reviews.Author: Kathrin E.
Reviews.Content: No, they don't take reservations.  Yes, you will have to wait a long time to be seated.  And yes, it's worth it!!  This is one of my favorite BYOB places.  While you wait they allow you to go to their waiting room, which is a small room in the back corner, where they will open your bottle of wine (or whatever alcohol you have) and allow you to have cocktails while you wait.  Whenever I've gone here it is very loud (there always seems to be some big birthday or bachelorette party), and you may have to wait a while for your food to come out. Oooo but when the food comes out, you will be SO HAPPY you waited!  The portions here are HUGE and all of the steaks are delicious! There were four of us last time we came here and we had a TON of leftovers, even though we ate and ate and ate and ate!  Our dinners (4) could have easily served 8 or 9 people. OH! And don't forget to order Chimichurra with your meal.  It's delicious. :)  If you ever want to recreate this meal at home, simply go to the store they have just to the left of the restaurant and buy your steak there (with the chimichurra).  It's the same place they buy their meat and it is CHEAP.  Yum!!

Reviews.Author: Zata M.
Reviews.Content: Wow. This review is based on a single Tango Sur's employee that I came into contact with during my five minutes at the restaurant.  Though it may seem unfair for me to even write this (since I didn't even eat at this place), maybe the management will think twice about who they have working here after reading this. I had been looking forward to eating here for quite sometime now and am somewhat disappointed that I will never experience Tango Sur's food due to the experience I had tonight.  My boyfriend and I decided to try this place out and even though today is Tuesday, I tried to call to see if I could make a reservation because the place always seems busy and it is holiday season after all.  I tried the number several times but each time I got sent directly to voicemail.  We decided to give it a shot anyways.  While my date looked for parking I went ahead in to see if I could get a table.  The host stand was not by the door but oddly placed in back of the restaurant.  I walked towards the back of the room and got stopped by a man telling me I needed to wait outside. OK...  I went back out and waited with another gentleman that seemed to also be waiting.  The man from the restaurant came out.  The gentleman asked for a table for 7 at which time the man from the restaurant informed him that it would be at least an hour and that he should have called since they make reservations for parties 6+.  I then asked about the wait for a party of 2. He told me it would be at least an hour and that he could take my number down and give me a call when something opened up.  I stepped away to call my bf to pick me up since the wait was so long while 2 girls came up and asked for a table.  The man said 20 minutes. 20 minutes!? I went back up to him and asked why the wait was all of a sudden so much shorter and he said they had called ahead and made reservations.  (Even though he had just said they only take reservations for parties of 6+.) I shared with him that I tried calling several times and couldn't get through.  He then said I was a LIAR and asked me to TAKE OUT MY PHONE, SHOW HIM MY CALL LOG and PROVE to him that I tried calling.  WT??!?!  It was completely unprofessional and uncalled for.  I'm absolutely disgusted with how I was treated and will not attempt to eat at this restaurant ever again.

Reviews.Author: Ian S.
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend loves this place and most people do. But, I don't care to come here. The wait is always really long. What restaurant doesn't take reservations? The place itself is crazy crowded with tiny tables. The food is average overall. I have had a few really awful steaks and a couple good ones. Empanadas are good at least, real hard to screw something like that up. I do like that it is BYOB, and the prices are fair. Overall, I only come here when someone doesn't give me a choice and I usually don't hate it. Update... Just waited over two and a half hours and wasn't seated. Walked down to my local burrito place and will NEVER come to Tango Sur again. Bad service, bad ambience, average food= not worth a 2.5 hour wait. I wouldn't even wait 30 minutes for this place. AVOID!!!!!

Reviews.Author: greg r.
Reviews.Content: the meat is good, tender and delicious. yet the only thing i really remember about this place is the lack of elbow room! perhaps it's my ocd but i really don't like eating or conversing while i'm seated uncomfortably close to strangers.

Reviews.Author: Robert W.
Reviews.Content: Great food.  Easily the best steaks I've had in the city so far.  The size of the entrees are really big so be sure to go with an appetite.  The service can be a little slow so it's good to go there when you aren't in a rush.  The place is usually crowded but after you sit down and try to food you'll know why.

Reviews.Author: Katie M.
Reviews.Content: BYOB places are always a great find-they save you money and allow you to bring your favorite wine. I especially like Tango Sur for many reasons. They have lots of outdoor sidewalk seating which helps because the wait can sometimes be about an hour or so past 7 pm on any given night. If there is a wait, there are many bars nearby where you can go until they reach you by cell phone to let you know your table is available. The cheese appetizer dish is delicious and I always get great meat which I like medium. Definitely a place worth going. Plus, it's a great location!

Reviews.Author: Helen A.
Reviews.Content: Yum! If you're in the mood for a big juicy stake that no one can see you eating...you found your spot. Super cramped, super cute, candle lit meat eater heaven. Those candles on the pics you see are the only lighting....love that. Long waits, no reservations (thus 4 vs.5 stars) taken. Yummy epinadas and filet among other things. Hard to believe prices. BYOB makes it even more romantic.

Reviews.Author: Becca K.
Reviews.Content: I joined yelp, ONLY because of my AWFUL experience with Tango Sur! And I am only giving one star, because they make you give at least one or else it would be -10.....My friend made a reservation more than a week before today (for another friend's birthday dinner). We arrived at Tango Sur at our reservation time and the owner/host faltered between two very different stories about why he didn't have a reservation noted for us... 1st, he said that we were supposed to confirm the reservation hours before our arrival and apparently we didn't so... no table (ok, that's fine if a restaurant wants to have this type of policy - but no one told my friend to do so when she made the original reservation).... and 2nd, he told us that the restaurant had tried calling my friend this AM to confirm, but she didn't answer (umm, ZERO missed calls on my friend's phone from today). OK, make up your mind and pick a story! Aside from the owner/host's fabricated stories.... he had an AWFUL attitude and was not very friendly. Since Tango Sur told us we would have to wait at least another hour to be seated, we moved down the street and found another fabulous BYOB that would accommodate our group of 7.... I highly recommend saving your time at Tango Sur. Go to Frida instead!!! It is BYOB and Mexican food... yummy. Plus, the host and wait staff were super nice/accommodating. Tango Sur might be delicious and cheap, but I will NEVER spend another $$$ there. Go to Frida!

Reviews.Author: jamie k.
Reviews.Content: another 5 star for tango.  although, im putting 5 star just to be a groupy with all the other yelpers.  people on yelp do need to get their own opinion and not be influenced by everything else that other yelpers say.  i live in lakeview, lived in lakeview for many years, and I have been to tango many many times, it is a great place.  but it is also not consistent, and  it is cheap and it is BYOB.  so, sometimes this place is a 2 star, then sometimes it is a 4 star, or maybe three star, and sometimes it is a 5 star.  i would not say that it is a 5 star all the time, i would say it misses 5 star most of the time.  but im going to read all these yelpers and be influenced by their reviews, so i had to put 5star!!!  go to this place once a week, and order the rib-eye; it will be different everytime you order it, and then go to yelp and give them 5 star.

Reviews.Author: Claudia M.
Reviews.Content: After years of wanting to eat at Tango Sur I finally got the chance.  Don't get me wrong I am persistent when it comes to eating but driving by and looking at that long line of hungry people waiting to get in is more than discouraging. My BF is more of a meat eater than I am so I thought he would love this place (if we ever got in).  So we walked over to Tango Sur and gave our name to the Host at about 8:30 pm on a Friday , he says it will be about 1 hour and 15 mniute wait and he takes my BF's cell number and says he will call him when the table is ready.  Well, an hour later we are still waiting and he tells my BF it will be another 30 minutes.  We walk down the street and wander into the cupcake shop to "browse" and check out the showings at the Music Box.  Thirty minutes later, still No call.  My boyfriend suggests I go and talk to him in Spanish.  Sure enough, the Spanish card gets us in.  He immediately calls someone out who takes us to a small table by the wall. Now this is a Hot summer Chicago night and there is absolutely no breeze in here.  The bus boys are zooming around filling glasses with ice cold water. The waiter takes a while to come by but when he does I use my Spanish again to get some quicker service. He quickly gets us a bucket of ice for our now warm wine.  This place is packed!  We order two empanadas, a corn one and a spinach/cheese empanada and tell the waiter we would like to put our order in for the entrees.  Both served with chimichurri sauce.  My BF is a fan.  I order the churrasco (sirloin steak) from the specials menu, 3/4 done.  My BF orders the Beef steak medium rare.  I loved my steak, I'm not a huge meat eater but was in the mood for some meat.  Delicious!  After we had had our fill I asked the waiter for some doggie bags and he was quick about it. It just took one glance to get him to our table with the check.  I read other yelper's reviews and waiting for the check and other service seem to go very slow.  I suggest learn some basic Spanish, this might help.  Anyway, I love you Tango Sur but because of the long wait and extreme heat and the loud noise inside I think this is more for the young and inexperienced diner.  It's a great place, very romantic but I'm going to try El Nandu after 10 years and see what they are up to.

Reviews.Author: Cristin M.
Reviews.Content: The meat here is fantastic.  They have a lot of choices, and it's reasonably price, considering it's such a steak place.  I had a steak that was stuffed with cheese, spinach, garlic, and white wine.  I could only finish half of the portion, because it was so huge.  And the chimichurri sauce on the side made the dish even better than it is on its own.  I usually like my steak naked (i.e., no sauce), but this really kicked thing up onto another level.  I would like to give this place five stars, but we had to wait an hour for a table, you're sandwiched in like sardines, and it was so hot inside that everyone at my table was sweating!  The plus side to having to wait so long, is that they take your phone number and call you when your table is ready.  That way, you can wander around the neighborhood, have some drinks somewhere, or even go to Dairy Queen to perk up your appetite.  And if you plant to make reservations, make sure you can get six people rounded up to go with you, otherwise, you're stuck waiting with the rest of us.

Reviews.Author: Nicole L.
Reviews.Content: I'm still recovering from my dinner at Tango Sur last night (and not in a bad way), a traditional yet trendy Argentinian eatery on Wrigley's north side.  This was by far one of the most flavorful, plenteous and distinctive meals that I have had here in Chicago.  The mood is right with dim candlelight on each table, and with no liquor license, BYOB is a nice additive for those looking to lighten up without dishing out mucho dinero.  The warm bread basket could have filled me up alone had I let it, but instinctively, I saved room because from the looks of the tables surrounding us, I had a feeling I was in for a feast.   The provolone and eggplant appetizers were exceptional, followed by a steak and mushroom platter that was so luscious and tasty, I took one bite and I was in heaven!  That is, until the last course was served our way --- flan with dulce de leche topping --- a sweet ending to an already decadent evening!

Reviews.Author: Maritere P.
Reviews.Content: A ridiculous place. Only try to eat here if you have no self-respect. The two of us arrived on a Saturday at 6:15. We were told the wait would be 1.5-2 hours. Like fools we waited. At 8:15 the unfriendly, uncharming host informed us it would be another 15-20 minutes. Please. Even if God himself were cooking, there was no way. We had a very nice meal next door at Deleece....and found at the bar (which, of course, the dry Tango Sur does not bother to have) where we were sitting a bottle of Argentine wine in a bag left some poor schmucks before us who had illusions of eating at Tango Sur. But what can you say? The place obviously has a following and the hype and doesn't care about its customers, who, gluttons for punishment, keep coming back.

Reviews.Author: Alan C.
Reviews.Content: We (a group of 4) arrived there at 6pm on a Friday and there was no wait. I have been coming here whenever I have out-of-town visitors and I have never been disappointed. Well, the criticisms of this restaurant, if considered in the more appropriate context, are rather trivial. If you pay $15 or $20 per head and you save a bunch of money by bring your own liquors perhaps you cannot expect the decor, service, and food of a five-star restaurant. I am not saying that any of them sucks, they are good, not spectacular. What makes Chicago special for lower income groups (like us students) is restaurant like Tango Sur that offer value, affordability, and a memorable evening. Southport is an interesting neighborhood and Musicbox is right around the corner, but parking is a bit tricky at times. My tip: Order one more appetizer (we shared 5 different dishes and were wowed by every single one of them), and go easy on meat (a mixed grill for two shared by 4 people). The bread IS good, reminds me of the dinner rolls from my childhood.

Reviews.Author: Rob C.
Reviews.Content: I recently gave up eating meat but if you're a carnivore, you will love this place. They serve the best steaks...all imported from Argentina. In my meat eating days I ordered the filet stuffed with cheese and spinach which was fan-tastic. Great ambiance with dimly lit dining area and live music on weekends. Another plus about this place is that it's BYOB and no corkage fee which can save you alot of money if you go there with a group of friends. I went there for my birthday last yearwith a group of 6. We all ordered our own entree, a couple of apps, a side salad and two desserts, basically a 4 course meal, and the toal was a little over $30/person.The only knock about the place is that they don't accept reservations so if you go on a weekend night be prepared to wait a while, but if you have a few bottles of wine with you the time will pass quickly! In summary, great food and ambiance with an excellent value.

Reviews.Author: Lindsay S.
Reviews.Content: OMFG! I am disgusted by the by the by the way that my group (not to mention several other groups and couples) were treated by the staff of Tango Sur.  We were told that there was a 2 hr wait to get in and while I would have said forget it, my boyfriend really wanted to wait and the two others we were with had never been so ...fine... we went to a bar down the street for two hours and waited and had fun and figured ok its prob a good idea to walk back to the restaurant and see whats going on bc we didn't receive any phone call that our table was ready.  I should have known things were going to end badly when some other group asked where they were in the wait bc they had been waiting for a number of hours already and ended up leaving because the man at the door was so rude to them.  So there are two guys at the door and I don't understand how they have no communication and obviously no idea what they are doing... one guy takes the names and one guy calls them, which is sad if you are not able to perform both functions yourself,  Anyways we were told it would be another half an hour... so we waited... ahhh why does a group of 16 get to go ahead of us.... then when other people who had only waited 45 min total were let in .... finally our party, who they had written down as a party of 2 NOT 4 mind u (so the name taker can't even do his one job).... gets called....oh NO not to actually sit down and dine ... but to go in the WAITING ROOM they have inside.  The height of the night was when 4 chicks were seated who literally just arrived ... my bf asked the guy who calls the names why they were seated when they just arrived and the caller said "go ask the guy at the door" ,,,, seriously?
