Isn't it your job to take the name hes written on his 50cent mini note pad and call them in ORDER ...as the patron I am supposed to go figure out ur issues?.... so the name caller can't do his job right either.  Needless to say we left ... and as we are walking out, name taker and name caller are like "oooo why are you leaving, your table is next" hahahahaha I'm soooooo sure that it is.  The food is great there is no doubt, but I will never go here again because the foods not that good.... my boyfriend can make the same if not better chimichurri sauce and can grill a steak awesomely ... so screw you Tango Sur.

Reviews.Author: Duyen D.
Reviews.Content: This place is good if you want to eat a whole lot of steak.  The quality is not the best but the price is right.  You have to remember that your steak is costing $20 instead of $50 at a nice steakhouse.  It is always busy here so make sure you go early if you want to get in without an unbearable wait.  I find the inside of the restaurant unimpressive so if you're lucky, you'll even get a table outside. Don't forget to bring some good wines for the BYOB or just run to the Jewel down the street.

Reviews.Author: Gina L.
Reviews.Content: great food, great service and I really like that it is BYOB.  You can have a nice meal out and not break the bank.  I liked the atmosphere too....although it did get a little loud as the night went on, but it wasn't a big deal.

Reviews.Author: Arda B.
Reviews.Content: I love this place for its food and ambiance. Have been to Tango Sur about 5 times now, and everything was perfect until my last visit this Sunday. Their food is really good(I like the steak with spinach/cheese in the middle) or el filet the most within their menu. Here is the reason for only 1 star though... This Sunday we were there with a party of 7, seated inside. We had a reservation, or we thought we did, but when we got there they said they could not find the reservation. Just because we were lucky, another party was leaving at that time, so they were able to seat us. We brought our wines, and were enjoying the appetizers(I personally like the eggplant one), then I felt something crawling on my hand... When I looked down on my napkin, I saw a 3 inch black round cockroach type of bug on top of it, which was really unexpected. I like outdoors and camping etc, so I am used to bugs, but this is my first encounter within a restaurant. In order not to freak out the ladies on the table, I wrapped the thing with the napkin, and took it to the manager type outside(he's the one with the pony tail). Told him what happened, and went back to my table. On his way back, arrogant son of a gun(aka. the manager type pony tailed guy) stopped by at our table, and without even apologizing, said something like, "Oh this is the summer time, door's open, these small bugs come in, there is nothing we can do about it, etc.", which really pissed me off. 1- it's was not small by any means 2- he did NOT assume responsibility for something he should be controlling 3- I am pretty sure that leaving the door open for a restaurant, which is his argument, is not allowed exactly because of this within the health code.Therefore, even though I like their food a lot, I wont be able to go back there for quite some time, simply because of the way they handled this situation. There are a lot of good food places in Chicago, and many of those places still care about customer service, unlike Tango Sur...

Reviews.Author: Rodolfo C.
Reviews.Content: The cuts of meat are the best in Chicago and they have a staff that is top notch. The music, vibe and top notch staff makes this one of my favorite places to eat out. There are no reservations so you may have to wait your turn.

Reviews.Author: Kelli B.
Reviews.Content: I'm really surprised that this place got such good reviews.  I really hope I was there on an "off" day or maybe I ordered the wrong thing.  We were with a group of 11 and had reservations.  I was15 minutes late and my friends were already seated, so no waiting.  The place was PACKED and when we walked in nobody greeted us.  We just walked into the back room to find our friends.  I didn't have a problem with this, I'm seeing that is more of a casual laid back place.  The ambiance was great, brick walls pillar candles on every table.  We had prosciutto for a starter, I've had better.  I was going to be "good" and order the grilled chicken and vegetables but changed my mind when my friend said their filet was "the best she's ever had".  So I order mine medium well and she ordered hers medium.  When the waiter delivered mine I said "Is this medium well?"  He said "Yes".  Come to find out half way through my pretty well done steak that I had her medium and she had my well.  We switched and now mine was REALLY well....burnt.  I didn't even finish it.  It came with (green) mashed potatoes which were okay.  I think they had spinach in them, nothing to write home about.  My bf had the T-Bone and said Outback was better.  I was pretty disappointed after all the hype, but again maybe I just ordered the wrong thing.  But I figured I couldn't go wrong with a filet in a place known for their meat.  I wouldn't go out of my way to go back to Tango Sur.  Instead, check out my review of Machu Picchu - it's way better!

Reviews.Author: Alex H.
Reviews.Content: i could try to wow you all with my flowery prose, but this seems much more useful.excellent:  price  bife de chorizo  beef empanada  chimichurri  good:   authenticity  blood sausage (hard to find)  chorizo  mediocre:  provoleta (poorly prepared)  vacio (too tough, even for vacio)  chicken empanada (not standard filling, mealy)unspeakably bad:  milanesa a la napolitana  that dessert with twirly bread and layers of dulce de leche (tasted like a month old)  wait on weekend and treatment by hosts

Reviews.Author: Eazmg C.
Reviews.Content: as long as you're comfortable with giving your name and going home (hopefully nearby) for an hour or 2 on a friday night...this is litreally one of the best friday night byob dinner experiences in chicago.  highly recommend the empanadas and the el vacio.

Reviews.Author: Rachel L.
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience with the worst server I've ever experienced with.Food: 3/5Decor/atmosphere:3.5/5 (dark, trendy, but too loud music for a date)service: 1/5 (explains below)So I went this place with my bf, we were on a date and I liked the idea of BYOB, and great reviews about steak.We ordered the EMPANADAS, which many reviewers recommend, and as an entree my bf ordered the COSTELETA, which is bone-in ribeye and I ordered the El Fillet which is the fillet mignon. I first ordered something else and then I changed my order because the fillet looked better to me.Why I gave it 1/5 for the service:The first reason I gave this place a 2 star is that the server took my order wrong and was being very rude and unprofessional. I could tell that his first language is not English, and I had nothing against that (I speak other than English at my house too), but if you made me wait for 30 minutes and gave me something that I did not order, he should have at least apologized me whether he would give me what i order or not later. Instead, he was giving me this sloppy look and pointed his finger at the menu  and said "Look, this is what you ordered and changed. So I;ve brought this to you."I was like no, that's not what I ordered, I ordered the fillet mignon.But he kept insisting that I ordered what he had brought me, and after arguing for about 5 minutes, my bf was almost getting up and ready to leave the restaurant and that's when, finally, the server said, "ok, I'll bring you the fillet mignon. It's gonna take like 20 minutes if that's ok."I honestly wanted to get up and ask for the manager and speak to him/her. But it was a beautiful weeknight and there were people around us enjoying their beautiful weather, so I just decided not to go there.Food:But the thing that made me mad the most was the fact that the food WAS SOOO below my expectation. the rib-eye was full of fat, we could literally see a chunk of white fat. He's the guy who would eat everything if it's red meat, but even he said it's too greasy and fatty.Mine was no different than his. It wasn't like OMG-it's-so-bad-that-I-can't-eat, but it wasn't something I expected since I read so much positive reveiws on Yelp.Overall:One word. DISAPPOINTING.If you like loud, trendy, dark dinner place and BYOB, maybe you can give it a try. But I wouldn't pay over 50 dollars to get that quality of meat and POOR SERVICE from a very rude server.

Reviews.Author: Tania W.
Reviews.Content: I went to Tango Sur on Saturday for an early dinner. I was starving. So much so that I didn't want to stop to pick up some wine since I knew Tango was BYOB. Oh well, that didn't matter to me. I had gone to Tango Sur for my birthday some years back and I had never been able to shake the thought of going again. So, again I went to an early dinner with a friend of mine and I was impressed again. The atmosphere and the courteous way everyone treats you makes the experience a lot better. I ordered the Bife Vesuvio which is Grilled Prime steak stuffed with Spinach and Cheese while my friend ordered the El Filet which was filet Mignon with Spinach Mashed Potatoes. They served bread w/butter along with salad. We didn't order any appetizers because I wanted to save my stomach for the real meal. It took a while for the server to serve us our meal, but it was worth the wait. I loved my dish.....especially the spinach and the Argentine potatoes that were served with my steak. The seasoning was good but just a tad bit salty for my taste. It didn't stop me from enjoying my meal though.....believe me. My friend's filet was cooked to perfection and by that I mean it had the right amount of redness (Medium Well) not to mention it was so juicy and it just melted in my mouth when he let me try a piece. I finally had to stop eating my dinner because there was no way I would leave without trying a dessert. I loved the little tray the server brought around to help us decide what dessert to get. I ended up getting the a light cake with peaches and my friend got cheesecake.....They were both superb and I'm glad I saved room for  them. All in all I love Tango Sur and I would definitely go again. And I like going there early because there isn't a wait. But next time I will be sure to have my wine in tow.....Great Place. :)

Reviews.Author: C M.
Reviews.Content: I doesn't get much better than Tango Sur when you factor in affordability, ambiance, service, taste, and value.  Food - excellent.  Service - Very good.  Steaks - the best.  The only downside from getting a perfect score - the wait is NEVER what they tell you and no reservations are taken for less than 6 or 8 people.  Big let down when you are hungry.

Reviews.Author: Kennen M.
Reviews.Content: For some reason people get all jazzed up for this place when I don't see the season.  Yes, this place COULD be a cozy and romantic place if it wasn't for the small, crowded, cramped and noisy setting.  Once I came here and our table was backed up against another table so that the back of my chair was against the older gentleman's chair at the other table.  When he got up to leave, taking his coat, he took my scarf as well, since they were touching.  The last time, we were sat next to a party of 7 with 3 buckets of empty beer bottles.  They were loud, obnoxious and obviously not there for a fine dining experience.  That was also the night while sitting on the sidewalk, being harassed by a bum for leftovers while the staff did nothing to protect its patrons.  The service is a bit surly and overwhelmed.  They are not very patient with the customer and pretty much want you in and out.  Their recommendations were weak and not convincing.  As for the food, it is a good price point but just ok.  The sweetbreads were the worst I have had in my entire life.  In the past, the steaks have been hit or miss on whether they were completely chewable due to the amount of tendons in it.  The boy claims he has never had a bad steak here, which I claim he has been very lucky.  This place isn't bad, but it isn't "oohh and awww" worthy.  I prefer the steaks at Las Tablas much more to Tango Sur's.

Reviews.Author: Thomas B.
Reviews.Content: A bit overpriced, but I always order the same thing, and it comes out perfect everytime.

Reviews.Author: anthony a.
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review after a horrendous experience at this ridiculous restaurant. Mind you, the food was okay, and might have even deserved a solid 4 stars, but the 45 min it took to take our order and the HOUR AND A HALF it took to cook our meat to medium and bring it to our table was absolutely inexcusable.  What's more infuriating was the less than attentive response we received after we finally complained, having completed our entire bottle of wine and finished our less than inspired or appetizing salads.  (Two slices of tomato, lettuce leaves, and some white onion does not a salad make in the culinary world of Chicago!)  Even though we asked to speak to a manager we never saw anybody except the host and we were told "desculpa" the delay, the Spanish equivalent of "let it go," which is not what you want to hear when you have waiting for over two hours to be fed. To add insult to injury, our meal was punctuated by an unedited and bloated bill, which we received with  a single complimentary dessert for our party of five...a dessert that was burned,  tasteless and thoroughly uneatable. It might have been easy to chew some of the meat served at our table this evening, but the experience as a whole proved too bitter and expensive to swallow.

Reviews.Author: Allyson C.
Reviews.Content: Tango Sur is definitely one of the best places I've been in Chicago. The only downfall I can even mention is the wait which of course everyone else has already mentioned as well. We showed up before 8 on a Friday and didn't get seated til maybe 10:30 or so. The good thing is they'll take your cell number and call you when your table's ready, so you can go wait it out in one of the nearby bars. As for the restaurant itself, I thought the food was fantastic, and loved the atmosphere as well. BYOB is always a good thing too and we took full advantage. We actually had a lot of fun in the back waiting room which we transitioned to around 10 from the Irish pub down the street, so we could start drinking our own bottles of wine. It's a small room so we didn't have the option of waiting there earlier in the night. I can't report on the cost because I was treated to my meal, but I think it was pretty reasonable. I had El Filet which would've been enough for 2 people easily! Cooked perfectly though & delicious!

Reviews.Author: Melody C.
Reviews.Content: my sweetie took me here on a date and it was so long ago but all i remember was candlelight, lots of tasty food, chimichurri sauce, a singer with a guitar, and a really nice waiter.  the waiter gave me the impression that he was the owner because he knew so much about the food and was passionate and proud about the menu.  they even got me hooked on sweetbreads (not a baked good)

Reviews.Author: K B.
Reviews.Content: Great steak, good appetizers, great BYOB policy - but what kind of asinine place does not take reservations??????  Who wants to spend half of an entire evening waiting for a table, when they don't even provide an adequate waiting area? Sorry but I have better things to do with my time, there are plenty of good places to eat in the area. All the hype around this place has given the people who work there a definite attitude.  Unless you want to eat at 6 or 10 pm, don't bother coming here any time except the beginning of the week - the wait can be over 3 hours long!

Reviews.Author: Erica S.
Reviews.Content: So I came here with a large group of friends in the middle of the afternoon.  Now, granted, we erred and made reservations for 8, and some of my group showed up late...and with guests.  I worked in hospitality for years, and I know how aggravating a situation like this can be.  But you know what?  You vent in the kitchen.  You tell your coworkers what an asshole table you have.  But you DONT be rude to your guests.  We are your income, in the lovely state of Illinois that pays servers with tip credit.  Our server was pissed off and not hiding it.  He knew that since we were a large group, and thus the table would have gratuity added that he could phone it in and not give a damn.Uhhh....no.  What really got me angry was they have policies written and unwritten.  I am always happy to read rules on the menu and follow.  I asked for separate checks and he said bluntly, "No.  No separate checks."  Ok, not on the menu.  But fine.  When my friends tried to share some empanadas (four) he said he was going to charge them $6 (I think) dollars for a split plate charge.  For an appetizer that you can order individually and in any quantity?  Please.  When questioned why, he shoved a menu in my friend's face and told him rules are on the menu.  I could go on with these stories, but I think you get the point. I'd give this place one star for service, and 3.5 for food.  Their flan is AMAZING.  AMAZING.I'll go back, because I don't believe in condemning a place because of one bad experience, but boy, I hope my server isn't as nasty!

Reviews.Author: Anjali K.
Reviews.Content: This place is overrated. We had to wait outside in the cold for 40 minutes even though we had a reservation. Once we were inside, it was too loud, and the wait staff was a bit sub-par. The food was just okay- nothing special. Don't go there on a weekend- not worth the wait or the hectic atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Cody M.
Reviews.Content: best date spot in chicago, byob, get the el filet.

Reviews.Author: Kyle D.
Reviews.Content: went here a week ago. i live 2 min away and the food always looked/smelled good. we got their early and got a table outside. i know its outside furniture but it was all rusted bent wobbly tables and chairs. our waiter always ran off doing who knows what. its very annoying when EVERYBODY that goes their is drunk. im serious. i know its BYOB but everybody was wasted. very annoying. i got a steak and at first it was great. of course it was not how i asked it to be cooked. then when i came home i had serious stomach problems the rest of the night after eating there.... wont see me there again. also most of the ppl that do go there are rich yuppies who prob dont have a single original thought in their head.

Reviews.Author: Mischel G.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite places in Chicago. Great food, great prices and BYOB.

Reviews.Author: Michelle S.
Reviews.Content: Dined here again over the weekend while I was visiting and I am so glad we squeezed it in. I have nothing bad to say about this place, I love everything about it. I actually think it adds to the fun when you have to put your name on the list and wait (and yes the wait can be up to 2 hours long) Once inside the staff is always excellent. You can grab any of the numerous staff around to give you a hand, even if it's not your server. BYOB makes it even more fun, we always seem to bring ample wine and if we can't finish off what we've opened we always share it with a nearby table (this has happened to us before where a table shares the left over alcohol so we happily continue on the tradition) Now for the food...its making my stomach grumble wishing I could have some right now! The empanadas are awesome! I've had all 3 kinds and love them. The salad that comes with the meals is simple but delicious, as is the hot and crusty bread that seems to always be on the table. I've had the Lomo steak and the El Filet and have never been disappointed by either. There is always leftovers to take home and it's always as delicious as the night before. Sweet potatoes and the spinach mashed are excellent! I hope to get here again soon!

Reviews.Author: Lindsey B.
Reviews.Content: Wow.  After waiting 1 and a half hours to sit down... this place was worth the wait.  We started out with a variation of empanadas.  Yum YUM!  The crust was light and flaky and the chimichurri to dip was one of the best I've had.  We also had a plate of heaven.. I mean, the melted provolone dip.  Drip a little of the left over chimichurri and slap it on some bread... O.M.G.  I could have eaten just THAT.  I ordered the rib-eye and my other friends ordered filets.  The rib-eye had a caper, garlic and herb olive oil all over it nestled next to a large amount of whipped potatoes. Talk about getting your bang for your buck.  This was a TON of food!  Really liked the romantic, candle-lit ambiance, too.  Oh and this place was BYOB so that was kinda cool.  Although the wait was long, we were able to go to a bar down the street and wait for the call to come back to the restaurant.  Unfortunately when we got there for our reservation, we still had to wait another half hour in the waiting room.. however.. we were able to pop a bottle and start drinking to pass the time.

Reviews.Author: Nicholas B.
Reviews.Content: Before meeting up with some college buddy's in Chicago, my wife and I decided to try Tango Sur after hearing some good reviews.  We arrived at 8:00 on the head and were told it would be a 45 minute wait.  No problem, we expected this and went belly-up a few doors down.  After 50 minutes and no call, we closed out our tab and decided to wait in the restaurants back waiting room.  On our way in the host informed us that we were 2nd on the waiting list and we should have a table shortly.  After 30 minutes of waiting and  seeing 4 groups get seated ahead of us, I kindly inquired once again where we were on the list and how long the wait would be.  Out of nowhere the host (Dressed up nicely is a grey hooded sweatshirt) throws a temper tantrum and tells me that we can leave if we are not willing to wait.  Nice service D-bag.  With no other options, we waited for another 15+ minutes before we were seated.  We ordered one of the meat entrees for two and were not very impressed with it.  I have a feeling it was slightly under cooked as the waiter knew we were in a rush and running very late.  In all reality the waiter did a great job to apologize for our wait and the actions of the host (Only reason they don't get 1 star), but it is kind of hard to give these guys a second chance after how we were treated.

Reviews.Author: James B.
Reviews.Content: I love their El Fillet steak! It's one of the best!  If u ever come to Chicago you gotta go to this place and dry their El Fillet!  I'm kinda a man who appreciates the quality for the $ I spent and I dont mind paying almost $30 for the El Fillet.  It's filling and DELICIOUS.  Did I mention the deliciousness of it? lol  I totally recommend this place.  Matter of fact I just took my parents and two of their friends there.  The only thing that I dont like is the wait time.  But I guess having that many costumers makes u have a long wait time.  By the way it's BYOB, which is awesome!

Reviews.Author: Michelle B.
Reviews.Content: We came here a couple Saturday's ago for a group dinner with friends and had a great time. Our reservations were at 9 pm and the place was crazy busy. Tables are close together and candlelit but gave it an interesting ambiance. We ordered appetizers and they came out immediately. We ordered the Provoleta, Empanadas, and Antipasto - so good! The Provolenta is like saganaki - the sliced red pepper on the top gave it an interestingly pleasant flavor. Now for the meats - everything was seasoned deliciously! The cooking times could have been a tad better - i.e. not even throughout and even though the middle was medium rare, the outer parts were a bit overcooked. But like I said, the seasoning on the meats made up for that. Everything was so flavorful! We had the Filet and Lomo Relleno. The chimichurri was amazing - I could dip anything in that all time time. For dessert we all shared various desserts - they were ok, nothing to rave about but they did their job at the end of the meal. But what's the best part of the night? Tango Sur is BYOB and they have no corking fee. There were 12 of us and each brought (and successfully finished) 2 bottles of wine each. At the end of the night, after apps, dinner, dessert, and tons of wine the price came out to about $65 / couple. Amazing! I really enjoyed Tango Sur and we'll definitely be going back.

Reviews.Author: Scott H.
Reviews.Content: I'd been wanting to try Tango Sur for quite a long time so my wife and I decided to take a friend there to celebrate his birthday. We arrived right on time and only had to wait a minute or two to be seated in the very loud and lively "second" dining room. Our server arrived immediately and scooped up our BYOB beer and wine to put on ice. We ordered a selection of empanadas (delish!) and the provoleta 'queso' that was unremarkable, but tasty when accompanied by the crusty bread already on the table. For entrees, the carnivores thoroughly enjoyed 'El Filet', a T-bone and the veal chop. The filet was huge (two pieces) and I was only able to finish half so the leftovers made for an extra-special lunch the next day. My wife isn't much of a meat-eater so she went for one of the ravioli dishes. She wasn't terribly impressed with Argentine pasta, but couldn't stop stealing bites of my huge filet so all was well with the world. Overall a very nice evening. My only gripe was that the acoustics are such that we found ourselves shouting across the table at each other. Worked out just fine for a wine-soaked evening, though. :)

Reviews.Author: Lawrence Y.
Reviews.Content: Sorry, but after last night, Tango Sur has lost 1 star. As I mentioned previously, I would gladly take any visiting friends to dinner at Tango Sur, and that is just what I did last night. However, we were all disappointed in last night's experience. I understand it's busy. We had a small party of 3, and waited an hour and a half for our food. Our server got our entrees a little mixed up --- the El Filet was ordered medium-rare and came back medium well (with VERY cold mashed potatoes), and the Lomo Relleno was ordered medium-well but came back medium-rare... I might just be imagining this but I think they also changed this entree since the last time I was there, as it is now a serving for two... anyway, we were so famished that we just ate it anyway, and our server never once came to check in on us until the check... I'm so torn because I can't ever break up with the food here... but service (or maybe just THIS server) needs to be more attentive!

Reviews.Author: Steve H.
Reviews.Content: One of my best friends from New York flew in last week so a group of friends went here for a large group dinner.  They charge a corkage fee for the BYOB but its definitely a win win.  The food here blew me away actually.  We had the provolone cheese/roasted red pepper appetizer and it seriously kicked ass.  Cheese so thick you can have to cut it with a knife.  Look at my headline people....I LIKE CHEESE!  What do I like more than cheese you ask?  Meat and Tango Sur delivers on all levels.  I had the Veal T-bone cooked medium and it was the best piece of veal I have ever had the pleasure of eating.  It was cooked perfectly and was huge.  My friends had the fillet medium rare which I have tosay was better than the Veal.  It was two HUGE fillets with some kind of reduction.  It was so good I ate it for breakfast the next morning.  My other friend had the New York Strip and it was just as good as the rest.  I love those dinners where everyone is passing bites around the table.  And I forgot to mention, my friend is a vegetarian and still ate here.  Its that damn good.

Reviews.Author: Matt H.
Reviews.Content: The food is OK.  Good but not great.  Since it's BYOB the meal ends up not being too expensive.  It has a nice ambiance but is pretty loud.  It's hard to carry on a conversation.  Glad I went after all the hype.  I would go back but I would not wait more than 30 minutes for a table.

Reviews.Author: Vickie L.
Reviews.Content: one of the best date place in Chicago.  the steaks are hearty and very tasty appetizers and desserts.  also cannot beat the BYOB.  the only (minor) problem might be the lighting and space in the restaurant.  the staffs aren't the most professional but def fun and friendly (come on, it's not a 5-star hotel).  I would go back again and again.

Reviews.Author: Alice P.
Reviews.Content: If someone would have told me that I'd have to wait 3.5 hours in the Chicago cold to see what all of the hype on Tango Sur was about, I'd laugh hysterically and then punch him in the stomach. But that's EXACTLY what I did on a blustery November night, contrary to my own impatience and beliefs on waiting. We put our name on the list at 7:30pm . . .and didn't get seated until 11pm. In that time frame, I could have already flown back home to San Francisco and be enjoying my own steak at House of Prime Rib. But there I was, blue in the face, faint from starvation, and staring down anyone who'd dare meet my evil eye in the restaurant. I have never seen a more lazy group of people trying to prolong their stay at a table where all of the plates have already been cleared and the bill's waiting to be paid than at Tango Sur. After we were seated, I realized why the wait is as long as it is- because this is the kind of place where you're having such a great time that you don't want to leave, plus the fact that you've eaten and drank so much that you physically can't get out of the chair. The steaks here are PHENOMENAL, other than Peter Luger's in Brooklyn, Tango Sur is a tough one to beat. I loved the wine selection, because I got to bring my own! And no one knows my tastes in wine better than I do. Everything we had was absolutely amazing, the portions are shareable, the cuts of steak are hearty, tender, and cooked perfectly to order. My friend and I decided to share a steak, but I liked mine bloody and he preferred his medium (which is a crime in 48 states). Before we started throwing knives, the kitchen agreed to accommodate both of our requests on the same piece of steak, and so our friendship was saved. Not only did Tango Sur save our friendship, but they also saved our wallets, because the best part of the night was getting the bill. If all this meal cost me was $28, I would wait 3.5 hours ten times over.

Reviews.Author: Jacquie A.
Reviews.Content: I am not sure why I am the only person here who does not think that this place is that great. I have visited this establishment at least three times and everytime I feel very sick afterwards. The atmosphere is wonderful very romantic, and I love the music. The men who work here are handsome and nice to look at. The last time I visited the host kind of pissed me off. He was cute and had nice stye, but he was hovering over people trying to get them to leave so he could seat the other guests. I work in the industry and I understand the concept of turning a table. You should however be given enough time after you have finished your entree to digest and possibly order espresso and dessert. The host I am speaking of is the one with the black rimmed glasses. The other guy has worked there forever and he is very friendly. Anyway back to the food. The one thing I do enjoy is the berenjana (sp) a baked eggplant dish. I also like the provoleta, but when I think of what I am eating it kind of makes me sick. It is just a huge plate of melted cheese. The empanadas are good, but a little to greasy for my tastes. The chimichurri despite what everyone says is what I think makes me very sick every single time. Granted the flavor is wonderful but the oil they use is very cheap. It is def not olive oil. The quality of the meat is also kind of poor. It only tastes good because they submerge in gallons of oil. The thought of every piece of meat I have consumed here makes me nauseated.  Overall the atmosphere is pretty amazing, and the byob is a great deal. Maybe next time I will stick to the non meat dishes.

Reviews.Author: Philippe F.
Reviews.Content: Steaks.  Cheap Steaks.  Cheap Flavorful Steaks.  Cheap Juicy Flavorful Steaks.  Cheap Juicy Flavorful Argentinian Steaks.  I could keep going.  Recommendations:  Come early and bring hella wine!  Very nice candlelit ambiance, which can get noisy....but there's just something about a small noisy restaurant that I love.  I have yet to kill an entire steak here, mostly because I save room for the wine.  But those are some killer ass steak and eggs in the morning!  As others have mentioned, it is BYOB with no fee.  So don't be offended if the waiter throws a wine tool at your table and leaves.  If you don't care to wait for the waiter to bring a wine tool (since it does happen to get busy on occassion) or if you simply are not crafted in the art of opening wine, go with a nice screw top.  Hell, show some real class and bring in a boxed wine!  Anywho, if you like enjoying steak with your favorite booze, come here.  PERIOD.

Reviews.Author: Kathy M.
Reviews.Content: Me and the bf were craving steaks and found this lil joint. The food was delicious, we both had steaks and they were cooked to perfection! I also love that its byob! Only thing I didn't like was that it was only lit by candlelight and when there's no sunlight coming in through the windows its a bit hard to see. This also isn't a place for a first date! Gets quite loud in the evening. But loved the atmosphere and they have a waiting area where you can view the menu before you get seated.

Reviews.Author: Sara B.
Reviews.Content: That was one of my best food experience in chicago

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth v.
Reviews.Content: I was here last Friday while back in Chicago. The wait is usually horrible, but then again they take your number so you can go and have a drink somewhere. They call you when the table is ready. Last Friday they stated it would be an hour and fifteen to an hour and a half. Within 30 minuted they called! We had just had enough time to pick up some wine at a small store nearby (Que syrah).  3 out of the 4 had meat. One had salmon, and later stated you should not order fish at a Argentinian restaurant. There was too much sauce and it was not that good. The meat however was very good. I feel they give too much meat but I guess that is better than not enough. The potatoes the meat usually comes with are not good. Order a side of fries, they're tasty. On one of the specials they had spinach mashed potatoes and that was very nice. If I go back to Chicago, this is definitely a place I would like to go to again. It had not changed since I moved in October of 2006. If you have a smaller appetite you could also consider ordering some appetizers and sharing an entree (although most people I see there do not do so). Don't forget your bottle(s) of wine.

Reviews.Author: adam k.
Reviews.Content: BYOB Meat Party.  Never fails.  Go early to avoid the crowds and you can always get seated.  Go even earlier if you want table on the patio in the summer.  2 ways to enjoy the Sur:  either a table for 4 good friends on the patio and a bottle of wine each OR a candlelight dinner table for 2 in a hot dark corner.  Please don't try to show up with a party of 8 at 7pm on a Friday.  Save that for the Wicker Park.... what happened to the expansion plan Sur?

Reviews.Author: Billy D.
Reviews.Content: El Filet along with the spinach mash potatoes were amazing. I came with a group of about 17 and they sat us at our 9:15 reservation, no waiting!!! I just wish they had a better AC system but I don't think any system could've kept us cool considering it was 90+ and humid outside.

Reviews.Author: Ryo T.
Reviews.Content: This will be my fourth time here. Many being special occasions. But this was one of my favorite crowds. First time was for a bachelor party the second was with a bunch of couples the third was for another bachelor party and this fourth time was the most fun. Anyway getting a reservation was as usual with the very blunt receptionist. But after deciding on a date based on everyones availability we got there and ended up waiting 25mins past our reservation time because the restaurant was behind schedule. Well it kinda worked out because 2 of our friends were running kind of late and the friends we came with took a while to find parking. The hosts treat the guests like were at a night club. Unless you have a reservation you are not allowed in the waiting room. Which kind of sucked because it was cold out and we had to wait about 15mins in the cold. But anyways we got in and only waited another 5mins until we were sat down. Everything after that was a pleasant experience. Everytime I go I order the Bife Ancho. That's the boneless rib eye. 3 out of 4 times I was in bovine heaven! Only once was the meat a little tough. This time it was simply divine. I'm not a bragger by nature but I thought my steak was the best choice out of everyone elses. Yes filet mignon is great for those that love tender lean meat but if you want a super juicy cut with tenderness while it's still mooing, order the Bife Ancho medium rare. Although I prefer baked empanadas my wifes ham and cheese empanadas were good. The bread they bring out also freshly baked. We also shared dessert with everyone. The flan was good except for the caramel being way too sweet. I should've had an espresso with it to balance the flavors. Overall it was a lovely evening. I understand it gets crowded but the customer service up front is a little to be desired. I'll be back but I don't know when.

Reviews.Author: Sarah R.
Reviews.Content: Heaven, pure meat heaven.

Reviews.Author: Philip P.
Reviews.Content: CHURRASCO STEAK! Enough said! Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm!

Reviews.Author: Chad H.
Reviews.Content: I love this restaurant. It is dark, romantic, and delicious! I have eaten there multiple times and I always find the service to be friendly and the food to be tasty! Yes it is dimly lit and a lit cozy, but that's the beauty of it. It is an Argentinian steak house, I don't go there because I want to sit in a booth at Applebee's.

Reviews.Author: Mariella C.
Reviews.Content: it always amazes me that places that are BYOB are so successful regardless of the slop they put on your plate. tango sur was gross the three times i went there, i didn't pay any of the times. the steak i asked for to be cook medium came back bleeding, and the octopus in the salad i swear were still moving. their side salad is a piece of lettuce with a tomato on top, i kid you not. the staff are attractive latino men, that was the only highlight, and since its BYOB there is always a crowd of waiting people who are already too drunk to even say excuse me and you try to navigate out. overrated.

Reviews.Author: Amaris F.
Reviews.Content: Wow!! Bring a nice bottle of wine enjoy the lakeview neighborhood and enjoy the best steak I have ever eaten! I'm not much a steak eater despite being from texas because I am usually let down by rubber meat and lack of flavor. Tango sur is quite the opposite!! My dinner was delicious (ribs) and huge portions which you can defintely share with even the biggest appetite. They do charge for sharing but the prices are very reasonable.

Reviews.Author: K W.
Reviews.Content: MMMMeat! Delicious, reasonably priced huge portions of meat! BYOB with no corkage. Fun atmosphere. Unless you're veg, there is no reason NOT to go here.

Reviews.Author: jack l.
Reviews.Content: I'm not a big fan of empinadas but this place has great ones. The steak was awesome as well.

Reviews.Author: Steve J.
Reviews.Content: Huge portions, well-cooked steaks, great sides and starters. BYOB and a really nice patio. Outstanding value at about $30 a person.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer B.
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere at this little gem is very nice and intimate.  I took my friend there for her birthday and we really enjoyed it!  The waiter was very proper, yet pleasant.  If not for the reasonable price, I would have thought we were eating at a bona fide  5 star prim and proper elegant restaurant!  If you would like a wine accompaniment, make sure you bring your own since it's BYOB - just an FYI as it did not apply to us.  The portion size of the filet is more than enough for 2 people...very good flavor, even the potatoes were flavorful!  They almost tasted like greek potatoes, but obviously Argentine style!  we both ended up bringing home enough for another full meat portion of a meal!  It was my friend's birthday, and they were happy to oblige me by bringing her some caramel flan with a candle.  I have to hand it to them, we came in late, and they let us stay well past closing without as much as a raised eyebrow.  Very polite of them!

Reviews.Author: Dain H.
Reviews.Content: Tang Sur.... mmmmmm.... You'll never leave me, will you.... Wonderful empanada's and steak.  Ohhh the steak.  I was drunk on beef. Nay, crunk on beef! Truly a magical experience.  Vacio - Dios mio!  Very romantic vibe - not that I care one way or another.  Make reservations cause the place gets packed.  One thing that I might add as a warning is:  The steaks and empanadas were simply heavenly but don't go in there thinking "Oh hmmm I've decided to be NUTRITIONALLY CONSCIOUS all of a sudden."  A man I was sitting nearby at another table was griping about how it wasn't as lean as he wanted it.  We were both eating the Vacio.  The Vacio was my best friend in that moment and I felt defensive.  I wanted to tell him:  dude you're at a steakhouse where the steaks are dripping in oil.  If you want lean eat chicken or turkey alone at home.  You know what you signed up for. This place is very reasonably priced in my opinion considering the portions of food provided.  I'm sure this restaurant can't exactly afford to hire butchers or nutritionalists to wait your table and give you the actual lean ratio or the amount of fat that is going to be in the steak your eating.  They're hiring people of Hispanic heritage (probably Mexican) and that's the prerequisite.  If you ask your waiter "what is the leanest you have?"  He'll tell you.  He isn't going to give you lab analysis.  He's a waiter who is clearly not a master of the english language let alone the cows origins and exercise regiment.  He's supposed to know what tastes good and he does that very well.  Bottom line:  If you want great steak and empanadas with a great atmosphere and par service eat at Tango Sur.  Wasn't pricey either.P.S:  I normally don't mess with empanadas but these were like no other empanadas I've ever had before.  GET THEM!!!

Reviews.Author: Ian H.
Reviews.Content: Lackluster service and poor quality of food--save you're time and money and go elsewhere. I went this evening by myself. After being seated, I waited 20 minutes for a server to realize I hadn't been helped. I ordered the beef empanada and the "famed" El Filet. The empanada was good, I would certainly return and just have these. Next, I was brought a measly plate with two leaves of lettuce, two tomatoes, and some onions. The veggies were nothing special, and I could have done a better job with the presentation. After waiting another 20 minutes, my entree was served. True to other reviews, I received two "filets" of beef, mashed potatoes, and a wine reduction. Honestly, the potatoes and reduction were common and nothing to write home about. Worse, the steak was chewy and bland.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan O.
Reviews.Content: Shared the Para Dos with my girlfriend.  If you want to relive your Atkins days look no further.

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey M.
Reviews.Content: Loved the filet mignon

Reviews.Author: Jill D.
Reviews.Content: I love BYOBs and I had been wanting to try this place out for a long time, but was always discouraged by the long wait.  We finally were able to get a reservation with a large group on a Saturday night.  Our steaks were cooked perfectly.  I would strongly recommend sharing dishes since the portions can be intimidating.  The only reason I'm only giving four stars is while the atmosphere is quaint and charming, the restaurant is very small and overcrowded.

Reviews.Author: Summer M.
Reviews.Content: outside of its location, and the fact that the space is quite small, this is a pretty good restaurant.  i enjoyed my filet mignon, and the spinach mashed potatoes were pretty great.  i'd go there again if i was looking to feed steak eaters with a moderate budget.

Reviews.Author: joanna f.
Reviews.Content: I see that most of the reviews here are great, but I can't agree.  I came here at the recommendation of some friends.  The only good thing this restaurant has going for it is that it's a BYOB.  I thought the wait staff was rude and not attentive enough.  The empanadas were okay, but low on filling.  My date and I ordered the filet for 2--it came in this tray of oil and fat.  It was awkward to cut as the table was way too small!  Chicken was really dry.  I could never eat here again and never feel like I'm missing anything.

Reviews.Author: E S.
Reviews.Content: The service and food is great (most times). I've been here several times, I'm not going to lie though- one time, I really did have a bad experience with the food. It was cold, even after it took a long time to come to the table. And then the waiter, was told that we were going to take the leftovers and he put the dirty dishes on top of the food. Crazy! So good luck! But it is good most of the time.

Reviews.Author: Clarisa M.
Reviews.Content: Fabulous ambience, fabulous steaks, fabulous desserts, fabulous, fabulous fabulous.  My boyfriend and I used to bring a bottle of wine every weekend and go here. We loved it! I wish I still lived in Chicago and keep the tradition going.  This restaurant is in my top 3 favorite restaurants in the country.  Don't miss it!

Reviews.Author: Kim B.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to try this place for my bday. We always get steak for each of our bdays and while this place wasn't your typical steak house, it was BYOB and I got to pick since it was my night. We went on a Monday night so it wasn't too busy and we didn't have to wait. I was a little nervous about how dark it was but once we sat down and got use to it, I found the ambiance perfect...especially when our food came out! We decided to do something different and experiment with the dishes that were reccommended for two people. I kinda zeroed in on the "Vacio" mainly because I had never heard of a "flap steak"....yes people..."flap". We asked the server to describe what exactly this was. For the next 3 minutes, he described with excited eyes, this dish. By the end of it, my beau and I were sold and decided to get it. I was a little nervous, cause while I am pretty much game for all kinds of foods and flavors, my boyfriend is not. Plus he wanted STEAK and we got something that sounded like the part of an animals nose and was stuffed. We had absolutley nothing to worry about. This sucker showed up on what looked like a miniature picnic table. It was huge and surrounded by a lake of herbed marinade and perfectly cooked yams. We were given two little plates, two knives, two forks, and ate away. It was perfectly cooked and the marinade was delicious. That combined with our great server made this a delightful dining experience.

Reviews.Author: Ellyn R.
Reviews.Content: We had heard really great things about this restaurant from friends and ended up taking some friends visiting from out of town. Unfortunately, our experience was not the greatest. We had made a reservation about a week prior to our visit, but when we arrived, they didn't have a record of it. Fortunately, they were still able to seat us because it wasn't too busy (it was a Sunday evening). We started with an order of empanadas (one of each flavor) which were not bad and came to the table pretty quickly. The dinner salad was basically just a plate of lettuce and tomato--nothing special. I will say that the chimichurri sauce that came with the bread was REALLY good. Very garlicky but addictive. Our table ordered two of the steak dishes for two people and all shared. After receiving our starters, the service was extremely slow and we ended up waiting an hour before getting our main course. The steak dishes were not impressive. The meat was really tough and the sauce didn't have much flavor. The best thing we had was the sweet potato side dish--those were great. We ended the meal with a flan dessert which was ok, but nothing to brag about. I really wanted to like this place, but it just didn't work out .

Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: I may be spoiled with all of the good South American Cuisine in Logan Square and Bucktown but this place was not that good to me.   In addition to being just average, I just didn't have fun.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany H.
Reviews.Content: We just ate here for my friend's birthday on Friday night.  It was great!  We ordered a steak entree for 2, topped with tons of garlic and seasonings...it was fabulous!!!  It was enough for 4.  The chicken empanadas are the best too.  Highly recommend, and sitting outside was great too.

Reviews.Author: Guy L.
Reviews.Content: Excellent steaks and service,

Reviews.Author: J B.
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best value for a great meal in the city.  As you have read, they're a BYOB with no uncorking fee. The portions are HUGE! I quite literally order one dish with the understanding that I will be taking a whole other meal home for later. Also, no "A La Carte" menu with an $8 baked potato here. The dishes are served in their entirety and seasoned perfectly! The wait staff is very polite and helpful. They seem to take real pride in the restaurant. Not only does Tengo Sur have great food and people, but the ambiance is something you won't find elsewhere. Each table has a candle lit for you. Bravo to saving energy and making it a part of the ambiance!! With the low lit setting, it's a perfect spot for an intimate dinner, whether that's the first date, a girls night out, or a 50th aniversary!I live and work in the southport corridor and constantly see a line down the block on the weekends and even sometimes on the week nights. In the winter,if you get there before 7 you're usually safe though. The summer's a whole different ball game. Calling ahead to see how busy it is may be your best bet. No matter the occassion, Tengo Sur is at the top of the very long must experience list in Chicago! Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Nikki C.
Reviews.Content: My absolute favorite steakhouse on the planet- amazing food, prices and BYOB.  What else can you ask for?

Reviews.Author: Jessy Y Pedro F.
Reviews.Content: We decided to give it a try since it had a lot of good comments. What a disappointment!!! The place is nice, service is to but the food wasn't all that like people says. We order the Lomo Relleno for 2 the meat was flavorless and it had sauce mushrooms and a salad. I seriously didn't like the meat at all we will give a second chance some other day. But by now 3 stars is more than enough.

Reviews.Author: Ryan G.
Reviews.Content: I love this spot! It's best if you can get there early because there is always a wait.  Recently I ordered El Filet and it was wonderful.  I love the way they prepare and season their steaks.  The portions are huge and it all delicious!  This is the best BYOB spot in Chicago!

Reviews.Author: Sandy B.
Reviews.Content: Love Tango Sur! BYOB and no corkage fee! Meals are big enough for 2 ! The spinach mashed potatoes rock! Very friendly servers.

Reviews.Author: Mark P.
Reviews.Content: Go for the specials over the basic cuts.  Vacio is probably the best bet.  Pluses are that it's very affordable and BYO.

Reviews.Author: Rachel O.
Reviews.Content: I did not enjoy the food at Tango Sur.  However I only tried the Lomo.  The restaurant could use some help on environment and cleanliness.  Most people I know rave about this place, but I would definately not put it on the same level as Ruth's Chris Steakhouse or Fogo de Chao

Reviews.Author: Lala R.
Reviews.Content: I have been to tango sur several times and have loved it each time.   The food is great and the prices are very reasonable too!   Great steaks and even better empanadas :)    Be prepared to wait (approx 1 hr) for a table on a weekend though.   However, while you are waiting you can give them your cell # and you can head to a southport bar and they will call you as soon as your table is ready- GREAT idea!!  This is definately a fun place to go for a night out with the girls or on a date!

Reviews.Author: Aisha D.
Reviews.Content: I loved this place.  the wait was well woth it.   The spinach mashed patatoes were so good.

Reviews.Author: Jeff Y.
Reviews.Content: mmmm...meat.tango sur is probably the best steak value in chicago.  the filet is $23 and you literally get two filets so it's easy to share.  all the beef is excellent, but don't sleep on the other items.  the suprema a la napolitana is essentially chicken parmesan and as good as the ones they serve on taylor st (almost).  the empanadas and gnocchi are also worth a go.  if you're feeling frisky, try the parillada. it's basically a huge plate full of cow parts grilled up (sweetbread and black sausage included).best of all tango sur is byob, so you can bring some wine for your meal or do it classy like me and bring in the 6 pack.  try to go in a big group if you can (6 or more) since you can make reservations then and not have to wait obscene amounts of time for a table.  luckily the southport area has some fun bars around it if you need to kill time while you wait.  this place would be 5 stars, but the service is a little pushy and a couple 3 hour waits killed off some of the mystique.

Reviews.Author: Robin D.
Reviews.Content: Im not a typical meat eater so I cannot say that I am an expert on steaks.  One of my favorite spots is David Burke.  I remember going to Tango Sur with my bf a year or two ago.  We were seated and the air condition was not working and this was in July.  It was very dark, loud and HOT (not in a good way) inside so we stood up and left immediately.  Some co workers decided to have dinner there friday night so I went.  We got there at 630 and was seated immediately which is a good thing considering that this place is notorious in making you wait for hours to be seated so I was happy about that.  The server was very accomodating and pleasant.  This place is BYOB so thats another plus.  We all ordered steaks,  I had the EL Filet I think which was a filet mignon, it was tasy tender and juicy, the spinach mashed potatos were so so.  We has chicken and beef empanadas and I like the chicken better than the beef.   The place is verrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrryy loud, one of those places where you have to talk on top of your lungs to be heard by someone across the table.  I didnt like that at all.  I mean, its good to go to a fun place but having to shout during dinner is quite annoying.  Towards the end of the evening around 9, the host came to our table and asked us to either go to the bar or move on.  When we left, there was a huge crowd outside waiting to be seated.  OMG, who eats heavy steak dinners after 930?  This place has good reasonable steaks.  The frontliners/maitre d/host need to take a crash course in customer service, maybe they think that because they have a huge influx of customers that they can talk to customers the way they do, no pleasantries just instructions and some frozen cold shoulders,  you stay there, go there, sit there, etc etc.  No no no huney this aint argentina or wherever continent you came from.  Here in america, service is key, that is why people  all over the world love this country because people here know what customer service is all about which is part of one's dining experience.   If it werent for those frontliners I would have given this place an overall rating of 3.5Food - 4Service - 3Ambience - 2Will I be rushing back to this place anytime soon?  If im broke and craving for good steaks maybe.

Reviews.Author: Lindsey H.
Reviews.Content: Excellent food, I haven't had that much of a problem getting a table either, especially outside. Really really really good food. I mean really. Times 3. Maybe 4.

Reviews.Author: Danielle H.
Reviews.Content: Perhaps because all the other reviews set me up to thinking this was going to be one of the best BYOBs ever... I was sorely disappointed... and I REALLY wanted to like Tango Sur.  I had been wanting to try it for months.  Now, granted, I am a vegetarian - so I already had a strike against me!  I ordered the eggplant/spinach dish which sounded utterly delightful... until it showed up drowned in a greasy, buttery, tomato sauce.  I could only eat about four bites before I felt completely sick to my stomach.  The service wasn't so hot either - our bottle of white wine was nearly hot before a bucket of ice was brought to our table.  I truly don't understand why there's a four hour wait list for this place on the weekend.

Reviews.Author: Katherine V.
Reviews.Content: I give Tango Sur 5 stars because every time I've been here, which is a lot, I've experienced consistently good service and food.  The chimichurri is wonderful and can be purchased next door in their small store in a plastic container to take home.  It's served with the filet mignon I order regularly there.  The meals are enormous.  A filet mignon order comes with two pieces of steak, along with potatoes and chimichurri.  In addition Tango Sur is BYOB.  The service is very quick and efficient and the candlelight makes it a romantic place to dine.  Be aware, however, that there are no reservations allowed, but they kindly take your cell phone number and will call you when a table is ready for you.  There is a bar a few doors down where you can sit and wait for your phone call.  Another thing to consider is that it is a very crowded place.  Basically you are within a few feet, on each side, from other diners.  The noise created by conversations around you create some sort of privacy, but basically it's a crowded setting and you are in tight quarters here.  Overall, this place is my favorite place to dine if I'm in the mood for a steak.  They have fancy, spiced steaks as well, but I prefer the simple filet and it's wonderful here.  I always bring a doggie bag home and have another two meals with it, which makes it a very budget-conscious restaurant.  I recommend this restaurant for a night when you just want a good steak on a date or with a few people.  A full table of more than 4 people might make it a little difficult to have a decent conversation because of the noise and close proximity to others dining there.  But this is, after all, only my opinion - I see people here in large groups all the time and I wonder how they are able to hear each other.

Reviews.Author: Greg H.
Reviews.Content: Best steakhouse for the Money. BYOB. $25 steaks. $2 Empanadas. Can't see why you would want to pay significantly more to go other places in the city.

Reviews.Author: Bri W.
Reviews.Content: I've had better service and steak but for the size, it's just right. They need to cut their attitude and not make people wait an hour to eat. We were the first table there when they opened for goodness sake (after reading these reviews of course). But the biggest filet I've ever been served...two in fact..the El Filet...skip the spinach mashed potatoes (green unappatizing mush) that come with it and sub with the regular..not very firm but easier to eat...but the beef empanadas were DElish...we sent back the weird sweet bread (fried fat pieces) and got two more empanadas...don't expect nice employees but expect big meat...and that's what I like...

Reviews.Author: adair b.
Reviews.Content: I save red meat for special occasions, this was just that! It was a bit loud and darker than I'd normally attempt to dine in but very ideal for a romantic date.

Reviews.Author: Evan L.
Reviews.Content: yummy. I had the skirt steak, in the past tried the Vesuvius. GF is vegetarian and had an eggplant and cheese kind of lasagna. Food is great, good value. It's BYOB, service is excellent. I tend not to go at busy times you will have to wait., I don't wait well.  Large servings

Reviews.Author: Denis H.
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome for meat lovers!! Wide selection of meat so it might be daunting to pick something. The atmosphere would be really romantic except I had to listen to the horrible date next to us where the guy was trying very hard to impress his date with random stories of his exploits. Now the reason I mention this is because the tables are very close to one another and the noise level is really high. I love the fact they used actual candles, BYOB, and it was just dim enough to make any date look better. The service department was lacking. Waiters tried but weren't very attentive and they had a very brisk way of talking. On a good note you can't beat the price. I would recommend the empanadas (they don't look as big in the picture) as an appetizer. Great place for a group so each one of you can order something different to try out. We had the Argentinian filet for two. Huge piece of meat but unfortunately the size didn't make it as tasty as it would have been. Even though I mentioned a lot of negatives I do recommend the place for the price, the atmosphere (if you can handle the noise) and the meat. You just have to keep coming back to find your own favorites. P.S. Try to get there there early as this place doesn't take reservation and after 7 the wait can be over 2hrs sometimes. I did like the fact that they call you 10 min before your table is ready so you can leave and not worry about missing your turn.

Reviews.Author: Ronald D.
Reviews.Content: Went there for the first time Sunday October 9th. The place was hopping. It was the day of the Chicago marathon, and the weather was awesome. We had a party of four. We waited a few minutes and we were sat. The place is byob and does not charge a corkage fee, nice!I ended up having the Argentinian BBQ. Four different types of meats. Served on a little grill type trail. It was awesome. I was not a b ig fan of the black sausage. It wasn't my taste. The steak and smaller sausage were wonderful. The sweetbreads were unreal!  I was hesitant at first but wow!My wife and daughter split the el filet. Great price for a big portion of perfectly cooked filet. The waiter was very helpful and patient, as it took us some time to decided. I had actually ordered something else and when I saw the BBQ come out at the next table I asked if I could switch. He ran to the kitchen, asked the chef, and returned to tell me it was no trouble. Ask for extra chimichura sauce. Use it in any of the meats, awfully good. We did not try the desertsWe will return. This was a grt experience!Mucho gracias!

Reviews.Author: Phillip K.
Reviews.Content: I've now been back 3 more times, and not had a single bad experience.  The prices, the service, and most importantly, the food, is amazing.

Reviews.Author: Cyndi F.
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by Tango Sur!  We had our friends birthday there, so their were about 10 of us.  We had reservations and we got sat right away.  There was a couple behind us without a reservation and they said it was going to be a 2 hour wait for a table..  Thank god we had a reservation.  I love that is a BYOB restaurant without a corkage fee.  The empanada's were so delicious.  The plates are huge.  My two friends split a steak and it was definetly enough for two.  I ordered the tilapia (I am not a big meat eater), I have to say it was the best I have ever had eaten.  The sauce was amazing.  The size of the fish was so big.  The servers served our wine to us, so you kind od forget that you brought the wine.  If I was to complain about anything it would be their dinner salads could of used a little more to it.  And we brought a birthday cake for our friend and they charged us a $10 dessert charge.  if you split entrees they also charge you $6, but each person does get a salad.  I loved that the had a musician playing the guitar and walking around.  The atmosphere was warm and inviting, but fun at the same time.

Reviews.Author: Rohit A.
Reviews.Content: food excellent...good for meat consumersenvironment is very romantic...good for romanticsservice was excellent...good for housewives/stay at home dadsclientele was classy...good for classy peopleBYOB...good for cheap peopleVERY NICE YUM YUM

Reviews.Author: Carey G.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Monday night for a friend's birthday.  Our party of 8 arrived at 5 PM exactly (a little early for dinner, but had other plans after).  No one else was in the restaurant yet when we arrived, though it was filling up at 7 when we left.  Everything was great.  We tried 3 varieties of the empanadas-the spinach and cheese, the chicken, and the beef.  All three were sooo good, especially with the sauce.  For dinner, my husband and I split the el Filet, per the waiter's recommendation.  I'm glad we did, it was excellent.  Perfect to split, as the filet is already split into 2 portions (approx 8 oz each I would say).  We ordered it medium and it came out cooked perfectly.  They were very good about us being in a bit of a hurry, and the service was excellent the whole time.  We had many bottles of wine and there was always a waiter on hand to open a new one when need be.  For no corkage fee, definitely can't complain!  I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Author: Em Z.
Reviews.Content: this is a great south american restaurant.. im not really a red meat eater, but my boyfriend swears by the steak.. when i went with my friend for dinner on a wednesday night, it was still packed to the hilt, but the BYOB rocks because by the time we were seated (about an hour later), we were nice and toasty with the wine bottle we'd just drained.. we had the cheese appetizer and some empanadas.. i had the chicken and she had some steak.. the bird was tasty, juicy and nicely seasoned, just like i like it.. our waiter was quite flirty, and there were a couple of times where i wanted to be like ok dude that is all, be gone with your smiley self.. but ill chalk it up to his latin loverness or something.. all in all, its a lovely place for a group or a date..

Reviews.Author: Katie S.
Reviews.Content: Went on a Saturday night and got there early (5ish).  We had our pick of tables.  Within an hour the place was packed and there was a waiting list.  I ordered the Bife Vesuvio, which I thought was too salty and the meat was undercooked.  I asked for medium and the bottom of the beef was pretty much raw.  There was more than enough food, so I didn't walk away hungry.  My friends really enjoyed their dishes (filet, and an appetizer of eggplant with cheeses).  Once the restaurant was crowded, the waiter was a little inattentive, but yet still seemed to push us out the door.  I'd go back, but I'd probably ask for the meat to be cooked medium-well.

Reviews.Author: Jay R.
Reviews.Content: great great place!

Reviews.Author: Curt S.
Reviews.Content: Very good!  I had a steack and it was great.  This place is also BYOB which is a plus.    The only drawback was the wait-- they apparently don't take reservations for less than 6.  We got there, they said it would be 45 minutes, 95 minutes later we finally got sat.

Reviews.Author: Mike F.
Reviews.Content: Add me the the long list of Tango Sur fans. Place is great!

Reviews.Author: Caroline S.
Reviews.Content: I love, love, love Tango Sur! We went for Valentine's Day last year and were really impressed. I recommend dinner for two. It's more than enough and I love the presentation. They're also really good about substituting sides. I really like the spinach mashed potatos and sub those in everytime. I've heard about long waits on the weekends but we know to go during the week and when we take our friends we call ahead and they have a table ready. Can't get enough of this place!

Reviews.Author: Jaymee S.
Reviews.Content: If you like meat, you have to check out Tango Sur!  My husband and I have gone several times for special occasions.  It's a little bit pricey but not over priced!  Service is great.  Atmosphere is dark and intimate... very intimate!  You may be practically sitting with your neighbors so if privacy is important, this may not be the best choice for you.  BYOB - check out Que Syrah, just steps away on Southport, for a GREAT wine selection.   We haven't ever had a meal we didn't love!  It's been a while so I can't remember the exact name of the dish but I usually get the steak that's stuffed with spinach and cheese! AMAZING!

Reviews.Author: Jason B.
Reviews.Content: I cant believe this place is getting so 4 and 5 stars from everyone. The Dinner for Two was nothing special, decent steak but 3 star at best. The place is crowded, loud and you spend an hour or two waiting. Its great that its BYOB, but the service and food are average at best.

Reviews.Author: AJ R.
Reviews.Content: Really like Tango Sur.  It is a great restaurant, and a great value.  BYOB, lots of meat/food for the price (have had both the El Filet and Bife Visuvio...yummmm--always take home leftovers), and a real contribution to the area.  Meat is usually cooked perfectly and sides are good too.  Empenadas are delicious as well as the eggplant appetizer.  It is dimly lit, and the wait can be long, esp on the weekends, but I highly recommend it!  There's a wine store almost across the street if you forget your libations, and a wonderful dessert place a few doors down (if you have any room for dessert after dinner!).

Reviews.Author: christine d.
Reviews.Content: Went for dinner thurs the 29th. 7:30pmThis place is so loud you have to yell at each other to be heard.My hubby and I shared the Costoletta-bone in rib eye.  ordered it medium. came more rare than anything, but not a nice juicy rare.  I have never had a rib eye that has stringy tendon bits that you cannot chew  or cut through.  The flavors of the sauce were good though, but this seemed like an "impostor" cut of beef disguised by a flavorful sauce.Our friends shared the Vacio. Order this only if you have strong jaws, because you will chew and chew and chew.  This meat would have been better tossed in a slow cooker and left for 8-10 hours. For $35 bucks this was robbery and rubbery.  The 'silverskin' was still left on the meat, which is a culinary mistake! again, an impostor cut or low grade beef, disguised by a decent sauce.I guess my definition of romantic is different.  I would rather be somewhere quite, where i can hear my hubby talk to me, rather than  scream at me.  awk...maybe i'm getting old :(

Reviews.Author: Private I.
Reviews.Content: BYOB.  No corkage fee.  Customers seemed to all be between 20 and 40, good looking, trendy, and positive.  I have never had a better steak in my life.  Ever.  The only thing that sucks about this place is the host is a bit of a stress-ball or something.  He is not friendly.  Something initially annoying, but no big deal, is that the waiting room is in the back so you have to walk over some people when the place is packed.  But they'll bring you wine glasses in the waiting room and open up your bottle for you, no problem.  After all, you don't need to be sitting at a table to drink.  Plus it's an opportunity to chat with friendly people.  I'll be going back to this place a lot!

Reviews.Author: Ben F.
Reviews.Content: Wonderful steak, the ambiance is fantastic (when I ate here, we had the typical candlelit restaurant and were sitting next to a table of priests --felt very Godfather), and you can't beat the price given that it's BYOB.

Reviews.Author: Tony G.
Reviews.Content: Great restaurant! Waiting time is terribly but when you enter you'll appreciate it!

Reviews.Author: Kelly J.
Reviews.Content: I had a really great experience here.  The lighting atmosphere was romantic and still lively. The waiter was pleasant and helpful with suggestions.  Extra star for being a steak place that has more than one vegetarian option.

Reviews.Author: Charlynne B.
Reviews.Content: Every once in a while, Tango Sur, you tarnish the esteem I hold for you.  Thursday was one such time.  We have learned through trial and error to go there when it's not terribly crowded (read: NOT Friday or Saturday), because the steaks tend to be better when your chefs aren't so busy.  Unfortunately, our logic didn't hold true this time around...my husband ordered the bone-in rib-eye and wrestled through dinner with a gristly, tough cut of meat.  Ordering error?  Maybe, since he usually orders the strip steak.  But in a steakhouse, all the cuts should be of good quality.  And the DULL steak knives sure didn't help the situation.  The other entrees our party ordered were well prepared, but we might hesitate ever so slightly when deciding whether or not to go back.  But we'll probably return, as the allure of BYOB is too strong to resist.  Perhaps we'll BYO steak knives as well?

Reviews.Author: Garrett D.
Reviews.Content: Went to Tango Sur again recently and as always very good. Have been here now a number of times and they are always very consistant with their service and food. Though the servers arent as engaging as some other restaurants (probably due to the fact that they are busy) the food is always great. BYOB is also a plus. Never dissapointed when we come here!

Reviews.Author: Daniel C.
Reviews.Content: So they were happy to take my reservation but When I got there they had no table. I think they need to do some research about what exactly a reservation entails(Que Seinfeld music). Secondly your greeted in a bullying manner almost as soon as you enter. This guy must be the owner cause he really has a pair, giving you 5 inches of space once you walk in. I wasn't even sure he worked there (tall and thin snob of a man with no smile)? I was then escorted to the back waiting area. Hmm okay I will play along. 20 min later we asked this RTard  when our table might be ready? He responded "when a table is ready it will be ready or you can leave" after I picked up my jaw from the floor (what a colossal D-Bag) we decided to stay. I figured it can't be much worse after we get passed this guy. So we are seated and the service is now very noticeably better though the waiter was in such a rush he left the table only taking one appetizer order.(stomach growling by now) When he came back in about 5 min. we were able to add to the appetizers which were eh so so, the sauce really made the empanadas. I ordered the steak in the wine sauce. MMMM! but I have had better at Las Tablas. In all it was like an awkward conversation with a girl who has been told shes super hot but she really is more like a 5 and she thinks her Sh&t doesn't stink. I give it a two star rating because of the price of the food and the better options in the neighborhood when you consider everything, but the food Was nice don't get me wrong. I give the DBag at the door a big F U! thanks for ruining my BDay dinner and making the place suck more than it should have. I will not be going back and I will consider that a BDay gift that keeps on giving! : )

Reviews.Author: Russell H.
Reviews.Content: Ordered the parrillada para dos (grilled meat for two) which is good (not fantastic), but service is subpar.  When asked to substitute the blood sausage (called black sausage on their menu) for anything else, even just another meat sausage, the response was a negative. No substitutions allowed for anything. They can hold the blood sausage, but the price will be the same. What if you're allergic or simply cannot consume blood for whatever reason?  Too bad. I've experienced this attitude before abroad but I don't expect this kind of service in the United States.  Thank goodness for the sites like this to write reviews. You've been informed. Now you make the decision.

Reviews.Author: Joe K.
Reviews.Content: For anyone looking for a real steakhouse this is not the place. Go to Morton's or Gibson's to get a real steak. Tango Sur provides large portions of low grade beef, the meat is not tender or very moist. OK for lunch or a weekday dinner but I would not waste of a weekend night to dine here.

Reviews.Author: Elle V.
Reviews.Content: My fiance kept hyping up this place..and it def delivered.  I'm one of the very few non-vegetarians in this world that does not like steak, but this place is SO good.  For appetizers , I liked to provoletta much more than the empanadas..as it was your run of the mill empanada. Our table had the rib-eye, para uno, filet mignon and the strip steak.  I'd say I liked the rib-eye the most however the fiance loved his para uno but I don't like sweet bread.

Reviews.Author: Wendy K.
Reviews.Content: Last night: Monday night. Four of us at 5pm. Outside seating, inside big with two separate diniing rooms. Very nice decor, bit romantic, candles, nice tango slow music. The two men ordered the beef steak and ribeye at $19 and $24. The women: salmon $24 pork chops $25. No corkage fee. Big portions, mashed potatoes were eh. All entrees came with salad (romaine, red onion, tomato) but only dressing they have was oil and vinegar.  Warm bread at table too- HEY!! its all about the free bread to some people!  Everything else was VERY tasty. Waiter was great except our busboy was better. He kept cheking on us and opening our beers/wine bottles. Think its time for them to promote him. If they are reading: his name was Sandro. Plenty of meter pay parking. Desserts were all great, especially the Dulce de Leche cheescake and at $5 each. Bill was $135. Forgot, each of 5 empanadas were ordered too and they were all very good.  Will definitely come back.  I think I invited my friend to go to NY that night - always do that, too much wine. Woke up and said...CRRRAAAAPPPP!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Kristy C.
Reviews.Content: Amazing. The most romantic restaurant I've ever been too. Went there on a first date and when we came back it was just as amazing. First- it's BYOB- no cork fee, which is surprising because it's a high end place. Second all the food is impressive, empanadas are a must, steak was perfect, mashed potatoes mind blowing. Last time we were there they gave us a dessert for free, for no reason. Oh and it's only candle light, just like the movies when the fast forward to the end where of the date where the candle has melted to nothing- great place to impress a girl :)

Reviews.Author: Lisa C.
Reviews.Content: The potato & egg appetizer was execellent and almost as good a Cuban grandma :)  We didn't need the empanadas.  The rib eye steak was fabulous.  Only down side - no substituions.  I wanted all veggies instead of potatos (which was delicious) so I ordered a side of excellent veggies.  Very busy for a Tuesday night.  Tables are a little close together so don't expect a private conversation.

Reviews.Author: Steven K.
Reviews.Content: Forkin' love the steak here. Byob too!  Fun restaurant for a date, good entertaining atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer M.
Reviews.Content: The food at Tango Sur is amazing.  I have been told by many people to check it out and I'm so glad I did.  Just like everyone else mentioned - the empanadas are great.  I had the churrasco with that fantastic chimichurri sauce that I couldn't have enough of.  I do agree that the wait time is kind of long, but it was definitely worth the wait.  I cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Train S.
Reviews.Content: From the second the thug of a "doorman" stopped us outside, THE EVENING WENT DOWNHILL LIKE A DRUNK ON A STOLEN RADIO FLYER WAGON.I give this place zero stars.
