If it were possible I would give it negative stars. The service was lousy...the place was so dark you needed a cell phone to read the menu. Loud? I could have had a better time on a runway at O'hare airport it would have been quieter. When we arrived two of our party were already there with four more coming, the waiter never did ask me if I wanted something to drink nor the rest of our party for the entire meal. Did I mention the service at this place is lousy? The best piece of advice I can tell anyone that is considering going to this place is DON'T! Parking? Give me a break, had to walk 5 blocks uphill both ways to get to this dump. Let's see, what else does this "restaurant" have not to offer? Oh, not to mention the fact that they pack diners in so tight there's barely room to blow a fart. Upon arrival I pulled my chair out and thought to myself "holy crap I'm going to need the jaws of life to get out of this". The menu I firmly believe was written in a combination of Greek hieroglyphics and Chinese algebra and maybe pig Latin I'm not sure about the pig Latin. In conclusion the only way I would recommend this dump is if you enjoy lousy service, terrible atmosphere, mediocre food, and need plenty of exercise getting there then by all means go. Otherwise, avoid this place like the plague, war zones, and personal injuries. If the purpose of this place is to provide you with a miserable evening then all I can is "MISSION ACCOMPLISHED".These people would be better off opening a dry cleaning business.

Reviews.Author: Jason K.
Reviews.Content: The food was good but it was a miserable experience.  Their system of seating is just awful and then when we finally got to our table we were about 1 foot away from the people next to us, so don't go unless you want strangers in your face while out to dinner.

Reviews.Author: Missy G.
Reviews.Content: Amazing!!! We came here on a Tuesday night after reading the reviews and saw that there is typically a long wait. We arrived at 5:30 and were sat immediately. They let us choose between a few tables and we chose a table for four (even tho there were only two of us) and they were perfectly fine with that. The service was OUTSTANDING. When I say outstanding I mean one of the top three experiences in Chicago. Attentive, knowledgeable, helpful, funny and organic. The food matched the service. We ordered three empanadas to start, beef, chicken and ham & cheese. All amazing flavor as well as they come with a a garlic, oil dipping sauce. They also give you bread and butter. For dinner we both ordered el filet. This is a filet with spinach mashed potatoes, a red wine sauce and two separate filets ( in addition to a dinner salad, nothing special but greens, tomatoes and onions). After eating the empanadas, we each had a filet and mp leftover so we probably could have shared a plate, but what's the fun in that? For dessert we ordered the caramel cheesecake..... Wow. On top of the great service and outstanding food, they are byob and do not charge a fee. Definitely a must try if you haven't been there already. You will absolutely not be disappointed!

Reviews.Author: Burbalicious X.
Reviews.Content: Very impressed by my visit on Saturday night. We had a party of 6 and could not get a reservation (they were booked when I called two days in advance). So we arrived at 6:15 to put our name in, gave the host our cell #, and headed down the street to Take Five for some beers. Although we were told the wait would be at least two hours, our table was actually ready in an hour and a half. The atmosphere is great - dim lighting, candles on the tables, etc. It is quite loud, however - so not exactly romantic, but definitely an intimate spot for a group of friends! The food --- we started with the provoleta (awesome) and a sampling of each type of empanada - I enjoyed the spinach and cheese ones, but not sure if I'd order them again. The boyfriend and I split the el filet, which is TWO filets in a wine/onion sauce with a side of spinach mashed potatoes. My steak was great - cooked perfectly, not fatty. The mashed potatoes are average at best. The best part, though - was asking for a side of chimichurri sauce on the side for dipping the steak. The chimichurri is out of this world! Just be prepared to smell like garlic :) For dessert, we had a rolled pound cake topped with the most delicious whipped caramel I've ever had. And the best part - we walk out of there for $25/person! I love BYOB and I love Tango Sur and I'll definitely go back!!

Reviews.Author: Katrina C.
Reviews.Content: okay, so i REALLY enjoyed this restaurant the only time i was able to get a table. love a BYOB, portions are huge, food is tasty and outdoor seating in the summer is very nice. highly recommended for serious, hungry carnivores. it's not the best steak you will ever have, but it's very flavorful and you get more than your money's worthl.  i would advise if you are going on a friday or saturday, go at LEAST an hour before you want to eat, the wait can be pretty brutal. luckily, there are plenty of bars in the area, the host will take your phone number and call you when your table's ready. we've gone to cullen's to wait, if you brought white wine they'll even put it in their fridge for you. we tried to go this weekend, but were quoted a two hour wait, and after two hours, they said there were still five tables ahead of us and they were close to closing. disappointing, but just make sure you get there early on weekends.

Reviews.Author: Angela D.
Reviews.Content: I will start by pointing out good aspects, BYOB, adorable Bistro like atmosphere.  We were a party of six on a Saturday, late afternoon.  We ordered a sampling of empanadas with chimichurri that were ok. Now the not so great part. We placed our orders, my sis and I ordered the fillet for two,medium.  The rest of the group ordered a steak stuffed with spinach.   The food took 1 1/2 hours to arrive. When our fillet arrived, it was a monstrous piece of meat covered in sauce and served with mushrooms, that's it no side of anything. I wasn't even asked if I wanted to order a side. When I put my knife to cut it I realized I had to use brute strength just to get a slice.  The steak was way way way overcooked. I was very disappointed about this. I showed the steak to the server who said it was just a little over cooked. I told him the meat was completely brown and gray, no pink it was overcooked.  He then said very dismissively, do you want another one? I said, well I really don't want to wait over an hour for it. His response was, "well the food takes as long as it takes to cook". At that point I was more than displeased not only with the food but also with the service.  I asked for a manager, he said there wasn't one.  Hard to believe on a busy Saturday there isn't a manager in the restaurant. He agreed to put an order in for another steak and put a rush on it.  The second attempt of the fillet arrived and this time is was completely rare inside. I told the server it was rare, he took it back to the kitchen and by the time he brought it out the third time I had lost my appetite, the steak was not very flavorful, it was still hard to cut. I think they use a poor quality of meat here. The rest of my group agreed that with the steaks lacking flavor and also being difficult to cut and chew.  I will never go back to this place to give it a second chance, regardless of it's most appealing draw of being BYOB.  Bad service in my opinion is inexcusable.

Reviews.Author: Angelica C.
Reviews.Content: Was really looking forward to checking this place out.  We didn't get past the doorman.  Apparently this place is so busy on a Friday night that they have someone at the door not allowing you to go in and adding you to their "hour and a half" waiting list.  To top it off, I asked where we can wait and we were referred to check out the surrounding bars.  Really? Because based on some reviews, there's a waiting room in the back.  When I asked about it, the host said we had to wait to be able to go in there. Wait to get into the waiting lounge?  Needless to say we took our name off the list and headed to a nearby restaurant where we were treated like our business was appreciated.   Unfortunately my review is not geared towards the food  as I never got to taste the food.  However, based on many other reviews the food is good.  So if you're looking for good food, with a side of arrogance,  well this is your place.

Reviews.Author: Nora T.
Reviews.Content: Sunday today, took two out-of-town guests to Tango Sur. Nearly didn't go, put off by reviews of slow service and long waits. Here is how long we waited: not at all, although the restaurant was cheerfully full.  Here is how much we paid: $117 for four people, half of what we expected to pay.  Here is what we ate: four empanadas, a stuffed beef tenderloin shared by two, a plateful of prime rib, a plateful of veal Milanesa, two iced teas, two extra orders of potatoes, four big salads, and four huge yummy desserts. Here is what I brought home: enough beef to make gargantuan sandwiches for our guests' plane trip tomorrow, enough food left over to give two of us generous dinners for the next three nights,  and a pint and a half of portobello mushroom sauce for the freezer.  Tango Sur has to be one of the biggest bargains in Chicago. Also we loved the BYOB policy (as did other customers---from our table we could watch them approaching the door  with their their bags of wine).

Reviews.Author: Seth G.
Reviews.Content: I hate to write this review because I have been here there 3 or 4 times prior to last night and never had an issue. I went with my girlfriend, who had never been there before. She loved the atmosphere and who could hate BYOB. She ordered the stuffed steak, a meal that I have actually ordered before, and asked for it medium-rare. The waiter told her it would have to be medium because otherwise the cheese and spinach would be cold. She was fine with that. The steak came out well done. She said something to the waiter and he basically said that he told her so. He told her it was going to have to be cooked more well than rare. I think he should have asked her if he could get her something else instead or offer to put in another order of the same thing. We are aware that it was not the waiter that overcooked it but he did not rectify the situation. He brought us a free dessert - flan - which neither of us wanted or would have chosen. We spoke to the manager on our way out. We had already paid and were not looking for a free meal, The manager made excuses and did not make us feel any better about the situation.
